miſery giue thée remedie blood haue blood againe cruelty haue like rewarded thou ſhalt féele force chollericke moode reuengement bee ſo ſharpe trebble griefe thée ſuſtaine prince vanquiſhed ſudden feare heare giant vſe ſuch word fury put vp hand • thought finde sword failing purpoſe preſently ſayd greeneſt graſſe lyeth moſt deceitfull serpent calmeſt water deepeſt whirlepoole ſo thoſe place aman thinketh himſelfe fartheſt miſhaps ſooneſt aſſayled ſome ſudden miſchance well quoth giant though anger doth vrge vnto great impatience cannot brooke open iniury done vnto mee bent ſeuerely reuenge thée thy kindred dealing ſhall make manifeſt great diſhonour yet kéepe thée firſt chaunced hand thou mayeſt witneſſe reſt diſpleaſure thy life franckly fréely giue thée ſéeing kingly lyon diſdaineth vaunt conquered prey princely eagle ſcorneth ſtoupe flye beſides thy life ſufficiencie ſuch cauſe beeing firſt death father next diſtreſſe friend preſent griefe ſelfe laſtly euer hereafter iſſue eternall ſorrow appeaſe life one tenne yet hundreth able make recompence ſuffice quench rigour neuertheles poore meaneſt ſort minded vſe thee thou liſt like thine owne choyſe ſhall finde occaſion ſo recount thy poſted pleaſure alſo thinke thy preſent enſuing paine though griefe mee vſe ſo harde thy hap thou canſt mayſt refuſe ſhall witneſſe world miſeries thou art abide rareſt miſfortunes euer man taſte thy lucke law thy hard hap heauy hatred 〈◊〉 thou departeſt thou ſhalt ſufficiētly vnderſtand time thou knowſt haue authoritie thou ſhalt feele thy greater woo pretended iniurie hauing thus finiſhed talke cauſed bee carried ſtrongeſt priſon top caſtle clapped great pair gyues leg minding furie neuer hee liued take againe edoard thus ſuddenly chaunged princely pompe oh poore prince thy hope thou haddeſt ſo great courteſie ſo ſoone chaunged extreame crueltie didſt thou credite faire wordes ſuch troth doeſt thou finde quite turned treaſon ala ſooner deceiued well meaning man quickly beguiled mean moſt honeſtly hath fortune hetherto allowed thée honour ſhee leaue thée taſte horror hath thy life hetherto beene ſpent delight ſhalt thou end thy dayes direfull diſtreſſe ala haſt helpe contrarie wherefore thou muſt holde thée content none néere ſuccour thée wherefore ſuppe vp thy ſorrow thy aged father miſſe thée thy louing ladie lacke thée thy courtly companion ſorrow thy want bucephalus ſtoupe none alexander mercury pipe ſcunded none orphaeus euen ſo proud ſoo may wayes intreated either muſt conquered ſtrength craftily deceyued ſleights farre thought deliuery ſo farre comfort poore oppreſſed heart déere florida thou ſhalt call thy vnkindeneſſe queſtion laſt departure thy preſence woman opinion know care leſſe trouble thy minde want thy comfort cauſeth miſerie ala though haue thus left thee follie yet thinke ſtill loue thée faithfully although thy griefe knowe great loſſe yet thinke ſorrowe putteth extremity life priſon ſo amateth ſadneſſe opinion neuer againe ſée without whoſe companie life cannot long endure eyther diſpaire vpon hard aduenture preſently die ſo ſharpe aſſault inuincible prince primaleon griefe abide loſſe brother ſorrow conceiue deare friend whoſe miſfortune feare cauſe leaue parent whoſe tryed friendſhip mooue put life perill except soldan niqu • e maiortes gatterit king tranies friendly perſwaſion caſtle whoſe crueltie feare way intreated theſe ſuch like rufull complaint captiue prince ſpent time vntill earneſt opinion ladie preſent vrged breake foorth theſe ſpéeches ala good ladie cruell torment might paine wherefore good ladie content▪ yourſelfe ſuffer mee moane blemiſh faire face rufull teares one may endanger proſperitie may way profite thus claſping armes together entring farther knight giant traine vanquiſhed ſo quéene daughter ſuffered ſpot diſhonour crueltie greatly ſtood feare giant siſter named eutropa ſo cunning magicke neither zoriaſtes magitians deuiliſh art comparable helpe whereof ſhe knowledge death brother entered ſo déepe heart ſhee vowed reuengement ſhould excéede cruell miſchance hauing caſtell nephew sonne giant frenaque named dramuſiande ſhe meant ſeeke ſharpe reuenge ſhee tooke armes entred theſe rufull complaint ah ſwéete nephew albeit thou art fatherleſſe yet art thou friendleſſe though thy tender time fortune hath framed thy miſhap yet eſpect farder time art ſhall beginne thy manhoode finiſh hath thus cruelly murthered father hee himſelfe lynage friendes familiar perſecute extreame rygor theſe ſuch like ſpeeches vttered ſhee prouided fortifie make ſtrong caſtell leaſt king england ſhould ſeeke ruine deſtruction giant kindred came eare treaſon ſhée pretended againſt wherefore ſhée armed ſelfe thoſe kindred knowing reſiſt power king aſked ſmal defence remedy leaſt worſt ſhould happen ſhe enchaunted forreſt round ſo none could enter forreſte without leaue vntill ſuch time yong giant dramuſiande able beare armor receiue order knighthood proceſſe time young giant grew able beare armor heart began thyrſt reuenge father death accompliſh hee deſirous trauell aduenture ſtrength according heart deſired eutropia perceiuing courage minde excéed ſtrength perſon de • iled ſtay iourney ſhe would yéelde hand ſuch one hee might ſufficiently reuenge death father thus theſe perſwaſions ſhe changed minde dramuſiande vntill hard fortune prince edoard brought caſtell entred without daunger good sworde kept force enchauntments hauing loſt diuelliſh deceyte remained haue expreſſed vnſpeakeablie leauing matter ſhall amiſſe ſpeake ſomewhat ſtate condition dramuſiande albeit giant commonly rough impatient nature yet indued ciuilitie life honeſtie behauiour exempting crueltie ſurpaſſing ſtocke parentage courteſie long ſpace kept edoard priſon onely perceiued princely quality alſo ſobrietie great gentle ••• life hee cauſed fetter bee taken féete gaue leaue recreation walke caſtell vppon condition hee would ſéeme paſſe beyond limit without conſent courteous prince gaue hand oath would paſſe one foote licence ſhould permit yet notwithſtanding gaue charge vnto diuerſe reſpect walking abroade hee reſpected aunte eutropaes promiſe many valiaunt knightes would aduenture liues ſearche ſtrayed prince whome ſhe doubted haue alſo priſoners caſtell againſt comming thither ſuch ſhee cauſed lye embuſh forreſt great number armed men aide dramuſiand againſt hard hap ſhould miſſe purpoſe tſſus paſſed young giant time pleaſure eodard acqusinted himſelfe former ſorrowes chanceth vnto thoſe long time kept ſight moſt deſire well want eſpouſed ladie alſo griefe king father would conceiue ill luck yet gentle paſtime dramuſiand would often vſe cauſed ſpend time pleaſure elſe would haue waſted mourning thus leauing captiue prince forced content returne prince flerida left forreſt ſorrowfully exp • cting glad returne lord edoard chap iii princeſſe flerida awayting returne loyal ſpouſe edoard forreſt deliuered two goodly yong prince sauage man walking two lion tooke feed lion withall happened ſir pridos ſonne duke galles ſearch prince edoard princeſſe flerida leſſe griefe mind agony whole perſon remained forreſt expecting came well abandon diuers chollericke humour ouercharged impatient mind alſo exile eger paſſions ſtill approching weake nature ſhee buſied ſelfe gathering flower accompanied faire attaida diuers lady gentleman time recreation correſpondent good liking heretofore ſhe could conceiue opinion like ſudden ſhe fell remembrance lord edoard whoſe long abſence ſhe admitted ſome misfortune elſe vngentleneſſe himſelfe diſdained preſence theſe reſalue ſelfe ſhee doubtfull one ſhe might conuict ſelfe raſh beléefe though ſhe might ſtand vpon good occaſion betwéene theſe cogitation ſhe ſpent whole day yéelding complaint likewiſe vncomfortable night approching indéed ſéemed obſcure grieſly deſpairable night paſſed remembrance vpon hard motion ſhe fell reſolute opinion neuer heare good tidings lord edoard knight ſpent labour ſearch returned without tidings lord lady perceiuing theſe paſſions extreame vpon heretofore beganne caſt themſelues whether might depart leaue theſe fit ſtay ſtill great griefe length thus concluded abide returne duke galles whoſe abſence likewiſe princeſſe agréeued ſhe would haue bene bene preſent vncomfortable night gone chéerefull deawes phoebus diſplayed ouer earth duke galles returned glad ſight prince leſſe ioy attendant ſhe hoped wiſhed newes lord heare become soueraigne expectation farre diſappointed ignorant prince cauſed freſh hurt vpon olde griefe neuertheleſſe intreated lord take themſelues trauaile might ſo fortune perſwaded ſhould haue better ſucceſſe meanetime would abide princeſſe comfort ſhe vowed neuer returne thence till ſhée heard ſome tidings beſt beloued noble gentleman leſſe loyaltie prince edoard loue bare princeſſe flerida addreſſed themſelues preſently fulfill requeſt among whome pridos eldeſt ſonne duke galles chiefe gentleman attendant prince rode along ſea ſhore mette two companion likewiſe endeuoured themſelues ſearch edoard determined returne paſt hope good ſucceſſe neuertheleſſe auoyd euill conceit princeſſe angry moode aged father hee left rode ſolitary ſometime exclaiming fortune hard hap againe blaming ſolly perceiued remedie midſt whereof brake forth theſe like ſpéeches méete mortall creature blame inuey againſt heauenly creator iuſtly good reaſon may claime like occaſion whoſe ſorrow enioy one houre ſuccor whoſe mone admitted halfe houre mirth whoſe extreame griefe taſte ſauour halfe minute reſt horſe haung laboured day take reſt inne night little bird comfort ſelfe euery twigge fiſh ſport make paſtime himſelfe riuer briefe euery creature enioyeth quiet pleaſant life man onely excepted excelling creature forme feature inferior tranquillitie life ſurueying whole courſe man life beginning end admit phyloſophers ſentence either neuer borne quickly die good continued late aduentures hath proued fortunate liueth yet depriued libertie captiue whoſe anger aſſwaged long time muſt ſtay griefe ſorrow wherefore thy knighthood charge thée certifie princeſſe flerida daungerous vſe ſuch great impatience may cut time yet abate trouble ſhe might manifeſt princely magnanimitie minde conquering griefe valure patience becauſe fortune prepared another miſhap becauſe happen ſoone referre ſhall feele ſhall know therefore giue vnderſtand griefe needeleſſe ſtate helpeleſſe vntill appointed time extreame ſorrowes ſhall finiſh vnſpeakable ioyes thus ſay argonida ſo grim ſire betooke themſelues flight one receyuing courage hart abide princeſſe lady attaida neuor ſhrunke one foote would haue aduentured death princeſſe defence might bene anſwerable good ſtomacke debility hope betwéene impatient aſſaults doubt daunger hee thus began vſe ſpéeche himſelfe edoard nature willes deplore thy loſſe intire affection make dye thy lacke whoſe preſence ſtaffe myne aged dayes whoſe abſence sword wound death graſſe hang héeles mercurie moſſe abide stone siſiphus ſo certaintie looked hand fortune whoſe ſickleneſſe ſéene chaunge whoſe frowardneſſe chaunce long haue truſted late hath ſhee deceiued one folly faſhion yet doubt thou enioy thy life ſubſtance thy valure ſhall excéede ſharepneſſe vengeance leſſe welcome thée long wiſhed ala well may 〈◊〉 hide griefe continued great agony • inde queene entred likewiſe vnderſtanding loſſe sonne began adde another stratageme griefe bewraying motherly affection teares heauy complaint appeaſe aged king thus began madame honour noble minde tried aduerſitie extremitie griefe conquered patience minde minde impatient kept within lymittes moderate gouernment leaſt croſſe happeneth waightie paine ſence farre weake depriuing v hope griefe haue loſt ſo comfort ſhall ſee againe meane time let v tollerate ſharpe affliction two princely child till enioy fight father againe ſhall noble mother comfort ſorrowes alſo good recouery god ſuffering ende ſhee willingly would gaue ſtrength againe little little comforted ſelfe beſt ſhe foorth company cauſed many knight leaue court liue ſearch ſtrayed prince edoard pitied triumph bare great good prince edoard alſo noble primaleon withdrew themſelues lodging armed themſelues preſently poſting ſpéed might aduenterous primaleon ſome taking one way ſome another well thoſe vſed triumphes lady ſakes alſo thoſe whoſe redoubted behauiour hath wonne honour field dignitie fame mutuall conſent aduentured limme life report déedes might manifeſt renowne knighthood becauſe ſhall haue knowledge behaued themſelues moſt worthy cōmendations leſſe famous rare aduenture bewray ſome yonr gentle opinion paine may yéeld recompence part condigne praiſe firſt tooke courage hazarde daughter emperour palmerin newly maried ſtood doubt proceed leaſt fortune ſhould ſo fauourable expected cauſed ſome ſlackneſſe good neuertheleſſe conſidered honor mar ſharpe cōflicts venus one laſting fame linked effeminate fancie hee determined follow companion driuing obliuion pleaſaunt conceyts hee often eſtéemed beſt beloued vſing perſwaſion himſelfe hee vanquiſhed himſelfe vanitie fancy yéeldeth libertie fond affection méete handle lute lance better court lady deſerue braue name captaine perſwaſion hee departed intending ſo knightly opinion minde honour name ſhould expreſſe noblenes valure bounty eſtéemed fayre bazilia thus city conſtantinople deſolate wanting noble knight thence departed cauſed emperour viſite chiefeſt place citie ſmall content himſelfe ioy citizen little minded abſence noble gentleman ye emperor ſo louingly vouchſafed thē cōmpany thē departed argolant frō court conſtātinople toward realme england bearing anſwere ambaſſage emperor lord ſoueraigne y• loſſe prince edoard blazed court diuers noble prince court armedes king france couſin son law emperor conſtantinople alſo court recinde k spaine court pellagris souldan niquee noble maiortes many prince loſſe engliſh prince grieuous himſelf proofe whereof imployed paine diuerſe noble mindes might remaine witneſſe walked forreſts vnknowne paſſages many countryes martiall behauior neuer eſtéemed thē ſearch ſtrayed prince argolant departed emperour many dayes trauell hee arriued engliſh courte whereas king fredericke quéene princeſſe flerida hee deliuered anſwere meſſage greatly ſatiſfied hearing noble attempt grecian knight whoſe endeuoured paine good proſperous ſucceſſe chap vi ¶how primaleon endeuoring himſelfe diligent ſearch prince edoard happened meet funeralls ſorrowfull lady pandritia daughter k lacedemonia ſhe ſolemnized vnkinde repulſe ſhe ſuſtained prince edoard primaleon determining ſecrete eſcape cittie conſtantinople haue declared commaunded eſquyre bring courſer armour cloſely conuey equippage furniture behind storehouſe siſter flerida none ſhould priuie intent eſqu failed accompliſh pleaſure lord come appointed place armed prince except shield helmet bare himſelf ſo mounting horſbacke departed vowing reſt place till hee might recouer ſome wiſhed tydings brother friend edoard without would neuer returne greece long trauelled encountred aduenture worthy rehearſall length arriuing bottom valley lacedemonia whē sun declined weſt part diſcoraged night obſcure vpon beſide thicknes trées made paſſage tenebrous thē elſe would haue bene ſo hardly could finde way wandring ſtill vſing minde ſeuerall imagination leaſt comfort himſelfe ioy eſquyre ſorrowed ſée lorde ſo ſuddenly penſiue hee eſpyed gailant troupe ladyes bearing theyr hand lighted torch eache one well mounted luſtie stéede attyred blacke framing voice great lamentation primaleon ſurpriſed great griefe minde ſée ſuch fayre ladyes weare habite mourner tooke boldneſſe himſelfe beholde drawing himſelfe ſomewhat nearer perceiued chiefe lady miſtreſſe palfrey trapped black veluet veſture ſame foure ancient knight middeſt bearing funerall couered blacke veluet primaleon perceiuing heauy lamentation nothing abaſhed preſence helde iourney though ſéene tooke ſuch earneſt deſire himſelf muſt néeds demand cauſe mourned manner preſenting himſelfe chiefeſt ladie whoſe faire face ſuſtained great blemiſh abundance teares iſſued eye manner prepared himſelfe giue onſet faire lady impute flattery call ſo folly ſo much ſo rather nature cannot admit praiſe perfectiō mind anſwered perſwaſion vnfeigned meaning eſtéemeth haue ſaid albeit farre inferior could ſay deſire vnder duety may demaund sute otherwiſe diſpoſed may ſtand honour replie honeſty requeſt friend lady foe vnto none inſomuch moytie deſires ſhould rather hinder miſhap diſhearten danger briefe requeſt thus frequent ſolitary place accompanied theſe equal ſorrow althougy worthy compariſon may soueraigntie accompanie funerall ſuch heauie complaint conſidering pleaſures court fit delight vncomfortable abyding ſolitary deſart thus much knightly oath auouching knewe ſuſtained iniury hand would eyther cauſe recount hee hath done hiſhonour conſtraine reuenge deareſt blood ladie hauing well noted courteſie primaleon well knightly offer • good opinion ſhee conceyued performance ſatiſfied requeſt gentle replye syr knight leſſe iudge ignorant eſtate may terme yée neuertheleſſe fayle one let friendſhip yet forget let ſuffice one fortune hath iniuryed euery way miſhappe aduantaged way good lucke ſo anſwere demaund onely ladye may compare miſfortune touching ame may ſome ſort vrge remēber meaning ignorant vnderſtand calld pandritia daughter famous king lacedemonia although preſent vncomfortable wilderneſſes yet gouerneſſe princely dominion hereby caſtle paſſe forth vnfortunate life hauing company theſe may behold beare part mone miſhappe eſtimation life ioy ſo ſmall griefe ſo well acquainted rather deſperate ende deſirous endure make returne vnto carefull caſtle vnprouided faire lady ſuch ſée preſent haue tearmed garden damoſells wherein receiue much ſollace mourning ladie taſting miſhappe obtaine myrth ſure haue trauelled countreys ignorant king ternaes brother death father enchaunted caſtle de noires oyſeaux vntill ſuch time valiancie famous prince edoard deliuered ſo grieuous perplexitie prince afterward remaining brother lacedemonia ſo long pleaſed ſuch tryumphes ordayned might gratifie ſuch honourable perſonage vnfortunate conceiued ſo good opinion valiant behauiour choſe honor life patron loue eſtéeming baſe reſpect hee farre beyond deceyued farre hope cake dowe labour ſpent loſſe long vowed ſeruice faire damoſell flerida eſpowſed departed foorth kingdome thus loue deſpiſed ſelfe diſgraced ſhée honoured gallant whome loued ſoone loſt late cauſeth mee refraine courtly companie betaking ſorrow folly miſt good happe deſired faith yet beholde remembrance vnkinde edoard haue reſerued picture chiefe ornament chamber imagining perſon preſent god knowes farre enough diſtance place farther good heart yet often doe blame picture maiſters ſake whome halfe ſo much power ouer haue portrait hee ſhould well know loue poſſibly deſire ſo much neuer liue deſerue may perceiue picture addreſſed manner funerall depriued hope meane solemnize ſorrowfull manner interring comfortleſſe houſe sadnes may forget fond loue bare ſuch vngentle friend ſée accompliſhed carefull companie may perceiue ready aſſiſt heauy trauel therfore courteous knight pleaſe ſée funeral picture ingratefull prince edoard lifte vppe hearſe ſhall beare witnes haue giuen word pandritia concluding diſcourſe heauy ſigh prince primaleon lifted vp hearſe beheld liuely portreit déere friend edoard ſo artificially drawne doubted whether bene ſlaine thereabout vnder head two pillowes blacke veluet either ſide body two burning taper enforced prince turne talke teares bar • pandritia company night enduoring comfort vowed ſorrow would ſuffer perſwaſion caſe ye would primaleon depart bare company another valley time faire aurora began ſhew cheerfull countenance cloare phoebus haſtened chariot run courſe earth valley ran blacke vgly riuer beſet high trées round made obſcure vnpleaſant beholder midſt riuer ile wherin placed ancient manſion couered ouer al black declared ſmal pleaſure thoſe remained great occaſion ſadnes ſhould come chamber ſolitarie place adorned many picture witneſſes great miſfortunes happened many louers tragicall motion hero leander ſorrowfull end piramus bie accompanied mournful philomela next ſtood vnhappy quéene dido hauing blade eneas pierced harmeleſſe heart workemanſhip ſo cunningly ordred would haue iudged freſh miſhaps bemoning funeral entring knight cloſed dore ſo primaleon meane anſwer neuertheleſſe ſtaied heare ſorrowfull clamor made within leſſe irkſome heart ſéene perfect interring brother eodard laſt hee departed dyrecting courſe ſuch place thought ſooneſt heare tydings ſtraied friend trauayling good hope wil leaue declare large cauſe pandritia great mourning alſo fortuned two yong prince nouriſhed caue sauadgeman chap vii ¶the cauſe pandritia led ſolitary kind life yong prince florian ſtraied caue sauadge man sir pridos brought • engliſh court happened occaſion pandritia bare ſuch great affection prince edoard large declared booke intituled primaleon prince deliuered brother tarnaes enchaunted caſtle wherein father deuiſed way encloſe came home lacedemonia shee oft •• •• emed mooue good liking behalfe prince edoard hee meanes could direct fancy courſe promiſe paſſed princeſſe flerida withheld conſent ſhe gladly looked auoyd therefore might happen refuſed vſe company talke hee wont much diſpleaſed bellagris soldā niquee death molerin eldeſt brother hee vnderſtanding ſecret affection great good ſhe entirely bare noble prince edoard aduentured trie fortune ſo fauourably proſpered intent vnder tytle edoard entred ſiſters chamber acquainting himſelfe deſire deceit time brought tho •• pleaſure goodly sonne named blandidon hereafter ſhall largely certified pandritia giuing credite ſelfe noble edoard receiued eſtimation honour grouuded ſuch firme affection ought would grant kéeping picture abſence vnderſtanding ſuppoſed death ſhe vſed ſoleunitie honour funeralles attyred ſelfe according became miſfortune departing garden damoſelles houſe ſadneſſe ſuppoſing thereto end life loſſe loue remaineth ſhe place ſhe ſhut dore againſt prince primaleon likewiſe endeuoring himſelfe aduentures returne two young princeſſo sauage man wife carefully nouriſhed vp béene owne child ſhe could haue vſed motherly compaſſion ſhort time grew ſuch eſtate whole delight hunt ſauage beaſtes forreſt wherevnto florian • affection brother palmerin vſed euery day beare bowe leade two lyon hee became expert sauage man himſelfe thus ten yeares ſpace liued theſe two young prince beloued w • greateſt enemie fortuned sunday morning prince fletida walked forth forreſt well ſorrow luue lamēt eſtate infortunate life hauing accompliſhed ſhe deſired ſhe returned time florian wandred forreſt lyon tyed vp meaning take force firſt wilde beaſt ſhould appeare ſight hauing long ſtayed without prey determined returne laſt eſpyed mighty hart groue trées whereat let ſlie arrow ſuch force paſſed cleane body beaſt hart féeling himſelfe wounded proſently tooke flight perceiuing let ſlip lion vaine ſwiftneſſe hart outreached ſpéedy pace lyon florian ſtrayed ſo farre loſt ſight lyon harte alſo way sauadge man houſe cauſed wander heauineſſe till darke night ouerſhadowed eſpyed two shepheards making little fire ſtickes warme becauſe night excéeding colde florian arriued hee ſate downe riuers ſide ſame place mother brought world ſitting pretty eſpyed knight come ryding attyred blacke armor ſpotted red bearing shielde figure gryffon certaine poeſie vnknown lady himſelfe excepted knight named sir pridos ſtill aduanced himſelfe ſearch noble prince edoard rode penſiue ſad till caſting eye vpon floran heart beganne ſomewhat conceiue maruellous inward ioy countenance bare perfect image noble father whereupon sir pridos fell diuers demaundes florian courteouſly anſwered syr pridos fell great deſire would beare company london wherein king court would preſent among number thoſe whome renowmed fame euer accompany young prince florian deſirous leade life among braue gallantes ſo paſſe time ſo ſolitarie among vnfrequenten place wilde forreſt gaue conſent iournyed sir pridos engliſh court preſented king cloathed skinne harte thing ſmall admyration king yet hee receiue graciouſly ſuppoſed one sonnes princeſſe flerida vnto whoſe chamber walked young prince manner beganne ſalute fayre daughter among grieuous vexation afflict weake nature loe heere honour syr pridos doeth preſent withall ſearching noble lord sonne hath found iewell hee offereth fruſtes labour truſt oftner beholde ſweete countenance conceyue opinion allyance sonne edoard princeſſe flerida little pleaſed ſo glad preſent ſigne whereof ſhée imbraced sonne albeit vnknowen went ſtraight way sir pridos certified found ſitting ſame place sauadge man came two lyon tooke two child mooued flerida ſuppoſe sonne fortune would yet ſuffer perfect aſſuraunce eyther hée ſhould know mother ſhee childe neuertheleſſe ſhée gaue name deſart training vp company young gentleman sonne syr pridos attaida named roſiran de la bronde whome leaue gentle prince florian know sauadge man palmerin ſéeing florian returned woont chap viii grieuous sauadge man tooke ſuddaine loſſe yong prince forian perceiued two lion returne waſhed blood hart ſlaine young prince palmerin walking sea ſide ſeeke brother accompanied siluian sauadge man sonne departed thence galley polendos king theſſalie ſailed conſtāntinople preſented emperor damoſel mounted white courſer bearing armes arriued court conſtantinople ſhe preſented emperor letter ſent lady lake gaue large vnderſtand ſhould oappen • yong prince palmerin long expected sauadge man ſhe returne florian ſeeing waxed darke hope deceiued hee meaſure diſquieted abſence florian whoſe company expertneſſe towardneſſe exerciſe commodious griefe would ſuffer expreſſe wherefore hee concluded thus young florian ſome way diſtreſſed himſelfe vtterly diſdained fortune morning lyon returned home al waſhed blood hart ſlaine sauadge man percelued guide wanting thus pollnted anguiſh heart chollericke perſwaſi • n doſperate moode hee ſlew lyon entred ſuch diſquietneſſe nothing could aſſwage extreame paſſion yong prince palmerin ſuſtaining great ſorrow abſence brother walked sea ſhore accompanied siluian sauadge man sonne ſitting comforting greene bancke naturs moued one nurture eſpied galley ſtrike ſhore twaine diſported polendos king theſlalie chiefe captaine galley likewiſe directed iourney finding edoard commanded caſt anker becauſe recreation ſake would walke vp forreſt alſo finde ſwéete water whereof greatly deſtitute palmerin siluian ſéeing king landed fearing leaſt ſhould ſuſtaine ſome harme ignorant determined courteous deme • let paſſe ſo ſhould haue cauſe moleſt depart friendly perceiuing nothing courteſie polendos deholding beautie palmerin leſſe ciuill comely behauiour bdth deſired goe abrdad hee would preferre ſuch place ſhould raiſed honour finde thing equiual • gentle nature palmerin whoſe fancy could hardly brooke ſauadge kinde life rather deſired acquaint himſelfe courtly exerciſe gaue grant • king requeſted albeit siluian vſed intreatie perſwade contrary hée ſaw meanes deuiſed could take effect well great loue betwéene inuiolate affection alway bare young prince vowed neuer leaue company either miſery miſfortune accident whatſoeuer king leſſe delighted minde greatly contented manner palmerin ſeruants beeing returned ſuch neceſſaries hee ſent went abroad heyſed sayles preſently committing themſelues god mercie waues riding pleaſure king deſired palmerin hée might lawfull craue ſo much certifie concerning byrth parentage courteous prince right willingly gaue conſent vnto declaring life sauadge man certainely ſuppoſed father many dayes fayling arriued conſtantiuople preſēt endued great heauines time paſt ſurpaſſed princely delight port hauen likewiſe nakedly prouided ſhips occean mediterranian ſeas ſcattered y• whole nauy ſearch p edoard alſo know become noble primaleon yet time wiſhed tydings heard emperor vnderſtanding y• polendos arriued conſtantinople walked • wn hauen accompany pallace come hearing tidings ſons became ſorrowfull cōtinued ſo long time polendos put emperour ſadde cenceyte preſented vnto young prince palmerin accompanied siluian caſ • ing eye young prince entred preſently ſuch alteration ioy béene ſonne primaleon could hardly haue béene better contented wherefore commaunded knight conduct hm princeſſe gridonia willing giue ſeruant faire polinarda whoſe beauty ſo excellent feature agréeable euery lyneament modeſtie ſo decent vertue therto apparant ſhe rightly termed phaenix beauty moſt famous among lady bounty empreſſe gridonia receiued yong prince albeit ignorant eſtate yet beſéemed honor reſpecting ſent went ſtraightway preſent faire polinarda time cauſed aduenture good fortune among pike miſchanches hazard moſt daunger onely loue hée bought déerely ſhe gaue daintily proofe let ſuffice hereafter enſueth attend ſtrange rare euent ſubdaine arriued emperor pallace comely damoſell mounted courſer white swan bearing armor alſo anſwerable ſame colour haire ſpread ouer ſhoulders gaue cauſe meruaile ſaw come preſence emperor little admiration thoſe beare company ſhe drew foorth letter delyuering ſame ſuch maieſtie behauiour méete gratifie ſuch honourable perſonage emperour deliuering one herald cōmanded read publique audience vnſeaking began followeth ¶to inuincible moſt renowned palmerin emperour greece salutation renowned emperor whoſe name enemy quaketh subiect reioyceth whoſe court name rich valiant friendſhip reward venterous wiſh thy ſtate permanent thy deed hath beene puiſſant vnanimitie thy friend proſper longanimitie happy fortune yong prince thou haſt receiued thy court albeit thou maiſt think incredible yet ſhall finde certaine time doeth muſt deſcended two moſt puiſſant king chriſtendome himſelfe victorious • uer wherefore let entertainment ſuch honour doth deſerue eſtimation according valure doth declare muſt need defend diadem thy domiminions ſhall remaine deſtitute wiſhed defence ſhall make thee lauded fortune loued thy enemy thy deareſt friend likewiſe two moſt infortunate prince world ſhall enioy libertie many haue ſhall attempt alone oidained finiſh exployr aboue fauour fortune ſhall exell nobilitie knighthood thus leauing ſumme promiſe gratious triall wiſh noble emperour greece may liue eternall honour felicitie dutie pen word ſhe way diſclole lady lake emperor leſſe amazed happy aduenture contented glad newes noble yong prince deſired damoſel might lady lake whō damoſell replied noble ſir ſhe altogether vnknowne thus much dare boldly aſſure maieſtie letter preſenteth ſhall performed worthy young prince theſe ſpéeches ended damoſell departed emperor perceiuing ſent yong prince vpon vſing many chéerfull countenance deſired noble gentleman ſtanding might tearmed palmerin owne name thought ſhould better eſtéemed lady polinarda whoſe fauor greatly eſtéemed wearing lady color might giue ſome cauſe beliefe empres gridonia ſtill lamented loſſe primaleon whoſe abſence court chiefeſt cauſe ſorrow chap ix happened vernar prince allemaign ſearch edoard controuerſie betweene belcar duke dura vnfortunate forreſt england haue declared vernar prince allemaigne ſonne emperour trineus faire agrigola left court conſtantinople palmerin departed ſéeke prince edoard affaire gentle prince likewiſe behaued himſelfe ſo worthily many rare exploytes fame remaineth perfect type hononr allemaigne chronicle cauſe leaue rehearſe returning happened prince charge ſpeake fortuned hee hauing ſpent ſmall labour trauaile arriued laſt great brittaine good hope heare ſome newes end labour entred vnfortunate forreſt ryding ſadly y• mind ſomwhat diſtracted remēbrance faire bazilia length met comely knight brauely mounted attyred gilt armour whereon wrought many leopard artificiall deuice yet crazed broken ſome rough encounter béene shéeld bare serpent field siluer trauailing alſo ſearch ſtrayed prince likewiſe méet ſuch profeſſed magnanimitie minde combate honour owne good fortune cauſe left lady engliſh court among called knight serpent paſſing prince vernar vſed ſuch courteſie vnto beſéemed knighthoode méete ſuch noble perſon altogether vſing thoughtes fayreſt bazilia leyſure beholde knight courteſie knight serpent ſuppoſing eythere hee willingly would perceyue ſéeing ſcorned gentle salutation vſed reuiued prince vernar theſe ſpéeches syr knight mee thinkes might ſtand honour profeſſion blemiſh way bounty euery way haue thought well meant ill haue gratified like courtier diſdained paſſe vſe courteſie prince driuen foorth dump whereto hee pleaſure knight gentle proffer betwéene iſet earneſt thus anſwered sir muy offended without blame iudge behauior bald would conſtraine ſpeake hearing ſpéeche matter minde would ſuffer ſée much leſſe heare syr quoth knight serpent excuſe farre ſimple denying hearing sight though ſtatelyneſſe would ſuffer ſée yet leawdneſſe ſpéech doth iuſtifie might heare vernar hearing large language knight might quickly mooue anger ſubiect ouer much melancholie▪ thus ſhortly replyed syr knight haue better licence depart leaue ſtay minde troubled ſuch metters rather requireth abſence thea alloweth preſence giuing farther vnderſtand companie ſo much heart ſtrife may ariſe betwéene v great harme knight perceyued ſmall eſtimation vernar thus roundly replyed syr either bringing vp hath bene ouer churliſh preſent behauior ſcant currant eſtéem courteſie like carter courtyer ciuile demeanour fitte holde ploughe fine quality honour perſon eſtéeme méete modeſt expreſſe ſuch friuolous motion doth repreſſe abruptly nature friendly manner greater danger concealing deſire damage concealing ſuch ſimple demand deſire rather quoth vernar mine owne ruine ſhould ſo ſimple graunt requeſt ſo much expedient none ſhould know thought ſhee onely excepted muſt priuie thinke wherefore eſteeming thy manhoode ſmall commaund thy might compell bury thought death intend ſatiſfie thy deſire leauing word fell weapon ſhiuering speares armour encounted ſuch brauerie glad take breathing knight serpent beganne thus charge belieue sir finde skirmiſh hote concealed thoughtes may eſtéemed wiſedome eſtate ſtandeth ſharpe hazarde mute conceyts force yéeld ſure helpe hope ſhall ſhew difference betweene careleſſe groome courtly gentleman syr aunſwered prince vernan opinion yet farre beyond purpoſe wide hope ſcant wiſe put intent hap perſwade ſelfe thus courage haue foyle ſecrecie eſtéem mine owne faith ſhall ere long giue abſolute anſwere whether ſhal periſh determination thy ſelfe preuaile thou demandeſt ſhall craue longer forbearance sword hath taught manner againſt would teach kinde modeſtie fell freſh combate dangerous firſt aſſault wearied sword endeuoured wraſtling ſuppreſſe ſtrength eache equal behauiour force ſuch▪ loſſe blood great yet valorous heart would conceiue faintneſſe knight serpent ſuch deſire knowe againſt fought began vſe fair ſpéeches perceiue sir eſtéeme earneſt opinion ſtand feare loſſe life honour deliuer vnto knowledge ſuch ſeuere chaunce ſhould happen vnto either v yet minde ſo affected know ſecret ſelfe ſhall value life life qd vernar ſo much willing looſe much perceyue zealous know ſhall wherevppon beganne againe third time albeit faintly paſſed cauſed eſquyres ſtanding enter many heauy complaintes eſpecially eſquire prince vernar thus framed mone oh infortunate emperor ignorant fortune time depriue ioy knight serpent noting theſe word preſently coniectured prince vernar ſonne emperour allemaigne againſt entred combat grieuous emperor palmerin would take matter heard loſſe either beſide himſelf would loth way diſpleaſe gentle prince vernar wherefore aſſurance beheld broken shield wherein perceiued deuiſe lady bazilia coloured purple halfe burning heart midſt armor prince edoard ſudden aduertiſed enchauntreſſe eutropa aunte ſhould arriue certaine knight caſtell whoſe valour proweſſe ſhould goe néere attainte honour alſo inforce life ſtand ſome hazard giuing credite vnto perſwaſion likewiſe ſomewhat carefull auoyde imminent perill fortified caſtel ſuch ſure defence thought ſufficient award enemie maintaine intent vowed proſecute feare ſome time maketh man foreſight reuenged knight death father frenaque better accompliſh entertained caſtle two hardy fearefull giant one named pandare alligan whoſe ſtature leſſe vglineſſe ſtrength cruell reſiſtance féele fortune bending browes couragious primaleon ſhe earſt aduanced honour determined vnhappineſſe directeth courſe vnfriendly caſtle ſhould end trauailes owne thraldome left ſolitarie pandritia realme lacedemonia trauelled burgondie happening among knight come place triumph himſelfe brauely mounted gréene armor colour ſomewhat aſſwaged extreame melanchollies shéelde ground azure sea brauely artificiallie framed beholder might eaſily iudge heauineſſe knight according ſad deuiſe primaleon leſſe abaſhed brauery caſtle ſée knight ſo well appointed armes began order vſe ſpéeches syr knight would ſo happy elſe ſo hardy enter caſtle without offering combate well ſatiſfie mine owne deſire loath offer rude demean deſiring requeſt ſtand reaſon let paſſe choller vpon knightly courteſie edoard perceiuing comely behauiour primaleon whome hee ignorant knowledge ſhaped preſently anſwere knew sir knight hard entertainment vnfriendly vſage knight whatſoeuer enter caſtle would loath ſpend ſpéech ſuch fond requeſt rather vſe ſpéed ſafe retire place may increaſe fame ſo place may ſtay ſorrow follie theſe perſwaſions cannot withhold intent raſhly runne continuall trouble knowe muſt firſt award puiſſance reſiſteth knightes ſéeke wilfully theyr owne perill admit fortune denie victorie ſéeke ouerthrowe vnder title valiance yet ſuch hazard paſſe doth diſcourage thinke diſhearten trie truſt sir anſwered primaleon word ſufficient make feare bare minde c • auen captaine heereof aſſure ſelfe neither perſwaſion daunger doubt ſelfe come cauſe feare ſhow ſhall make fainte ſhadowe eſtimation alwayes beare mee harde aduenture brauer victorie ſir take certaintie haue ſetled hope neyther remoue onely death ſelfe thus concluding ſpéeches couched speares began ſharpe encounter wherin behaued themſelues ſo brauely ſtood caſtle beholding leſſe commend theyr valour good intent eache othar ſhewed hope victorie laſt ſo fiercely met togither vnhorſed much diſpleaſed primaleon beeing neuer life caſt foorth saddle drawing ſword thus approched prince edoard sir knight trye ſtrength vſing sword equall y• force haue felt speare hauing made mee impatient beeing neuer ouerthrowen doth increſe courage know hath done inſtant many attempt could done edoard leſſe offended miſhap amazed courage perceiued aduerſarie began ſuſpect knight againſt endeuored himſelfe brother friend primaleon cauſe moued think ſo equall ſtate ſtrength time paſt often prooued doubt reſolue himſelfe thus began syr primaleon may rather tearmed preſumption politique foreſight would ſtriue matche aboue manhoode ſo mée might accounted rather fooliſh hardineſſe friendly héede doe brauery ſhould excéede limites bountie ſtriue friend dutie ought moſt honour primaleon hearing theſe friendly ſpéeches preſe • tly knewe brother edoard caſting sword ground hee embraced prince theſe louing ſalutations heart able thinke tongue ſpeake ſelfe make manifeſt meane inward ioy conceiue high good fortune doo eſtéem trauells ſhould deare friend brother perceyue health happines primaleon liueth longer edoard reioyceth long haue deſired happie day long haue ſought good lucke daunger albeit neuer ſo proſperous heare yet moſt fortunate men come ſée edoard would haue anſwered againe giant pandare brought word dramuſiande breake theyr talke come whoſe commandement prince obeying entred caſtle primaleon offering goe pandare beeing armed great yron mace hand ſtrong shielde thruſt backe theſe churliſh wordes stay sir knight meane ſée thou canſt deliuer thée hand alſo thou warrant thine life primaleon beholding great pride pandare diſhonor offred word alſo diſdaine tooke thus controled gaue anſwer difficult anſwere thée thy wordes require dangerous correct boldneſſe ſuch proud riuall ſcorne vſe word ſuch peaſant whoſe maners ſo far honeſtie maiſter neuer come knowledge thereof whoſe plume may pull ſuch due reward ſhall thinke warrant better wiſdome eſcape brag owne brauerie may hap lie lurtch pandare vexed y• reply primaleon knowing whether beſt anſwere word déeds laſt ſent ſuch blow yron mace primaleons ſhield ſhiuered piece grieued ſtāding ſome néed made foe triumph hoped death hée eſpying part body pandare vnarmed reacheth ſuch blow reuenge shield began ſtagger hardly withholding himſelfe frō falling earth dramuſiande leaning edoard foorth windowe caſtell perceiuing courage primaleon daungerous combate deſired know name whence edoard anſwered according deſired giuing vnderſtand onely many aduentures hee put life hazard onely ſake dramuſiande knewe hee determined primaleon apartner edoard kéepe twaine captiuitie till fortune ſent cuſtomers pandare ſéeing blowes beſtowed ſmal purpoſe primaleon returned many ſhrewde gréetings flung sworde target great furie pretending deſtruction primaleon yron mace many ſore ſtrokes paſſed either part primaleon followed determination ſo well y• ſtroken pandares fowre finger wherewith mace fell ground ſtooping recouer primaleon gotten ſuch good aduantage hee ſtroken head ougly giant alligan obſcure caue bene reſcue ſtepping betwéene thus ſaluted primaleon syr knight thou haſt freſh labour beginne wherefore withdrawe thy hand conqnered come deale hope conquer thée therewithall primaleon fully prouided receiued ſuch cruell blowe head put ſome danger primaleon ſéeing ſuch fearefull enemie mighty blowes ſtill charged withall bethought friende edoard whoſe helpe fierce aſſault might doe ſmall pleaſure yet hee conſidered himſelfe doubtleſſe ſome néede ſo kept vnder hee might aſſiſt elſe hee perſwaded himſelfe would requiſite helpe hée ready wiſh hee taking vp shielde pandare betwéene alligan himſelfe began hotteſkirmiſh place fought altered colour theyr blood made manifeſt yet alligan rough behauiour little hope good ſucceſſe becauſe hardineſſe primaleon hadde martyred shield armour piece ſo defence beare blowes freſh eager aſſaults noble hearted prince brought vnto ſuch lowe eſtate ſuppoſed quight ſlaine mooued ſitte downe reſt faintneſſe loſſe blood wearyneſſe ſo long continuing battell made glad deſirous little eaſe dramuſiande perceyuing harde euent combat ſtanding doubt fortune ſome ſiniſter meanes would ſéeke ouerthrowe ſo depriue looked aunte laboured armed himſelfe preſently came foorth primaleon aſſailing firſt theſe wordes syr knight friend pleaſe foe dare one may finde comfort diſtreſſe incurable miſchiefe beare companie ſo great daunger mee thinkes • honour yéelde blemiſh knighthoode endure freſh aſſault great hazarde eſtéeme courteous offer ſée wound cured mine owne charge weake eſtate comforted beſéemeth good knight primaleon well nothing honeſt word dramuſiande fearing faire talke might beare fauor ſhrewde meaning made anſwere ſir paine haue beſtowed ſharpe encounter haue eudured might purchaſe y• deliuery deareſt friend ddward would make eſtimation courteſie confeſſe ſelfe life euer bound duty iudge meane nothing leſſe reward trauaile deſireth nothing ſo heart bent vnto hautie enterpriſe intreatie ſerue ſhall gayned perforce courteſſe eſtéemed compulſion may ſhall command oath haue made friend doeth diſcharge heart feare hope haue victorie bid rather die vanquiſhed ſo ſhall award reproch world true friend whoſe ſafetie tender owne ſoule dramuſiande pauſe tooke occaſion reply manner sir knight two cauſes account honour vſe thée courteouſly firſt greatly pittie harme may enſue vnuiſed heade doth brauerie faſhion glad bitter teares bemoane folly ſecond cauſe conquer thée would rather diſcredite honour gotten victory conſidering thy vnfortunate miſerable eſtate knightly puiſſance ſhall beſtowe thee neuertheleſſe charme proud ſpéeches thou haſt vſed correct raſh behauiour thy vnſtayed wit thou ſhalt know tam • mallepart bridle thoſe cannot rule owne manhood vpon theſe word laid fiercely primaleon whoſe debility rather required quietneſſe ſuch extreame ſtrokes hee muſt néedes ſuffer neuertheleſſe hee employed himſelfe ſuch nimble defence weary trauayle would permit mooued great compaſſion minde dramuſiande ſée weakeneſſe body agrée inuincible courage heart would thing haue ſlaine eaſily might haue done hee would vſe perſwaſiō diſcharged order sir knight thou maiſt ſée refuſe fight griefe ſuſtaine thy hurt feare haue thée doe harme token whereof ſet thée libertie one willing doe thée good thē deſire haue bereaue thée life thou refuſe courteſie deſperately ſéeke thine owne deſtruction promiſe thee neither mercy may aſſwage rygour meane beſide ſhall withhold reuenge careleſſe ow • e life great pitie ſhould looſe primaleon caſting eye vpon armour perceiued al broken battered piece alſo bathed blood iſſued frō wound calling remembrance lady gridonia whoſe heart might hardly brooke heare miſchance beſt beloued walked little himſelfe vſing theſe ſilent cogitatiōs madame behold laſt day heauy departure laſt farewell ſent teares bléeding heart ſubiect mine enemy ſtriue conquere yet rather deſire death loſe honor name know next aſſault laſt tragedie time muſt refuſe loue friend yet ſhould forſake remembring loſſe wel hard hap whē fortune hath determined extremitie ſhould ſéeke ſhunne would iuſtly repay deſerued ſhame famous emperor renowned father whoſe thought far heauy caſe troubled heart void comfort yet let iuſt perſwaſion cut griefe may ſuſtaine liues friend whoſe fréedome felicity die fréend whoſe thraldome miſery deſire finiſh ere ſhrinke one iot honour knighthood albeit loſſe blood ouerchargeth mee faintneſſe long continuance fight oppreſſeth wearines yet ſhall neuer reported primaleon turned backe forgetting bounty left • ield one hauing already conquered twaine ioy conceiue finding chiefeſt friend biddeth die ere leaue ſo ſhall hee trie loue thinke deare father ſwéete gridon • ia forget duetie law nature willeth beare deſperately run mine owne death increaſe ſorrowe continuall mones thinke haue ventured vpon honour loue ſo eſtimation friend time commaunds mee hazard life wherein ſwerue obedience friend amitie pauſe ſo hartened noble primaleon ran couragiouſly vpon dramuſiande theſe word defend thy ſelfe either win haue promiſed leaue life gage thy preſence whereupon fell fiercely combate againe made dramuſiande muſe ſée noble courage primaleon weake defence hée himſelfe laſt extreame faintneſſe fell ground though hée beene quite bereaued life cauſed dramuſiande beare chamber edoard cōmaunding chirurgions phiſitions vſe great care diligence ſauing life might bée poſſible becauſe hée greatly affected ſaue life ſuch couragious knight edoard penſiue great daunger primaleon whoſe health hee leſſe carefull hee béene venterous purchaſe deliuerie ſomwhat receuered knowledge eutropa great friendſhip good ſhould time come ſuſtaine handes nephew dramuſiande ſhould make double amends miſchances happened thus leaue dramuſiande vſing meanes might health primaleon alſo recouery pandare alligan laſt brought good conſtitution body ioy great comfort two faythfull prince liued loued reioyc • others friendly company chap xi emperor conſtantinople made noble young prince palmerin knight diuers yong prince lord court hee honourably made knight armes ppalmerin remaining long time father beloued euery one princely behauiour eſtéemed beſt gentle nature grew vnto ſuch ripeneſſe age greatly deſired order knighthood feare looſe ſeruice lady myſtreſſe polinarda vowed duty heart whole courſe life knightly aduentures withdrewe minde ſo bold enterpriſe ſhee likewiſe ioyned equal affection modeſtie cauſed couer maydenly demeanour moue conceale ſhée would raſhly run ſuſpition palmerin appointed begin firſt iuſt gaue curteſie lady polinarda himſelfe thus opened preſent thoughs good lady whoſe beautie prize allureth field whoſe curteſie honour ſtriue attaine let fauour remaine aſſured dare warrant ſelfe victory aboue beautie ſo ſhall bountie conquer miſchances wherewith hee couched ſpeare againſt libuſan greece enduring abraue combate till laſt hée taught libuſan ſit ho ••• aſter palmerin nothing diſmayed ioying hee conquered one chiefeſt knight greece greatly pleaſed emperour lady polinarda alſo whole company knight whoſe eye partner gallant exployt prince florendos encountred follane brother platir attenebrant blacke knight whoſe valure one againſt leſſe chéerfull beholder delightfull themſelues gracian tragandor brake ſpeares ſuch violence horſe man ſent ground berolde oniſtald dramian ran againſt truſiande clariball hungaria emerolde faire fortune ſo aduerſe thrée firſt diſmounted stéede oniſtalde one fore leg broken next roſuell eſtrellant bellizart receiued countie valerian archillagus brother guendolin whoſe ſtrength farre weake reſiſta • ce therefore bare diſhonour forth field francian dridan tremoran germaine orleance lnyman burgondy met ioyntly criſpian macedon foruolant ſtrong flauian yet vnhorſed except tremoran kept ſaddle valiantly thus firſt encounter gallantly diſcharged ſmall pleaſure emperor nobility alſo regardants gaue great commendation hautineſſe 1 exployt libuſan greece ſomewhat offended vnfortunate fall remounted fellowes entred field reuenge enemie berolde spaine receiuing point launce charmed bold attempt ſuch knightly behauiour eſtéemed one chiefe knight triumph reſt déedes hereafter ſhew deſerued leſſe praiſe tituball red knight medruſian fearefull tracandor truſiande trofoliant clariball hungaria puiſſant frouolant one ſide young knights▪ gracian friſoll dramorant oniſtalde eſtrellant roſuell bellizart suyman burgondie bazilliart francian prince florendos falling wraſtling behaued themſelues pollicie diuerſitie ſubtill ſleights emperor lady tooke great pleaſure behold ſuppoſing report famous triumphe would call home ſome thoſe knight ſearch two ſtayed prince briefe honour palmerin noble young knight cōmended euery one eſpecially fayre polinarda gaue ſeruant palmerin ſmall commendation empreſſe gridonia ſomewhat ſad primaleon yet reioyced ſée towardly behauiour young palmerin knightes traine almoſt forced liſtes ſuddaine entred among two knight brauely mounted attired gréene armor running againſt two young knight brake speares valiantly laying handes swoords dealt ſuch knightly blowes amongſt euery one driuen great admiration palmerin perceiuing hardines theſe two knight doubting leaſt traine ſhould endaungered bowed himſelfe lady polinarda rode forward vſing theſe ſpéeches himſelfe ſwéete lady time ſhould diſmay ſelfe hauing perſon mée whoſe ſight ſufficient conquere proud enemy time wherein name ſhalbe eternally honored knight eſtéemed worthy ſo good miſtreſſe aduancing one theſe ſtrange knight called euery one knight sauage man looked deuice sield wild man leading couple lyon hand well viewed knight ioyned combat ſo fiertely handled either part paſſed farre incomparable fearefull aſſault regardants ſeeing equallitie ſtrength could iudge victory likelieſt cauſed emperour meruaile deſirng might parted themſelues would thereto agrée wiſe twaine thus egerly dealt one another platir ſet vpon companion knight sauage man ſoone brought vnder puiſſance platir ſo knight forced liſts tremoran luyman burgondie bellizart excepted faine carried foorth ſo ſore wounded emperour perceiuing rough aſſault betwéene palmerin knight sauage man ſo ouercome doubtes ſcant knewe ſay eſtéemed combate beſt euer ſawe life time comparing fight himſelfe giant dramaque encountring frenaque england neither combate betwe • ne friſol france contentiō picture empreſſe polinarda much leſſe eſtéeming hardy aduenture betweene primaleon prince edward giuing onely praiſe aboue inuincible courage theſe twaine emperor perceiuing drewe towardes night feared endamagement might come either ſent cōmandement leaue fight deſirous ſtill victorie would hardly agrée till trumpet ſounded retrayt euery knight muſt haſten vnto captaine two gréene knight becauſe would knowne departed ſecretly way came emperor knight departed pallace ſumptueus banquet prepared euery one forgetting anger betwéene turnament banquet ended knight fell dancing palmerin ſomewhat baſhfull ſpeak lady polinarda courted dramaciana daughter duke tirendos chiefe gentlewoman attending lady miſtreſſe prince florendos becauſe would ſtraine ouermuch cuteſie tooke ſiſter polinarda thought might lawfully ſo bold platir choſe floriana daughter ditree néece friſoll france gracian deſired claricia daughter king polendos theſſalie berold prince spaine delighted oniſtalda daughter duke normandie bellizart requeſted deieſa daughter king sparta francian amorous vernande daughter valiant belcar thus euery one courting lady fell dancing ſo ended paſtime night emperor departed chamber accompanied palmerin two noble ſonnes primaleon empreſſe gridonia faire polinarda generally gaue great commendation braue behauiour yong prince palmerin emperor ſomewhat offended two gréene knight ſo departed without knowledge whence came courage made manifeſt two valiant approued knight armes deſerued reward honour • euer came thus reioyced emperour court remained flower chiualrie young knight neuer tryed themſelues alſo couragious palmerin whoſe hardineſſe would giue place hazard made emperour famous themſelues enrolled booke eternall memory chap xiii next day triumphes lady arriued emperor court declaring shield ſent sage aliart obſcure valley yong prince palmerin taken knight sauage man kept ſame forreſt cleare fountaine vntill knight durſt aduenture fetcht many knight enterpriſed winne loſt labour till palmerin came brought away morrow tournament emperour accompanied kng friſol young knight ſate great hall giuing ſuch cōmmendations late taken trauell eſtéemed themſelues highly honoured finde ſuch curteſie emperor hand euery one wiſhing might haue gained knowledge two gréen knight behaued themſelues ſo worthily breake talke ſuddainly entred damoſell attyred engliſh faſhion robe veluet middle ſkirt gold face endued leſſe beautie garment adorned ſumptuous brauery ſhée well beheld knight fayling perſon ſhe ſought finde bending knées emperour thus vſed ſalutations moſt renowned emperor whoſe name leſſe honored déedes held worthy immortall memory pardon rude entrance bold maiden attend diſcourſe ſhall deliuer maieſtie great sauadge magitian named sage aliart obſcure valley hartily wiſheth continuall happineſſe faithfull oath obedience kiſſeth hand imperial maieſty becauſe highneſſe hath bin lately conquered much ſadneſſe ſmall gréefe courtly aſſiſtants alſo himſelfe vnknown ſubiect promiſeth loſſe ſhall recouered ioy neither fortune ſhall let miſhap auouch contrary cauſe comming preſent shield maieſties hand ſhould giuen famous yong knight triumph honour day bear title perfect knighthood iuſt deſert haue often heard yet dare • cantcy credite tale noueltie importing truth lawes reuenge iniuries lady knight ſuch cauſes would aduenture liues well may ſo finde ſo perhaps miſfortune denies ſhould fo haue ſafely trauelled many fortaine coaſt found reſcue diuers noble knight euery ſtraunge countrey till happening dominion leaſt ſuſpected doubt ſoone fell extreame daunger muſt eyther admit mine owne miſhap ſuch vnkinde knight deny helpe faire lady ſo great hazard shield charge deliuer maieſtie reward knight whoſe deſert méeteſt taken knight gréene armor bearing shield sauage man leading two lyon thus willed certifie knight whoſe valure worthineſſe hath deſerued shield méete within theſe thrée dayes foreſt cleare fountaine méete ſome knight fetch away haue vnhappily loſt vndoubtedly beare shield away cauſe ſo circumſpectly behold knight try fortune beene ſo good know couragious minde entred trauayle thus hauing done duetie referre rudeneſſe diſcourſe gratious pardon whoſe wiſedome accept ſimple declaration conſidering maiden ſeldome acquainted eloquence emperor pondering damoſels word friendly meſſage sage aliart neuer heard ſent empreſſe princeſſe gridonia receiued ſo honorably hope glad tydings encreaſed comfort vpon theſe newes diuers knight determined themſelues goe fetch lady shielde reſoluing thus fortune winne honour ineſtimable ſhoul • gaine ſo braue victorie whereupon clariball hungaria emeralde fayre criſpian macedon flauian rotandor medruſian fearefull trofollant proud foruolant friend emperour came tournament ſéeke reuengement ancient malice bare vnto maieſtie certaine predeceſſors felt force furie freſh ſpight engendred becauſe young knight giuen ſuch great diſgrace lady wherefore would purſue knight sauage man win shéeld knight ſhould come come forreſt cleere fountaine beheld ſhéeld hanging trée hard fou • taine noble knight sauage man ready defend foruolant tooke courage giue firſt aſſault ſet beſide saddle ſhéeld helmet hanged trée ſigne hée conquered long ſtaid criſpian macedō clariball emerald flauian rotandor bare cōpany whoſe ſhéelds helmet likewiſe placed vanquiſhed trofollant ſéeing hard hap companion ſomwhat angry hauty courage knight sauage • n thought haue done ſtrength would permit ſo diſmounted horſe vpon hauing recouered himſelfe féete drew ſword began freſh encounter time palmerin accompanied diuers noble knight gracian dramian florendos platir reſt arriued ſaw trofollant ſent conquered cōpanions whereupon prince palmerin began maner deſire ſir knight neither gaine glory friendly affection beare bind vp wound grieuous ſight féele yet reſpecting friendſhip thē deſire find hand mine enemy knight sauage man ſtaying anſwer thus ſhortly anſwered sir apparance griefe take ſuch deſire good may ſhal find occaſion remaine déepe debt iudge either ouerfond elſe forgetfull ſelfe offer ſuch friendſhip ſtranger doth neither deſire way deſerue ſuppoſe rather come ſtay ſalue sir quoth palmerin eſtate ſée doth cōmand vſe ſpéech conſtraine might ſuccour neither fearing doe falling one iote ſhould doe tell come deſire intreaty cōpel force reſtore ſhield againe haue diſloyally taken trauelling lady conſidering might diminiſh honour ſhould deale ſo vngratefully ſéeme enemy knighthood regarding helpe wrong iniured lady knight sauage man beholding great courteſie palmerin eſtéeming word ſpoken aduantage conquered braue behauiour alſo inward affection naturally moue gaue anſwere haue often heard sir knight wordes déepely wound weapon courteſie compell cruelty may neuer conquer hath bin high good fortune time ſuch knightly demeanor haue ſéene gentle language hath entred lance cannot friendſhip woon either feare force may conſtraine ſéeing haue takē paine find haue done inſtant could deliuer ſhield beſt worthy weare gift nature floriſh abundantly gratious nature doeth adore nobly theſe word imbracing p palmerin preſently mounted horſebacke departed returned prince accompanied knight greatly delighted beholding shield midſt field azure placed faire palme trée ſo liuely framed béene naturall trée moſt wondred certaine poeſie letter gold engrauen round ſides ſo darkely placed none company could iudge ſhould meane length came court emperour newly ryſen ſupper certified al happened much diſpleaſed mind becauſe whole deſire haue knowledge valiant knight sauage man taking shield looking earneſtly vpon hée ſent damoſell know poeſie • ngrauen damoſell anſwered would moſt gracious emperour power fulfill requeſt ignorant therof muſt deſire gracious pardon ſhe ſaw emperor giuen palmerin shield vowed vſe became knight
