chapter ſhall giue relation conſider procéedings afterward p edoard left realme lacedemonia occaſion willed ſtay empire grrece deliuered king tarnaes forth cruel enchanted caſtle entred galley ſo departed voyage long bin ſeas damoſell ſuddenly chanced galley vſing ſpeech taking principall ore hand turned paſſage quite contrary another iland edward landed deliuered comely knight hand diuerſe cruel tyrant leading abide vnmercifull death damdſell conducted prince habitation argonida friendly entertayned ſtaying welcōmed gueſt ſuch conuerſation betwéene two goodly sonnes named pompider sage aliart wée meane diſcourſe whoſe grandmother expert science magicke nouriſhed aliart popular conuerſation thorowe meanes hee became maruailous ingenious wit ſkilfull diueliſh exerciſe ſo eſteemed notableſt magitian world whoſe memory touched booke primaleon declare order hee paſſed whole life aliart reputed leſſe fame learning inferiour bare eſtimation aboue ſo none durſt offer iniurie albeit deſerued none would contend ſtood ſuch awe ſeeing himſelfe honoured mighty durſt doe loued moſt part excellent cunning beganne exerciſe himſelfe martiall exploytes ſhewed bée sonne renowned edward hauing receyued knighthood handes giant garatie behaued himſelfe famous exploites eſtéemed ſingular practiſed arte hee vnderſtood father impriſonment noble primaleon caſtell dramuſiande ſkill aunt eutropa endeuoured haue flower chiualrie like captiuitie albeit impriſonment theſe prince vnknown knightes laboured continually ſearch yet aliart ſo well acquainted matter kept moſt ſecrete arte gaue power knowe done countreyes world grecian knight whoſe affection theſe two prince cauſed leaue natiue countrey happened vnfortunate forreſt great brittaine brauely repleniſhed many couragious heart alſo ſundry gallant lady preparing many hard aduentures fewe eſcaped moſt part loſt vnfortunate ſearch among noble mindes recined prince spaine arnedes king france maiortes sir pridos whoſe abſence greatly bemoned engliſh court prince belcar vernar ditree soldan bellagris renowned polendos theſe honourable affection bare ſtrayed prince left kingdomes ſignories vnhappily taken priſoners cruel enchaunted caſtell great griefe friend ineſtimable ſorrowe well peopled dominion aliart conſidered theſe vnfortunate accident enterpriſed ſo ho • ourably falling ſo vnhappily determined hazard himſelfe ſearch father try ſtrength againſt giant dramuſiande whoſe force little nothing eſtéemed bare great deſire aduenture could way finiſhed meanes onely mind departed valley perdition named ſo becauſe noble knight loſt determined make habitation follow ſtudie prouide remedy againſt diuerſe miſchanches like happen becauſe nature deſired ſolitary bringing vp forth company builded little fortreſſe betwéene two great high mountaines kept light sunne away day moone y• night ſeaſon dwelling called obſcure valley others tearmed valley aboce clowdes entrance whereof could found aliart cauſed giant trabollant know coſt ſon alſo lord faire caſtell velley néere adioyning aliart newly erected garniſhed within many faire bookes ſpending time long ſtudie laſt got meane called sage thus liued sage aliart obſcure volley often vſing caſtle dramuſiande bemoning miſfortune knight could way remedy till appointed time often repayring sage aliart cauſed eutropa doubt ſomething dramuſiande ſtand great feare yet could way hinder pleaſure viſite captiue prince ſate one day penſiue ſtudy vnderſtood art triumpes conſtantinople emperour would try yong knight nouriſhed court againſt time framed ſhield hee ſent damoſell palmerin england beare aduentures ſhould vndertake way taken knight sauage man hereafter diſcloſe vnto yet reſtored againe gentleneſſe language prince palmerin vſed thus remayned sage aliart expecting time deliuery prince concealed griefes ſpent time ſilent opinion miſerie would ſuffer litle reſt inferre occaſion yet neuer fallig one iote amitie though world woe conſtraine chap xv belcar vernar cured wound receiued one againſt arriued caſtle dramuſiande accompanied polendos king theſſale combate entred betweene taken priſoners verna prince almaigne belcar duke dura remained citie brique till felt themſelues good diſpoſition health departed london engliſh court diſguiſed vnwilling knowne ſée happily might attaine ſight prince flerida princeſſe remaining ſtill penſiue therefore kept chamber fayling theyr pretended purpo • e trauailed thorowe great britaine valiantly reuenged quarels lady enlarged report redoubted knighthood neither time weare memory death ſelfe meanes diſſolue procéeding thus aduenturous trauaile eutropa gotten within circuite ſhe ſure bene priſon yet let alone awhile try hardnes fortune hauing ſpent day trauaile darke night ouercharging vncomfortable houres determined take reſt foote trée farre prouiſion alighting giuing horſes eſquiers belcar ſat • dowe fell ſoundly aſléepe vernar whoſe minde faire bazilia ſatte conferring shrine hauing ſtomacke ſléepe hee might better accompliſh amourous deuiſes withdrew himſelfe little riuer pretty way friend belcar ſwéete harmonie little byrdes ſilent paſſions vſed himſelfe gentle prince greatly delighted polendos k theſſalie wandring way fortune tooke place reſt neere prince vernar hee heard louely ditty ſwéete diſcourſes hee vſed commendation fayre bazilia loath diſquiet knowne ſo neere laſt tooke occaſion braue inuentions heard vttred prince vernar enter commendation owne lady faire francelina ſo twaine manner▪ paſſed away weary night morning might eaſily eſpye prince vernar hee could hide preſence longer went ſalutation know syr vernar amorous paſſions extreame griefe ſcant ſuffer opprſſed head enioy gladneſſe becauſe remembrance faire bazilia hath vrged night bewray ſundry aſſaults afflicted minde whoſe farre diſtaunce preſence hath made grieuouſly ſigh would gladly haue ſlept wherof friend witnes little forrie vnderſtand w • e vernar embracing noble polendos▪ declared great ioy conceiued company yet ſomewhat diſpleaſed ſhould priuy amorous complaint might cauſe bee iudged rather effeminate way famous earneſt talking belcar came walking vnto reioycing ſight king polendos embraced vſing theſe pleaſant ſp • eches care greatly take reuengement ſharp aſſault gaue port corderia bare away prize repulſe vernar loath wee ſhould fight therefore let v ioyne together like truſty friend many gratulations paſſed partes mounted horſebacke rode recounting aduentures hadde happened ſéeking prince edoard polendos rehearſed vnto howe hee brought young prince palmerin conſtantinople forgetting letter ſent lady lake procured sage aliart obſcure valley made belcar vernar ſomewhat abaſhed heare happy ſucceſſe chaunced continuance talke came caſtell dramuſiande euery one giuing verdicte braue •• e ſtrength fortreſſe till length put foorth theſe thoughtes prince edoard came vpon bridge ſame order fought noble primaleon vrged polendos pauſe thinkes caſtle ſhould inuincible well prouided within ſuch good knight wee ſée without vppon accident prince vernar preuailed intreatie haue firſt iouſte edward preſently encountred onean ſuch large appearance knighthood edward loſte one styrrops prince vernar vnhorſſed hauing recouered himſelfe drewe sworde came couragiouſly againe edward ſtayed deliuering theſe ſpéeches syr knight may bee ſkill foote agreeable ſtrength foreſight haue horſebacke would might haue beene happe trye hath ſo pleaſed wh • ſubiect againſt euery knight commeth allowed firſt exployte belcar deſirous enter combatet pacifie prince vernar theſe fewe word syr vernar ſince knight hath fulfilled firſt remaine beginne freſh challenge may refuſe forbeare fight conſidering hath obſerued dutie field wherevpon edward belcar beganne ſecond encounter whoſe hap ſo hard beare friend vernar companie polendos pe • ceyuing began thirde iouſte couragiouſly remained whileſome doubtfull battered one others armour much till laſt polendos diſmounted likewiſe came foorth giant pandare commaunding donedward goein againe whoſe commaund obeyed ſorie might ſpeake knight laſt ranne withall entring caſtle prince vernar thruſt edward preſently ſaid sir vernar hath ledde beyond witte place ſhall abide diſtreſſe life time cannot fall like danger deſperate himſelfe would little eſtéeme friend life vernar hearing theſe word knowing halfe angry ill lucke made anſwere syr eſtéeme witte litle wiſdome friendſhip ſo ſimple ſcant impute troth word vnderſtand neither year ſhall withdraw deſire although buy mine owne death word pandare ſaluted mace ſo betweene twaine fierce ſkirmiſh primaleon leaning chamber windowe tooke great pleaſure beholde hautie courage vernan whoſe name knowne vnto dramuſiande little glad father trincus alſo cauſer death father frenaque vernar ſo long aſſailed pandare broken sword hand shielde c • eane middle whereat pandare ſomwhat angry caught armes aud ſhaking ſore threwe againſt ground doubtfull life left wherefore preſently carryed edoards chamber prouiſion made relieue owne eſtate gate held open • ill belcar polendos entred preſently ſhut againe came pandare againſt belcar receyued couragiouſly yet brought vnder carryed friend verner polendos ſéeing hee muſt • éeds enter combate pandare prepared himſelfe againſt firſt ſummoned theſe word thinkes thy great honour alſo expedient reſeruing thy health yéelde thy ſelfe mee rather reſpect mercie enter fight man ſo cruelly mangled doo behold thine owne blood conſider pro •• e • ad bounty ſo ſhall thy life ſaued mine honor reſerued sir ſaid pandare ſhould ſubmit ſelfe thy thou mightſt account wit euer weake would ſtand thy mercie ſhould ſhewe mine owne cowardiſe manhood wherefore reſolue thy ſelfe yéeld thy death ſūme deſire fell fight wherin polendos preuailed ſo happily pandare thought paſt recouery whervpon cruell alligan came foorth defend him▪ finding himſelfe alſo mated euery way fruſtrate hope victory way diſpaired himſelfe fine ſo faint wearyed fell downe neyther gayning conqueſt edoard primaleon tooke polendos chamber thrée patient vſed wholſome comfortable phyſicke ſorrie miſfortune twaine ſhould bring ſo many noble prince aduenturous knightes cruell caſtell yet remaine good hope found good hap appointed time deliuered ſtrange knight hardly knowne dramuſiande went cure ſicke perſonnes might good health knight ſhould happen come chap xvi ¶howe recinde king spayne aruiedes king france left theyr royall dominion wander ſearche ſtrayed prince edoard aduenture hapned betweene black knight knight dogge arriued caſtle dramuſiande recinde king spayne hearing great purſuite many noble knight make enquyrie two young prince edoard primaleon abſolutely determined himſelfe trye hazard fortune employed paine might compaſſe good lucke leauing whole gouernment eſtate duke orliande marqueſſe richard leſſe valiancie true nobilitie departed body eſquyre attending many countreyes till came courte france royallie gratiouſly receiued king arnedes vnderſtanding ſumme noble determination ſelfe affected thoſe woorthie prince commited kingdome quéene melitia trauelled recinde hautie enterpriſe long trauell arriued engliſh courte ſo diſguiſed knowne becauſe could ſée princeſſe flerida would ſtay departed theyr iourney hearing knight loſt forreſt great brittaine entred ſéent returne made theyr courſe way till miſhap brought cruell caſtle ſudden met two knight excellently well mounted one hauing armour ſpotted red crimzen colour shielde deuiſe bare dogge vppon azure fielde knight blacke armour shield ſame colour without deuiſe theſe foure mette together ſtriuing ſhould firſt enter vpon bridge edward come foorth ſéeing ſuch controuerſie ſought ende matter theſe word gentleman come honour zeale trie magnanimity courage ſtriue order may returne great diſcredites let boldeſt firſt beginne ſo ſhall finiſh iudge come vppon theſe word recinde couched speare knight dogge offered ſtay syr ſéemes neither regard ciuilitie knightly courteſie offer mee great wrong came prepared therefore right ought beginne recinde ſomwhat mooued theſe wordes ſhaped replie syr brauery ſéeke goe beyond mée peremptory wordes beare prize away farre deceyued word cannot cutface weapon feare firſt prouided therefore preuented edward perceyuing theſe queſtions like grow quarrell aſſayed ſet quiet thus began ſuddaine enmity driueth ſhr • wde ſuſpition come talke try manhoode rather ieaſt iuſt diſpoſed let twaine come deale meane time may try ſhall firſt laſt knight dogge greatly vexed well word edward alſo ſtay recinde helde charged boldly maner since haue denied right offered wordes importing great rygor know reuenge wrong vppon perſon die field • put vp iniury wherewith ran together fiercely arnedes prepared himſelfe blacke knight ſo betwéene began hot ſkirmiſh wherein horſe men al laide ground riſing vp againe drawing foorth theyr ſwordes charged one ſuch mightie ſtrokes ſingular courage made manifeſt valure theyr noble mindes dramuſiande accompanied primaleon polendos knight ſtood looking forth window caſtle giuing leſſe commendation notable combat behauiour knight iuſtly deſerue yet none could iudge whence ſauing edward knew knight dogge remembrance alwaies wont beare deuice couragious knight maiortes knowing cōmended well worthy maiortes throwing downe ſword ioyned armes enemy try ſtrength wraſtling arnedes likewiſe reciued blacke knight ſo blood iſſued forth vpon theyr armor althrough great weakeneſſe fell downe earth came foorth dramuſiande noble priſoners whoſe promiſe made vnto oath would ſuffer ſtart away taking theyr helmet primaleon knew blacke knight soldan bellagris certified dramuſiande twaine recinde king spaine arnedes king france preſently caried caſtle wound might cured themſelues recouered dramuſiande vſed knight honorably refuſing take extreame reuenge father death ſuppoſed impriſonment puniſhment ſufficient cauſe ſhewed himſelfe milde gentle becauſe helpe good hope conquere iſle lake kept giant almadrago time paſt taken force time maiortes knight dog soldian bellagris blacke knight arnedes king recinde obtained former health reioycing impriſoned deareſt friend whome trauailed ſeeke ſo happily found prince edward obliuious faire lady flerida alſo griefe hee ſuppoſed aged father whoſe ſorrowe procéeded great miſfortune time hee good hope ſhould turne great ioy chap xvii palmerin england deſirous trauaile ſeeke ſtrange aduentures tooke courage ſpeake lady miſtreſſe polinarda loth depart without leaue hauing ſuſtained grieuous repulſe departed ſecretly court taking leaue calling himſelfe knight fortune yong knight made manifeſt great expertneſſe many triumphes honour thier lady eſtimation helde themſelues emperour grewe pleaſant conceyts long time hee vſed like cauſing euery night dance deuiſes performed delight empreſſe princeſſe gridonia faire bazilia ſtill refuſed company abſence prince vernar cauſed ſpend time penſiueneſſe palmerin england affecting ſtrange aduentures deſirng knight make proofe knighthood would gladly diſcouer earneſt minde hee feared procure ill miſtreſſe chanced night princeſſe polinarda ſitting ſolitary palmerin came ſate downe ouercome many grieuous paſſions ſtriuing ſpeake yet neither would begin commonly fareth thoſe march vnder enſigne amorous venus ſubiect many efeminate folly idle head dulled wit pale wanny face thought ſtill ſilent yet alwaies worke mind mute yet neuer quiet ſpeaking faintly behauing themſelues fondly walking ſolitarie vſing ſickly ieaſtures euer exclaiming cupid neuer remembring owne cowardiſe ſtill cry fie loue meete correct folly life theſe paſſions louer entreth idleneſſe kindled deſire ſet fire affection perſeuerance helpe vtterly waſted deſperation palmerin ſitten good lady ſtil ſilent gaue occaſion ſpeake theſe ſpéeches faire miſtres might fréely ſpeake blame thought farre ſpot bounty ſhould eſtéeme ſelf happy gaining ſuch leaue account ſelfe honoured gracious loue yet perſwading ſelfe gentle nature quip friend giue croſſe motion may cut fancie pardon preſumption ſhall yeeld circumſtance diſcourſe gentle conſtruction ſo feeling ſelfe deſire honour way attaine ſome hautie enterpriſe haue thought good venter among pike miſchaunces either encreaſe renowne ende life infamous reproch many wil ſend large ſpéeches defame priuate ſpight ſeeke worke diſcredite lo knight crept fetherbed fame doth allure warlike field hath minde maſke venus march mar wearing gloue lady ſhould vſe gantlet loue theſe ſpeeches faire miſtreſſe grieuous ſeruant patience expreſſe gentle nature ſuffer heare auoide well proue loyaltie vnſpotted beare alſo ſhew dutie wherewith honour noble father haue vowed indeuour ſelfe attempt leſſe welcome vnto ſéemely ſelfe hath long wiſhed • f vowed ſeruant neither danger withdraw mind doubt cauſe thinke miſhap hauing licence courage trauaile gracious loue awardeth al trouble accident may annoy oppreſſion may ſuddenly deceiue liued knight fauour die knight fame onely haue flower loue ſo ſhall neuer fade till latter end life princeſſe polinarda perceiuing intent gentle heart loath haue abſence ſo ſoone teares ſtanding eye thus made anſwere seruant ſuch hath courteſie hand haue found ſo loyall continuance promiſed faith neither able gratifie would giue honour dutie ſhould princely behauiour made chooſe ſeruant equiuolent bountie made loued ſelfe ſo loued none albeit none knewit ſo little beſide eſtimation •• father hath alwaies giuen notable deſerts hath euer ſelfe increaſed loue aboundantly chiefly loue yet flameth freſhly •• nce deſire departure groweth thorow mee perhaps ſome occaſion grieueth would glad know crime may make recompence rather giue leaue tarrie grant licence depart ladie quoth palmerin though cauſe yet crime though depart ſake yet free ſuch ſuſpect onely fauour haue found handes friendſhip haue granted continuall honour way recouer ſuch duetie ought albeit trauailed ſake whole life ſée ſuch gratious perſon vnrequited ſelfe yéeres put recompence proofe might rightly deſerue reproched men much refuſed ſo ſwéete saint princeſſe ariſing maruellous choller highly offended paſſed talke ſhe gaue cooling quaile hot attempt haue often truſted béene rewarded treaſon placed ſtedfaſt affection haue bin ſooneſt beguiled repent late bridle fancy ſée mine owne folly wherefore ſéeing fault ſuch rather afford roome company giue command poaſting voyage wil thinke honour ſéeme preſume preſence bind duty ſtraightly command obſerue turning back ſhe flung away fume leauing palmerin ſuch alteration one could hardly iudge life left happe body preſent deſcrie heauy complaintes euery body conducted lady chamber ſauing princeſſe polinarda ſtayed intreated went flinging gallerie greatly vexed ſhe left ſeruant paſſioned palmerin departing lodging toſſing tumbling himſelfe reſtleſſe bedde euery thought lady diſcurteſie hee fell agonie bitter death ſuffering ſléepe enter head ſtill bewayled eſtate aduerſe hap laſt aurora riſen armes olde titan huſband hée determined fulfill lady commaund albeit great paine graunting conſent getting armour bare colour harte forreſt thickly ſet little golden ſhrubbes bearing shield fortune holding tottering vnſteady whéele naming himſelfe knight fortune hee ſecretly departed accompanied siluian sauage man ſonne whome called brother becauſe nouriſhed together hee bare shield palme tree ſent sage aliart neither taking leaue emperor vehemency griefe mounted horſebacke ſo rode away way rode siluian endeuored himſelfe perſwaſion driue away heauineſſe farre purpoſe prince himſelfe deuoide patience rode vſing word ouercome ſuch extreame melancholy yet affection ſo earneſtly grounded lady vowed behalf aduenture life doubting duety hee would ſhewe abſence ſhould win fauour againe grant preſence chap xviii palmerin england vnder title name knight fortune ſtill continued penſiue iourney till laſt happened caſtle honour faire ladie miſtreſſe princeſſe polinarda hee conquered knight tearmed himſelfe knight death still trauailed valiant prince palmerin heauy ſadde greatly lamenting ſo late miſfortune neither reſting pla • e abyding place abyding company brother siluian loued highly eſtéemed laſt happening groue trées eſpied faire caſtle ſtanding ſolitary beſet round gréene bancke ſight whereof prince alighted siluian perceiuing alighted likewiſe aud ledde steedes paſture time palmerin ſeeing body néer remembring great vnkindneſſe ladie entred theſe heauie mourning palmerin ſon poore sauage man borne vnfortunate forreſt great britaine ſoone preferred honor late thrown hatred regard haddeſt thou princeſſe thy ſelfe poore peſant eſtimation hadſt thou modeſtie mooue ſo great offence thy gracious miſtreſſe whoſe loue ſtate thy life whoſe fauour flower thy proſperitie ah ſweet ladie courteous pitie let paſſe preſumption hath dutie impute may rude behauiour clemencie may puniſh pardon yet good ladie reſpect truſty ſeruice conſtant loyaltie haue alway borne soueraigntie fault committed raſhly deſerueth ſuch repulſe ingratitude much ſhew way ſuffer regard owne beauty ſtayed aſſurance ſeruants bountie ſhall perceiue word bee honour worthie hate preferre name aboue lady nobleneſſe yet contented abide hard doome according pleaſure waſt day diſtreſſe till either mooue recant ſpotleſſe loyaltie relieue miſhap longer deſerre dolor remaining obſtinate paine helpeleſſe gentlenes giueth hope diſpleaſure ſhall end eternall delight thus hauing finiſhed complaintes drew neare caſtle good hap heard ſound muſicke gaue occaſion enter comming great hall eſpyed one corner one ſitting blacke fair long beard graue countenance ſhewing ſad complexion minde moane myrth palmerin would yet enter leaſt ſhould break quiet exerciſe ſinging many ſadde dittyes lute himſelfe framed prayſe ladie palmerin hauing heard ſingular report gaue ladie none might compare beautie brauerie much offended hee eſteemed ladyes counterfeite fayre polynarda wherefore hee brake knightes sonnet kinde salutation thinkes syr either want manner modeſtie glorie lady thought none like syr late compariſon hath vrged great choller ladie aboue beautie▪ honour name beſide beyond noblenes nature therefore worthie praiſe becauſe ſhe ſuperiour auncient knight ſeeing one entred vpon ſo ſuddenly correct pleaſures ſuch ſharpe word aduanced himſelfe towards anſwer syr knight bolde entraunce place great offence haue offered perſon may happe ſet ſo deare price ſhal coſt blood would loath ſpare anie bee equall lady méete beare compariſon whoſe remembrance maketh liue vnſpeakable tormentes thou dareſt ſtay till armed make thée eyther denye thy bragges buye ladyes honour loſſe thy life breath ſo reward thy preſumption ſhall teach thée thy dutie winne heart deſire syr ſaid palmerin ceaſe theſe word execute wrath haue ſpoken thing diſpleaſure reuenge ſelfe ende auncient knight withdrewe himſelfe chamber▪ eſquire preſently armed palmerin went foorth mounted horſebacke attended comming length came foorth knight attired blacke armour bearing shield portraite griefly death lying toomb couered blacke vſing word fell ſtraite fight eache behauing themſelus valiantly knight death length throwne earth dealing togither swoords palmerins lucke ſo fortunate ouercame enemy comming taking helmet entred theſe ſpéeches loe sir knight contrary expectation become priſoner muſt gainſay haue boldly ſaid extolling lady aboue whō honour prepare ſelfe extreame rigour death knight death replyed syr well may eſtéeme valoure make account victorie haue foyled good hope neuer diſmayed concerning harde choyce put eyther denye ladie leaue life suffice ſelfe rigor conſtraine death ſelfe may ſhall compell rather chooſe abide cru • lty offer ladie ſo great diſcourteſie anſwer take pleaſe palmerin comparing loyaltie knight conſtancie owne loue affection ſurely planted earneſt deſire himſelfe ſatiſfying himſelfe conqueſt called syluian departed knight death returning caſtle carefully tended looked vnto eſq • yre greatly contemning fortune ſo ſuddenly foyled chap xix ¶here ſhall vnderſtand knight death renowned palmerin england conquered cauſe remained ſolitary caſtle regiſtred ancient hyſ • ories sardignia ſometime raigned king named euandrin eſpowſed quéene emeralda daughter duke armian normandie siſter vnto noble duke drapos king one onely sonne named floraman leſſe expertnes capacity knightly behauiour courage made liked ſaw loued y• knew ſo chaunced floraman growing ripeneſſe yeares became enamoured altea daughter duke charles cicilia ſubiect king euandrin ſo betwéene theſe twaine ioyned ſuch league perfect good liking ſuch mutuall conſent faithfull loue ſuppoſed neither accident could hinder determination extreamitie • euer plighted promiſe fortune enemie hauty courage prepareth malice againſt well meaning minde ſo loue could pleaſe king father meanes could thought ſtill preuent king perceiued could hardly reclaime sonne affection ſtill increaſed faire • tea ſent home duke father meaning matche sonne adriana quéene cicilia floraman denied loue grant father minde rather endeuoured follow lady whoſe abſence procured languiſhing life king well noting intent floraman could fancy father choiſe ſecret treaſon duke ciciliaes court found meanes poyſon fair altea ſmal griefe noble father friend alſo gentleman courte whome beauty honored ciuility life greatly commended duke miſdoubting vntimely death daughter procured ſome vnnaturall meane becauſe ſhe ſo ſoone ſicke ſo ſuddenly gone ſent allaricqua bedfellow executing ſundry torment ſhe confeſſed hyred king serdignia ſhe miniſtred potion cut flowring yeares duke hearde diſcourſe lord soueraigns vnkinde dealing hee cauſed anatomie daughter artificially figured placed vpon toomb repreſenting funeral thervpon golden verſes writ epitaph rare vertuous life image death liuely drawn perfect proportion rare piece workmanſhip laid goodly fair chariot leuying great army went againſt king serdignia whoſe comming floraman heard could finde heart enter battel againſt lady father company wel appointed knight brake thorow rankes entred campe whence tooke chariot picture altea ryding preſently porte sea tooke ſhipping coaſted turk dominion building ſolitary caſtle liued bemoaning vnkinde acte father vnfortunate death faire altea whoſe picture hee would often report affliction minde ſundry lamentable sonnet diſcouer praiſe owne paine lute hee often recorded onely meane perſwade deſperate intent place remained floraman till ſuch time prince palmerin viſited haue hearde although good fortune palmerin conquere waſted mourning growne great debilitie excéeding ſorrow yet floraman eſtéemed knight ſingular proweſſe palmerin departed hée entred caſtle againe vnto ladyes picture appealed manner ala altea impute conqueſt right mine enemie rather feeble weake aſſaults ſeruant extreame ſorrow miſhap hath cauſed griefe mine owne miſfortune ſo aduerſly chanced wherefore make amends great miſchaunce may knowe knight eſtéemeth none aduentures ſo blaze memorie lady ſhall report onely altea cauſe know ſhe yet vnborne muſt equall long ſtayed comfortleſſe place till laſt king father vnderſtanding ſent becauſe hee would ſhewe himſelfe diſobedient hee departed thence bearing ladyes portraite ſtill vſing blacke armour shielde wherein death painted onely sepulchre great ſorrowes vſing name himſelfe knight death rare aduentures atchieued honour ladie great reputation himſelfe ſhall large certified ſequell hiſtorie chap xx ¶palmerin england hee departed floraman knight death happened come ſaw combate fought betweene three knight knight bull named pompides commandemens lady kept paſſage bridge knight fortune bare away victorie renowned knight fortune conquered floraman knight death brother siluian procéeded iourney neuer ſhewing ſigne liuely diſpoſition heauy penſiue way rode siluian deſirous might remedy vſed theſe word vnto good ſir waſt time woe ſhould vſe pleaſant recreation ſéeke ruine ſelfe hee regardeth ſo • lenderly profered courteſie rather extinguiſhed memory ſhe hath lightly left thinke iudge ſhe mindfull vnto word knight fortune thus ſhaped anſwere siluian deare brother friend thou cauldeſt diſcerne drop blood fall oppreſſed heart thou perceiueſt moyſt teares iſſue head thou couldeſt iudge world woe abide ſilent thought thou doeſt perceiue ſome motion outward appearance thou wouldeſt rather wiſh graue ſée remaine remedileſſe griefe way remedied onely laſt extremity death albeit thou ſaiſt ſhe eſtéemeth paſſions rather merry mourne laugheth languiſh yet ſhall neuer ſayde palmerin liued without fraude therefore dyed faith preferring honourable death hapleſſe life would bene blinde firſt ſaw beauty ſtayed father enioy ſuch vngentle friend wee might haue liued quiet eſtate enioying one houre reſt albeit liue ſpotleſſe loyaltie yet rewarded moſt vngentle loyaltie let ſuffice ſhe vnkinde thou vnhappie ſhe bent crueltie yet thou liue die conſtancie deſiring longer life may frée ſpotte promiſed loue heereupon syluian aſſure thy ſelfe beauty ſhall hazard honour thouſand launce ſhe ſhall confeſſe ſelfe palmerin aboue loyaltie thus paſſing time talke one knight fortune great paine syluian ſtill continuing perſwaſion arriued bridge ſaw thrée knight would haue paſſed ouer reſiſted knight fair white armor kept paſſage bearing shield deuiſe bulles head called knight bull one thrée knight couragiouſly gaue combat knight bull wan quickly ſet beſide ſaddle fine knight bull preuailed againſt thrée griefe glorie knight fortune knowing theſe thrée knight bene foyled emperours court luyman burgundie germaine orleaunce tenebrant little ſorrie miſhappe preſently menaced courage againſt knight bull met ſo ſtoutly togither diſmounted charging one another ſwords betwéene began doubtfull ſkyrmiſh laſt knight fortune happe ſo good ſtrooke downe ſetting foote vppon charged tell hee wherefore kept paſſage knight bull ſéeing himſelfe brought vnder hearing demand loath graunt laſt diſcouered himſelfe thus syr knight hath bene alwaies deſire kéepe ſelfe vnknowne hyde name feare till noble exploytes might deſerue make knowne ſince fortune receiue firſt conqueſt muſt declare ſtand deſirous know vnderſtand ſonne edord famous prince england argonica lady enchanted iſle hauing name pompides concerning kéepe paſſage thus certaine lady cured wound receiued laſt encounter againſt two knight ſlew commanded kéepe paſſage vntill conquered knight ſhe greatly deſireth way come knowledge haue remained ſpace twentie dayes yet neither happening knight conquered preſent knight fortune hearing word ſuffered ariſe gaue anſwer thinkes ſir might • ame alſo happineſſe good fortune linke life ſimple enterpriſe aduance ſelfe trie hazard place place ſit idle abroad might better imployed think amiſſe leaue lady command ſo siluian departed vanquiſhed knight greatly deſired haue knowledge knight fortune ſorry ſuffered depart without vſing conference neuertheleſſe ſuppoſed renowned palmerin deuice shéeld deceiued bare purpoſe becauſe would known otherwiſe name knight fortune well rid pompides went lady fortreſſe might haue wound cured made faint loſt ſo much blood wil returne knight sauage man hauing deliuered palmerin ſhéeld left trofol • ant conquered knight trauail • reputation knight hood good fortune attempt till arriued triſtfull valley befell vnto ſhall preſently vnderſtand chap xxi knight sauage man left prince palmerin conquered knight forreſt cleere fountaine chanced come triſtfull valley tried ſtrength againſt blandidon knight swan ſonne ſorrowfull lady pandritia conquered becauſe vnmindfull knight sauage man behaued himſelfe ſo brauely conſtantinople alſo forreſt cleere fountaine ſhall vnderſtand endeuouring himſelfe trauaile fortune directed courſe triſtfull valley might rightly called ſo knight could enter witheut great affliction heauineſſe minde made ſorrowful pandritia abide houſe ſadneſſe rode valley eſpyed great trée whereon hanged great many shéeldes néere trée caue den etrance whereof lay trunchions ſpeares broken ſwords like weapon declared béene many combat fought place caue came knight black armor bearing ſhield vpon ground ſand faire white swan hauing eſpied knight sauage man preſently ſounded horne vnto houſe néere adioyning ſound horn window houſe preſently opened laid faire cloath blacke veluet cuſhions ſame came faire lady damoſels leaned thereon ſée combate knight swan determined haue knight ſawe comming ſight mooued knight sauage man ſtand great maze well behold faire lady alſo ſuch ſeemely knight place ſo ſmall frequentation ſtudy reuiue knight swan ſent page ſummoned ſort lord maſter ſir knight behold way eſcape hath kept paſſage ſixe moneths aduancement honour diſgrace ſmal company good hardy knight shield ſuffice witneſſe hang yonder tree haue left behind vnable withſtand yet hath vanquiſhed none therefore hath ſent name ſollicite cowardly feare enforce faint daring venture ſo many hath beene vanquiſhed permitted choiſe two extreames wherof muſt chuſe one receiue ſuch authority wil charge withal firſt muſt paſſe returne whence came boūd knightly oath make knowne euery one ſhamefull repulſe ſparing tell truth fauer ſelfe manifeſt cowardiſe commendation lord ſecond ſo deſirous would needes paſſe without endamaging ſelfe foreſaid perill muſt fulfil wil loath either eſtéeme knighthood happy ſtate life muſt firſt giue shield placed name written vnder ſame intent knight happen way may know came like knight departed hence like fainting crauen ſo ſhall extreame rigour ſpéech procure meanes eternall ſhame beſide muſt vow ſorrowfull lady companie ſpendeth time wailing neuer reioyce remembrance griefe part • er ſadneſſe life endureth none theſe twaine pleaſe come lord eaſe knight sauage man ſmiling diſcourſe menared diſloyaltie alſo threatned danger ſent knight anſwere theſe word goe tell thy lord hath met ſuch one neither reſpecteth proffer regardeth puiſſaunce minding goe forward yet returne till hath cauſed know hath much authoritie conſtraine himſelfe hath command vpon anſwere met together valiantly charging ſuch knightly blowes lady gaue great commēdation fight hardly iudging likeſt victorie breathed fell againe knight swan accounting himſelfe well •• ated knight sauage man thought indifferently matched length victorie chaunced knight sauage man reioyced conquered ſo good knight vnclaſping knight swan beuere quite ouercome grieuous trance wrought meanes get life againe charged tell alſo wherefore theſe lady liued vndertooke kéepe paſſage vnto requeſt knight thus anſwered sir knight looſing life might profit euer ſought pleaſe finiſh muſt brought ende would rather imbrace death t▪en ſatiſfie deſire craueth thing would neuer ſhew ſeeing griefe cannot holpen way greatly eaſed way hauing authority command wil accompliſh minde euery point called blandidon sonne ſorrowfull lady pandritia hath long yet longer muſt abide caſtle called houſe sadneſſe griefe yet way remedied ſhee hath vowed end life miſfortune continue mourning ſo long ſhe liueth onely loue ſhée bare knight whō trauel ſure haue heard leſſe famous hautie déedes armes aboue al knight atchieued victory called haue heard many edward england becauſe cannot find meane perſwade mother frō ſorrow full kinde life ſhe ſtill remaine v • wed heauineſſe haue determined garde paſſage making conquere partaker griefe forcing refraine ſhame haue heard wherin honor deſire trie many good knight encreaſing fame though neuer ſuſtained like miſhap hope meete man ſhall doe againe knight sauage man hearing tale blandidon eſtéemed knight leſſe valor good fortune deſired leaue ſolitarie place beare company forreſt great brittaine declaring renowne might gotten day life time heauie paſſage blandidon would haue graunted right willingly penſiue eſtate ſad mother perſwaded contrary hee loath leaue yet deſirous kéepe knight sauage man company whō earneſt haue knowledge length little departed knight sauage man thus perſwaded blandidon sir knight account ſelfe happie meete ſo good knight would condemne ſelfe altogether ingratitude ſhould requite gentleneſſe ſo farre without mine owne harme may whoſe company would gladlie haue yet vnwilling ladie mother ſhould remaine deſtitute guide reſolue ſhall know called knight sauage man name knowne many good knight haue tried found gentleneſſe hand farther diſcloſe name till better acquainted ſelfe yet intend hazard ſelfe aduenture great brittaine whereas many noble knight doe enter heard afterward meane beare company elſe ende great danger blandidon would gladly haue aſſaied aduenture alſo faint eſtate himſelfe great care vſed mother pandritia would ſuffer depart wherefore vſing ſuch friendly gréeting departure beſéemed profeſſion loyal intent curteſie knight sauage man tooke way iourney blandidon caſtle comfort mother alſo haue wound recured aſſuring ſtrife betweene wrought ſuch maruellous endeuours either part afterward hath ſeldome heard ſhall reade ſequell wherein vertue nobleneſſe vnanimitie conioyned faithfulneſſe deſirous one delightfull chap xxii floraman knight death prince serdignia arriued conſtantinople emperours court cauſed tent pitched honour faire altea emperor hee made chalenge againſt knight court▪ defence lady beautie fortune ſo good hee ouercame prince gracian brother guerin knight aduentured lady ſakes great ſorrow knight death ſuſtained foile palmerin noble knight fortune giuen whereof reuenged hee viſited king father ſent continued trauell ſo long laſt arriued conſtantinople emperor pallace erected two faire tent artificially made workmanſhip al black silke gold whereon giuen view braue picture rare beauty lady altea alſo whole courſe mournefull life▪ ſpectacle great delight tooke occaſion ſee one theſe tent prepared furniture lodging ſtoode luſtie courſers speares weapon maintaine tournement top betwéene tentes placed perfect image faire altea tooke duke father two army waging battaile knight death hauing euery thing readineſſe two eſquires attending entred emperor pallace attired accuſtomed armour made emperour ſomewhat abaſhed yet well pleaſed ciuill demeanor perceiued kneeling downe kiſſe maieſties hand ſuffered would kept backe abiding patiently began fire eye vppon empreſſe courtly ladyes ſee could finde ladie might beauty compare altea good while pauſe order began render ſpéeches moſt puiſſant emperour let boldneſſe admitted ill intent rude behauiour merite gracious diſliking whome onely vowe heart hand vnfained ſeruice houre death vnhappy knight whoſe miſfortunes bee recounted life hitherto hath bin nothing miſerie threatned ſpende life infinite calamity hath drawne minde ſuch debilitie neither honour grace ſhould behaue ſelfe gladly would firſt appointed minde quiet eſtate thought miſhappe could alter extreamitie chaunge reſolued ſelfe infallible ioye aye one fling fortune ouerturned heauen happines became hateful hell youthfull yéeres allured loue fancie made choyce mine owne good lyking eſteemed ſelf happieſt man aliue though chance hatefull griefe vnfolde ſpight onely berefte ladie allotted poore ſelfe exreame ill lucke forſooke courtly companie onely determining waſte tune ſolitary kinde life ſpent remembrance moſt regarded ſtill lauding beautie eſtéemed aboue remayned mee thought merrie though indéede mournfull time yet fortune ſatiſfied rubbeth freſh gréefe vpon gréene wound ſending knight breake ſilent deuotions repining ſhould extoll lady aboue saint vnknowne entred fight returned foile bare away victorie vanquiſhed thus haue bene euer indamaged euery way diſtreſſed may ſay knight ſay onely man miſhap becauſe reputed ſo ingratefull lady one repulſe ſhall make forſake ſwéete ſhrine haue vowed prince court extoll beautie referring compariſons eſtéeme none equall theſe knight honour lady dare contend altea either beautie bountie ready giue combate allow ſuperioritie none concerning order appointed fight would obey none break thus vnder gratious leaue requeſted thoſe knight eſteeme quarrell ſo good enter field beautie ladyes ſhall bring portrait whoſe ſake aduenture wil honour fame lady beſide hap ſo good gaine victorie muſt enter tent render armour name regiſtred booke haue tearmed sepulchre louers enemy preuaile contrary expectation ſhall lord came againſt couragiouſly theſe wordes syr knight beginne fainte nay defend ſelfe hardly ſince would eſtéem gentlenes proffered ſhall féele recompence belongeth ſelfe • ioyned agaiue till laſt knight fortune reached ſuch ſound ſtroake brought knées aduantage offered motion haue ſlaine gréeue knight conſidering eſtate beganne manner vſe intreatie syr knight puiſſance eſtéeme ſelfe thinking time aduanced themſelues deſirous knowe cauſe complaint whome gentleman declared thrée knight taken lady deſiring greatly abuſe honour wherefore requeſted tendered eſtate lady ſo would helpe defend iniury beauty comparable princeſſe polynarda excepted went ſée sepulchre louers lady beheld name knight armour deuiſes made behalfe fauors thing diſpleaſed ſome ladyes ſhould thought priſoners knight death becauſe longer ſubiect priſon loue take hardineſſe vpon mee ſet firſt hand ſpoyling sepulchre wherewith ſhee tooke vp table wherein image beauty prince berolde preſently caught hid vnder gowne euery lady began ſuch order quickly defaced y• sepulchre louers vſing ſuch courage dealing amazonians came ayde ſtately towne troye greekes earneſt deſire theſe ladyes deſtroying sepulchre louers emperour vſe comfortable ſpéeches knight great heauineſſe bene captiues sepulchre louers walking vnto pallace empreſſe cauſed image altea taken downe brought chamber ſhe placed according rare perfection great brittaine minding viſite king fredericke princeſſe flerida ſéek caſtle dramuſiande greatly talked loſſe knight dramuſiande ſet eſquires knight libertie carryed forth ſuch pollitique manner could neither returne againe caſtle giue report place ſtood knight sauage man ſuch proſperous winde laſt ſight coaſt england ſudden aroſe ſuch tempeſt carryed perforce vpon coaſt ireland taking hauen mount saint cyprian▪ becauſe could reach port moricque knight sauage man great deſire land maiſter perſwaded contrary theſe word deſire sir take good reſpect enterpriſe well know vnhappineſſe dwelleth next doore hardines danger neighbour earneſt deſire therefore action vſe good foreſight ſo may better preuent yonder mountaine dwelleth giant leſſe vglyneſſe perſon renowned puiſſance hee hath name calfurnien whoſe crueltie ſuch chance hand preſent death wherefore good sir ruled friend would loath ſhould fall ſo great folly syr quoth knight sauage man giue great thankes perceiue counſell tendeth welfare ſo cruell ſpeake good teach ſome courteſie conceiue none himſelfe ſo much truſt repoſe fortune ſhee ſuffer deale albeit conquer returne loſſe life eſtéeme leſſe ſo much ſhall perceiue courage courteſie one would wiſh much himſelfe maiſter ſeeing perſwaſion might auaile ſent eſquire artifer land little cocke committing reward good fortune knight sauage man accompanyed eſquire trauelled vp mountaine thicke beſet trées till laſt came little pauilion lay great many trunchions speares broken armour belonging ſuch knight foyled ſeeking caſtle walking farder litlle path ſaw traced freſh blood lead droppes thereof ſight caſtle gate placed ſuch vnmeaſurable height faine alight walk vpon foot armour troubleſome vnto walking thorow ſuch narrow paſſage hee wearie attained top hill hee ſaw giant ſuch man maſter ship reported ſtoode ſeuen well appointed men armes holding fowre knight knées giant thrée lady looking foorth caſtle window gianteſſe kept priſoners perforce ſéeing knight sauage man ſorrowing good knight ſhould come ſuch tyrant began grieuous ſorrowfull lamentation giant eſpying knight sauage man ſent thrée knight take bring preſence ſtood leaning vpon sword wearie comming vp high hill came commaunding yéeld elſe would ſlay knight sauage man hearing rough wordes ſtoode waiting nice tearmes made anſwere rather chuſe abide danger denying command truſt courteſie yéelding ſelfe little eſtéeme friendſhip ſo • make leſſe account furie theſe wordes ſaluted one ſo friendly vpon head hee fell downe dead foot • twaine dealt ſo reaſonably hee paid debt ſame coine aduancing himſelfe caſtell gate calfurnien knowledge miſhap came foorth ſtronglie armed mightie ſhield great mace iron hauing head thicke beſet azure nailes ſhield armour would enter manner ſpake knight sauage man ala poore knight fortune ouermuch thy friend ſhe conducted thee hither rather thought ſelfe much cumbred thée ſhould ſacrifice thée mine owne honour abuſe thou haſt offered • laying knight hath prepared rod ſo ſharpe thée thou wilt wiſh thy boldneſſe béen better gouerned courteous knight neuer ſéene giant maruelling mightie ſtature would vſe perſwaſion himſelfe proſperous ſucceſſe manner gaue anſwere think ſir commendation greater honour euery way diſburden heart cruell attempt embrace courteous ciuill kinde life god hath made mighty men ſo thoſe inferiours ſhould vſe gentle demeanour would better agrée knighthood ſauage quality calfurnien ſuch rage theſe wordes preſently returned anſwere would tenne ſtrongeſt knightes earth might reuenge theſe taunting wordes becauſe thy death ſatiſfie furie ſhouldeſt thou perceiue impatience god syr quoth knight sauage man diſdaine weake men though owne ſtrength monſtrous ſhall like combate court within caſtell may hap ſaue mine knight labour becauſe tenth though hee ſo big ten doe much one calfurnien willed knight sauage man goe caſtell length came faire court ſtood faire fountaine water iſſuing foorth mouthes two dwarffes artificially made chriſtall vpon faire iaſper pillers court hauing ſuch goodly lodging chamber greatly pitied • faire place ſhould kept ſuch cruell perſon hiſtorie maketh mention goodly emperour vſe giue ſuch pleaſant ſpéeches might conſtraine forget rufull complaint giuing ſmall attendance thereto made anſwere grace cleane contrary ſmall amazement highneſſe alſo courtly attendance honor conſtancy teares could call dead life rufull mon • recouer great loſſe yet doe conſider ſelfe loue compels ſetled affection hath brought immoderate euill compare impoſſibility ſtate condition yet ſubſtance ſhouelled clay though delight image picture yet hath death made anatomie fayre perſon ſhe liued loued dead remember loue liue honour enterpriſe ſhall witneſſe aduentures hazard ſhall manifeſt drowne dulled deſire remembrance knighthood enioy manhood mourning diſplay worthy deedes play amorous dities one moneths vſing medicine truſt extinguiſh mallady floraman perceiued ſhe earneſt wordes emperour honour name noblenes life replyed thus moſt gratious emperour ſee chat goates blood molifie adamant little drop raine pierce hard marble ſ wiſedome reproouing wilfulneſſe ſheweth follie perſwaſion piercing obſtinate doth friendſhip others doe force confeſſe affection altea hath ouercharged minde cleane dulled wit ſo neither ſéeme ſhould doe ought ſit musing loue hath life endamage mine owne life ſuch ouer fond loue ſince maieſtie hath quickened mine idle nature reuiaed dutie owe vnto knighthood remember ſelfe forgetting though cannot exclude loue ſudden yet tolleration perſwaſion time may doe ſomething becauſe honor field aſſwage fondneſſe dutie commaundeth mee employ ſeruice hazard ſelfe good fortune winne much ſtrength haue loſt yll happe wherefore deſiring maieſtie would entertaine mee courte vnder noble name ſéeke aduentures reſolued forſake follie purſue valiantly whereto haue bene enemie emperour ſéeing change floraman heartily pretended himſelfe deſired thus anſwered thinke ſelfe highly honoured greatly ſteéemed fauour fortune receyue ſo good knight whoſe endeuour hope himſelfe ſhalbe worthily accounted fame courte euer extolled floraman would haue knéeled kiſſe emperours hand hee gratiouſly ſuſtayned armes great thanks eyther ſide liberally beſtowed time damoſell lucenda returned court empreſſe among hir lady came walking withall knight ſent sepulcher louers vppon report came hath fulfilled could done manie returned court againe mette haſtily riding yet ſtayed deſire behalfe craue pardon maieſtie ſo ſudden departure intending promiſe bindeth conceale name till haue tryed aduenture great brittaine wherein proue fortunate giue greater courage bewray ſelfe hath bene greatly famed abroade iuſt proclaimed court beautie lady named altea aduenture ſelf haue trauelled hither maintaine lady miſtreſſe called lucina deſerueth perfect praiſe aboue beautie ſince arriued hath bene told knight departed court bearing renowne life syr quoth emperour would gladly heare knight ſelfe ignorant hr time yourſelfe thinke ſhall trauell farre ſhall heare ſuch famous report conduct place becauſe valour behauiour ſuch vnknowne place heard euery neuertheleſse might counſell would wiſh minde changed ſo fond enterpriſe becauſe hardly beleeue aduenture wil quite labour good opinion hold anſwered knight maketh affectionate ſéeke famous deed greatter eſtimation ſhall conceyue deale ſuch one fortune ſtand friend conquere ſo well liked doubt reputation ſhall gaine conſtraine thinke well repoſe good affiance tremoran ſonne duke leceſia nephew emperour trineus hearing proud wordes knight aduanced himſelfe towards greeting imagine fortune hath greatly friend ſend hither gone leaſt miſaduenture ſhould chaunce méete wold ſo ſettle armor ſhoulders would curſe lady abide canuazado neuertheles albeit yet hath ſuch friend would bee ſorrie ſhould depart without ſome recompence trauell vnder emperours correction man ſhall bring acquainted knight fortune ſo ere depart ſhall know hath left ſuch friend behind giue liberall entertainement thoſe ſeek manner knight halfe offended word tremoran made preſently giue reply thinke ſir good beare knight maketh ſo fooliſh hardy appertaineth vnto yet becauſe dare aduenture ſo much behalfe welcome knight ſuch brauery arme ſelfe preſently becauſe would bee loath cold calme lodging hee vſed ſuch diligence attendaunce hee recouered little ſtranger eſtate ſent emperour require whence knight word returned hee sonne k bohemia named recamon vpon tidings preſently ſent palace honourably vſed till ſuch time gained healbh departed thence toward great brittaine accompanyed florendos platir sonne prince primaleon pittying great ſorrowe theyr mother princeſſe gridonia forreſt borne met sauage man nouriſhed ſo long caue long trauailed damoſell lucenda till laſt came cape totnes tooke ſhipping toward england landed port saint mathew two mile sorlingue accompanyed gentlewoman came paſſage whoſe houſe reſted one night departed next morning rode foreward friendly talking siluian reioycing arriued place determined put fortune triall trauelling along forreſt came laſt fountaine chriſtened ſitting downe water refreſh himſelfe eſpyed come running forth thicket trées hart fiercely purſued lyon running ſtill toward prince laſt came lay downe féete one might iudge craue defence wherewith aroſe offering ſtrike ſword lyon preſently yéelded himſelfe féete likewiſe two horſes moued feare lyon brake bridle ranne wood siluian hied pace leauing prince two gentle force pierced ſheeld gentle prince knowing foſter father nouriſhed ſo long caue beganne vſe reuerence vnto him▪ certifie sauage man hauing patience heare came towards ſuch violence conſtrained ſheeld bearing shield three giant heades siluian reported man order abuſed prince ſomewhat feare monſtrous bigneſſe offered reuerence according curteous ſtature giant ſéeing men ſlain ſtood vſe wordes ſtrooke head preſently falling knee giuing thankes god whoſe prouidence aide ſuch dangerous combat men lead two horſes came fell downe prince deſiring ſaue liues conſtrained againſt wils attend miſchieuous wretch vſed likewiſe cruelly faire intreaty quickly perſwaded ſo deſired report giant manner liued anſwere called camboldam mulzell • lord penebroque one cruelleſt tyrant world hauing goodlucke deſired go england certifie vnto king fredericke knight fortune ſlaine giant camboldam ſhould commaund thing pleaſure promiſing fulfill requeſt departed preſently knight fortune siluian mounted horſes tooke iourney preſently towards great brittaine meant accompany noble prince elſe deliuer long ſeruitude chap xxxiii siluian declared knight fortune manner sheeld palme tree taken ſaue cruel giant camboldan happened ſee combate betweene platir floroman pompides blandidon alſo sage aliart obſcure valley came brought caſtle ſhewed many goodly able monument fortune aduancing honor knight obtaining famous conqueſt cauſed proceede diſcouer depth hidden doubt hée rode perceiuing ſhield paſt mean ſeruice aſked siluian ſhield palme tree becauſe iourney lay dangerous place therefore eſtéemed wiſedoms alwayes prouided ſaw ſhéelde gone wherein repoſed moſt affection kéeping extreame néede willed siluian report manner ſuffered taken demand siluian thus anſwered way haue iournied deuiſing might make knowne loſſe without gayning diſple ſure mouing anger two cauſes made conceale ſuch miſhap cruell giant tooke damſel mounted white palfrey came croſſing ouer forreſt vſing ſpéeches thus siluian deliuer shield thou beareſt ere thou ſuffer fall hand giant thine aduerſarie neuer recouered may cauſe great endamagement thus much faithfully promiſe thée yéelde thy maiſters hande againe ſhall ſtand ſuch néed vſe gentle ſpéeche preſent daunger mine eye vrge rather giue mine enemie ſhould enioy thing ſuch honour wherefore gaue preſently departed could tell way giant tooke vſing found knight fortune muſed euent could iudge ende wrought wherefore siluian put ſtudy deſired attend great noyſe heard little groue though flaſhing weapon combat directing courſe thither eſpyed foure knight foote fiercely aſſailing one another armour ſo bruſed shield ſo battered hee could hardly perceiue deuiſes except one head white bull belonging pompides ſonne edward ſharp aſſaults betwéen theſe foure vrged knight fortune breake forth theſe ſpéeches gentleman great danger perceiue ſtād grieuous endamagement may happen vnto conſtraineth deſire would leaue great rage end ſtrife friendly reaſon ſo ſhall find cōmoditie ſelfe always bound accept counſell indéed anſwered one knight quarrell grounded ſo ſlight occaſion might eaſily agrée honeſt deſire doth onely conſiſt knight bull name knight ſéeketh although deſired v likewiſe vnderſtand ſome tidings vnpoſſible tell name anſwered knight bull could ſatiſfi deſires could way compell ſo long haue hand ſword defend theſe word procured freſh ſtrife f • againe fiercely without regard themſelues greatly pitied knight fortune ſée ſuch couragious mindes ſubiect ſo great hazard loth tarry behold greatly eſteemed one knight white armour dealt blowes ſo freely leaſt danger knight fortune perſwade leaue fight ſo ſeuerely bent one againſt ſcant knew themſelues laſt ſuddaine darkneſſe ſent caſtle sage aliart ouerſhadowed departure whereof knight eortune ſawe foure knight laid charyot drawn foure blacke horſes made ſomewhat abaſhed mooued demand one eſquirs droue chariot knight fought ſore combate anſwered knight white armour platir ſonne noble primaleon floraman prince sardignia two knight pompides blandidon entred combate enquiring knight fortune made leaue emperours court enterpriſing likewiſe aduenture great brittaine might meete knight whoſe friendly company alway deſired ſee miſfortune arriued farre great brittaine theſe two knight met thē demanding alſo knight fortune ſo word aryſing either ſide ſhould ſeeke knight fell fierce ſkirmiſh ſelfe hath partly ſeene loſſe feare noble maiſters except neare ſome place wee might make prouiſion knight fortune greatly moued tale perſwaded eſquyres haſten maiſter london ſhort time doubt might recouer health thus grief departed rode ſad eſpied one come riding towards horn necke attired like hunter began manner gréete behold thou noble palmerin england time wherein thy famous déeds ſhall bring obliuion worthy proweſſe long time hath béene hid ſo great brittaine ſhal enioy former quiet ſtate offended becauſe enterpriſe ſo boldly name priuie ſhall happen although ſelfe remaineth ignorant thereof knight fortune knew thinke heare himſelfe named ſuch ſtrange place perſwaded himſelfe vnknowde length beganne thinke might sage aliart obſcure valley yet would certainly giue credite ſuſpection doubt remoue aliart thus ſpake againe diſmayed worthy palmerio aliart ſeruant would gladly imploy ſelfe ſeruice doe greateſt honour might concerning ſhall chance vnto neither may yet declare bnt aſſure ſelfe ſhall enioy quiet happy eſtate yet sir aliart anſwered knight fortune god forbid ſhould requeſt thing willing ſhould bee knowne great bounty friendſhip haue vſed towards remaine life endureth loue duetie honour walking laſt came obſcure valley aliart conducted knight fortune caſtle ſhewed many rare excellent monument liuely ſhape men woman faire portraiture gaue great delight noble minde ſo thought caſtle faireſt euer ſéene life remained ſo long pleaſed well entertained sage aliart gaue vnderſtand platir knightes ſhould healed wound forreſt ſo ful ſtrange knight damoſels procured perillous aduentures laſt eſpied damoſell white pal • ray come riding towards haire ſpread ouer ſhoulders garment ſéeming greatly miſuſed way aa ſhe rode ſhe vſed many ſkrikes gréeuous lamentation greatly pittied knight sauage man ſaw knight came haſtily riding whereupon ſhe began gentle knight manner good sir regard honor knighthood diſtreſſed eſtate poore damoſell ſo time helpe defend ſeekes diſhonour maketh eſteemed amongſt vertuous perſons theſe word pierced ſo déepe noble minde ſtaied knight coming well armed brauely mounted began theſe word perceiue knighthood armor ill beſtowed vpon imploy ſelfe perſecution faire damoſel bound dutie law armes defend sir anſwered ſtrange knight deſire let fained teares vniuſt complauit strumpet inueigle minde troth ſhe reporteth neither ſo baſe minded purſue cauſleſſe knight sauage man ſo perſwaded damoſell would credite ſaid bnt anſwered thus sir ſhall rather diſaduantage diſhonour therefore prouide ſelfe ſtrange knight ſeeing ſo egerly bent ſaid content ſince enforce rule deſire reaſon whereupon touching speares met together couragiouſly ſo ſtrange knight caſt knight sauage man sauage man come traytour deale whoſe loſſe blood wearineſſe beſide deſireth rather take reſt combate knight sauage man greatly offended theſe wordes wherefore left went ſaying make thée either recant thy wordes elſe leaue life place charging one another puiſſantly knight sauage man laide laſt along earth knight ſéeing alſo armor gentle knight greatly broken many place began followeth ſée syr knight brought ſuch debilitie great expence blood alſo wearineſſe long enduring fight thinke great diſhonour giue freſh aſſault ſmall manhood mee vrge ſuch extremitie knight sauage man ſtill incenſed furie vnkind wordes hee receiued returned preſently anſwere haue little cauſe eſtéeme friendſhip ſo haue leſſe opportunity craue fauour though wound yrkeſome ſight yet endure vttermoſt charge withall wherefore ſet apart theſe word execute extremitie thy diſloyall thus breaking talke beganne aſſault one another rigorouſly ſo knight ſitting horſeback conceiued great maruaile hauty courage knight sauage man occupied eies beholding noble exploit ſuch féebleneſſe entred minde fellow could ſcarcely hold sword kéepe himſelfe falling ground fearing could eſcape death ſuch great diſaduantage alighted horſe knight sauage man began manner thinkes syr knight better aſſurance health alſo great gentlenes might offer theſe knight ſatiſfie deſire vpon victory hope farder likewiſe ſo depriued might hardly ſpare might yéeld greater diſaduantage conqueſt haue gotten enlarge renowne syr quoth k sauage man except recant ſhrewde wordes gaue confeſſe himſelfe vanquiſhed reſt commaund finiſh boldneſſe honour sworde ſay hee dare truſt sir anſwered knight grant ſuch ſmall requeſt ſhall extoll fame manifeſt friendſhip ſhall enforced enter combate loath doo conſidering preſent eſtate ſo much would hée ſhould depriue life good syr quoth knight sauadge man care haue deſerued deſire ſhould vſe vnto wherefore hereupon aſſure ſelfe able deale haue found indifferent conquere theſe word knight noble victor held ſubiection fell along ground faintneſſe much blood iſſued alſo grieuous wound hee ſo vnhappily ſuſtained made knight aſſaile knight sauadge man rigorouſly hope haue reuenged friend hurt detriment noble enemy life found knight sauadge man ſo great ſtrength ſo greatly affected farther victorie hee partly repented himſelfe entring ſuch hazard yet behaue himſelfe greater courage ſerued according sage aliart thought conuenient force charmes hee caſt dead ſlumber brought place ſought combate awaked found place beſtrewed trunchions speares alſo piece armour graſſe ſomewhat died danger ſuccoured ſo great diſtreſſe wherefore muſt needes thinke aduentures land rare rare becauſe haue béene accuſtomed like truſt quoth prince platir theſe two knight enemy combate inuade v ſtill might ende former enterpriſe ſo intent vnprouided neither v horſe weapon armour ſo reſcew himſelfe enemy theſe word thus e • ded floraman came toward two knight deſiring could reſolue doubt anſwered pompides ſuch vncertainty ſelues moued queſtion ſelfe would haue requeſted ſame litle talke paſſed betwéene fell knowledge forgetting former enmitn imbraced one another greatly reioyced ſo happily met vnto ſeuerall contentation breake friendly purpoſes ſalutations eſpied damoſell come riding ward mounted bay palfrey attired blacke countenance bewraying ſad ſorrowfull diſpoſition ſhée come vnto griefe friend ſorrow ſelfe faire lady ſaid blandidon ſhould rehearſe manner miſchance hath happened ſhould ouertedious heare danger ourſelues ſtand ſhew wanting armour auoyd may happen place knowledge admit quoth damoſell ſelfe would meane prouide horſes armour againe would grant ſmall requeſt ſhould put foorth vnto ladie aunſwered floraman reſpecting owne néede duetie owe diſtreſſed ladie hath wrought ſure like fellowes condition fulfilled abide vttermoſt extremitie defence euery one proteſting floraman promiſed damoſell departed returning ſhort time foure eſquires bearing foure faire according ſhall finde proofe giuing grrat thanks eſquires armed preſently armor differing one another colour richneſſe foure ſhields like wiſe deliuered deuiſs ſhall vnderſtand hereafter armed mounted alwais worn imbraced together curtuouſly ſo depart sage aliart promiſing place ſhould ſtand deſtitute helpe would aſſiſt againſt miſfortunes rode knight fortune towards anciēt famous cittie london
