wandring knight eſtate countrey noble aduentures olde time paſſed alſo preſent great brittaine supper came ſate porch houſe laſt ſawe ending gate damoſell accompanied young gentleman requeſted gentleman place haue lodging night gentleman whoſe cuſtome entertaine straungers commanded chamber ſuch prouiſion ſhe ſhould ſtand néede shée giuing thanks friendly hoſt ſo great courteſie came ſate gentleman houſe knight fortune perceiuing remooued ſtoole ſat among talke requeſted occaſion ſhee ſo penſiue heauie great griefe beholde abyde damoſell taking occaſion behold eſpying ſhield fortune ſo much eſteemed famed countreyes caſt ſelfe downe feete teares began ſorrowfull diſcourſe perceiue anger fortune ſatiſfied former iniuries ſhee hath executed poore ſelfe inſtaunt chaunge rigour fauour hath bene altogether infortunate haue found knight onely hope ende miſeries knightly valour worthy syr ſometime sonne ingenious euery exerciſe chiefely well nurtured martiall affaire fortune agréed towardly behauiour bin matrone ioy mother miſfortune ſo chaunced sonne growe amorous young beautifull damoſell retained fauour knight sonne admitted seruant ſuch affection toward sonne loue firſt suter died cold ſhe eſtéemed worthy good perceiued ſight knight began greatly ſtomacke finding oportunity fit purpoſe aſſayled violently sonne notwithſtanding danger ſides brought enemy hazard life himſelfe better lady liking time admitted conquerer better eſtate wound healed ſtrength conquered forgetting repulſe ſuſtained sonne alſo earneſt loue bare damoſell hee returned knight attyred gréene armour bearing ſhield portrait sauage man leading hand couple lion ſéeking reuenge knight behalfe sonne tooke courage enter combate ſuch ſpite fortune ſo great malice againſt mee sonne brought ſubiection ſtrange knight contented victory cruelly cut head gaue mortall enemy thus conſidering great iniury knight wrought mée none doe fauour reuenge vntimely loſſe determined leaue trauaile till found bearing name knight fortune renowned countreyes hath either ſéene heard compell enemy confeſſe fault giue reward belongeth ſo great diſcourteſie wherefore moſt worthy syr word ſtaied thus faire lady extreame griefe inward thought witneſſed aboundance teares bedewe roſichéekes conſtraineth belieue haue ſaide beare part accuſtomed heauineſſe wherefore conſidering wrong great vngentleneſſe knight sauage man fortune may bee ſo good méet reuenge iniury death leaue life pawne rather vrged deale knight remaineth controuerſie betwéene mée yet vnfiniſhed miſhap ſhall giue good occaſion recompence together knew certaine place finde truly ſir quoth damoſell left cittie london valour held ſuch eſtimation ſpeake whereof iudge little proude knight fortune perceiuing earneſt deſire damoſell reuenged would gladly finde promiſed ſens defiance next morning eſquire would diligent behalfe ſhe deſirous haue diſpatched word damoſell replyed ſufficiently iuſtifie haue often heard care hath bene ſo great welfare lady fortune hath better proſpered affaire ſo much iudge others much finde ſuch great curteſie ſelfe die deſerue let yet gentle nature afford good opinion life time ſhall ſpent honour name ancient gentleman vnderſtanding gueſt noble knight fortune eſteemed good luck could way diſcloſe wherefore deſired pardon vſed according famous report deſerued ignorance might ſerue excuſe fault committed rather vſed leſſe ſuſpition toward becauſe entertained ſo many noble valiant gentleman among well worthy gaue great commendation knight sauage man heard many partly ſéene himſelfe good report incited greatly moued knight fortune vſe diligence finding deſire time ſerued brake company departed lodging couragious knight ſuſtaining ſmall reſt 〈◊〉 cleare morning appeared aroſe armed ſpéed taking leaue hoſt damoſell departing towards london accōpanied siluian drawing ſomewhat neare citie tooke great pleaſure behold braue tower ſtrong edifies ſhining sunne gaue great contentation minde vrged aligh • becauſe would take good view therof vſing much talke siluian concerning great fame ancient cittie long ſtayed till ſuppoſed aged king riſen rode cittie brauery place remembrance famous exployts begun finiſhed prouoked ſome hautie attempt might enrowle name among number thoſe held high eſtimation report noble déeds doth vrge minde couragious equall thoſe beare moſt commendation approued valiancie chap xxxvi knight fortune arriuing london paſſed away time ancient hermit ſeeing monument funeral many noble perſons vntill ſent siluian engliſh court preſence king declared maiſters challenge knight sauage man willingly accepted albeit king would hardly agree vnto endured combate ſo long king accompanyed princeſſe fl • rida faine come▪ intreate leaue enterpriſe whoſe requeſt gaue conſent neither giuing victorie many gréeuous cogitation paſſed mind knight fortune entred famous citie london well vngentle dealing lady polynarda alſo ſundry conceit occaſion thinke laſt remembring might licenced combate till dinner withdrew himſelfe hermitage heard ſeruice deſirous ſée ancient monument chappel moſt part ruinated yet ſome remained good eſtate beautie among thing ſéene knight fortune behld ancient sepulchre cunningly framed workmanſhip albeit long continuance time waſted dimmed workes figure thereof ſo one could hardly reade engrauen ſauing one end perceiued name arbam norgalles buried whē king liſuart ruled crowne england vpon ſight ancient monument queſtioned hermit time paſt ancient sepulchre contained much larger quantity demand hermite thus anſwered good sir firſt came inhabite place computatiō time geſſe 34 yéers ſince found ancient sepulchre ſame eſtate behold haue heard many therefore may hold report infidel inuade land ruinate ſpoyle tombe aboue reſt ſparing theſe may perceiue wherein inferred grumedan cuillan penſiue beſide perſonages leſſe nobilitie knightly behauiour hermit talke vrged remember diſcourſe life noble guillan comparing hapleſſe life heauy eſtate like manner procured lady polynarda original ſorowful mourning remembrance falling great agony mind conſtrained leane iron compaſſed auncient sepulchre vttering ſuch rufull complaint within himſelfe gréefe thereof cauſed teares run chéekes standing great amaze hermite ſuppoſed occupyed mind ſome euill intent sriuian ſtepped vnto declaring wont often incumbred melancholy therefore willed vſe doubt matter length hapned forth mute ſtudy turning head hide extreame griefe siluian went vnto deſiring would noc forget enterpriſe knight sauage man leaue • ch thought would draw eſtate ſuch debility might greatly hinder former determination theſe word ſomewhat diſpleaſed ſaying doubt late ſtudying hath called remembrance thē either feare force enemy vſe taking leaue hermit rode toward citty met gentleman hoſt damoſell whoſe behalfe enterpriſed combate becauſe would enter citty yet ſent siluian court manifeſt king maiſters challenge vſe great circumſpection anſwer king returned siluian well noting maiſters commandement departed ſhort time arriued pallace going vp great hall perceiued king newly riſen diuner walking knight among knight sauage man well perfectly cured wound receiued fought againſt gracian francian polynarda alſo company siluian came preſence king knée ſuch duty required reſpect began followeth moſt puiſſant prince knight fortune noble lord maſter humility owne perſon yéeldeth homage heart knightly sword grace command intent court bowed make proofe ſeruice fortune ſo agréeing ſtead aquiet entry vnder grace leaue meaneth come way challenge trauailed met ladie whoſe cauſe miſfortune ſhée doeth attribute knight sauage man lord taking diſtreſſed caſe hand giueth challenge combat méet dare ſo grace allowe lord ſafe entrance return without diſturbance hinder determination knight sauage man onely excepted king heard fame knight fortune ſuch extolled prince court ſory arriuall ſhould moue ſuch requeſt would willingly haue denied combate knight sauage man came maieſtie vſed theſe word gracious soueraigne knight fortune ſuch reputation neither may grace denie requeſt ſelfe refuſe enter combate albeit puiſſāce hath vrged challenge aduantage gotten country maketh earneſt haue déedes knowne yet neither gréeting diſmay courage preſence compell leaue fielde wherefore deſire grace grant requeſt may haue libertie iuſt according hée ought otherwiſe goe well ſatiſfie deſire compaſſe affection haue ſelfe king ſéeing excuſes would ſerue hinder matter knight sauage man would néedes take fight returned siluian anſwere friend tell thy lord pleaſed offended requeſt yet ſéeing demand ſtandeth law armes way iuſtly denie graunt free leaue without contradiction better would haue iudged challenge béene knight ſo lightly eſcape perhaps hee maketh account meſſage siluian returned maiſter hauing heard pleaſure king came prnſently place appointed combat king quéen princeſſe flerida nobility ready placed behold noble attempt citizen likewiſe repaired thither ſee combate ſo ſuddenly noyſed abroade ſo place filled abundance people knight fortune entred made obeyſance king paſſed came knight sauage man accompanied many knight noble gentleman among company argolant brought ſpeare roſiran de la bronde deliuerd ſhéeld ſo marching king left vſing talke knight fortune know ſir knight ſhould cauſe ſo great challenge without iniurie neuer offended sir anſwered knight fortune behold ladie preſent haue offered ſmall abuſe ſée recompence conſtraine abide doome mercy truſt ſir quoth knight sauage man lady altogether vnknowne neyther haue offended body beſide ſhould deſerue thus vngently accuſed ſée good opinion haue owne manhood cauſeth ſo earneſt matter denym albeit could yet giue ſpot honour departing themſelues fetch caréere ſound trumpetst hey met brauely together breaking halfe dozen staues péece yet neither able ſtirre ſaw could diſmount one another tooke ſwords charged ſuch pollitique behauiour fight maruellous heare commendation generally giuen well wearied themſelues horſebacke alighted endeuored endanger ſuch rigorous blowes thought combat would long laſt ere one ſlaine ſhéelds ſhiuered péeces armour ſo broken blood trickled downe ſides fell wraſtling one another gripe made blood iſſue foorth aboundantly yet neither aduantage ſtrength ſo equall could iudged likeſt victorie princeſſe flerida gréeuing great effuſion blood departed ſuch heauineſſe ſhe known blood ſonnes ſo cruelly ſpilt king courtly attendaunts ſtroken ſuch maze ſaw take ſwords againe thought flower chiualrie preſent great heauineſſo would giue ouer meanes knight sauage man ſéeing himſelfe deſtitute sword ſheeld armour began ſomewhat feare life would ſtand great hazard yet contented himſelfe death ordained ſhould ſuſtaine leſſe reproch knight ſuch honour giuen ouerthrow wherefore pauſe thus began ſhould diſcourage ſelfe death ſéeing ſhall depart flower prime mine age end dayes hande onely eſtéemed good fortune yet oath haue made princeſſe flerida great duty find ſelfe deſert conſtrains mée wiſh longer time might well exalt honour trie aduenture hath endamaged ſo many good knight whereto euer bend mine affection onely enterpriſe life win renowne ſéeing falne ſo great miſhap fortune doth deny mine owne manhood faile yet ſo behaue ſelfe vpon mine enemy hath woon vttermoſt ſhall boaſt conqueſt ſuch writ deliuer ſeale hope ſhall craue ſignet heart blood like manner knight fortune ſtood debating himſelfe well vpon preſent danger alſo paſſed dollour forgetting ladie miſtreſſe polinarda ſhe bene preſent began complaint madame behold time wherein anger doth kill fauour reuiue except beare cruell mind worke tragedy reſtore wonted clemencie encouragement hapleſſe labour ſince lyeth handes caſt friendly looke man extremity none onely deny ſmall requeſt neither ſhall aduenture enterpriſes great brittaine doe honour heart hath euer deſired ſo ſhall flower chiualrie remaine great miſfortune obſtinacie accounted loſſe knight hath put mee danger euer yet neither v enioyeth conqueſt infortunate death returne ſhare ſhall thinke ſelfe honourably failed handes poore heart cruelly martyred hard dealing fell combate againe able charge one another ſo fiercely firſt yet labouring earneſtly end ſtrife one way mooued king diſcend accompanied knight fearing loſſe theyr liues ſought ſet vnitie ſuch deſire victorie ſo couragious mindes middeſt moſt doubt king faine returne becauſe would giue eare perſwaſion went hee chamber princeſſe flerida manner began vſe ſpéech fayre daughter noble sonne edward lord liuing may deliuered valour earthly creature perſwade ſelfe one theſe knight ſhall meane relieue aduerſe eſtate combate greatly feare ſhall ende liues vpon hautie attempt farewell hope euer repoſed ſhall loſe ſelfe ſhall euer lacke might aſſure ſelfe heare sonne enioy court woonted eſtate againe wherefore beare ſuch loue haue alway proteſted fauour earneſt deſire vouchſafe paine walke vnto one word mouth wil enfore leaue combate ſo ſhall poſſeſſe haue long wiſhed honoured ſo great courteſie princeſſe ſince abſence lord ſeldome come abroad alway kept chamber wonted lamentation requeſt aged king came walking downe foure damoſels attired blacke attending ſelfe apparrelled ſame manner ſauing vaile head ſhadowed face ſo none could haue full view behold beautie ſhe entred place iuſt great amazement preſent ſhe came knight fortune tooke arme theſe word sir knight either make account honour lady manifeſt déedes owe duty requeſt intreate leaue combate well auoyd hazard liues content noble company ſatiſfied famous exployts knight fortune wel eying princeſſe perceiuing reſemble countenance faire polinarda humbled himſelfe knée theſe word faire lady deſire hath bene greatly bent end combate render knight victory hath well deſerued ſéeing haue charged ſuch curteous command rather deſire death yéeld deny sir quoth knight sauage man ſhould report eſtimation haue knighthood forceable charge haue receiued hand might ſay iuſtly haue rightly deſerued onely knight grant conqueſt ſéeing haue made grant duty muſt alway reuence intreaty hath moued end debate ſhould contrary ſhe haue appointed might worthily reproched among knight much diſped among faire ladyes prince ſo well pleaſed good agréement giuing harty thanks ſhe returned chamber king little pleaſed good euent commanded knight ſhould bée brought pallace ſuch reſpect ſhould vſed ſhort time might recouer former good health knight fortune would accept knight offer time departed gentleman hoſt houſe againe whether carefully brought chariot ſuch prouiſion ordained helpe gentleman daughter maruailous expert arte medicine weake eſtate relieued indifferent good plight damoſell ſought cauſe combate anſwere made ſo ſoone entred fight ſhe ſecretly ſhrunke away thorow preace ſo could gaine knowledge knight sauage man conducted chamber hée ſuch great attendance curing wound meanes could deuiſe might beſt ſerue remedy neuer hurt ſo dangerous thoſe receiued combate life greater hazard preſent made princeſſe ſo diligent ſhe enterpriſed much ſimpleſt occaſion trauaile health king greatly diſpleaſed knight fortune would vouchſafe lodging pallace leaue awhile two vnknowen brother till haue attained health thē may haue occaſion ſpeake loth forgetfull knight court conſtantinople aſſembled themſelues tranaile forreſt great brittaine truſting tickle dealing fléering fortune ſhe fauored day frowned againe month ſpace thought themſelues ſureſt eſtate good hap néereſt owne deſtruction chap xxxviii eutropa enchantreſſe ſent damoſell procured combate betweene knight fortune knight sauage man cauſed al grecian knight come caſtle ſeuered themſelues maner two army ſhe ſent two damoſels faigned report ſet ſuch diſcord betweene party prepared themſelues dangerour battaile evtropa enchantreſſe aunt giant dramuſiande ſeeing caſtele ſtored good knight fearing time drewe nie preuent wicked purpoſe ſhe ſought ſet ſuch diſcord among knight lately arriued england ſhould without knowledge ſpoile liues ende purpoſe ſhe framed intent ſhe could execute couragious knight endeuoured themſelues ſearch ſtrayed prince ſhe would ſet ſuch ſtrife enmitie thorow chriſtendome paganes ſhould ruinate ſpoile dominion lord ouer kingdom countreys better bring deuiſes paſſe ſhee ſent damoſels continually abroad circute great brittaine ſet ſtrife diſcention betwéene trauayling knight damoſelles ſo diligent theyr miſtreſſe commaund daily brought many good knight hazard danger haue partly heard ſhall doe hereafter one theſe damoſels occaſion combate betwéene polinarda knight sauage man ſame damoſell brought horſe armour prince platir companion alſo ſet ſtrife betwéen knight fortune knight sauage man damoſell teares commaund ſuch ſubtill report auaile miſtreſſe ſhée onely beloued eſtéemed eutropa yea ſhee referred whole ſubſtance practiſe deceitfull report damoſell knight lately come conſtantinople remained pleaſure engliſh court enforced theſe craftie meanes take departure ſéeke aduentures great brittaine combate ended betwéene knight fortune knight sauage man diſguiſed armour changed deuiſes theyr shieldes leaſt ſhould knowen put themſelues trauayle way inforced finde caſtle giant dramuſiande eutropa brought knight field caſtle ſtoode ſeuering two company riuer running betwéene tent pitched ſuch prouiſion appointed thogh determined fight maine battaile one ſide prince gracian oniſtalde dramain francian polinard tremoran claribal emeralde faire ſide prince berolde dridan belizart guerin eſtrellant germaine orleance platir floraman blandidon criſpian diuers ſides brought ſuch eſtate neither could tell meanes brought place laſt foorth caſtle came two damoſels one accompanied like perſō great grauitie hauing body yong gentleman guide preſently went pauillions next caſtle prince gracian company ſide riuer ſhe come preſence prince gently courteouſly entertained preparing ſelfe deceitfull courſe intermedling talke teares ſhée beganne manner sir knight crown noble déedes continuall fame well imployed knighthéed ſufficient irritate vſurping enemy confound ſuch ſwell againſt honourable duety ſo owne drift ſhall prepare iuſt deſtruction euill deuices runne contempt whole world concerning preſumption haue vſed raſh entry bold behauiour may perceiue reproch ſhall deſire firſt conſider extremity griefe pardon enterpriſe priuy paſſions auncient caſtell may behold doth belong haue liued heauy happy time time paſt haue béene better acquainted pleaſant conceyts long time could enioy like tranquility miſfortunes well knowē witneſſe great alteration former eſtate fortune among liberall benefit ſhe beſtowed wealth maintaine quiet gouernment protect gaue daughter ſo perfect beauty ſo pure modeſty ſo preciſe perſonage ſo exquiſite vſuall behauiour many noble gentleman haue put liues hazard deſerue good liking liked great hath bin intreaty many honorable perſonages haue mariage haue alwaies denied till making choyſe one aboue haue agréed accompliſh importunate deſire knowne knight long time béene suter yet neuer ſo fortunate gaine intent preſumeth vpon ſtrength take perforce iniure hath obtained conſent eſpouſe ſigne wherof pointing pauillions knight farder ſide riuer behold hath placed tent inuade caſtle helpe friend purpoſeth ruinate mine ancient dwelling vſe violence betrothed another conſidered meane remedy neceſſity caſe eiter kéepe hold famiſhed yéeld ſelfe foe ſo diſhonoured ſent one damoſels engliſh court whoſe requeſt arriued place may behold vſurping enemy great danger ſtand hard award fortune haue ſent way intreaty breake vp ſiege trouble cannot haue though vſe neuer ſuch violence ſuch great mallice knight intent linked ſuch extreme purpoſe neither gentleneſſe may intreate faire demeanour ſerue perſwade wherfore noble gentleman reſpect honour oppreſſed virgin oath knighthood hath auouched behalfe ſtand friend voyd defence maintaine cauſe renowne good fame euer hauing thus ended coined proteſtation ſtood debating themſelues anſwer ought make herat laſt prince gracian hauing referred diſpoſition tooke damoſell hand thus ſhaped anſwer faire lady ſince honorable company haue appointed vn worthy anſwer behalfe perſwaded would informe v miſreport thus dare awareant ſhall finde ready defend enemy dare preſume way moleſt damoſell hearing anſwer prince gracian ſuch ſerued fit purpoſe gaue thē hartg thanks calling▪ teares againe remembraunce vrged knight ſuch pittie greatly deſired enter combate company returned damoſell beene knight informing likewiſe ſuch falſe report entred pauillion damoſel curteſie ſhe gaue forth theſe ſpéeches mathe enemy honour friend owne damage wil perſwaded follow enterpriſe deriſion ſcoffeth noble aſſembly reporting ſo weake dare ſhew themſelues theſe word vrged oniſtalde vnto ſuch anger preſently brake forth theſe ſpéeches beléeue tryed thoſe haue aduentured dare ſhould finde chaſtiſement peremptory bragges aunſwerable effect haue iuſtly deſerued tuſh quoth polinarda eaſie enemy talke pleaſure ſhall find trechery rewarded due recompence hee wiſh vſed himſelfe fréendely ladie hath ſo greatly iniuryed francian deſirous ſend defiance damoſell would ſuffer leſt dealing ſhould eſpyed worke ſurer deceite ſhe ſent damoſell depart preſently whereto made denyall ſhe ſhould ſummon armes prepare fight maane ſhe gone meſſage craftie gyrle vſed ſuch familiaritie prince gracian knight heat enflamed againſt beyond riuer damoſell reported prince gracian company endeuour themſelues take caſtle miſtreſſe perforce whereupon ſhée requeſted defend miſtreſſe right cauſe know went diſloyall enterpriſe prince floraman hauing well pondered word damoſell returned preſently aunſwer albeit duettie defend diſtreſſed perſon ſo gainſay miſhap iniuried lady yet reaſon willeth v ere preſume haſtily acquai • ted cauſe well aduiſed ere begin ſuch raſh attempt elſe may enemie iudge come vpon brauerie knighthood may awarrant behauiour ſo runne danger ſelues rightful cauſe hath alwaies victory wherfore thus reſolue ſelfe wee firſt know reportes trueth leaſt enter ſuch defectes may perhappes repent v demoſell began rehearſe promiſe ſuch time ſhe deliuered horſes armour great neceſſitie cauſe ſhe deſired accompliſh promiſe threatning nobility might defaced denying word truſt anſwered platir haue ſuch good opinion dealing ſhe would vſe perſwaſion v vntroth wherfore tell v faire lady doth enemy ſtill remaine reſolute determination albeit companion deny ayd haue auouched yet abide death haue promiſed prince berolde coming damoſel began thus faire lady ſée ſuch great hazard imploy ſelues giue ſuccour aſſure ſelfe mine owne part ſo dare auouch reſt company pawne blood heart ere ſée remaine ſuch heauineſſe damoſel theſe word returned prince gracian certifying willingneſſe fight long ſhe ſtayd returned againe face ſprent teares chéefe vaile couer treaſon thus ſhe ſpake gentleman quarrel force ha • ing lady miſtres hold haue vowed let depart without ſhe render caſtle moreouer ſend word way defiance ſo ready deale iudge dare come forth either defend cauſe lady make proofe loyaltie report prouoketh ſuch earneſt deſire knight mounted horſeback beganne ſhew themſelues field vſing ſuch behauiour often recourſes knight could enioy reſt till likewiſe prepared ſuch enuious dealing eutropa fight ſhe ſet sonne againſt father one brother againſt another deareſt fréend enemy one another ſée furiouſly behaued themſelues knowing fought againſt would haue made one iudge meanes preſent death force diuelliſh deuiſes treaſonable attempt damoſell vndertooke neiter ciuilitie regarded owne ſafetie time reſpected chap xxxviii damoſels ended ſubtle perſwaſions knight ioyned themſelues together dangerou • doubtfull fight wherein ſo ſore endamaged one another liues ſtood hazard recouery sage aliart ſeeing intent eutropa worke vtter ſpoyle theſe couragious knight came charmed ſuch order quickely left battaile giant dramuſiande came forth wirh captiue prince greatly lamented ſee ſonnes kindred ſuch doubtfull eſtate tooke priſoners caſtle damoſels accompliſhe • diſloyall practiſe miſtreſſe eutropa departed leauing knight readineſſe enter battaile ſo changed armour deuices shéelds knowledge one another prince gracian attired gréene armour mingled ſpots white coate maile ouer ſame colour shéeld bare red lyon rampaunt field sinople oniſtalde armour blacke whereon artificiall deuiſe made pretie thing reſembling ſcales fiſh ſhéeld bare gorgon head brother dramian armed ſame manner armor bazilliart ſomewhat gréene thicke beſet lyoneſſes gold bearing ſhield deuiſe eagle francian armor reſembling litle flame fire ſhielde likewiſe ſame order deuiſe dridan armed blacke bearing ſhield tower babilon polinard armour ſandy colour whereon painted many broken speares token loſt victory againſt noble floraman whē aduentured beautie faire polinarda hauing deuiſe ſhield ſpeare broken middeſt friſol armour colour red beſet ſundry pretie antique face sable ſhield bare white lyon golden field tremoran attyred carnation coloured armour brauely beſet golden pellicans deuiſe shield image sagittarius luyman burgondie clariball hungaria armour white theyr ſhieldes alike deuiſes flauian emeralde faire armour blacke finely beſpotted red ſhieldes reſemblance faire clowde field ſiluer knightes ſide riuer like manner diſguiſed giuing ſhewe enemy hautie courage magnanimitie prince berolde firſt aduanced himſelfe field armour blacke whereon cunningly beſprent teares louer shield bléeding heart rent violently number péeces roſuell belizart came next armour gréene carnation colour bearing ſhieldes amorous paſſions louers minde fielde azure eſtrellant would change armour defaced deuiſe ſhield could knowen trofollant armor gréene whereon figured many golden doues ſhielde bare troyan horſe field sable guerin white armour bearing ſhielde pecocke fielde reſembled coullour many needle rotandor criſpian macedon armed alike germayne orleance armour azure bearing shield beautifull damoſell kept remembrance fayre florenda daughter arnedes king france whoſe ſake determined trye aduentures great brittaine platir floraman blandidon pompides damoſell eutropa deliuered horſes armour came forth horſes alike armour blacke beſet ſiluer swannes helmet ſumptuouſly guilded adored rich pearles shieldes deuiſes alike ſmokie forge anuill god vulcan smith company marching forward till met beheld maruailous great contempt taking occaſion ſerued couched speares encountred together valiantly betwéen continued ſuch dangerous fight ſore hurtes receiued alſo great debilitie brought effuſion blood witneſſed earneſt deſire victory aduerſe eſtates remained patterne great perill edward primaleon recinde arnedes belcar vernar soldan bellagris ſtanding dramuſiande window caſtle beheld fierce aſſaults theſe couragious knight whereto gaue ſuch commendation moſt hauty exployt euer ſéene moued edward ſay haue time paſt onely ſéene many notable ſkirmiſh alſo haue experience behauiour many noble knight yet comparing paſt behold muſt néedes ſay reſt hath béene counterfeite onely worthy eternall commendation indéede quoth primaleon aduentures place meruailous maketh mée ſuſpend iudgement couragious aſſembly bée naturall fight indéede imagination giuen vnto v practiſe euchantment muſt commend moſt knightly aduenture life time could gaine ſight dramuſiande likewiſe abaſhed preſent ſpectacle knowing come paſſe meanes aunt fearing leaſt battaile ſome ſhould ſlaine went intreated pacifie grieuous stratageme minde bent ſuch cruelty ſhe would vſe reſpect word long endured violence faintneſſe made let fal weapon catch hold one another manner wraſtling great griefe princeſſe caſtle behold ſore paine themſelues continue fight ſo long sage aliart vnderſtanding great miſhap ſcorning eutropa ſhould attribute triumph victory wholly vnto ſelf came place theſe knight aſſembled entring campe like ancient olde man hauing rodde hand wound serpent ſtrooke vpon ground preſently knight fell earth ſuch ſtrange marueilous alteration one would haue iudged béene depriued liues finiſhed pleaſed wēt vp caſtle dramuſiande ſending ſuch darke ſmoke ouer valley wherein might perceiued great flaſhes flame fire prince caſtle marueilouſly affrighted moued eutropa ſuch great anger becauſe ſhée could gaine knowledge hapned worke • knight ſhe certainly purpoſed ſhée went raging caſtle mooued ſuch diſquietneſſe roſiran de la bronde trauailed long arriued valley perdition becauſe night knewe well way take alighted ſitting downe roote trée determined ſléepe vntill next morning ſuch griefe receiued wound knight sauage man ſundry cogitation tormented minde ignorant whence ſo hee could ſuffer eye receiue ſléepe troubled thought enioy reſt ſtil deſired caſtle ſo many noble knight held priſoners vowing redéeme aduerſe eſtate hee would leaue life pledge valure morning siluian brought ſtéed preſently mounted horſebacke rode way thought ſooneſt ende pretence eutropa hauing brought dramuſiande knight woonted health could beare armour reſiſt enemy ſuffered knight fortune come caſtle perceiued knight newly come foorth making ſhew reſiſtance durſt offer venture ſight cauſed preſently couch ſpeare ſodaine damoſell came riding horſebacke ſhield vpon arme ſtaied ſir knight deſire begin combate take shield better defence becauſe day ſhal haue moſt néed day ſhal ſtand cheefeſt ſtéede ending talke deliuering ſhield immediately ſhe departed ſuch great haſt could haue leiſure ſpeake vnto giue thanks ſo great courteſie deliuered shielde fortune siluian faſtening vpon arme knew shield palme tree taken siluian ſlew giant camboldam mulzella made expect ſome good aduenture wordes damoſel ſpake ſhe tooke siluian y• ſhe would reſtore ſhould haue moſt neede imploy ſeruice moued approoue ſhield becauſe ſpéeches damoſell emperor conſtantinople whē sage aliart ſent haue heard likewiſe becauſe moſt dangerous aduenture life time enterpriſed could wiſh fit occaſion inſtant make wiſh fit occaſion inſtant make triall ſhield edward ready prouided menaced corage yt knight fortune receiued ſuch exquiſit behauior fight edward ſore hurt good knight receiuing ſtroke vpon ſhéeld eſcaped force lance knight fortune vpon good lucke would haue entred combate ſword pandare comming forth caſtle commanded prince toreturne ſo could ſatiſfie requeſt edward entring ye caſtle knight made ſuch ſpéed entred pandare perceiued ſhut gate came vanting ſword toward good knight ſhort time diſhartned pandare becauſe blow could pierce ſhéeld ſo ſpoiled armor giant ſhort time brought vnder obeyſance greatly cōmended dramuſiand edward primaleon noble exployt grecian knight partly knowledge ſome conſtantinople damſel broght ſhéeld knew beautie braue deuice ſuch opinion knight fayled end aduenture doubted ſhould neuer get deliuery cruell caſtle yet ſo great pleaſure conceiued could tell wether ſhould go welcome enter combate ſo deliuer ſeeing vſed pandare vrged beléeue ſhould haue good ſucceſſe hautie enterpriſe alligan ſéeing pandare néere loſing head came fiercely aſſailed knight fortune welcommed ſuch pure paiment made quickely retyre take breath dramuſiande ſéeing alligan ſo ſhrewdly handled ſo vexed knew well ſay thought vnpoſſible conquer hardy knight hauing ſuch ſhéeld could pierced ſo began vtterly denounce fortune fauoured ſo long would leaue laſt alligan albeit vnwilling began againe aſſaile knight ſuch reward trauaile brought vnder ſubiection left head gage knight fortune dramuſiande ſaw alligan ſlaine great rage called armour vowing execute ſeuere reuenge good knight meane time prince edward came vnto requeſting ſuch friendſhip hand would ſuffer haue ſight face floraman ſéeing vnwilling diſcouer himſelfe ſaide ought deny ſuch ſmall requeſt ſo noble prince edward heard edward named reported ſuch ſingular knight proweſſe whoſe ſake ſo many valiant prince left countrey kindred finde loſt none could tell cauſed siluian take helmet prince delighted comely contenance preſently ſaid hope sir knight god hath endued ſuch ſéemely honourable ſhape ſo hath reſerued finiſh perillous ſtrange aduenture behauiour doth eneourage v ſo good opinion neuertheleſſee fortune allow victorie deſire vſe curteſie giant prepareth himſelfe encounter gentle vſage v doth conſtraine ſpeake ſo fauourable caſe knight fortune leyſure make anſwer becauſe perceiued dramuſiande comming towardes siluian hauing armed head began charge furiouſly ſo began proofe fight al paſſed nothing reſpect preſent exployts ſtrokes dramuſiande entred knight fortuns ſhéeld eaſily would haue done vrged good knight think promiſe made ſhéeld falſe truth ſéeing failed ſtood moſt extremitie perſwaded himſelfe againe gained victory ſhould attributed vertue ſhéeld rather gotten valour perſon ſhould eſtéemed renowne atchieue conqueſt ſuch prouided meane wherefore repoſing longer confidence ſhéelde truſted ſtrength good ſucceſſe aſſure himſelfe vſing dramuſiande ſuch ſort little cauſe boaſt bargain ſpeake vprightly ſmall aduantage either ſide ſore wounded alike wearied great danger preſent death made prince heauy regardants ſorrowfull ſée ſuch vnfriendly ſpectacle dramuſiande retyring take pauſe beganne ſuſpect knight ſhould bring vnder obeyſanue whoſe comming aunt eutropa alway caſt great doubt preuent hee thought beſt render ſome prince ſo leaue enterpriſe conſidered preſent ſuch condition enemie might expreſſe cowardiſe extinguiſh good report woonted knightly déedes determined end life ſo good champion rather reproched continuall infamy knight fortune walking vp communing ſelfe manner doe looſe life deliuer ſo many deare friend account chiefeſt honor life beſt aduenture euer enterpriſed ſuddainly turning thought faire polinarda manner began vtter amourous complaint madam time reſpected vowed dutie ſeruant time vouchſafe remember princely fauor ſo victory returne according wiſh may manifeſt honour mine attempt ſoueraigne bounty liue haue hope confound enemy began againe ſuch wrathfull manner ſuppoſed remedie death ſuch féeble eſtate ſo great loſſe blood dramuſiande conſtrained fall downe hée could longer ſuſtaine himſelfe knight fortune ſate downe glad haue little reſt become ſo faint edward prince came running dramuſiande tooke helmet might receiue aire deſiring knight fortune conteut himſelfe victory worke death friendly giant anſwered although mine intent part head ſhoulders yet time execute ſuch crueltie reſpecting honour haue done intreate haue done much heart deſired prince conducting ye caſtle ſo diligent thē dangerous eſtate required eſpecially dramuſiande reduced weake eſtate ſo buſie thē heard great knocking gate prince platir opened ſpéed beheld ancient man apparelled grecian faſhion entred caſtell accompanied two comely damoſels carrying handes two golden box precious oyntment wherewith enbalmed knight fortune alſo knight receiued hurt auncient man would ſuffer wounded knight onely two damoſels wherefore commanded foorth chamber promiſing ſhould recouer woonted health againe promiſe greatly content prince deſired nothing ſo much health knight fortune conquering giant receiued former libertie againe cruell enchauntmentes eutropa practiſed valley perdition fully finiſhed power eſtéemed anciēt man tooke leaue prince commaunding damoſels depart thence till recouered ſound eſtate health againe prince daily accompany knight fortune edward woud often viſite giant dramuſiande labouring ſhew great courteſie becauſe would vngratefull frienſhip hee found handes manner prince paſſe away time vntill deareſt friend gained good conſtitution body damoſelles accompliſhed would depart caſtle chap xlii prince caſtle giant dramuſiande ioy deliuery puiſſance renowned knight fortune ſent floraman prince sardignia court king england preſence queene princeſſe flerida hee declared ioyfull newes edward alſo prince bene long time kept priſoners cauſed king ſend argolant againe emperor conſtātinople declare glad finding prince edward ſonne noble primaleon sir pridos came engliſh court verifie prince floraman dramuſiande thus happily ouercome remaining ſuch great debilitie doubtfull ſpéedy recouery prince would depart thence till knight fortune able beare company whō damamoſels neither ſpared labour good endeuour ſo good hope ſhort time ſhould ſtrength trauaile meane time determined themſelues ſend meſſenger king england might vnderſtand good fortune happened would make amends great ſorrow hee ſuſtained long time prince floraman becauſe great wiſedome iudgement appointed generall conſent beare theſe glad tidings went armourie belonging giant dramuſiande put owne armor battered broken alſo coloured blood came body ſkirmiſh taken priſoner caſtle armed tooke leaue rode ſuch haſte ſecond day arriued london much beheld becauſe armour ſo greatly bruſed length came court time king ready goe hunting floraman preſented himſelfe deſirous kiſſe grace hand eſquire taken helmet king knowledge imbraced theſe word certainly ſir floraman armour brought ſuch great alteration doth witneſſe great danger hath bene incident perſon truſt gréeuous beholding hath bene yrkoſome ſelfe abiding ſéemeth ſhould bring ſorowfull tidings ſuch great miſchance ſéemeth haue taſted neuertheleſſe hauing often receiued ſuch ſad report better endure therefore ſay gracious lord anſwered floraman would vouchſafe returne pallace might behold quéene princeſſe flerida ſhall diſcouer ſuch ioyfull newes long continuing wiſhes ſhal prenſently ſatiſfied theſe word king tooke floraman hand walked chamber quéene princeſſe ſitting welcommed gratiouſly vſed according noble birth required floraman neuer ſo happy inſtant haue ſight princeſſe flerida eſtéemed himſelfe gladdeſt knight aliue bring tidings ſuch rare princeſſe beautie done dutie according place perſons beſéemed began ſalute theſe ſpéeches following tedious word gratious soueraigne trifle time long circumſtances might offend patience ſtay heare cumber memory taſtand ſhew wherefore vſe breuity ſch caſe haue long deſired laſt deſerued thinke expedient conſidering heauineſſe therefore attend hath luckily happened edward noble ſonne primaleon prince knight haue bene ſo long time loſt found laſt remembrance obedient duetie kiſſe hand maieſtie long oppreſſion hath obtained happy end grieuous ſorrowes finiſhed generall delight haue recouered wonted libertie albeit hath bene bought ſharpe reſiſtance belong come themſelues honour dutie willeth ſtay yet becauſe renowned knight fortune whoſe proweſſe hath fréede bondage hath recouered ſuch health may permit iourney vntill time remaine caſtle dramuſiande hath kept priſoners till long aduenture hath bene ſo worthily brought end thus haue certified grace hath bene giuen charge accompliſh theſe word moued looke ech doubting whether might giue credance report floraman ſéeing al ſuch amazement though hardly beléeue ſaid began againe perſwade thus truſt grace doth thinke would preſume manifeſt tale vntroth might remaine blemiſh mine honour beſide offence vnto grace deſerue pardon therefore deſire miſtruſt haue bene ſo bold diſcloſe credite noble ſonne edward line yeſterday left prince cauſes haue already declared king perceiuing earneſt proteſtations prince floraman came imbraced theſe wordes haue opinion sir floraman wold dalude v falſe report yet blame hardneſſe beléefe becauſe haue béene ſo often certified tydings gaue impoſſibilitie haue declared ſo cauſe filled ſuſpect neuertheleſſe yet ſuch confidence repoſe ſuch grauitie accompanieth dayly attempt reſolued ioyfull tydings giue thouſand thanks imployed pain nothing acceptable thing welcome theſe long deſired tydings quéene princeſſe withdrew themſelues chamber manifeſting ſuch ioyfall diſtourſes might witnes great contentation yea ſuch ſeuerall motion gladneſſe tooke place within ſorrowing mindes themſelues power expreſſe leyſure declare king deſirous know edward prince beene ſo long time kept priſoners alſo knight fortune behaued himſelfe ſo many ventured yet none ſo happie preuaile floraman rehearſed whole ſtate impriſonment firſt laſt continuance accident happening time declared laſt combate knight fortune againſt gyant dramuſiand king taken maruellous aſtoniſhment vrged enter theſe ſpéeches certainly war gyant frenaque made againſt father hath bene cauſe miſchiefe aduerſe miſhaps hath chanced ſo life likewiſe come danger god mercy vſed reſpect vnto tell sir floraman gyant dramuſian de yet liuing certes good lord anſwered floman left grieuous doubtfull eſtate health ſonne carefull welfare owne proſpertie deſireth grace ſuch time ſhall come court would entertaine gently receiue himſelfe ſo great affection ſon ſurely behauiour hath deſerued leſſe king well pleaſed report promiſed fulfill deſire sonne thing ſo hée went chamber princeſſe flerida hee rehearſed talke paſſed betwéene prince floraman theſe newes ſo blazed thorow cittie london many came welcome prince floraman many tooke way caſtle giant dramuſiande ſhewing ſuch ioyfulneſſe recouery loſt prince paſſed ſorrowe nothing thought vpon gladneſſe citizen vnderſtood princeſſe flerida exiled heart former feare made herb • conuerſant courtly company long time ſhee béene would ſit talking ſuch returned giant caſtle witneſſing prince floraman declared king thought good giue knowledge happy chance emperour palmerin conſtantinople calling argolant béene ambaſſador thither gaue commaundement following becauſe carryed tydings emperour great miſhap befell sonne minded ſhall goe giue cauſe great ioy heauineſſe declare vnto son edward noble sonne primaleon knight loſt deliuered captiuitie enioy former libertie againe meſſage argolant armed himſelfe departed ſpéedily towards cōſtantinople within thrée dayes king deſirous ſée sonne prince determined ryde caſtle dramuſiande arriuall syr pridos changed minde preſently certifying ſo ſoone knight fortune giant dramuſiande able abide trauaile would ſtay come court ſpéede might king imbraced ſir pridos conducted chamber prince flerida reioyced greatly ſée gladly would haue ſight huſband edward till ſhe ſawe ſhe thought word tale fable chap xliii damoſels hauing cured wound knight fortune giant dramuſiande tooke leaue departed ancient man againe edward prince left caſtle came london royally welcomed king fredericke oftentimes would prince edward company renowned knight viſite knight fortune vntill laſt attained ſuch ſtrength could well endure beare armor hee concluded abandon foretreſſe would appoint ſuch knight gouernoit ſhould render hand whē willing receiue eutropa albeit diſcourteous dealing deſerued ſmall fauour nephewe vanquiſhed hée would giue another caſtle well manifeſt noble minde power pardon extreame cruelty ſhowne alſo cauſe leaue helliſh abhominable exerciſe life wherein ſhe onely vexed number prince great reputation granted well eſtéemed general conſent prince berolde appointed goe giue knowledge therof preſently heard ſuch noyſe caſtle ſuppoſed would haue fallen downe head beſide aroſe ſuddenly ſuch terrible darkeneſſe could neither behold one another power abide altogether laſt aire iudged heard gréeuous crie ſounded eares manner edward ſeeke pleaſure ſhall requite thy fréendſhip great vnthankefulneſſe labour thy ſelfe toward good whoſe extreame cruell nature delighteth thy griefe eutropa hath plagued thée thy noble friend continue tormenting thee thine vntill world hath made end go place ſhall haue leyſure forget iniurie thou haſt done vnto power fulfill deſire thy continuall vexation theſe word thus ended aire waxing ſomewhat cleare againe might perceiue enchantreſſe aire inuironed darke gloomy myſt like cloud ſhe cut aire great many fiery flaſhes ſhe departed forth ſight remayned great amazement yet glad rid ſo ill affected damoſels commandement ancient man ſtayed till knight perfectly rerouered came prince edward vſing theſe word good ſir giue v leaue depart ſéeing knight fortune giant dramuſiande danger ſtrong enough endure trauaile armour truſt lady anſwered edward great courteſies hath ſo ſeuerely bound might iuſtly reproached ingratitude ſuffer depart vſing ſuch honourable recompence haue well deſerued neuertheleſſe ſuch ſimpleneſſe place worthy deſert ſo great affection ſee liberally rewarded would vouchſafe courteſie come engliſh court report may ſend abiding leaue good opinion report sir quoth damoſels vertue alway reſident noble minde fameth knightly déeds throughout whole world neither enuy blot accident time haue power extinguiſh ſo may well eſtéemed happy hath ſo good champion defend honour princely offer find deſerts ſo ſimple loth preſume place ſéeke recompence yet preſence london may either profite pleaſure friend ready come deſirous wiſh v ſuch buſineſſe friend reduced former eſtate muſt néeds depart wherfore deſire voucheſafe v leaue lady quoth edward ſhould ſéem deny giuing conſent thereto ſhould boldneſſe blood would offer iniury haue deſerued ſay therefore ſhall thinke good depart may right willingly none gaine dare deny damoſels perceiuing great humanitie gentle prince failed giue courteous thanks according ſo taking leaue knight fortune prince went gate caſtle found two palfrys appointed mounted thereon returned place whence ancient man brought edward ſéeing al good readineſſe dramuſiande méetely ſtrongagaine offered caſtle knight fortune wold refuſe vpon condition day forward might called fort fortune ſo leauing pompides kéep departed al towards london accompanied dramuſiand bearing armour wherein combatted againſt knight fortune citizen admoniſhed coming long loſt priuce edward gathered themſelues ſuch heapes ſtréets prince could hardly paſſe without hurting ſome horſes preaſed ſée prince edward becauſe bene ſo long abſent ſome ſée giant dramuſiand maruelling knight fortune power conqure ſubdued ſo many thus paſſing arriued laſt court edward caſting eies princeſſe flerides chamber teares trickled downe chéekes remembring long time bene thence ſéene moſt honoured intirely loued ſéeing come againe laſt gentle behauiour ſhould recompence béene amiſſe quieted himſelfe leaſt ſhould behold amorous paſſions king fredericke entrance cour came receiued graciouſly giuing ſuch princely entertainment nobilitie birth hoyourable eſtate required edward dramuſiande laſt preſented themſelues maieſtie knéeling downe humbling himſelfe kiſſe hand prince began followeth soueraigne lord father either haue may find fauour highnes hand let time denied ſame entertaine giant cruell deſerts father euen moſt curteous friendly knight world king imbracing ſonne receiued armes ground bedeawing white heary beard aboundance teares meere loue ſhed preſence edward hée began anſwere manner ſon conceiuing ſo great deſire long time haue ſée could find heart deny thing ſhould require comming dramuſiande endeuoured kiſſe grace hand imbracing armes thus began intent ſhewe courteſie hath béene cauſe long continuing heauineſſe report ſonne hath made great bountie gentleneſſe hath conquered extremitie ſworne vſe vnto ſo hee would offer vexe way ſhould enemie ſo eſcape vnpuniſhed knight fortune humbling himſelfe preſence king caſt armes necke gréeting minde aſſure sir knight heauy ſorrowes endured long time ſhould ended valour hautie déedes armes ſo welcome grace liuing creature earth could ſoueraigne lord anſwered knight fortune haue done hath bin thorow god appointment whoſe power aſſiſting beyond deſert haue finiſhed aduenture pollicie could otherwiſe bring paſſe honor happy victory went al chiefe church london ſeruice accōpliſhed great ſolemnity returning pallace quéene princeſſe flerida receiued great bounty knight vſing ſuch courteous demeanour beſeemed roialty theyr perſons right glad haue ſight fayre princeſſe flerida vſing courteſie knight king lead quéene prince edward ſaying madame behold sonne haue wiſhed ſo long may leiſure make knowne vnto gréeuous paſſions abſence haue ſuffered deſire entertaine theſe noble prince great fauour way deuiſe greatly bound vnto conſidering danger haue paſſed finde sonne edward ſhewed noble primaleon ſhe went embracing armes gaue ſwéete kiſſe welcome like ſhe prince vernar king polendos recinde arnedes prince knight flerida comming brother primaleon imbraced armes theſe wordes let offenſiue noble brother haue ſtayed ſo long welcomming ought ſure glad comming lord edward made vnmindful body reaſon siſter allowed anſwered primaleon ſhould blame worthy eſtéemed among thoſe ſéeme profeſſe honour vertue king commanded lodging ſhould preſently prouided found euery point ſo royally adorned could ſpeake ſufficient praiſe court england thus ſtaied good engliſh court euery one deſirous returne owne dominion ſet ſuch thing order deputy failed deſire leaue court england becauſe thoſe left charge kingdomes dealt ſuch order ſubiects ready rebell againſt rightfull prince therefore thought ſooner departed leſſe time might allay trouble againe chap xliii trineus emperour allemaigne hearing happy deliuery prince caſtle dramuſiande left court empreſſe agriola trauailed till arriued england royally princely entertained report blazed countreyes prince knight béene ſo long time loſt could heard libertie aduenture great brittaine fully ended trinens emperour allemaigne ſpent dayes great ſorrowe grieuous complaint two sonnes vernar polinard vnderſtanding remained engliſh court heart ſuppriſed ſo great ioy bewraying intent hee determined trauaile till hee came england accompanied empreſſe agriola ſuch knight beſéemeth royall eſtate haue hée paſſed thorow germaine diuers city hée honourably receiued laſt landed coaſt england king fredericke knowledge comming emperour trineus wherefore commanded chamber ſhould prouided wherein empreſſe childhood talke ſuch time emperor palmerin came preſent ſeruice king england many noble eſtates prepared goe meete thrée mile citie london king accompanied vernar polinard came receiue citie rehearſe vnto royall gratious entertainment receiued king ſumptuous rare deuiſes fcamed citizen welcome withall would aſke greater time well ſtay ſo long diſcourſing hiſtory ſo great king fauour ſo liberall expences dutifull ſubiects ſaid within themſelues england fellow come pallace quéene princeſſe flerida gorgiouſly attyred againſt comming ſuch great state receiued ſuch royaltie ſpoken great honour conducted chamber retyring backe except vernar polinard ſons empreſſe commanded ſtay becauſe ſhée great deſire talke conferre knight determined themſelues prepare ſome notable ſhewes pleaſure wherewith might delight minde emperor might perceiue loſſe chriſtendome noble parent ſhould haue fortune determined continuall ſeruitude giant dramuſiande wrought meane grant libertie emperor agriola paſſed away time pleaſant communication heare aduentures noble son paſſed yet ſafely eſcape ſuch bitter plunge lauded fortune eſtéemed age happieſt time life would often declare agriola ſharpe aſſaults endured chamber amorous loue beſtowing affaire ſeruice wiſhing time againe wherein ſpent flouriſhing youth ſo valiantly knowing deſire vnpoſſible receuered delighted rehearſe pleaſant cenceits paſſed betweene well ſhe coy ſhe made acceptation courteſie ſhewd ſecret place danger full many time made hazard deſire ſpeake n • w conſidering ancient time cut ſuch fortune deliuered fdward primaleon captiue prince cruell enchanted caſtle eutropa dramuſiande argolant commandement king england departed voyage towards conſtantinople declare vnto emperour palmerin good ſucceſſe ſonne primaleon prince indeuoured himſelfe ſo well iourney thorow helpe good wind weather laſt attained end trauaile rode citïe eſpied emperour among great many souldiours whoſe beard growne ſo white anguiſh minde face ſo wanne reaſon continuall mourning ſtood doubt whether emperour certified thereof people made recourſe thorow ſtréetes told report giuen abroade soldans babylon perſia gathered mightie armie intending beſiege cittie made emperour owne perſon goe ſée fortifying walles rampiers defence might bée readie reſiſt enemie argolant comming emperour preſently knew alighted knéeling downe humbly kiſſed hand emperour thus ſpake may ſée argolant neceſſitie citie conſtantinople vnhappily falne time paſt hath vrged opinion neither warres could ſurplant treaſons inuade diſloyall accident vſe ſpight againſt ſuch alteration time ſo vncertaine fauour fortune famous monument moſt honour antiquitie ſoone ſubuerted weakeſt defence ſo remaineth ſay could iuſtly ſay haue béene happy ſuch danger threatened eſtate ſo doubtfull miſchance may ſuddainely annoy v subiects ſtand euery houre feare liues ſelfe diſpaire mine ſafety becauſe want thoſe whoſe name eare mine enemy hath carried great eſtimation hot reſiſtance abſent doe ouercharge cold comfort fareth thy soueraigne lord king • ngland demand tidings néedeleſſe ſuppoſe helpeleſſe ſhall like highneſſe highneſſe trifle time ſo long becauſe want one partner happy tydings faire bazilia whoſe heart right ſure thought abſence lord vernar long emperour ſuppoſing ſome glad tydings toward concerned one remaineth whether aliue yet fare otherwiſe well ſtate cannot endure without bearing company argolant replyed ſuch time gratious lord departed realme england left ſuch good diſpoſition himſelfe could friend left valour ſhould turne diſaduantage ſound trumpet prepared themſelues encountring one another ſuch knightly courage eſtates preſents ſuch whole multitude people attributed great cōmendation hardy exployt diſmounted one another either ſide doubtfull ſay company likeſt victory gracian ran fiercely againſt eutrope beltran engliſh knight great ſtrength well eſtéemed fortune turned backe towards day ſo could withſtand knightly puiſſance french prince platir encountred normant proude gaue ſuch colde welcome faine carry forth field like manner carlente ſped hand prince berolde conſequently engliſh knight albeit déeds iuſtly merite eternall commendation tilte tourney vrged repulſe becauſe grecian knight ſtronger ſide berolde breaking rankes vſing ſuch ſingular behauiour attempt greatly liked regardants came clariball hungaria ſetled themſelues ſtoutly againſt ech endured doutfull dangerous fight neither hauing aduantage ſuch equall condition paſſing betwéene emperour royall company greatly affected therewith king recinde albeit ſharpe ſtrokes sonne receiued vrged take ſome impatiently yet generall applauſe giuen vnto conſtrained thinke well valiant procéeding eutrope came aſſiſtance clariball accompanyed syr pridos archirin lābert roquendar rugerald flocandriſſe alberraz lamonſtrant brutamont againſt maintain quarrell prince berolde came gracian friſol luyman oniſtalde dram • tenebrant rouſel bazilliarde theſe behauing themſelues gallantly armes yet brunt weak reſiſt hot aſſaults valiant engliſh prince ſtil maintained freſh ſupply noble mind ſome doubt gaine ouerthrow ſuddenly entred field platir floraman francian germaine orleance vernar polinard others ſo began brauery fight well worthy paſt without notable praiſe engliſh knight came ſtill afreſh fiercely greciā knight néere conſtraint vrged retire behold ſudden aide grecian prince entred thrée ſtrange knight brauely mounted firſt bearing ſhield groūd ſand god satur • u compaſſed starres ſecond deuiſe gréene field image houſe sadnes • hird would haue shield knowne therefore bare couered theſe thrée ſéeing engliſh knight preuailed maruellouſly reſiſtance couched speares ran repaſte ſei • ed ſuch honorable comely order prince greatly loue court england againſt ſupper done king gaue charge knight ſhould prepare themſelues dancing done ſumptuous banquet ſhould preſently ſerued table dancing banquet finiſhed ſitting pleaſantly ieaſting one another entred hall thrée knight behaued themſelues ſo brauely tournament many deſired come néere becauſe would know whence hinder intent ſuch miſt ſudden aroſe hall light dimmed torch burned ſcarcely lady diſmaied caught knight armes put feare miſt departed hall cleare ſtraight way beheld middeſt lion tiger enduring great fight together ſet vnitie entred faire damoſell golden rod hand wherewith ſhe touched humbled themſelues féet done ſhee departed aroſe againe forme two fierce vntamed bulles cauſed ſuch aſtoniſhment beholder wiſhed themſelues foorth hall knight ſéeing lady ſo greatly diſcouraged perſwaded ſome deuiſe artificially prouided delight emperour would hardly beléeue becauſe two bulles fought ſo vehemently one againſt ouercharged wearines fight fell ground breathing mouthes horrible ougly blacke ſmoke hall auoided theſe accident ſame eſtate firſt might behold thrée knight head vnarmed ſo would haue ſhield known found gentle knight sauage man preſently went king kneeling downe kiſſed hand theſe word gracious soueraigne earneſtly intreate hand knight may receiue courteous entertainement grace afford requeſt sage aliart maieſties moſt affectionate ſeruant griefe hath ſo diſpleaſant thought himſelfe perfect quietneſſe till might manifeſt humble deuoite grace king fredericke often heard report sage aliart reaſon renowne fame ſpred abroad ſtoode doubt ſhould bee hée becauſe youthful yeeres much vnlikely embrace ſo great cunning learning euery famed neuertheleſſe giuing credit knight sauadge man hée embraced theſe ſalutations certainely ſir aliart bound duty make good account well vertuous dealing doth iuſtly deſerue alſo bringing fatherleſſe knight inſo ſound good diſpoſition health wherein haue onely honoured likewiſe approoued vnſpotted faith knighthood gracious lord anſwered aliart deſire haue manifeſt loialtie ſeruice vrgeth opinion might liue neuer ſo long could accompliſh ſo much duty doth require reſpecting great friendſhip haue found grace hand vndeſerued • vnder soueraigne pardon preſume diſcloſe ſo great ſecrete ſhall content highneſſe alſo illuſtrious aſſembly king ſuppoſing ſome glad tydings toward requeſted prince vouchſafe audience euery one quietly placed owne content aliart humbling himſelfe princeſſe flerida began followeth madame hard diſtinguiſh betwéene extreame griefes paſſed ſwéete ſolace enioy preſent albeit thought beyond compariſon yet time heauie wofull complaint equally vehement priuie aduerſe caſe could eaſily beare vrgent cauſe referring long diſcourſe matter eſtéeme ſelfe highly honoured leſſe hauty happy famous knight fortune ſake hath ſuffered annoiance paine recompence dangerous trauaile ſuſtained ſuch time deliuered two child vnfortunate forreſt lord left sauage man taken redoubted knight sonne florian brother ſacrifice rauenous iawes gréedy lion pittie ſo pierced heart poore louing wife ſhée ſaued bloody ſlaughter nouriſhed carefully ſhe owne childe madam let forgotten wordes ſir pridos rehearſed vnto ſuch time loſt huſband child reported ladie argonida loe inſtant promiſe accompliſhed noble lord edward reſtored two loſt ſonnes ſafe ſound recouered whoſe knightly valure hath ſufficiently diſcharged ſorrowe afflicted perſon ſuffered knight fortune sonne palmerin gaue name honour emperour palmerin father meanes knight polendos receiued ſon court likewiſe cauſed tearmed owne name aduenturous knight sauage man sonne according place birth called florian forreſt haue nouriſhed brought vp motherly care albeit knowen ſtraunger thus knit vp former ioy thought good preſume ſo farre make partner knowen onely god ſelfe princeſſe flerida edward wel viewing one ſuddenly rauiſhed ſuch inward ioy impoſſible giue iudgement thereon palmerin florian came imbraced moued king preſent vnto ſuch delight could conceale great pleaſure conceiued whereupon king entred theſe word truſt syr aliart theſe newes altogether vnlookt preſent albeit haue béene earneſtly deſired long time yet doe fauour certifie aſſured haue giuen foorth manifeſt troth may ſome dare hardly aduenture beléeue ſhould good lord anſwered aliart fable ſuch caſe well worthy ſuch ſeuere puniſhment due ſhould falſely informe prince neuertheleſſe giue better aſſurance thereof marke ſhall enſue anſwere ſatiſfied drewe hée foorth little booke whereon hauing read prettie sauage man wife entred hall nouriſhed palmerin florian ſo long theyr caue preſently two prince beholding went imbraced great courteſie like siluian hauing learned ciuility court remained father caue knéeled downe vnto duetie princeſſe flerida receiued ſuch excéeding ioy ſhée imbraced louingly palmerin thinking great diſhonour vnmindfull nurſes vſed ſo gently tooke hand brought king giuing vnderſtand twain deſerued good reward recompence great affection brother found hand king taking ground armes promiſed labour ſhould honorably rewarded ſo lifting eye vp heauen vttered ioy manner heauenly father laſt good happe euer deſired ſée wherefore thy pleaſure take miſerable world vnconſtant fortune determine miſchance done tooke two nephew brought princeſſe flerida humbled themſelues knées kiſſed hand great many time ſhe caſting armes necke teares remembred great danger ſhe ſaw endured bloody combate ſuch time ſhee faine ſet vnitie prince vſed many friendly ſpéeches like manner empreſſe agriola king recinde arnedes prince lady whoſe ioyes ſmall happy ſucceſſe palmerin vſed great courteſie prince primaleon vnderſtood father lady miſtreſſe polinarda sonne emperor grandfather vouchſaued honour dnring time remained pallace conſtantinople sauage man wife graciouſly entertained ſéeing two prince dignity beyond expectation caue greatly reioyce fortune ſo fauourably preſerued noble liues palmerin ſéeing time euery one prepared themſelues chamber commanded siluian conduct father mother faire rich chamber prouided euery one departing king accompanyed aliart chamber deſired know knight came company pleaſe grace anſwered aliart morrow morning ſhall reſolued vttermoſt meane ſpace aſſure ſelfe ſuch one valour deſerueth remembred amongſt moſt renowned thus generall gladneſſe euery one went take reſt forgetting gréefe paſſed remembrance fortunate ſucceſſe happened inſtant determination ioy chap xlviii morrow blandidon knowne aliart bewraied himſelfe pompides sonnes prince edward argonida lady enchāted iſle emperour trineus prince determined depart court england deſired firſt goe ſee caſtle giant dramuſiande wherein prince remained priſoners ſo long time pleaſures court aged king england prince palmerin florian brother cittizens paſſed away night merrily making great bonefires ringing bel manifeſt ioy likewiſe conceiued happy accident morning king went chamber two nephewes found primaleon prince vernar merrily diſpoſing themſelues together ſo accompanied arnedes recinde went chamber emperour trineus béeing already ſtirring prepared themſelues go heare diuine seruice accompliſhed maruailous great ſolemnitie returned vn pallace ſuch aſſembly people ſée two prince could hardly aſcend ſtaires great hall people gathered ſuch preaſe ſtrange prince endcucured themſelues entertaine sage aliart honourably ſo highteſt loweſt greatly made account inſomuch euery one thought labour well imployed ſeruice euery one deſir • u queſtion florian guarantized wound receiued caſtle dramuſiande dinner ended went chamber empreſſe agriola quéene princeſſe flerida dined king deſiring ſilence placed began order sage aliart let ſéeme diſpleaſant vnto good sir preſume remember promiſe made yeſternight alſo deliuer doubt haue conceiued ſelfe may requeſt ſo much fauour tell whence becauſe great cunning ſcience haue heard doth argue diſcended ſome noble linage demand aliart preſently returned anſwer determined déere soueraigne neuer bewray ſelfe auy ſince maieſtie hath commanded whoſe word force compell prince potentate may conſtraine certifie neither friend foe could yet get knight whoſe name deſirous know called blandidon concerning birth parentage prince florian large giue vnderſtand cauſe paſſe furder diſcouer touching ſelf knight named pompides ſelfe brother v ſonnes prince edward argonida lady enchanted iſle hath béene affirmed v oath diuerſe edward ſitting beloued flerida loath conceale thing might profite caſe humbling himſelfe king father began followeth deare father sir aliart hath deliuered grace muſt auouch moſt true sonnes wherefore deſire entertaine nephewes ſwéete flerida let ſéene diſliked becauſe long entred acquaintance ſuch craftie deuices argonida vſed perill life pleaſure alſo company theſe twaine fruit long familiar labour king came aud imbraced louingly preſently florian inſtant requeſt declared hautis exploytes knightly déedes hée tryed found noble blandidon flerida forgaue lord edward offence ſmyling ſubtill inuentions argonida vſed gaine deſire ſhe bare engliſh prince immediately aliart pompides came ſubmitted themſelues ſhée welcommed hartily béene owne child ſo continued pleaſantly talking till time required ſhould depart chamber palmerin england held y• sage aliart great eſtimation perceiued allyed kindred ſo altogether framed delight company would attempt thing ſhould priuie triumphes ſumptuous feaſtes continued daily aboundantly euery night marking dauncing rare deuiſes put execution ſo grecian knight highly honoured lady england whoſe braue geſture courtly entertainement onely eſtéemed much commended returne court conſtantinople long continuance excéeding ioy arnedes recinde concluded depart kingdomes leauing ſonnes accompany prince pleaſure emperour perceiuing determined iourney towards allemaigne alſo prepared themſelues take leaue edward prince deſired vouchſafe paine ſée caſtle dramuſiande wherein ſo long time béene kept priſoners requeſt pleaſed emperor well ſo deſired arnedes recinde beare company alſo would depart together intreaty quickly wonne ſo morrow departed themſelues thither accompanied lady gentleman engliſh court greatly longed ſée caſtle ſo much ſpoken cauſed great brittaine ſtand ſuch feare proweſſe noble palmerin brought ſubiection chap xlix emperour trineus king england prince lady rode towards caſtle dramuſiande way ſaw caue sauage man wherein two prince beene ſo long time nouriſhed way rode sage aliart preſented many rare braue deuiſes vntill ſuch time arriued caſtle met ſtrange knight honor beautie lady miragarda iuſted diuers prince departed againe thence vnknowne sage aliart diſcouered palmerin england name whence morning knight behaued themſelues ſo worthily triumph prouiding new rich armor made great haſte becauſe would bee ready goe giant drauſiande onely becauſe would gratifie lady bearing company ſée caſtle departure foorth london king ſound trumpet heralde cauſed proclaimed citizen ſhould offer follow becauſe hée determined ſo many themſelues none ſhould enter caſtle lady knight night hée concluded lye forreſt therefore ſent ſuch prouiſion tent pauillions arriued found euery thing owne contentment princeſſe flerida deſirous ſport ſelfe forreſt walking place ſhée ſuffered extreame panges trauayle sauage man came humbled himſelfe vnto declaring place tooke two prince nouriſhed coue néere adioyning report knight deſirous ſée caue ſo taking leaue princeſſe walked thither primaleon maiortes soldane bellagris entred began euery one greatly amazed ſéeing caue containe ſo large breadth length made ſuppoſe manner intricate de dalus walles hanged tapiſtrie gold silke caddis ſuch maner ſtuffe ſkinnes beaſtes two prince ſlaine finely laboured artificiall frame ſo decked foorth chamber knight marueyled ſo deſart place finde ſuch fayre dwelling great ſtood debating one another ſtrange conceyts perceiued caue made iudge time paſt béene ſolitary dwelling ſome noble man exiled countrey therein greatly deceyued ancient edifice erected enchantreſſe mellia kept place great raigne king armace brother vrganda ſhe liued one time rehearſed hiſtory emperour splandian sonne valiant moſt magnificient king amadis prince oriana wife quéene great brittaine prince knight ſatiſfied mindes beholding place returned pauillions lady welcommed louingly primaleon ſitting downe ſiſter flerida rehearſed manner caue two prince nouriſhed little content minde place ruinated put obliuion night repoſed themſelues forreſt honourably ſerued béene engliſh court morning prepared themſelues towards caſtle way delighted ſuch fiue deuiſes ſent cunning sage aliart euery one tooke great pleaſure princely iourney hunter purſued wilde bore hart buck ſuch noble game came wearily falling downe lady feete offered touch preſently ſkipping farder ſide riuer theſe deuiſes ſo pleaſed emperor company gaue great thankes aliart frequented ſuch pleaſant paſtime al way rode laſt arriued valley perdition ſight caſtle dramuſiande went ſomewhat heart princeſſe flerida ſéeing priſon wherein louing edward ſo long remained emperour trineus king frederick fel great commendation ſumptuous building caſtle often ſéene fayrer mooued thē intreate dramuſiande founder ſuch ſingular péece workmanſhip demand dramuſiande preſently gaue reply gratious lord caſtle firſt builded mine aunt eutropa meanes hath remayned thus long knowledge truſt ſaid emperour trineus fortreſſe ſuch ſtrength beautie ought hand one could imploy ſuch great abuſe commonly ſée wicked thriue well good enioyas great account world maintaine action iuſtice equitie riding laſt dramuſiande willed ſuddaine ſtay began manuer vnfold cauſe think ſée entrance bridge ſéemly knight ready appointed iouſt perceiue body offereth reſiſtance maketh ſupoſe hath attempted kéepe paſſage vnlooked accident ſtayed behold knight well mounted gray courſer armour ſpotted white blacke greatly pleaſed eye beholder ſhéeld ba • e naked body lady beauty whoſe countenance ſo excellently figured altea floraman accompliſhed ſuch chiualricus déeds conſtantinople might ſéeme offer compariſon beautifull ſpectacle neither faire princeſſe polinarda might preſume equall ſelfe braue ſhape lady lower end ſhéeld letter gold written miragarda prince occupied eye beholding ſingular forme compacted ſhéeld perceiued eſquire come towards done dutie began ſalute theſe proteſtations faire lord lady noble knight maiſter behold bridge giueth vnderſtand cauſe trauailes vnto place far countrey whence aduentured himſelfe honour good fortune command lady whoſe humble ſeruant remayneth houre try knighthood caſtle hath béene blazed abroad moſt infortunate arriued aduertiſed enchantment fully finiſhed ſtrength giant dramuſiande retinew conquered valour hautie prowes knight named palmerin england hath deliuered prince kept captiue cruell meanes diſloyall eutropa newes moſt welcome vnto deſired nothing yet loth returne lady place knighthood hath bene tryed paſſe backe againe approued craueth enter iouſt ſuch diſpoſed referring combate sword becauſe aduenture pleaſure challenge encreaſed ſuch courage knight entred ſtrife ſhould firſt runne ſtrange knight king perceuing returned eſquire anſwer friend tell thy lord enterpriſe worthy perpetuall renowne containe ſuch courage proofe meſſage himſelfe giueth ſhow lady ſhall haue occaſion vſe according valiant attempt deſerueth eſquire receiuing king pleaſure returned lord ſooner made knowne tremoran ſhewed himſelfe bridge inuiting ſtrange knight iouſt ſtayed accompliſh deſire encountring ſuch pleaſant charge tremoran forced leaue ſaddle chance ſomewhat diſpleaſed luyman burgondie thinking reuenge repulſe tremoran ſent himſelfe kéepe company belcar deſirous ſhew proweſſe among young knight couched speare againſt ſtrange knight ſent horſe man ground preſently roſuell tooke cauſe hand made pertaker ſame miſhap like manner guerin friſol blandidon floraman diuers ſerued moued king polendos vnto ſuch choller would haue ventured againſt ſtrange knight prince edward perſwaded contrary went great murmuring amongſt knightes ſuppoſed sage aliart brought champion art diſgrace vnto attempt vſed ſuch meanes vnto might vanquiſhed herein greatly deceiue themſelues onely noble force knight continually animated beholding faire face ladie ſo brauely proportioned ſhield floraman greatly bent againſt knight beléeuing victorie procéeded beauty lady would put fortune hazard thinking feature faire altea ſoueraigne authoritie ſtrange miragarda wherevpon thus began conferre himſelfe albeit madame haue ſuffered name abſent thought yet hath beautie bene alwayes extant memory ſo neuer vowed title although miſhap would haue vrged contrary wherefore time let beautie ſo fauour may foyle mine enemy perfect honour fame encountred one another againe couragiouſly paſſing firſt courſe breake staffe ſecond time floraman stéede throwne ground violently making recourſe former ſecrete spéeches began thus perceiue altea miſfortune chanceth thorow froward opinion mée attempt honour repay ſtill hatred vrge forſake ſeruice neuer aſſay thing hereafter warrant courteſie emperour trineus prince ſad behold ſorrowe floraman alſo ſée oniſtalde pompides reduced like miſchance whereat ſtrange knight triumphed florian ſtomaking ſee friend euery ſide foyled knight vant himſelfe ſuch ſort giuing conge empreſſe lady ranne violently againſt ſtrange knight thrée time met yet neither preuayling againſt ſtrange knight looking shielde perceyuing faire face lady ſomewhat raiſed speare began order talke himſelfe execute ſelfe diſhonour haue receiued ſuffering faire face polluted owe moſt dutifull affection neither preuaile againſt hath done endure long combate ſo attached ſorrow fourth attempt met ſo furiouſly together layde along earth becauſe night approched ſo faſt palmerin could compaſſe meane enter iuſt made ſuppoſe hée ſhould diſpleaſe fayre polinarda aliart put opinion came theſe wordes good syr let ſéeme offenſiue becauſe haue iuſted knight valoure ſhould returne diſaduantage lady miſtreſſe would thinke great vngentleneſſe thanke syr aliart anſwered palmerin courteous perſwaſion wiſhing might hurt albeit vnknowen vnto yet arte made manifeſt may requeſt name knight wherein may make mee greatly beholding alſo cauſe vſe circumſpection mine attempt wherein onely deſire eſcape anger lady polinarda queſtion aliart ſhaped reply courteſie ſuch ſo great mine affection cannot conceale thing may doe pleaſure wherefore ſhall vnderſtand knight named florendos putteth noble déedes proofe honour whoſe image may perceiue figured shielde euen hazard action purchaſe fauour lady siſter theſe word palmerin imbraced aliart giuing hartie thankes ſatiſfied earneſt deſire vowed kéepe ſecrete diſcouer florian mounted horſebacke againe ſomewhat offended receiued better ſucceſſe againſt ſtrange knight perceiued eſquire ryding away great haſt loath knowne becauſe ſped according hauty deſire cauſe hee departed ſmall ſorrowe chap l ſtrange knight departed sage aliart bewraied faire miragarda entred caſtle dramuſiande palmerin gaue againe giant friend honour cauſed bee called inuincible fort fortune departing thence aliart brought caſtle obſcure valley ſhewed many rare ſtrange deuices whence king recinde arnedes taking leaue emperour king england departed home country emperor prince iourney court england edward diſcouered soldane bellagris blandidon ſonne begotten ſorrowfull lady pandritia ſtrange knight ſpéedy departure emperour prince ceaſſed commend redoubted enterpriſe greatly deſiring know made importunate ſo sage aliart laboured vaine would matter ſatiſfie deſire prince primaleon hee told ſecret hée perſonage great authoritie whoſe valour excellent vertue equally thereto apparant ladie whoſe portraite vſed shéeld bare ſuch affection would nothing diſobey cauſeth abſent himſelfe company till hée haue attained title lady deſireth himſelfe deſerueth ſatiſfie lady pleaſure hath ventured life arriue place thinking aduenture dramuſiande reſerued perceiued already finiſhed proweſſe knight voweth humble ſeruice could honour proffer iouſt cauſe know bountie courage ſufficient haue enterpriſed ſuch hautie pecillous aduedture eward deſired ſhew name damoſell vowed ſuch earneſt affection whoſe aliart loth gaine ſay beganne order anſwer requeſt lady knight hath vowed ſeruice named euery one faire miragarda whoſe face would take occaſion contempleate ſhould behold perfect rare ſubſtantiall image beauty concerning birth ſhe daughter countie arla • great authoritie dominion spaine whoſe ſinguler forme knight beheld could chuſe thruſt himſelfe among pykes hazard inſomuch none hath ſeene could withdraw effections haue aduentured limme life beyond compariſon truſt ſaid king recinde haue bene well acquainted county himſelfe ſuch exquiſite perfection remaine daughter neuer time could gaine knowledge indéede left kingdome spaine ſhe ſo litle none make account beautie alighting horſes taking lady one hand entred caſtle dramuſiande ſo greatly delighted ſumptuous building braue conueyance commodious place gallery chamber made ouer ſuch little fine brooke riuers • magined commendation ſufficient place dramuſiande endeuoured himſelfe entertainment according time yéere ſuddaine comming would permit ſuch good order euery thing diſpoſed fine neate excellent quicke diſpatch prince well pleaſed dramuſiande accordingly thanked next morning concluded depart thence becauſe princeſſe flerida become ſomewhat ſickly palmerin deliuered caſtle againe dramuſiande reuerence worthineſſe memorie owne good lucke called inuincible force fortune departing thence sage aliart conducted way habitation frequenting ſtill ſuch ſinguler deuiſes lady weake nature ſomewhat diſmaied prince themſelues maruellouſly delighted arriued obſcure valley behold caſtle sage aliart ſo ingeniouſly edified ſtrengthened ſo ſure induſtrie ſhould ſtay recite opinion hereon ſhould weary mind tedious diſcourſe ſtayed ſpace foure dayes hauing ſuch royall ſeruice meanes aliart ſuppoſed owne court vnpoſſible bee princely ſerued arnedes recinde deſirous owne kingdomes tooke leaue emperour company one taking way towards france towards spaine hauing body ech one eſquire attending sonnes left ſtill prince yeares fit endure trauaile yet incline themſelues eaſe world returned emperor king frederick reſt traine engliſh court emperour faire agriola tooke leaue likewiſe ſuch greefe either ſide departure becauſe iudgements ſufficient conceiue ceaſſe ſpeake soldane bellagaris maiores hauing kiſſed hand king fredericke came embraced prince edward whoſe ſake left country partner impriſonment prince accompanying part way began order soldane bellagris truſt syr ſo baſe memory remember pleaſure vnder colour name receiued siſter law pandritia realme lacedemonia lady cauſe cannot admit obliuion labour growne ſuch knightly iſſue aſſure ſelfe knight named blandidon ſonne vntill time haue kept ſecret yet thought diſcouer time place required becauſe ſhould amend default faith paſſed vnder ſuppoſition ſelfe wherfore brother long ſince dead people ſorowfull auſtere kinde life ſhall manifeſt honour eſpouſe laſt beſide ſhall enioy princeſſe excellent beautie sonne highly eſtéemed knightly bountie bellagris pauſed hereon prettie debating minde qualitie enterpriſe ſuppoſed craue déeper iudgement remembrance offence done paſt laſt hauing remained mute good ſpace required prince edward anſwer credite sir neuer amazed thing either fortune hath ſent miſchance mine owne folly accident report haue vouchſafed diſcloſe farre thought natiue country neuertheleſſe make ſuch eſtimation blandidon accompt ſelfe happy haue ſuch sonne affection beare wil accompliſh elſe neuer thought haue done hereupon bid hartily farewell vowing ſend word procéeding ſo ſhortly poſſible may thus departed soldane bellagris maiortes accompanied polendos belcar vernar loue faire bazilia called home conſtantinople shortly prince primaleon left engliſh court trauailing alone himſeife without company becauſe hee meant trie aduentures fortune could way preſent vnto ſparing perſon would ieopard himſelfe place moſt perill danger knowing well life loyalty couragious ought imploied defence miſaduenture kept reſtraint terror time ſorrowfull ſeruitude chap li primaleon departed court england arriued realme lacedemonia intended viſite ſorrowfull lady pandritia triſtfull valley met knight behaued himſelfe ſo well iuſt caſtle dramuſiande behalfe beautie lady miragarda hauing giuen himſelfe name knight twaine entred dangerous combate till pandritia lady faine come ſet vnitie primaleon knowledge ſonne florendos primaleon hauing left engliſh court taken
