himſelfe honour good fortune made little ſtay place till hee arriued kingdome lacedemonia forgetting laſt conference ſorrowfull lady pandritia touching manner ſolitarie sauage kinde life concluded viſite againe try ſhée continued former conſtancie becauſe ſome either vpon mallice miſbeliefe haue reported condition woman lincked vnconſtancie certaintie might repoſed dealing wept wantonneſſe ſmilde ſubtilty ſo teares full treaſon pleaſant conceyts mired ſpightful attempt opinion gentlewoman farre thought noble sexe ſo farre wiſh diſliking miſconſtruing ſaying long rode primaleon without aduenture worthy rehearſall till laſt come triſtfull valley knight entred preſently conuinced ſadneſſe eſpied two horſes comming caſtle pandritia one hée knew belong knight maintained iuſt caſtle dramuſiande made ſomewhat amazed ſée wander without maiſter laſt caſting eye hee eſpied knight ſetting behinde trée attyred blacke armour hand shielde portraite lady whereto hée vſed many amorous complaint primaleon deſirous heare alighted deliuering horſe eſquire drewe néere vnto knight ſo farre rauiſhed beholding lady counterfaite perceiued comming primaleon thinking body néere continued diſcourſes manner madame deſire hath ſight ſwéete face quallified meanes till come againe preſence happy may eſtéeme themſelues onely haue continuall view heauenly beauty partaker incomparable courteſie ſufficient inueigle mindes god hath larger force intrap heart earthly gallant often doe imbrace picture vnfained heart powre foorth complaint middeſt miſhaps liuing nobilitie name elephant doeth ayre reioycing shrine god knowes far ſubſtance oh florendos borne great happineſſe thou eſtéeme thy parentage brought infinite miſhaps thine owne perſwaſion thou doeſt contemplate thought without end beginneſt loue endeth likeing thée well mayſt thou call thy ſelfe miragarda good occaſion gaue thée name poore heart hath paide indifferently ſhall thou vſe rigor continuing theſe great many ſuch like ſpéeches primaleon well knew ſonne florendos whoſe gréeuous paſſions cauſed call memory like ſorrowes himſelfe endured ſpent trauayles princeſſe gridonia wherefore drawing néere vnto would yet take knowledge ſaluted theſe tearmes sir knight would impart ſome gréefes ſorroweth ſée ouercharged ſuch heauineſſe truly sir aunſwered triſtfull knight receiue ſuch contentation troubled thought haue vſed ſo long good liking would bée loath ſhould priuie paſſions onely ſelfe alway welcome make ſelfe ſo hardy diſturbe contended exerciſe certainly dare expect either force repent diſcourteſie bring vaſſaile lady miſtreſſe calling eſquire arme primaleon mounted preſently horſebacke ſo greatly offended sonnes word would make anſwer ſtayed comming pretty way triſtfull knight ready prouided bethought himſelfe vngentle wordes came vnto primaleon theſe ſpéeches sir knight pardon pray haue forgotten ſelfe towards aſſuring ſorry wordes gaue choller tuſh sir anſwered primaleon nothing may vſe talke pleaſe prouide ſelfe determined trie courage becauſe would attempt giue dare theſe word couched speares deliuered either ſide ſuch force triſtfull knight ſent earth primaleon bearing company becauſe girts saddle broken either greatly abaſhed drew sword charged one another fierce ſtrokes primaleon vſing pittie vnto ſonne hacked armour eagerly bene greateſt enemy world may perceiue furie little regardeth fréendſhip affinitie ſo extreame father childe ſtretcheth beyond reaſon limit nature long fight dangerous either part armour ſpoyled body ſore wounded ſtrengths ſo much altered one would haue ſuppoſed death next remedie withdrawing themſelues pauſe little caſt eye vpon houſe sadneſſe window couered blacke pandritia damoſels ſt •• behold combate great gréefe ſée two champion endure ſo long primaleon greatly afflicted behold ladyes alſo angred hautie courage ſonne ſtayed hand entred theſe ſpéeches sir knight trie inſtant portraite lady ſtand néed deuotions vſe vnto deliuer hand ſhe faile beyond expectation ſhall know vaine ſpend time ſuch fooliſh cogitation truſt ſir replyed triſtfull knight ſtood néed ayde make reſiſtance againſt thinke ſhe would willingly grant thereto witleſſe moue ſuch raſh preſumption ere long haue doubt ſhall déerely know price fought good againe primaleon ſéeing ſore wound giuen ſonne beganne rue daungerous eſtate whereupon vſed theſe ſpéeches following thinke beſt sir knight leaue weapon end combat ſome louing word may returne greater honour ſo ſéeke ſpoile one anothers life ſo sir ſayd triſtfull knight firſt might haue remedied miſhappe ſéeing would eſtéeme ſelfe thinkes ſcorne graunt time talke pandritia came foorth caſtell accompanied damoſelles deſirous pacifie daungerous ſtrife wherein perceyued theſe two champion remaine ſo primaleon ſeeing courteſie pandritia left triſtfull knight thus ſaluted madame truſt ere long ſhall receiue contentation griefe firſt entrance caſtle cannot welcome hath alwaies bin deſired sir anſwerered pandrita pardon becauſe haue knowledge good wil giue harty thāks vrged great diſtreſſe ſée make entreatance would leaue combate vpon report name may without blemiſh mine honour ſhall enter caſtell doe beſt relieuing weake eſtate credite madame ſayd primaleon haue ſo earneſtly deſired doe ſeruice haue ſpared trauaile perſon farre countrey bring ſuch tydings hope ſhall agrée good nature becauſe ſhall remaine ſuſpition giue vnderſtand called primaleon sonne famous emperor conſtantinople triſtfull knight heard theſe wordes ouercome ſuch extreame ſorrow heauineſſe becauſe entred combat father primaleon much adoe ſuſtaine himſelfe prince ſéeing came theſe word florendos let grieuous motion ſéeme abate courage knowledge fell combat hath paſſed franke fréely forgiue glad haue tryed right ſuch reputation triſtfull knight knéeling downe great humility kiſſing father hand hée ſuſtained graciouſly armes great ſalutations paſſed betwéene pandritia glad ſée prince primaleon conducted houſe sadneſſe lodged goodly chamber wound attended lady diligent louing reſpect chap lii primaleon triſtfull knight healed wound receiued combat courteous entertainment ſorrowfull lady pandritia ſtaied little ſpace primaleon certifying happy deliuery prince edward departed thence prince toward conſtantinople triſtful knight iourney towards spaine pandritia likewiſe theſe ioyfull riding left houſe sadneſſe went garden damoſels primaleon prince vernar arriued conſtantinople soldan bellagris ſent meſſenger emperor gaue vnderſtand dealing soldan babilon ſtaid army contend certaine lord dominion rebelled entred armes againſt floredos triſtfull knight noble father prince primaleon made abode ſpace certaine dayes carefull caſtle ſolitary pandritia ſo carefully viſited feeble eſtates ſo louingly tendered ſhort time recouered perfect health time primaleon certified proſperous ſucceſſe prince fdward ſhe verily ſuppoſed dead long ſo ſhée conceiued ſuch great delight report requeſt prince left houſe sadneſſe returned manſion named garden damoſels vſing pleaſant conceit great ſhe might ſuffer thinke primaleon hauing borne company longer willingly hee would declared name knight priſoners edward alſo manner happy deliuerance accompanied triſtful knight tooke leaue ſhe loath ſhould depart ſo ſoone perſwaded earneſt affayres gaue courteſie ſo left twaine thus ryding together triſtfull knight deſired father hée might leaue company becauſe affection lady directed trauaile spaine denying ſonnes requeſt becauſe himſelfe minded ryde alone ende hee might make better proofe valour imbraced one another triſtfull knight riding towards whoſe ſwéete ſake liued great affliction anguiſh minde time wée leaue returne prince primaleon encountring aduenture time come conſtantinople whereas full often wiſhed himſelfe becauſe heard soldanes army ſuch force cauſed whole empire ſtand great feare primaleon entred citie kept cloſe beuere becauſe would knowne intended come ſuddainly vpon friend wold make better welcome come y• pallace hauing deliuered horſe eſquire went vp great hall ſame armour vſed againſt triſtfull knight much defaced blowes receiued cauſing great aſtoniſhment preſent gaue way come emperour knéeling downe deſiring haue empreſſe lady preſent would diſcourſe 〈◊〉 highneſſe happened lately england emperour deſirous heare yet knowing receiued ground ſaying honour place whence came ſhould make great deale better welcome ſo conducted empreſſe chamber good hap princeſſe gridonia polinarda bazilia preſent emperor tooke occaſion begin thus faire lady knight commeth court england would declare meſſage vntil ſuch time might come preſence deſireth ſhewe ambaſſage wiſh otherwiſe thinke becauſe tariance ſonne primalaon whoſe abſence ſmall cauſe heauineſſe emperour ſate downe lady primaleon began behold earneſtly becauſe perceyued growne great alteration eſpecially emperour father whoſe countenance much changed ſaw laſt prince gridonia greatly offended faire face continuall mourning ſhée vſed abſence lord ſo generally beholding ſtaying ſpeaking indifferent long ſpace great amazing emperor alſo company courtly lady laſt vnclaſped beuer began order deſire gratious father pardon long ſilence alſo great time mine abſence royall court hauing meſſage preſent good health noble friend england alſo sonne primaleon humbleth himſelfe gratious preſence emperor ſuddenly wrapt ſuch inward ioy y• great time remained trance like maner empreſſe gridonia polinarda al lady came running altogether imbraced ſuch ioy impoſſible giue iudgement thereon hée vſed curteſie al princeſſe bazilia came kiſſed hand ſaid faire siſter feare lord vernas long abſēt himſelfe frō ſhal haue right ſoon dare warrant vnarmed emperour could ſatiſfie himſelfe till heard ioyfull newes lately chanced england vnderſtood palmerin ſonne prince edward daughter flerida receiued great contentation nouriſhed company princeſſe polinarda concealed ioy one dramacian excepted whō ſhe accuſtomed diſcloſe ſecrets great pleaſure returne primaleon noble gentleman cittie came dayly welcome greater content within prince vernar great many prince knight greece arriued court whoſe company ſo long deſired ioyfully hartily embraced middeſt great triumphing ſolace meſſenger ſent soldane belagris preſented himſelfe emperour diſcloſed meſſage manner illuſtrious prince soldan bellagris lord maſter humble duty kiſſeth hand excellency giuing vnderſtand ſo ſoone arriued court aduertiſed soldon babilō hauing great puiſſant armie prepared himſelfe ouerrunne country empire make generall ſpoile people dominion eſtate weakned loſſe thoſe knight haue left court ſéek aduentures great brittain taking ship army poynt hoyſe ſailes word preſently brought certaine lord realme leuied number owne ſubiects enter armes againſt able longer ſuffer oppreſſing tyranny vpon occaſion ſtayed armie bring obeyſance béene ſo hardie rebell againſt thing hardly without loſſe 20000 pagan ſhall finiſh thou intendeth viſite might preuent lord thus willed make knowne vnto wiſhing ſée houre death imperiall eſtate ſhould way diſtreſſed gramercy good friend ſaid emperour inſtant perceiue great good wil soldane thy lord hath alwaies borne vnto pray thée commend honourable thankes proteſting much god forbid ſtand like néede thinke beſt take reſt becauſe hauing endured ſo long trauail cannot elſe chuſe ſore laboured yet firſt deſire thée rehearſe fareth thy lord ſince coming home lord anſwered meſſenger euer ſince arriual hath delighted diſcourſe ſtrange aduentures long ſince brought ende great brittaine rare know highneſſe hath heard wherfore néed reherſe ſay true quoth emperour aſſure ſelfe impriſonment engliſh prince edward cauſe caſtle dramuſiande remaine perpetuall renowned memory thus concluding talke emperour went empreſſe chamber preſence lady rehearſed meſſage soldan bellagris morrow meſſenger departed bearing emperours letter lord court citizen repleniſhed great ioy filled heauineſſe ſtood feare armie soldan babylon chap liii hiſtory diſcourſeth large triſtfull knight hee departed conſtantinople company prince knight went purſue ſearch prince edward occaſion ill weather ſcas landed vpon coaſt spaine trauaile came caſtle giant almarol became enamoured faire miragarda whoſe loue foyled giant kept paſſage great honour picture▪ becauſe authour hath made mention prince florendos preſent tearmeth himſelfe triſtfull knight endeuoured himſelfe likewiſe ſearch edward well excuſe owne negligence alſo fauour hard fortune knight trauayle ſhall bée perfectly reſolued procéedings ſuch time departed conſtantinople company diuers knight purſued prince primaleon euery one taking contrary way courſe directed hauen sea imbarking himſelfe merchant england time occaſion ſo ſerued tooke departure hauing endured ſo long ſeas knew themſelues within ken england ſuddaine contrarie winde came vpon held ſuch danger betwéene hope feare laſt great hazard liues chanced vpon coaſt spaine tooke landing rocke day called lisbone florendos ſéeing himſelfe ſo farre place whither directed courſe would haue ſo gladly attained rode ouercharged extreme heauines complaining fortune vnlucky trauaile paſſed prouince portingall hautie chiualrie obtained generall commendation happened come riuer theſin ryding contemplating amorous thought eſpied goodly caſtle ſcituated vpon rocke gaue great occaſion pleaſure behold caſtle vrged aduance courſe thither lay blocke way great let former pretence vnder gréene ſhade rode perceiued three lady ſuch ſingular beautie life time ſuppoſed neuer haue ſéene like theſe lady continued ſerious diſcourſe among themſelues ſo tooke héede arriuall florendos gaue great good liking eſpecially ſhée ſat middeſt twaine ſhewed great reuerence moſt ſtately beautie alſo ſingular erquiſite behauiour ſhall ſay florendos enamoured faire ſpectacle hee could well eſchew bird faſt caught fowler ſnare liked better moſt honour heartily loue ſo hee changeth mirth mones talke teares whole cogitation louers complexion aiming whole courſe affection lady whoſe face power detaine fréedom behauiour operation chiefe ſtarre within compaſſe sphere still ſtroue himſelfe goe backe againe ſhun blaze ſet fire ſences affection hung ſuch clog conceit one looke brought heart ſuch labyrinth ariadne thread could good ſaint giuen glaunce remained theſe muſes ſuch occaſion lady receiued leaue field walke caſtle gaue ſuch vnkind corſey heart florendos mind ſome outrage yea ſooner gone fell ſuch rigorous accuſations againſt himſelfe partly becauſe timeritie withheld ſpeaking againe neceſſary cauſe haue mooued ſpeech ſo betwéene one euē man diſtraught wit began feele ſeuerall accident loue imprinteth heart thoſe delight dally vnder banner little ſon goddeſſe citherea pierce déepe aiming ſhaft hardy enemie enter launce ſo confeſſed himſelfe bee ſuretie bullet flew eares beautie ſent charge warre againſt eies able houre power ſpace yeere well ſad walked caſtell finding gate ſhut hee fell former agony fortune caſting eye aſide hee beheld shéeld hanging wall wherin liuely giuen view portrait lady miſtreſſe hart iudged handled ſuch perfection wanting nothing reſemblance perſon vnder ſhéeld golden letter artificially written name miragarda whereby florendos verily ſuppoſed belonged iuſtly deſerued becauſe beautie merit viewed would likewiſe inuegle heart ſtouteſt durſt conceiue hardineſſe themſelues come place abode yet thoſe letter placed tent purpoſe aduertiſe ſuch knight took occaſion trauaile way carefull themſelues feare giant almarol lord caſtle kept shéeld behalfe faire miragarda againſt knight durſt preſume take thence florendos ſtood vſing thouſand amorous deuotions ſingular picture eſpyed giant come forth caſtle armed iacke azier leſſe faire ſtrong mounted ſturdy blacke courſer florendos began vſe theſe word credit ſir knight myſtery theſe letter hath gottē ſuch maiſtery feare repent firſt ſaw fortune ſo much enemy conduct place truſt anſwered florendos fauour portrait ſtand feare thy puiſſance regard ſwéete face owes reſpect theſe word thou vſeſt thy ruffe ſhould hardly ſhew deſire giue thée thy dutie ſince thou wilt haue forbearance ready payment cauſe ſword time ſeale thée quittance theſe word cauſed one either ſide cruell blowes weapon ſo dangerous one doubtfull yet fortune fauouring prince florendos brought giant almoral ſuch eſtate bene made ſhorter head miragarda preſently diſcended perceiuing almoral brought ſubiection vſed theſe word prince florendos sir knight deſire make acceptation victory beare ſuch bloody minde deſire loſſe life ſake ſo much fauour much beholding well gentleneſſe alſo becauſe gard fortreſſe florendos ſéeing gotten ſuch good lucke might ſpeake durſt requited preſently anſwer madame ſuch force gratious ſpéeches alſo good opinion conceiue ſéemely ſelfe onely vow heart command alſo hand mainetaine cauſe wherefore grant life deſiring gentle nature wold afford like beauty claimed ſuch conqueſt none ſelfe way mitigate miragarda giuing great thanks curteſie departed caſtle againe accompanyed giant florendos ſtill remaining without complaining wound receiued beautie hurt gained giant whoſe company enterpriſed kéepe ſhéeld miragarda entring combat defence knight made iourney way indéed nany ſingular report beautie yet fortune inſtant preferring florendos cauſed ſtill remaine conquerour thus remained prince extreame conflict loue frequencing dayly lady picture amorous penſiue complaint miragarda tooke ſuch pleaſure behold ſhe fained loue onely becauſe ſhe would ſcorne fond fooliſh dealing fame blowne abroade aduentures great brittaine knight continually loſt caſtle giant dramuſiande miragarda conceiuing ſuch opinion earneſtly requeſt would take iourney thither perſwading aduenture fortreſſe reſerued finiſhed valour florendos loath diſobey commandement tooke vpon crauaile arriued england ſuch time heard aduenture finiſhed prince preparing themſelues come caſtle bridge attended comming behaued himſelf againſt haue heard gentlewoman whoſe rare excellencie ſuch may perceiue vrgeth gentle minde attempt déepeſt danger gratious ſeruice ſhall reſolued faire miragarda chanced caſtle giant almorol defended haue heard ſuch time king recinde priſoner enchanted caſtle many prince spain betaken themſelues ſearch quéene remained ſuch gréeuous ſorrowes nothing could moue procure pleaſure whereupon countie arlae preſented daughter miragarda quéene end might receiue ſome pleaſure company noble gentleman delighted rare péece beantie enterpriſed iouſts triumphes onely winne ſo affectioned expences ſo great doe pleaſure litle regarded many brought great neceſſitie onely riotous charge beauty ſet quéene ſéeing lord ſo long abſent kingdome noble gentleman court ſtriuing excell one another braue rich deuiſes brought hard exigent many liuings onely procured loue miragarda aduiſe countie honourable councell pittied ſée great inconuenience ſent giant almoral giuen certaine knight gentlewoman attend vppon ſhould kéepe till ſuch time ſhould appoint mariage inſtant could diſpatch becauſe great diſcord riſen amongſt prince knight court ſo ſent caſtle giant almoral vntill prince ſhould quietneſſe againe meane time ſhe often vſed walke gréene féeldes delight ſelfe euen ſhe time florendos come found ſhe liued till ſome one might reléeue captiuitie hereafter ſhall vnderſtand euery thing happened time abyding chap liiii palmerin departed realme england trauaile met prince gracian lying faſt ſleep vnder greene tree gaue vnderſtand hard aduenture befaln prince platir floraman riding helpe met damoſell brought place fighting combate palmerin ſlew dramaco lord caſtle redeemed three ladyes tirannicall ſeruitude long remained palmerin court king england noble father fréends reioyced company euery one ſuppoſed would trauaile could hardly kéepe himſelfe earneſt intreaty king prince flerida mother vrged ſtay longer gladly would laſt perceiued al mean could ſerue hinder determination laboured night day purſuing pretence gaue conſent ſhould depart whither pleaſed ſo taking leaue aged king father mother fréends little ſorrowfull enioy abſence gaue thē euery one gentle conge ſo left great heauineſſe within florian ſéeing brother palmerin gone honour imbaced ſtaying ſo long trauaile hee began freſh ſadneſſe throughout court eſpecially king frederick whoſe affection inclined thē prince palmerin becauſe hee nouriſhed court therefore loue great deale ſurelie grounded firſt diſcourſe happened prince palmerin riding encumbred thouſand conceites durſt take way conſtantinople fearing diſpleaſe lady polinarda remembring neere affinitie good hope ſhe wold make eſtimatiō ſeruice contenting himſelfe thought hee rode till arriued vnfertile valley whoſe ſcarcitie tree thing delightfull eye vrged diſpence thought ſudden ſadneſſe till laſt hee ridden good came faire mightie bigge tree whoſe compaſſe boughes contained fine coole ſhadowe vnder eſpied knight lie faſt aſleepe hauing neither horſe eſquire beare company made ſomwhat amazed loath leaue dangerous eſtate moued lance theſe ſpéeches sir knight place ſuch one repoſe wearie limmes becauſe vncertaine ſafetie may aſſure ſelf feared knight ſuddenly awaked ſetting hand sword preſently ſtarted vp palmerin knowledge bee prince gracian whoſe company little welcome ſuch ſolitary vnfrequented place paſſage wherefore hee began theſe tearmes following sir gracian let preſumption admitted offence rather eſtéemed ſort way command ſeruice graciā glad ſee prince palmerin knowing puiſſance might remedy part miſfortune willing diſcloſe imbraced prince armes order began vtter tale vnknowne worthy ſir knightly chiualry hath brought end aduēture tearmed beyond poſſibility ſo knowe affection inclined ayde thoſe whoſe miſaduenture requiret helpe ſo good knight happie arriuall time let ſpectacle ſhall ſhortly ſée remaine vndoubted infallible witneſſe becauſe delay word may turne ſome danger thus follow way ſée right long ſhall come place prince platir floraman abide great danger may yéelde maruailous friendly ſuccour make haſt would gladly ſo happy haue ſight meane time siluian doe fauour may mount vp behinde come vnto deſire except v forgetfull stone haue doubt meete together palmerin ſory heare theſe newes highly commending fortune came ſo luckely aide two prince promiſing fulfill requſt gracian ſet spurres horſe rode faſt poſſible might towards rode long came place two pathes ſeruing two ſeueral wayes made ſtand muſe way beſt take driue doubt eſpied damoſell come riding towards vſing ſuch heauy clamour one purſued depriue life palmerin abaſhed vnlooked aduenture ſtayed horſe queſtion ſhe perceiuing intent great feare gaue theſe ſpéeches good sir offer diſcourteſie hinderance happy trauaile may endamage greater harme ſtay diſcourſe miſfortunes yéelde content heare afraide diſcloſe becauſe doubt valour giue comfort great miſhappe truſt lady anſwered palmerin valour hardly make warrant ſo great deſire inſtant muſt requeſt ſhewe cauſe grieuous lamentation well syr quoth ſhée ſince ſo deſirous vnderſtand exextremitie caſe come ſhall certified hereof much poſſible craue riding length eſpyed goodly caſtle heard great ſlaſhing bruit weapon noyſe damoſell brought ſhewed ten knight ſetled themſelues fight againſt twaine defended ſo great pollicy charged enemy ſuch courage minde little ſpace laid fine dead ground theſe knight ſtood certaine men holding two faire comely lady would haue entred caſtle theſe two knight kept themſelues ſtill againſt gate ſo poſſible way enter palmerin beholding combate fierce ſides blood cruelly waſted ſtrengths altogether brought great weakeneſſe ſtayed long perceyued mighey bigge knight come forth caſtle ſtrongly armed mounted ten well appointed men garded perſon diligent aduauncing himſelfe remainder thoſe left aliue ten knight endured ſtill combate twaine verie maieſtically gaue foorth theſe wordes retire varlet let breake bone theſe caitifes haue procured high heauie diſpleaſure palmerin ſaw two knightes féeble eſtate ſo freſh reſiſtance vtter loſſe liues ſtepped knight replying manner thou haue either regard knighthood honourable condition thou oughteſt vſe martiall attempt leaue thou ſéeſt weake reſiſt prouide thy ſelfe haue enterpriſed quarrell knight offended theſe word palmerin couched ſpeare ran againſt ech ſuch puiſſance able reſiſt encounter ſent together violently earth falling combate sword armed men came defence lord good fortune prince gracian came ayded ſuch couragious helpe foure aſſayling knight companion end preuailed ſiue outright cauſed ſtanding ſéeing lord knight ſlaine face run caſtle betake themſelues darke seller vauts onely becauſe ſtood feare loſing liues palmerin ſéeing field body came offer reſiſtance went ladyes pale colour reaſon great feare ſtood cruell dramaco tooke ſeeking diſhonour offer villany could wherefore prince theſe word began ſalute faire ladyes ſhew pray occaſion villanous wretch endeuoured himſelfe diſhonour becauſe ignorant hath happened yet certified miſfortune came beſt ſeruice might platir floraman knowledge prince palmerin ſtayed ladyes anſwer comming imbracing great courteſie gaue harty thanks friendly ſuccour nay truſt anſwered palmerin giue thanks prince gracian come vnto time declared vnto heauineſſe eſtate taking lady hang went caſtle found body two aged woman ſate wringing hand death dramaco ſéeing coming ſlain companion diſſembled greef remained hart ſubmitted themſelues fearing leſt ſhould taſt ſame cup themſelues onely requeſting liues might ſaued renowned palmerin england preſently grant lady brought goodly chamber eſquires bound vp wound made prouiſion get ſtrength againe palmerin deſirous haue knowledge knight ſlaine queſtioned one old woman mother ſhe preſently returned anſwer knight griefe haue ſlaine called dramaco hée ſonne begotten valiant giant lurcon ſometime huſband primaleon ſlew conſtantinople ſuch time enterpriſed reuenge death famous perrequin dura haue wée long liued owne content vntill froward fortune conducted hither deſirous heare pardon mée griefe permit rehearſe prince contented himſelfe report departing hée went viſit lady vnderſtand manner miſhaps chanced chap lv lady declared prince palmerin manner brought caſtle hardy knight dramaco met prince gracian ſent platir floraman reſcue lady thence palmerin found caſtle labouring ſtill aduenturous enterpriſe dramaco companion thus happily foyled knight remayning caſtle till wound healed palmerin determined depart frō thence firſt deſired lady tell happened became ſo oppreſſed cruell dramaco eldeſt lady perceiuing earneſt deſire prince palmerin ſatiſfied requeſt manner worthy sir daughter lady inhabiteth farre place caſtle liued ſuch quiet content life ſo well guarded ſuppoſed enſuing danger feared miſhap ſo well gouerned lady mother none auoide deſtenies haue ordained muſt abide doome appointed fortune ſo allowed great vnhappineſſe haue felt part rygour cruell tyrant addicted ſuch cruell nature noble rewarded bloody murther fayre lady damoſelles defaced honour vſed alike villainous furie ſent tent knight aforeſayde caſtle mother finding v altogether vnprouided refuge time inſomuch woonted ſafetie gaue v ſmall cauſe doubt without reſpect teares complaint brought v away extreame violence way brought v met knight meaning prince gracian diſmounted horſe becauſe perceiued ſuch comely knight ſaued life tooke horſe left foote goe whither pleaſed thinking ſcorne accept combate ſundry meanes offered vnto leauing alone brought v caſtell theſe two knight ſwiftly purſuing v ſtood defence ſuch order would ſuffer v bee lead caſtell dramaco ſéeing theſe knight preuailed ſo well againſt ſeruants came himſelfe accompliſh could fulfill well ſtood friend happy effect remaineth ſubſtantiall witneſſe palmerin well marked diſcourſe lady theyr great miſfortune monſterous crueltie cramaco hée reioyced found gracian ſuch luckie time whoſe meanes brought aduenture ſuch good happy concluſion gracian rehearſed time hée ſtayed trée platir floraman came way knight conducted lady taken horſe left order haue heard declared miſhap lady whereupon rid haſtily continued combat haue already heard vntill ſuch time one lady eſcaping away met prince palmerin brought defend oppreſſed cauſe ſifted euery matter according themſelues deſired knowe prince palmerin gaue caſtle lady taking farewell gently mounted horſebacke leauing cure woundes caſtle lady carefull helpe prince length brought former ſtrength paſſed away time pleaſantly lady recounting ſtrange aduenture happily paſſed death dramaco comming eare theſe lady mother cauſed come thither ſée daughter ſhe arriued gaue great thankes prince imployed paine gratified ſuch honour ſhée could deutie expedient time place prince ſaw euery thing due deſent order determined depart thence deſiring lady vſe courteſie ancient mother dramaco becauſe ſhee innocent culpable miſchieeous practiſes requeſt lady willing ſhewe liberalitie vertue great commendation gaue caſtle ſonne dramaco ſhe rewarded courteous thankes prince going armoury dramaco prouided themſelues one notable armour ſtable likewiſe tooke three faireſt stéeds might better ſerue neceſſitie abide put exerciſe leauing lady caſtle readie depart owne abiding vowed ſtay place till attained citie conſtantinople ſped ſhall heare hereafter chap lvi palmerin left prince two lady caſtle rode accompanied siluian eſqure til laſt arriued ſea ſhore finding ſhip lying anker entred preſently ſo ſonne ſhip cable burſt middeſt billowes sea brought ſhip ſtrange iland palmerin went land encountred ſtrange hardy aduenture fountaine siluian met francian oniſtalde declared miſhap maiſter cauſe betooke preſently ſearch like manner siluian arriuing caſtle giant dramuſiande vrged vpon report aduance himſelfe preſently trauaile palmerin departed caſtle left prince lady mother rode without aduenture ſpace thrée dayes together till laſt comming sea ſide reaſon diſtemperature made great raging alighted gaue horſe siluian deſirous looke ſurges would driue penſiue matter foorth minde walking along ſide rocke eſpied shippe hard lay ancker marriners body elſe hee could perceiue neare made deſirous goe aboard ſee body hée might reſolued whence veſſel wherfore ſtrooke land ſuch vnfrequented place ſtayed ſuppoſing bin gone land fetch freſh water ſuch neceſſaries néedfull vſe ſaw body came ſpace neither could perceiue whether bin gone land prepared himſelfe enter ſhip siluian desired change minde ſo fond enterpriſe aduenture better countenance méer folly hazard perſon ſaw word might attaine perſwaſion attempt ſuffered enter ſhip according deſire ſooner prince fully entred cable rope held ship burſt midſt siluian preſently cried maſter offred caſt himſelfe land againe bough y• tree vaine yt ship lanched forth déepe full gale wind rode merily vpon ſurges ſhort time palmerin loſt ſight ſhore ſtil thinking fortune intend ſodain aduenture diſhartning himſelfe iudging beſt repoſed mercy god fauour waues expecting ſome good iſſue vnlooked chance siluian remained ſuch auineſſe loſſe maiſter thought ſtay place till heard ſome tidings either good bad ſéeing thrée dayes news would happen rede ſadly frō thence leading maiſters horſe hand eſpyed two knight white armour beſet pellicans red carnation colour siluian preſently knew francian oniſtalde demanded become maſter siluian declared manner miſhap entred ſhip cable brake ſuch ſuddaine feared ſome miſchance would annoy deare friend whoſe happineſſe wiſhed owne health wherfore concluded siluian ſhould go ſtrait london becauſe king fredericke would conceiue great gréefe ſhould know vnlucky chaunce deſired ſhew way thought might ſooneſt find pain death ſhould go london reherſe loſſe prince ſuch one knew beare maiſter great affection siluian promiſed accompliſh pleaſure ſo departed vowing ſpare labour sea land vntill might heare noble palmerin siluian fully reſolued beſt tooke way ſtrait great brittaine arriuing caſtle giant dramuſiande entertained kinde louing courteſie diſcouered loſſe lord preſently dramuſiande clapping armor backe promiſed neuer returne vnto caſtle without might attaine good recouery famous prince siluian ſeeing affection giant ſo great maſters welfare himſelfe could wiſh preſented himſelfe ſerue eſquire till might ſo happy finde prince againe thus leaue good fortune trauaile returne noble palmerin england enduring ſharpe brunt sea long thought laſt ſhip ſtaying ſide rocke sea left iland vnhabited forſooke ſhip glad gained ſhore leauing sea ſide betooke himſelfe trauaile little path right little brought faire gréene meddow middeſt whereof placed marble stone height man inſcription vppon take heede thou goe way read poſey stone placed ſuppoſed cauſe paſſengers afraide knew minde greatly moued ſée end accident accompanied continually hauty courage went taking great pleaſure behold high rock greene trées ſpread bough ſo brauely ouer path went palmerin ſéeing aduenture would happen marble pillar giuing ſuch terrifying manner word went ſtill without feare till laſt nighted laying downe graſſe take reſt made helmet pillow ſo determined ſléepe night ſuch motion mind thought take quiet reſt farther intent one remembrance fayre polinarda preſented ſelfe beſt worthy memory becauſe hée béene ſo long abſent yet durſt enterpriſe come preſence thē loſſe siluian whose counſell alway ſerued eſpecial remedy amorous aſſaults wanting company heauy caſe hee forced vtter diuers ſundry complaint thus ſpent hée night courtly debate betwéene reaſon earneſt deſire one perſwade dangerous kinde trauaile exclude mind fond allarmes giuen fancy continually wrapped intricate endleſſe vexation ſences often ſée reaſon ſubiect amorous deſire ſo prince able reſiſt aſpiring drift eger paſſions reſigned wit follow loue amitie begun lady miſtreſſe hée waſted night ſmall order reſt chéerefull morning deliuered faire countenance went ſtill muſing wordes read vpon pillar eſtéemed flat mockage becauſe could perceiue nothing deſerued ſuch forewarning trauailed faire plaine field ſtill vſing minde former exerciſes hée came fountaine ſingular beautie pillar whereof fine wrought azure water iſſuing forth mouthes diuers beaſts artificially made prince ſtanding good muſe fountaine ſo much water ſhould aſcend vp ſuch high mountaine ſuch faire thing ſhould ſtand ſuch vacant place could readily thinke himſelfe might iudge thereon lower end aforeſaid pillar lay two cruell tygers two fierce lion hée ſuppoſed kept paſſengers ſhould drinke fountaine ſtrange ſight made ſomewhat abaſhed ſtand feare ſome enchantment practiſed get ſome preſent danger becauſe beaſtes behaued themſelues ſuch order though might eaſily brought vnder ſubiectiō chaine ſuch bignes requiſite holde ſuch furious beaſtes yet tyed ſuch ſhortneſſe litle ſcope walking palmerin knew néedles aſke leaue drinke fountaine thoſe reaſō make anſwer albeit ſtrong force offer reſiſtance wherefore attempted try friendlineſſe fortune put life hazard vpon aduenture aduancing himſelfe taſte water vpon one pillar letter gold engraued theſe word behold fountaine wiſhed water going little farther eſpied thus hath courage drinke fountaine ſhall bring ende enterpriſe belongeth aduancement honour fame ſo ſhall accompliſh much may comprehēded ſtrength proweſſe man ouer againſt written theſe word paſſe drinke made prince little aſtonied one gaue encouragement approach fountaine ſo ſtood way hinder determination yet concluded try aduenture iudged impoſſible méete occaſion hautie enterpriſe chap lvii palmerin encouraged rare aduenture entred ſight againſt beaſts kept fountaine laſt albeit great danger vanquiſhed approched drinke water alſo departed thence arriued caſtle whereon ſawe foure shield placed vrged poeſies hee ſawe written try ende vnlooked accident hee entred combate againſt foure knight came forth caſtle whereof ſlew three ſaued life fourth diſcouer ende ſtrange aduenture many doubtes prince conceiued minde concerning might happen gorgeous ſpectacle becauſe poeſies placed ſuch vncertaine manner verilie ſuppoſed ſome trappe ſecret fetch allure venture owne deſtruction wherfore hee determined depart thence meddle beaſts becauſe ſaw faire ſhew gentleneſſe onely haue approch fountaine walked little way thence began accuſe blame himſelf either ſeare ſhould cauſe forget duty occaſion withdraw mind ſuch honourable attempt returning couragiouſly backe againe aduanced himſelfe againſt one tiger corner fountaine like wiſe gaue himſelfe ſuch manner againſt prince catching hold vpon shield ſo forceably handle brake detained ſuch wiſe prince could meanes get againe charged ſuch ſound ſtroke ouer legges tiger could vſe himſelfe ſo well would ſuccour féeble eſtate tiger came thrée beaſtes behauing themſelues ſo furiouſly againſt prince thought moſt doubtfull aduenture al life time attempted hauing wounded one lion verie ſore ſo conſtrained fall earth prince ſtouped downe recouer ſhield tiger abandoned lion approched ſo néere vnto catching hold vpon helmet drew within reach ſo violently hee enforced fall vpon knées whan tiger cruſhed pawes ſo cruelly armor ſtronger torne prince hundred péeces perceiued himſelfe attainted ſuch extremitie life ſtood point danger ſword ſaluted ſo déepe heart tiger ſprawled earth cleane bereft life bréefe courage noble minde animate ſuch hardineſſe albeit great paine trauaile hee made diſpatch liues ſate downe take little reſt becauſe tiger preſſed ground ſuch extreame violence thought verily bone bene broken red prettie went fountaine deſirous quench thirſt perceiued another little poſey ſo darkly couched could gather meaning wherefore preſently drauke water finding pleaſantneſſe running riuer ſpring iudged fountaine aduenture placed ſome cunning enchantreſſe diſharten timerous glut eye valiant faire pleaſant ſhow ſaw hazard tried place went ſtill path made fountaine laſt ſuddaine eſpyed goodly well fortified caſtle ſo finely moated round draw bridge entrance trées ſhadowing ſuch delicate manner minde altogether delighted beholding rare ſeemely caſtle gate ſtood foure faire iaſper pillar vpon ech hanged knightly ſhéeld palmerin taking perfect view beheld firſt vpon siluer ground poſey man dare conceiue courage take downe quoth palmerin leaue ſo bold trye taking downe ſhéeld ſhould feare matter aduenture worthily foyle ſince proteſtations ſo hautie enforce humble ſelfe well ſerue néede becauſe want ſhéeld alſo prooue bragges contained theſe word palmerin faſtened ſhéeld arme eſpyed knight comming forth caſtle verie great maieſtie béeing ſtrongly armed ſeeing prince without helmet lyon hauing bruſed ſuch ſort could weare proudlie began vtter theſe ſpéeches preſume take downe one theſe shieldes armed according finiſh ſuch enterpriſe muſt taſte puniſhment due fault committed becauſe hee may learne againſt another time arme head ſtandeth moſt danger theſe word ſtaying heare anſwer palmerin began charge mightie ſtrokes ſtill aimed hit bare head palmerin preuented determination ſo well cloſing faſt vpon hée brought downe vpon knées making ſemblance though would haue ſlaine knight deſired mercie yeelded himſelfe prince courteſie palmerin ſauing life demanded hee deale withall hee anſwered chiefeſt danger behind wherupon prince arming head helmet vanquiſhed knight went ſecond pillar whereupon shield campe azure read thus perillous therefore worthie feared conſiſteth greateſt danger truſt quoth prince may bée thou ſaiſt true yet ſhalt thou ſuppriſe minde cowardly feare ſo leauing firſt shield took downe ſecond preſently came forth another knight ſpake prince manner trulie ſir knight haue done vnwiſely hazard ſelfe place eſpecially take downe ſhielde requireth rther ranſome heart blood sir anſwered palmerin ſee dutie knightly behauiour hath failed behold ready deliuer recompence sword ſo leauing word ſetting themſelues ſtoutlie one againſt ende prince reached ſuch ſure warrant creaſt ſword pierced ſo deepe head fell earth diſcharged life pauſing little laſt went third piller wherein middeſt sheild vpon field sineple azure letter written theſe word mee bee gotten honour aduenture taken downe expected comming third knight ſoone came forth great haſte without vſing word entred dangerous combate twaine paſſed alemerin hauing cut one armes wounded ſore many place body brought long enduring fight ſuch weakneſſe hée fell downe yéelded vp ghoſt foot good fortune cauſed prince aduance himſelfe fourth pillar viewing sheild beheld letter gold good encouragement remaineth happy victorie theſe word made deſirous end fortunate aduenture taking downe ſhield came fourth champion theſe ſpéeches think fondneſſe béene ſuch could content ſelfe ſufficient conqueſt wherefore paiment may witnes iuſt deſert prepare ſelfe receiue hardy blowes palmerin accuſtomed make anſwere place knightly ſtrength ought ſhew ſelfe deliuered mind halfe ſcore ſtrokes wellaid notwithſtanding force thrée yet ſerued ſelfe ſame ſauce ioy whereof kneeled downe hartily gaue thanks god prouidence permitted enter hauty exploit demanded y• knight ſtood al ſéene noble behauiour aduenture caſtle ſhould hazard himſelf againſt requeſt made anſwere credit worthy ſir yet thing finiſhed perſwade ſelfe may accompliſhed worthineſſe becauſe well perceiue ſpight thing contrary valor muſt enter place haue ſéene neuer thought find preſent behauiour conſtraineth confeſſe vertue ſo gouerneth action ſhée ſée conquerour attempt vndertake chap lviii palmerin hauing vanquiſhed three knight entred caſtle likewiſe ſlewe giant offered reſiſtance paſſed ouer blacke riuer great danger met enchantreſſe eutropa aunt giant dramuſiande threw ſelfe headlong riuer thinking haue pulled prince ſhe failed pretence likewiſe knight whoſe life ſaued reported death three knight emperours court aſſayed enter caſtle deliuered bazilliart germaine orleance kept priſoners dungeon certified caſtle called perillous iſle palmerin vanquiſhed theſe foure knight ſawe come offer reſiſtance accompanied knight entred caſtell thing ſuch admirable beautie court pillar iaſper ſtone ten cubit length whereon many goodly chamber faire lodging built court paued marble wrought colour red gréene euery thing ſo curious ingeniouſly framed caſtle prince ſuppoſed moſt excellent thing euer ſéene hee wearied eye beholding ſumptuous paralell hée walked thorow faire gallery brought hall ſingular beautie entrance whereof mighty giant preſented himſelfe prince holding hand knagged mace yron hee held vp ſight reſiſt paſſage palmerin perceiuing bold intēt would ſeeme diſmay himſelf remēbring fortunately begun without determined ende valiantly within ſo ſetling giant found play ende payde home ſo made quiet enough ſpeaking hauing thus worthily conquered enemy walked vp downe hall till laſt thorow little gate entred ſumptuous gallerie wherein could finde way firſt hée muſt paſſe ouer abroade place water ouer layde little boord planke ſo ſmall breadth ſtrength ſuppoſed able abide leaſt wayght world faine would haue béene ſide vnhappy place hindered determination mooued ſo many grieuous conceites began greatly blame aduerſe fortune boord breake ſhould fall water ſo blacke ougly riuer stix whereon acheron carryeth damned ſoules hell might compared fearefull lake well ouer would though coſt life wherefore diſarming himſelfe becauſe heauineſſe armor might chiefe occaſion breake planke good courage beganne venture vpon hauing nothing defend withall swoord euer might happen attained almoſt middeſt olde rotten planke began ſomewhat cracke ſo palmerin verily ſuppoſed remedy muſt fall helliſh gulfe wherefore calling faire polinarda memory began manner deſire fauour madame hitherto haue aduenture life martiall exploytes dangerous attempt ſake crauing nothing handes ayde fauour ought inſtant greater reaſon wiſh ſame ſéeing try greateſt hazard onely aduance honour whoſe friendſhip may ſo happy finde onely meane encourage diſtreſſe ſhall aſſay ſuch renowne behalfe ſhall faithfully ſerued ſelfe euer fully ſatiſfied thus concluding ſpéeches little ioy gained ſide perceiued olde withered creature come forth doore preſence face al wrinkled haire ougly blacke diſpearſed abroad ouer ſhoulders ſo ſtaying awhile began manner eſtimation ſhall make ſelfe ſhall iudge cunning auaile warrant ſafetie place ſuffers vanquiſhed one knight ſo often ſtretching forth hand take hold palmerin verily thinking plucke ſhe caſt ſelfe headlong filthy puddle ending life wickedly tretcherous villanous déeds deſerued prince ſéeing ſhe failed intent ouercome ſadneſſe wretched ſight went diuers chamber get downe found many mayden feruants enquired knigt whoſe life ſaued combate found deſired ſhew name caſtle alſo ſhe ſo deſperately drowned ſelfe worthy sir anſwered knight proofe noble valour ſuch cannot conceale thing may pleaſure know wherfore marke ſhall ſhew vnto caſtle called name perillous ile whereof ſome hold opinion sage vrganda firſt founder lady place ſhe hid ſelfe becauſe heath caſtle remained enchanted ſo perſon could attaine inhabite order ſhe left faire pallace fountaine ſée little gate becauſe may eaſier beleeue longer agoe ſithence time inhabited could giue aſſurance ſcituation ile dame drowned named eutropa aunt giant dramuſiande vanquiſhed prowes famous knight england ſhe coeceiued ſuch inward ſorrow ſhe almoſt diſtraught ſelfe wit reuenge miſhap ſhe ſent ſpeede soldan babylon ſhould prepare mightie army wherewith might ruinate citie conſtantinople whole empire greece diueliſh deſire could take effect becauſe soldane enough doe owne ſubiects raiſed themſelues mutany open rebellion againſt cauſe ſhee ſeeing drift could accompliſh wiſh came vnto place accompanied thrée knight haue ſlaine ſelfe ſo performed damnable art thē volantary affection ſelues iſle round ſhe hath ſo diſperſed enchantment ſhe might allure wandring knight vnder power either ſlay preſētly kéepe continuall orizon ſatiſfie inſatiable bloody deſire haue maintained ſafety long time alwayes ſo fortunate many knight ſlew ſome tooke captiue chanced long ſince euening fortune conducted hither fiue noble knight ſlaine thrée thē twaine conquered two fellowes yet laſt brought ſubiection fourth knight remaine priſoners caſtle pray ſir ſaid palmerin ſhew name thrée knight ſlaine alſo priſon two may beſtow vpon former libertie demand made anſwere firſt knight called medruſian fearefull ſecond titubal blacke third foruolant strong ſure ſometime haue ſéene emperour palmerins court conſtantinople indéed quoth palmerin haue ſéene great ill wil wicked diſpoſition alway bent moleſt trouble wiſhed moſt good euer honoured wherfore leſſe eſtéeme loſſe rather reioyce world hath cut enuious practiſes time talke come place two priſoners lay without company reaſon y• ſmal abode eutropa made place wherein ſhe determined execute ſuch tyranous cruelty y• caſtle ſhould ten time feared dramuſiande made abiding sage aliart drift practiſes w • diſcouered willing ſtop miſchiefes enchanttreſſe ſtriue commit cauſed palmerin enter ship ſent purpoſe thorow diſapoint vile pretence downe went knight prince priſon carying torch lighted hand becauſe ſo déepe vnder ground man might ſhoote croſſebow length moued palmerin greatly agaſt thinking paine two knight endured ſuch obſcure vncomfortable priſon made enter th • ſe word certainly caſtle hardly beleeue erected vrganda report goeth ſhe neuer w • ont vſe cruelty wandring knight laſt came grate opened ſaw whereas two knight attending cōming ſome villainy ſuppoſed rather ſet liberty leaſt part thought whē preſently prince knew one bazilliart germaine orleance great yrons vpon leg yron chaines middle cauſed preſently fall teares able ſuffer ſhould abide longer heauy caſe cō manded knight take chaines iron bazilliart like well becauſe feared ſhould lead ſome tormēts wherefore began ſpeake vnto thus sir knight might doe v pleaſure let v reſt captiuity lead v place puniſhmēt sir bazilliart ſaid palmerin impriſoned place would hardly conſent deliuer ſo ſoone minding put feare would hide himſelfe longer helmet germaine orleance catching armes renued acquaintance order ſée well sir palmerin hereafter muſt abandon fooliſh feare becauſe proweſſe wholly applyed redéeme captiuity fortune bēdeth lowring browes dramuſiande amply teſtifie ſaluted one another courteouſly came preſently forth noyſome priſon conducted faire chamber refreſhed hungry ſtomacks diſcourſed hapned ſundry aduentures chap lviiii time palmerin remained caſtle called perrillous iſle accompanied bazilliart germaine orleance sa • ransfort knight keepeth caſtle francian • ſtalde departure siluian tooke vpon trauaile prince ſearch arriued caſtle palmerin departed ahence ſayling sea attained coaſt spaine deſirous ſee faire miragarda changed armor vnder title diſpayring knight trauailed toward caſtle giant almarol long time theſe knightes ſpent friendly diſcourſes till drewe towards night knight caſtle named satransfort prouided two faire bed one prince palmerin another two companion night tooke quietnes ſince firſt comming caſtle morning concluded depart thence firſt deſired ſée chamber commodity goodly caſtell found ſo rare excellently ordered could chuſe commend highly deſerue walked thence fountaine yéelding leſſe laud noble conqueſt palmerin dangerous attempt ſuch exployte worthily merite returning vnto caſtle earneſt requeſt satransfort ſtaied ſpace foure dayes comming foorth afternoone ſit pleaſant ſhadow vnder gréene trées eſpied farre two knight come haſtily ryding preſently knowne shield francian oniſtalde endeuoring themſelues ſéeke prince palmerin ſuch time siluian declared vnto loſſe lord ſuch good fortune came place palmerin entred ſhippe found paſſengers ready croſſe ſeas ſo intreatie ſealed hauing ſuch fayre winde tyde length diſcouered perillous iſle place made paſſengers greatly abaſhed becauſe ignorant ſoyle knew danger might receiue place yet requeſt two knight ſomewhat pacified ſet land ſame place palmerin entred firſt ſhore attained top hye rockes came pillar fearefull ſentence vpon vſing litle regard becauſe affection bare vnto deare friend incited forward came haue told y• fight knowledge prince knight receyued curteouſly imbraced another token mutuall inuiolate friendſhip time abiding viſited noble aduenture fountaine alſo dead body tituball medruſian foruolant came place eutropa drowned ſelfe way extolling worthy proweſſe power atchieue ende ſuch ſingular exploytes occaſion ſo fell would néedes depart palmerin left caſtle cuſtody gentle knight satransfort intending make preſent noble sage aliart friendly departing thence came sea ſide inbarqued themſelues among diuers paſſengers foure knightes themſelues palmerin alone deſire enired ſeas ſight land sage aliart conducted ſhip prince made ſayle contrary way knight ſo knewe ſhould land althought determined goe conſtantinople ſée lady faire polinarda whoſe ſake heart endured diuerſe grieuous thought paſſions length ſuch fortune attained coaſt spaine pleaſed well becauſe would try valour preſence faire miragarda intent might know beauty comparable miſtreſſe polinarda come chiefe city portugal heard maruellous commendation florendos triſtfull knight becauſe father primaleon bruiſed armour ſore made himſelfe notable faire new armor hauing done many famous actes court recinde king spaine came home laſt caſtle giant almarol miragarda ſo ſoone arriued would néedes know ſucceſſe caſtle giant dramuſiande albeit ſhe béene admoniſhed thereof yet would ſhe neuer accept triſtfull knight done england mind whatſoeuer done ſhe made account deſirous ſée déedes might bee agréeable reputation hee deſerued commanded kéepe paſſage caſtle thinking ſo many good knightes would endeu themſelues thither ſo aduenture ſhould much renowned caſtle dramuſiande triſtfull knight loath thing diſpleaſe faire miragarda cauſed ther sheelde made image beauty report whereof allured ſo many knight thither defence conquered two hundred tooke ſhields remembrance victory hanged vp either ſide faire portraite lady miragarda perceiuing shieldes proweſſe florendos triſtfull knight receiued vnſpeakeable contentment yet making ſhew praiſe ſo hauty enterpriſe noble victory leaue returne prince palmerin trauialing portugal al time made excellent faire armour ſpotted colour ſcarlet white gaue ſuch great delight beheld euery one deſirous make himſelfe like shield plaine sinople curiouſly figured image deadly hope ſo ſingular well ordered liuelineſſe face lineament alſo ſéemels ſhadowing attire euery one iudged naturall proportion name likewiſe preſented vnder ſo deuice named euery one deſpairing knight manner ridde toward caſtle almarol deſirous trie force aduenture eſteemed ſo great fame fearing perill fortune ſhould vnkindly turne ſelfe perſwaded himſelfe vnpoſſible attaine top honour man doe hazard perſon thoſe place victorie worthily preſented minde beareth affection leaue perpetuall renowne poſteritie chap lx palmerin vnder title diſparing knight came caſtle giant almarol hee ſaw ſhields diuers famous knight friend hanged among number vanquiſhed whereupon entred combat againſt triſtfull knight whoſe ſtrength ſuch neither could win victorie miragarda tooke ſuch anger thereat ſhee commanded triſtfull knight abſent himſelfe thence weare armour ſpace twelue moneths certaine aduentures bee mentioned finiſhed prince palmerin time hee trauelled towardes caſtle giant almarol hee arriued hée greatly abaſhed ſee placed ſuch hie rocke ſore trouble come vnto deſparing knight come ſomewhat néere eſpied two knight entred combat deſirous ſee hee ſet ſpurres horſe bee mad end could come thither triſtfull knight vanquiſhed aduerſarie placed ſheild among meanes palmerin certaine knowledge conquered knight called carmelant writing vnder ſheild made manifeſt palmerin beholding ſo manie shield trée eſteemed valour triſtfull knight great reputation laſt hee perceiued ſhelds friſoll eſtrellant tenebrant friendes great renowne whereat ſo amazed knew ſay ſaw picture miragarda repreſented ſuch beauty ſenſes rauiſhed could procéed farther till vſed theſe ſpéeches certainly madam ſee preſent thing neuer thought doe cannot thinke amiſſe knight may wel hazard life ſo hare goddeſſe yet deſire approue ſelfe againſt bearing opinion beautie beſt fauored beloued neither may equalled whoſe ſake aduenture combat triſtfull knight hearing theſe word could withhold himſelfe returned prince anſwere chaſtiſement correction ſir knight giuen according proud wordes haue deſerued ſhould bee repaied extreame crueltie wherefore fearing leaſt fauouring ſhall deſerue raſh report ſelfe try valo •• ſuch may maintaine diſhonour haue vngently offered hereupon fetched carire met together ſo great force enforced abandon horſes drawing foorth ſwords deliuered one another ſuch rigorous blowes one would haue iudged neither able endure giant almarol abaſhed noble combate called faire miragarda come ſée hauing ſpread faire cloath gold along windowe rich cuſhion whereon ſhe leaned damoſelles ſtanding behold knightly chiualry ſhee preſented ſelfe windowe two champion retired themſelues take little pauſe meanes triſtfull knight gained commoditie contemplate faire miragarda theſe tearmes man albeit ſtate oppreſſed neuer ſo much debilitie would aſſure himſelfe remaine victor maintaining qua • rell ſo excellent rare iewell like manner palmerin complained faire polinarda breake theſe cogitation began couragiouſly againe triſtfull knight beholding lady great griefe could vanquiſh knight hauing fayled ſo many forceable aſſaultes gaue one another armour cut cruelly mangled blood effuſed ground fought shieldes broken hundreth piece ſo faine take breath againe vnable endure ſuch penitrable grieuous trauaile palmerin ſtanding leaning vpon swoord beholding armour reduced ſuch eſtate aud remembring cauſe entrance combate ſad conceyt beganne ſay madame either ſufficient doe ſeruice elſe eſtéeme ſo litle mine affection vnworthy ſeruant none grant honor fight hauing onely power maiſter ſo deſire aſſiſt friendly fauour ſince haue made hazard life aduance fame loyaltie ſuffer knight remaine victor ſéeing mine eye lady neither may preſume aboue triſtfull knight walked vp downe debating himſelfe ende combat began ſomewhat feare becauſe life time dealt hardy valiant knight wherefore lifting vp eye place mirgarda ſtood began diſcouer minde thus ſometime déere miſtreſſe siſter named polinarda whoſe beautie others ſelfe eſtéemed moſt rare perfect earth beh • lde inequall ſtate ſurpaſſing beauty perceiued iudgement groſſe ſo much ſhe neither may ought paragon ſelfe heauenly perfection wherfore ſwéete miſtreſſe doe honour fauor may ſupport againſt mine enemy ſuffer haue béene vanquiſhed beautie brought ſuch ſubiection féeling themſelues ſomewhat refreſhed charged one another againe valiantly continued fruſtrate expectation ſo long ye caught one another middeſt endeuouring way ſhould gette maiſtrie laboured vaine ſtrengthes ſuch equalitie one could hardly iudge greater aduantage miragarda commended combat beſt euer ſhe ſeene deſired victory might returne triſtfull knight wiſh expectation deceiued night approching ſo faſt vpon commoditie trie conqueſt came foorth giant almarol intreatie parted themſelues becauſe indéede could hardly ſée one another ſo palmerin returned halfe mile place remained till woundes healed determing gained little ſtrength come againe caſtle would ſo knightly behaue himſelfe would beare shielde miragarda thence honour prize conſtantinople almarol conducted triſtfull knight chamber field alwaies vſed lodge miragarda greatly offended power vanquiſh prince ſtanding vpon triall betwéene beauty lady valiant palmerin ſent meſſenger florendos theſe tidings ſhould ſtraightway abſent himſelfe place weare armour ſpace twelue monethes becauſe béen ſo fortunate vanquiſh enemy ſo iuſt cauſe gréeting ſo diſpleaſant triſtfull knight became reſolute make life ſorrow agreeable penſiue name verily ſuppoſing fortune determined vtter detriment chap lxi triſtfull knight commandement ladie miragarda departed caſtle almarol accompanied eſquire armello brought backe maſters sheeld armor left tree among conquered knight florendos met shepheard trauell ioyned ſuch amitie vowed neuer leaue one another prince palmerin returning ende combat certified armello cauſe maſters departure wherefore likewiſe preſently departed thence triſtfull knight receiued ſharpe meſſage miragarda loth thing diſobay minde hee called eſquire armello bare great loue affection going little thicket tree briniſh teares trilling downe cheekes began eſquire heauie diſcourſe armello friend ſoo guerdon frowning fortune recompence trauailes hath ordained patiently ſuffer god thy ſelfe theſe ſollitary wood remaine witneſſe neither moued miſhap ſtorme againſt great diſcurteſie ſay philoſopher patience moſt noble conqueſt yet alway opinion truſty trauaile deſerued better reward onely reſpecting faith worthily merit ſome moitie friendſhip thy ioy thy mirth thy happineſſe thy comfort world changed hard lot miſfortune onely thou patient preuaile vſing thy continual epithite quid non facit amor yet haue one hope chiefeſt remedie extreame affliction death ſpéedily finiſh heauie complaint cut miſeries wherwith ſo cruelly aſſaulted wherfore good friend armello thou wilt manifeſt thy wonted curteſie pleaſure mine extreame néede take horſe armor depart conſtantinople giue forth certaine truth death hath claimed due hands▪ haue ended life vnfortunate aduenture wherein know thou ſhalt amiſſe becauſe griefe doth aſſure ſhall ende right ſoone onely let requeſt thine hand thou conceale late miſhap thy ſelfe let neither friend foe vnderſtand ſay euery one thou art witnes death armello hearing word maſter ſtrooke heart grieuous extreame paſſion teares eye began manner truſt lord know place content thing like deſire oppreſſion beare companie ſhould forſake god knowes danger might happen alſo ſorrow ſhould conceiue ſelfe neither doe thinke expedient blaze abroad death becauſe number miſhappes might ariſe thereby entring ſeuerely mind friend much ſéeme diſpleaſant parent alliance wherefore beare furie miragarda▪ thinke raſh dealing ere long moue vnto repentance time ſhee hath conſidered faithfull ſeruice aſpyring minde hath beene honourably maintained ſhee recall vngentle wordes recompence haue deſerued worthily therefore expect good sir frame well enough warrant know anſwered florendos perfection thy truſtie zeale ſo carefully bent welfare deſpaire preſent haue ſmall occaſion thinke know fault ſuch ſhall fauoured ingratitude ſo ſeuerely bent againſt torment world adioined might deſerue compariſon great diſpleaſure yet knighit world would haue vanquiſhed ſeeing defended onely phaenix beautie would haue made hazard laſt extremitie encouraged combate ſuch excellent meane ſuch crueltie dwel ſuch pooreleſſe perſon ſuch angry minde harbour vnder ſo faire face well fo • ſan h • c • lim meminiſſe iu • abit tel eſteeme ſelfe hauing conquerour ouer ſo many could bring obeyſance one knight certainely perſwade ſelfe haue vſed leſſe proweſſe aduenture wherein thou haſt ſeene mée wherfore haue good occaſion take heauily lament honour haue loſt exiled gracious preſence therefore good armello receiue horſe armour ſuffer walke alone heauineſſe cauſe mine owne hurt ended theſe ſpéeches forſooke armello wandring along riuer ſide till laſt ſate downe vnder tree deſir • u receiue little reſt vexation minde would hardly ſuffer hee awaked hee perceiued great heard ſhéepe féediug paſture ground vnder tree neere hee ſaw shepheard playing inſtrument whereto recorded ſo many ſwéet ditty florendos tooke great pleaſure ſit heare perſwading himſelfe shepheard ſuch baſe condition ſeemed becauſe deuiſes ſo excellent wel ordered commendation loue alſo great iniuries receiued thereby triſtfull knight well noting complaint fortune conducted place might enioy partner liue heauineſſe came vſed ſuch friendly meanes ſhort time grew good liking florendos béeing glad hee met ſuch friend ſolitarie life shepheard vttered ſecrets mind triſtfull knight bewraied ſum griefe vowed ſuch amitie remaine betwéene miſfortune ſhould haue power ſo ſunder friendſhip armello hauing ſtood muſing good maſter gone ſight determined trauell without company came backe againe caſtle almarol foote trée directly vnder shield faire miragarda placed maſters shield armour among vanquiſhed knight preſenc • mirag • rda hee vttered ſo many rufull grieuous complaintes would haue mooued gentle heart compaſſion ſhee entered ſuch great diſdaine eſteemed worthie account triumphed paine triſtfull knight time wee leaue shepheards company prince palmerin hauing wound wel cured prouided new armour becauſe cruelly defaced returned caſtle giant almarol intending depart thence conquered triſtfull knight arriued caſtle heard lamentation armello vſed whereby vnderſtood triſtfull knight renowned prince florendos moued great diſpleaſure becauſe entred combat againſt ſuppoſed hatred miragarda might worke occaſion ſome greater miſchance loſſe ſo valliant prince florendos might cauſe great griefe emperour palmerin alſo lord lady royall court theſe thought vrged prince ſo great vnquietnes could determine whether might abide place purſue prince florendos cauſe abandon triſtful kinde life remedie eny miſfortune might annoy meanes princeſſe miragarda ſuppoſed fayreſt lady euer ſéene thus muſing vpon thouſand matter alſo beauty miragarda compare heauenly hew lady miſtreſſe laſt remembring effect duty hée ſet ſpurs htrſe galloped thence reſpecting way went deſirous attaine citie conſantinople chap lxii giant dramuſiande accompanied siluian arriued caſtle giant almarol amorous picture miragarda hee entred combate almarol foyled miragarda gaue cuſtodie portrait alſo keeping paſſage againſt knightes came thither muſt remember giant dramuſiande trauailed many ſtrange country accompanied siluian finde againe prince palmerin arriued caſtle giant almarol within prince departed thence beheld caſtle hee deſired ſo long ſée could perceiue neither body néere came trée ſaw laden shield vanquiſhed knight whoſe name ſubſcribed vnderneath euery one made haue knowledge diuers bene foyled laſt ſoote trée eſpyed armour ſhéeld triſtfull knight made greatly muſe armour conquerour ſhould deſerue better eſtimation placed among number vanquiſhed néere armour beheld armello hauing endured teares pittifull complaint long time length chanced fall faſt aſléepe dramuſiande deſirous heare ſome tidings vſed ſuch meanes awaked vnderſtood aduentures fortreſſe alſo departure triſtfull knight began greatly rebuke himſelfe fortune failed encounter ſo good knight whoſe shield would haue placed higheſt trée armello deſired contrary dramuſiande taking good viewe picture miragarda brought ſuddaine ſuch alteration ſtout hauty ſtomacke could way reſiſt cutting care ouercharged mind yea brought ſuch great quandary could hold launce trembling leafe ſtirred wind euē ſo ſtood cleane bereft ſences whereupon began vtter theſe ſpéeches madame beholding portrait beauty wherwith nature hath plentifully adorned wiſh deſire kéep paſſage might faithfull ſeruice make renowned thorow whole world ſince countenance hath courage conquere heart mine yet neuer done deſire vnder noble conqueſt may endeuor ſtrength exalt princely beauty ſo dare preſume ſpeake againſt ſhall receiue puniſhment due ſo great offence continued amorous thought giant almarol came brauely forth caſtell miragarda ſent offended ſée giant dramuſiande wherefore aduancing himſelfe preſence almarol deliuered greeting sir knight thinke might auaile ſet ſheild rancke vanquiſhed thus buſie ſelfe beholding portrait thing would rather perſwade gentleneſſe ſhew conſtraint may happen force word dramuſiande replied thus perſwaded miſtreſſe picture wold pleaſed ſo ſmall matter rather accompliſh thy deſire doe thing might return contrarie trauaile ſhould little loſſe leſſe heart libertie remaineth captiue becauſe would gladly receuer againe entend enter combat thee intent thou maiſt report thy word could foile mee yet thy workes puiſſance daunt mee almarol naturally accuſtomed cruelty ſuch courteſie gentle dramuſiande receiued theſe ſpeeches angrie manner ready prouided encountred speares valiantlie together throwne beſide horſes charged one another fiercely swordes miragarda ſtanding window behold exploite gaue great commendation behauiour dramuſiande ſhe feared would ouercome giant almarol ſore hurt well wearied themſelues retired take little pauſe dramuſiande beholding faire miragarda ſuddenly ſtroken ſuch amaze remembrance combat cleane minde almarol ſéeing eſtate brought beholding face miragarda awaked ſtudy ſuch ſure ſtroke creaſt sword cleft wounded ſore vpon head dramuſiande taking il part returned almarol ſo great fury inforced ſtart way way glad auoide blowes wherewith charged laſt almarol fell earth dramuſiande ſetting foote vpon vnclaſped helmet becauſe would haue ſmitten head miragarda preſently ſent downe one damoſels named lardemia ſtaied dramuſiande theſe word moſt noble knight princeſſe miragarda doth ſent intreaty would ſatiſfie ſelfe honor victorie depriue giant life whoſe loſſe might griefe indeuours way recompence madame anſwered dramuſiande onely grant life requeſt ſuch gracious princeſſe vow ſelfe keepe famous shield ſo bee ſhe except loyall ſeruice fortune conduct knight hether conquere deſire ſetting pittie aſide ſhe ſuffer enioy death ſo ſhall trauailes trouble poſſeſſe long wiſhed ende lardemia hauing lead almarol caſtle window returneth anſwere sir knight lady miſtreſſe ſendeth thouſand thankes recompence courteſie committeth ſafegard ſhield hand wiſhing good fortune may alway gouerne enterpriſe dramuſiande theſe word greatly cōtented becauſe deſired aboue thing pleaſure faire miragarda whoſe beauty depriued wonted libertie forcing loue grow ſomewhat amorous cauſe remained kéeping faire portraite accompliſhing ſuch hautie déedes chiualrie altogether ſuppoſed incredible honour got long time tarriance fortune hauing fauoured laſt anger ſhe forſooke euen ſhe accuſtomed falſifie promiſe thoſe ſhe perceiueth haue entrance proſperitie chap lxiii dramuſiande keeping ſhield paſſage giant almarol entred iuſt prince gracian roſuel victory ended ſtrife friendly acquaintance next morning dramuſiande accompliſh promiſe faire miragarda came foorth ſate downe tree portraite knightly shield placed vſing ſuch grieuous complaint siluian marueiled ſée ſo mighty man brought ſuch ſubiection force loue faithfull truſty eſquire armello kéeping company frequenting ſtill grieuous mones thought none worthy kéepe ſuch precious treaſure ſhield faire miragarda onely lord maiſter beſt deſerue wherfore able conceale paſſions heart conceiued began manner giant dramuſiande knowe well ſir knight fortune hath greatly fauoured maſter abſent kéepe iewell ioy durſt hée ſhewe himſelfe place conſtrained forſake command miragarda ſhould well perceiue faire portrait kept none whereto dramuſiande replied thus friend faith affection thou beareſt thy maiſter ſéemeth worthy great commendation déeds remaine true confirmation witneſſe woryes yet muſt vſe euill ſuſpect altogether vnknowne would alſo enter combate wich maiſter preſent place chauce vanquiſhed would content ſelfe placed among theſe conquered whoſe aſſurance haue béene likely mine peraduenture might profite left shield vnder obeyſance whoſe onely ſéeke ſatiſfie ending life ſuch hautie enterpriſe againe might ſo fortune chance ſée combate wiſh maiſter would conceiue another opinion th • n yet doe iudge either better worſe perceiue preſent make account wherefore perſwade ſelfe well worthy able kéepe defend ſhield faire miragarda knight maiſter vnknown albeit confeſſe ſo worthy hath ſo déerly deſerued onely ſure notable cōqueſts alſo proofe knightly curteſie ſhould way equal ſelfe might well thought trueth remained ſhall ſtay certaine ſpace doubt ſhall ſée hauty attempt ended time haue béene maiſter finiſhed continued theſe ſpéeches hée eſpied farre two knight come riding along riuer ſide one armour coloured blacke white diuers border gold finely wrought vpon bearing shield deuice murthered body campe sinople armour gréene colour thicke beſet lyon gold ſhield two lion rampant theſe twaine ſooner arriued caſtle dramuſiande incontiuently knew one roſuel prince gracian ſometime béene priſoners whoſe amitie hée alwayes made great account albeit friendſhip acceptable yet promiſe made miragarda commanded contrary confidering alſo loue gotten maiſterie directing minde enterpriſe made neither ſpare friend foe vſed alike trauailed thither mounting ſtéed came forth perceiuing prouided himſelfe iuſte well pleaſed becauſe deſired approue ſtrength behalfe faire miragarda caſting eye beautifull picture beheld middeſt shieldes florendos conquered ſuppriſed ſuch ſuddaine amazement quite forgotten cauſe came thither dramuſiande ſeeing addreſſed himſelfe manner ſalutation sir knight portraite lady placed contemplated ſo great eaſe hée deſireth enioy ſuch iewell muſt firſt combate againſt denyeth priuiledge till vanquiſhed fortune reſpect doe fauour yet ſhall féele double torment remayning victor truſt anſwered prince gracian man life may ataine honour ſuch ſingular perſonage behold hath courage aduenture firſt concluding ſpéeches met dramuſiande valiantly breake speare ſuch force hee throwne earth ſo ſtrong violence great voyde feeling mooued roſuel ſuch diſpleaſure reuenge friend hée pricked foorth againſt dramuſiande ready prouided another speare ſent beare prince gracian company rude encounter made maruaile ſuppoſed enemy renowned palmerin england whereof deſirous reſolued gracian hardieſt ſwoord drawne hand entred theſe tearmes sir knight althogh fortune hath béene friend foyle v iuſte yet pray diſcende foote ende may finiſh combat ſwoord becauſe would trie valour vttermoſt may depart hence benefite life dramuſiande euer accuſtomed great bounty gentleneſſe ſeeing deſire prince gracian gotten honour victory would reſpect ſatiſ • ie mind made anſwere maner sir gracian make ſo ſmall eſtimation life would man ſh • uld bring ſuch danger beſéeching take part haue already ſo boldly ventured ſelfe bound duty doe thing may honourable welfare gracian hearing himſelfe named knight knowledge greatly abaſhed replyed thus worthy ſir ſince fortune hath béene ſo good obtaine friendſhip ſo hardy knight eſtéeme ſelfe happieſt vnder sun deſiring haue knowledge ſhall finde expedient theſe wordes dramuſiande tooke helmet preſently ranne imbraced conceiuing ſuch vnſpeakeable ioy company miſchance put cleane memorie becauſe iudged ſhame foyled handes dramuſiande requeſted cauſe remained place ſatiſfie deſires recited whole occaſion iourney made promiſe miragarda conquered giant almarol kéepe shield place vntill ſome knight proweſſe could bring vnder obeyſan •• certainly ſaid roſuel perceiue intended keepe life time becauſe knowe nothing death ouercome truſt quoth y• prince gracian haue time paſt extolled verily belieued faire claritia might equall beautie hauing beh • ld admirable miragarda exempt minde deſiring accompliſh meane might doe ſeruice credite ſaid roſuel haue ſo forgotten loue bare lady depart ſooner hence ſhall fall contempt lady giuing onely laud péereleſſe miragarda mounting horſebacke ridde away ſo faſt poſſible could like maner prince gracian poſſed preſently neither vſing friendly departing giant dramuſiande could refrain laughter think weake ſtomacks theſe two prince chap lxiiii palmerin england trauailing toward conſtantinople laid downe ſleepe hard faire caſtle whence came foure lady carried caſtle one lady bearing louing affection diſdaining great good vrged keepe priſoner palmerin england left caſtle giant almarol happened frontier nauarre dominion france perceiued altogether inhabited gouerned mighty giant whoſe vnciuility life wrought many cruel ſpoiles villanous deed theſe part among palmerin behaued himſelfe ſo worthily effect déeds returned due commendation cō tinuing trauaile along coaſt laſt faire gréen valley eſpied goodly well fortified caſtle neere vnto faire largs poole well ſtored choice fiſh prince alighted horſe let feede paſture meane time looking could ſée body ſuddaine might come endanger ſat downe water ſide beholding wherof droue many ſolemne fancy remembrance take little nap miſtres polinarda approached thoughtes alſo remembrance manifold courteſies receiued remained conſtantinople ſo ſome theſe motion prouoked good opinion ioy ſome number heauie lamentation eſpecially ſharp command miſtres loath breake mad abſent himſelfe conſtantinople longer otherwiſe hee would gladly haue done theſe thought hee fell ſound ſleepe foure damoſels came walking foorth caſtell beholding prince chéekes dewed teares eye lid redde ouermuch wéeping conſtrained great compaſſion one damoſels rare excellent beautie called certaine ſeruants helpe caried prince faire chamber caſtel cauſing armes faſtened together chaine ende might vſe reſiſtance againſt awaked found himſelfe great alteration ſo ouercome griefe knew ſay ladie bearing great affection euery inſtant changed colour witneſſed ardent loue ſhée conceiued minde laſt made manifeſt ſum deſire whereto palmerin meanes would giue conſent deſirous ſhunne occaſion whereby hée might bée thought diſloyal lady determined depart thence without horſe armour onely auoide importunate ſute moued lady ſuch extreame griefe ſhe violated bondes reaſon whoſe limit duty alwaies warned kéep within ſéeing neither tear intreatis might mollifie heart ſhe commanded brought chamber iron made faſt leg great ſpéeches giuen forth terrifie becauſe would vſe pittie outragious paſſions palmerin eſtéeming either ſelfe word bare greater affection clogging iron amorous ſpéeches lady could vſe laſt turned hee hot loue extreame hatred ſo abſenting ſelfe companie cauſed bée vſed rigorous manner crueltie long time laſting woonted affectiō cauſed repent haſty fury mind ſhe thought diſcharge prince ſéeking meanes poſſible baniſh memorie cauſe ſhe incloſed ſelfe chamber labouring example preſent proofe extinguiſh furious flame continuall paſſions ſhe ſaw nothing would ſerue griefe driuen impoſſible cure ſhe concluded kéepe prince priſon ſo long length ſhee would glut ſelfe remembrance elſe laſt prine would ſo wearie able longer endure cruell practiſes ſhe vſed would repent ſo long deniall ſo bee enforced accompliſh amorous deſſre palmerin hauing already made faithful vowe loue torment cruelty would perſwaded violate promiſe ſmall griefe lady frequented himſelfe ſtill woonted ſute alſo obſtinacy encreaſed ſeuerall deuiſes cruelty chap lxv florian remaining court england made ſuch entreatie behalfe orianda ſiſters daughter imbarqued ſelfe greece tempeſt ouerreacht ſuch violent meane ship attained coaſt ireland would needes goe land albeit maſter ship perſwaded contrary land ſuch fortune met giant calfurnien whoſe ſtrength although redoubted indeede yet good hap gaue honour death bloody fight receiued ſo many grieuous dangerous woundes could way haue eſcaped death ſelfe three lady daughter marqueſſe beltamor whome cruell giant kept perforce vſed ſuch honourable goodly prouiſion ſmall labour trauaile recouered ſound perfect eſtate aſſuring lord onely maſte high eſtimation friendly courteſie alſo confeſſe beltamor brother forenamed roſiran florian kiſſing highneſſe hand token vnſpeakable pleaſure hée receiued king wordes meanes edward noble father ſent poaſt al ſpéede bring lady court wel ſée king caſtle miragarda whoſe beautie ſo renowned thorow whoſe world great griefe ſuffered depart ſo trauaile paſſed court king redinde hee arriued caſtel almarol dramuſiande euen vanquiſhed thrée knight whereof one valiant pompides made florian ſomewhat abaſhed becauſe ignorant gentle dramuſiande wherefore deſirous hazard himſelfe combate prepared speare encounter dramuſiande ſeeing knowing florian deſart ſon deare louing friend edward againſt would haue entred fight caſe ſatiſfie lady miragarda met ſo ſtrongly diſmounted earth vp againe roſe fell violently swordes ſo much dramuſiande would beaſt bargaine florian bragge choiſe made combate ſo dangerous iudged likeſt victory miragarda leaning window extolled maruelouſly hautie valure ſo excepting combate triſtfull knight palmerin ſhe gaue onely commendation ſingular fight continued ſuch outrage betweene conſtrained retire take little breathing dramuſiande féeling proweſſe aduerſary ſuppoſed florian deſart therefore concluded many time diſcouer himſelfe without bringing combat ende fearing leaſt ſhould reported gaue ouer want courage maintain quarrell changed opinion hée ſo deſirous finiſh intent faire miragarda ſecretly began manner déere miſtreſſe know merite trauailes ſhall bée burie commendation pi • te obliuion little regard yet great inſupportable griefe ſo vnkindly requited neuertheleſſe ſo great conqueſt haue gained dramuſiande truſtie loyall friend siluian ſooner ſpoken theſe wordes preſentlie threw downe sword embracing one another ſuch gentle ſalutations though greateſt f • iends world florian greatly amazed ſée siluian without maſter wherefore hee demaunded thing hapned vnderſtood loſſe brother hee remained griefe beyond perſwaſion ſo determined goe ſtraight conſtantinople failed would ſéeke world ouer
