intending iourney toward conſtantinople thinking find noble couragious knight worthily prooued themſelues onely perfect flower chiualry wherevpon took ſhipping next hauen fortune fauouring honourable intent dayes brought caſtle wherein noble palmerin england remained priſoner staying reſt themſelues beheld damoſell mounted white palfray accompanied two eſquires come foorth caſtle knight preſently tooke way friendly gréeting requeſted goodly caſtle belonged demand might hindrance haſty affaire whereto damoſell made anſwere albeit gentleman buſines wherin muſt preſently imploy ſelfe matter waight great importance yet gentle demaunds ſpéech outward behauiour hath commanded ſtay til haue ſatiſfied deſire caſtle firſt founded commandement noble couragious prince bazelie ſometime king nauer • ed deceaſed princeſſe arnalte faire daughter come unhabite ancient famous manſion ſhe vnwilling gouerne people reaſon ſhe yong yeeres alſo vnmarried committed guiding ſo waighty charge ſuch honourable perſons court ſhee knew vertueus wiſe diſcrete vſe iuſtice vſurping enemie equitie louing ſubiects generall time ſhe hath remained report hath blazed abroad aduentures finiſhed caſtle giant almarol maintenance beauty faire miragarda whoſe ſtately magnificence ſo highly cōmended cauſe ſhe ſuppoſeth ſhée beloued knight remaineth caſtle ſhe heareth great loue affection beliefe ſhe hath cōmanded goe ſée princeſſe miragarda whereby ſhe may certified beauty ſo highly extolled may ſurmount wherewith nature hath ſo plentifully adorned ſelfe ſo fall princeſſe miragarda carry credit ſhe minded deliuer knight ſhall remaine longer priſoner lady prooue ſuperiour canonized ſpectacle know ſhe put knight death conſidering iniury hath offred hath ſo much abaſed ſelfe beare vngrateful perſon ſuch affection ſhe gather knowledge acquaiatance florian well pondering damoſelles wordes ſomewhat pleaſantly diſpoſed withall demanded beauty miſtreſſe might compare indifferent condition ſhee owne mruſt sir quoth ſhe finde thing deſerued beare title beautie ſhall chance haue ſight lady ſay haue made ſimple compariſon fayre damoſell ſaide florian would followe counſell ſhould make ſtay haſty iourney credite miragarda much beautiful lady quoth pompides let theſe word ſéeme ſtay miſtreſſe commaund procéede enterpriſe ſhall ſée neither v worthy vſe talke ſo ſhal ſaue life knight ſhe loueth certifie lady certaine report hath pleaſed knight ſay wordes ieſting neuer ſawe faire miragarda ſéemes sir knight anſwered damoſell haue béene affectioned faire view princeſſe ſo readily ſtand witneſſe behalf beautie deſire therefore returne princeſſe lady ſo ſhall ſaue iourney able ſpeake vpon iudgement perhaps might ſtray vſing affection alighting horſes went altogether caſtle damoſell gaue lady vnderſtand ſhe met two knight lately come caſtle almaroll could large informe concerning beauty faire miragarda princeſſe arnalte glad theſe newes cauſed fayre chamber prouided two knight diſarmed themſelues taking little eaſe wearie trauaile ſhée came courteouſly welcommed caſtell ſhewing commodity might vrge pleaſure walking forth pondes ſide ſitting downe vnder cipreſſe tree pleaſant ſhadow ſhe began manner gentleman albeit ignorant accept wordes manner ſhall pleaſe ſhape mee anſwere yet ſo timerous without ill ſuſpect may craue ſuch leaue cut doubt hath long time concealed ſuch time king father gouerned countrey finiſhed courſe terreſtriall time betooke ſelfe liue ſolitarie habitation till gouernors kingdome choſen ſuch phéere might reſpects ſatiſfie late deceaſed lord father fortune enemy al mine action permitted vnknown knight happen caſtell made ſuch choiſe onelie man loued becauſe neuer liked ſo according affection concluded lord mee princely poſſeſſions hee neither regarding bountie beauty applieth himſelfe ſo diſdainful gentle deſire rather taketh pleaſure iron wherewith haue charged princely offer whereto haue chaſen although great deſpiſing inſupportable torment yet haue diſſembled diſquietnes ſuppoſing affection ſome hath ouercharged wittes ſo could perceiue honour wherewith preſented yet opinion vſed fondly ſelfe lady beauty ſufficient win princeſſe miragarda onely excepted whoſe report filleth euery climate extolling benefit yet becauſe ſome doubt commanded one damoſels take iourney thither ſee beautie might ſtand equall ſo ſhe onely perfect without compariſō determined ſet knight libertie found deſerue high title ſhee would reward puniſhment according diſdainfull nature worthily deſerue horian well noting proud minde arnalte determined cauſe abide vaine opinion thus truly madam would vſe torment knight let perſiſt obſtinate p • ruerſe minde ende puniſhment owne follie himſelfe ſhall lament ſtate loſſe hereupon aſſure ſelfe yt princeſſe miragarda faire ſhe famed yet li • le beholding knight conſidering feature liuely bee ſeene one vniforme might hardly iudged ſhould ſooneſt abaſed princeſſe arnalte wel pleaſed theſe word floriā ſtedfaſtly ſetting coū tenance vpon euen lightly ſhe grounded loue palmerin ſo according mutability vnſtedfaſt womā ſhe began gr • w great good liking vtterly aboliſhing pelmerin memory though ſhe neuer ſeene life wherefore euery part repleniſhed vnſpeakeable ioy ſhe tooke knight hand returned caſtell againſt comming table ready couered ſat downe florian deſired ſée knight whoſe requeſt immediatly ſent florian pompides ſight able conceale great ioy ſuſtained eſpecially siluian imbraced maſter caſt himſelfe féet neuer ſo glad life preſent made arnalte ſo amazed ſhe wiſhed al departed caſtle wel downe ſat feaſted honour great reuerence supper ended palmerin pompides l • dged one chamber together faire chāber prouided prince florian ſhe gaue ſuch friendlie entertainement ſtaied ſpace eight day florian knight would néedes depart ieauing princeſſe penſiue ſorrowfull depart company ſhe deſired ſo faine made promiſe ſo ſoone could would returne hereon departed merrily away princeſſe arnalte greatly commending good fortune ſhe hoped prince florians returne ſhe doubt win heart litle ſight fallen ſuch obliuion made ieſt brother pompides great fauour arnalte beſtowed chap lxvii palmerin england florian brother pompides departed caſtle princeſſe arnalte met faire florenda daughter arnedes king france whoſe requeſt florian ran twelue knight kept princeſſe company prograce time iuſt damoſell came intreated palmerin haue helpe finiſhing ſtrange aduenture preſently departed iuſt ended pompides prince florian rode palmerin giue aide hee ſtoode neede theſe thrée knight thus departed princeſſe arnalte palmerin way r • de siluian aſide hee expreſſed great perpleritie wherein remained loue hee bare faire lady miſtreſſe polinarda feared approach becauſe cōmandement ſhe gaue ſuch time departed conſtantinople whereto siluian vſed kind perſwaſion ſhe giuen angry ſpéeches rather try conſtancy mooue conceiue opinion diſcourteſie palmerin would hardly giue credance wordes becauſe ſuppoſed heard already could vanquiſh triſtfull knight entring combate controuerſie betwéene beauty princeſſe miragarda oppreſſed minde many grieuous thought much diſpleaſant florian pompides altogither ignorant cauſe heauineſſe ridden certaine dayes came laſt valley kingdome france vnder fine ſhadowe trées perceiued foure faire tent erected whereupon placed twelue goodly shieldes moſt admiration braue company lady diſported themſelues vnder gréene trées knightes reioycing finde company ſuch ſolitarie place betooke themſelues preſently toward tentes ſuddaine came foorth one tent knight attyred faire armour thicke beſet golden glaſſes hauing put helmet mounted stéede tooke ſtrong lance hand preparing himſelfe couragiouſly enter iuſte courtly attendant gréeteth courteſies poſſible giuing vnderſtād delighting ſelfe ride prograce ſhe ſtayeth pleaſant valley til heat day ſomwhat declined much ſhe hath ſeene perfect appearance knightly worthy behauiour ſhe deſireth fauour requeſt ſo much would breake fewe lance certaine knight fulfilling whereof cauſe reward honourable thankes truſt ſaid palmerin deſire fulfill occaſion may found pleaſant princeſſe florenda ſeeing pleaſure ſee v iuſte certifie remaine gratious cōmand ſooner eſquire deliuered anſwere princeſſe florendos knight came foorth tentes florian hauing obtained leaue firſt iuſte encountred firſt knight ſuch hautie courage ſent meaſure length earth manner ſerued fiue without breaking lance ſixt ſheuered piece wherefore pompides deliuered launce glad ſee ſpéede ſo luckily princeſſe ſomewhat mooued ſee knight foyled ſo faſt one exhorted make better proofe chiualrie meane damoſell came croſſing valley blacke palfray yeelding ſelfe foote renowned palmerin began vtter theſe ſpeeches deſire sir knight honour haue receiued knightly déedes armes inſtant conceiue ſuch courage followe ſhall receiue greateſt praiſe giuing ayde life time neuer gained like palmerin bare armes ſuccor weake eſtate diſtreſſed deſired pompides kéepe brother florian company fayling ayde finiſhing noble enterpriſe would long returned againe ſo giuing conge lady rede away haſt damoſell one lady belonged princeſſe florenda ſéeing palmerin depart ſuch ſuddaine came pompides theſe wordes truely sir ſéemeth deſerue beare armour afraide ſhould much bruiſed ſuffer companion depart alone knowing miſhap damoſell hard fortune may hap attach knight lady anſwered pompides gentlewoman gouernmēt ſo good knight dare awarrant ſhe ſhall haue little cauſe feare becauſe ſhall net account ſuch cowardiſe preſently direct courſe rather behold hardy pr • weſſe thinke ſhould ſtand néede helpe wherevpon tooke leaue lady endeuoured himſelfe way prince gone ſo far outreacht pompides could ouertake good florian hauing diſmounted eight kuights could deale becauſe laace broken one lady came preſented another deſiring breake one lance ſake florian thanked lady courteouſly promiſing employ lance preſent come hand would aduenture life ſeruice witneſſe prepared himſelf againſt ninth knight hauing good opinion himſelfe began order ſpeake prince haue great deſire ſir knight try valour ſuch eſtimation hope ſhall manifeſt haue yet ſeene thus concluding ſpéeches caſting eye vpon carmelia handmayde princeſſe florenda choſen chiefe miſtreſſe heart couched ſpeare againſt prince • c • urteous manner turning princeſſe florenda vttered ſpéeches wiſe faire miſtres account diſhonour vanquiſhed knight attempt euer remaineth victor princeſſe vnderſtood florian deſart ſomwhat allied word gaue faire lady anſwered florian ſuch knight ſure bée ready time employ himſelfe ſeruice named pompides brother euer approoued good friend humbly pray ſaid lady would excuſe greateſt offence haue vngently offred florian promiſed would accompliſh ſo taking leaue princeſſe florenda noble company poſted apace way prince palmerin tooke ſtanding great feare leſt miſchance ſhould happen vnto chap lxviii damoſell hauing brought palmerin faire florenda conducted caſtle duke ronſillion enterpriſed combat redeeme three lady duke kept priſoners put death great haſt made lady conducted palmerin way vſing word till came litle village dukedom ronſillion ſhe deſired prince ſtay ſhe would go village ſhée would ſtay returne preſently meane palmerin tooke helmet ſat downe reſt becauſe ſomewhat weary trauaile damoſell returning beholding ſo young beautifull ſhe deſpaired herſelfe able fulfill earneſt deſire cauſe ſhe preſently fell teares palmerin knowing cauſe ſorrow deſired ſhe would expreſſe whereupon ſhe began anſwere thus alaſſe sir knight cauſe haue lament order onely infortunate woman world haue trauelled whole kingdome france thinking find valiant renowned knight perceiue greatly deceiued thought intreat princeſſe florenda giue one moſt ſtrong hardy knight finding company thoſe vnhorſed lord great valiancie ſo good opinion intreated follow rehearſing perillous danger ſhould bring place ſhould put déedes proofe finde ſo young ſuch ſmall force voyde hope haue good ſucceſſe faire lady anſwered palmerin ſhall faile doe much power permitte perhappes cauſe haue better opinion ſee yet willing vſe therefore deſire tell intent haue cauſed • trauaile doubt aduenture life doe ſeruice thing ſoeuer sir quoth ſhe happy effect deedes would agrée wordes village remaineth three lady priſoners daughter one moſt noble lordes countrey becauſe father would giue mariage duke ronſilion two brother found meanes murther theſe three lady kept caſtle haue graunted commodity finde knight preuaile combat ſhall reſtored former libertie prefixed appointed day combat muſt firſt tried againſt bramerin chiefe gentleman belonging duke one moſt renowned knight countrey chance vanquiſhed muſt hazard ſelf againſt cliaſter alfarin two kinſmen yet theſe conquere returne victorie muſt deale duke two brother knowen ſuch ſtoute noble knightes one conceiue courage deale yet muſt lady day finde knight auenge quarrell elſe duke hath ſworne ſhall looſe heades put lady ſome hope went told brought knight would vndertake deale cauſe duke ſooner hearing hee began greatly offended surely ſaide palmerin muſt néedes venture ſelfe thoſe take vpon vſe cruelty faire lady alwaies diſallow king prince ſhould ſuffer iniury vſed lady within dominion token deed ſhall agrée word goe preſently abiding duke inuay ſo much againſt owne wicked ſhall worke ouerthrow damoſell perceiuing noble minde palmerin little doubt deale enemy vſed better affectition thē ſhe whereupon ſhe broght caſtle duke made abode ſée ende noble enterpriſe chap lxix palmerin come caſtle entred fight behalfe three lady wherein hee vanquiſhed bramerin ſlew cliaſtar alfarin fought duke two brother againſt hee preuailed reſtored lady prince gentlewoman come caſtle aſſembled great multitude people ſée combate drawebride let downe duke commaundement palmerin prepared enter caſtle bramarin prouided ſeeing enemy face came vnto theſe wordes abide sir knight approach farther muſt deale belieue haue made ſuch ill bargaine ſee ware bragge peny worthes truſt sir anſwered palmerin euer happen muſt hold content opinion right belongeth returne beſt aduantage therefore fully determined fight becauſe feare ſhall lacke daylight finiſh mine enterpriſe syr ſayde knight ſhall néede complaine lacke time warrant wee ſhall ende right ſoone leaſt wiſe ſo chance faile ſhall deale ſuch fellowes caſtle loth prolong time giuing ſcope horſes met ſpeares ſo nobly together bramerin throwne ground void féeling palmerin perceiuing alighted horſe ſet sword throate theſe word yéeld varlet ſweare henceforth neuer iniury oppreſſed lady sword thou ſhalt die death bramerin ſéeing life ſtand ſuch ieopardy deferred fulfill deſire palmerin mounting horſeback entred caſtle court eſpied chaſter alfarin faire gréene armour thicke beſet azure flower beheld palmeria ran againſt fiercely sword hee ſaluted one ſo ſoundlie head made ſure enough harme fellow perceiuing came behaued himſelfe great courage againſt prince ende palmerin brought vnder obeyſance demaunding would yeeld made anſwer becauſe thought ſome would come reſkew palmerin ſéeing ſo obſtinate failed ſend head ſhoulders al ſo happy eſcape without hurt whereupon came gentlewoman aſked thing el wherin ſhe would haue imploy ſeruice certainly ſir quoth ſhe ſee danger withdraw coruage muſt hazard ſelfe againſt duke brother vſe combat aboue caſtell pray god ſend fortunate ſucceſſe hitherto haue againſt theſe iii knight hope wherof leaue company partner al combat ſhall try deliuer theſe three diſtreſſed lady gentlewoman thus concluded talk ſhe ſhewed ſtaires ought aſcend might find duke brother palmerin commanding siluian ſtay comming without tooke ſword went vp till laſt came faire hall beheld three lady ſitting attyred blacke endued ſuch ſingular beauty greatly lamented vngentle oppreſſion long ſtood beholding perceiued thrée knightes well armed come lady one began manner faire lady ſhould procure ſo great miſfortune ſelues alſo labour worke ruine deſtruction cauſe three knight haue béen ſo cruelly abuſed whoſe deathes entend reuenge ſo ſharpely liues ſhall ſatiſfie part loſſe wherat champion ſhall little pleaſed fully ſatisfied duke ſpake theſe word came lady accompanied brother bearing one manner deuiſe ſhields cupid chaſed away leauing bow arrowes bloody broken peeces duke aduanced himſelfe palmerin wiſe sir knight ſuffiſe ſelfe ſlaughter knight yeelde ſelfe friendly hand ſurely would bee great griefe bée death ſo good knight whereto palmerin ſhaped anſwer sir thing abuſe albeit place ſuppoſe may command come ſuch ende rather conſtraine vſe recompence theſe lady haue ſo highly offended fauour ſeeke hand duke brother ſtrooke freely palmerin ſide charged couragiouſly lady weeping deſtred god force prince ſhew ſome fauour louing regard vnto well perceiued dangerous fight eſpecially ſide contend againſt three yet end ſuch valor high good fortune one one ouercame duke ſeeing brother vanquiſhed himſelfe left alone abide hazard tooke occaſion pauſe theſe word pray sir knight thinke good tell name whence may know ſhall vanquiſh leaſt ſhall remaine victor ouer mee sir ſaid palmerin knowledge ſo needeleſſe ſtand ſatiſfie deſire firſt let v make end combat perhaps let vnderſtand belike quoth duke make ſuch account victory admit leiſure parley well ſince ſo bent yet conceiue ſuch weakneſſe ſelfe make ſute fauour began againe great effuſion blood witneſſing perillous danger fight laſt duke conſtrained fal downe foote prince il pleaſed ſhrewdly handled eſpecially becauſe thought neuer ſee lady miſtreſſe againe wherefore humbling himſelfe deſired prince ſaue life alwaies accuſtomed great pittie ſeeing ſo affectionate towardes lady tooke ground armes promiſing vſe matter ſuch ſort would make highly eſteemed duke receiued prince offer vpon condition ſhe ſcorned mercifull vnto ſhould preſently bereaue life becauſe vnpoſſible ſuffer ſuch furious ſharpe aſſaults hee daile proued ſake chap lxx palmerin hauing conquered duke brother procured ſuch meanes three lady cauſed married together florian pompides arriuing palmerin departed towards conſtantinople great broyle fully finiſhed thinges ordained decent order ſuddaine entred hall twentie souldiers two knightes well armed ſpake aloude neceſſary ſhould ſlaine killed moſt famous noble knight world wherewith came palmerin defended himſelfe sword intending butcher ſhould firſt lay hand duke ſéeing ſo great tumult riſen without knowledge put himſelfe betwéene deſiring farther pauſe matter might taken vp quietly duke canducted chamber palmerin went chamber lady woundes diligently dreſſed organel duke chirurgion carefull euer hée duke lord time palmerin ſtaied lady reported great eſtimation duke brother made alſo cauſe ſharpe dealing onely becauſe denied loue diuers report lady eſteemed laudable honeſt ſo granted themſelues onely bée ruled gouerned aduiſe p • lmerin becauſe ſtood ſo much friend therefore promiſed graunt thinke well ſeeing determined nothing might ſtand owne honeſty maintenance honour palmerin ſo ioyfull ſée lady conformable appointment made account conqueſt honour receiued combate wherefore walked duke chamber hée imbraced declared good agreement conuerſiō lady whereat duke receiued ſuch content great remained ſound come himſelfe againe began manner vtter ſpee ••• sir knight hand haue receiued damage muſt need confeſſe recompence double ſo bee deed agree word blame sir ſomewhat hard beleefe haue brought onely comfort 〈◊〉 life worthy sir ſaid palmerin haue ſpoken grace ſhall find effect according doubt brother ſhall laſt purchaſe delight neither long ſtudy compulſion could bring paſſe continued talke two knight 〈◊〉 ſouldiers came duke chamber helmet palmerin ſéeing two brother florian pompides ran imbraced great ioy deſirous know ſped iouſting princeſſe florenda florian rehearſed point point alſo manner happened thither duke ſéeing theſe three knight brother ſuppoſed perſons ſome great birth wherefore commanded organeli becauſe drew towards night conduct chamber palmerin certified done caſtle alſo marriage appointed betweene duke brother thrée lady thus diſcourſed till ſléepe commanded leaue morning duke brother married lady dragonell ſecond brother choſe armiſia ſecond ſiſter darofant eſpouſed ariſmena yongeſt feaſt ſolemnized marueilous great royaltie palmerin diſcouered himſelfe brother made duke conceiue better opinion himſelfe beene foyled ſuch worthy knight ſheweth great honour time ſtaying longer thē would haue doue pleaſure duke lady length taking leaue honourable company departed thence intending goe ſtrait conſtantinople chance come turne againe chap lxxi targiana turkes daughter commanded knight albayzar goe caſtle giant almarol maintnine beautie againſt princeſſe miragarda arriued entred combate dramuſiande able vanquiſh wherefore night tooke downe shield miragarda brought thence away new muſt wee leaue prince palmerin brother hauing left duke lady trauailing iourney towards conſtantinople let v ſée hath happened caſtle almarol maintaining beautie faire miragarda haue already certified olori • que alchediane soldane babilon left ſonne behind great enemy chriſtendome ſeeing himſelfe brought deſpiſing fortune determined follow courſe knightly aduentures make valour knowne among number moſt famous knight happened firſt went great turk co • rt ſtored couragious knight better meane try hardineſſe proued ſo effectuall aboue fame attributed patterne chiuallry named albayzar became amorous ſeruant targiana turkes daughter onely name beautie giuen thorow turkes dominion loue vſually augmenter mindes endeauour themſelues vnder obeyſance hauing en • lamed hart albayzar maketh forſake wonted liberty wander ſolemne conceit inucigled fancy made brooke paſſions meekely hauing receiued originall griefe ſuch excellent occaſion pargiana likewiſe bearing good affection would 〈◊〉 loue ſuch ſoueraigntie • uer proteſtations ſweete pa • ley often confeſſed ſo hauing platforme 〈◊〉 order inuention ready aduenture ſhall giue charge finiſh hath bin blazed abroad spaine caſtle giant almarol remaineth prince named miragarda reported onely goddeſſe beauty becauſe god neuer frame one beautifull ſhe yea iudgement thoſe haue ſeene picture truly iuſtly figured perfect proportion shield placed caſtle deſireth muſt firſt aduēture ſtrength report tell affirmeth leſſe faire aduenture ſelfe hath béen tried famous place ſhould haue depart preſently trauaile fauour defence beauty ſhew hauty courage againſt giant champion fortune ſuffer vanquiſh neuer greater pleaſure bring hither shéeld faire miragarda returne pray iourney conſtantinople court emperour palmerin may witneſſe ſelf againſt thoſe dare denie moſt faithful ſeruant faireſt princeſſe aliue fulfilling hereof maketh lord mine gracious lady anſwered albaizer ſee preſent perfect loue beare vouchſafe employ honorable ſeruice whereto preſently betake ſelfe promiſing bring shéeld miragarda place féet becauſe lady world ought humble ſelues thus breaking ſpéeches took leaue wearing fine greene armour wheron wrought many golden spheares sheeld vpon field siluer hee bare deuiſe phaenix vnder written golden letter name targiana trauailing thus diuers kingdomes laſt arriued caſtle giant almarol ſoone combat dramuſiande finiſhed prince florian albayzar perceiuing number ſhields trée eſtéemed greatly valure power accompliſh ſo rare exploit hee beheld picture miragarda could chuſe confeſſe aduantage ſhe aboue lady targiana neuertheleſſe hée would put due execution albeit night could time ſo farre ſpent morning preſented himſelf caſtle dramuſiande aduertiſed arriuall armed himſelfe came foorth horſeback ſo litle friendly greeting paſſed betwéen couched speares third encounter ſent one ground couragiouſly drew forth ſwords deliuering ſuch cruell aſſaults one another miragarda lady highly commend yet ſhée ſtood feare leſt albayzar ſhould vanquiſh dramuſiande albayzar life time felt ſuch hardy blowes thought promiſe ſo certain departed frō princeſſe targiana dramuſiande found enemy ſo ſtrong could hardly aſſure himſelfe victory ſo cruelly deale one another wounded one another ſuch grieuous maner one would haue thought poſſible life could remaine whereupon dramuſiande began thus faire miragarda good lady doe refuſe ſeruant ſo great néede hath neuer done ſeruice ſhall cauſe dramuſiande loſe recompence thinketh trauels haue worthily deſerued ſide alybazar cōplaints princeſſe targiana deſirign remember fauor ſufficient ouercom enemy ſo commending ſelfe god mahound began afreſh dramuſiande long fought yet neither could preuaile thought themſelues indifferently matched ſo night approaching made thē leaue combat finiſh next day could dramuſiand entred lodging meaning morrow ende ſtrife one way albayzar retired ſame minde knowing reſt night hee might better deale dramuſinde morrow returned trée shield remembring promiſe made lady euery one faſt aſleepe tooke downe ſhield prineſſe miragarda hée purpoſed beare turkie firſt would paſſe court emperonr palmerin according lady targiana commanded fearing leaſt ſhould purſued ſtayed place till twenty mile thence bearing ſhield couered body ſhould know lodged ſtayed vntill wound healed ſorrowfull becauſe could vanquiſh dramuſiande bring perfect prize lady targiana chap lxxii albayzar departed shield miragarda dramuſiande left caſtle almarol followe armello brought word prince florendos shield made preſently leaue ſhepheards kinde life fellowe ſhepheard tooke themſelues trauaile dramuſiande hauing dreſſed wound ſo well might ſo ſhort ſpace morning returned trée intending ende combate leaue life field began gréete picture miragarda according hée woo •• found himſelfe diſpoſſeſt thereof hée taken ſuch ſorrow could abide place ſought trée could finde began ſuſpect knight againſt maintained combat caried away wherefore ſecretly might concluded perſue preſently ſtaying till princeſſe miragarda certified thereof becauſe hee could yéelde account ſhée ſo faithfully committed kéeping determined ſéeke world ouer would reuenged diſcourteous knight whoſe treaſon rehearſed giant almarol tooke leaue ſtaying til wound healed yet thinking danger wherein tooke himſelfe trauell dramuſiande gone miragarda vnderſtood ſhield ſtollen knight dramuſiande determined trauaile made take ſomwhat heauily thinking though dramuſiande gone recouer againe yet miſhap ſhould knowne triſtfull knight would take weapon followe offered ſo great diſcorteſie ſhe repoſed better confidence dramuſiande armello ſeeing ſhield ſtollen dramuſiande gone order good hope maiſters good fortune made trudge haſt fromthe caſtell way went riuer theſin till laſt found kéeping shéepe fountaine ſtaying himſelfe heard ſound flute often ſtayed vtter complaint euercharged minde ſo armello greatly mooued heare lamentation came hée litle neere behold face ſo much offended eſſuſe teares armello could iuſily ſay whether 〈◊〉 féete fate another shepheard ſimply apparelled playing many delightfull deuiſes vpon flute ſo armello verily thought place wilderneſſe woe ſight made ſuch caſe kn • w way beginne tale well knew lord minded ſuch 〈◊〉 life ſuch 〈◊〉 left caſtell giant almarol yet hardly knowe wherefore encouraging himſelfe approched vnto theſe ſpéeches pray friend report ſome tidings young knight loue hath cauſed vndertake ſolitary kinde life eſtate doeth rather command vſe knightly armes truſt friend anſwered shepheard ſelfe ſo cruelly vrged outrage loue hardly endure make anſwere loue hath allowed miſfortune neuer day houre minute quietneſſe prince florendos began order oh ſir doe ſéeme blame loue ſo much haue ſuſtained loſſe impute féebleneſſe fortune loue let alone complaine loue armello caſt good view vpon knew lord albeit changed remembrance wherefore falling féete deſired execute himſelfe ſuch extreame griefe would fauour himſelfe ſome pittie would greatly diſpleaſe power command otherwiſe florendos ſomewhat offended himſelfe done thing might diſpleaſe beſt beloued armello ſéeing ſtayed thus sir haue taken paine come hither might vnderſtand matter greatly profite dramuſiande hath long time kept ſhield miragarda many knight hath brought vnder obeyſance ſuch miſfortune shielde ſtollen thence knight ſhe hath hope recouer meanes florendos whoſe heart already ſtroken ſuddaine ioy began manner armello wiſh goe ſuccour ſeeing ſcant able helpe ſelfe may weaknes preſume againſt one chiefeſt ſtrength could conquer one onely knight neuertheles becauſe wil ſtill remaine ſorrow hitherto hath daily vſually borne mee company followe knight hath borne away shield lady make yéelde againe fortune ſend victory againſt ſhall trouble ſorrowes world thus riſing vp deſired fellow ſhepheard delight accompany heauineſſe beare company leaue ſad ſilent kind life follow noble exerciſes wherin béene alwaies trained albeit ſimple yet béene tried good knight armes knight though content ſorrowful life yet power refuſe requeſt gentle p florendos whoſe amitie left ſhéepe went towne hard remained till ſtrong enough endure trauaile time ſtay made fine new blacke armor alike without deuiſe becauſe prince would knowne made ſend armor caſtle almerol departed thence trauailed ſéeke ſhield faire miragarda trauailed lōg togither miſaduenture vnhappily parted ſhall certified hereafter chap lxxiii knight bare florendos company shepheard occaſion parted company albayzar proceeded shield miragarda becauſe ſhall vnderſtand knight kept florendos company hiſtorie declareth knight priſoners edward departed realme england floramā prince sardignia tooke trauailes coaſt spaine purpoſing trye aduentures princeſſe miragarda becauſe arriued caſtle almarol florendos gone england try aduenture caſtle dramuſiand leiſure ſufficient behold muſe faire portrait miragarda ſéemed apparant eye entred prayſes ſurpraiſes beautifull image made deſire ſom knight would take way thither intent might ſhew ſome ſeruice gratious princeſſe ſeemelineſſe whoſe picture cauſed verily beléeue none world might compare beauty remained opinion old remembrance altea claimed one title cogitation vrged ſome motion ſtrife ariſe becauſe became leſſe affectionate miragarda knight behalfe ſo many ſhields wherevpon hee began order floraman wilt thou vndertake exerciſe armes ſéeing thou haſt power appeaſe thy tedious trauailes labouring get thou enrolleſt thy ſelfe farther thou waſt content vanquiſhed conſtantinople wherby thou mightſt ſhun follow deceitfull loue art thou deſirous enter armour fortune fly thée thou able way endure oh blinded affection muſt roue euery ſtranger knoweſt ſtrange loue made thée late ſéeing late come knowledge mine errour haue gone ſo far cannot returne without féet wet purpoſe purſue fortune hath allowed mee labourſome life reſigning ioy thoſe wont familiar contenting heauines ſince way eſchew happe ſéeing graue meeteſt dead man ſolitarie wilderneſſe comfortleſſe wretch meane beare company mournfull heart ſo long ſhe ſhall die ſée twiſe dead time ſeeke ſhall miſhappes haue ful concluſion diſpaire ſtrike dead thus breaking lamentation walked along riuer theſin forſaking horſe armour al knightly behauior entring little ſhade trées determined liue ſolitarie greateſt contentation ſat kéeping shéepe play mournfull deuiſes vpon flute write graue barke trées certaine amorous ſonnets paſſions louer tree grew ſo ſeuerall sonnet flouriſhed vpon albeit reſolute liue al company yet florendos came vnto found ſo néere agréeing complexion manner motion coyned like ſtampe glad receiue partner heauineſſe liued together hearbes root pang griefe ſobbes ſighes ſalt teares daily foode ſuſtenance louer ſollace ſorrow till armello cauſed depart thence haue heard diſcourſed already ſo fortuned theſe two careful prince rode along sea ſide eſpied little galley comming towards wherein ſat lady endued ſuch ſingular beauty attyred blacke accompanied ſuch modeſt behauiour euery one might iudge bee ſome perſon nobilitie lady feete ſat two aged woman eſpying theſe two prince commanded marriners row shoare beholding prince rufully lady ſaluted ſort sir knight deſire one doe ſo great fauour come abord galley aide cauſe deſireth helpe one onely knight faire lady anſwered florendos beare armes purpoſe imploy ſelues aide diſtreſſed perſons ſo entring galley commanded armello eſquire take horſe expect comming caſtell giant almerol would faile méete thus leauing prince floraman galley launched forth quickly ſight wherefore rid deſiring company florendos became maruellous affectionate trauailed thrée day came ſtrong bridge foure corner whereof foure faire ſtrong tower erected deſirous approch vnto eſpied knight willing paſſe denied ſaying would leaue shielde behind giue vp name ſigned writing cuſtome fortreſſe ſhould permitted paſſe quietly ill cuſtome anſwered knight ordained hinder ſuch ſelfe rather ſuch could make part good againſt enemie ſayde gaue ſhield bare eſquire receiued another ſo encountred knight bridge able withſtand force speare diſmounted horſe throwen water horaman ſomewhat abaſhed hardy encounter approached néere bride behold eſquires hand portrait faire princeſſe miragarda made deſirous ſtay ſée enterpriſe would take concluſion knight bridge ſooner giuen turne ouer one tower one ſounded horne vehemently ſound wherof knight came forth bearing hand mighty axe wherwith approching knight charged many ſharpe dangerous ſtrokes ende ſuch valour knight hee laide flate vpon ground giuing place another becauſe leiſure ariſe came foorth tall ougly giant bringing hand mace iron knight deliuered theſe taunt thou deſtroyer blood doe thy duty defend thy ſelfe reuenge horrible iniury thou haſt offered intend cutte thy body ſo many piece fowles ayre ſhall glutted thy carkaſſe knight refuſing giue anſwere couered himſelfe shield ſo betwéene giant began terrible dangerous combate ende knight named valiant albayzar ſo coniured giant left life albayzar ſore wounded ſeeing reſiſtance come entred foretreſſe ſtayed till able deale floraman deſired haue ſling get shield faire miragarda low eſtate eſtéeme great diſhonour aſſaile becauſe couragious mindes rather deſire encounter thoſe haue might reſiſt deale ſuch haue power defend themſelues wherfore paſt bridge knowing whither beſt take way deſire abſent himſelfe farre thence becauſe would looſe commoditie ſight albayzar meane time waſted away idle houres woonted ſilent amourous paſſions chap xlxiiii declared fortreſſe vpon bridge belonged albayzar behaued himſelf ſo worthily cuſtome ordained happened florendos ſailing galley lady circumſtance hiſtory mentioned duke artilio spaine daughter liuing enioy poſſeſſions nouriſhed company faire belizarda daughter king recinda loue hauing gained power aforeſaid lady cauſed fancied prince oniſtalde ſuch continuance betwéene end deſires happened take effect prince receiued order knighthood court emperor palmerin hee changed minde became affectionate towards princeſſe emperor court ſo forgat ducheſſe ſuch ſort neuer ſince departure fortune ſo ſée ducheſſe perceiuing vnkind dealing ſhée able er • lude memorie ordained cuſtome bridge ſhe caſtle cauſed paſſage kept giant lamortan two knighes linage ſuffered knight paſſe bridge without leauing shield name writing perſwading ſelfe deuiſe length recouer beloued oniſtalde ſake many knight great danger aſſailed themſelues ſtrange aduenture till valiant albayzar came ended cuſtome great griefe vexation ducheſſe neuertheleſſe bountie valure ſhe perceuied ſhe commanded hee ſhould bee honourably vſed till recouered hurt wound ſo albayzar ſtayed fortreſſe dutcheſſe good till laſt departed tooke iourney toward conſtantinople concerning prince florendos ſaled al night lady till morning diſcouered caſtle middeſt sea artificiall founded vpon rocke taking occaſion ſtrike ſhore ſhe began florendos manner sir knight declare cauſe haue brought place letting paſſe boldneſſe vnder knightly courteſie within caſtell abideth damoſell little vertue beauty vnderſtanding eſpouſed one faireſt lord countrey deuiſed meane acquaint ſelfe reporting knight depriued one caſtels ſo intreaty ſhe ſtay champion diſtreſſed cauſe time ſhe gotten caſtle ſhe fell ſuch vnlawfull liking ſhe vowed neuer ſuffer depart thence vnleſſe ſuch knight came could preuaile againſt fiue knightes maruellous ſtrength againſt one knight ſhee ſuffer champion enter combat ſo ſtand doubt neuer recouer louing lord huſband againe faire lady ſaith florendos ſend ſummon theſe fiue knight ſight meane prouide ſelfe ſtand defence shortly aduanced himſelfe toward caſtel gate eſpied fiue knight com forth falſe doore ſtrongly armed prince one began order sir knight wee eſteeme beſt yeeld ſelfe ſeeing fortune hath ſo much enemie conduct hither ſo ſhall find v friendly otherwiſe may incurre ſelfe double deſpite truſt ſaid florendos firſt intend trie crueltie vſe regard gentlenes afterward make anſwere intent vpon came aſſailed prince likewiſe behaued himſelfe great agility againſt ſo confeſſed neuer found ſuch valour remaine one knight neuer haue aſſayed perillous aduenture often ſtaied fell againe prince hauing ſlaine two lady vſing reprochfull wordes vnto fiue power preuaile againſt one ſet ſuch chafe began charge vnmercifull blowes ſeeing way eſcape becauſe one ſide ſea hindered caſtell could retyre lady within commanded gate made faſt wherefore two fell downe dead laſt knight ſéeing danger ſtood tooke point sword hand humbled himſelfe prince thus moſt worthy knight ſince fortune hath allowed honour victorie haue preuailed againſt companion let pitty enter heart ſaue life moſt humbly ſubmitteth himſelfe mercy grant thée thy life ſaid florendos becauſe bée thought ſuch bloody mind kill able reſiſt ſat downe reſt himſelfe lady vſing great care bind vp wound lady within caſtle ſtanding feare leſt ſtubbornnes might procure greater iniury ſent one damſels opened gate florendos ſéeing tooke lady hand entred caſtel met lord béen priſoner ſo long imbraced lady great thankes bringing knight liberty began order worthy ſir knightly déedes haue gained ſuch honour cannot make eſtimation according haue worthily deſerued ſhall pleaſe reſt yéeld courteſie depart together florendos gaue great thankes ſtayed ſée lady kept caſtle could attaine deſire becauſe ſhe made ſelfe faſt chamber ſo one might come haue ſight went ſée place lady vſed impriſon knight amongſt found prince guerin reioyced maruelouſly ſee florendos knowing finiſhed hard aduenture accounted himſelfe happy company eight day expired departed galley thence houſe knight lady guerin hee found themſelues ſo gratiouſly vſed béen court conſtantinople within tooke leaue knight lady gaue good horſe trauelling together parted one another becauſe florendos deſired iourney alone might better approoue aduenture fortune reſerued chap lxxv palmerin florian pompides trauaile met damoſell brought caſtle dramorant cruell found albayzar ſhield miragarda vanquiſhed twelue knight ſlew dramorant lord caſtle palmerin brother continuing trauaile towardes conſtantinople riding thorow forreſt ſaw lady come riding towards great feare come ſomewhat neare florian ſtaied palfray ſaying faire lady pray ſhewe v cauſe feare ala ſir quoth ſhe ſtay report thing ſéeing dare ſcant aſſure ſelfe company enterpriſed iourney court french quéene two knight came reſiſted endeuouring ſelues abuſe mine honour fortune ſo fauourable cry knight came defended cauſe behaued himſelfe ſo worthily againſt open fight ſlew paſſing caſtle end ſtone wal aſſailed twelue knight feare death ſpéedily holpen ſome good reſcue truſt gentleman loſſe would great one moſt hardy knight al world pray lady ſaid florian bring v caſtle knight remaineth ſuch danger ſeeme report great pittie ſuffer ſuch knight die lacke helpe although quoth ſhe otherwiſe determined yet bring place well try worthineſſe alſo ſhew good knight owne danger hath pleaſured ſo much ſaid rode together ſhort time heard clattering weapon found knight haue ſlaine fiue ſixe knightes behauing himſelfe alſo manfully againſt whereat prince fell great admiration lady ſéeing ſate ſtill looked began enter theſe wordes gentleman determined doe nothing came béene honour haue kept iourney rather ſuffer ſo good knight ſlaine preſence ſtand refuſing aid maketh iudge weapon ill beſtowed faire lady anſwered palmerin knight doeth ſo well diſcharge dutie ſhould offer great wrong preſumed aid ſo might cut praiſe ſhould worthily beare obtaining victory cauſe ſtay mary ſhould perceiue knight haue dangerous aduantage ouer would ſhewe ſuch ayde reſiſtance ſhould recall word haue better opinion v continued parle knight famous albayzar twelue knight left foure aliue vrged florian opinion word belieue knight ordained darkē déeds knight onely accepted déere brother palmerin wherevnto know neither may approch neuertheleſſe know one profeſſeth knightly armes would ſtriue exalt déeds ſeeing behauiour ſo noble champion fine perceiued knight ſlaine except two conſtrained yéelde themſelues noble conquerour preſently came forth dramorant himſelfe brauely mounted ſtrongly armed albayzar ſeeeing mounted horſe came prince palmerin brother manner pray gentleman beſtow one ſpeares vpon receiue knight prepareth himſelfe againſt aſſuring forget remēber courteſie ſo sir ſaid palmerin becauſe dutie fauour ſuch knight content giue mine mée thinkes ſeeing ſelfe ſore hurt ſhould reſt awhile referre iuſt one v albayzar taking speare palmerin ſaid fortune bée ſo much mine enemy ſhe ſuffer brought knight ſubiection ſhall haue better leiſure loue manifeſt proweſſe remaineth eſquire ſeeing maſter want ſhield came preſented portrait faire miragarda albayzar refuſing ſaid rather made looke employ vſe fight preparing himſelfe run dramorant ſéeing deſtitute ſheeld caſt owne ground theſe word albayzar ſory ſée thée poore eſtate becauſe victory might obtaine vanquiſhing thée cannot returne great honour becauſe thou ſhalt thinke haue aduantage thée giue thee priuiledge neuer yet ending talke fetched courſe met ſuch puſiſance forced fall ground ſore hurt riſing taking swordes beganne ſo fierce combat palmerin highly commend valour albayzar would gladly haue knowledge made begin manner truly make ſuch account detaineth puiſſance shield miragarda verily beléeue dramuſiande kéeping hath bin vanquiſhing brought ſubiection doth vrge great maruell ſeeing could obtaine little hand ſo knight ſo well diſpoſed would hazard ſelfe againſt bring ſhield place whence hath brought credite ſaid florian hardly beleeue dramuſiande yet vanquiſhed albeit déeds knight may mooue v thinke wherefore let firſt finiſh combat may reſolued doubt albayzar dramorant ſtroue ſo long together palmerin would haue parted labour vaine albayzar would meanes giue ouer till hée diſcharged dramorant vitall breath himſelfe point ready faint long trauaile alſo loſſe blood palmerin horian lady came ſuſtained leading caſtle better receiued looked good leiſure attend wound albayzar many alſo verie dangerous chap lxxvi florian albazar made defiance appointed end ſtrife court emperour palmerin becauſe ſhall vnderſtand dramorant cruel hiſtorie declareth eutropa aunt giant dramuſiande brother named dramorant one ſtouteſt giant time liued flouriſhing yéeres became amorous faire damoſell daughter wiſe diſcreete gentlewoman would giue conſent marriage wherefore tooke away perforce son named dramorant whoſe hauty valiant déeds time obtained name cruell chanced mother died trauell ſtrooke ſo déepe hart giant ſeeing dead whoſe loue life maintained extreame griefe dyed ſhortly wherfore child kept grandmother vntill ſuch time grew yeares ſtrength decent vertuous manner whole endeuour kill innocent rauiſh ſpoile fayre lady continuall inclination deſperate cruell attempt ſo feared countrey round vntil ſuch time albayzar came preuailed againſt haue heard palmerin florian pompides keeping company caſtle vntill attained better diſpoſition florian deſired report gotten ſhield miragarda quoth know wel thinke becauſe kept well knowne one beſt knight euer profeſſed armes sir ſaid albayzar haue woon ſhield proweſſe worthineſſe haue vanquiſhed vndertooke kéepe moreouer haue vowed onely preſent lady targiana whoſe knight obedient ſeruant till death alſo ſhew prince court world manifeſt knight dare auouch contrary lady targiana moſt faire noble princeſſe liuing opinion firſt goe court af emperour palmerin make proofe haue profeſſed florian hearing ſpéeches ſo proude arrogant greatly enuied thereat returned anſwere opinion sir enterpriſe returne ſmall aduantage ſhall finde court lady whoſe beautie targiana ſéeme altogether counterfeyte ſhall finde ſo many knight enter challenge doubt ſhall receiue ſhame ridiculous intent either fame praiſe way beare company albayzar great anger ſtaied florian theſe termes sir knight ſée wel eſtate preſent dare take paine come emperous court whither intend goe ſo ſoone may poſſible cauſe know farre beautie targiana doeth ſurmount lady name ſo dare enter combate hereon giue hand wil faile ſoone ſo may poſſible wher déedes ſhall witneſſe worthineſſe cauſe maintaine thrée prince vpon departed preſently leauing albayzar returne occaſion ſhall ſerue endeauoured themſelues ſo well trauaile arriued kingdom hungaria glad attained ſo néere conſtantinople palmerin remained former doubt concerning commaund lady miſtreſſe siluian onely phiſition theſe extreame paſſions gouerned maiſters cogitation excéeding well neuertheleſſe two brother perceiued ſomewhat yet durſt intrude themſelues matter rid till came place would take ſhipping paſſe greece mariner prouiding departure prince delighted walke along faire plaine long ſtaied eſpied coach couered blacke thrée eſquires droue making dolefull grieuous lamentation vpon mourneful ſpectacle florian approached coach lifting vp cloath beheld knight lying gréene armor ſo imbrued blood one could hardly iudge colour mooued florian great heauines deſirous know cauſe miſfortune came one eſquires willing report miſchance knight ſlaine eſquire hauing ſmall leiſure ſtay made ſhortly anſwere ſort deſire vnderſtand ye infortunate hap knight follow ſhall bring aduenture may atchieue ſuch rare renowne neither death time able extinguiſh memorie surely quoth florian haue alwayes deſired imploy ſelfe ſuppoſed greateſt danger yet could neither feare diſmay doubt hinder thus concluding ſpéeches followed coach deſirous ſée ende eſquire told palmerin pompides ſéeing gone ſo ſoone walked ſoftly along valley damoſel preſented ſelfe mounted blacke palfray ſaluted manner deſire gentleman one would ſo much fauour goe ſuccour lady thrée knight endeuour abuſe put herto death moſt cruel maner pompides hearing cōplait damoſell began thus prince palmerin séeing preſent enterprſe doth require force ſhowne therein pray giue leaue accompany damoſell may try fortune wil aſſiſt cauſe palmerin deſired alone company siluian glad pompides ſhould aſſiſt damoſell ſo taking leaue pompide • departed enterpriſe palmerin accuſtomed remembrance lady polinarda wherein waſted ſo much time could repaire place lodging glad night take reſt little thicket trées ſooner laid downe heard one complaine doleful maner drawing neare better heare night ſo darke could deſcrie one another heard heauy waight begin thus fond florendos doeſt thou thus complaine thy griefe ſéeing thy lady miragarda doeth take ſuch delight therein ſhe forceth vtter ruine ſubmitteth himſelfe chiefely vnder gratious regard knewe right well trauaile may ended deſire one doe ſeruice ſhall doe vſe ſuch entertainment may permit leaſure doeth moſt honour ſuffer forgotten depriued life whereby hee might haue leſſe occaſion complaine crueltie ending mo • e grieous ſigh ſate fel aſléepe palmerin perceiuing prince florendos determined oftentimes make himſelfe knowne fearing hinder enterpriſe changed minde bewailing much heauines florendos extreame caſe owne miſfortune day appeared hee departed ſecretly could thence away deſiring attaine emperours court might conclude ſeuerall motion doubt feare loue preſented oppreſſed minde chap lxxvii florian accompanying coatch dead knight met sea arduramet baſtard brother valiant albayzar defied combate haphened pompides following lady florian deſart kéeping company coach three eſquires great way ſight brother one began thus conferre syr ſeeing deſire ſo much knowe knight ſlaine ſeeme affectionate reuenge wrōg neede giue eare wil diſcourſe thereof large ſhall vnderſtand knight named sortibran eldeſt brother famous king friſol whoſe worthineſſe hath 〈…〉 beene ſuch hée euer bare name moſt 〈…〉 kingdome fortune little 〈◊〉 yeſterday conducted eſquire 〈…〉 wéeping teares deſired •• bran 〈…〉 doubtful cauſe wherto courteouſly gaue conſent thinking trecherous intent eſquire brought place wherefoure enemy awaighted comming ſetling himſelfe againſt ende sortibran cruelly ſlaine aduertiſed great miſhappe came fetch caſtle might ſee wounded body honourably interred meane one young sonnes gone court ſooke ſome knight reuenge father death therefore deſire dſiſiſt ſuccour caſe ſhall onely enlarge eternall renowne alſo ſhall worke ſuch occaſion none may dare preſume commit ſuch treaſon florian promiſing eſquires accompliſh requeſt rid till came sea coaſt entred galley attended comming hauing ſh ••• ed body sortibran ſailed away pleaſant gale winde long sea diſcouered foure turkiſh galleyes 〈…〉 preſently borded 〈…〉 moore 〈…〉 veſſell beholding 〈…〉 florian iudging noble knight entertained courteouſly commanding eſquires caſt dead body lord sea next morning heyſed ſailes goe iourney arduramet baſtard brother prince albayzar trauailing ſeeke giue vnderſtand soldane babylon father dead right ſucceede place arduramet talking florian demanded time heard prince albayzar reported ſuch mark token knew well vanquiſhed dramorant cruell bethinking combat aſſigned betwéen albayzar performed emperours court buſineſſe ſo chanced could meete appointed time begā greatly offēded himſelf ſo much arduramet deſired ſhew cauſe heauineſſe vnderſtood ſeuerall clauſe great anger hée began rage thinkeſt thou knight world may dare attempt againſt lord brother albayzar certainely thou art much beholding fortune deliuering thée ſo great danger neuertheleſſe thou haſt ſo great deſire ſhew thy proweſſe thou doſt ſéeme vſe proteſtation let v goe court great turke make thée confeſſe princeſſe targiana albayzar moſt honorable knight liuing earth ſhe onely perfect goddeſſe beauty beſide thou thinkeſt hath offred thée wrong thy ſtomacke ſerue thée thereto reuenge thy ſelfe die cauſe proofe wherof receiue gloue thou dare florian deſired manifeſt valour ſtrange country receiued gladly challenge arduramet thinking honour brother conqueſt florian went court great turke determination time leaue let v remember pompides trauailed damoſel till came thicket trées heard one make great clamour looking aſide beheld knight offering monſtrous diſhonour lady two knight ſitting horſebacke laughing ſimple ſhift ſhe made defend ſelfe villainous intent knight pompides able ſuffer ſo great ſhame ſight couched launce againſt abuſed lady ſo ran cleane thorow head laid dead ground dealing roughly twaine ſerued ſame ſauce iuſt deſert would abuſe themſelues ſo vile ſort came lady ſubmitted ſelfe féete pompides feare ſhe ſuſtained crueltie would hardly ſuffer vſe ſpéech wherefore pompides taking armes ſeing heauy eſtate great perplexitie comforted manner faire lady let feare ſéeme diſmay mind body ſuch imploy themſelues defence lord quoth ſhee theſe bloodie minded men haue brought ſuch feare albeit ſée dead face yet remembrance crueltie doeth ſtill make afraide wherefore deſire depart leaue mourne great miſhap elſe ſhall ſtill fearefull bird branch danger fowler pompides began ſmile ſée little truſt lady repoſed company neuertheleſſe minding ſatiſfie deſire beautifull alſo vertuous honeſt diſpoſition departed accompanied damoſel brought thither reported knight would haue rauiſhed lady met ſhe trauailed toward court king friſol newly come ſlaughter sortibran méeting endeuoured faire ſpéech allure luſt ſawe ſhe would conſent would vrge perforce pompides departing followed palmerin becauſe deſired trauell ſtill company chap lxxviii happned palmerin england departed prince florendos hee fighting giant bracandor albayzar arriued holpe ouercome enemy palmerin left florendos ſléeping trée came forreſt halfe mile citie buda king hungaria lay perceiued company knight lady fountaine wherefore fearing leaſt company might bee ſome hinderance trauaile turned horſe ride way intent abandon place reſort becauſe hee might better commune diſpute loue ryding turned head eſpied theſe pleaſant company fountaine fiercely fighting together wherfore turned againe goe thither ſawe great conflict came done quiet becauſe enemy takē gladly ſtroue reſiſtance dutheſſes pontus duracā trauailing court noble father company prince ditree vnfortunate ſkirmiſh ſlain vrged palmerin great heauineſſe ſaw alſo heauy cry lady made hold bracandor mightie giant inhabiting rocke ten knight daily waiting palmerin pitying lady miſhap couched ſpeare ran againſt giant ſuch force laid along earth manner though ſtarke dead ten knight ſtanding ſéeing came altogether running vpon defended himſelfe ſo wel power vnhorſe hardy blowes made quickly coole courage bracandor riſen vp againe commanded knight retire becauſe would reuengo iniury himſelfe wherevpon gaue ouer giant palmerin ſternly dealing one another bracandor ende began greatly faint knight ſeeing danger forced maiſters commaund came beſet prince palmerin albeit receiued many dangerous hurt paide due little profit lady continued prayer good aſſiſtance eſtéeming beſt knight euer ſeene bracandor ſeeing maruellous force one onely knight beganne blaſpheme god ran ſuch violent manner againſt prince god indued great pollicie force leaſt blowes ſufficient haue ſlaine bracandor beholding ſix knight ſlaine dangerous woundes diſpaire himſelfe fell ground palmerin well pleaſed rid ſuch enemy ſhort time ſent foure beare maiſter company came offering take helmet hée might haue preſently cut head aſtapardo came foorth accompanied ten knight charged ſo ſudainly leiſure commend himſelfe miſtreffe palmerin reduced great perplexitie yea death appointed furious ſkirmiſh puiſſant albayzar preſently arriued ſeeing great iniury offered one knight gaue ſpeare fought againſt dramorant cruell ran againſt aſtapardo ſuch manner ſpeare went quite thorow body armor behaued themſelues ſo well moſt part ſlaine reſt ſaued liues flight palmerin ſéeing himſelfe deliuered ſo great perill came offered great thanks prince albayzar ſuffering vſe ſuch courteſie without making knowne ſet ſpurres horſe rid away great haſte palmerin returned bracandor finding yet aliue commanded eſquires leade ſo rode city buda accompanied ducheſſes lady ſorie death ditree knight well pleaſed againe noble hautie déeds palmerin chap lxxix ſhal declared vnto giant bracandor wherfore came remaine place svch report hiſtory deliuereth vnto v perilous iſle remained giant named bucarquant ruled iſle ſuch cruel maner ſubiects ſtand doubt death put beſide gouernement iſle concluded conſpire death poyſon sonne bracandor innocent wicked diuilliſh déedes father yet fearing gouernement would prick like cruelty chaſed iſle giuing company nephew aſtapardo theſe twaine went kingdome hungaria purpoſed people little mountaine giuen name inhabited rock place might ſuffered liue quiet becauſe reuenge would ſought cruell déeds bucarquant gotten company bloody minded diſhoneſt knight liuing robbery deflowring faire virgin lady villainous déeds might deuiſed till laſt heard theſe ducheſſes went ſée king friſol father law accompanied prince ditree knight suddenly came ſet vpon ſo prince knightes ſlaine alſo fiue belonging bracandor till reſcue came prince palmerin behaued himſelfe haue heard come citie buda king friſol vnderſtanding death sonne tooke ſo heauily ſuch great loſſe forceable conſtraine yet hee diſſembled griefe came ducheſſe prince palmerin giuing great thankes courteſie commanded ſhould vſed maruellous good reſpect till wound healed ſtrength ſomewhat better increaſed citizen tooke giant bracandor without king leaue put death burning bone nothing might left ſéene ſuch cruell villaine soone king friſol able withſtand extremitie griefe méekely yéelded day ſtroke death ſmal griefe noble linage well loiall obedient ſubiects greatly lamented loſſe ſuch gratious prince obſequies funerales moſt magnifically finiſhed eſtrellant son prince ditree receiued name rightfull renowned king committed gouernment scepter one moſt noble lord hungaria becauſe time eaſe yet come would follow exerciſe valiant knight armes palmerin ſtaied citie buda till ſtrength would permit beare armour hee followed intent alwaies ſée place greateſt aduenture chap lxxx florian court great turke entred fight baſtard arduramet vanquiſhed heere muſt remember arduramet prince florian landed came turkes court arduramet receiued great thankes turke himſelfe priſoners taken fortunate voyage comming prince targiana whoſe gentle nature afforded gracious welcome arduramet deliuered ſpeeches manner gracious lady ſince time departed excellencie haue endured along tedious trauell recouer lord brother albayzar albeit fortune méete yet haue heard ſuch report déeds heart contented labour finiſhed aſſuring hath woone ſuch renown againſt chriſtians haue knowledge doe daily deſire ſée make proofe puiſſant behauiour againſt beſide haue heard hath conquered shield faire miragarda wherewith gone court emperor palmerin maintaine againſt knight dare auouch contrarie ſéemely ſelfe onely goddeſſe beautie earth time ſearch happened tooke certaine priſoners among found knight told mee newes lord albayzar hee aſſigned fight againſt emperours court wherupon ſuch word aroſe betwéen v haue appointed combat tried ended court florian ſéeing great pride arduramet ſtricken ſuch coller hée began vtter mind theſe ſpéeches arduramet arriued place muſt entend meane accompliſh promiſe albeit albayzar valiant knight armes effect déeds manifeſt leſſe yet maintaine prooue againſt hath shield manner conqueſt prince targiana beautie eſtéeme confeſſe ſuch authoritie ventureth field fauour cannot chuſe ſpéed happily déedes ſhall pleaſe licence mee field defend againſt albayzar knight law rather deſerue receiued ſeruice eſtéeme arduramet could ſuffer theſe braue word eſpecially one priſoner rage caſt helmet ground began raile theſe tearmes follow oh mahomet doeſt thou ſuffer preſence chriſtian preſume ſo vile preſumptuous brag gratious lady deſire aſſure miſcreant field vow leaue til haue reuenged rare monſtrous iniury targiana commanded florian take helmet whoſe gentle manner preſently obeyed ſo offended word arduramet beauty farre otherwiſe alwayes accuſtomed cauſe princeſſe commanded arduramet depart make himſelfe ready enter combate prince florian affection ſo greatly placed ſhe tooke priſoner vnder protection better aſſure ſafe danger ſhe commaunded fiftie knight ſhould preſently armed ſée none might come neare hurt time ſhould combate arduramet florian kiſſing hand departed place appointed fight ſhe vp chamber ſee euery thing happened came f •••• e knight field aduice targiana arduramet prauncing like noble champion great turke himſelfe ſtood window daughter deſirous ſée ende noble enterpriſe ardumaret bowing himſelfe princeſſe targiana couched speare againſt prince florian theſe word lady cauſe knight knowe ſeruants bring ſubiection florian brake speare ſo valiantly vpon hee ſent ground maruellous violence wherat great turke ſomewhat diſpleaſed targiana greatly triumphed arduramet ſorrowfull miſhap came prince sword hand thus sir knight sword ſhall make amends fault thou offer ſooner reſiſt trench blade bellie thy horſe perceiue well ſaid florian néedleſſe vſe aduantage ſuch knight ſo deſcending horſe betwéene began dangerous combate wherein florian ſo cruelly martired armour arduramet great turke would gladly haue parted fearing death arduramet targiana deſired let trie becauſe minde aſſure victory ſtrange knight arduramet ſéeing himſelfe ſo ill intreated thought many time haue yeelded himſelfe thinking ſhame hée might get ſo concluded fight till latter gaſpe ſhort time fell downe dead féete florian departed field came princeſſe targiana whoſe preſence fell knée vttering theſe ſpéeches faire lady vnknowne miſchance vnhappie aduenture haue bene brought land ſtrange knowne ſéeing bountie hath allowed victory deſire recompence great honor haue done may hencefoorth imploy ſelfe ſeruice wherein ſhall manifeſt greatly bound gentle curteous nature targiana ſomewhat changing colour looked earneſtly father came receiued florian gratiouſly allowing onely knight whereat great turke well pleaſed ſtayed ſeruice targiana leſſe affectionate towards willing doe pleaſed chap lxxxi dramuſiande florendos ſought together hurt dangerouſly palmerin arriued wrought meanes relieue feeble eſtates giant dramuſiand mention hath béen made ſince departure caſtle almarol trauailed many country find knight taken shield miragarda thence tranaile proued famous fortunate laſt arriued caſtle dramorant cruel kinſman vnderſtood ſlaine dramorant knight carried away ſhield miragarda made anſwer thoſe offer courteſie knight ſad conceit theſe word reuiuing himſelfe caſt eye dramuſiande grieuouſly anſwere truſt ſir knight heart mine ſo afflicted theſe eye ſo ouerwatched theſe eares ſilent opinion ſo much dulled ignorant whether ſaluted ſhould thinke heard refuſed anſwere like credit ſhould much deceiue ſelfe perceiue well quoth dramuſiande haue ſpoken truth wherewith hold ſelfe well contented could report might finde knight beareth shield wherein pictured faireſt face euer nature framed hauing letter name péereleſſe inequall miragarda theſe word knight gaue grieuous ſigh ſaying surely ſir doe greatly deſire méete ſelfe becauſe trauels end ſeeke onely combate bring backe shield head caſtell almaroll whence ſo bold take away enterpriſe toucheth one aliue wherefore deſire giue euery trauell betake ſelfe reſt life mine hath preſerued danger aduenture maketh deſirous follow dramuſiande ignorant knight ſeeing vſe intent order endeuoured know labour ſpent ende profit wherefore ſo incenſed ſuch anger gaue ſcope stéedes met together ſo nobly diſmounted ground fell freſh ſwords ſo armour expence blood witneſſed dangerous eſtate perſons dramuſiande thought two wretched fortune brought ſuch debility haue power vanquiſh one knight 〈◊〉 déere miſtres know miſhap chanceth onely becauſe haue mind remember fight haue attempted vnder gracious name wherein ſuffer vanquiſhed grant ſo happy may render shield againe cuſtody afterward recompence dutifull faithfull ſeruice put death gracious pleaſure knight ſide grieuouſly paſſioned thinking verily finiſh day combate wherefore began order vſe complaint madam ſhould happy conſidering deſire haue alwayes preſent houre ende trouble becauſe delight hath euer béene bring laſt extremity vitall courſe yet highly one way contented knowing die honourable ſeruice wherwith haue continually endeuoured gratifie deſire breaking ſpéeches fel egerly combate laſt brought vnto ſuch feebleneſſe forced fall ground fortune preſerued greater conqueſt honor cauſed inſtant noble palmerin england arriue place knowing dramuſiande ſuppoſed verily ſlain wherefore came knight taking helmet perceiuing noble florendos became ſo ouercharged griefe could hardly ſuſtaine himſelfe falling earth commaunded siluian goe citie preſently bring chirurgions becauſe thought verily almoſt paſt recouery siluian knowing death theſe two knight might occaſion put maiſters life danger vſed ſuch diligence ſhort time hee returned two expert maiſters chirurgerie palmerin deſired manifeſt knowledge preſent recouering health thoſe dangerous wounded knight recompence ſhould excéed liberalitie ſo chirurgians ſearched wound found ſo dangerous weakeneſſe wearineſſe wherefore promiſed grace god bring good eſtate health euer prince reioyced good anſwere cauſed siluian fetch coach citie wherein brought houſe ancient gentleman palmerin bare company vntill able trauaile againe chap lxxxii albayzar came court emperour palmerin condition made begin aduenturous intent well prouided full renowned knight court emperour palmerin ſuch time albayzar hauing left palmerin england hée ſlewe bracandor arriued alighting horſe came vy great hal faire gréene armour beſet golden speares two eſquires attending finding emperour ſitting prinoipall knight thronged thorow reuerenced himſelfe emperour theſe ſpéeches moſt dread puiſſant emperor haue béene conſtrained viſit court two cauſes hold eſpecial one ſée noble mindes alwayes abyding try ſelfe againſt behalfe hath ſent hither giuing vnderſtād loue faireſt moſt noble lady world haue béene caſtle giant almarol force haue obtained shield faire miragarda force beare onely honour saint homage heart enforce knight yeeld vaſſailes highneſſe licence field compell knight court alſo dare auouch contrary lady miſtreſſe targiana onely daughter great turke lord soueraigne ſhe ſhall beare prize beautie theſe condition doe require mine attempt defendant shield ſhall bring liuely portayt lady name verified foote thereof becauſe ſhall onely recompence conquerour ſhall gaine manifeſt themſelues indifferently fauoured lady ſhall ſworne giue writing name miſtreſſe hath good hap vanquiſh ſhall onely lord ſhield lady targiana ſhall haue likewiſe deliuered ſhieldes fortune ſhall allow proweſſe furthermore granted knight diſmounted iuſt ſhall haue licence fight sword vanquiſhed deliuer shield ſo depart expect anſwere moſt redoubted emperour concerning ye requeſt hath trauailed many ſtrange countrey commeth make triall valure puiſſance knight ſo conceiue courage aduenture combat behalfe lady name albayzar emperor aroſe immediatly imbraced ſaying would gladly ſee court another eſtate preſent loue ſhall excuſe enterpriſe commaunded chamber ſhould prouided made refuſall thereof becauſe deale ſooner lady hied window ſée ſeruants ſhould accompliſh beſt endeuour albayzar horſeback attending ſhuld firſt come sir badiart knight lucenda ſlendernes beauty ſimpleneſſe knight made shielde recouered againe quickly bellizart came roſuel brother preſenting shield bearing portraite dramaciana handmayde princeſſe polinarda likewiſe diſmounted ſecond iuſt whereat emperour greatly grieued ſory granted field prince albayzar knight court almoſt diſhartened becauſe two noble brother ouercome ſo ſoone shieldes placed among vanquiſhed knight chap lxxxiiii happened ſixt day iuſt albayzar ſtayed long ſixt day came preſent themſelues tilt wherefore emperour went chamber princeſſe gridonia leaned window beholding albayzar ſit gate tent vſing many amorous cogitation picture targiana cōcerning trauailes attempted onely loue fauour buſying eye mind beautiful proſpect knight entred fielde armed blacke whereon diſpearſed little flame fire bearing shielde like ſhew hée preſented iudges couched lance doe duty albayzar ſéeing wanted image lady refuſed enter iuſt knight ſéeing denied ſo ſmall matter came albayzar theſe word sir knight aſke much wanteth anſwere ſéeme craue ſhield haue preſented lacke would haue much wiſh onely cōtinue reſemblance hath borne many day grief neuer houre ioy gladnes yet haue ſéene time could haue preſented picture could haue enforced great maruaile ſelfe little eſtéeme might ſo vnhappily hath fortune frowued preſent hope ſequeſtred good hap preſēt nothing dolefull apparance midſt miſfortunes beare afflicted mind onely image ſometime hath yet time may ioyful countenance lady miſtreſſe deſiring excuſe beſt auailes fortune hath left sir knight anſwered albayzar willingly would picture wherwith threaten preſent gouernment would make knowe beare another whereto lady liuing ought muſt giue place neuertheleſſe ſéeing emperour hath ſtayed ſo long regarding honeſt ſpéeches extremitie griefe haue reported conſtraineth breake promiſe francke fréely permit iuſt couching speares paſſed firſt courſe gallantly ſecond knight ſent earth héeles vpward albayzar ſo greatly terrified ſtroke loſt stirrops conſtrained hold mane horſe elſe himſelfe borne company perceiued knight ready charge swoord hee leaped horſe aduancing shield beare hardy blowes knight ſo betwéene beganne ſuch dangerous combate regardants hardly knewe whome impute moſt aduantage albayzar fortune béene alwayes friendly ſuffered charge knight ſuch mightie blowes litle litle perceiued faint wherefore laſt ſcant able hold longer retired himſelfe entring diſcourſe know right wel weapon inuented maintain honour alſo diſcharge perillous aduenture wherefore beed much better haue paſt life without frequenting abide miſchance wherein remaine preſent ala poore wretch thinke vanquiſh fortune ende finde ſelfe vanquiſhed knew well enough kéepeth himſelfe falling ſnares hath little cauſe doubte peruerſe frowarde chance fonde ſoole complaine manner author mine euill wilfully ſéeke mine owne dammage whereupon valiantly aſſaulted albayzar againe ſhort time ſubdued laid foote vnarmed found floraman prince sardignia made emperour ſomewhat offended fearing albayzar would vanquiſh knightes court floraman carried pallace lady greatly lamenting becauſe inuiolate faithfull conſtancy albeit albayzar remained victor verie ſore hurt brought great weakeneſſe danger chap lxxxv albayzar healed wound returned field continuing iouſt vanquiſhed diuers knightes floraman remained ſore hurt ſpace two monthes onely griefe ſuſtained miſhap cauſe medicine preſented beſtowed al uaine wherefore emperour accompanied diuers time becauſe behauiour ſo vertuous honeſt made euery one deſirous beare company honourable viſitations friendly good well beſtowed vpon power appeaſe extreame griefe rather deſired death comfort ſo ſollace ſo ſwéete remembrance often deſiring death time brought former ſtrong eſtate emperour deſired leaue court whoſe would ſhew himſelfe diſobedient ſtaied palmerin england renowned florendos thinking albayzar able reſiſt againſt albayzar pride thought contrary contenting himſelfe victory paſte ſooner diſpoſition beare armour preſented himſelfe againe field perſwading himſelfe lord ouer thoſe durſt conceiue courage deale ſuch nature proud arrogant minde ſpéeding well content thinking alway remaine good fortune hauing ancient prouerbe deſire hath reſt till lie duſt prodigall opinion put ſingular faire armour regarding miſhap might chaunce vnto becauſe fortune placed top whéele whereon wiſe man repoſe ſeat aſſurance variable mutable
