vſe ſuch honourable attempt primaleon armed himſelfe diuers time deſirous chaſtiſe pride prince albayzar emperour would ſuffer procéede becauſe bare great affection soldane olorieque would ſéeme change valiant sonne albayzar ſoiournied long conſtantinople without finding iuſt withall wherefore heperſwaded himſelfe attaine great credit finding deale vanquiſhing thoſe came tournament palmerin florendos giant dramuſiand would haue ſtaied ſo long thence béen diuers aduentures conſtrained determination ſo abſence cauſe albaizar ſo much eſtéemed euery prince court nothing preſent talked expert valiantneſſe noble moore albayzar hiſtory willeth v leaue becauſe haue forgot prince florian long chap lxxxvi happened florian deſart remaining court great turke long time ſoiourned florian great turkes court highly eſtéemed among hardy knight moſt honoured beloued princeſſe targiana whoſe amorous company made forget martiall enterpriſes ſo much hee wholly ſhaped himſelfe pleaſe fantaſie loue tooke ſuch déepe perſwaſiō either part y• florian burſt lance y• face venus targiana yéelded chiefeſt iewell vnder obeyſance conqueſt cupid ſuch indifferent opinion together loue miſtreſſe action time florian remained ſtate targiana buſied mind wonted amorous deuiſes report blazed great victory albayzar turk court newes accounted ſo great eſtimation behauiour prince florian almoſt forgotten thing vnwelcome wherefore one night talking princeſſe targiana ſhee began recount dutie wherein déedes albayzar bound courteſie ſhe could hardly fulfill promiſe ſhée made departure ſide ſhe thought fortune would allure florian ſome dangerous enterpriſe ſhould ſhe abide ſorrow thinking hard miſhap might eſtrange remainder day florian perceiuing cauſe heauines yet diſſembling though knew thought time play part whereupon began manner good lady opinion déedes albayzar ſuch account thinking forget mine offer vngentle reward great diſcourteſie ſéeing receiue content onely company hee maintaining honour beauty againſt know none able contend know aſſuredly taſke mine ſhould make men monſters offer reuerence victory albayzar hath attained ought right bee giuen ſéeing noble vanquiſhed beautie rather courage ſworde albayzar attribute ſo large commendation would grant mée leaue go ſéeke fight vnder ſoueraigne fauour name ſhould ſée v moſt bound ſhould beſt deſerue admitted ſeruice targiana ſtanding ſtill aprettie laſt ſhe tooke florian hand began order deſired worthie ſir one thing long ſince opinion deſire enforce accompliſh ſame wherein requeſt may ſatiſfied mine ſufficiently contented thus meane habite trauailing gentlewoman accompanied ſelfe two damoſels foure eſquires iourney hence court emperour palmerin better winne father conſent caſe deſire may viſſte mine aunt quéene aſſyria requeſt know deny ſo meane ſhall haue opportunitie procéede content mine owne deſire firſt meane ſend meſſenger prince albayzar ſhal depart conſtantinople till ſuch time haue tidings meane ſhall aſſurance finde ſuch time arriue conſtantinople aſſuring ſelfe hath ſo great deſire pleaſure ſhall refuſe grant ſo ſmall requeſt florian alwayes deſired eſcape handes theſe infidel ſéeing time preſent fit occaſion began greatly commend enterpriſe targiana ſaying ſhe ought preſently put deuiſe execution elſe deſire might happen catch ſuddaine death becauſe natural property ſome woman thinke thing ſpéedily forget preſently yet often time haſty ſuch thing end proue hurtfull themſelues example let ſuffice princeſſe targiana next morning came chamber father therewith teares great pitie ſée woman ſhe began rehearſe ſhe beene aduertiſed quéene aſſyria aunt miſaduenture fallē ſuddaine ſickneſſe cauſe ſhe humbly deſired would permit leaue goe viſite great turke ioy faire daughter targiana loath diſpleaſe granted requeſt hee could perſwade take company thē two damoſels foure eſquires florian vſually called court chriſtian knight departed iourney brauely gallantly appointed arriued ſhort time within y• dominion conſtantinople riding thorow pleaſant valley thicke beſet trées princeſſe deſired ſtay till heat day ſomewhat paſſed long reſted eſpied foure knight come riding towards ſéeing princeſſe targiana lately come conſtantinople wher bin vanquiſhed albayzar whoſe shield picture ſo naturally drawn knight haue bin ouermuch blind miſtaken wherefore knowing perſwading themſelues ſhe one offred theſe ſalutations faire lady eſtéeme lawfull honourable beauty hath bene cauſe great loſſe dammage ſhould haue aduantage recompence miſhappe bring lady ſelfe may manifeſt great difference betwéen beautie florian aroſe vp anger gaue anſwere gentleman well follow way haue receiued miſchance impute folly occaſion procéeding lady lady ſhee ſo fond goe ſo fooliſh accompliſh ſuch vaine requeſt anſwere ſo brauely ſayde one knight fully determined ſhe ſhall goe v ſéeme dare offer offend ſhall quickly coole courage becauſe diſpoſed ſo ſuddenly chafe florian mounted horſbacke preſently came vnto thē theſe ſpéeches determined try worthines proue according word may come one another foure pleaſe diſloyalty neuer ſhew ſelfe continually reſident tuſh ſaid one knight hold ſuch proude opinion ſelfe one v alone find worke enough ſelfe ſo bold ſtay haſtineſſe followes iudge would thinke diſhonour ſhould deale ſuch one florian able abide theſe word ran ſuch courage againſt craking cōpanion y• ſpeare paſſing cleane thorow threw dead ground comming violently vpon ſerued ſuch ſort two ſlaine glad ſaue life flight florian diſcharged theſe foure knight alighted horſe came lady targiana ſo wel contented victory knight ſhe would haue béen diſpleaſed fortune alotted contrary pleaſure ſéeing night approch ſo faſt vpon ſhee commanded eſquires plate thrée tentes bottom valley neere gréene bancke whereby ran pleaſant little brooke thinkiug finde pleaſure remaine night dead knight quiet reſt paſſed night becauſe tediouſneſſe iourney gladly wiſh enioy ſome eaſe chap lxxxii happened florian departing valley vanquiſhed foure knight cleare morning awaked princeſſe targiana company packed vp prouiſion departed iourney greatly deſiring court emperour palmerin afternoone came goodly forreſt ſtood excellent faire foū taine ingeniouſly framed reported emperor marcellus time curious cauſe rare edifice braue inuentions framed erected faire fountain forreſt ſéemed true two cauſes firſt emperor much affectioned haue dwelling ſolitary place néere ſome pleaſant ſpring ſome ſuch faire coſtly fountaine ſecond becauſe name marcellus many place fountaine néere whereunto two knight ſuffered stéeds receiue water targiana ſeeing ſuch ſingular proſpect place ſo conuenient repoſe deſired prince florian pauſe whereto preſently agréed princeſſe taking maſke two knight well regarded affirmed ſhee albayzar maintained valiant iouſte wherefore conſented betweene themſelues take lady ſhame might better couered attained receiuing infortunate foile iuſt ſo putting helmet heades approched néerer princeſſe one began thus madam ought wiſh ill choſe receiuing ſharpe repulſe beautie conceiue courage minde ſéeke remedie ſhall vnderſtand knight hath vanquiſhed v conſtantinople maintaining excellent ſtate beauty hath woon ſhields whereon figured lady hath honoured placing féet wherefore let fault paſſe méeke penance behoueth depart v ſo ſhall offence leſſe eſteemed thoſe may muſt command v thinketh ſir quoth florian ſhould blame innocent little defence ſelues keepe shieldes without preſuming fortune may happen prouide farre worſſe inconuenience perceiue ſaid knight againe lady beautie cauſeth vſe tearmes ſo bluntly doubt able maintaine albeit may make good account manhood ſhall trie ſir quoth florian ſo cloſing helmet charged ſuch order thy aſhamed againſt dutie knighthoode aſſaile whoſe ſtoutneſſe ſtill detained targiana death one thē ſéeing fell knee princeſſe theſe word madame deſire appeaſe anger death fellow grieuous woundes ha • receiued let mercy pleade cauſe though vnworthy yet thinke life would little pleaſure targiana beholding repentance deſired florian hée would forgiue preſently granted commanding dead body ſhould bo caried away whereto knight daring gainſay willed eſquire lay ouerthwart vpon horſe ſo departed together knight grieued himſelfe ſéene targiana walking florian ſaid ſhee thought place aſſurance countrey truſt ſaid florian neuer ſawe order yet ought maruailed one one ſide ſhield albayzar ſide beauty cauſeth theſe aduentures happen thoſe haue bin vanquiſhed gaining ſight excellent feature cannot chuſe threaten themſelues greater danger nature framed onely bring thoſe extremity dare conceiue hardineſſe behold targiana ſéeing florian ſo déepe praiſes ſtayed conge ouer lippes ſéeing faire trée farre ſhe tooke hand ſaying let v goe walke vnder yonder faire 〈◊〉 minde aſſureth thing happen ſtrange haue yet ſéene madame quoth florian would wiſh come greateſt danger might know little eſtéeme •• neritie accompanied onely ſhield ſafety albayzar hauing picture ouercōmeth moſt puiſſant knight world might hauing ſéemely perſō maketh deſire fortune would ſend hazard aboue ſhould ſee forceable magnanimity beauty engraned heart mine ſuch hauty diſpoſition death thouſand death able withſtād preferreth title excellencie▪ chiefeſt honour vpon knightly sword theſe two louers thus walking talking found word princeſſe targiana true indéede foote trée eſpied goodly knight laid along company eſquire accompanied depart frō maiſter might better report amorous cōplaints alwayes reſident penſiue minde knight one faire blew armour helmet ſeruing vnder head office pillow lay without receiuing reſt gaue forth ſighes complaint dolefull manner targiana florian deſirous heare loath diſturbe ſo ſeriouſly buſied withdrew themſelues litle ſo cloſely could knight thinking ſo neare began vnfold griefe order lady haue béene offenſiue ſhould offer ſo great vngentleneſſe leauing aliue wiſh daily death yet ſo obſtinate ſuffer die onely might paſſe time vneſtimable opinion endles torment greater griefe often wiſh prolong life ſeruice wherto vſe ſuch vnfriendly meanes permit imployed therein onely authour mine euill daily occaſion mercileſſe paſſions forget extremitie abide loue neuer dying death compell waſt 〈◊〉 courſe life truſt ſerueth ſtrange neuer ſaw affliction man ſome meane whereby tollerate mine kéepeth one certaine ſtay commeth beſt change falleth ague quartaine quotidian miſhap onely meant men ſuſtaine griefe hope ſhort ende fortune ſuch mine extreames neuer take ende vrgeth beliefe triumph ſée tormented iudge vnworthy liue ſeruice vexation content ſelfe ſo well may think ſhould remember rigour ſhowne hath deſerued hauing conſidered ought ſhall find haue giuen raſh recompence hath deſerued better reward vngentlenes hath bin either cuſtome bold curteſie beare thus ended complaint ſuch grieuous ſigh though hee fetchht h • latter gaſpe florian attached griefe heare heauy tale diſtreſſed knight tooke lady targiana hand returne knight hearing noyſe silke apparell princeſſe made buſhes ſtarted vp putting helmet head came prince florian theſe word abide sir knight becauſe againſt another time ſhall learne manner diſcretion defend ſelfe truſt ſhall report proweſſe take occaſion rehearſe complaint séeing sir quoth florian ſo minded folly offer excuſe therefore procéede determination drawing swordes beganne braue fight charging one another ſuch dangerous manner targiana commended exployt aboue ſhe ſéene thus animated againſt one another knight gréene white armour chanced arriue shield hée bare deuiſe speare pierced many place blowes receiued two eſquires attending deſirous knowe cauſe theſe two knightes endured combate ſo cruelly wherefore hée came princeſſe targiana knowe beheld quite forgat ſhould demand becauſe one knight albayzar vanquiſhed knowledge preſently wherfore ſet vp behind one eſquires riding away gaue theſe ſpéeches faire lady ſéeing theſe knight able beare company know none ſo worthy ſelfe kéepe ſhall recompence diſhonour haue gotten targiana ſéeing neither faire intreaty reſiſtance ſmall ſtrength could pacifie florian maintained combate ſo fiercely could heare cry beganne order perſwade know sir knight dare preſume make entrāce vpon others poſſeſſion ſeeing although haue power carrie away yet good affection ſhall alway eſtranged ſéeing remedie pray ſuffer goe foote yonder fountaine abide mine attendance ſhall goe aſſuring haue weapon wherewith aſſiſt againſt defend content ſaid knight ſatiſfie deſire moſt deſireth honor ſeruice ſo walked downe fountaine time minde leaue florian knight ſo earneſt enterpriſe neuer perceiued targiana carried away ſeene brought ſuch weakneſſe could haue reſcued dangerous eſtate fortune ſo friendly vnto dramuſiande trauailing toward conſtantinople recouer ſhield faire miragarda arriued ſeeing extremitie theſe two knight knowing armes knight dragon alſo beholding another knight endure combate ſo well greatly abaſhed fearing loſe man moſt loued gaue horſe ſpurs ran betwéene theſe word gentleman deſire requeſt ende debate weakneſſe rather requireth reſt continue diſcord ſo extreame danger leaſt▪ sir palmerin ſpeaking knight dragon ſhould refuſe grant deſire ſo knight hope ſhall haue occaſion thanke florian heard name palmerin conceiued ſuch griefe throwing ſword fell ground manner béene dead wherefore palmerin ſéeing ſo great debilitie found ſo vertuous valiant commaunded siluian vnloſe helmet might receiue ayre hee knew florian deſart brother readie fall ground himſelfe dramuſiande vſed diligence ſtay florian riſing ſéeing brother palmerin ſo ill intreated began theſe word might recompence great offence haue committed forgetfulneſſe ſhould ſo much gouerne ſences know hardy blowes noble lord noble brother anſwered palmerin ſeeme part take thing amiſſe hath happened rather let v bethinke ſelues howto requite courteſie haue found deere triend dramuſiande florian contented himſelfe brother anſwere eſquire giuen vnderſtand▪ knight carried away lady targiana ouercharged grie • e beyond meaſure great heauineſſe determined make purſuite palmerin would agree thereto moreouer dramuſiande ſhewed danger wherein preſent making faithfull promiſe ſo ſoone wound brought better eſtate himſelfe would vndertake trauaile earneſtly hée shield miragarda yet griefe prince florian ſo great neither counſell friendly intreatie could perſwade dramuſiande hauing accompliſhed meane ſet prince horſebacke departed forreſt florian caſting eye towards fouutaine thinking loſt ſuch miſfortune teares ſtanding eye began thus thou valley whoſe ent • ance ſéemed ſo pleaſant mee know iſſue value miſhap deare neuer ceaſe trauaile yeeld life among miſchances till haue found ſwéete content haue loſt meane know euer forget departed forreſt came monaſtery wound cured great facilitie dramuſiande ſo ſoone hee brought place went backe valley purpoſing fulfill promiſed florian hyſtory leaueth theſe thrée knightes returned carried targiana away perſwading himſelf company attaine title immortall praiſe chap lxxxviii ſhal rehearſed knight carried targiana away happened company remembrance made hiſtory king denmarke thrée sonnes al prooued bee noble valiant knight eſpecially eldeſt called albanis freze ſo renowned thorow father kingdom knight durſt encounter come age fiue twenty yeeres hearing braue report princeſſe miragarda became ſo affectionat leauing father court trauailed caſtle almarol accompliſhing many notable déeds way arriued ſuch time albayzar carried ſhield thence ſaw could attaine enter combat ſtaied till fortune would ſuffer ſée princeſſe miragarda whoſe view hee became ſo ſeuerely vanquiſhed vowed poſſible bring ſheeld againe fortune ſtand friend ſo much purpoſed make greatly beholding ſhe ſuch ſtrange condition haue told ſhee reioyced receiue euerie one without making ſhew welcome albanis preuailing diuers aduentures came cittie conſtantinople ſéeing number ſhields valiant moore woon great renowne held euery valour purpoſed manifeſt courage againſt albeit worthineſſe great brake thrée speares valiant albayzar yet fortune ſo much againſt receiued foyle shield placed among conquered knight departed thence opinion euer ſerue miragarda hee arriued valley florian palmerin fought beholding targiana eſtéemed faireſt creature euer ſéene knew ſhée whoſe behalfe albayzar ſped ſo happily wherevpon concluded bring conſtantinople trie fortune would fauour better againſt albayzar hauing preſence faire targiana offered great honour curteſie power altar faithful affection ſhe bare prince florian wel rid drawing néere conſtantinople euening met knight blacke armour riding ſad heauily albanis gaue ſpéech friendly ſalutation blacke knieht rid without making anſwer whereat albanis ſomewhat diſpleaſed deſirous ſhew ſome courage targiana turned blacke knight manner sir albeit word ſo little eſtéemed haue made ſhewe courteous anſwere yet doe thinke béene dutie offer ſome friendly motion lady wherto blacke knight made reply good sir haue béene obliuious ſelfe towards lady ready recompence ſame ſhe ſhall commaund ſéeme ſo diſcourteous ſpéech becauſe haue ſaluted truſt farre reaſon minde ſo buſied affaire neither ſaw much leſſe heare would faine knowe ſayde albanis whence ariſeth cauſe doubt ſée ſufficient excuſe vnciuill behauiour syr quoth blacke knight would wiſh kéepe iourney tel cauſe griefe would gladly pleaſure little profit albanis deſirous know demanded▪ ſo importune blacke knight tooke field pleaſure encountred albanis ſuch force horſe fell downe ſhoulder broken albanis could recouer himſelfe blacke knight alighted forced abide mercy done▪ riding away targiana came ſtayed thus sir knight deſire euen make hazard perſon many danger magnanimitie doeth accompany againſt aduerſity abandon thoſe liue affliction beare gentlenes mind keepe c • mpany ſo trauaile emperours court ſuffer partner iourney buſineſſe lyeth place expect knight▪ conducted trauailes hither lady anſwered blacke knight thought knight vndertook conduct perceiuing contrary minded goe thither force muſt pleaſure ſo ſmall requeſt albeit extremitie li • e ſtood thereon thus departed together leauing albanis ſorrowfull euer bin blacke knight way requeſted wherfore knight enforced goe whō targiana ript vp whole matter wherefore blacke knight gaue greater honor done knew ſhe whoſe cauſe albayzar kept shield miragarda made ſomewhat excuſe déede albayzar beauty targiana would haue vrged knight aduenture hardieſt exployt arriued conſtantinople whē albeyzar appointed depart thence carrie shield away becauſe none durſt aduenture recouer thē made emperor greatly agrieued eſtéeming y• greateſt ſhame euer happened prince court ſide primaleon ſo chafed becauſe father would grant combate albayzar minded ſtay comming foure mile without citie beare shielde image gridonia ſecretly cauſed made ſée might vanquiſh albayzar bring backe shield lady loſt fortune ſo hindred purpoſe tooke effect alſo would ſuffer albayzar depart thence ſo great glorie chap lxxxix blacke knight entred combat albayzar blacke knight lodged night without city houſe ancient gentleman becauſe would knowne next morning targiana attyred ſelfe ſumptuouſly gowne turkiſh faſhion crimſon sattin adorned braue bi • lament gold precious ſtones mounted palfray white swan damoſels eſquires likewiſe braue apparrell attēding ſeemely order maner ſhe came y• city accompanied black knight arriued iuſting place whē albayzar euen conquered engliſh knight placed ſhield among emperour courtly company behelding braue geſture blacke knight noble company brought good opinion ſhould end iuſt made lady knight throng beſt place ſight becauſe looked ſome notable exploit cauſed greateſt amazement beauty princeſſe tagiana rich ſumptuous ſhew apparrell made people run heāpes great murmuring whereat albayzar ſomewhat abaſhed caſt head aſide ſéeing lady targiana could hardly ſuſtaine himſelfe falling ground blacke knight ſtaide good beholding ſhields albayzar conquered ſaw portrait faire miragarda teares ran chéekes began manner madame poſſible thing wherein nature hath ſhowne ſkill make ſurpaſſing faire ſhould bee power might glad vanquiſhed ſelfe would triumph found ſo fortunate preſent becauſe deſire die maintaine truth hope diſcouer deceit albayzar ſuch ſort recompence ſhall returne hath iuſtly deſerued albayzar greatly reioyced ſée lady targiana whoſe loue ſhe attained ſuch eſtimation honour wherby ſo farre ouerſhot himſelfe prodigall pleaſure ſtood maze whether ſhe black knight hauing ended complaint ſéeing albayzar ſo farre diſtracted put himſelfe little néerer awaked theſe wordes albayzar whereon doeſt thou vſe thy mind ſo mutely aduertiſe thee princeſſe company called targiana daughter great turke hath taken pain come hither ſée thy valour ſo much blazed commended world albayzar theſe word alighted horſe hauing taken helmet came kiſſed hand targiana manner ſalutation madame know may requite ſelfe hauing honored ſo highly aboue deſert targiana receiued gratiouſly giuing hearty thanks noble ſeruice whereof ſhe made ſuch eſtimation florians deed preſently forgotten yea ſo farre banniſhed memorie though ſhe neuer ſéene life manifeſting rightly inconſtancie ſuch regard ſeruants according raiſed authoritie albayzar hauing done duty princeſſe targiana mounted horſebacke began thus blacke knight sir knight would faine know moued bring lady hither alſo haue deſire enter iuſt vpon preſenting ſhield ſhal receiued sir quoth blacke knight ſtrife concluded betwéene v ſhe ſhall diſcourſe certaintie thereof ſelfe concerning ſhield ſay muſt preſent allowed iouſte time vnprouided thereof becauſe thou haſt diſloyally ſtolne elſe might haue worne honour lady wherefore haue thus determined puiſſance cauſe thee confeſſe ſame honourable aſſembly fortune fauoureth thee ſo much ſuffer vanquiwed thy hand faile reuenge thy ſelf greateſt enemy euer thou haddeſt vanquiſh thée deſire greater victorie recompence trayterous wrong thou haſt offered carry backe shielde lady miragarda place hath alway accuſtomed remaine content anſwered albayzar fortune permit thée conquerour ouer thou enioy theſe shield ſhe hath ſuffered mée vanquiſh thou bring caſtle miragarda ſhe ſhall ordaine life pleaſeth like ſhall lady targiana deale thée mine accuſtomed good happē returne victorie syr quoth blacke knight thereto ready thine albeit thou ſhalt finde friendſhip hand offer greateſt enemie emperor company ſuddenly ſtrooken great maruaile heard wordes blacke knight eſpecially primaleon deſired greatly haue knowledge whereupon iudges commanded field targiana entred according albayzar requeſted trumpet ſounded knight mette ſo couragiouſly albayzar thrown groūd héeles vpward black knight diſmounted saddle betwéene legges becauſe girtes horſe broken elſe kept horſeback ſtill made emperour iudge albayzar ſhould depart ſuch honour hee thought drawne swordes laid ſuch terrible manner albayzar thought neuer met ſtrōger knight blacke knight well eſtéemed ſtrength albayzar ſo generall verdict neuer ſéene hauty combat albayzar encouraged lady targiana blacke knight ſo animated picture miragarda betwéene declared deedes incredible proweſſe laſt albayzar ſéeing armour ſo bedewed blood himſelfe brought ſuch extremitie hee retyred take breath began thus complaine noble victory haue attained againſt many noble mindes preuaile thing ſeeing inſtant muſt loſe glorie haue gotten oh lady targiana haue power vanquiſh beſt knight world abſence ſuffer one knight preuaile ſo much againſt preſence looſe former honor deere life falling ſo contrary doth maketh thinke affectionate ſome onely cauſe victorie fall ſide yet▪ princeſſe world braue bountie beyond beautie better deſerueth title aboue title truely may loſe victorie combat defect weakneſſe fault excellency wherto faireſt aliue may ſeeme aſpi • e blacke knight ſide ſéeing dangerous eſtate could aſſure himſelfe good ſucceſſe ſilently picture miragarda entred theſe ſpeeches madame ſeeing hath pleaſed vſe affaire haue greatly touched deſire forſake enterpriſe wholly wherein though alba • zar hath vanquiſhed many knightes honour praiſe targiana excelleth theſe figured lady beauty yet ſhew ſelfe excelling ſingular gift ouercome hath conquered ſo many perſwade ſelfe wil fauor hath done ſuch wrong diſloyally beare shield caſtle let true faithfull ſeruant giue honour hautie attempt afterward deale curſed carkaſe mine euen ſhal ſtand gratious pleaſure fell combate freſh emperor ſéeing ſmall defence themſelues ſuppoſed could long continue fight primaleon opinion came nature griefe mind receiued perfectly cruell wound blacke knight though felt vpon owne body becauſe ſuppoſed linage cruell behauiour vſed ech empres gridonia departed able abide grieuous ſight theſe two champion griped one cloſing arm albayzar • weake reſiſt longer fell ground whereat blacke knight reioyced vncloſed helmet haue ſmiten head emperour called vſe mercy yet makking though heard lifted vp ſword princeſſe targiana fell knées theſe ſpéeches syr knight firſt deſire ſtrike head afterward proceed ſhall pleaſe loth would ſee die hath ventured life danger ſuch honourable ſeruice blacke knight ſeeing modeſtie princeſſe moued pittie wherewith granted albayzar li • e iudges came field haue blacke knight honoured according became victorious conquerour would depart field portrait faire miragarda placed middeſt againſt reaſon princeſſe targiana ſupplied roome led honoured according hie eſtate deſerue emperour commaunded albayzar ſhould led tent meane while blacke knight kiſſing highneſſe hand vpon knee began manner moſt dread mighty emperour deſire prince may regarded aboue court ought ſhew honor perſon know whē emperour knew blacke knight noble nephew florendos heart ſuppriſed vnſpeakable ioy chiefely father prince primaleon cauſed albayzar brought palace vnderſtanding targiana daughter great turke lodged faire princeſſe polinarda daughter greatly deſired hand emperour honorably ſerued ſhe béene court great turke father prince florendos albayzar great care vſed dangerous wound ſhield princeſſe miragarda held chiefeſt eſtimation chap xc damoſell thrace brought ſtrange aduenture court emperour palmerin florendos albayzar remained cure wound empreſſe gridonia glad victory chanced florendos would often come viſit reporting iudgements ſingular forme miragarda talke partly wrought much health medicine applied wound likewiſe emperour primaleon would often viſite albayzar vſing comfortable ſpeeches wherby might forget griefe ſuſtained becauſe vanquiſhed albayzar diſſembled good countenance deuiſed himſelfe might worke iniury florendos afterward ſhall perceiue large ſecond volume hiſtorie meane court emperour ſtored moſt renowned knight lady incomparable ſtate beautie world ſo wanted thing thē two renowned knight england whoſe preſence court made emperor thinke y• force might preuaile againſt triumphing empreſſe gridonia targiana polinarda ſitting vnder cipreſſe trées néere faire fountaine lady maruellous mighty ſtature preſented ſelfe whoſe ſéemly ieſtures ſumptuous ſhew apparell made beléeue ſhee great authoritie attyre sattin cut laide cloath ſiluer purple robe compaſſing bodie wheron placed number rich coſtly precious ſtones long ſleeues hanging • thicke beſet bird hart braue deuiſes foules beaſts gold eie could neuer wearied beholding thing ſuch ineſtimable value attended two knight one hauing armes faire coffer cloſed little locke gold brauely garniſhed pearles precious ſtones maruellous coſt reputation diſcerned within nothing water ſo hard congealed frozen impoſſible moue moity thereof ſhe held hand ſhe deliuered coffer againe knight whereon ſhe ſet cup looking wiſhly vpon company laſt ſhe began vtter theſe ſpeeches moſt noble emperour haue ſo many prince court make triall ſtrange aduenture contained cuppe finding ende ſame wearie ſeeke auy alſo opinion good hap except highneſſe court moſt honoured eſteemed vpon whole earth may find ſuch expected fortune long time haue failed doth encourage ſomewhat conſidering like firſt triall attempted diſcourſe cauſe rare aduenture becauſe one theſe noble gentleman may better affectioned holdeth heart chiefe miſtreſſe thought ſometime ruling thrace king name sardamant ſo excellent well ſéene art magique qualitie gift ſurpaſſed liuing time king daughter leſſe beauty courtly behauiour greatly beloued two knight one called brandimar artibel kept cloſe ſecreat loue til fortune enemy good hap diſcouered good liking diſpleaſ • chanced princeſſe named brandiſia eſteemed chiefly ſeruice artibel father miſdoubting kept cloſe tower loue woon ſuch perfection betwéen artibel accompliſhed deuiſe without ſuſpition oftentimes viſite ſollace faire brandiſia ladder rope climed ſo often window princeſſe time conuerted iſſue delight vna bellae figliola brandimar paſſing oftentimes tower brandiſia deſirous ſée delight theſe walles encloſed one leonarda enchantment vſed ſuch order none might ſée yet come neare vnto far might diſcerned goodly fortreſſe endeuoured come neare vaniſhed away nothing could ſéene ſo done tooke cup wherein congealed frozen teares vſing art ſo vpon hath brought ougly blackneſſe behold houre death ſeeing kingdome ſhould remaine deſtitute heire ſuccéed commanded cup ſhould carried princeſſe court world paſſe hand knight ſhall command aud one thing ſhall vnderſtand knight may equal himſelfe faith loyalty hath power molifie theſe teares aduenture ſuch wil turne former obſcure eſtate againe ſuch one come may knight may beheld themſelues teares ſhall ſée perfect forme thoſe perſons deareſt friend greateſt enemy knowe thoſe leaſt fauour vpon taking cup ſhall féele ſauour ſo ſtrong ſhall hardly able endure contrary beloued fellow higher degrée affection ſhall cauſe greater brightneſſe cuppe wherefore moſt redoubted emperour deſire knight may try aduenture ſelfe giue firſt attempt becauſe may better great perceiuing changed colour began ſomewhat offended himſelfe wherefore damoſell receiued againe mooue ſadneſſe gaue theſe ſpéeches gratious lord ſée age hath decayed force affection aduenture béene deliuered time know could haue remained thus preſent primaleon preſently came tooke cuppe fortune fauoured emperor father vrged ſome cauſe anger fearing gridonia would haue giuen ſlender thankes came prince vernar hand cup receiued little brightneſſe whereby lady knewe damoſell reported nothing trueth vernar came king polendos hand cup became blacke againe euer whereat lady began laugh fortune ſéeme ſo aduerſe aroſe prince gratian thinking end aduenture faithfull loue bare faire claritia hand cup receiued brightnes prince vernar whereat heart rauiſhed vnſpeakeable ioy giuing cup brother guerin became blacke againe euer lady greatly delighted ſée variable quality contained cup ſo aſſured meane ſée knight might excel loyaltie loue berolde p spaine onely beloued faire oniſtalda aduanced himſelfe take cup vſing ſilent opinion himſelfe madame haue euer deſired helpe mine affaire preſent craue ſuccour hand merit conſtancy promiſeth large title honourable aduenture taking cup ſeemed brighter euer béene frozen teares began ſomewhat melt mooued princeſſe oneſtalda ſo great pleaſure ſhe could conceale lady ſitting perceiue came p platir knight fidelia daughter king tarnaes albeit bare great good cup ſo bright hand berolde held became black came bellizart ſeruant faire deniſia dramian knight florian ſped alike enterpriſe francian loued faire bernard tooke turne next trie cup ſped ſo ill wiſht himſelfe place hand cup loſt brightnes knight brought whereat greatly agrieued emperor laughing good began merrily theſe word sir francian may cōmend fortune ſuch libertie lady receiue haſtie occaſion whereby may thinke good fal loue may ſhape ſelfe like diſpoſition time haſtie truſting came friſol oneſtalde eſtrellant tenebrant luyman burgondy pompides bla didon germaine orleance dridan polinarde tremoran baromont albanis freeze amongſt company beſt fauoured polinarde beromont germaine orleance yet none might compared prince berolde damoſel thrace great deſpaire thinking aduenture would ended emperours court preſently came ſorrowfull prince floraman emperor requeſt tooke cap ſaying lady remember danger wherin ſée alſo griefe ſuſtaine ſake wherout may deliuer pleaſe ſet againe ioyfull ſtate ended ſpéeches cup receiued ſuch maruellous brightneſſe congealed teares melted ſo ſuddenly whole aſſembly thought aduenture fully finiſhed damoſell knowing contrary went emperour preſence ſpake thus prince sardignia know well sir floraman aduenture reſerued becauſe firmeneſſe faith gaue mée great deale aſſurance experience haue report enterpriſe truſt glad ſo fallen becauſe hold eſtimation ſelfe long time repoſed lady euer bare good affectiō floramá great deal vrged towards y• damoſell perceiuing euery one ſuppoſed aduenture ended emperor ſhe began maner gratious lord deſire y• knight may abide place albeit cup brought good effect yet y• brought paſſe muſt finiſhed know ſaid floraman fortune wont cauſe begin euery enterpriſe ioy concluſion thereof ſhe threatneth death roſuel diuers knight aſſaied cup ſome ſpéeding well ſome ill euē conſtancy differ quality laſt whē whole cōpany minded retire y• time eſpied knight gréene armour preſent himſelf whoſe ſtoutnes behauior cauſed al feare tooke occaſion behold none y• knew primaleō preſently ſaid giant dramuſiand wherfore deſired emperor ſtay aduancing himſelf méet dramuſiand came imbraced great reuerence opened helmet primaleon brought emperor humbly vpon knée began maner deſire gratious lord father wil receiue knight accuſtomed honor valiant noble behauior hath made much renowned earth emperour knowing dramuſiande would ſuffer kiſſe hand imbracing armes began followeth albeit friendly dealing long time detaine life vnexpected danger yet good report proweſſe noble behauiour ſince time hath vrged mee forget vowing ſelfe friend command ſo pray euer vſe dramuſiande often thanked emperor primaleon preſented empreſſe gridonia albeit made ſhew friendly welcome yet could hartily conſidering griefe ſuſtained impriſonment primaleon ſay nature woman forget forgiue iniuries ſéeke reuengement thought remembrance emperour tooke dramuſiande hand reported gathered together ſée could finiſh aduenture cup wherfore deſired make trial therof ſée ſo happy end ſhal quoth dramuſiand pleaſeth grace command mee fortune ſtand ſo much friend may preuaile aboue al enterpriſe ſhall manifeſt ſoueraigne duty wherein loue hath bound faile therin ſhal haue leſſe cauſe maruell becauſe firſt time fortune hath forgotten receiuing cup damoſel became almoſt cléere hand prince florian whoſe hap yet ſuppoſed moſt perfect emperour commended dramuſiande think perſon ſo ſtrong valiant ſhuld haue ſuch faithfull countenance honour loue day ſo far ſpent al returned pallace emperour deſiring damoſel depart yet becauſe would haue albaizar florendos ſhould make trial likewiſe verily thought one ſhould haue power ende damoſell promiſed accompliſh pleaſure wherefore ſhe walked made abiding emperours pallace chap xcii florendos albayzar proued aduenture cup palmerin florian arriued court dramuſiande hiſtory reporteth hauing left palmerin florian followe princeſſe targiana aduertiſed knight carried away béene conquered one conducted conſtantinople aud prince florendos likewiſe conquered valiant albayzar whereat hee ſomewhat diſpleaſed becauſe thought none ſo woorthie reſtore ſhield himſelfe ſeeing taken thence time kept yet ſéeing florendos gotten aduantage hée diſſembled griefe beſt manner could tooke leaue damoſell reported al vnto ſtayed till came conſtantinople haue declared already craue pardon leaue palmerin england prince florian deſart brother ſtayed twenty two dayes monaſtery giant dramuſiande left well healed appointed new armour siluian cauſed made departed thence greatly thanking religious good diligence vſed weakeneſſe neare conſtantinople becauſe ſuppoſed time yet enter citie alighted horſes contemplate diuers accident happened mind elorian whō paſſions loue could take certaine place diſſembling euery thing content fancy layde downe vnder trée muſe aduentures fortune ſhould permit enterpriſe palmerin many along looke towards citie recounted great fauour found emperor court alſo gentle departure princeſſe polinarda ſo determined enter citie siluian vſed perſwaſions contrary vſed conceit ſuch matter liked beſt mounted horſebacke rode toward court arriued ſuch time emperour riſen dinner empreſſe lady come great hall ſée farther triall cup prince florendos albayzar though perfectly healed came foorth chamber manifeſt conſtant loue alwayes conceiued loyall heart palmerin florian went vp great hall leauing siluian court gate leaſt perhaps ſhould knowne come emperor albayzar lay vpon cloth blacke veluet beholding beautie princeſſe targiana aroſe tooke cup hand became cleare prince floraman held whereat targiana receiued gread pleaſure albayzar ſatiſfied becauſe ſaw aduenture concluded palmerin becauſe would knowen bare dragon deuiſe shield brother florian ſtanding ſéeing cup ſo blacke changed ſuch brightneſſe hand albayzar began conceiue great occaſion maruaile deſirous knowe chance happened emperor often beholding iudging perſons ſome great authority cōmanded ſhould placed began diſcourſe large cup deſirous know likewiſe whēce excuſed themſelues ſo honourably emperor held himſelfe cōtented theſe two engliſh prince held talke emperor prince florendos leaning lap ſiſter princeſſe polinarda aroſe muſing beauty miragarda began mind vſe theſe ſpéeches madame would might ſée triall troth might moue hereafter vſe according proue loyall truth taking cup damoſell receiued farre brightneſſe euer teares brought ſuch eſtate though béen frozen whereat emperour primaleon ioyfull ſée ſuch perfect proofe amitie prince florendos made requeſt damoſell aduenture yet ended moſt noble emperor quoth ſhe cup teares tranſformed greateſt perfection yet could bring command come néere haue yet made proofe cup receiue change eſtéeme knight moſt conſtant faithfulleſt louer world ſo cup alter againe beleeue aſſuredly knight ſhall excéede either knightly déeds armes elſe amorous conſtancy louer emperour ſeeing al knight aſſaied cup deſired knight dragon fellow make triall alſo palmerin ſo buſie beholding faire polinarda heard emperor word wherfore florian frée louers paſſions albeit could diſſemble lady indifferently aduanced himſelfe theſe wordes lady targiana lady defi • e aſſiſtance paſſing danger forſake onely let enioy recompence deſert thing hold greater eſtimation reſerue greater affection theſe word farre diſtant loyalty louer ſo holding cup manifeſt ſame held nothing world iudged blacke grieſly cup ſéemed inſtant targiana knew yet would known therof griefe ſhe conceiued accident •• retired chamber repenting euer ſhee beſtowed loue eſteemed ſo ſmall fidelity damoſell thrace receiuing cup againe florian ſaid sir knight fortune ſpéed better déedes armes action manifeſt faithfulneſſe loue would • ounſell neuer hereafter purſue aduentures faire lady anſwered florian recompence ſeruants according deſert would greatly grieue fal ſo hard deſtiny farre diſtance reaſon maketh eſteeme leſſe ſhould paſſe farther ſuffer ſelfe inueigled ſnares leſſe bee pittied ſeeme bewaile languiſhing life anſwer florian albeit ſéemed acceptable many knight yet lady receiued great contempt becauſe naturall quality ſuch yéelde according déedes thoſe ſubmit themſelues abide pleaſure contrariwiſe naturall inclination vſe ſuch recompence ſeruice haue receiued neuer deſerued damoſel thrace came knight dragon deſiring try cup according diuers done perſwading perſon ſo knightly hée ſéemed expected good iſſue palmerin ſéeing matter brought extremity caſt eye damoſell heart whoſe obſtinacy cauſed die griefe entring theſe ſpéeches aduenture truth pray lady henceforth excuſe fearfulneſſe dare preſume think mind receiuing cup contained ſame quallitie hand prince florendos becauſe could exceede farther emperour glad tooke cup prooue reſt damoſels word bottome teares beheld empreſſe pleaſant euer ſéene made thinke aduenture ended doubting contrary requeſted damoſell cup ſhuld alway remaine ſtate whereto damoſell anſwered thus muſt 〈◊〉 tried wil turne againe former blacknes deſire knight meaning prince florian make triall thereof hath ſo little deſire kéepe loue faithfull lady cup hand ſtand great danger pretty triump ladyes conceiued good occaſion laughter emperour commanded al knight ſhould take cup againe labour vaine neuer ſéemed alter colour wherefore empreſſe tooke beheld emperour ſo perfectly ſhe verily ſéene face empreſſe came gridonia bazilia wherin ſaw chiefly eſtéemed princeſſe polinarda took ſhe perceiued noble palmerin england ſuch heauines able endure extreame grieuous countenance ſhe deliuered cup fearing let fall hand ſhaked ſo maruelouſly none knew cauſe thereof except emperour whoſe amorous youthfull time gaue occaſion thinke ſhee ſéene ſome one cup greatly deſired doe ſeruice made round eare ſaying faire daughter make mee iudge want ſeruant word ſhe began ſo ſweetely bluſh rare beauty gaue excellent colour whereat knight dragon became afflicted cup paſſed hand hand till came againe prince palmeriu beholding ſwéet face faire polinarda tooke occaſion ſpeake maner himſelfe gratious lady well perceiue countenance haue forgotten borne ſeruice yet doth miſerie time conſtraine liue without hope deſiring nothing elſe accompliſh pleaſure deliuered cup brother florian beheld bottome teares prince araalte nauarre faire targiana alſo many lady greatly offended theſe twain deceiued wherefore damoſell taking cup ſaid doe sir knight behold iſſue vnfaithfull loue whereto preſently ſhaped anſwere ſéemeth ſex canno hartily fauour knight oweth moſt affection maketh many force conſtancy yet thus much dare aſſure lady haue ſhall great deale better ſecured diuers haue tried aduenture cup hath ſhowne fauour damoſell making anſwere turned emperour ſaying deſire highneſſe n • w proofe may made thoſe moſt chiefeſt beloued wherein credit receiue great pleaſure agréed quoth emperour intend ſelfe mak triall firſt ſo ſhal perceiue ſlenderly fauoured empreſſe haue loſt power end aduenture holding cup remained ſame order ſtill without change apparance heate wherefore damoſell ſaid lord muſt confeſſe ſelfe time paſt therefore deliuer cup empreſſe hath ſo truly faithfully loued empreſſe hand continued ſtill wherfore primaleon king polendos faithfully beloued lady made cup ſtill containe chiefe brightnes theſe two prince roſuell aduanced himſelfe make triall loue ſo little heate cup contained vrged deliuer prince platir found altogether ſo hot roſuell paſſed hand ſome good hap ſome ill till came againe prince florian paſſed lightly becauſe heart exempted frée louers griefe albayzar tooke loue fauored ſo much held great came turne knight dragon whoſe hap proued worſe reſt cup ſo enflamed round ſéethed euen water doth vpon fire cauſed great feare beh • ld griefe hee patience abide verily thought conſumate day vexation life ſhould end ſupportable meane made would let go cup kept ſo conſtantly euery one thought remedy death truſt ſaid damoſell vnfained loue ſo true knight deſerueth rewarded ſo ſharp recōpence theſe word ſhe offered take cup gaue backe anſwering thus faire ladie deſire ſuffer abide doome miſhap hath alway ordeined wherein may end trouble incident mourning continual diſpairing life emperor able abide ſo great crueltie executed preſence aroſe caught cup immediatly quenched though neuer bin ſo violent whereat receiued ſmall cauſe amazemen prince florendos albeit weake yet deſirous partner conſtancy knight dragon receiued cuppe hand emperour preſently rigour prince miragarda vſed towards cauſed ſuffer ſelfe ſame torment noble prince palmerin flame aroſe cup ſo inuironed body prince ſéene ſighing lamenting midſt thereof mooued lady ſhed aboundance teares vſe many extreame word againſt cruelty miragarda florendos though midſt flame could hardly ſuffer hear blamed whoſe ſake ready make ſacrifice himſelfe emperor ſéeing many meanes applied quench flame yet none power preuaile put himſelfe midſt thereof tooke cup florendos thinking would preſently bequenched labor effect flame continued empreſſe gridonia al lad • e knight fell ſuch rufull complaint maruailous heare noyſe made grieuous ſpectacle polendos king theſſalie came damoſell thrace theſe word deſire faire lady ſéeing haue found thing ſought would vouchſafe courteſie ſuccour dangerous caſe prince florendos ſo agrieued quoth damoſel great tumult made wherein wil vouchſafe heare know ſay doe giue order appeaſe murmuring wil work meane deliuer prince danger emperours commaundement diſturbance quieted damoſell preſented ſelfe emperor ſaying aduertiſe moſt dread gratious emperor aduēture cup already paſt finiſhed flame doth compaſſe prince florendos way extinguiſhed vertue conſiſteth teares hand knight hath ended enchantment cup muſt ſprinckled flame wherein encloſed dare aſſure prince ſhall brought former eſtate fire ingendred ſuch cruell woman loueth cannot way quenched onely teares ſuch pitiful lady conſtant faithfull brandiſia ſhe deliuered cup knight dragon put finger therin ſprinckled teares vpon florendos preſently fire vaniſhed away leauing florendos men thought verily dead aliue good eſtate great content emperour company chap xciii another aduenture happened court emperour palmerin followed florendos thus happily deliuered great ioy courtty company wiſhed ſhe intreated faithful loue ſo great cruelty béene place ſhe might haue ſéene triall inuiolate faith emperor deſirous know knight whoſe ſpotleſſe loyaltie ended enchantment miſdoubting y• noble palmerin england deſired earneſtly would make himſelfe knowne vnto palmerin putting hand helmet diſcouer himſelfe hindered aduenture hereafter followeth ſudden entred hal lady accompanied three mighty ougly giant whoſe armour colour faſhion helmet carried thrée men ſo ſwart euill fauoured face cauſed lady tremble alſo many knightes change colour theſe proud ſtately giant thronged middeſt knightes aduancing themſelues emperour without ſhewing courteſie reuerence ſtayed damoſell charge declare ſéeing ſo great nobilitie emperour ſomewhat offended yet notwithſtanding ſhe ſeaſed fury began order perceiue right noble emperour renowne blazed world princely court little reſpecting honourable company ſee preſent vrgeth enter due land therof hath rightly iuſtly deſerueth ſo opinion might ſubdue gouern whole world would diſtribute force iudge way able matched yet fortune affaire hath hitherto proſpered may vngently enuious long quiet peaceable felicity turne backe towards ſo ſuddenly fury ouerturne good fortune glory haue gained prime yeeres may defaced aged eſtate forbiddeth follow trauaile armes long happineſſe vnwilling enter warres wherewith come ſummon soldane perſia principal captaine law mahomet alſo great turk y• noble gouernours coūtrey belonging soldane babilon named albayzar ſtrange aduentures hath put himſelfe make triall valour vpon hope long expected good fortune theſe named let vnderſtand time certaine heathen prince ſlaine wall conſtantinople whoſe death hath vrged great impatience ſéeke reuenge great wrong haue offered god protector defendor welfare fauouring beyond expectation haue heretofore hindred determination theſe prince prepared ruine kingdomes vtterly race fame memorie hath ſuch quarrel ſeditions ſprung vp amongſt haue murthered one another happening many ſundrie time hath ſuffered put pretence execution wherefore auoid ſuch miſchance alſo fauour euil may happen haue ſent v highneſſe certaine condition performing whereof ſhall end hatred ioyntly ioyne continuall friend firſt ſhall ſend polinarda daughter prince primaleon ſonne soldane perſia aged xxv yéeres prince much renowned puiſſant incomparable rich ſhee ſhall bee eſpouſed beſéemeth ſuch noble prince ſecond florandos sonne ſhall promiſe marry armenia daughter soldane named princeſſe ſuch ſingular heauty ſhee thought excell lady liuing earth dowrie soldane giue title hée hath theſe part empire without deſiring recompence prince albayzar soldan babylon becauſe soldane father lately deceaſed thus haue reported whole ſumme ambaſſage attending highneſſe ſhall anſwere ſame wil agrée heathen prince theſe giant haue charge tell perhappes may enforce greater maruell emperour hauing noted word damoſell ſmiling thereat began ſay truly lady deſire heare giant muſt report becauſe perhappes ſhall haue better opinion word thoſe haue ſpoken concerning amitie princeſſe requeſt condition lincked ſo many contrary rather chuſe perpetuall warre wherein ſelfe friendes ſubiects willingly die hold league ſuch order knight requeſt haue altogether ignorant abideth hée preſent court would ſuffer receiue iniury perſwade ſelfe princeſſe targiana rather come hither compulſion hath béene vſed anſwere haue determined giue wherefore let knight declare haue commiſſion one giant aduanced himſelfe emperour vnreuerently entred theſe ſpéeches heathen prince whoſe iuſt law full requeſt thinke ſcorne grant doe ſend defiance thée dare vndertake meane motion offer thée ſuccour yea pronounce open warre againſt thée behalfe call god record onely intend thy death thoſe dare preſume beare armour againſt v place moſt renowne thine empire ſhall changed waſt deſolate wilderneſſe thou ſhalt well perceiue thou ſéeſt thy men murdered thy woman cruelly ſpoyled thy virgines violated thy child martired yea infant torne mother breaſt gored top lance witneſſe great grieuous vnſpeakeable fury channel thy ſtréetes ſhall powre foorth blood thy murdered ſubiects thy citie ſtandeth abounding wealth exceſſiue pride ſurpaſſing prodigality ſhall fire vtterly conſumed thy whole kingdomes ſignories raced ruinated ſo ſhall eſcape bloody tiranny may ſit downe ſighing ſay ſometime ſtood citie conſtantinople th • ſe place ſometime whoſe heart greatly reioyced receiue ſwéete content ſo long deſired chiefeſt grief eclipſed ioy becauſe prince florendos ſhould preſent faire miragarda thought made ſo pleaſant beloued otherwiſe hee would haue béene time came departure targiana humbly ſubmitted himſelfe princeſſe gridonia lady eſpecially princeſſe polinarda vſed graciouſly time abyding emperour knight rode two mile citie committing charge polendos prince could perſwade florendos would needes preſent albayzar caſtle almarol witnes vnfained faith lady miſtreſſe miragarda emperor taking leaue targiana returned traine cittie endeuouring himſelfe change mind florendos vaine two dayes departed conſtantinople accompanied albayzar would ſuffer weare armour permitted one eſquires belonging targiana himſelfe tooke twaine one carrie shield miragarda couered carry owne thus iourney intend leaue damoſel thrace ſéeing prince palmerin good diſpoſition health preſence emperour ſhe ſpake thus worthy sir thinke ſufficiently certified cannot depart hence without company ſéeing haue finiſhed many yeares haue béene thought impoſſible wherefore moſt humbly beſéech would imploy ſelfe ende likewiſe miſerable eſtate diſtreſſed moſt infortunate princeſſe thrace whoſe enchantment way expelled whoſe renown ſhall ſpeake ſhal ioyne marriage ſo make ſelfe king ouer thrace perchance deſire haue follow aduentures wil ſuffer ioyn honourable eſtate ſhall ſhe ſtand appointment marry ſuch one ſhall thinke méeteſt wherfore deſire ſet part excuſes enter vpon iourney ſo ſoone poſſible may faire lady anſwered palmerin ſo much vſed trauaile know better continue neuer refuſe aide perſon whoſe intent might preiudice alwayes bound obey therefore aſſure ſelfe ſo ſoone ſhall prouided armour becauſe albaroco hath ſo diſappointed ſtay accompliſh deſire damoſell well pleaſed anſwer palmerin emperor wiſhed good nephew conceiued great gréefe leaue company ſo ſoone▪ wherefore went chamber empreſſe alſo ſorry ſhe heard theſe newes likewiſe prince polinarda hearing palmerin ſhould ſo ſoone leaue court went chamber amated great griefe many paſſions minde dramaciana perceiuing knowing well cauſe heauines caine perſwade manner faire miſtreſſe neuer thought miſfortune could depriue diſcretion haue alwaies vſed gréefe grounded departure palmerin conſider y• deſire euer may behold • though truth deſerueth enioy moſt excellent prince y• earth yet dare aſſure beauty ſufficient yéeld heart vnder obeyſance onely deſireth ſwéet friend loue without good hope deſire know could long enioy life perſwadeth himſelf enioy gladſom long expected felicity wherfore deſire vſe ſuch courteous fauour towards may vrge ſooner returne court folinarda hauing receiued ſome content word dramaciana made anſwer manner well brooke ſudden voyage palmerin aboue loue heart giue moſt honour yet make ſo priuy thought albeit ſuſtained hazard death becauſe perhaps beauty leo • arna princeſſe thrace may alter affection hath vowed beléeue quoth dramaciana inconſtancy cannot harbour heart proued himſelfe ſo loyal aduenture cup preuent worſt vouchſafe leaue priuate talke vſe ſuch meanes ſhall quickly ſound depth intent polinarda eſtéeming deui • e returned preſently aunſwere thinke ſo well dramiciana pretty inuention well content procéed therein loues pray vſe circumſtance matter ſuch ſort perceiue nothing therein done polinarda thus concluding ſpeeches went ſate princeſſe gridonia mother mean engliſh prince remembring haſty iourney alſo ſmall kindneſſe perceiued lady paſſed day many ſilent thought whe •• euening came went empres chamber knight lady danced duty came ſate downe dramaciana familiar entred theſe ſpéeches swéet friend either might could vtter complaint opinion receiue redreſſe verie glad conſent would ſéeing ſorrowes grow greater extreame none dare bewray requeſt ſo much courteſie hand reſolue one two queſtions thus cauſe lady polinarda dealeth ſo hardly driue vtter deſpaire contempt life ſhe thinke deſerue greater fauour truſt may iudge ouermuch vnkind care meane motion lay heart foote loyall ſerucice ſhe ſéeth full well griefe couereth ſelfe ſuch cloſe conceit ſhe ſéeme know onely becauſe ſhe either daintie courteſie elſe thinketh ſcorne recompence trauell deſire beare witneſſe faith neither forceth paine torment miſerie ſo ſhe would forget knight ſuffreth al ſake cannot expreſſe would ſuffer ſo might pleaſe eſtéeme thereof truſt ſwéete friend neuer life entered ſo farre ſpéech hereof perſon would haue gone ſo farre preſent proofe fidelitie hath conſtrained ſpeake haue heard knowing well truſtie friend ſecret buried bottome ſea sir palmerin anſwerd dramaciana long time haue abſented ſelfe hence hath mooued thinke mind addicted ſome purpoſe ſo iudge rather complaine cuſtom cauſe al wont hold fiſh baire greatly • whether beſt take let goe aduertiſed go end enchantment leonarda heire prince thrace whoſe loue feare cauſe forget old friend wherefore may greater eaſe beare ſo ſmall burthen truſt anſwered palmerin beautie leonarda rich proffer preferment world ſhal haue power alter qualitie might iudged either inconſtant faith negligent promiſe cauſe haue greater deſire ſpeake princeſſe polinarda ſhe may aſſured loyaltie poore heart mine ſhall continue death well quoth ſhe conſtancie ſuch report thinke ſo ſmall matter changed ſpeaking lady know time vnpoſſible wherfore triall truth prepare ſelfe depart damoſell thrace abſence wil ſo manifeſt conſtancie return ſhall ſpeake pleaſure y• mean time wil promiſe occaſion moued offend ſo good prince theſe word palmerin thought haue made anſwer dancing done hindered purpoſe ſo dramaciana conſtrained part company glad diſcloſed part griefe would ſollicite ſute ample manner night tooke better reſt done ſince departure england next morning roſe early faire new armour preſented ſhield bare man torne péeces tiger went damoſel take leaue emperor brought empreſſe chamber humbly duty alſo gridonia bazilia lady departed damoſell siluian towards kingdome thrace soone two allemaigne ambaſſadours arriued court yéelding ſeate gouernment ancient emperour trineus deceaſſed prince vernar ſonne theſe newes great
