princeſſe targiana sea happened prince florendos fort aſtribor king polendos hundred knight bare company conduct princeſſe targiana home againe ſayling pleaſure fortune ſo aduerſe tooke coaſt africa aſſaulted ten galleyes belonging king mamercos chiefe gouernour cenia countrey vnder ſubiection k polendos ſéeing himſelfe point ſo extreame danger dealt ſuch braue forceable manner ſuncke tooke captaine couzin knight tunis looſing one knight noble ſkirmiſh glory conqueſt came princeſſe targiana glad ſée ſelfe deliuered ſo great danger honoured ſuch worthy wiſe king polendos noble priſoner ſet forward voyage turkie winde ſeruing ſo well ſhort time arriued citie great turke reſident witneſſe honourable cōpany vnder sayle diſcharge ordinance ſuch braue peale people accuſtomed ſo ſuddaine gréeting came running heapes hauen knowe cauſe ſuch braue warning great turke himſelfe deſirous likewiſe vnderſtand theſe newes came ryding courtly attendant toward hauen polendos eſpying tooke faire targiana hand accompanied noble train prince knight armed rich ſumptuous order preſented father falling knées bedewing face fewe teares ſhe humbled ſelfe kiſſe féete great turke mooued naturall remorſe pitie embraced louingly armes came king polendos company vſing marueilous princely gratious fauour lodging pallace feaſting ſuch noble wiſe emperor court thought themſelues time better vſed thus continued poſſible pleaſure till day came departure turke vſed ſuch intreaty thē perſwaded ſtay one day longer prepared ſuch priuely feaſt time neuer like paſſing dinner time talke emperor palmerin alſo honorable vſage daughter conſtantinople table ſooner withdrawne entred fiftie armed well appointed knight one hauing ſwoord drawen hand cōmanding one ſhould offer reſiſtance except would preſently looſe life great turke entred falſe ſecret doore giuing thē theſe ſpéeches yéeld polendos grant thy ſelfe thy company priſoners otherwiſe ſhall preſently looſe heades polendos knight tooke one corner hall kéeping sword hand himſelfe ſpake turke order would gladly knowe cauſe offer v great diſcourteſie conſidering well daughter hath béene vſed conſtantinople alſo honour haue done conduct ſafely court polendos anſwered turke emperor thy lord thy ſelfe theſe thy friend meane harme ſo offended knight tooke daughter hence greece promiſe ſhall depart hence till emperour deliuer knight hand truſt quoth polendos hope would ſtand hard ſuſpence ſhould ſtay condition wherefore eſtéeme honour end liues face enemy thy vaſſailes continuall priſon hereupon aſſure thy ſelfe emperour would gladly leaue knight court ſatiſfie thy deſire one moſt hardy nobleſt knight earth likewiſe wiſh much good mine owne ſoule well ſayd turke muſt reſolue ſelues either preſently abide death ſubmit ſelues remaine priſoners theſe word princeſſe targiana caſt ſelfe knées father deſiring vſe ſuch cruelty done ſo much honor emperor court alſo deliuered peril life dangerouſly aſſaulted came voyage turke ſeeing imporunate daughter great anger conuayed himſelf forth againe becauſe would ſée ſlaughter ſo many good knight targiana ſéeing father gone intreated king polendos company would ſuffer themſelues remaine priſoners abide danger ſhould offer reſiſtance naked hauing nothing defend withal time priſon ſhe would either deuiſe accompliſh ſuch meanes ſhe doubt purchaſe liberty vpon good perſwaſion yeelded themſelues preſently carryed deepe dungeon ſtrong tower laded many iron could poſſible beare whereat targiana receiued great griefe cloathing ſelfe mourning apparell would neuer ſhew merry countenance time knight priſon remained long time ſhall reade ſecond part booke turke commanded chriſtian galley kept ſafe ſure protection preſently ſent word soldane perſia prince diuers emperours knight priſoners determined ſharp reuenge great iniury florian deſart done theſe newes eſtéemed ſtrange neuertheleſſe fearefull way diſpleaſe made reſemblance good opinion matter giuing counſell kéepe vntill prince albayzar returned elſe emperour might cauſe ſlaine great turke truſted much deuiſe ſuffering captiue prince might ſend eſquires emperour palmerin aduertiſe miſerie wherein remained eſquires meanes would forſake maiſters deſiring accompanied proſperity ſo leaue great miſchance belcar perceiued commanded eſquire go certerfie emperour great miſhap befollen vnto eſquire come conſtantinople theſe newes nothing welcome emperor nether primaleon entred theſe word gratious lord father miſchance onely procured meanes dealt ſo courteouſly neither quality motion deſert would gladly ſée thing accompliſh way pleaſure iudge power ſufficient deliuer bondage wherein wherfore thinke beſt ſend ſpéed ſéeke prince albayzar may recouer king polendos knight way cannot perceiue may pleaſure profite sonne anſwered emperour impriſonment polendos knight perpetuall would ſéeke ſet liberty meane rather ſhould enioy death accompliſh might continuall reproach difference alway craue betweene world good may perfectly diſcerned euill albayzer guilty iniury turke doeth ſéeme offer knightes therefore againſt honour ſhould ſuffer anothers offence whereat moſt amazed targiana ſuffer great diſcourteſie conſidering honour ſhe receiued court deare soueraigne quoth eſquire cauſe complaine intreaty could way preuaile • er father whereupon hee rehearſed whole diſcourſe • nd manner impriſonment emperour ha • ing heard departed empreſſe chamber • rie muſt forſake returne prince • lorendos trauailed ſo long accompanied noble albayzar •• dominion spaine came faire • aſtell albayzar knowing well began thus open intent sir florendos haue heretofore paſſed place greateſt danger euer fror giuing aide damoſell bloody minded wretch ſought diſhoneſt ſlewe ten alſo lord named dramorant cruell kept caſtell exployte noble palmerin england florian pompides brother preſent teſtifie haue ſpoken therefore pray let v goe caſtell aſſure ſelfe lady gaue ſuch time deliuered danger receiue v courteous friendly welcome content quoth florendos ſéeing haue place lodge night ſée néere thus breaking talke rid two ſtones caſt beheld foure armed knight come towards eſquire came vttering theſe word prince florendos sir knight great aſtribor ſendeth ſtrait commandement companious preſentle yéeld armour vnder obeyſance deniall wherof ſhall cauſe vſe cruelty toward would willingly offer good knight thing doth requeſt except report tydings knight hath ſ • aine dramorant brother ſometime lord rightfull poſſeſſor caſtle giuen knight damoſell keepeth priſon till fortune ſend knight hither ſacrifice god reuenge brother death albayzar aduanced himſelfe make anſwere becauſe vnarmed florendos thus replied eſquire goe tell lord aſtribor knight would ſo gladly finde well acquainted ſure hée hath ſlaine knightes deſeruedly mine armour becauſe cannot well ſpare c • ntent ſhall goe without time except knowledge haue ſhall returne well ſaid eſquire ſince yéelde gentle meanes muſt prepare ſelfe againſt theſe knight appointed ſufficient authoritie take armor away perforce refuſed yéeld according cuſtome florendos ſeeing knight prouided iouſt encountred ſent two couragiouſly meaſure length ground one ſlaine outright ſo ſore wounded able rec • uer himſelfe came foorth aſtribor himſelfe brauely mounted ſéeing florendos deſtitute launce gaue horſe ſpurs ran againſt ſuch force florendos conſtrained fall ground recouering himſelfe dealt aſtribor ſuch couragious manner bringing vnder obeyſance cut head recompence diſloyall actes certaine knight caſtell ſéene lord maſter ſo conquered lett armour cōming toward prince florendos reuerent manner yéelded themſelues would enter caſtell lady might come ſoorth priſon whereupon albayzar entred found dungeon cruelly vſed ſo great ſhe could remember laſt ſhee fell knées reward gentleneſſe ſubmitted ſelfe kiſſe hand would ſuffer ſuſtained courteouſly armes willing thanke prince florendos becauſe ſuffered beare armour lady theſe word fell great rage though ſhe diſtraight wit began thus ſay curſed hath ſo diſhonoured yon credit knightly armes better beſtowed linage wherefore thus perſwaded lady ſhall haue loſſe ſo good knight whoſe heart aud hand euer ready aide albayzar ſuffering runne ſo farre praiſe framed talke another purpoſe deſirous knowe maner aſtribor happened thither syr quoth ſhe ſhal vnderſtand aſtribor brother dramorant cruell man malicious nature euer giant brother ſooner aduertiſed death ten knight came vnto fortreſſe finding ſmall force reſiſt entred cau • ing found put ſword reſeruing priſon till might chance haue knowledge intended burne v together till might come ordained cuſtome ſo worthily finiſhed albayzar certified euery thing pleaſure cauſed prince florendos vnarmed woundes carefully reſpected lady good knowledge art chirugery ſtayed longer prince florendos willingly would place neuer ſo pleaſant could ſatiſfie fancy onely place remained beſt beloued chap xcvii happened palmrin england company damoſell thrace svch ſpéede noble palmerin england made company damoſel trauailed without aduenture hinder quietly entred kingdome thrace whereat damoſell ioyfull ſéeing euery thing fell ſo fit ſhe deſired labour ſhe ſpent ſo many yéeres began ſo happily proſper damoſell well knowne highly honoured kingdome great reſort people came many city townes receiue ioyfully béene ſo long time abſent people beholding prince palmerin gaue foorth theſe ſpéeches one another behold gratious lord soueraigne happy ſhall ſubiects vnder gouernment ſuch noble prince remaineth courage clemency ſhall finiſh enchanted eſtate princeſſe enioy onely quéene lady gouerne scepter ouer v according deceaſed prince appoint palmerin applied whole cogitation might manifeſt loyaltie princeſſe polinarda reſpected honour done vnto though hée good hope ende enterpriſe intent preſently returne lady miſtreſſe opinion rode togither til came city limorſana principall lord ruler came receiue triumphes poſſible conducting royall pallace reſpects vſing king emperour came chamber quéene carmelia aunt princeſſe leonarda duty vnto ſhe receiued nobly bene owne ſonne becauſe ſhe verily thought ſhould marry princeſſe ſhe farre intent engliſh priuce ſéeing ſo verily beléeue ſhould gouernour thrace ſomewhat offended remembring promiſe lady polinarda wherefore tooke leaue courteouſly bowing himſelfe quéene carmelia went chamber vnarmed siluian damoſell came way company ſupper accompanyed quéene carmelia many lord noble gentleman country ſhewed great courteſie engliſh prince till houre reſt came euery one departed chamber palmerin lodging could take reſt becauſe deſired ſo much deliuery princeſſe leonarda morning siluian armed early ſo lord came chamber found ready depart thence wherfore accompanied chappel ſeruice ſolemnized royally archbiſhop cittie rode neare place princeſſe enchanted reporting danger feare aduenture ſhould chance vnto chap xcviii palmerin tooke way enchaunted princeſſe happened ſhort time lord brought prince place leonarda remained enchanted beheld pleaſant valley company braue ſtauely tower among gréene trées building ſéeming ſo excellent eye nature could haue inuented gallant ſo thought framed celeſtiall power rather earthly creature palmerin glad ſée thing ſo pleaſant though ſorrowfull abſent lady polinarda comparing great felicitie ſhould enioy princeſſe leonarda mournfull thought frequented mind could make choyſe nothing onely hope hée fauoured lady whoſe remembrance cauſed aduenture promiſe pleaſure hazard ſuch doubt could moue feare thing truly great grace diſcréete man becauſe diuers tune ſée doubtfulleſt thing haue pleaſanteſt iſſue ſéemeth moſt pleaſant beginning doth proue ſharpeſt danger ending euen ſo noble prince palmerin contained ſuch courage magnanimity mind feare diſmaying power ſupplant thought becauſe good fortune ſuffered returne euery attempt honour one chéefe knight kept company preſented himſelfe manner moſt worthy sir fortune hath alway béene ſo great friend danger diſtreſſe could offer diſmay ſéeme diſcourage ſelfe aduenture accuſtomed proſperity forſake preſent yet ſometime raw procéeding returneth vnexpected vndeſerued puniſhment caſe ſtandeth noble ſelfe accompanied ſo great aduiſed care cannot moue foote vertue ſhall warrant ſafety pardon good sir haue béene ouer lauiſh ſpéech intended iſſue onely aduertiſe aduenture perillous therefore craueth héed friendly admoniſhment better late repentance sir anſwered palmerin counſaile ſhewing ſo great grauity foreſight eſtéeme great deale time vtter fortune ſpéede enterpriſe vnmindfull friendly good promiſe preſented ſo great humanitie enflamed ſuddaine enuy heart ſome preſent hope ſée king began enter diſſembling prayſes true faithfull ſubiect would ſéeme offer began perſwade aduenture dangerous ſoeuer proued might attaine power aſtoniſh perſon declining ſuch vainglorious prayſes dayly gift workes flatterer courteouſſy tooke leaue ſet ſpurs horſe riding towards determination example ſurely worthy great praiſe prince ruler liuing earth ſhould incline leane ſuch onely ſtudy ſwéete word flattering tale falſe report reſt bring aſléepe ſo vile exerciſe painted face would ſuppreſſe subiects friend seruants ſhould bée equally regarded renowne plentifully encreaſed accordingly honoured yea vertuous ſhould richly rewarded vicious rightfully euer reproched would plaine dealer gouerned ſuch haue béene noted good ſhould openly diſcerned euill enioy one hope continuall quiet matter palmerin come ſomewhat neare place light beganne darken ayre maruellouſly troubled miſtie ſo lord thrace ouercome ſuch feare ſome fell beſide horſes ſome hurt themſelues ſore made haſt citie faſt could tho darkeneſſe likewiſe terrible siluian palmerin willed ſtay behind ſéeing ſuddaine feare tooke ſuch courage would follow maiſter enchantment would ſuffer enter ſaue onely knight power ende siluian forced returne citie hée found people great aſtoniſhment happened ſince departure palmerin remembring wordes ancient knight beganne diſlike enſtance ſharpe euill thought eaſily finde way aduenture greatly deceiued hée felt ſuch paine ſuppoſed would haue rent aſunder likewiſe thought finde place power torment beyond loue bare lady found expectation altered inuiſible motion diſmounted horſe wherevpon anger hee drewe swoord thinking preuaile againſt ouerthrew ſéeing blowes ſmitten againſt winde thought mount horſebacke againe ride forward labour vaine poſſible finde horſe diſaduantage onely swoord taken likewiſe armour caught away ſuddaine darkeneſſe ſo violent hée commoditie goe forward yet goe backe againe place commaunded siluian tarrie chap xcix ¶what happened prince palmerin daungerous aduenture palmerin hauing loſt horſe armor haue heard already became full heauineſſe becauſe reſpect naked ſo hard aduenture required better prouiſion ſtrength ſuddaine beganne faile armes legges denied wonted nimbleneſſe ſuddaine heard mighty terrible thundering ſtill expected earth would haue opened vnder vpon heard fearefull hollowe voyce looking could perceiue body ſnatcht vp ſuch mighty height ſtill looked ſhould violently throwen downe againe feare power hurt greater comfort light excluded darkeneſſe away found himſelfe middeſt little iland encloſed rounde lake ſo blacke ouglie thought one flood hell néere eſpyed olde withered trée vnderneath ſtoode knight armed armour palmerin swoorde like wiſe hand whereupon began prince order deſire syr knight ſée preſent meanes thou canſt defend thy ſelfe swoorde mangle thy fleſh bone whereon wilde beaſtes countrey ſhall feed ſo thy renowne famed ouer whole earth ſhall take full end none approach beare witneſſe thy death prince neuer accuſtomed feate nowe ſurpriſed maruaylous manner whereat maruaile ought bee vſed hée deſtitute thing defence ſtriue armes ſuch enemie hee founde altogether inſufficient yet notwithſtanding extremitie fortune allotted hée approched knight offering aduenture ſo vppon thought cloſe together darke cloude ſuddainly ouerſhadowed ſo palmerin could way diſcerne knight thinking gripe sword ſuddainly put hand armour hée perceyued vnder tree knight gone knew way palmerin héereat ſomewhat abaſhed ſéeing aduenture ſo repleniſhed fearefull aſſaults end would changed rigour armed himſelfe againe ſuch courage ſtrength encreaſed alſo minde nobly addicted accompliſh ſo mucgh deſired light beganne chéerefull againe palmerin diſcerned faire caſtell whereto could attaine without croſſing ougly lake paſſe hée coulde deuiſe meanes woulde ſtand hazarde life beſide banke ſide ſo ſtéepe approching downe water could iudge himſelfe howe get vp becauſe 〈◊〉 w • ight armour would 〈◊〉 great hinderaunce 〈◊〉 ſide hée would yet hinder determination hee eſpyed companie mo ••• ous miſhapen beaſts ſuddaine fought ſo furiouſly together end vtterly ſpoyld killed one another gréeuous fight thus ended hée went iland ſee might haue paſſage ſide laſt eſpied boate hauing foure ore handled gouerned foure ape eche one tyed mighty chayne one ende boate ſate mighty lyon embrued blood though maiſter conducter paſſage fed himſelfe nothing elſe fleſh paſſengers palmerin tooke occaſion beholde ſight eſpied man farder ſide cry beaſtes carry ouer whereat became much amazed thought man ſo fooliſh hazard himſelfe vnder ſuch pilote man ſooner entred boate lyon ſtraight way rent peeces giuing part companion ſuſtaine life prince ſtood behold knew determine himſelfe ſawe way paſſe terror death behind wherefore ſeeing remedy hee concluded put himſelfe rigour beaſts ſhift ſtrength armes ſawe himſelfe wholly deſtitute hope héereupon looked hée might diſcende downe rocke ſo ſlipperie ſtéepe hée thought way breake necke extremitie hée committed himſelfe god afterward miſtreſſe beganne manner madame loſſe life appaleth hope fauour ſuſtaineth doubte well conſider ſelfe ending life aduenture greateſt good euer may happen becauſe inſupportable paine ſhall attaine perfect full concluſion yet knowing gréefe molleſteth procéedeth none onely fixe ioy comfort ende helpe extreames onely aduancement good fortune héere taking occaſion ſtay hée ſuffered himſelfe ſlyde ſoftly downe rocke attained riuer ſide without harme whereupon lyon fellowes came receiue boate hée perceiuing enchauntment drew ſword offered reſiſtance preſently beaſts vaniſhed knew way palmerin leaped boate diligence rowed himſelfe y• farther ſide landed hée cauſe maruaile becauſe hée ſawe way get vp vpon rocke walking litle aſide hée beheld rope reached ground top ſo ſlender rotten hée thought able abide waight armour wherefore make himſelf lighter determined leaue armor yet knowing occaſion ſhould haue vſe ſhould come top rocke bound himſelfe middle rope preſently hée pulde vp maruailous ſpeede toppe could perceiue drawne vp knew field beaſts ſlaine euery thing enchauntment preſented cauſe abate courage fore addicted himſelfe ſo aduenturous feare world power diſmay chap c palmerin ended enchantment princeſſe leonarda night palmerin reſted himſelfe vnder trée morning beheld tower brauely wherefore walked laſt eſpied horſe tyed trée worſe caſe left mounting vpon rode little hee met two knight without word couched ſpeares againſt firſt receiued vpon shield knight preſently vaniſhed away ſecond burſt lance vpon whervpon palmerin followed requite blow ſword loſt ſight like maner knight palmerin looking eſpied man readie draw bridge paſſage ouer water made gallop thither apace ſo entred gate power locke heſawe himſelfe ſo faire caſtle aduanced himſelfe ſée brauerie chamber two giant came laid mace ſo enforced fall ground recouering himſelfe thinking faſten halfe good blowes gone nothing remaining great ſmoake cauſed make leſſe eſtimation thing chaunced whatſoeuer reſiſted hee would little force ſo comming court caſtell perceiued little gate high wall whereto muſt aſcend paire ſtaires ſo narrow dangerous man would haue hardly truſted himſelfe palmerin deſirous ſée ende labour aduentured goe vp vpon middle ſteppe walles beganne ſhake vehemently ſo palmerin doubted whole caſtell would fall vpon till came top ſtaires enchantment laſted ſooner come general terror ſhew enchantment fully ended palmerin entring little doore came darke entrie great gate made faſt great locke boltes iron hard gate lay mightie serpent whoſe horrible bigneſſe oughly forme made prince greatly amazed whoſe necke vpon chaine hanged keyes ſhould open gate prince knewe paſſe gate except might winns keyes ſo terrible porter hee charged many noble ſtrokes serpent breathed ſuch horrible veneme ſmoke hauing prince swoord one noſtrilles terrible • ore hee ſlewe one windowes people ſéeing flye ouer cittie made iudge palmerin ſome painefull trauaile whoſe good ſucceſſe prayed often ſaw serpent gone found keyes ground wherewith vnlocked opened gate entring ſo faire hall perilous iſle eutropa caſt ſelfe lake ſumptuous caſtle sage aliart obſcure valley might compare rare excellent monument ſo engeniouſly deuiſed king thrace walked found thing new bee perfect eſtate enchantment fully finiſhed laſt came chamber perceiued certaine damoſels talking ſtood armed man likewiſe tooke pleaſure conferre damoſels prince loth trouble entred verie faire garden gréene banke faire fountaine beheld diuers lady excellent beautie eſpecially faire young princeſſe leonarda ſooner eſpied ſhe came courteouſly manner credite sir knight finde ſelfe ſo largely beholding cannot recompence ſo nobly haue deſerued time ſhall endeuour ſelfe requite honourable bounty receiued hand meane ſhall requeſt accept good ſatiſfaction noble déedes imprinted ſo déepe heart ſhall faile accompliſh proweſſe hath bound gratious lady anſwered palmerin beauty nature hath aboundantly adorned withall ſufficient content greateſt trauailes attempted hardyeſt knight world ſo fortune allowed lybertie receiue ſo great benefite ſuch gratious lady ſéeing aduenture ſo wonderfull theſe preſent put paſt darke obliuion ſhall intreate tell haue greater danger paſſe pleaſeth preſent truſt ſhall diſpaire accompliſh knowing right well hope ſo rich treaſure beautie ought reſerued knight indewed greater preweſſe ſelfe theſe word procured ſwéete bluſhing princeſſe face whereof reſoued ſhe replyed thus know sir knight danger ſuſtaine preſent becauſe danger hazard caſtle tooke end ſuch tune came garden breake talke came lord gouernours citty ſéeing serpent fly ouer citty knew well end enchantment came great maieſty riding caſtle comming garden humbled themſelues knées princeſſe leonarda offering likewiſe kiſſe hand noble palmerin would ſuffer receiued courteouſly friend companion quéene carmelia ſent coach caſtle wherein princeſſe leonarda brought pallace vnckle receiued became high eſtate dignity prince palmerin likewiſe vſed great honour princely obeyſance came camber found siluian little glad ſée lord ſo ſauely returned chap ci palmerin remaineded court thrace requeſt quéen carmelia palmerin granted ſtay court thrace eight dayes time lord fulfill commandement deceaſſed king went camber queene carmelia whoſe preſence charged duke rialdo giue engliſh prince vnderſtand king sardamant commanded fulfilled came prince chamber found talking siluian concerning ſpeedy departure thence knewe appointed next day following making themſelues ignorant therof laſt duke rialdo entred theſe ſpéeches lord thinke haue forgotten commandement deceaſſed king sardamant left performed marriage princeſſe leonarda néece willing accompliſh ſtraight heauie charge alſo ſuffer ſuch noble prince hath merited ſo graciouſly ingratefully recompenced likewiſe part cannot eſteeme ourſelues happy felicity ſuch king rule v whoſe déeds rightly deſerue monarch whole world theſe cauſes conſidered nominated humbly deſire accept owne right dutie ſée faithfully accompliſhed gratious king seueraigne ſo happy tranquill eſtate remaine feared ſtranger beloued friend neighbour except increaſe wealth doe alter noble mind alwaies hitherto continued vpright ſome happeneth falling ſo great miſhap eſtimation would leſſe accounted honourable pain haue beſtowed reſtore v princeſſe leonarda queene ſhould blotted ſuch obliuous report though béene neuer ſéene done aſſure sir anſwered palmerin refuſe make accept reward ſo happie fortunate onely becauſe verily iudge princeſſe leonarda ought kept ſuch one may better eſtate wealth worthineſſe damoſel thrace brought thither ſtanding hearing anſwere made came vnto manner sir palmerin know right well loue hindreth enioy déeds hath deſerued cauſeth muſe ſuch one peraduēture thinketh ſo well onely cauſe refuſe recompence honorable famous labour word damoſell ſéemed reaſon able duke company ſéeing could obtaine anſwere palmerin returned againe quéene carmelia concluding ſhould giue noble lord enioy princeſſé leonarda according king sardamant ſo ordained whereto palmerin gladly agréed ſaying account honour worthy gentleman greateſt euer fortune could ſent ſuffering princeſſe ioyne marriage according minde therefore thus aſſure yourſelues ſhall beſtew ſuch prince vpon ſhe ſhall contented receiue lord thrace gaue harty thankes reporting anſwere queene carmelia made ſuch acceptation thereof worthily deſerued leonarda ſomewhat offended would haue fallen anger damoſell thrace vſed theſe word vnto faire princeſſe thinkes ſhould thinke ſo ill conſtant faith loyaltie prince palmerin wil kéepe vowe hath made perhaps nothing inferior beauty wealth aſſure palmerin hath brother prince ſo ſaire vertuous déedes ioyne marriage know gladly held ſelfe content damoſell vſed perſwaſions ſo well princeſſe leonarda well pleaſed palmerin tooke leaue night becauſe would gone ſomewhat early morning quéene carmelia ſeeing ſhe tooke aſide thus charged pray sir remember couzin leonarda ſend ſuch lord birth worthineſſe hath continually deſerued thinke good might cauſe brought court emperour palmerin ſhould eſtéeme greateſt honour life time might happen vnto perſwade would ſo wel entertaine faire polinarda néece ſhe would likewiſe greatly delight ſelfe furthermore becauſe chiefe knight world court conſtantinople would gladly kingdome ſhould ruled ſuch prince hath bin trained vp famous emperour madame ſaide palmerin aſſure emperour eſtéeme honour highly entertaine according ſhe doeth deſerue therefore wiſh ſend ſo ſoone may becauſe ſooner ſhe commeth better ſhall ſhe welcome pray quoth quéene eſtéeme damoſell brought cup thither truely anſwered palmerin know one ſo conuenient reaſon good ſpirit wit ſhe hath doeth greatly grace reporting meſſage preſently quéene called damoſell giuing vnderſtand determined wherevpon letter credit made done palmerin tooke concluded take leaue quéene carmelia young lady deſiring humbly would ſéeme hinder voyage conſtantinople within whoſe walles incloſed ineſtimable treaſure knightly loyall minde indéede faire princeſſe polinarda ſoueraigntie whoſe beautie ſuch power made refuſe crowne thrace preſented vnto according sage aliart made rehearſall theſe famous aduentures principall noble gentleman throughout realme thrace hartily deſired might poſſible noble palmerin england whoſe honeſtie valour knightly courteſie agréeable together ſhould fulfill commandement king sardament would haue béene loth contrary thereto conſented palmerin made knowne minde ſecret intent well vnto alſo princeſſe intended hée would ſée eſpecially performed wheron honor ſhould ſtand warrant end gratefully accepting humbled themſelues take farewell framing like toward quéene princeſſe departed princely conge rode thouſand thought toward conſtantinople bearing aforenamed deuiſe tiger ſhield proſperous iourney leaue returne prince florendos ſon noble primaleon hauing ſlaine aſtribor giuen liberty lady priſoner caſtell departed iourney albayzar whoſe company paſſed realme france without deſire approach court becauſe doubted king quéene melicia knewe would ſtay longer willingly would therefore continuing way entred kingdome nauarre wherein theſe two worthy knight trauailed two dayes length entred faire goodly valley middeſt whereof ran pleaſant riuer diuerſe ſorts trées planted pleaſant beholder ſight hereof greatly reuiued penſiue minde prince florendos could bridle thought remembrance caſtell giant almaroll wherein iewell happineſſe remained whoſe walles ſpent ſome part youthful time • knightly tryall long trauailed pleaſant valley within greater delight eſpied ryuer ſide ſtrong well fortified caſtell whereto aduance themſelues beheld damoſell accompanied two eſquiers foote preparing herſelfe towards méete florendos perceiuing knowing himſelfe armed worſt ſhould happen gaue forth himſelfe nobly méet damoſell ſpake ſort sir knight faire arnalte princeſſe nauarre ladie miſtreſſe commaundeth reſpect daunger may happen vnto aduenture faile accompliſh one theſe thrée condition wherewith ſhall preſent firſt muſt returne vnto place whence came ſhal ſweare ſhe onely princeſſe beautie whole world secondly muſt enter combat way ryde dare maintaine contrarie accept theſe two condition ſhall make promiſe neuer beare armes cauſe wherein knighthood may witneſſed merite renowne ſuch enterpriſe neither behalfe diſtreſſed lady triall knightly loyaltie thus gentleman cannot put mind ſatiſfie lady muſt hazard ſelues endure manifold peril contained within valley wherein either cunning faile ſufficiencie noble demaund foile muſt content ſelues abide perpetuall impriſonment wherin nothing ſo bitter vnto life nothing better vnto preſent death héere prouided thoſe dare endue themſelues hardineſſe refuſe obey condition haue tolde wherfore gentleman follow aduiſe would counſel take oath maintenance beauty way impeach diſhonour diminiſh iote knightly valour conſidering ſhall iuſtifie nothing truth wherin neuer faile rid ſelues great deale trouble ſurely knight infamous blot aſſure ſuch fall daunger owne folly may well ſit repent extreme miſhaps 〈◊〉 • et power remedy great miſfortunes faire damoſell aunſwered florendos take verie great diſdaine miſtreſſe commaundeth reſpect vaine glorious requeſt knighthood ſtandeth vppon better regarde aſſure take leſſe pleaſure counſell dread perill confounding lady claime alwaies conſidered condition ſuch ſhe may neither demande defend yet aduantage would requeſt would doe ſo much fauour declare ende ſtately enterpriſe lady tendeth ſéemeth immodeſt wil ſo much ſhould ſhew ſelfe vnmannerly thruſt ſelfe ſuch vnreuerent ſeruice promiſe ſir knight aunſwered damoſell enterpriſe ſo full doubt vnto hardieſt knightes conuenient firſt ſhould receiue oathes wée diſcouer princeſſe arnalte whereof ſhould acquainted hand would aduance themſelues promiſe thing chance lady compell yéelde méere conſtraint ſhall beare bad eſtates depart hand becauſe ſhe ſo gentle • queſt ſo daintie making promiſe damoſell quoth florendos well perceiue ſcope meaning threatning word enſuing danger would bring like yong nouice lady would haue ſo gladly performe ſurely ſo childiſh ſatiſfie minde promiſing one cōditions haue rehearſed rather deſire acquainted ye moſt difficult danger wherewith ſéem ſo much menace whereto willingly giue conſent rather ſo baſe minded accompliſh commandement ſo may depart tell damoſel aunſwere returned caſtell ladie whence ſhort ſpace came forth ſix knight gallantly mounted armed bearing launce downward approched ye prince florendos deliuered forth theſe ſpéeches sir knight thought good lady miſtres y• ſhould vnderſtād preſent danger ancient cuſtome vſed place doth bring knight dare ſéeme denie lady hath béen ſo courteous demand thou ſo impudent thou wilt néedes deny thou ſhalt well know may compel thée word ſwéet anſwered florendos lady may much command much compell ſelfe neither command compell bid hartily welcome dare doe theſe wordes gaue ſpurres horſes ſixe fetched carire againſt good hardy knight florendos likewiſe prepared himſelfe receiue couragiouſly ſooth ſuch knightly proweſſe firſt depriued one life ſhort ſpace left deſtitute lance began take hart freſh ſetled himſelfe manfully toward fiue endure ſharpe charge wherewith aſſaulted fight hereof mooued albayzar immeaſurable griefe wiſhed ſo happie maintaine cauſe good knight would reuenge iniury vncourteouſly offered perceiued ſo great wiſhed rather preſently voyd life want armour ſuch extremity florendos enuironed euery ſide enemy knew well way ſhun perril moſt vnhappieſt thing one horſes one knight gaue ſuch cruell ſtroke hee conſtrained fall earth long recouered feete againe preſently tooke himſelfe trée reſcew himſelfe little mallice knight perceiued deliuered vnto theſe ſpéeches syr knight tree neither ſhall defend power therefore ſlender helpe truſt vnto wherefore wée iudge far better render ſelfe priſon lady miſtreſſe ſuffer ſo great danger ſee great effuſe blood much rather anſwered florendos endure death making ample proofe noble minde render ſelfe hand ſuch cruell diſcourteous perſons wherfore gentleman ordare conceiue ſo good opinion hardines ſelues knightly fauour let deale one another honeſty requeſt honor grant otherwiſe ſo faint hearted ſelues dare fight altogether diſmount horſes ſhew much vertue honour good knight eſteemed aboue brutiſh manner cowardly mind whereunto one knight preſently thus replied ſée reaſon ſir ſhould ſo much preſume ſelfe one v thinketh himſelfe able enough compell ſubmit ſelfe ſo little account make vanquiſhing deale altogether rather pleaſe humor princeſſe arnalte thē diſhability ſelues quite man man neuertheleſſe ſéeing haue ſuch deſire ſhould come foote content giue ouer horſes wherupon preſently alighted came together aſſail florendos receiued gladly behaued himſelfe toward ſo brauely ſhort time reputed left horſes florendos long fought thē diſcharged one life quickly continued deuoir ſo gallantly ſword toward foure one another ſent thrée kéepe company length florendos brought laſt ſubiection part head ſhoulders princeſſe arnalte ſuddenly came accompan • ed domoſels deſirous ſaue life knight wherupon ſhe ſpake florendos manner sir knight end great victory haue atchéeued may call name diſhonor murdring hath power defend himſelfe beſéech would giue life knight diſcourteſie haue ſuffred fellow amends may made maner put ſelfe way duty acompliſh thing ſhall like ordaine prouided alwaies honour authority way impeached therby madam anſwered florendos ſhould life granted whē finger giuen ſuch perſons ſo much forget owne honour imploy themſelues ſuch vnnatural attempt neuertheleſſe vertuous honeſt ieſture hath gained ſo much power ouer refuſe graunt thing conditionally ſo much honour tel reaſon cauſe maintained ſo bad cuſtome sir knight anſwered princeſſe arnalte fearing long ſtaying place wound may turne greater daunger expect pray ſo much fauour go caſtle hauing prouided redreſſe wound alſo thoſe knight hath receiued faile anſwer pleaſe florendos hauing need ſuccor himſelf reaſon dangerous fight would refuſe agree princeſſe arnalte cauſed one damoſelles ſée curing wound ſooth greater danger might eaſily trauell day following princeſſe cauſed thoſe bee buried ſlain ſhe tooke florendos hand walked chéerfully pleaſantly diſpoſed courteſie held great reputation hauing made proweſſe ſo nobly knowne againſt knight ſhe walked ſhe began contemplate beautie prince florendos great admiration whereupon preſently came remembrance prince florian forreſt cauſed crimſon colour mount chéekes ſo face deliuered amiable bluſh florendos well noted beginning whereupon hée donducted princeſſe ſide window proſpect whereof ouer faire running riuer ſhe receiued hardineſſe ſprake manner know wel ſir knight cuſtome caſtle ſéemeth vnto ordained againſt reaſonable regard hauing vnderſtood occaſion maintaine order wayes offended thereat ſo sir lord father leauing cuſtody ſundry noble gentleman realme nanarre deſired houre death would ſée ſhould married mine owne pleaſure contentment attending time withdrew ſelfe auoyd popular frequentation caſtles hauing fortune ſoiourned chanced arriue comely knight moſt braue gallant honeſt gentleman ſo worthily accompanied vertue proweſſe good liking coupled equall loue deſired aboue match holding opinion alſo ſhould iuſtly ſatiſfie lord father commandement ioyning hereunto ſhould greatly grace ſelfe ſuch ſooth braue knight come caſtle grant almorall ſo altered nature neuer made account freendſhip refuſing altogether mine honeſt offer caſting remembrance great good contemptuous vnkind forgetfulneſſe whereupon cauſed taken layd priſon kind tender regard becauſe ſaw vnarmed could promiſe ſecurity himſelfe ſhould haue ſhowne extreameſt rigour fortune ſo happy friend ſhe ſent knight vnto place called florian forreſt much reſemble whoſe behauiour gained ſuch power ouer onely made ſet liberty firſt knight gréeued far made ſo forgetfull ſelfe ſuffered gather fruit garden honour commanded mée kéepe better regard furthermore beſide ſo farre delighted flattery purpoſe permitted depart made mee faithfull promiſe return ſo ſpeedily poſſible hée would fayl come marry mée attended long time ſaw returne according promiſe conconcluded ſelfe come pleaſant valley make thoſe ſweare profeſſed arm ſhould break ſpeare put armor back againſt knight onely one hath offered great deſpight held opinion valiant knight happening place could get maintain beauty miragarda reſpect might equalled mine wold cauſe florian curious ſearching ſuch hauty aduentures take hardines come proue againſt knight contrary aide might chance recouer long deſired florian forreſt eaſily knight might conquer knight ſhould make alſo ſweare maintaine condition damoſell declared vnto firſt comming many knight fearing perill wherein might fall comming way daring take ſo hardy oth vpon haue bene glad returne ſtay knight haue come forth preſented themſelues defend beauty madame anſwered florendos know verie well knight ſpeak aſſure ſelf hardly ſhall bring place without liſt himſelfe ſo noble valiant knight armes hardly ioyne equall therefore pray greeue ſelfe although forgetfull ſatiſfying promiſe aſſure cuſtome affect greatly ſeruice lady eſpecially amourous opinion queint conceit loue knight cannot yeeld honeſt attempt great commendation eſtéeme likewiſe much aduanced themſelues maintaine beautie ſooth ſufficient binde ſeruiceable duty thoſe haue deſired render ſembleable good liking neuertheleſſe would perſwade hereafter would mainetaine cuſtome likewiſe would deſire would deſtow ſuch knight hole impriſonment ſhalbe able honor knightly ſeruice liberty ſhal aduantage ſelfe kéeping ſuch ſeruitude sir anſwered arnalte great honeſty wherwith accompanied hath gained ſuch power ouer cannot ſée ſhold reefoſe muſt néeds grant deſire find ſelf brought ſundry maruailous extreame paſſions word make altogether hope ſhal recouer againe knight whoſe ſake impriſoned knight deliuered ſhal certaine word deliuer hand key priſon would giue knight hand whole world prince florendos ſooner receiued keyes deliuered y• prince albayzar deſirous ſée priſoners wherefore ſtaied long tooke way downe caſtle lighted torch hand dungeon déepe opening little tower found many priſoners whereof knew diuers incontinent failed ſalute knew among knight cō ſtantinople fought combat mainteuance beauty faire princeſſe targiana mean wherof ſéeing themſelues deliuered knew wel thinke come vp caſtle perceiued enioyed libertie mean prince florendos failed come humble thē ſelues féete young prince knew incontinent wit blandidon floraman reccamon tenebrant preſence whō ſo greatly reioyce held eſpeciall good fortune came ſo luckily vnto caſtle prince arnalte ſeeing day gaue place vnto night time haue ſome refection cō manded attendant couer ſupper florendos knight come forth priſon princeſſe vſed ſtately entertainment reſpect honeſt behauiour prince florendos deeply imprinted heart conſidered alſo great courteſie bound vſe ſuch liberality chap ii happened prince florendos departed caſtle princeſſe arnalte florendos ſtayed night caſtle princeſſe arnalte importunate ſute vpon owne voluntary pleaſure well knew little coales enuy kindled ſtomacke ſhe couered ſhamefaſtneſſe modeſtie farre diſagréeable curteous nature reaſon whereof ſooner diſcouered cleare bright day aroſe put armor much defaced reaſon ſore fight ready trauel follow enterpriſe ſtaied came take farewell princeſſe arnalte alſo blandidon tenebrant reccamon caſe would leaue company floraman prince sardignia becauſe two liued maruellous affectionate one ye oth • r ſince time armello eſquier florendos came found ſolitary kinde life ſo nigh vnto caſtle giant almaroll princeſſe arnalte remained ſo greatly paſſionate ſudden departure prince florendos ſhe could admit thing minde ſtill ſhe receiued thereat much diſpleaſure without vſing remembrance prince florian • eſart ſhée altogether thruſt forgetfulneſſe ſo ſore troubled want preſence prince florendos ſhe tooke farewell reſtored priſoners griefe ſhe could vſe ſuch gratious behauior ſhe done day florendos rid certaine dayes company albayzar floraman concluded trauell caſtle almaroll ſée entertainment faire miragarda would make prince albayzar whether ſhe could • nde contrary former cuſtome noble imployed ſeruice agréeable curious nature theſe thrée knight following enterpriſe perceiued entred ſomewhat within realme spaine foote mountaine knight ſtanding ſadly betwéen two great oakes armed blacke armour bare shield white bull fielde sable mounted gallant courſer ſo theſe thrée knight conceiued good opinion would haue approached ſuddenly eſquier ſtept hauing ſaluted courteouſly deliuered minde order gentleman knight ſtandeth theſe dakes giueth vnderſtand hath enterpriſed guarde paſſage hath kept lōg time againſt many knight hath deſire offer knight diſcourteſie onely ſatiſfie lady remaineth affectionate loyal obedient therfore may ſtand liking grant ſuch thing demand paſſage ſhall libertie enterpriſe doe contrary put triall make confeſſe perforce cannot reaſonably deny refuſe grant declare vnto v quoth prince florendos firſt wil thy maſter ſoone make thée anſwere becauſe hardly determine matter whereof ignorant reaſon thou concealeſt ſo cloſely hee cauſe confeſſe anſwered eſquier arnalce princeſſe nauarre fayreſt creature vnder heauen moſt worthy knightly ſeruice ſéemes ſayd albayzar ſhall find ſame knight ſhunne combate caſtle hath accorded promiſed fulfill impecious condition therefore iudge mine opinion good cauſe know aſſuredly enterpriſe dangerous ought longer maintained let happen pleaſeth fortune ſayd florendos afterward turning eſquire anſwered order friend may goe aſſure maiſter iouſte eſquire buſie ſpéech prince florendos floraman ſooner perceiued returne maiſter deſired florendos would graunt combate againſt knight kept paſſage requeſt would denie wherevpon floraman gaue ſpurres horſe ran couragiouſly againſt knight princeſſe arnalte encountring together ſuch great force diſmounted earth héeles vpward recouered themſelues promptly like good knight ſet hand ſwords wherewith began ſtrike one another daungerouſly vſing ſuch knightly dexteritie florendos albayzar greatly delighted behold floraman reputed good knight abaſhed greatly aduantage ſhould happen knight princeſſe arnalte loue hée fought brauely moſt diſpleaſant floraman dutie like good vertuous knight leaſt princeſſe florendos albayzar ſhoulde take euill opinion ſide knight paſſage thought bonde wherein loue princeſſe arnalte tyed harten encourage theſe two knight continued combate ſo long ouercome extreame trauaile conſtrained retire take breath ſtraunge knight reioycing thereat began vſe language towardes floraman know sir knight might better breake ſaue life depriued ſhall come confeſſe princeſſe arnalte fayreſt lady aliue ſhall iote ſpared fauour alwayes conſidered ſhall confeſſe truth conſent thy anſwered floraman ſhould maintaine thing farre beyond dutie much arnalte faire worthy bée ſerued ſo much rather thou makeſt thinke world enioyeth ſome ſuch ſhe thing compared diuine beautie hath made ſo ſingular faire princeſſe nauarre may wiſe equalled ſide haue time paſt loued lady ſelfe reſpect whole world filled report prayſe rather die accord preſumption thou wouldeſt haue confeſſe floraman ſooner concluded ſpéech returned freſh y• combat charging one another ſuriouſly done ſo could iudged whether one aduantage likelyeſt win victory maintained ſight ſo brauely end knight kept paſſage beganne little little feele feebleneſſe ſomewhat aſſailed ſtroke ſtroke word turned hand armour broken many place likewiſe armour floraman better caſe enemy followed ſtrokes wiſely dealt ſo gallantly ſecond charge againe conſtrained retire floraman accompanied ſuch gratious gift imbraceth heart vertuous prince would proue might poſſible chaunge knight fonde opinion whereupon ſpake knight maner sir knight ſée well enterpriſe truth according haue iudged conceit wherefore pray confeſſe many lady world whoſe beautie princeſſe arnalte may way paragon know well sir ſayd knight paſſage weakeneſſe ſée brought giueth hardineſſe vſe ſuch perſwaſions reproofe ſo ſo greatly affectionate towards princeſſe arnalte haue deliberated ſelfe ſuſtaine y• death graunt ſay deliuered end purpoſe charged floraman afreſh ſhort time laide along ground whereat florendos albayzar ſomewhat afraid ſée brought ſuch daunger wherefore quickly opened helmet beheld knewe syr albanis friſe prince denmarcke ſight made floraman penſiue bare maruellous good florendos albayzar conducted theſe two combattants houſe knight whoſe abode neare mountaine walked together demanded albanis friſe vpon occaſion enterpriſed gard paſſage worthy gentleman anſwered albanis defer tell ſum deſire aduertiſing fortune guided one day valley princeſſe arnalte maketh preſent abode ſo rauiſhed beholding beautie remained vowed ſeruant good wherevpon ſhe put three condition ſhould approoue againſt wandering knight maintaine proweſſe ſhe faireſt princeſſe world aſſuring came place rather deſire doe ſeruice princeſſe nauarre feare ſix knight deſteny ſo farre vnfortunate fallen hand sir floraman hath made looſe hope till houre entertained make profeſſion armes ſaide florendos ought abaſhed miſfortune befalles aſſure arnalte princeſſe merriteth much yet ſo much many others haue deſerued farre aduantaged aboue therefore wiſh sir albanis thanke god cauſed fall hand friendes perſwading yourſelfe would loath ſée way iniured continuing talke arriued houſe knight receiued gladly accuſtomed lodge wandering knightes ſuch diligent attendance vſed ſhort time woundes albanis méetly healed certaine day accompanied prince florendos attached vnmeaſuraable griefe deſire finde caſtle almarol yet diſſembled griefe much could poſſible forced himſelfe mirth gratifie friendes wiſe man part forget ſad melancholike affection content thoſe perſons ioyned friendſhip chap iii damoſell princeſſe thrace arriued court emperour palmerin happened knight tiger hiſtorie maketh mention emperour empreſſe chamber accōpanied worthieſt lord empire damoſell thrace chanced enter court ſéemed much changed becauſe ſhe ſaw knight accuſtomed bée emperor whoſe féete ſhe failed humble ſelfe incontinent hée cauſed taken vp preſently entertained gracious behauiour hée deſired vnderſtand thing happened nephew palmerin england aduenture vndertooke leonarda princeſſe thrace naming cauſed princeſſe polinarda giue moſt ſwéet delicate bluſh face whoſe preſence damoſell thrace began vſe language manner ſhould rehearſe maieſtie moſt knightly proweſſe noble nephew ſhould find ſelfe ouerthrowne great perplexity know worthy déedes reſerued bee deliuered one prompt diſcréete memorie ſelfe neuertheleſſe diſcharge great bond friendſhip wherein princely courteſie hath ſo ſtraitly bound mee report haue ſéene time companie hee tooke occaſion leaue went place princeſſe leonarda enchaunted hee witneſſed ſuch knightly valour render name perpetuall honour hauing finiſhed aduenture ſo ſtraunge admirable whole diſcourſe whereof damoſell deliuered circumſtance emperour giuing vnderſtand hard cauſes diſtreſſe eftſoones offered knight tiger ſhe came report manner paſſing lake wherewith iſle compaſſed daunger boate faſhion drawn cord ladyes preſent remained ſo mightily ouercome griefe ſwéet delicate colour wherewith diuine face moſt plentifully endued began ſadly alter thinking great perills noble palmerin england paſſed putting life ſuch extreame point hazard deliuerie princeſſe leonarda haue heard reported ſaid emperour many ſtrange aduentures haue knowne ſome worthily atchieued time neuer heard life ſo perillous know well imagination king sardamant farre different king well perceyue proweſſe palmerin excelleth farre valour knight aſſure yet neuer ſaw knight might equalled without great impeachment could finde meane diſcharge ſo great daungers damſell ſufficiently ſet ſale praiſe thriſe noble palmerin eares ſo many gratious perſonages ſhe changed talke manner hath thus woorthily deſerued beſtowe vttermoſt endeuor bring within compaſſe affection princeſſe leonarda whoſe good minde altogether placed entertainement princely fauour knight ſuch hautie diſpoſition ſéemeth either altogether blinded owne conceite elſe heart affectionately placed ſome perſon aſſure made account crowne thrace bnt flatly refuſe alſo eſpouſe princeſſe leonarda brought preſence principall noble gentleman court according ordained teſtament king sardamant grandfather reaſon whereof lord requeſted quéene carmelia ſhee would ſend highneſſe princeſſe remaine company princeſſe polinarda neece daughter prince primaleon alſo noble lady wherwith renowned court plentifully enriched whoſe gratious conuerſation may onely entertaine heart leonarda precious dignitie vnſpotted vertue alſo imitating honourable example ſhe may highly eſtéemed acceptable fauour ſuch noble perſonages preferre renowne lady felicitie owne life prince palmerin well liked intent queene caemelia meanes whereof ſhe doth humbly deſire might ſo ſtand highneſſe pleaſure make deniall requeſt ſeeing haue hitherto ••• ed entertainement fulfilling whereof ſhe ſhall eſtéeme herſelfe whole kingdome perpetually bound excellency becauſe highnes may eſteem greater truth haue made report ſhe commanded preſent maieſty letter credite wherein full well ſhall perceiue reſidue pleaſure may like highneſſe pardon blunt diſcourſe vneloquent maiden emperour gratiouſly receiued letter peruſed thus framed anſwer damoſell vertuous ſage lady onely pittie great paiue haue ſuffered trauelling thus farre alſo giue thanks ſuch good endeuour forgetting honour bountifull courteſie good newes haue brought nephew palmerin regard princely deſerts vttermoſt requitall duty deſire god power may ſtretch ſo farre requite according haue worthily merited lady regard cauſed nephew hold ſo ſmall eſtimation princeſſe leonarda know care beyond iudgement deuiſing meanes ſhe might gaine power requite cauſe ſo great honour deſire would yéeld conſent princeſſe leonarda might come remaine court aſſure ſelfe well contented thinke ſelfe highly honoured ſuch requeſt better declare gratefull accept comming hither thankfull would great trauaile giue countie salin reaſon death county arlae remaineth vacant hauing left heir repoſſeſſe ſame damoſell preſently threw ſelfe emperor féet offering kiſſe hand ſigne thankfull mind ſuſtained armes graciouſly accuſtomed ſtranger yet ſuch eſtimation damoſell behaued ſelfe ſame manner duty empreſſe alſo toward prince primaleon gridonia witneſſe beneuolent mindes honour wherewith would entertaine ſuch fréendly gueſt great intreaty courteſie made ſtay humble offer whereupon ſhe returned emperour deliuered mind theſe word hardly withhold ſelfe inſtant gratious lord ſo deſirous vnderſtand couragious mind prince palmerin dealing eſcaping tiger ſo hideous fearefull alſo ſo happy end ſuch aduenture gracious fauour ſo agréeable deſirous thought ſo plentifull meaſure beyond poore demerit ſhall leaue report thereof highneſſe memory till ſuch time returne princeſſe leonarda aſſure maieſty heart vnſpeakeably ſatiſfied pleaſure ſhall ſpéede ſo well reſolued excellencie thing haue ſo long time wiſhed wherefore moſt humbly deſire may depart deſire haue enforme princeſſe leonarda gratious fauour cauſeth iudge euery day yeare till haue cauſe fulfilled dutie faire damoſell anſwered emperour ſhould like well made abode ſtill court perceiue great deſire returne anſwer thankfull meſſage wiſh ſelfe whole courſe iourney damoſell humbly tooke leaue emperour company came chamber princeſſe polinarda ſecretly withdrawne ſelfe reueale dramaciana waiting gentlewoman good opinion hart ſuddenly conceiued thoſe ioyfull tidings ſo damoſell kept company preſently ſhe beganne coniecture beautie princeſſe cauſed prince palmerin refuſe gouernement thrace princeſſe polinarda modeſtly began queſtion damoſell euery particular chance happened knight tiger whoſe ſake ſhe honoured damoſel princely courteſie ſhe deſired ſhee would bee meſſenger vnfayned good princeſſe leonarda whome ſhee would willingly ſhould ſtay come vnto court preſently damoſell made promiſe performe euery thing vttermoſt ſo departing princeſſe ſhe went palace ledging ſhe locked vp honourable preſents empreſſe gridonia ſince comming ſent vnto ſo hauing thing readineſſe ſhee departed farre rich ioyfull ſhe damoſell wee intend leaue iourney becauſe returne noble renowmed knight tiger hée departed kingdome thrace tooke ſtraighteſt way hee could poſſibly chuſe bring vnto conſtantinople wherto drew ſomewhat neare chance one day hee arriued great forreſt farre houſes reſort people likewiſe trées much defaced ſpoyled ſo ſéemed waſt deſolate wilderneſſe ryding along ſad penſiue minde heard trampling great many horſes caſting eye way heard noyſe eſpied ten twelue knight well armed croſſing ouerthwart forreſt wherevpon gaue horſe ſpurres deſirous doe ſeruice ſo néede vſe aide followed way rode ſhort time ouertooke one company could ſo ſpéedily iourney reaſon horſe receiued attaint one legges knight palmerin deſired friendly conferre made vſe ſpéeches maner deſire sir may demand ſo bold requeſt report vnto cauſe theſe knight iourney ſo ſpéedily whither goe vnfrequented forreſt know well sir anſweeed ſtrange knight enterpriſe doeth concerne thing therefore néedeleſſe tell haue ſmall occaſion demand purpoſe ſée acquaintance cauſe neither impeach mallice pleaſure aide content reſolue requeſt ſhall vnderſtand sir thrée league diſtance place lady courteous creature remaining ſtrong well fortefied caſtle hath daughter moſt exquiſite perfection beautie knight countrey named feliſtor deſirous marrie lady mother ſuffer ſo beſtowed hauing already giuen eſpouſed another rich gentleman countrey named radimar wherefore lady daughter haue conſented gentleman goe vnto caſtle owne ſecretely knit vp determinate purpoſe deceiue long labourſome expectation feliſtor aduertiſed cloſe intent hath determined hazard fortune extreameſt danger either hinder helpe himſelfe leaue conqueſt doubtfull eſtate may better preuaile fortune darken sunſhine good hap hath placed ſecret ambuſhment little wood lady daughter muſt neceſſitie paſſe hauing giuen ſtrait charge ambuſh life radimar put ſwoord ſoone may lay hand countenance blemiſh earneſt intent marry damoſell deſpight dare ſay contrary becauſe marriage may better accompliſhed aſſiſt company onely good wil vnfainedly beare fortune contrary fauour horſe bath taken ſuddainly attaint whereby ſhall hazard breach promiſe would diſlike friend grieuous ſo would happen preuent worſt therefore pray sir thinke ſo well lend horſe content ſelfe meane time whereon eſquire rideth iudge take mine good part courteſie cauſe place haue power anſwerable forget ſuch fauourable pleaſure truely sir anſwered palmerin ſée well ſhould doe ſo great pleaſure bent vſe gift deede greater diſhonour better ſtandeth credite defend cauſe diſtreſſed lady inſtrument whereby honour may receiue ſuch diſgrace therefore found leaue ſo deſirous companion cannot time ſtay make anſwere ſo poaſted ouertake feliſtor ſtrange knight perceiuing preſently entred theſe ſpéeches ala fond foole thou makeſt ouer much haſt entertaine thine owne miſfortune ſimpleſt thée able ſufficient teach thée thy fellowe duty wiſh ſo ſoone companion haue giuen due chaſtiſement ſhe pride wherewith thou art fondly accompanied thy horſe may fall ſhare well teach thée thou oughteſt haue done courteous requeſt alſo may diſcharge promiſe made fréend knight tiger attained ſuch length ground vndeſtood preſumptuous language ſtrange knight yet looked back whereby gaue know ye hauty diſpoſition aduenturous mind moued fearefull foreſhew ſuppoſed danger contrariwiſe cowardldy wretch eſtéemeth euery flaw tempeſt little motion miſchance vtter ouerthrow ſoueraigntie noble palmerin england purſued theſe knight ſo long ouercharged gloomy fogge night ſo could perceiue follow trackes horſes reaſon whereof conſtrained alight gaue horſe eſquire entending repoſe himſelfe ſo well could deſolate place vntill aurora faluted beautifull countenaunce vaine beſtow labour take reſt deſtined houres ſléepe earneſt deſire defend cauſe iniuryed ladie would ſuffer ſo much cloſe eye wherefore day began ſooner péepe cauſed siluian bridle horſes preſently tooke way feliſtor company paſſed could ſet eye beganne gréeuouſly mooued imitating enioy quietneſſe mind till haue deliuered innocent cruell oppreſſors among déeds knighthood beareth largeſt title honour chap iiii happened knight tiger againſt thoſe ambuſh take damoſell valiant knight tiger ſo long purſued ſearch knight almoſt ſpent one halfe day meane feliſtor knowledge giuen ſecret ſpies lady daughter ſet forth way company foure good knight feliſtor met ſo cruell conflict betwéene ſhort time foure kuights al ſlaine hauing taken lady daughter returned way whence came palmerin ſeeing could haue ſight turned againe met knight talked prince deliuered theſe word ſee well ſir knight either haue great deſire méet companion elſe ſuch ſuddaine kindneſſe come vpon returne lend horſe receiue becauſe ſo much beholding whereto knight tiger anſwered truſt ſir much miſtake ouer fondly deceiue ſelfe intend ſo much fauour ſhall indebted ſo much fréendſhip horſe better mine would good borrow whether would becauſe would follow intent haue entrepriſed giue aide thoſe whoſe neceſſity requires helpe cannot chuſe laugh ſaid ſtrange knight perceiue haue fayled way ſpent whole night purpoſe onely deſire haue méete feliſtor perceiue comming hitherward hauing lady entended eſpouſe ſir ſhall haue leyſure enough preſent time fulfill wiſh ſtomacke ſo ſerue palmerin perceiuing knight told truth cauſed siluian gird horſe well claſped faſt helmet fearing danger might happen prepared himſelfe ſalute troupe came firſt whereof feliſtor hauing damoſell arme made great proteſtation amorous good ſhe rid wéeping bitterly ſo good lady mother sixe knight company feliſtor foure cauſed ſtay lady caſtle ſo palmerin ſufficiently viewed came comfort lady manner faire lady teares ſo gréeuous behold preſent danger hath conquered ſuch ſurpaſſing pittie muſt aduenture life deliuery either purchaſe former quietneſſe leaue life content enemy yet haue often heard ſmall force ſerue chaſtiſe thoſe perſons haue regard owne honour becauſe confounded enuious ſtomacke owne diſloyall action containe ſo little manhood report knightly dignitie laide brauer conqueſt owne manifeſt diſgrace feliſtor hearing knight tiger vſe ſuch braue language became ſo offended himſelfe power make anſwere middeſt choller without remembring arme head began fiercely aſſaile knight tiger ſaluted feliſtor ſuch friendly blowe head hée cleft downe ſhoulders valiantly addreſſing himſelfe knight behaued • elfe moſt maruellous proweſſe damoſell ſéeing prince ſo great danger fearing hée would hardly eſcape hand gaue palfrey bridle ſo rode ſolitarily muſing along forreſt knight tiger perceiuing began much gréeue neuertheleſſe ſo valiantly dealt knight ſlaine thrée reſt tooke themſelues preſently flight whereupon knight whoſe horſe attainted trauell ſo pleaſantly iybed prince came humbly yéelded himſelfe deſiring would remember diſcourteous word paſſed whereupon knight tiger according courteous nature gently entertaine lady ſéeing enemy ſo happily vanquiſhed receiued heart vnſpeakeable ioy ſhe looked could ſée daughter ioy preſently amated ſorrow wherefore ſhe might better recouer againe ſhe came fell downe knight tiger giuing moſt humble thankes ſo noble ſuccour deſiring might ſo pleaſe lend aſſiſtance till ſhe found daughter whoſe abſence ſhe remained oppreſſed gréefe ſhe danger cruell enemy madame quoth knight tiger ſhould attribute honour victory miſfortune vnkinde aduerſaries ſuch alwaies receiue recompence according wickedneſſe liues deſerueth diuine iuſtice ſuffer eſcape vnpuniſhed careleſſe cōmitting ſuch heinous offence daughter iudge within forreſt therfore good trifle time vaine haſtily beſturre ſelues preſent ſearch promiſe leaue till haue ſafely deliuered owne ſecurity whereto lady replied ſée well sir knight vertue magnanimitie ſhineth brauely noble heart would poore power ſufficiencie requite princely bountie neuertheleſſe truſt god repay good deſerts farre vnable preſent yet remaine life time dutifull good ſhewe acceptable thankes noble commaundement thus lady concluding ſpéeches knight tiger siluian lady rode way iudged damoſell taken iourneyed day moſt part night yet neuer nearer purpoſe maruailed ſhe ſhould ſtray ſo far feare ſhe leaſt honour ſhould impeached cauſed take thoſe occaſions vpon iudgement might beſt preſerue hauing thus trauailed late conſtrained alight eaſe horſes siluian preſently vnbridle might refreſh themſelues paſture gaue lord ſorrowfull lady ſuch prouiſion ſuſtenance carried wherewith ſufficed themſelues ſo well could knewe ſuch deſolate place ſtrange looke courtly dainty faire auba ſooner deliuered faire morning ſight preſently mounted horſbacke rode whole forreſt yet finding ſo gladly looked made lady conceiue ſo great griefe knight tiger perſwaſion could appeaſe wherefore deſired goe caſtle vnfit take ſuch vnaccuſtomed paine wherewith much adoe laſt ſhe conſented rode caſtle arriued euening entrance thereof garded foure knight feliſtor giuen charge remaine began freſh vexe lady firſt ſée daughter ſo vnhappily loſt forbidden entrance houſe theſe two extreames mouing many paſſions cauſed repute ſelfe vnhappieſt vnder sunne knight tiger ſéeing lady ſo great affliction beganne flatter eye knightes ſhowes moſt gratious behauiour cuſtome among aduenturous mindes diſſemble intent deuiſes amiable conceit ſometime preuaileth pollicie déedes manifeſt knightly power ſo fortuned knight feliſtor came receiue ſo many made ſo venturous chiefeſt intent haue murthered knight tiger cary backe lady herein found themſelues greatly deceiued knight tiger perceiued ſooner bride bee let downe entred thereon beganne valiantly charge theſe foure knight ſetled themſelues altogether againſt one began vſe theſe word perceiue well sir knight great folly occaſion preſent ending life ſéeing wilfully come ſéeke deliuer anſwerable paiment bold enterpriſe theſe word knight tiger nothing regarded dealt ſo roughly two quickly diſpatched liues fellow fearing leaſt ſhould brought like eſtate caſt downe weapon yéelded themſelues lady ſéeing happy ſucceſſe alighted entred caſtle greatly abaſhed noble bountie knight tiger ſorrowfull beſide becauſe ſhe knewe recompence ſo great courteſie ſhe ſtood conſidering ſmall danger ſuſtained deliuer hand feliſtor company ſhe beheld daughter comming conducted fiue knight certaine tent wherto ſtraying ſhe happened come damoſell gone caſtle mother theſe knight beheld blood thoſe ſlaine knightes face attached ſuch ſudden feare would gladly haue béene thence lady perceiued cauſe diſmaying went incontinent hauing imbraced deſired would ſuffer cauſe doubt ariſe would ſhewe thankefull mindes knight tiger deliuered ſo great danger herevpon humbly went ſaluted prince kept company ſpace eight day end whereof departed thence taking iourny toward place heart deſired chap v happened knight sauage man departed court emperour vernar becauſe long time ſince hiſtory hath made mentiō noble knight florian deſart leaue tiger way coſtantinople returne prince florian departed court emperour vernar gréene guilt armour bearing ſhield sauage man leading two lion ſiluer field euen according • ore knowne ſonne prince edward purſued intent hauty deſire time carried ſtrange deuiſe atchieued honourable exploit euer euen firſt part hiſtory hath largely made mention braue knight ſeeing place moſt famous aduentures fortune conducted realme ireland euen place nobly woon caſtles • thrée siſters daughter marqueſſe beltamor theſe caſtles cuſtody others vtterly vnknowne knight sauage man reaſon whereof conſtrained lodge cell ancient hermit diſcourſed vnto two brother giant calſurnien within thoſe caſtles one named brocalon baleato long time béene nouriſhed profound iſle mother collambra giuen vnderſtand great miſfortune happened giant calfurnien camboldam murcela brother loſſe contrary mother armed themſelues like good hardy knight vewing take vengeance ſo much defaced noble ſtocke might ſooner execute bloody enterpriſe embarqued themſelues galley hauing company knight linage length landed coaſt ireland long known lord caſtles thrée siſters alſo belonged brother giant putting sword found within thoſe caſtles fortified thēſelues great ſtrength leſt ſhould chance meanes aſſayled knight sauage man could ſuffer hermit procéed tale muſt néedes demand queſtion pray good father ſo much reſolue one thing theſe giauts vſe come forth caſtles walke delight along forreſt certainly sir anſwered hermit would loth reſolue demand ſuch queſtion ſéemeth manifeſt earneſt deſire offer combate theſe giant would ſorry ſhould meaneſt abilite reſiſt thrée beſt knight realme therefore deſire affection bent way requeſt would bridle within limit regard remember diſhonour noble mind adenture life wilfully wiſely yet couer intent vnder title ſeeking renowne muſt iudge altogether voyde knightly regard ſées danger beyond compaſſe yet deſperately throw himſelfe hazard truſt pittie ſuch one well corrected wherefore good sir auoide worſt may happen deſire let ſuch minde remaine would witneſſe valour thoſe occaſions may repreſent hope victory ſéeme better equalitie knightly force otherwiſe ſhal cauſe good minde thinke deſperate hope hath rather conducted hither carefull aduiſe way returne victor theſe giant woont walke abroade morning murther one villeinouſly mangle another hauing ſworne continue crueltie vntill meete two sonnes prince edward intent famouſly reuenged brother ſlaine hand perceiue father ſaid knight sauage man make conſcience condemning thoſe aduenture liues redeeme wretch eſtate poore soules ſuppreſſed ſuch cruell tyranny remember ſelfe armour ought borne onely ſuch imploy pain ſuccor thoſe way able ſhield themſelues order knighthood giuen v end ſhould faint ſhadow conquered wordes ſee deedes wherefore father perſwade ſelfe fortune ſhal ſooner preſent occaſion put hap aduenture theſe word aged hermit began ſhed teares ſée could remooue determination neuertheleſſe laboured ſtill perſwaſion paine beſtowen ſmall purpoſe ſo full intreatie reſolutely bent ſo paſſed away night friendly communication morning florian preparing himſelfe depart time heard great noyſe without cell going doore eſpied damoſel came haſtely riding ſhe ſeeing knight sauage man came vnto ſuccour ſhe egerly purſued giant brocalon ſame white armour well mounted luſtie courſer alighted ſpeaking thus damoſell ſée well damoſell haue taken place ſmall aſſurance ſelfe knight deliuer hand ſhould doe ſhould preſently perceiue eſtate diſpleaſure whereto knight sauage man thus anſwered truſt syr deceiued farre perceiue none oweth dutie much leſſe ſtand feare doubt diſloyall tyrannie thou vſeſt ſhall well enough tempered ere thou part theſe wordes cauſed ſore combate betwéene brauery whereof much delighted aged hermit ſtill prayed good ſucceſſe happen knight sauage man ſo gallantly hee continue fight giant enforced take breathing acceptable prince shielde greatly defaced himſelfe ſurcharged much trauaile yet farre better ſtate giant ſéeing blood trickle downe armour ſo faſt began vſe theſe ſpéeches come paſſe one knight hath power preuaile ſo much againſt certainly feare hope haue alwayes vanquiſh thoſe knight ſlew brother one knight brought ſome doubt yet muſt néedes end life rather might one handes valour carrieth ſo large commendation knight vtterly vnknown thus concluding began charge knight sauage man rough forcible ſtrokes notwithſtanding ſo duly awaited oportunitie length brought enemie vnder ſubiection taking helmet preſently parted head ſhoulders ſight hereof ſmall ioy aged hermit alſo damoſell came humbled ſelfe prince manner vnpoſſible sir knight render thanks according worthy deſerts neuertheleſſe report ſuch laudable language knightly déedes court vernar emperor allameigne whither preſent direct courſe fame ſhall remaine continuall memory gladly would bee acquainted name earneſtly deſire two cauſes one might exactly diſcourſe noble valour amazement cannot deſerue ſo well might know noble gentleman whoſe gratious bountie might repay contiuuall prayer faire damoſell quoth prince deſire knowe name may doe ſeruice vttermoſt power declare vnto rather cauſe aſſure déedes ſo ſmall eſtimation credite may worthily caſt diſcountenance giue ſuch praiſe hath pleaſed vtter let ſéeme eares vnaduiſed ſpéech preſent neceſſitie muſt diſcloſe becauſe mine eye heart haue taſted fierie plannet rather let obtaine ſuch acceptable opiniō beliefe modeſt thought remaining captiue mercy may finde ready pittie beauty wound vpon theſe ſpéeches hermit tooke occaſion begin thus sir knight déepe point wiſedome flée ſubtill temptatiō beautie ſo glorious eye grieuous heart ſo ſwéete conceite ſower triall reaſon iealouzie frenzie beggerie murder many miſchiefs always waiting yokfellowes haue already eſcaped one extreame danger like fall greater one could haue béene hnrtfull body hangeth waity ſoule remember ſon thy fall grieuous thy ſelfe father ſaid prince beautie ſo familiarly welcome eye men ſée haue power eſcape delight ſo agréeable heart likewiſe flint ſhe would mooue affection euen ſo contemplate heauenly grace beautifull damoſell could otherwiſe chuſe offer ſelfe humble ſeruant refuſe doe ſhould perſwade ſelfe good nature altogether forſaken alſo might iudge colde kindneſſe could moued ſuch forcible motion ſee well quoth hermit pleaſure fleſh make thee forgetfull health thy ſoule wherefore pray thou maieſt conuerted time leaſt thou féele puniſhment thy follie late thée helpe thy ſelfe whereto prince anſwered thus pray father tell conquere theſe earthly delight ſit wreſting many matter study wil looking booke abate ſecret inflamations heart haue heard many calling profeſſion haue laboured kill learning hath quickned themſelues ſeeking draw throne anothers heele haue prickt themſelues therwith heart tuſh father religious reaſon haue ſeen olde billet burne freſher young bauen holineſſe ſhould inueigh againſt ſecret delight loue would take heretique good argue ſhew folly allow declare wiſedome well quoth hermit betake ſelfe oratorie youthfull worldly pleaſure deſert whereof doubt end reward ſo went cel making ſuch ſpeed til ſhut doore giant brocalon beene aliue againe followed wherat knight sauageman laughed heartily comming vnto damoſell began ſalute theſe tearmes could wiſh faire lady ſeruant ſo kiude miſtreſſe might ſhall like allowe ſeruice ſooth iudge would like behauiour doe content auoide pleaſure worthy sir anſwered damoſell cannot ſo much ingratefull great good defending greateſt diſtreſſe power muſt witneſſe ſome ſhew thankfull minde mean time deſire haue company theſe two thrée dayes till theſe place ſo great danger ſhall account ſelfe highly beholding lady quoth receiue ſo great pleaſure courteous anſwer thinke ſelfe happieſt man liue attaine ſuch bountie wherewith preſently tooke horſe cauſing eſquire mount damoſell way recounted prince florian tempeſt sea ſhe caſt coaſt ireland comming denmarke carrying letter e • ediſe baſilia empreſſe allemaigne perceiued quoth ſhe countrey couzins daughter marque baltamor remained intended beſtow little labour ſéeing • ortune ſo hard met giant brocalon contented murdering two eſquires bare company purſued haue fulfild villanous wil ſo good hap reſkew thinke ſelfe beholding expreſſe prince taking hand returned anſwer promiſe faire lady reioyce fortune ſuch ſeruice doubt ſhall finde ſo gentle companion guard perſon danger may happen would either ſo happie ſo courteous giue liberty priſoner ſingular beautie hath ſecretly fettered continuing theſe pleaſant purpoſes ſpéech laſt came goodly riuer pleaſant ſight whereof inuited alight horſes eaſe themſelues little ſitting louingly together prince began amor • uſly diſpoſe himſelfe toward ſober chaſle damoſell meane eſquire went damoſell svch ſo great pleaſure knight sauage man conceiued preſence damoſell night paſſed time away riuers ſide till length prince began waxe heauy ſléepe like vnto thoſe entertaine loue preſent time rather ſuffiſe appetite thing elſe made ſo ſmall account louers paſſions humour ſatiſfied preſently forgotten damoſell ſéeing prince vſe regard vnto fell extreame conceite gréefe ſhe ſo lightly beſtowne honourable chaſtitie knight ſhe feared would commit courteſie vtter obliuion ſhuld happen ſo vnkindly quoth ſhe vnworthy ſhew face among perſons credite wiſh preſent loſſe life might falue vp ſtaine blemiſh former rich heauy pittifull diſcourſe ſhe continued time knight sauage man ſlept ſoundly laſt ſhe looked eſpied two eſquires attending knight ſuch huge ſtature ſéemed exéede giant brocalon walked many time would ſtand ſtill muſe himſelfe pull rent haire one would haue iudged depriued wit laſt extreame paſſions called eſquiers commanded wait ther neare vnto would repoſe himſelfe vnder tree hereat damoſell greatly abaſhed ſo ſtanding ſome feare ſhe awaked knight sauageman theſe wordes good knight forſake drow ſines danger nearer thée thou art beware another brocalon come iniure v therefore helpe neuer defend v theſe word prince ſuddenly ſtarted vp put himſelfe good regard enemie hee aduanced himſelfe néerer vnto ſéeing eſquires walking horſes maiſter lying vnder trée great griefe minde ſtayed himſelfe ſecret heard breake foorth theſe ſpéeches ſée great folly repoſe credite god either want power elſe wilfully bent euerthrow hath moſt truſted good cauſe haue thinke ſo brother vanquiſhed one onely knight make ſo ſmall eſtimation fauour ſuffer meete might either beare brother company take reuenge griefe nature compelleth chuſe blaſpheme name deny giue honour haue done ſuffer knight ſo much diſhonour v haue altogither caſt obliuion wil honor altar teſtimonies affection truſt repoſe ſelfe ſo euer henceforth deſpiſe theſe heauy complaintes cauſed prince iudge baleato brother giant brocalon hauing intelligence brother death ſought finde done deede good hap acceptable prince found without knight aid ſo walking aſide baleato laſt eſpied made ariſe theſe ſpéeches dare imagine himſelfe ſo hardy trouble ſilent purpoſes aſſure thée thou art little beholding fortune thy vtter enemy conducting thée hither eſpecially time fury thou wilt find gréeuous thou art able endure damoſell kéeps thée company haue good occaſion receiuing part g • éefe meanes ſuch one ſhe appeare anger god offering sacrifice ſo deale sexe méete brocalon beſt knight world ſlaine following ſuch another ſhe baleato anſwered prince reſerue theſe threatnings thoſe affraide thee prepare thy ſelfe deale neither word weapon terrifie damoſell aſſure thy ſelfe onely defend alſo humble proud min • e make thee thinke none ſo good thy ſelfe ſo ſhalt thou learne vſe thy better deale courteouſly people countrey becauſe mooue mallice greater againſt thou ſhalt vnderſtand hath ſlaine dalfurnien brocalon thy brother haue good hope ſend thée wherefore put thy ſelfe readineſſe entertaine much diſdaine haue aduantage thee thou proudly thinkeſt vnable deale thée giant extreamely moued heare braue language prince began rage manner thou cruel deſtroyer blood thou maiſt aſſure thy ſelfe haue thy preſence greateſt enemy vnto thée world therefore ſhew vttermoſt thy manhood carry hope bathe theſe hand mine thy blood beſide rent thy curſed heart péeces throw foode fowles aire began fierce cruell combat wherein prince ſo nobly behaue himſelfe forcible ſtroakes giant deliuered te ſmall purpoſe length perceiuing ſubtilty prince vſed beganne ſtrike vere roughly ſo ſwoord broken thrée piece body wounded diuerſe place whereat damoſell much diſpleaſed doubting leaſt ſhe ſhould ſée ende ſo valiantly defended prince ſéeing himſelfe danger caſt shield receiue mightie ſtroke giant gaue blowe lighting shield entred ſo farre could pull againe prince perceiuing cloſed driuing ſtill backward till came riuers ſide ſtrooke leg ſo fell ouer bancke water waightineſſe fall head going forward brake necke ſmall ioy damoſell alſo prince reioyced rid ſuch enemy mounting horſebacke rid againe cell olde hermit prince woundes ſomewhat dangerous meane eſquires baleato returned knight caſtles giue vnderſtanding maſters death hee ſlaine brother brocalon likewiſe diſpatched come cell good olde hermit albeit ſomewhat offended prince yet receiued louingly ſuch poore bed cauſed lie vſing ſuch good regard vnto within fewe dayes dangerous eſtate well recouered deſire prince would ſuffer damoſell depart iourney giuing vnderſtand ſhe might trauaile without danger ſhe knowe ſelfe giant ſlaine alſo ſaid ſtood honeſt report ſhe ſhould ſo kéepe company knight armes whoſe affaire lay ſo many ſundry place decent honour ſéene ſuch effeminate order prince well content ſhe ſhould depart albeit damoſell found ſelfe greatly agreeued vſe eſtimation hauing ſealed fort maidenly honour none power obtain neuertheleſſe ſhe ſaw remedy ſhe forced make vertue neceſſity teares ſhe tooke leaue prince feigned himſelfe amourous ſpéeches ſad ſorrowfull departure chap vii knight belouged giant
