caſtles hand knowing themſelues farre vnable withhold determination came hermit cell found knight y• sauage man lying bed well diſpoſed comparing yong yéeres nobleneſſe late exploites receiued great cauſe admiration laſt iudged himſelfe hardieſt courage amongſt ſuddenly entred theſe ſpéeches ſhould deny ſir knight fortune hath entertained eſpeciall regard ſhould ſéeme much forgetfull ſelfe puiſſance brocalon baleato two giant reputed ſmall courage noble hardineſſe brought vtter confuſion therefore remaineth choſen argument ſhe onely hath called dignity fauour alſo ſhe maintaineth affection towards ineſtimable bountie let ſéeme ſo hardie offer checke reproofe valour beſt fortune vnlike equall let rather imagine themſelues happy may deſerue good countenance ſo worthy champion due conſideration hereof hath conſtrained v enter ſuch hardineſſe come preſent ſelues noble mercy good opinion guided v hath ſo worthily ouercome remaineth honour famous conquerour ſtaine laudable title offering diſcourteſie thoſe humble themſelues obedient ſeruants ſigne whereof receiue hand keyes caſtles lord ſometime enioyed withall receiue hearty good affection remaine onely noble comandement courteous word prince returned anſwer ſpéeches ſo honeſt ſo well repleate ſhith ciuill courteſie ſorry preſent caſe ſuffer let vnderſtand thankefully accept great gentleneſſe ſhall beare company court england cauſe king grandfather ſatisfie diſhablity ſuffer tooke keyes caſtles wherewith much contented ſéeing iſſue ſo fortunate beginning ſeemed ſo doubtfull knight ſtill kept prince company reſpect honourable promiſe made wherof little glad hoped gaine good fauour court england report noble conqueſt ſhort time ſo blazed mooued generall conſent gladnes ſo much recouery caſtles woon proweſſe prince florian good king fredericke ioy good happe ſent ſir pridos duke galles ſpéede might ſée could méete noble nephew taking galley preſently ſhort time arriued coaſt ireland farre hermit cell finding prince declaring ſum meſſage prince concluded depart thence notwithſtanding wound thorowly healed ſo taking leaue gentle hermit deſiring knight accompany committed themſelues sea whereon long ſayled arriued cittie london thorow honourably conducted king pallace tydings come king arriued court accompanied sonne edward hée came méete caſting armes necke prince florian teares ran downe white beard inward ioy conceiued preſence father edward would hide earneſt affection welcommed ſonne great kindneſſe mother princeſſe flerida pittying hurt glad company ſhewed ſelfe louing mother vnto would depart day night till ſhe perceiued thorowly recouered king england honourably entertaine knight came nephew would ſhow made eſtimation accepted office according degrées court great bountie witneſſed themſelues vnthankefull ſo behaued themſelues great credit king court prince florian good eſtate health newes came vnto engliſh court impriſonment king polendos companie court great turke vnhappy tidings moooed king whole court great gréefe conſidering withall ſtate ſorrow wheren emperour conſtantinople remained extreame take cauſe reſpect ſmall hope liberty againe great turke ſworne put death except emperour would ſend knight ſo boldly carryed away daughter princeſſe targiana theſe newes comming eares prince florian began fall theſe ſpéeches far better go render ſelfe ſuffer extrame rigour cruell infidell ſo many good knight ſhould liue danger ſéeing occaſion cauſe firſt ariſe better meane ſalue vp againe ſelfe cannot beléeue ſayd prince edward turke ſo forgetfull himſelfe ſéeke death ſo many ſo ſmall matter reaſon albayzar one owne kindred ſhould ſtand hazard life report goeth emperour ought carefull kéeping albayzer end ſafegard life might redéeme woonted liberty whereto prince florian thus replied perſwaded good father turke hardly remooued determination maketh greater miſdoubt ſafety thoſe knight abſence aſſure ſo gréeuouſly offendeth good emperour perfectly reſolued goe comfort conſidering part dutie behalf ſo farre time ſéeing depriued ſhould defend aged king fredericke father edward mother priuceſſe flerida could diſſwade determination contrary wils departed court taking iourney toward conſtantinople armed accuſtomed maner bearing sheeld vſuall deuiſe thus happy ſucceſſe may fall vnto time intend leaue becauſe returne prince florendos time wel néere caſtle giant almarol hauing iourney done many noble déeds deſeruing commendation rehearſed engliſh chronicle would ſéeme impertinent place rehearſe neuertheleſſe muſt need tell yée floraman prince sardignia iourney atchieued great renowne ſo continued till arriuall city rioclaro preſent called tamar florendos ſéeing himſelfe ſo neare place ſpent great time languiſhing affliction entred thouſand imagination himſelfe firſt conſidering beginning loue happy continuance thereof enforced number ſad coniectures wherein paſſed night quietly could morning rid toward caſtle almaroll albayzar beganne vſe ſome doubt entertainement iudged woman ſlenderly acquainted pittie eſpecially hée looked ſmall fauour princeſſe miragarda contrariwiſe ſo cruell towardes ſtrangers ſhée toward deareſt beſt beloued friendes florendos ſooner diſcouered trées planted riuer theſin walles caſtle almaroll heart immeaſurably touched ſuddaine feare remembring many ſtormes endured perilles hath beene iuſt ſerud lady due regard ſhe gouerned owne miſtruſt denies ſeruant deſirde reward misfortune waxeth yet ſuffer though die therefore finis thrée knight ſooner eſpied prince florendos walking caſtle almaroll preſe • tly left ſinging pulled downe beuers helmet becauſe doubted ſhould known came trée ſhields hanged began greatly commend valour whoſe nobleneſſe gained ſuch braue prize length knight greene armour ſtedfaſtly beholding portrait faire miragarda began brauely vſe language thus beautie heauenly face picture repreſents authoritie ſufficient bring obeyſance heart neuer thought loue yea worthieſt knight whole world albeit minde farre otherwiſe ſawe mine eye hath béene daily cōmended ſo much mine eare neuertheles thoſe knight hath enterpriſed defend ſo rich treaſure dare ſo hardy breake couple lance doe endeuour becōmeth good knight condition prouoke doe iniury willingly would becauſe feare lady oweth faire picture would ſeuerely puniſh offering offence knight contrariwiſe ſhee entertaine eſpeciall fauour take vpon enter combat prince florendos thus replied pitie sir put foorth ſo good minde ſéeing ſtomacke ſerueth ſo wel purpoſe becauſe ready prouided iouſt force greatly beſtow breaking launce two therefore take field pleaſure ſanctifie requeſt theſe word parted fetch courſe met together ſuch force launce ſlewe vp ayre piece ſo paſſed brauely thing ſhaken firſt encounter giant almaroll ſeeing deſtitute launce cauſed ſome brought forth caſtle deliuered eſquiers went ſerued lordes withall valiantly met againe breake launce ſecond time encounter ſo forcible prince florendos loſt one ſtirroppes ſide ſome danger haue fallen beſides horſe neuertheleſſe knight gréene armour meaſured length ground recouered himſelfe againe quickly meaſure diſpleaſed fall drew ſword theſe word syr knight made meanes ſummon iouſt albeit foyle hath happened yet offended thereat ſo ſo much honour let v trie one another ſwords ende good hap vanquiſh valour ſhall haue larger eſtimation knowe anſwered prince florendos theſe gentleman company eſteeme requeſt becauſe ſée preparing themſelues offer iouſt therefore let intreatie time perſwade deſire ſhall haue time victory ſo much haue woone thoſe eſpeciall friend would haue know offended miſchance vanquiwed prince ſo great ſinguler proweſſe may better perſwaded word ſhall vnderſtand ſo earneſt prouoking combat greateſt part day rehearſing manifold knightly aduentures lengthened large diſcourſe becauſe would gladly get ſight princeſſe miragarda ſo dainty ſhewing ſelfe ſeldome would ſhe come open window looke forth ſome priuy ſecret place greateſt felicitie ſhe might ſée fiield died blood thoſe came contend ſingularity beauty triall whereof ſhe little proud victory returned alwaies made take greater deilght ſhe perceiued liues tried combat ſtand danger ſhe oftentimes behold ſundry combat fought caſtle theſe thrée knight continued ſtill talke laſt told entertainment princeſſe miragarda afforded prince albayzar better content thing elſe greatly deſirad liberty great turke hold priſoners whoſe cruelty knew would ſeuere mittigated meane ſpent day hope ſée princeſſe could way accompliſh deſire knowing beſide prince florendos floraman determined ſtay ſtill caſtle friendly tooke leaue taking iourney toward cittie conſtantinople cauſe left king spaines court thus prince florendos accompanied beloued friend floraman concluded ſtill guard sheeld faire miſtreſſe miragarda againſt thoſe durſt come vſe controuerſie therewith ſtil bemoned hard fortune true faithfull ſeruice could better eſtéemed chap ix ſtrange aduenture chanced caſtle giant almarol happened prince florendos hiſtory report thrée knight iouſted againſt prince florendos linger loyter place til came greece farre cittie conſtantinople chance trauailed met leonarda princeſſe thrace worthily guided many noble gentleman ſome imployed themſelues knightly ſeruice gaine good opinion princeſſe others vttered many amorous conceit inueigle fancy towards marriage ſo paſſed away time till arriued con • ſtantinople princeſſe entertained maruailous great honour becauſe hiſtory doth make mention hereafter royall receiuing citty ſpeake thereof returne againe prince florendos walking along riuers ſide take freſh aire next day three knight departed eſpyed two boat well furniſhed oares foremoſt wherof ſate foure damoſels attired ſumptuous apparell ſitting poope end boate ſounding tuning lute whereto voyces deliuered ſuch pleaſant ditty might well haue bene compared three knight taken way conſtantinople ſo ſtayed ſtill caſtle almaroll haue made triall drew neare caſtle men beſturred oar merily lady continued pleaſant ſong often making ſignes courteſie towards boate couered tilt ſurpaſſing rich vnder pauilion ineſtimable value ſate lady pillow cuſhions veluet imbrodered 〈◊〉 gold whoſe countenance ſooth maruellous beautifull ſhewd gouernes ouer ſhe light robe carnation taffata cut layd beautifull silk ſéemed great coſtlines value beholder reaſon wanted gold pearle precious stone ſet forth vttermoſt ſhe might better diſcerned heate day paſt sunne declining neather region ſhe gaue commandement mantle pauilion ſhould lifted vp prince florendos floraman might behold exquiſite perfection beautie féete might ſee ſitting cloath blacke veluet two aged gentlewoman betwéene ſat faire damoſell ſide lay ſéemely knight gréene armour bearing ſhield deuice field sinople cupid faſt lincked chaines gold bowe arrowes lying broken piece knight himſelfe ſéemed man altogether vanquiſhed ouercome damoſell aduanced ſelfe aboue marriners brauely decked colour ladie whereof may ſay little proude behauiour ſéemed ſo pleaſant accident ſoeuer could haue power change theſe great ſhewes delight brought boates ſide caſtle continuing theſe ſwéete harmonie eccho water gaue acceptable noyſe eares windowes caſtle ſtoode behold two prince florendos floraman thought time long till might haue knowledge theſe lady eſpecially prince florendos earneſt deſire knowe knight boate caſting armes together thus communed himſelfe mind e • treameſt rigour miſfortune reſerued adioyned lament others reioyce daily hourely toſſed ſurges vncertaine chanches one elſe haue harbour hauen happineſſe ſpeake amiſſe let world enter iudgement firſt whole courſe life knightly ſeruice reuerent dutie haue alwayes borne miſtreſſe yet haue gained one haue loſt ſpeciall argument altogether vnfortunate hee would haue procéeded furder ſecret complaint floraman ſtayed friendly imbraſing ſo walking together behelde come boate lady ſate modeſt ciuill damoſel boate came two eſquires vailed bonnet lady miſtreſſe went orderly together damoſell came two prince eſquires reuerently dutie damoſell gaue gracious ſalutation ſhe paſſed laſt came trée shieldes placed damoſell beholding portraite faire miragarda turned eſquires theſe word diuine motion vnequall beautie cauſeth enter hard opinion lady miſtreſſe returne greatly diſpleaſed ſhe arriued ſuppoſe pleaſure baſe stone saint vincents rocke may preſume paragon ſelfe pure perfect diamond ſhee procéeded towards caſtle windowe reaſon ſuddaine aduenture princeſſe miragarda ſtately placed ſhe ſhould haue deliuered meſſage ſhe maruailouſly damped glimpſe ſingular beutie occaſion pauſing thing ſtrange woman quickly abaſhed ſimple cauſe therefore worthy fanourable conceite damoſel attained hardineſſe yet without maidenly ciuil baſhfulneſſe ſhe ſaluted princeſſe miragarda theſe ſpéeches let ſéeme faire princeſſe offenſiue gracious eye thruſt ſelfe preſence ſuch bold maner countrey maiden ſildome acquainted courtly quality beſide meſſenger pardonable becauſe ſome audacitie muſt vſed declaring meſſage therefore preſuming noble fauour omit néedeleſſe prolixious phraſes becauſe incident matter haue diſcloſe neither neceſſarie offend care long tedious proteſtations ſhall therefore vnderſtand moſt gratious princeſſe arnalte princeſſe nauarre eſpeciall good lady miſtreſſe kiſſeth hand excellencie deſire ſhe hath doe ſeruice ſpend ſometime ſo farre famed commended company hath béene ſo bold trauaile thus farre ſhe arriued ſuch ſmall traine attendeth daring enter land preſume caſtle ſhe firſt reſolued ſtand good liking affoord entertainement otherwiſe loth offend ſhe returne whence ſhe came word princeſſe thus replyed faire damoſall requeſt honeſt commendable part eſtéeme well thereof yet lyeth grant lady requeſt ſmall gréefe vnto aſſure comming princeſſe nauarre acceptable greateſt good fortune world beſide might happen concerning friendly deſire truſt cuſtome caſtle flatly againſt entrance well defended againſt woman whoſe company ſtrange againſt men daily imploy themſelnes deed honour good affection bare lady miſtreſſe ſhould preſume ſelfe breake cuſtome giant almaroll whoſe authority ſtretcheth mine ſure would wiſe agrée thereto therefore deſire imagine ill grant lady requeſt great truſt committed thoſe knight without perill none muſt enter caſtle ſo pray returne acceptable thankes lady excuſing allowable anſwer may aſſure griefe greater ſhe iudge imagine deſtitute power accompliſh courteous madame anſwered damoſell ſhall faile declare large princeſſe arnalte gratious pleaſure ſo doubt ſhe well accept friendly aunſwer rather becauſe daunger greater ſhe preſume vnaduiſedly owne peri • l ſo ſhe highly bound courteous nature ſending ſuch forewarning ſo ſhe humbly tooke leaue princeſſe miragarda whoſe anſwer ſhe thorowly deliuered lady miſtreſſe whereat ſhe receiued ſo great vnkindneſſe ſhe would hardly ſuffer damoſell report allowable ſufficient excuſe princeſſe ſhe grew ſo great melancholly neither one might ſpeake vnto knight gréene armour perceiued aroſe began thus pacifie madame ought take euill part princeſſe miragarda maketh réfuſall entry caſtle perchance ſhe fraide leaſt beauty ſhould ſtaine blemiſh know ſuch doubt ſtandeth way ſhe ſhould ſéeme vnwiſe committing hee caſe ſo great hazard wherefore pray let perſwaſion imagine cauſe deniall ſo quietly content choller remaine vpon ſtomacke theſe word knight vſed ſuch force eares princeſſe arnalte ſhe contented ſelfe anſwer damoſell brought becauſe ſhe would preſently depart thence without ſeeing ſome occaſions ſhe commanded knight go place shield hanged thence bring shield wherein princeſſe miragarda pictured becauſe ſhée would carry away knight eſteemed commandement highly princeſſe would imploy cauſe ſeruice wherfore without fu • der delay went land accompanyed damoſell carried meſſage princeſſe ſhe made knowne intent ſhe preſently went two prince florendos floraman ſhe ſummoned theſe word gentleman knight ſée come company lady miſtreſſe deſireth ſend princeſſe miragardaes sheeld lady would vſe thoſe occaſions iudgement ſhe eſtéemeth well thought ſhould ſéeme ſo bold denie demand carry ſuch opinion ſelues may ſpéed purpoſe faire meanes know ſhall conſtrained fetch away againſt wils yea deſpight thing dare doe contrary truſt would loth doe ſuch ſo great gentle nature would willingly offer iniury knight countrey vpon theſe wordes prince florendos thus anſwered gentle damoſell knight ſéemeth ignorant daungers shielde doeth promiſe cannot content himſelfe feede eye beholding contemplating thing ſo rare beautie excellency hee muſt needes enter ſo proude imagination owne pleaſure lady muſt carry shield away belongeth matter ſo truſt faire damoſell lord hath néede himſelfe hath néede shield haue hee may chance goe without time vnleſſe bring larger commiſſion get good deliuer commonly accuſtomed ſend shield woman becauſe thing ſhe knoweth vſe therefore ſhe haue bid ſo good fetch himſelfe becauſe ſhall carry ſound meſſage vnto pray doe mee ſo much fauour let vnderſtand time take matter ſo hardily vpon mee defende shielde againſt vttermoſt hee doe fortune ſerue ſo well conquere shield ſhall without trouble deliue • ed prooue ſo happie carry away shield proweſſe ſhall eſteeme ſelfe moſt fortunate man aliue looſe ſhall looſe life wonderfull vnfortunate race haue final ende neuertheleſſe muſt let vnderſtand ſéeing doth eſtéeme ſo well lady ſake intrude himſelf deſperate aduentures neceſſary bring ſome witneſſe teſtimonie gratious fauour may bee placed féete faire portraite leaſt perchance want thereof victorie ſhould chance fortune doe turne backe ſo expectation may vtterly deceiued knowe minde may depart tell damoſell returned place knight attended ſhe told anſwere prince florendos tooke leaue lady accompanied two eſquires came brauely marching toward prince drew ſomewhat neare began proudly vtter theſe ſpéeches ſée well sir knight good counſell vſed towards ſo ſmall diſcretion cannot take offered méete therefore taught diſcipline principle duty friendly perſwaſion yrkeſome care willed friendly meſſage ſhould ſend shield wherein image miragarda becauſe would loth conſtraint come fetch perceiue rather l • ſe great detrimeut ſhame giue friendly whereby might haue gained commendation lady fauour demand wherewith would honour feete picture promiſe vpon knighthood ill hap conquered ſhall made acquainted pledge lady fauour therefore doe vttermoſt endeuour bring vnder ſubiection ſhall ſee giue ſuch lecture feare hardly conſtrue truſt syr quoth florendos language braue • bountifull repleniſhed large circumſtance wo • d manhood prooue anſwerable thereto déedes whereof knowe man might better reſolued draw ſword doe commit cauſe preſent triall herevpon theſe two knight prepared themſelues combate offering one towards heard caſement winde caſtle ſuddenly open cauſed prince florendos looke vp eſpied princeſſe miragarda ſéene ſince comming caſtle reaſon whereof remained ſo inwardly rauiſhed delight gazing delicate ſpectacle combate quite cleane minde ſtrange knight perceiuing tooke arme thus awaked sir knight preſumeth enter combate ought ſo forgetfull himſelfe ſéemes therefore either prouide defend promiſe goe away lady shield prince thitherward conſtrained paſſe realme nauarre chaunce happened paſſage guarded princeſſe arnaltaes knight whereof two vanquiſhed noble valour princeſſe arnalte well noting worthy behauiour alſo braue luſtie young gallant ſhe vſed ſuch friendly perſwaſion went caſtle ſhe entertained ſuch honour ſhe accuſtomed vſe towards reſembled dragonalt bounty proweſſe young prince beholding arnalte intiched ſo great beauty vnderſtanding dowry quéene nauarre began waxe maruailous amorous farre inueigled loue iudged owne opinion conſiſted detriment life dignity honour length ſo fel lady miſtreſſe dutifull caſtle almaroll accompanied lady damoſels ſix eſquiers haue heard alſo noble aduenturous prince dargonalte witneſſe intire loue bare princeſſe many time way aſſayed knightly occaſions wherein fortune ſtill affoord victory princeſſe receiued ſmall pleaſure happy chance ſhée eſtéemed ſo well thereof ſhe thought worthy poſſeſſe loue dragonalt aduiſedly pondering frequented princeſſe amiable condition ſo ſhort time came citie ſtanding bankes riuer theſin made two league caſtle giant almaroll ſtayed till prouided two boates paſſe along riuer wherein came caſtle almaroll dragonalte entertainement haue heard noble valiant prince florendos whoſe valour mooue ſuch hatred prince arnalte towards affectionate loyall friend dragonalt ſhe angerly departed caſtle almaroll towards owne place abode nauarre entending neuer ſée againe doubted ſuddaine choller would take ſuddaine cooling ſhe could eaſily intreated anger againſt little offended euen ſo could ſhe eaſily woon forget deſire wreakefull vengeance vnſtayedneſſe ſuch good loue ſo great manner chaunced dragonalt continuing affection princeſſe arnalte ende ſo fortunate obtaind good mariage ſhe making lord ſelfe king nauar • e wherefore carmelia grandmother ſent away worthily accompanied lady gentlewoman better gouernement iourney beſide ſhe gaue charge lord gentleman went caſe ſhould depart vntill preſented emperour order ſhe ſet forward towards conſtantinople met diuerſe time way many braue gallant vnderſtanding ſetting forth honour dutifull attendance vntill ſhee came emperours court aſſembled togither ſo many braue knight ſo richly armed carrying ſuch fine deuiſes one would haue iudged rather prepare incampe themſelues warre ſhew knightly diſports delight emperor many came thither behold brauery others doe princeſſe court honourable eſtates ſeruing well ſo doe prince gracian berolde sage aliart platir diuerſe knight emperor court going company aged emperor himſelfe went meet princeſſe two league citie aduertiſed comming reaſon prince primaleon prince rid ſomewhat reſt preſently leaue coach mounted goodly white palfray whoſe harneſſe rich coſtly beholde princeſſe ſelfe brauely attired greekiſh faſhion ſhe might better delight eye behold robe carnation veluet fairely imbrodered paſement lace gold clocke scarlet cloſed ſumptuous diamond placed thicke maner button compaſſe cloke likewiſe garniſhed diamond hauing betweene euery diamond ranke glorious orient pearle ſhined sunne ſo gallantly maruailouſly decke ſet forth coſtly veſture beſide glimpſe ſo ſweetly dazeled face youthfull knight whoſe thought frée aſſaults loue ſuddenly entrapped ſingular beautie emperor albeit farre yeeres yet attire himſelfe youthfully giue greater grace yong prince bare company ſo comming princeſſe leonarda entertained ſtately accuſtomed honour afterward gaue place prince primaleon sonne kiſſed hand gentle manner ſo prince came emperonr whoſe preſence witneſſing ſo great eſtate much content mind young princeſſe thicke beſet little 〈…〉 gold whole armour gallantly ſet forth • erewith helmit likewiſe ſame maner shéeld bare deuice field azure cipreſſe trée thicke hung nut gold knight mounted luſtie bay courſer hauing attending two eſquiers one carying shield couered ouer cloath ſo deuice thereof could diſcerned knight hauing eſpied emperour ſent preſently one eſquiers vnto come emperour rained palfrey began ſalute order gratious lord knight behold vnder yonder oake ſuppriſed maruellous earneſt deſire trie againſt theſe knightes court renowned valour hath beene ſo much reported whole world willed certifie long time ſince bare armour followed knightly aduenture therefore would gladly make proofe good opinion holdeth himſelfe becauſe might better ſpéede purpoſe denied honeſt requeſt determined day guard paſſage doubting ſhall defend himſelfe ſufficiently againſt dare iudge ſo great hardineſſe themſelues paſſe without aſking licence wherefore humbly deſireth maieſtie would command knight iouſt hath promiſed refuſe none except prince primaleon sonne againſt neuer conſent beare armes emperour ſo ioyfull theſe tydings might rather would conſent knight requeſt meane whereby princeſſe leonarda might receiue ſome pleaſure conſidered alſo well like becauſe ſhe ſhould perceiue noble valour proweſſe knight remained court hauing opinion knight enterpriſed guard paſſage one well ſeene hautie exerciſes returned eſquier anſwere friend ſay vnto knight thy maiſter freely giue leaue proceede honeſt requeſt partly ſorte aged yéeres ſuffer one number thoſe ſure hazard honour get libertie thy maiſter princeſſe leonardaes paſſage company promiſe thée abide till either haue woonne valiantly loſt vnfortunately came againe princeſſe leonarda eſquire departed anſwer maiſter began theſe ſpéeches madame thinke reaſonable one ſhould denie way within mine owne dominion eſpecially ſuch time company certainely knight hath enterpriſed thus hinder v ought one ſmall courage except doth imbolden himſelfe meanes beauty hoping moue towards 〈…〉 doth offer perſon endure doubtfull 〈◊〉 ••• antly emperour concluded intent reccamon court eſtéemed good hardy knight gaue ſpurres courſer againſt ſtrange knight fortune ſo farre contrary preſently diſmounted horſe hauing nothing moued knight kept paſſage whereupon friſoll coutched lance againſt ſtrange knight cauſed bea • reccamon company galloped horſe fetch himſelfe knight cauſed ſpéede gracian done emperour hereat greatly abaſhed beholding ſhame knight receiued whereupon dramian went trie fortune ſooth aduerſe horſe fell downe together perceiuing ſaid enemie ought refuſe iouſt ſtrange knight hearing word gaue ſigne dramian ſhould giue ouer run would warned friendly motion putting himſelfe vpon ſecond triall againe throwne earth verie ſore dangerouſly wounded moued emperour much agreeued doubting leſt iſſue enterpriſe would returne diſhonour • knight court roſuell ſéeking reuenge iniurie companion receiued gaue himſelfe forth brauely pompides blandidon happened arriue emperour ſeeing knowing ſuch merited fauour afforded gratious welcome deſiring would endeuour make frée paſſage end princeſſe leonarda might enter conſtantinople contented mightie emperour anſwered pompides make proofe good fortune well witneſſe regard haue excellency trie may attaine purchaſe ſo many good knightes haue ſailed ſooner pompides thus vttred minde gaue ſpurs horſe againſt ſtrange knight ſooth compelled blandidon ſpeed knight done ſaw knight emperours court vanquiſhed liſted vp helmet came vnto emperour fell knées kiſſe maieſties hand emperour perceiued knight ſo hardly kept paſſage nephew prince florian forreſt ioyfull happy victory hée agrieued ſée knight ſo vanquiſhed yea themſelues thinke diſhonor ouercome noble prince florian hauing kiſſed hand emperour primaleon offered doe like princeſſe leonarda ſhée ſéeing prince ſuch young yeares accompanied ſuch ſingular proweſſe could ſo much account • eof eye ſhe imagine worthy great good ſuddainly inſtant ſhe gaue ſecrete hardy prince florian vertuous deſeruings conceit well beſéeme fauourable acceptation prince florian whereas vntill preſent heart could neuer faithfully make certaine eſtimation loue euen preſent humour haue heard ſingular courteſie princeſſe leonarda alſo ſufficency equiualent beautie cauſed ſuch hot ſkirmiſh betweene loue liberty muſt needes yéeld himſelfe ſubiect affection conquered brought vnder extreame charge ſo nothing agréed ſo well labouring thoughtes ſuppoſed princeſſe commaund ſeruice good applied dutifull attendance emperour palmerin ſéeing ſuch libertie paſſage graunted minde gaze faire princeſſe remember happines obtained victory came maner princeſſe thrace madame knight imployed himſelfe hinder paſſage onely contented grant v libertie paſſage emperour deſirous make knowne princeſſe leonarda magnificent entertainment could affoord court ſet forward way towards conſtantinople prince primaleon florian forreſt leading way brauely hardy champion reſiſt dangerous aduenture ſhould forbid entrance citie come citie receiued people maruellous triumphantly prepared scaffoldes theater 〈◊〉 preſented many ſtrange hiſtories rare inuentions entertainment young princeſſe thrace alſo delight aged emperour albeit indifferently contented withall yet remained eſpeciall cauſe griefe ſtomacke wit impriſonment king polendos noble prince company belcar diuerſe approoued knightes armes rid haſtily pallace aduertiſe empreſſe princeſſes gridonia polinarda comming leonarda princeſſe thrace came feete prettie way pallace met princeſſe failed entertaine gratious courteſie whereat princeſſe receiued great contentation thinking receiued ſuch great eſtimation firſt arriuall would continue fauourable iudgement ſhe ſtayed empreſſe gridonia ended l • uing ſalutations princeſſe polinarda next aduance ſelfe ſhewing princely amiable geſtures courteſie towards princeſſe leonarda whoſe beauty ſhe iudged worthy great commentation aſſure whoſoeuer indifferently beholde theſe two lady together could hardly iudge ſurmounted beautie princeſſe polinarda aduiſedly marking diuine face faire leonarda beganne growe great opinion fauour towards prince palmerin commending maruellouſſy ſta • neſſe iuſtneſſe fidelitie would forget 〈◊〉 loyalty hauing offered ſuch eſpeciall treaſure princeſſe leonerda ſufe • ed ſo great paine trauaile yet could perſwaded accept choyce theſe two faire beautifull lady holding one another familiarly hand followed empreſſe chamber ſelfe gridonia lady ſate downe contemplate ſwéet delicate face theſe two princeſſes florian ſooner entred chamber hee humbled himſelfe kiſſe gmpreſſe hand embraced louingly great many time ſhee bene alwayes affectionate mother princeſſe flerida reſt child reſpect ſhee receyued maruellous contentment behold sonne prince florian forreſt hauing done dutia empreſſe came ſaluted princeſſe gridonia offering ſame manner honour done vnto empreſſe ſhe would ſuffer regard ſo much wherefore ſhe caſt armes neck giuing ſuch worthy entertainement ſo noble prince deſerued haue went place princeſſe polinarda ſate knéeled vpon one knées offering ſame maner courteſie vſed empreſſe princeſſe gridonia ſhée maidenly modeſtly interrupt taking hand began thus parley ſée syr florian preſent come make ſatiſfaction offence haue day giuen princeſſe leonarda hindering libertie way wherefore ſelfe would adiudge firſt puniſhed offering ſuch diſcourteſie perſwade ſelfe able make recompence diuerſe wayes knightly ſeruice vnſufferable faulte haue day committed wordes prince thus replyed would fortune would make ſo good account mee princeſſe thrace would abaſe ſelfe ſo much take good parte ſimple ſeruice might attaine ſo great happineſſe déede might deſerue good lyking ſuch gratious princeſſe ſhould thinke ſelfe moſt fortunate vnder heauen hazard could ſo daungerous ſhould ſake eaſily ouercome wherefore fayre madame heartily deſire ſhould perſwade princeſſe leonarda accept knightly ſeruaunt honour ſhe doo affoord eſtimation ſhould account ſelfe would ſuch heart encouraged ſuch laudable cauſe ſhould worthily finiſh aduenture might like imploy mée princeſſe polinarda returned anſwer woorthy syr princeſſe leonarda ſhall purchaſe ſelfe ſo great honour noble knightly behauiour entertaining vowed seruant champyon perſwade ſelfe long circumſtance néede vſed ſhee ſo gladly accept honeſt offer wherefore doubt ſhee ſo much ab •• e ſelfe 〈◊〉 receyue friendly motion dare take hazard vpon ſelfe ſo imagine ſhe cauſe deceyued therefore ſigne permanent loyaltie ſhall bee none elſe thinke ſcorne goe kiſſe princely hand ſhall bee ſeale perpetuall bond ſhall beſtow knightly ſeruice ſhe likewiſe ſhall admit continuall fauour princeſſe leonarda ſwéetly bluſhing beare polinarda ſo pleaſaunt diſcourſe turned affable aunſwere madame cannot wiſh commaund mee thing would ſo forgetfull ſelfe make refuſall thereof eſtéeme 〈…〉 honoured receyue prince florian 〈…〉 requite kindeneſſe polynarda contented herſelfe well gentle aunſwere fayre princeſſe leonarda well reſolued ſpeciall entertainment ſhee gaue noble couzin florian alſo remooue ſuſpition ſhee ſingular beautie fearing leaſt moſt fauoured friende prince palmerin england ſhould fall lyking matche becauſe ſhe reſerued altogether ſéemely ſelfe prince florian little prowd good fortune emperor would haue called ſaw familiar two princeſſes talk whervpon determined good hap would ſo permit make marriage betwéene princeſſe thrace gaue bed fellow née • e polinarda aſſuring theſe two vertuous lady liued loued ſo intirely together one could neuer without others company occaſions ſecrete ſorrow ſo euer hapned one would 〈…〉 reuealing cloſe conceit 〈◊〉 minde could called firme faithful friendſhip kind
