leonarda ſo earneſt thought 〈◊〉 tumbled could enioy wiſhed reſt next day morning emperour béene chappell heare diuine seruice table couered princeſſe fleridaes chamber dined company empreſſe gridonia polinarda faire princeſſe thrace table withdrawne •• tten prettie talking together entered damoſell attired blacke two ſéemely eſquiers attending ſhe humbled herſelfe emperour kiſſing hand like empreſſe gridonia polinarda gently imbraced damoſell ſhe knewe one wayting gentlewoman vpon princeſſe targiana ſuch time ſhe abiding emperours court empreſſe ſhee ſtayed ſtill emperor hauing knowledge came demanded concerning welfare lady miſtreſſe wordes ſhe anſwered manner dread prince moſt gratious lord deſire receiue diſpleaſure ſée rather inclined empreſſe excellencie becauſe princeſie targiana commaunded addreſſe ſelfe vnto highneſſe one ſhe vnfainedly regardeth grace deſireth vnderſtand princeſſe good lady • • eth ſo ſhe neuer came foorth chamber ſince day prince polendos sonne prince knight committed priſon time ſhe hath ceaſſed moſt gratiouſly wéepe lament inſomuch faire beautie maruellouſly altered chaunged yet hath turke father laboured much may diſ • wade mournefull kinde life vaine waſteth endeuor ſhe tooke oath preſence ſhe would neuer giue euer vexing ſelfe continuall waiting vntill knight enioyed frée libertie came conſtantinople turke father fearing leſt extreame griefe would cauſe ſhortning youthfull time hath promiſed reſtore libertie prince albayzar babilon haue requeſt may enioy among againe cauſe great turke hath ſent hither ambaſſadour either day tomorrow morning highneſſe ſhall vnderſtand ſumme matter princeſſe targiana feareth leaſt ſhould denie graunt requireth may mooue ſuch inconuenience maieſtie would repent great honour beſtowed court ſhe put faithfully truſt bring theſe tydings vnto empreſſe whoſe preſence haue made acquainted charge becauſe te • cheth doeth perſon moreouer ſhee carefully pondering euery car • e ſelfe doubting leaſt mallice father beareth princeſſe court ſéeke ſecrete reuenge ſome way treaſon intended betwéene ambaſſadour towards highneſſe preuent worſt may happen ſhe deſireth returne father good word forgoe prince albayzar know lawfull huſband firſt knight foorth father power haue attained ſuch place aſſurance al deuiſes notwithſtanding harme may come vnto libertie ſuch miſfortune happen ſhe would loath maieſtie may ſée cauſe finde ſelfe agrieued offender faire damoſell anſwered emperour accept gratefully good aduice princeſſe targiana ſée well honour ſhe receiued court albeit ſmall double double rewarded perſwade ſelfe determined follow counſell emperour concluding minde damoſell came againe princeſſe polinarda preſent gratious commendation faire targiana ſhe behelde rare ſingular beautie princeſſe thrace ſet damoſell tooke hardineſſe demaund lady princeſſe miragarda prince albayzar vanquiſhed ſooth faire damoſell anſwered polinarda princeſſe miragarda leonarda princeſſe thrace noble palmerin england deliuered enchantment wherein ſhe remained long tedious time theſe wordes damoſell tooke occaſion beginne thus fauour madame knowe lady becauſe haue forgotten ſtraunge aduenture cuppe brought damoſel court aſſure palmerin england ſtrange nature could make ſo ſmall account ſuch faire princeſſe alſo refuſing ſtately gouernment kingdome thrace polinarda deſirous mooue damoſell talking matter willed ſhe would report welfare princeſſe targiana ſo friendly giuen vnderſtand tidings brought thither ambaſſadour beiug arriued conſtantinople emperour ſent chiefeſt prince knight court receiue friendly courteous entertainment damoſell heard ambaſſadour come ſhe preſently departed thence towards spaine go find prince albayzar promiſing princeſſe polinarda returne conſtantinople ſhe made returne turkie emperour deſſred damoſell preſent meſſage good king recinde alſo prince albayzar beſtowed diuers rich coſtly giftes ſhe betooke ſelfe trauaile verie glad ſhe eſpyed none came ambaſſadour haue already declared receiued princely order enemie became beſt eſtate ſent ſooth ſuch noble vertuous minde ſhould deale roughly extreamely enemy hee would entertaine vowed profeſſed friend ſuch courteſie ambaſſadour emperours pallace conducted worthlie riding among chiefeſt prince knight court emperour himſelfe doe greater honour came receiued gate pallace proud turke would one vouchſafe vaile bonnet offer honourable ſigne emperour ſuch malicious ſtomacke towards caſe offended turke lord emperour perceiued well ſmall regard word princeſſe targiana ſent damoſell yet ſuffred thought beſt vſing ſtill ſo great courteſie vnto laſt conſtrained ſhew decent ieſture preſented emperour letter lord turke ſeale thereof pure gold faſtened ſumptuous chaine emperor receiued hand gratiouſly hauing viewed tenour thereof deſired turke go take reſt chamber next day would ſatiſfie occaſion ambaſſage deſire grace anſwered turk may ſo ſtand pleaſure make preſently anſwer without deſer • ing furder time haue receiued goe • eſt ſelfe mine owne tent haue commanded prouided without walles citie ſhould otherwiſe great turk gratious lord would find himſelfe much offended emperour replyed faſhion ſhall doe imagine conuenient owne conceit neuertheleſſe ſhould whit agreeued ambaſſadour lodge pallace great turke might better fulfill dutie charge committed beſéech grace ſaid turk let theſe néedleſſe ſpéeches goe remember ſelfe hundred knight court held priſoners lord turke ſée make ſome prouiſion lord hauing power reuenge diuers iniuries hath receiued ſome subiects determined put death witneſſe gratious noble nature content earneſt intreatis daughter faire princeſſe targiana giue liues reſtore change prince albayzar kept priſoner court king spaine commandement princeſſe miragarda truſt thinke ſelfe ſmall fauour princeſſe targiana whoſe teares ſuch power ſ • ue liues knight lord turke determined ſhould neuer ſée againe vntill highneſſe ſent knight sauage man might reuenge iniurie forgetfull himſelfe committed carrying away sea daughter targiana deed truly worthy ſharpe puniſhment turke pauſing emperour tooke occaſion beginne thus certainly confeſſe ſelfe greatly bound princeſſe targiana farre faire princeſſe miragarda wiſe foreſight beene greater knight ſuffered extreame rigour death aſſure ſince cruell fortune ſo throwne dyce mee rather would haue loſte twice ſo many ſend lord turke knight sauadge man preſence whome faithfully promiſe deliuer prince albayzar prouided alwayes make ſufficient aſſurance whome turke holdeth vnkinde ſeruitude whereof may certainly perſwaded pray vouchſafe knowledge manner caſe muſt ordered courſe muſt take matter anſwered turke thus maieſtie muſt ſend vnto soueraigne lorde prince albayzar vppon inuiolable oath mee voweth may account ſo great ſufficient truth faile ſo great bond ſend prince polendos ſonne prince knightes companie may bolde lorde willingly would looſe life falſifie faith towards excellencie emperour leaning vpon arme noting well word embaſſador pauſed good ſpace without making anſwere prince florian perceiuing better acquainted infidelitie turkes emperour fearing leaſt hee would haue giuen credite ſubtill aſſurance preſently ſtarted vp began thus moſt worthy emperour conſider cauſe great turke detayneth knight priſon ſhall well perceiue ſmal truſt ought repoſe occaſion ſo little aſſurance troth much leſſe againe ſuffer prince albayzar eſcape vpon worde may chaunce ſooner would repent ſelfe remember vnfaithfull dealing giant dramuſiande time hee kept shield princeſſe miragarda contrary vowed promiſe brought caſtle almaroll night comming court brauely giue foorth ſpeeches woon knightly endeuour diſhonourable dealing found end coſtly therefore neceſſarie king recinde regard carefully hitherto hath done libe • tle perſon cauſe ſending home againe knight ambaſſador take vpon maintaine meſſage preſenteth turke ſoueraigne onely regard royall clemency defend contrary againſt yea enforce confeſſe proceedeth earneſt inſtance made ſubiects prince alb • yzar importune ſute haue lord gouernour libertie ſo fall turke doe ſatiſfie continuall requeſt ſhall conſtrained guard himſelfe wont defend eſpeciall aide knight anſwered ambaſſadour thou ſhalt aſſuredly vnderſtand promiſe thee authoritie ambaſſage alloweth enter armes againſt thée faile make thée know reuerence thou oughteſt entertaine vnreproueable word lord soueraigne doubt beſide giue due recompence thy diſloyall vnſeemely dealing whereto prince florian thus replyed moſt acceptable thing make account thée enter combatte reſpect good encouragement haue thereto ſmall honor fall thy ſhare emperour perceiuing nephew ſo great chollere touched scepter held hand ende ſhould procéed ſomewhat inwardly offended giue ſo hard rough ſpéeches neuertheleſſe hee eſtéemed well good counſell maintaine hee came embaſſadour manner ought offended knight aſſiſt good carefull aduiſe eſpecially prince florian nephew ignorant long ſince cuſtome maners vſed turkes court great turke himſelfe haue opinion faith promiſe hath himſelfe beleeuing well would honour profeſſeth violate breake word thing yet dare build aſſure ſelfe thereon leſt priſoners take occaſion complaine fond dealing remembring hard vſage haue ſuffered moreouer ſhould preſume ſo venture ſo raſhly king recinde know would ſo willingly conſent whoſe ſonne amongſt prince priſoner til haue owne aſſurance grant libertie prince albayzar wherefore may thus giue lord vnderſtand ſend home priſoned knight faile ſend prince albayzar requeſt lawfull promiſe honor performe ſo chance doubt faithfull dealing herein giue pledge aſſurance owne daughter princeſſe targiana ſure make anſwere well perfect knowledge ſhe hath fidelitie alſo deſire ſhe hath recouer home huſband ambaſſadour ſtanding muſing laſt replyed thus emperour ſee well knowledge ill men attaine follow good lawfull ſo take leaue excellency aſſuring princeſſe targiana wil aduenture life onely vpon word promiſe withhold onely felicitie hath done ſuch noble ſeruice lord father ſo ſaid emperour ſhe ſhall highly pleaſe good beare pray behalfe heartie commendation kiſſe princely hand ſuch eſtimation haue ſhe hath power diſpoſe anything ſhe taketh pleaſure imploy ambaſſadour made promiſe fulfill commandement courteous obeyſance tooke leaue departed emperor departure ſate conferred knight commending greatly wiſdome princeſſe miragarda ſending prince albayzar king recinde whome would ſo come paſſe ſhould yet againe recouer sonne polendos knight chap xii ¶of aduenture happened courr emperour palmerin followed afterward next day embaſſadour great turke departed emperours court ſame day afternoon emperour ſate accompanyed diuerſe ſundrie prince lord knight perceiued enter great hall bigge goodly aged man ſo much weakened ouerſpent yéeres ſéemed hee ready fall earth emperour iudged perſon ſome authoritie reaſon goodly graylocks faire longmilkwhite beard thought ſuch ſéemely fatherlike man would deceiue world falſhood diſſembling prince others kept emperour company deſired earneſtly vnderſtand would ſay oftentimes beholding aduiſedly come emperour offered ſtoupe downe kiſſe highneſſe hand taking pittie would ſuffer ſo doo make ſuch humble salutation could emperour demaunded occaſion come gratious lord ſaid aged man voyce ſo fainte lowe hardly could vnderſtood court alwayes ſo fortunate entertaine noble aduenturous knightes euer ready ſuccour deſtitute aide aſſiſtance good hope would refuſe affoorde mée theyr fauourable refuge deliuering great daunger whereinto miſfortune ſuddenly brought theſe heauy ſadde ſpéeches accompanyed ſuch aboundance teares hee mooued heart emperour great compaſſion pawſing prettie ſpace déepe dolourous ſigh hee began thus againe moſt humbly beſéeche maieſtie would time comfort gratious aide reuenge iniurie extreamly offered mee ſooth ſo great grieuous commenced ſuch perſonages cannot reporte ſumme thereof without excéeding ſorrowe might much offend highneſſe wherefore pray beſtow mée ſuch knight whoſe good fortune may liue ſome hope eaſe bring place hee may atchieue ſuch rare renowne life time neuer attaine like wordes emperour replyed thus albeit ſuch perillous affaire neceſſarie ſende knight without firſt acquainted cauſe yet ſuch great excéeding pittie take ſée grieuous ſighes manifold teares muſt néeds conſent requeſt great diſcredite man ſuch ancient goodly time ſhuld found forgerie deceytfull dealing good opinion ſuffer mée iudge ſo knight ſée ſtanding called prince florian forreſt albeit ſome name hardie knight sauadgeman nephew one whome put greateſt truſt giue ayde ſuccour matter ſuch importance ſée hee prepareth himſelfe forſake court aſſiſt noble approoued valour cauſe ſhall haue neede vſe aged man ſéeing maruellous courteſie emperour fel knées kiſſed hand ſpake followeth vaine ſée well moſt famous emperour young olde ſo thunder ſurpaſſing bountie occaſion ſelfe receyueth time giueth good cauſe thinke vttermoſt haue hearde noble commendation hath rather beene ſparing ſpeech ſufficient comprehend hero • call deſertes ſhall thinke ſelfe moſt happieſt aliue hauing ſéene mine eye hath bene ſo often bruted mine eare knight sauadgeman aduanced himſelfe kiſſe emperours hand ſatiſ • action honourable ſpéeche vſed aged man ſtill ſo earneſt ſuite prince florian conſtrained arme himſelfe preſently departed court ſuch great haſte hee leiſure take leaue empreſſe friend emperour fell queſtioning knight court knowe auncient man whoſe company nephew florian ſo ſuddenly gon one could report whence primaleon much offended emperour father would command nephew florian depart ſo ſoone aged man knowing firſt place aduenture would conduct wherevpon ſame day berolde prince spaine platir blandidon pompides gratian polinard reccamon albanis reſuel moſt renowmed knight emperor court departed folow prince florian feared leaſt euill ſhould happen vnder guilefull dealing aged man emperour ſaw court left deſolate manner noble knight woont kéep company found himſelfe grieuouſly perturbed minde fearing leaſt ſome finiſter chaunce ſhould happen nephewe florian rode ſtill company aged guide without reſting place til next day morning neceſſity muſt ſtay giue refreſhing horſes ſuffered féede indifferently mounted againe horſebacke reſted day likewiſe till come within ſight fayre caſtle ſtood top fayre rocke fortreſſe del • ctable eye behold foote whereof goodly riuer courſe ſo déepe dangerous went vnto caſtle conſtrained paſſe ouer ſmall boate wherein two men could hardly paſſe one time aged man wearie ryding deſirous haue little eaſe alighted horſe vſing language manner prince florian danger sir knight wherin muſt hazard liues ſo bold venture ſelues together little boate therefore pray alight ſecuritie ſhall paſſe ouer alone eſquyre come one another becauſe bring ouer v horſes reaſon wel anſwerd prince florian reſpect aged vnweldy péeres alſo wiſhing beſt auaile therfore intend follow counſell ſée neceſſitie compelleth v doo ſay theſe word diſmounted horſe entred little boate commanding charge thereof paſſe ouer ſcantly attained middle water ſuddenly ſuch blacke ougly clowde ouerſhadowed aged man eſquyre land loſt ſight eſquire perceiued hée leape water followe lord deſperate intent eſpyed great hill ſuddenly would ſuffer paſſe vpon turned goe place left aged man ſo quickly rapt away gone eſquire could poſſiby imagine way taken eſquire began iudge teares aged man ſhed preſence emperour end ſhadow treaſon wretchedly wēt ſo ſtood muſing great canuaſed thouſand imaginations▪ concluded ſearch maiſter thoſe part fortune find would return y• emperor court make known vnfortunate loſſe lorde maiſter ende prince friend might take vpon enquyre ſuch opinion loyall eſquyre diligent ſearch great many knightes might happily recouer lorde againe noble prince florian forreſt ſooner gotten ſide riuer clowde conueyed away boate wherein paſſed ſuch ſort hee could meanes haue ſight wherevpon hée began aduance himſelfe towardes caſtle ſtood vppon rocke fearing daungers might happen becauſe rocke high troubleſome climbe armor hee weightie withall hee conſtrained reſt himſelfe thrée foure time way ſo night chaſed away gladſome day hee could arriue caſtle hee came vnto caſtle gate came foure verie gallant damozells receyue cauſed many torch alighted ſhewed themſelues dutifull entertaine caſtle courteous offer prince would ſéeme denye beautie ſo much blinde minde daungers might ſuddenly happen hee fedde eye beholding altogether one free bondes becauſe hee would neuer greatly hurt himſelfe affecting ladyes theſe damoſells prince entered caſtle court whereof paued fayre goodly marble stone paſſed courte came great hall builded maruellous artificiall antique worke entraunes wherof prince receiued damoſell thrée attending ſhe ſo great huge ſtature gyant albeeit ſhee indeede woman paſt ſixtéene yéeres age gentle milde natured perſon tooke prince florian hand lead fayre hall hanged tapiſtry ineſtimable value prince come place pleaſed damoſell bring tooke helmet beautie ſéemed ſo acceptable eye damoſell inſtant ſhee gaue whole affection vnto yet ſhe ſomewhat abaſhed ſhe ſhould eſteeme ſo well whoſe dealing vnknowne neither whence conſideration whereof turned ſuddaine good liking ſuddaine hatred diſdaine ſhe would gladly haue diſſembled therefore thus beganne parly sir knight heart time greatly ſuppriſed ſorow grieuous iniury offred wherof haue good hope reuenged yt ſo courteouſly vouchſafed come caſtle ſucc • ur mée wherefore pray goe reſt ſelfe night becauſe trauaile doth require ſome eaſe morrow morning recite cauſe wherein may doe much pleaſure madame anſwered knight sauage man imagine ſelfe déeply indebted excéeding fauour much bound conducted place reioyce good fortune doe ſeruice account ſo great honour life greater value would hazard extreame perill excellency thinke well commaund damoſell accuſtomed entertained ſuch courtly language preſently returned reply thanke sir friendly offer pray would make good supper night may better quietneſſe minde take reſt tomorrow morning wil diſcourſe haue occaſion vſe aide ſo time hartily good night ſhe tooke leaue ſuch ſwéete gratious manner ſecrete intent treaſon could way diſcerned knight sauage man remained greatly • onten • ed hoping ſpeede ſo well fauour damoſell furder cauſes friendſhip ſhould ariſe betwéene may thought ſpéed ſo well damoſell hermit rebuked haue doe ſecret intent prince chamber ſet ſupper worthily ſerued damoſels gaue entertainment gate caſtle among thought beſt waited cup ſooth ſhe well adorned perfect beautie made forget former affection lady caſtle ſuch may perceiue conſtancie loue well briefe began queintly deuiſe damoſell ſhe likewiſe mooued conceit companion prince glanced amorous toying ſhe iybed double conſtruing supper ended brought theſe damoſels bed chamber bed ſhe bene ſo famialiar supper time came theſe amiable ſpéeches sir knight time place ſo commodious vnto ſhould well perceiue good account make ſéeing fortune ſo aduerſe determination burning lamp affection muſt quenched déepe ſorrowfull ſigh • pray accept king whereof make ſmall eſtimation earneſt penny good concluding ſhe left king hand attending prince anſwer ſhe departed damoſells remained well pleaſed could friendly language damoſell giuen loue put king one finger left hand incontinent prince ſo depriued power brought ſo farre courſe himſelfe could moue ſtirre part stone king ſuch vertue ſooner put finger preſently naturall féeling taken damoſelles ſooner returned vnto lady named arlencea preſently bringing cōpany ſhe came chamber prince florian lay ſo maruailouſly enchanted power diſcerne ſpake ſhe vnto damoſels manner ſée friend iourney imployed altogether vaine iudge mother colambia liue great contentment hauing power reuenge death ſons brocalon baleato calfurnien camboldam brother ſhée pronounced theſe wordes ſhe caſt eye vpon prince ſéeing young ſwéet countenance ſhe entred theſe termes greatly abaſhed thinking ſo noble valiant force ſhould conſiſt knight ſo young yeares power ouercome one man ſurely muſt néeds thinke good fortune ſide matter doth mooue doubtfull opinion ſeemeth viſage ſomwhat comfortable vnto fortune fauourites make repute neare allied ſupernaturall affinitie aſſure could willingly remit offence hée hath done death brother prouoke mée ſéeke ſharpe reuengement death ſo many good hardy knightes thus regard enuie amiable perſonage mooue ſecret contention within willingly ſhe would haue ſaued knightly proportion loſſe brother ſo grieuous vnto fauourable pittie quite cleane forſake ſo ſhe preſently minded cutte head ſhe inſtant doe déede aged man ſent ſéeke florian brought thither arriued knowing fit fancie preuailed ſo much changed angry moode wherevpon began thus haue accaſion madame feare knight wil eſcape hauing brought ſuch extreame alteration wherefore pray change ſharpe ſeuere humor reſerue life till haue brought vnto mother take pleaſure ſéeing die hath cut flowres honourable linage may deliuer ſooner thinke beſt wee doe imbarque ſelues goe ſéeke iſland ſhe remaineth albeit minde otherwiſe bent anſwered arlencea yet refuſe followe counſell wherefore deſire goe morrowe morning earely port ſée prouided proper ship cannot enioy quietneſſe feare looſe knight againe breaking minde arlencea damoſels left prince florian chamber brought ſuch vnhappy ſubiection ſuffer endure ſharpe ſentence enemy chap xiii ſhall diſcouered damoſell thus gotten prince florian happened time voyage remembrance made hiſtory collambra ſooner intelligence death giant brocalon baleato sonnes prince florian forreſt ſlaine ſhe concluded couer griefe practiſe meanes ſhe could deuiſe fortune would preſent onto whereby ſhe might reuenged done • e mu • ders ſuch earneſtneſſe damnable wicked minde compaſſed thouſand horrible inuentions immeaſurable rage wherein ſhe continually would ſuffer determine certainely thing herevpon ſhe came iſland ſomewhat nearer ſhe good hope finde ſuccour aide pre • ent purpoſe meanes auncient knight named alfarnao béene nouriſhed long time huſband made aboade within iſland hauing great knowledge acte nigromancy man altogether brought vp ſubtill craftie deuiſes hée hearing continuall complaint collambra made mooued take compaſſion ſo promiſed helpe thing hée could poſſible take reuengement knight sauage man whome hée knewe arte court conſtantinople wherevpon came collambra vſing theſe ſpéeches madame ſo ſhall like follow counſell dare promiſe make forgoe extreame griefe wherewith accompanied wherto collambra thus replied would haue come ſo farre perſwaded ſelfe aſſured friendſhip good opinion conceiued cauſe addreſſe voyage hither altogether minded follow friendly counſell since perceiue good madame ſaid alfernao repoſe ſo great aſſurance fidelity ſhall perceiue platforme haue laid ſo knight sauage man preſent court emperour greece grandfather growne ſo amorous loue intendeth depart long time conſtantinople hath made himſelfe ſo aduenturous promiſe onely loue ſwéete saint forſake greateſt danger wherein one ſhall haue occaſion vſe vpon determined goe court hée remaineth proſtrating ſelfe emperour ſpéeches ſad pittifully couched beſide teares ſhall want grace matter earneſtly requeſt maieſty may pleaſure ſuccour affaire great importance whereout impoſſibly eſcape alſo helpe ſelfe whereout aide one beſt knight euen eſteemed hardieſt amongſt wil deſire may haue onely requeſt know hée denie ſhaddowing intent ſuch behauiour vertue well enough ſo preſent mée nephew florian eſtéemed moſt noble valiant amongſt hauing gotten conduct caſtle vpon frontier greeece hungarie abydeth ladie arlencea onely daughter vnto w • make knowne horrible ſhame knight hath doone ſhee ought take ſharpe vengeance hath offered ſo great famous iniurie without aide ſhall ſo eaſily execute ſumme enterpriſe muſt forget deliuer mee king hath power depriue ſences man put • ame vpon finger king cauſe one damoſels attendant daughter put hand knight preſently put finger faile bring receyue ſuch due reward ſhall thinke ſelfe ſufficiently contented withall collambra ioyfvlly returned anſwere deare friend alfernao know well remedy paſſed trauells vengeance child lyeth altogether accompliſh know ſhall thinke ſelfe euer beholding well may perſwade ſelfe doe beſtow paine ſhew ſelfe ingratefull towards intend follow aduiſe ſo compaſſe ſome meane may declare thankfulneſſe collambra preſently prepare ship wherein daughter embarqued accompanyed foure damoſells many knightes winde sea ſeruing ſo well fewe dayes tooke landing plaine farre caſtle ancient knight alfernao named damoſell arlencea wherein hee left companie tooke way court emperour greece whence ſubtill meanes haue hearde hee brought prince florian forreſt whome hée deliuered caſtle arlencea damoſell giant made abode hee vſed haue hearde declared alreadie nowe come wee place wée left giuing vnderſtand auncient knight next morning prouided coatch wherein much ſpeede could poaſted porte sea fearing leaſt way knight sauadgeman would knowne ſome arlencea imbarqued good knight marryners hoyſed theyr sayles hauing pleaſant gale winde committed themſelues mercie sea whereon intend leaue returne eſquyre knight sauadgeman fearing leaſt ancient knight would offer ſome iniurie lord maiſter failed take way hee iudged would bring conſtantinople hee trauelled firſt day fortune ſo vngentle hee could méete perſon demaund way next day paſſed ouerthwart forreſt perceiued vnder trée knight richly armed hauing shielde borne eſquire golden tyger field sinople wherevpon hee preſently rode eſquyre whome behelde knew syluian knight noble palmerin england whoſe preſence gaue eſquire aſſurance neuertheles teares trickling downe cheekes hee beganne prince manner lord albeit newes haue declare vnto brother maiſter prince florian bee ſo agreeable would yet muſt need report perſwaded remedy miſfortune chaunced diſcourſed whole circumſtance matter prince palmerin commaunded eſquyre bring preſently place lorde paſſed riuer goe caſtle ſtoode high rocke hée grieuouſly paſſionate well miſfortune happened brother alſo breaking voyage conſtantinople place earneſt affection called hee complained greatly fortune applye herſelfe hee thought ende onely breake determined purpoſes dayly preſenting continuall peril wherewith could meanes eſcape without great loſſe blood danger life theſe gréeuous agony fellowed eſquire vſing ſpeedy diligence might leaſt ſome ſhould offer brother diſcourteſie arriued caſtle next day euening tide eſquire ſhewed prince riuer could paſſe ſpeaking ſort may lord behold dangerous paſſage loſt knight sauage man noble maiſter word prince made anſwer curſed may firſt inuenters theſe cruell enchauntments extremitie whereof hath bene ouerthrow many good hardy knight hath made wretch • owards triumph miſfortune came downe riuer prince palmerin eſquire could finde beate prſſage yet man conuyed prince ouer reaſon whereof went along riuers ſide till came place water parted twaine entrance little iſle whereto prince prepared himſelfe goe ſounded depth foord knight couered armour skinne wilde beaſt ſlaine cryed aloud prince manner noble palmerin ſo hardy deſire paſſe ouer water farre déepe ſéemeth may ſuddenly fall vnrecouerable danger preuent counſell goe downe little along riuer ſide faile ſhew place may goouer moſt ſecuritie palmerin well noting word knight ſpake preſently ſtayed horſe maruailing knight ſhould laſt knew brother sage aliart whereupon came brother florians eſquire commanded goe conſtantinople ſtay preſence hinder diſpoſed conferre siluian faire polinarda tolde ſhould ſooner heare tydings maiſter court place eſquier would haue gladly kept prince palmerin company would wiſe ſuffer commaunded goe thoſe place might ſooneſt haue vnderſtanding lord ſo prince departed ſmall time came place riuer broade leſſe déepe knight • ried againe vnto might venture hardly becauſe ſureſt place paſſage prince ſtaied aſſurance knight word entred riuer ſo déepe paſſed ouer eaſily rigor water hauing power hurt prince ſo recouered ſide ſafe ſoundly knight perceiuing came offered himſelfe take princeſſe horſe would ſuffer alighting came embraced knight theſe word ſhould thinke lord brother ſo friendly come ſuccour greateſt néede certainely may aſſure ſelfe florian brother ſhall deliuered preſent danger meanes ſo great authoritie furniſhed ſo high ſingular knowledge gratious lord anſwered sage aliart cuſtome make account miſchance may happen becauſe imagine knightly proweſſe able aduantage euery attempt pray time forſake ſuch opinion ſelfe perſwaded florian brother great danger looſing life hartily ſory fortune would ſuffer finde place ſo haue gained knowledge peruſing bookes knight cauſe forſake emperor court bring hither caſtle rendring handes damoſell giant daughter collambra mother giant calfurnien camboldam brocalon baleato brother florian haue ſlaine ſéemes ſaid prince palmerin ſhould forſake caſtle prepare ſelues towards profound iſle embarque ſelues trie fortune ſo much fauour v permit v recouery feare ſome miſfortune come already feare whereof confoundeth extreame griefe whereto sage aliart thus replyed lord neceſſary ſhould goe trifle time profound iſle florian loſt greateſt hazard come vnto v wherefore thinke moſt conuenient doe endeuour ſéeke foorth ſparing day night trauaile take courſe another way wherein vſe ſuch diligence aduenture life beléeue wel anſwered prince ſpare aduice may thing profite brother therefore determined follow counſell wherevpon rid away ſpéedily vntill came two ſundry wayes cauſed part one another ceaſed trauell earneſtly loſſe prince florian ſo grieuous chap xiii happened knight tiger following ſearch prince florian forreſt brother palmerin sage aliart hauing taken farewell one another rode way fortune conducted prince himſelfe trauailed night deſire helpe brother would ſuffer take reſt horſe began waxt ſtrackt féeble reaſon excéeding great labour ſo prince conſtrained vſe ſpéech siluian thou ſéeſt well truſty friend ſeruant fortune hath ſet ſelfe directly againſt yet ſhould giue ouer preſent enterpriſe ſhould blemiſh credite perpetuall infamie therefore intend take horſe whereon thou rideſt ſend thée away mine able hold long vnto néereſt port sea thou canſt finde thou maiſt take ſhipping profound iſle time paſt belonged giant brauorant father giant calfurnien faile ſend aduertiſe thée whole eſtate iourney time afford contrary ſucceſſe trauaile fall ſo vnfortunate newes ſhall ſéeme gréeuous irkeſome thée deſire thee goe conſtantinople giue lady miſtreſſe polinarda vnderſtand cannot make account ſelfe looſing lampe loadſtone life depriued ſame muſt néeds knit vp conclude trauailes moreouer thou ſhalt aſſure ſum felicitie conſiſteth thing remembraunce gatious ſelfe contentment alwaies receiue thinking long haue liued languiſhing loue ſo déepely imprinted ſoule able put flight thoſe feares earneſtnes deſire compaſſe time preſent vnto death hath depriued meane whereby life alwayes ſuſtained haue remedie whereby comfort afflicted heart onely contentment receiue paſſions hauing remembrance ſwéete ſhe whoſe ſake liue ſuffer come ſo paſſe hurtfull plannets diſplaced remembred acceptable opinion lady ſhall commit forgetfulneſſe angry ſtormes hitherto hath euen weather beaten fainting ſpirit giuen courſe thouſand calamity fall vpon aſſure thée accident whatſoeuer haue power endamage ſo long ſouleis ſet worke contemplate rare ſingularities wherewith diuine ſpirit aſſociated theſe ſpirits reſecued ioyne together familiaritie mine ſhall little triumph thought wr • thy offer ſeruice ſo taketh occaſion behold ſhall finde wit ſuperficially metamorphiſed ſo attending long expected honour felicitie know poſſible liue abſent heauenly preſence remember time paſt haue often vſed behold delicate face fo farre happy meane griefe encreaſeth ſo aboundantly thinkes death good pleaſuce would bring forth laborinth reſtleſſe deſires therefore deſire thee siluian preſent vnſpotted faith aſſure firme ſtedfaſt loyaltie conſidered truth moone pittie ceaſeleſſe trauailes none aliue onely endure yea endure ſuch extreamitie beyond iudgement perceiue becauſe danger ſo doubtful haue enterpriſed neither haue aſſurance truſt vnto hope returne ſuch troubleſome aduenture deſire thée faithfull ſeruant lady thou haſt bene loued ſo déerely ſo thou mayſt happen vpon honourable recompence either vttermoſt power giue thée comming ſo paſſe little content hath proued ſo loyall iuſt faith ought reſpected ſuch vncertaine reward left inheritour tea • e torment ſatiſfaction ſo honeſt truſtie ſeruice cannot thinke lady polinarda ſhall conſider honorable obeyſance wherewith haue dayly hourely regarded thy vnfained ſeruice hath thought ſo well ſhe ſhew ſelfe gratious reſpectiue thée well witneſſe owne princely nature alſo remembring thy vertuous loyall deſerts thy angry starres ſo much repine thy happy welfare ſhe ſeemeth daintie knowledge thée good siluian let ſéeme ſtrange thee thou beareſt part thy maiſter miſfortune ſhe neuer fauouring muſt neceſſitie frowne thée • vnkind dealing may mooue thee thus iudge ſhe wedded affection ſome muſt ioyne happy content deſerued haue vnhappy trauailes thus breaking dolorous complaint remained ſo gréeuouſly afflicted ſpirit teares aboundantly trickled downe chéekes rendered certaine teſtimony troubled heart willing diſſemble leſt siluian ſhould perceiue gaue horſe ſpurs without word departed thence leauing siluian ſo mightily ouercome heauineſſe conſtrained earth ſomewhat pacified himſelfe mounted maiſters horſe doubted would bring profound iſle becauſe bene ſo ſore trauailed already lord maiſter good eſquire riding ſad penſiuely laſt ſpyed two knight knew deuices shéelds armor prince berold platir called deſired might pleaſe ſtay little whereupon knight knew preſently ſtaied abaſhed ſée ſo badly horſed perceiued teares run downe chéekes began doubt ſome harme made demand maiſter alſo happened caſe lord anſwered siluian know well reſolue demand though report ſo agréeable could wiſh diſcouered miſfortune prince florian lord ridden giue ſuccour aduenture ſo dangerdus ſaid siluian wherein lord muſt aſſiſt brother life ſtand extreame hazard helpe according would beſide doubtfull ſhall come late becauſe horſe hardly hold word platir thus replyed siluian lord ſo fortunate hath finiſhed ſuch rare incredible aduentures perſwaded deliuer danger brother hardy florian forreſt therefore content thy ſelfe power end ſuch noble exploit hath done ſure cannot faile preſent occaſion departure prince florian truſt little offend aduertiſed without preſent aide danger loſt companion faile follow becauſe againſt reaſon looſe ſo good knight go place tell v prince palmerin hath commanded ſhall likewiſe heare tidings v ſo ſoone ſhall poſſibly haue commoditie ſend prince platir vpon theſe word tooke leaue siluian companion rid away haſtily ſucceſſe iourney leaue remembring forget knight tiger departed siluian made ſuch diſpatch way length came little village seacoaſt entred venetian gally paſſe sea iſland collambra much famed abroad reaſon giant poſſeſſed ſame aſſuring veſſell whatſoeuer might take landing time theſe giant liued becauſe crueltie ſo inſupportable durſt arriue iſle galley came neare vnto iſland conſtrained rowe cloſe ſhoare becauſe winde ſo ſore vpon two dayes greatly hindered third day likewiſe wind aroſe ſo extreame violent mariner iudged middeſt winter could 〈◊〉 rigorous ſo driuen certaine place diuerſe ship glad auoide troubleſome tempeſt taken anker one theſe ship sage aliart ſore paſſionate leaſt ſome miſfortune ſhould happen florian forreſt brother neuertheleſſe hée receiued ſome comfort beholding veſſels hoping fortune might ſo fauourable albeit winde ſo contrarie nauigation might yet happen vpon ſome coaſt might happily bring together iſland collambra knight tiger vnderſtanding sage aliart alſo acquainted aduiſe receiued great contentation minde becauſe tempeſt endured day left galley contenting maiſter thereof paine came one thoſe ſhips hauen would goe veſſell sage aliart doubted leaſt together would hinderance ſeuerall determination hee conſidering farre different prince berolde platir likewiſe arriued entending beare palmerin sage aliart company voyage vnderſtood prince palmerin deſired trauaile without company embarqued themſelues sage aliart ſetting forth hauen together kept company ſight one another vntill darke night ſeparate aſunder winde riſing againe kept ſhort time ſo farre aloofe one cleane loſt fight land yet ſailed couragiouſly dreading furie winde rough billowes water mercy whereof intend commit courſe hiſtory willeth v returne redoubted knight sauage man conducted collambra order haue told commaundement ailencea damoſell giant ſayled ſuch ſpéedy pace sea pleaſure greater ſpeake ſhée cuſtodie knight sauage man whome ſhée thoſe bare company foure dayes ſoure night ſo fauoured winde weather came within ſight iſland proude gianteſſe colambra made reſidence whoſe handes fortune would ſuffer fall knight sauage man raiſed ſuddenly ſuch mightie tempeſt doubt caſt away little houre caſt ſo farre iſland pilot could iudge countrey winde driuen reaſon whereof marriners remained ſo far quietneſſe could tell saint ſhould commend themſelues preſent ſuccour arleneea perceiued ſudden alteration ſhée likewiſe ſo inwardly vexed ſhe wiſhed ſhe neuer ſéene prince florian ſhe none company could promiſe ayde except alfernao hée ſo worne age could leſſe helpe ſhe beganne encourage pilot defend cauſing marriners make expedition al vaine heart ſo faint ſtomackes ſo failed ſeeing ſo great danger trouble towards ayde ſhould haue giuen remedy doubtfull trouble account vnderſtanding forſake ſo amazedly knew way helpe peril extant eye alfernao ſéeing mariner ſo heart came arlencea theſe word madame deſire abaſh ſelfe aſſurance excellency conſiſteth liues miſfortune hath come vpon v hapneth cuſtomably frequent ſeas though ſee water ſo rough impatient moment ſhall ſée calme enough againe wherefore pray come forth chamber end pilot mariner may behold perſwaded ſéeing receiue freſh encouragement order tell ye alfernao endeuour himſelfe friendly counſell much lay cauſe forget fearefull motion arlencea requeſt alfernao came preſently chamber ſhe beheld y• furiouſneſſe water ſometime liſting ship vp heauen throwing downe againe depth hell water likewiſe beating aboundantly heart would ſerue kéepe mariner longer company ſhe went againe chamber ſo full diſpaire fearefull frightings able ſuſtaine ſelfe ſhe laid downe vpon pillow betwéene two damoſels wéeping bitterly ſhe entred theſe ſpéeches ſée well alfernao ſmall recompence ſhall receiue enterpriſe ſuch déeds diſhonourable far dutie beléeue certainely diuine power determined puniſh v great iniury diſloyaltie offer ſéeking death good hardy knight ſlue brother one another plaine fight offering taking aduantage hautie derds albeit cannot let paſſe without great maruell yet make verily thinke fought good lawfull cauſe deſpiſed exceeding crueltie tyranny wherein proud preſumptuous brother liued diſorder life rightly chaſtiſed proweſſe knight ſet ſelues againſt reaſonable regard iudgement practiſe death well forgetfull ſift iuſtneſſe cauſe goe depriue good knight life reuenge whoſe innocencie wrathfull anger heauens fallen vpon v wherefore auoyde flie extremitie betime leaſt wee fall woorſe inconuenience reſolued chaunge angrie moode thinking better take ring cauſed ſléepe ſo ſoundly thus abide ſharpe countenance wreakefull power whome whether muſt obey arlencea hauing ſpoken pleaſed commanded chamber doore opened knight sauadgeman lay ſhe taken ring hee good eſtate hee yet without great maruell himſelfe perceiued ſhip sea ſo compaſſed faire damoſells wept verie grieuouſly ſee themſelues ſo great daunger prince amazement came foorth chamber ſaw furious waues water toſſe turmoyle barke pilot marriners euery one ship theyr hart dead becauſe • hey knew way helpe themſelues wherupon beganne noble word chéere encourage extream feare generally conceyued cauſed make ſmall eſtimation word abaſhed eſpecially ſée himſelfe ſuch place leaſt parte thought haue come came ſo embarqued caſtle damoſells came entertained ſo exceeding friendly gate thereof ſtrange aduenturs made oftentimes deſirous demund ſort chanced thither danger hee ſaw imminent eye would affoord ſo much leiſure compelled ſettle thoughtes neceſſarie marriners often int • eaty friendly behauiour prince began ſomewhat comfort themſelues beheld hee went chamber arlencea ſitting downe hée beganne ſpéeches order madame would might intreate forſake thoſe fearfull paſſions regarde eſtéemeth maruellous well diuine beautie tempeſt beginneth little little looſe force therefore let perſwaſion ſomewhat appeaſe theſe teares wherewith offend gratious countenance grieuous beholde bootleſſe ſo much hurt ſelfe arlencea hearing courteous language prince noting withall ſéemely countenance reioyced ſhee ſo ſpared life intreatie alfernao malicious reuenge ſhe ſought changed againe good opinion loue whereat knight sauadgeman well pleaſed alfernao remained moſt grieuouſly paſſionate knowing well enterpriſe could come good ende night ſpent breake day tempeſt calmed pilote gaue vnderſtand arriued coaſt spaine word diſpleaſed alfernao hearing ſate vttering ſilent complaint himſelfe pilote diſcouered cittie malaga helde kept turkes prince tooke arlencea hand led foorth hatch ſhew land cauſing ſit downe deſired ſhe would report vnto manner brought shippe wherein ſlept ſo long without knowledge himſelfe worthie syr aunſwered arlencea ſo ſhall pleaſe let former angrie occaſions paſſe pardon ſay knightly courteſie ſhall reſolued earneſt deſire therewith aſſuring loue hath brought mee ſuch eſtate hath mooued ſuch forcible affection mée towardes ſo conceale iote trueth ſhée recounted large whole enterpriſe collambra aged knight alfernao whoſe treaſon ſo aſtoniſh prince hee brake foorth theſe ſpéeches madame deſire wherewith came doe ſeruice deſerue vnkinde dealing wherewith haue vſed ſince ſo trauaile hath béene imployed vaine deſire affoord ſo much fauour report guile whereby alfarnao brought hither knowe perſwaded commit cruelty mother ſhould ſo great towardes nothing would content death let offend goe chamber arme ſelfe becauſe compell theſe company vnder obeyſance may perſwade ſelfe forget gentleneſſe trauaile whatſoeuer maintaine excellency ſo bound good deſertes whereto arlencea thus replyed lord deſire conſider ſingular courteſie ioyned vnfained good beare cauſed mee diſcouer damnable treaſon intended againſt thought vnkind could find hart ſubmit ſelfe recompence whereof deſire would remember ſhall onely looſe preſence collambra mother likewiſe patrimony alſo ſhall receiue ſuch common bruite ill report euery one wound malicious ſpéech yéelding ſelfe hand haue ſo cruelly ſlaine brother madame anſwered florian pray forget remembrance looſing mother fauour ſuch opinion regard good may happen fortune fauour worſe ſhe hath done wil faile make double requit kindneſſe may repoſe better aſſurance word proteſt ſelfe commandement meane time florian ſpent time talke vnderſtood shippe went ſome enterpriſe againſt meanes whereof left arlencea ſhe followed chamber helpe arme ere girded himſelfe mayle coate alfernao foure company came chamber doore lay hand miſſed purpoſe florian comming maine ſtrength thruſt foorth chamber theſe wordes time come alfernao wherein thy traiterous dealing ſhall worthily recompenced lifting vp ſword haue ſmitten fiue ſtepped defended wherewith prince ſo much mooued beſturd himſelfe ſo among two quickly tumbled feete two ſéeing knowing ſmall pittie florian would ſhewe tooke heart afreſh came prince aſſailing couragiouſly laying treaſon olde alfernao gaue ſuch cruell terrible ſtrokes cut arme one hard ſhoulder fourth feare glad leape sea alfernao ſeeing life brought ſo great danger came humbled himſelfe arlencea manner madame vnfained loue haue alwayes vſed ſeruice mother ſelfe deſerueth gratious reſpect neceſſary affoord loyaltie ought recompenced hath worthily merited deſire intreate fauour knight word knowe may preuaile ſo much anger pacified life ſaued damoſell giant ſo amazed noble proweſſe prince ſhe knew addreſſe ſelfe mooue intreatance quandarie power anſwere alfernao yet fulfill requeſted neither would florian deale extreamely wiſh ſéeing knées arlencea whoſe ſake thus began truſt madame alfernao good fortune render himſelfe haue power preſerue life contrary deſerts ſhould goe vttermoſt arlencea maruellouſly eſtéem great humanitie prince vſed alfernao commaundement put ſure guard fearing leaſt ſhould practiſe treaſon prince beganne eſtéeme well arlencea according honeſt vertuous nature deſerued well laudable bountie gentle minde alſo vſing ſo kindly ſhe done albeit ſubiect voluptuous pleaſure yet beholding chaſt regard damoſell ſelfe ſhe bridled affection determined beſtow wife great friend giant ant dramuſiande iudged part friend wiſh ſuch one friend hee knew acquainted vertue chaſtitie ſubdue wicked deſire himſelfe ſhould mooue violate faith friend damoſell ſelfe albeit ſhe preferred noble behauiour knight sauage man worthy vttermoſt ſtraine abilitie yet ſhe eſpeciall regard honour knowing chiefeſt ornament make eſtéemed therefore ſhee behaued ſelfe diſcréetely wiſely gayning good commendation knewe hiſtorie hereafter declare vnto chap xv happened knight sauage man come land wheu noble prince florian thus vanquiſhed alfernao companion ſo neare ſhore determined goe land wherevpon commaunded pilote drawe ſhore preſently landing hauen belonging recinde king spaine reſted themſelues certaine dayes becauſe arlencea damoſels ſomewhat ſickly trauile alfernao deſired knight sauage man would giue leaue returne owne country ſéeing arriued place aſſurance little néeded feare danger demaund prince ſhaped anſwer wel aſſured alfernao court conſtantinople greatly troubled meanes therefore intend ſhall depart whither elſe haue ſworne go emperour againe let vnderſtand hath happened time falſe teares made forſake court euen vntill infrant came hither may well enough without feare puniſhment emperour lay becauſe clemency farre greater thy euill deſerts ſooth ſhall neuer laid thy charge reſpect great good beare madame arlencea whoſe friendly pittie hath deepely bound deliuering perill wherein malice hath craftily caught euen may large declare vnto emperour lord ſayd alfernao libertio ſo highly eſtéemed ſo greatly deſired well acquainted ſometimes deſire recouerit ſo wilfull forgo maketh put life great ieopardie ſeeing himſelfe brought ſuch miſhappe commeth ſuch ſort repen thimſelfe wiſheth rather continuall ſeruitude haue liberty looſe order fareth time deſirous liue thraldome content obey noble commandement yet without feare ſome inconuenience ſuch hope haue emperours bountie truſt pardoned heinous offence wherein haue diſpleaſed imperiall maieſtie comming arlencea ſaid madame bethinke ſelf ſhal pleaſe cō mand mother ſo fall y• happen place ſhe word arlencea replied thus may giue vnderſtand thinke neceſſary ſhe become friend knight sauage man ſhe deſire ſhould remaine obedient daughter requeſt ſhe would forget death brother ſeeking reuenge loſſe ſhe cannot otherwiſe doe cut daughter life may well aſſure ſhe refuſe graunt requeſt ſhe ſhall henceforth neuer ſée haue yéelded ſelfe obey commandement knight sauage man doth ſuch honor eſteeme greateſt good fortune euer could come conducting emperours court ſhall acquainted gratious behauiour diuers noble vertuous prince likewiſe ſhal learne amend vnciuil condition ſeeing rare quality vſed renowmed court madame anſwered knight sauage man ſée good vertuous minde cannot chuſe conceiue great contentment ſhall fortune come court ſhall perceiue well thinke meane time render ſome aſſurance ſay pray thée alfarnao report emperour good mind thru diddeſt leaue lady arlencea humbly requeſt maieſty ſhe may lawfully receiue baptiſme end empreſſe may beſtow ſuch lordly care vertuous qurlities doth well deſerue alfernao promiſed fulfill whole commandement ſo tooke leaue able endure ſight amiable courteſie arlencea vſed knight sauage man ſoiourned pretty ſpace prouided neceſſary thing trauaile becauſe intented ride countrey ſhew eſtate thereon arlencea damoſels thing readineſſe ſet forward faire company firſt day ſomewhat towards euening arriued within faire goodly valley well furniſhed trées comming neare pleaſant fountaine eſpied two ſeuerall tent pitched farre beheld foure damoſelles walking recreation vnder gréene trées ſhroud themſelues parching heate sunne vpon occaſion arlencea thus ſpake prince iudge amiſſe good sir theſe damoſels coniecture receine farre greater pleaſure frée contentation haue put libertie hand maketh ſmall account thereof prince made ſhew though vnderſtood arlencea ſaid wherefore change preſent fantaſie procéeded intire loue ſhe bare familiar talke paſſed away time vntill came ſomewhat neare tent rich faire could deuiſed florian ſtood ſtill taking pleaſure behold damoſell came vſed conference thinkes thing ſtrange sir knight one man ſhould take vpon conduct fiue damoſelles cannot chuſe great charge whereof ſomething eaſe ſo ſhall like follow counſell ſhall diſaduantage wherto prince thus anſwered albeit cannot thinke ill courteous ſpéeches wherewith kindly come ſalute yet ſhall perſwade thing except accompanied vertue honeſtie therefore deſire ſatiſſfie mée opinion ſtanding reaſon ſhall faile follow one would willingly diſobey good counſell content ſaide damoſell demaund wherefore ſhall vnderſtand foure damolles garded foure knight long come hither whome pleaſe may try ouſt ſhall happe vanquiſhed muſt neceſſitie deliuer lady muſt content doe like fortune denie fauour victorie ſhe reſpect friendly eye allowe happy conquerour foure ſhall deliuered cannot greater hinderance vnto conducting nine lady theſe fiue ſide fortune throwe diſcountenance commit knight vanquiſhed foure theſe lady muſt taken fift ſhall ſuffered enioy ſtill thus ſée ouſt cannot way diſagréeable way ſo euer happens cannot lacke pleaſure profite gentlewoman anſwered knight sauage man ſéeme ſo well acquainted gentle behauior gaine ieopard aduenture looſe ſelfe promiſe thinke time long vntill haue made conqueſt whereto damoſell made anſwere pray ſir doe thinke ſhall purchaſe v ſo lightly deſire haue defend thoſe lady conduct hardly permit ſpéed ſo ſoone ſuch hardy valour ſhall finde thoſe knight haue attempted defend v damoſell ſooner ended word dwarfe néere hand vnderneath trée began ſound trumpet ſo high note brought gallant eccho whole valley prince looking aſide eſpied foure knight come prauncing along valley armed white gréene armour helmet richly gilded vpon faire garland flower shield eſquires brought portraited ſiluer swannes field sinoble come place damoſell talked prince ſhe rehearſed vnto cōmunication paſſed whervpon one thus anſwered madame ſo may pleaſure feare aduenture danger would loath ſo vnhappy looſe without might expect greater profit happen would willingly depriued life abide ſuch hard irkſome extremitie forced commit cuſtodie another deſirous kéepe ſelfe truſt ſir anſwered damoſell ſéeke thus excuſe ſelfe word would wlllingly endure iouſt proue falſe word knight lady beare company greatly beholding ſéeing aduenture triall ſo worthily himſelfe againſt v haue one knight defend madame ſaid knight gentleman eſtéemeth great trouble burdened ſo many lady therefore would willingly vanquiſhed might diſcharged ſo ſéeking ſhun ſmall occaſions harme ſteppeth maze greater danger whereto prince gaue anſwer truly ſir farre meaning ſo farre giue vnderſtand onely entend guard theſe damoſels compnny diſburden thoſe foure lady preſume defend carrie away manfully behaue ſelfe behalfe truely ſhall much diſpleaſed woont make account victory except may atchieue great loſſe blood well ſir anſwered knight ſeeing deſire make valor ſeene theſe lady prepare ſelfe entertaiue word clapt downe beuer helmet hauing couched lance fetcht courſe againſt knight sauage man welcommed brauely albeit knight brak lance worthily yet ſuch rough charge prince gaue conſtrained meaſure length earth ſo greatly amazed fall lay good ſpace without mouing himſelfe meane knight sauage man came damoſell talked ſpeaking manner perceiue madame knight able kéepe hath enterpriſed defend wherefore pray diſcharge ſelfe promiſe ſaid ſhould enioy reaſon cuſtome appointed word damoſell framed reply haue done dnty ſo well like approued knight armes might worthily apprehended ingratitude ſhould withhold haue ſo well deſcrusd therefore ſince lot hath firſt fallen knight enterpriſe defend ſubmit ſelfe deſiring would entertaine among theſe ladyes requeſt make requitall miſfortune hath thus vnluckily loſt prince fauourably reſpected damoſell would haue made anſwer ſecond knight cryed ſhould prepare himſelfe whereupon ſet ſpurres horſes encountred ſuch valour trunchions ſpeares flew vp gallantly aire comming againe ſecond triall prince gaue knight ſuch forcible ſtroke threw earth one leg broken two knight ſéeing great diſhonour fellowes receiued doubting ſhould ſpéed better themſelues ran together againſt knight sauage man dealt diſcourteouſly yet power vnhorſe ſo ſoone could gaine opportunitie béeing loath truſt much gentlenes alighted horſe drawing ſword came theſe word indeed gentleman haue gotten aduantage two ſo diſhonourably aſſaile one onely knight yet cannot diſcourage purchaſing lady haue depart ſhall haue beſt blood helly word one knight made anſwer cannot tell thing may fall haue theſe ladyes ſhall buy hand ſo déerely liue ſhall know price ſo alighted horſes running furiouſly knight sauage man entertained ſuch braue ingenious ſleights fight ſhort time one knight able hold longer conſtrained fall princeſſe féete knight perceiued ſaw life brought ſuch extremitie put foorth himſelf nobly defend ſtrokes wherwith knight sauage man charged deuoire bring vnder obeyſance knight began iouſt ſitten great anger ſéeing fellowes maiſtred proweſſe hardy knight sauage man great danger wherein endured combate came ſword drawne aſſiſt prince ſéeing ready yéeld tooke heart freſh fellowes company redoubled ſtrokes vpon ſayd would gladly ſuccor would come helpe knight end victory ſhall obtaine might yéeld larger eſtimation renowne might likewiſe make knowne theſe ladyes beantie ought reſerued thoſe knight vertuous better defend briefe ſuch preweſſe prince towards one knight ſore wounned fell downe earth ſight whereof ſo grieued ranne fell downe lady deſiring ſhield surie prince ſmiling ſee behauiour knight entred theſe ſpeeches sir knight haue taken vp hoſtage place good aſſurance otherwiſe would giue thee ſuch recompence thy malicious difloyall ſtomacke deſerueth comming lady began order faire lady deſire would mount ſelues vpon palfrays would willingly place leſt remembrance ill hap theſe knight cauſe forgetfull honeſt promiſe made began iouſt ſooth worthy sir anſwered one damoſels hard put memory ſlender vnhappy fortune could withſtand force one knight becauſe haue deſerued ſo well ſubmit ſelues moſt willingly worthy ſelfe diſpoſe v ſhall ſeeme beſt iudgement humbly deſiring vertue blemiſhed inordinate meane oftentimes happeneth lady great diſhonour late recouer againe ſuch eſpeciall iewell loſt lady anſwered knight sauage man accuſtomed vſe diſcourteſie ſexe eſpecially make account ſuch miſfortune haue well deſerued due recompence farre enough taking one horſes vanquiſhed knight rid away lady leauing knight tent remember great loſſe ſuſtained thus depriued gratious lady eſquires rid merrily reioycing werein cuſtody noble aduenterous knight sauageman chap xvi aduentures chanced knight sauage man conducting theſe lady king spaines court happened knight tiger voyage profound iſle knight sauage man left valley vanquiſhed foure knight determined iourney realme spaine glad ſo worthily accompanied lady intending let vnderſtand eſtimation made ſingular beauty indéed ſo pleaſing eye willingly could haue afforded point courteſie damoſell giant arlencea regard promiſe wherein bound himſelfe beſide cauſed qualifie amorous humour becauſe friend dramuſiande ſuch account made hee would leuell ſo pleaſant perhaps company ſhewed himſelfe merry iocond ſo laſt hée tooke helmette gaue eſquier damoſelles beholding faire vſage youthfull comely withall ſeuerally fell ſo good opinion dapper boy goddeſſe citherea hauing ſomewhat touched repented wordes ſpake firſt humbled themſelues vnto prince behaued himſelfe gratiouſly becauſe would haue malice growe either ſide damoſels brought forth valley procéeded earneſt conference wit whence wherefore remained company thoſe knight ſo nobly vanquiſhed damoſels modeſt countenance returned prince anſwere moſt worthy ſir witneſſe regard haue dutifull affection wherewith honour preſume behalfe reſt ſatiſfie preſent demaund ſhall therefore vnderſtand first theſe damoſels named armelia ſecond iulianda third sabelia ſelfe called artiſia one citie farre valley called arſeda wherein thoſe foure knight whereof two brother ſo twaine yet ſo allied together couzins one another made abode deſirons doe v ſeruice might thereby time marry v becauſe wee ſhould miſſe ſo great honour mariage licence mother came oftentimes recreate ſelues fountaine perceiued neere tent found v would knightes vſually take delight féede eye ſuch pleaſant ieſtes déedes could daily attempt forreſt moreouer might better perſwaded loue would offer iouſt knight paſſed valley ſummoning thereto dwarffe ſounded trumpet aſſuring alwaies conquerours vntil time fortune made vnhappy noble valliant proweſſe ladyes anſwered knight sauage man great ſhame looſe fortune happy victory hath deliuered hand wherefore promiſe forſake vntill ſome knight bring ſuch extremitie ſhall deſtitue power ſufficient defend beleeue bardly vanquiſh ſubmitteth himſelfe ſo earneſtly direction thus much doe beſide conduct king spaines court bring likewiſe ſée caſtle giant almaroll afterward ſhall finde ſo conuenient leaue company content let depart owne pleaſure damoſelles vpon motion deſired earneſtly would bring thoſe place promiſed nature woman deſire ſée nouelties arlencea inflamed ſelfeſame deſire forward moouing requeſt yet ſhe feared leaſt company theſe damoſelles would alter prince former determination ſhée néeded caſt ſuch doubt prince reſolute ſhe could wiſh thus iourneyed till night came vpon went caſtle néere hand friendly entertained prince cauſed good attendance bée vſed ladyes ſo heare leaue togither hiſtory willes v procéed tell knight tiger fiftéene day imbarqued came within ſight profound iſle pilot knew well ſo gaue prince palmerin vnderſtand ſet ſhoare moſt conuenient place could find committing god good fortune knight tiger rode vifite profound iſle ſeemed pleſant fertile night ſuddenly hindering conſtrained alight foote mountaine ſuffered horſe refreſh himſelfe began mourne lacke company approoued friend siluian whoſe preſence agréeable well remembrance nouriſhed alſo fwéete louing counſell would giue extreme grief heauineſſe becauſe knew beſt comfort thus want company conſtrained paſſe night among gréene leaues vſing helmet pillow vnder head toſt tumbled vnquietly night vntill cleare morning chaſed away vncomfortable darkeneſſe aroſe mounting horſebacke rode heauy penſiue yet ſomewhat comforted pleaſantneſſe iſle iudged worthy peopled ly waſt deſolate euening tide came little iſland compaſſed ſtrong wals iſland entred tooke vp lodging houſe ancient knight accuſtomed giue entertainment ſuch knight beſtowed time ſéeking aduenturesand becauſe ſaw knight tiger without eſquire attending came tooke horſe himſelfe afterward helped vnarme vſing ſo great humanity poſſible knight tiger glad friendly entertainment deſired informed hoſt cuſtomes manner countrey ſo riſen supper repoſed himſelfe little requeſted hoſt tell ihat iſland belonged maners cuſtomes thereof might report place came demand ancient knight hoſt made anſwer lord came good time reſolued perceiue ignorant béene fortune come hither little ſooner ſwéeteſt time yeares life would haue béene great danger ſhall vnderſtaud long time ſince giant named brauorant cruell lord poſſeſſor iſland delighted ſet ſpies port informe knight damoſels arriue iſland ſuch happened come would vſe extreame cruelly knight would depriue liues damoſels would villanouſly force afterward ſend away ſtarke naked diſpoyled rich coſtly cloathing purpoſe kept great company vaſſayles nothing elſe imploy themſelues following wicked humor merchant fortune came caſt anker iſle vaſſailes would compell ranſome themſelues great extremitie would ſuffer depart hence chanced find fault tyranny refuſed pay ranſome knew laide without right reaſon would murther put ſome villainous death heauenly power ſeeing great oppreſſion crueltie bloody minded helhound continually vſed chiefly towards neuer offended diuine prouidence thought good cut ſuch tyrant ſo fortuned giant died whoſe ſoule thinke carried place vnnaturall déeds deſerued haue recompence could imploy life better thus dying left behind foure ſons iſſue thing compared giant father two eldeſt ſons named calfurnien combaldam content liue ſo ſmal teuenues iſland yéelded went inhabit another country albeit thus departed hence ſupreme authoritie would long ſuffer liue vnſupportable crueltie tyranny made diſpatch curſed liues hand one onely knight called report hath blazed knight sauage man ſo named beareth figured ſhield sauage man may haue better knowledge knight haue ſuch one ſéeme cannot chuſe acquainted thoſe noble mindes imploy themſelues ſéeking hautie aduentures whereby fame thundered whole world two brother nouriſhed iſland vnder mother wing againſt whoſe iudged themſelues able endure armor determined depart hence reuenge death brother calfurnien camboldam earneſt deſire gone would ſuffer tary longer taking ſhipping away went ſpent great time bloody horrible life predeceſſours ſpent ſéeking aforenamed knight sauage man ſo fell good hardy knight himſelfe chanced come entred combate behaued himſelfe ſo worthily againſt likewiſe ended liues two giant whoſe death deliuered inhabitant countrey dwelled great deale feare trouble ſo iudged knight ordained onely meane defend miſerable afflicted people life flauiſh ſeruitude wherein remained long time cruel giant mother theſe merciles hellhound named called collambra could long endure ſorrow ſhe ſuffered death child wherfore ſhe practiſed compaſſed deuiſes ſhe could wherby get knight sauage man cuſtody ſhe might ſpéede better cloſe intent ſhe ioyned magitian friend one loued well named alfernao gone emperor court conſtantinople hauing ten day allowed accōpliſh intent worke ſo craftily wel y• knight sauage man muſt brought hither becauſe occaſion ſhal want may helpe way damoſell giant named arlencea daughter collambra accompanied certaine nūber knight damoſels ioyned company enchauntor vpon whoſe promiſes ſuch aſſurance made knight sauage man ſhall bée brought hither great hope cruell collambra hath reuenge deuilliſh good knight ſhe gone citie foure league diſtance hence accompanied great many friend alſo one brother though young yet maruailous bloody cruell reputed eſpeciall knight armes alſo giant named eſponuautable hath conuerted countrey great cruelty gouerned giant brauorant cruell ſpeake vprightly brauorant altogether ſo terrible hee lately named wherefore hartily pray good knight sauage man fall hand giant neither treaſon may preuaile laide ancient knight knitting vp tale ſigh knight tiger thus began good friend hard eſcape daunger fortune hath determined fall ſéeing ſo could wiſh ſhe would ſuffer brother colambra ſéeke reuenge death nephew perhappes might fall handes hath good puniſh wicked life make knowe deſert crueltie well kindred hath taſted knight sauage man hée one knowe well hope wil eſcape hand enemy one reſerued bring end many worthy hauty aduentures wherefore reſpect hee eſpeciall good friend deſire know certaintie haue rehearſed ſpéede ill cannot take quietly therefore becauſe wil ſatiſfy mind determined morrow morning goe ſeeke giant doubting fortune fauour repay wicked euill deſerts ſuch recompence méete ſuch offender ſée well syr anſwered ancient knight ignorant giant force preſuming ſo combate ala sir hée make account enterpriſe ten ſuch came waged fight therefore cannot chuſe miſlike iudgement one repute enterpriſe rather want diſcretion vpon good ſound aduiſe knight tiger tooke good part councell hoſt laboured haue follow yet intend ruled ſo hoſt talked indifferent ſpace withdrew himſelfe chamber tooke reſt better done night reioyced greatly brother florian yet arriued alſo himſelfe ready helpe ſo hée brought cruell collambra morning taken leaue courteous hoſte hée departed follow hée intended comming forreſt ſhould trauaile citie collambra made aboade heard roaring noyſe sea made whereto would néedes goe ſée could eſpy veſſell wherein knight sauage man brother might imbarqued rode towards sea coaſt hée heard great bruit noyſe ſomewhat néere riding forward ſée might bée eſpyed shippe lying anker hard tenne knight belonging collambra mother arlencea maintaining firce combate againſt thrée knightes ſo ſoone ſéene knew platir berolde sage aliard obſcure valley put liues hazard onely giue ſuccour knight sauage man ſight mooued ſomewhat reioyce till ſuddenly aſtoniſhed againe beholding paſt twentie pace theſe knight fought combate giant maruellous ſtature armed rich coſtly armour cried kill murder thoſe thrée knight preſumed make ſuch reſiſtaunce ſo hacked hewed enemy one tumbled ſide another ſide moſt dangerouſly wounded giant ſéeing beganne waxe meruailous worth himſelfe mounting horſebacke came giue ayde knight knight tiger perceiuing fearing leaſt arriuall would hurtful three deare friend poaſted till came ſaluted giant theſe word art thou aſhamed eſpouuantable offer thy ſelfe againſt thou ſéeſt ſore wounded haue ſcantly power defend themſelues let alone addreſſe thy ſelfe mortall enemy came ſéeke thée would deliuer vnfortunate iſle thy cruell bloody tiranny giant ſtayed behold ſummoned combat ſuch braue manner perceiuing bare golden tiger shield hée knewe preſently knight world hold ſo great eſtimation thought durſt ſo bold ſpeake ſo proudly neuertheleſſe regarding preſence knight tiger ſéeing knight ſo vanquiſhed fell theſe ſpéeches ſée well valour theſe ſtrange knight far different countrey maketh deſirous hazard fortune happy conqueſt yéelde contentment comming knight tiger began againe thus deſire syr knight doe ſo much fauour tell mée belong emperours court conſtantinople sonnes linage noble prince edward might greatly content mée would reſolue mée héerein perſwaded could thus long maintain y• fight againſt knight without ſome haue named content anſwered knight tiger ſatiſfie thée thou deſireſt wherefore giue thée vnderſtand theſe knight brought vp court emperour conſtantinople company ſelfe sonne prince edward brother renowned knight sauage man whoſe behalfe earneſtly deſire requite treaſon thou thy kindred haue practiſed bring vnder ſubiection iſland art thou palmerin ſaid giant eldeſt ſonne prince edward vanquiſhed dramuſiand camboldam didſt win iſlle man elſe could thruſting forth kept ſame cauſe deſireſt thou know anſwered knight tiger marry greatly deſire ſaid eſpouuantable enter combat thée preſence ſiſter collambra would receiue vnſpeakeable contentment ſéeing thée ſeuerely tormented diſhonour thou haſt done kindred word prince replyet thus euen ſelfeſame man thou haſt ſo great deſire knew glad ſee thée ſo willing fight combate although place thou thy ſelfe haſt appointed becauſe make knowne publikely heauenly power haue ſent chaſtiſe thy wicked life alſo crueltie thy siſter collambra well ſaid giant end thou maiſt better folow thy enterpriſe faile prepare thy ſelfe againſt morning night cauſe field prouided wherein entend fight combate thoſe thy companion would likewiſe ſet worke haue thrée couzins ſhall maintaine combat againſt furniſh armour armoury brother bravorant becauſe ſee armour greatly order hauing fought ſo long againſt knight vppon word berolde tooke occaſion ſpeake th • thou ſhalt v great pleaſure lend v armour haue neede ſo refuſe combate well accompany ſeruice prince palmerin deſtroy aboliſh memorie haue kept people ſuch tirannous ſeruitude ſée quoth knight tiger combate betwéene giant muſt ended firſt noble palmerin ſaid sage aliart deſire ſuffer v combate firſt may ſo fall hauing obtained victory againſt giant feare make couzins forſake field day following wherefore ſhunne miſfortune may happen v deſire cauſe giant agrée requeſt ſhall endue ſelfe perpetuall renowme doe v great pleaſure humble ſeruants commandement séeing earneſt deſire anſwered knight tiger content ſhall ſo according ſelues thinke beſt order giant went away ioyfull might promiſed himſelfe victory verily make account kill knight england giant thus gone buſineſſe prince palmerin demanded friend cauſe giant knight enter fight whereto sage aliart thus replied lord giant cauſeth number spy lucke countrey ſeeing ſtrangers come iudged themſelues aſſurance tarrie land darke night accounting rather gouerned arrogancy folly wiſedome diſcretion would truſt made account faith eſpecially profeſſed ſworne enemy chap xvii combate betweene giant eſpouuantable noble knight tiger battell betweene berolde platir sage aliart three couzins giant cleare phebus ſooner ſhewed golden face earth next morning theſe foure knight departed ſhip thrée armed badly reaſon armor béene mangled cruelly day yet though ſo ſlenderly prouided would forſake combate againſt giant couzins ſo leauing shippe cuſtodie marriners rid accompanied eſquiers bare lance shield vntill came place giant remained come thither beheld caſtle place appointed combat paled round handſomly ſcaffolds made great height whereon aſſembled innumerable company people came onely ſée combat iudged would moſt famous euer fought y• countrey wherein heartily deſired giant might depriued life vſed people ſuch extreame rigor yet durſt ſpeake againſt chiefe noble gentleman country ſtood awe cruell dealing glad honor face though ſcorned diſdained behind backe thus liued lordly ouer euery one vſing alike ſlauiſhly might ſo none durſt diſpleaſe offend raſcall vaſſails leaſt ſhould raiſe ſuch ſcandall among tyrant puniſhment would hard ſuffer ſo many time practiſed death giant might diſcharged cruell oppreſſions let v come againe former matter knight entred place knew ordained combate ſtood attending giant ſhort time came one windowes caſtle accompanied ſiſter collambra armed day laſt giant lifted vp beuer helmet end chriſtian knight might diſmaied beholding ſterne vigorous countenance aſſure albeit yong yet ſo mighty tall ſtature hauing ſuch vgly fearefull face ſufficient terrifie heart accuſtomed ſée ſuch hideous proportion face alwayes bitterly frowning ſkin whereof ſwart wrinkled lip bigge boyſterous gaping ſo farre aſunder téeth ſéene monſtrouſly ſo anatomie agréed well name called fearefull giant giant ſtood leaning cuſhion blacke veluet window ſhewed ſiſter knight tiger deſiring comfort ſelfe intended reuenge y• death ſonnes becauſe ſlaine yet come ſpake becauſe would let know talke paſſed day betwéene knight tiger leſt ſhe ſhould chance diſcorage ſelfe doubt ſufficiency ſtrength ſhe eſtéemed equall deale ten good hardy knight meane giant ſtaied window came eſquire men laden armor place combate ſhould fought comming prince company eſquire ſaluted entred theſe ſpéeches gentleman lord giant willed let vnderſtand accuſtomed make conqueſt thoſe knight ſhal afterward excuſe thēſelues miſfortune want armor becauſe auoid ſuch impeachment hath ſent choice armour willing take ſhall thinke moſt conuenient willed bring word whether rather yéeld mercy siſter collambra abide triall himſelfe couzins prince platir anſwered eſquire thus truſt friend cannot thinke méete receiue thy maiſters armor thanke would ſo courteouſly ſend v becauſe carry mind better v looſe liues without aid hauing armour fall hand vanquiſhed armour ſo much ſpoyled may well endure triall combate wherefore trie fortune armor haue conſidering ſkill muſt vſed well defence imploy ought doubt ſhall haue victory content follow aduiſe platir ſaid berolde ſince find ſo conuenient quoth sage aliart thinkt good meſſenger returned backe maiſter let vnderſtand may come pleaſe field reioyce greatly ſaide eſquire counſell young knight take armor lord giant ſendeth therefore let hath aduantagr boaſt winning end thus eſquire departed caſtle collambra againe giuing giant vnderſtand knight ſaid whereat fumed fretted greaely ſée diſdaine theſe chriſtian knight made wherevpon tooke leaue siſter maner madame pray abide window combate endureth ſhall greatly iniuried want preſence departing went vnto couzins blacke armor conformable griefe ſorrow bearing deuices ſhéelds portraiture brocalon baleato couzins figured field sable promiſing neuer change deuiſes vntill reuenged death giant ſons collambra déerely beloued vnckle giant eſpouuantable tooke way place appointed combate people reioycing ſaw comming couzins ſtature able deale ſixe ſuch thrée knight made giant ride merily perſwading himſelfe knight tiger companion ſhould looſe liues field day comming ſomwhat néere began vſe theſe word ſooth friend better yéeld ſelues abide terrour combate ſo ſir anſwered knight tiger albeit thy arcogant pride ſhould ſéeme fray v theſe people iudgements content abide vttermoſt doubting god aiding v bring downe thy haughty ſtomacke theſe likewiſe beare thée company vpon theſe word giant ran againſt knight tiger cozins againſt knight trampling horſes made earth groane ſo quicke ſpéedy courſe knight tiger companion nimble méeting ſo brauely middeſt carrire giant broke lance prince palmerins ſhéeld ſo great force conſtrained catch hold mane horſe otherwiſe fallen beſide neuertheleſſe giant caſt saddle great violence againſt ground whereat maruailouſly offended knight tiger reioyced broken lance ſo well ſix knight likewiſe diſmounted except prince flatir kept saddle ſtill yet charge ſo rough vpon almoſt borne fellowes company recouered himſelfe gallantly hauing loſt ſtirreps knight tiger ſéeing giant comming towards caſt himſelfe beſide horſe quickly becauſe feared giant would haue kiled horſe féete ſpake giant thus content thy ſelfe thou counterfeit monſter let thy cozins procéede haue enterpriſed deale ſuch ſhall find ſufficient abate lofty mind haue tried fortune becauſe hinder neither like v thou quickly decide controuerſie doubt thou ſhalt perceiue little regard haue thée vttermoſt thou canſt doe ſée well anſwered giant becauſe thou hadſt ſo good fortune diſmount make thee ſo bold ſpeake thus brauely receiue greater contentment thē thou canſt deuiſe ſee thee place mine owne pleaſure ſhall giue thee puniſhment ſword repay ſhame fall drew ſword forth ſcabbard ſaying prince cauſed weapon made onely take reuenge therewithall death couzins brocalon baleato theſe word ran fiercely knight tiger gaue ſuch cruell forcible ſtroakes defended worthily life would haue bene great danger verie rigorous blowes giant gaue prince ſo moſt part ſhield cut peeces little left award enemy great could wound giant yet length gained ſuch opportunitie wounded grieuouſly three foure place made giant faint waxe ſomewhat wearie great loſſe blood alſo extreame ſweating chafing ſee himſelfe ſo hardly matched one knight fretting prince regarded followed intent ſo worthily redoubled ſtroake ſtroake ſo roughly vpon giant conſtrained retire take breathing awhile knight tiger ſorry therat gladly deſired reſt giant though ſuch extreame occaſion conſidering alſo deſired ſee three friend continued fight giant three couzins ſooth brought ſuch narrow point power defend enemy charge ſo worthily prince much delight himſelfe beholding ſo couragious nimble quicke beginning combate prince platir dealt ſo gallantly enemy general praiſe iudged worthy honour day aboue two companion giant beholding couzins ſuch danger himſelfe haue loſt moſt part blood likewiſe ſuch ſtrong puiſſant enemy heart began faint becauſe would haue know great feare debilitie came againe luſtily could combate knight tiger ready willing entertaine rough ſharpely giuen giant firſt encounter meane time tried thus hardly together knight fought againſt platir ſo faint féeble hee fell downe ground platir taking helmet ſtrooke head ſhewed collambra ſhe ſate window ſhe ſawe fortune thus fully bent againſt ſhe preſentle ſhut window wéeping bitterly pittious ſight ſhee pulled rent haire cruelly giant beholding ſhe diſpaired victorie would vouchſafe longer countenance determined ſell life déerely could laboured take beganne aſſaile prince furiouſly perceiuing giant force could endure long ſo hackte hewed armour preces laſt hée cutte great collops fleſh dyed graſſe blood giant eſpouuantable knight tiger looking aſide eſpied couzins giant ſubdued head preſented firſt two knightes euery one expecting ende combate betwéene giant truely hée maruelled much giant helde ſo long wherefore layde ſuch cruell ſtroakes vpon length able ſuſtaine himſelfe fell downe flat ground vpon backe committing ſoule hand ſtrengthened wicked abhominable déedes knight tiger tooke helmet ſée whether aliue dead ſaw life left tooke ſword point beate hils ſo head made eye téeth fall cut leg knées done thanked god happy victory people ioy gaue ſuch generall ſhoute earth ſéeme tremble withall ſo glad deliuery monſtrous cruelty wherin theſe giant ſo long time kept great ioy concluded altogether goe beſet caſtle collambra none bloody linnage might left aliue except ſhe likewiſe diſpatched people feared former ſeruitude meane collambras knightes guarded people entrance caſtle one damoſels came humbled herſelfe prince palmerins feete theſe ſpéeches deſire sir knight would take pittie lady collambra v damoſels attedant haue defence ſelues thrée knight labour kéepe people foorth caſtle would put lady death pray vouchſafe defend exueltie willingly would ſhe receiue chaſtiſement hand offence fall people power voide reaſon reuenge knight tiger fearing hée ſhould come time enough giue ſuccour ſpake thrée friend manner deſire brother friendes goe aſſiſt collambra becauſe people ſéeke put death theſe thrée knight willing ſatiſfie prince requeſt began thruſt preaſſe preuailed ſo much ſtrength laſt attained caſtle gate defended collambraes knight one ſlaine two ready yeeld themſelues time knight tiger companion come place great hurly burly deſirous pacifie thruſt caſtle collambraes knight turning face people deſired depart houſes aſſure themſelues would faile ſet ſuch ſure ſtate libertie ſhould moleſted ſuch cruell tiranny bin long time people conceiued ſuch contentment word prince palmerin preſently departed thence cry manner iſland ought giuen knight tiger owne right heartily deſire would accept content humble themſelues vaſſailes ſubiects ſo would perſwaded flattering word collambra whoſe mallice inferiour cruell giant palmerin made promiſe deale ſuch ſort ſhould contented owne willes ſo giuing courteous farewell went great hall reſt himſelfe afterward came collambra ſate among damoſels haire diſperſed ſhoulders hanging head downe ground making ſuch pittifull lamentation damoſels could chuſe bedeaw chéekes teares beholding extreame heauineſſe lady miſtreſſe inſtant remembred death huſband loſſe sonnes deſtruction houſe death brother came onely ſake thither well defend alſo ſée death knight sauage man paſt hope haue fearing leſt ſhe likewiſe loſt daughter arlencea ſhe made moſt high eſpeciall account thoſe occaſſions conſidered together compelled immoderate mourning knight tiger hearing great complaint collambra diuers time offering comfort iudging word would rather vexe pacifie let alone comfort ſelfe well ſhe could prince platir ſéeing collambra howled made ſuch pittifull heauy noyſe beganne thus ſpeake vn knight tiger thinke good ſo two friend companion caſtle remaine vnto v owne
