euer chaſe hence cruell woman cauſe brought ſome ſuch place mallice may haue power endanger v put good mind feare friend platir anſwered palmerin agrée whatſoeuer thinke expedient pray prouoke collambra outrage yet brinn company cannot endure behold one ſo full griefe ſhe theſe thrée knight perceiuing ſight cruell giantneſſe much offend prince palmerin concluded haue brought ſhip lay anchor carry conſtantinople becauſe emperour ſhould diſpoſe thought méete ſtayed long put intent execution cauſed conueied chariot port ſhip rode leauing company sage aliart vntill determined ſtate iſland chap xviii happened noble prince palmerin england departed profound iſle ſo fell hiſtorie reporteth collambra ouercome excéeding griefe anguiſh minde brought ſuch weake féeble eſtate ſhe fell ground trance otherwiſe reputed thē dead body prince platir deſired ruine whole progeny commaunded eſquire take vp ſhée ſo heauie weightie hauing helpe could ſcantly lift ſo bringing downe ſtaires conueyed chariot certaine damoſelles attended ſo ſhe caried away caſtle ſhip followed way number men woman foote made ſuch woefull bitter lamentation mooued pitie béene greatly iniured crueltie come ſhip conueyed thereinto two damoſels would meanes depart determined beare company take part ill fortune might happen ſuch ſo great amity bare vnto collambra ſéeing ſelfe ſhip cuſtodie enemy depriued al hope come backe againe ſhe determined caſt ſelfe ſea iudging onely way end ſorrowes ſo frée practiſes foe berolde platir sage aliart y• ſhip palmerin meanes would come ſhe endeuoured cōfort much could come ſhe endeuoured comfort much could ſhe made account perſwaſions ſhe ſaid without might ſée daughter arlencea againe ſhe ſhould neuer giue euer ſorrowfull wailing ſhe continued company thoſe knight knew wel nothing ſuch ſoueraigne remedy deſperate folkes death ſelfe wherefore concluded leaue company sage aliart preuent crueltie ſhe might offer ſelfe platir berolde went ſhoare comming aga • ne citie found prince palmerin among people deſired accept faithfull homage onely prince ſoueraigne reſpect great inſupportable tryanny deliuered noble proweſſe palmerin receiued courteſie gratious gentle manner caſe would accept gouernment iſle quoth appertaineth brother florian forreſt otherwiſe called knight sauage man hée hauing aduentured life deſtroy thoſe tyrannous ruler ſometime poſſeſſe ſame theſe friendes came hither onely finde ſo brother florian refuſed gouernor faile ſatiſfie iuſt reaſonable requeſt whereto reaſon commaundeth mee condiſcend till time vnderſt brother minde name receiue make account homage aſſure ſelues ſée haue gouernour ſhall like meane time pray make account behaue ſelues good obedient ſubiects great danger life loſſe blood hath bought redéemed quiet libertie principall lord iſland preſent prince made anſwere would thing fulfill commaundement thoſe honoured vnfained reuerence ſight whereof reſigned vp caſtles fortreſſes keyes whereof humbly deliuered palmerin hauing viſited caſtles ſet thing due neceſſarie order better encouragement inhabitant iſland hée gaue fort caſtles hand againe cuſtodie commaunding carefull reſpectiue well guarding ordering vntill ſuch time brother arriued prince palmerin entertained people iſle honourably cauſed treaſure belonged collambra bée locked vp within caſtle might bée deliuered brother florian appoint porter place moſt aſſurance caſtle perceiued siluian enter accompanied ancient knight béene hoſte prince firſt arriuall iſle enformed victory palmerin atchieued againſt giant eſpouuantable would néedes come siluian cittie ſight little reioyce heart prince palmerin ancient knight come preſence humbled himſelfe féete theſe word gratious lord haue vſed ſuch entertainement nobilitie deſerued humbly deſire would vouchſafe pardon palmerin aroſe tooke vp imbracing gratiouſly ſpake thus vnto haue forgotten excéeding friendſhip wherewith vſed houſe account ſelfe greatly beholding preſent power ſtretch make ſufficient amends pray accept gouernment iſland lord thereof know well contented therewithall fortune vouchſafe call dignitie faile remember great kindneſſe doe thinke lord anſwered argentao name ancient knight people admit gouernor ſelfe yea truely anſwered palmerin lord hereof brother iſland doth appertaine duty feare lord ſaide argentao ſome harme hath happened ſtocke image giant brauorant ſince ſtandeth ſo gracious pleaſure call mée vnworthy wretch ſo great credite honour knowe ſhould refuſe eſtéeme ſelfe moſt happieſt man aliue deſiring vnderſtand people doe imagine well preferment better content ſelfe mine poore houſe liked accept lodging whereof pray diſpoſe owne alwayes commaundement thinke life time vowe ſelfe humble vaſſaile obedient subiect people hearing wordes argentao chriſtian knight one good life alwaies great enemy giant well allow accept gouernour promiſing generatly prince would honour dutifull loue obedience prince palmerin ſent call sage aliart commaunding siluian ſtay meane shippe come thither entred ship preſently taken exceeding feare beheld ougly frowning countenaunce collambra iudged ill fauoured report went eſpouuantable brother people countrey thought inuincible ſaw ſo nobly conquered valiant palmerin england siluian hauing declared pleaſure lord sage aliart preſently departed citie come prince friendes hee found determining ſend conſtantinople eſqurer prince berolde named albanis willing depart thence ship preſent emperour greece newes happy victory iſland alſo deliuer maieſty gianteſſe collambra concluded eſquiers meſſage departed ship collambra pilot hoyſing sayles winde ſeruing gallantlie rode pleaſure cut sea maruellous expedition prince palmerin peceiuing thrée friend written mindes beſt thought ſorry done much neuertheleſſe thought fit ſhould venture ſo boldly commit ſecrets one elſe ſauing friend siluian driue fancy mind deſired friend beare company viſiting iſle whereto willingly conſented argentao cauſed two giant foiſts put readineſſe wherein principall lord iſland bare company riding iſland ſéene moſt part profound iſle came another called perillous iſle well peopled fortified number goodly tower caſtles ſmall rich nobleſt prince world could wiſh ſtately gouernment argentao well acquainted cuſtomes maners iſland gaue vnderſtand rare ſingularities thereof deſiring thinke ſtrange ſaw people ſo ſcant ſo fearefull extreame cruelty giant brauorant made forſake houſes looking euery houre ſhold put sword theſe knight receiued great pleaſure beholding theſe two iſlandes ſo rowed vntill next day morning came place may reade firſt part hiſtory palmerin went ſhore end ſtrange aduenture landed mounted horſes get vp high rocke way ſo narrow rocke ſo ſteepe faine alight againe giuing horſes eſquires went vp rocke foote one another come place palmerin found monument theſe letter engrauen thereon take heed thou paſſe ſo weary glad mount horſes againe ſo ſhort time attained top rocke reſted themſelues abaſhed ſee ſuch huge mountaine argentao thrée knight come fountaine greater cauſe aſtoniſhment ſéene yet ſaw monſtrous huge beaſtes like vnto palmerin flew would ſuffer drinke water aſſure theſe beaſts ſo cunningly artificially framed one wold haue iudged aliue made ſuch vigorons fearefull ſhew chained neckes ſelfe ſame chaines palmerin noble valour diſcomfited rare ingenious figure declared great ſtudy practiſe vrganda compaſſed leaue ſuch ſtrange edifice remembrance knowledge palmerin ſeeing rare monument ſurpaſſe euer ſéene ſuſpected sage aliart done art cauſe wonder wherefore deſired would ſatiſfie whether ſo sage aliart made anſwer lord ſhe inuented aduenture fountaine ſo happy atchieue honour thereof ſhould recompeuced according worthy deſerts leaue poſtericies perpetual remembrance ſhe ordained theſe cruell beaſts framed naturall ſhapes ſlew ſhould remaine ſtill place end chance come iſland may render continual laude commendation worthy proweſſe yet thinking ſufficient enough prayſe ſhe cauſed erected portraiture thoſe knight belonged enchantneſſe eutropa worthily brought vnder obeyſance liuely carued marble ſame height proportiō figured defending ſhields may yet ſée hanging ſeuerall pillers euen ſame manner fought iſland conquered iſle ſelfe ſometime belonged sage vrganda muſt thinke ſelfe greatly beholding ſéeing meanes noble déedes remaine regiſtred perpetuall memorie certainely anſwered berolde cannot deny muſt néedes iudge himſelfe well fauoured yet ought regard power end ſuch perillous aduenture may ſay ſome would make fearefull theſe beaſtes made arte becauſe giue ſhewe ſuch rauenous crueltie would one aliue doe ſée ſaid platir poeſie engrauen piller doth inuite v drinke fountaine letter within commaundeth v defend ſelues truſt ſince danger awarranted prince palmerin yet ſée aduenture theſe word approached fountaine hauing drunke water commended ſwéeteneſſe thereof aboue water argentao profound iſle greatly maruel ſée ſtrange ſights like manner platir berolde albeit good hardy knight yet admire company extolling hauty noble proweſſe famous conqueſt brought iſland inhabited long time diſcourſed ſingularitie fountaine tooke way caſtle hard riuers ſide ſtood foure faire iaſper pillar whereon hanged foure ſhieldes like vnto palmerin foure knight ſtood image knight columbs marble hauing like armor shield liuing knight ſtanding though vſed regard ſhéeldes whereon ſeuerall name written letter gold palmerin greatly amazed ye fight hereof ſame day approoued aduenture kuights tooke pleaſure behold ſtrange monument perceiued come ouer bridge eſquire ſent thither satrafort gouernor caſtle eſquire ſooner ſéen knight tiger preſently returned caſtle giue maiſter vnderſtand lord iſland arriued wherevpon satrafort come forth receiue humilitie conducted caſtle wherein ſooner entred platir began manner thinkes ſtrange fight countrey farre contrary part world theſe motion ſhew great danger aduentures paſſed brauery caſtle doth euidently witneſſe ſkull knowledge sage vrganda ought eſtéemed aboue prince platir could chuſe maruell much ſéeing ſundry rare monument sage vrganda erected place ſhe made continuall abyding becauſe ſhe would alwayes ayde thoſe ſhe made account ſo ſpeciall friend may reade large booke valiant amadis gaule come againe former purpoſe theſe knightes hauing ſéene lower part caſtle laſt came place palmerin england time paſt found giant demetail fight hereof cauſed paſſe came blacke riuer wherein malicious eutropa caſt ſelfe prince palmerin tooke hand ou plancke ſo dangerous ſight perillous aduenture made forget brauery ſéene siluian began thinke maſters fortunate ſucceſſe atchieuing ſuch worthy famous aduenture conceit manifold trouble paſſed ſuch force gentle eſquiers minde began ſhed teares knight tiger perceiuing siluian wept friend buſied beholding occaſions preſent came embraced siluian vſing theſe word would haue thée thinke good friend siluian knight hath rare beauty princeſſe polinarda imprinted heart could faile accompliſh theſe aduentures dangerous ſo euer firſt aſſure thée vnfained leue beare made trie hazard vncouth place whence ſoueraigntie name returned victor wherefore pray thée refraine thy teares perſwade thy ſelfe aſſuredly earneſt deſire haue ſeruice lady encouraged trauailes left siluian came againe friend companion ſpeaking order pray friend forſake place doth nothing elſe trouble thought ſilent vexation griefe thinking thing ſo ſmall importance think satrafort ſaith time go ſupper theſe word knight departed thence commending highly valour knight tiger satrafort brought faire great chamber windowes thereof ouer faire garden thicke beſet trées prettie ſmall riuer taking courſe thorow place knight ſet ſupper ſerued ſuch great pompe ſtate wanted nothing could deuiſed satrafort deſirous witneſſe great welcome perillous iſle ſhewed himſelf ſurpaſſing bountifull beſide ſo glad preſence noble palmerin england ſpared trauaile purchaſe thoſe thing might yéeld contentation supper time delighted themſelues pleaſant diſcourſes vntill table withdrawne aroſe courteſie one another satrafort brought ech thē chamber hanged rich cloathes tapiſtrie enchantreſſe eutropa giant dramuſiande left becauſe houſe ſhould decked time friend came might haue better entertainment thought well durſt ſo bold preſume thither becauſe vſed friend courteſie ſo enemy crueltie chap xix yet continued happened palmerin england perillous iſle theſe foure knight ſooner riſen next morning walked field caſtle faire fragrant behold sage vrganda take great delight life time buſie time spring laſhed planting ſetting yong tender graft done manner walk arbour hauing kept ſuch iuſt proportion meaſure ſetting ſurely would content friendly eye walkes paued large ſtones colour white gréene trées ſo brauely branched summer time sunne could offend heate ſuch delicate ſhaddow winter cold ſharpe winde could come reaſon trées ſo thicke high garden ſtood goodly ceſterne receiue water fell rained pipe deuiſes water ronueyed neceſſary roomes caſtle ceſtern incloſed round chriſtal bound barres ſiluer maruailous beautifully theſe knight could ſufficiently content eye diuerſitie braue deuiſes caſtle ſo long walked till meſſenger came called dinner though loath go ſo ſoone againe yet remembring courteous hoſte went preſently reſt day ſpent former exerciſe vntill night came ſtealing euery man loding could entend ſléepe ſo buſie praiſing deed sage vrganda aurora ſaluted knight amiable countenance windowes satrafort came chamber giue morning courteſie comming prince palmerin ſhe began vſe theſe ſpeeches ſéemeth worthy sir nouelties iſland continually chaunging appeare ſtrange euerie houre gareen yeſternight inſtant ſtanding goodly lodging inuented builded think ingeniouſly cometh paſſe excéedeth occaſions haue yet ſéene made offer enter forcibly kept backe two monſtrous giant ſuffer come doore wherefore thinke good trie courteſie perſwaded reward due knightly trauailes beſtowed conquering iſle vndoubtedly within place theſe news ſo greatly amaze knight ſtarted vp preſently armed themſelues comming garden found middeſt thereof ſtately lodging satrafort declared workemanſhip whereof ſéemed miraculous ſtrange walles marble ſo ingeniouſly built vnpoſſible finde like couerture houſe azure ſtone glimpſe sunne ſhine ſo brauely greatly delighted knight behold top houſe ſtood piller siluer great bigneſſe leaned againſt faire table compaſſed exquiſite deuiſes arte higheſt part thereof figured heauens ſeauen planet liuely image pictured therein mercurie lord attired ancient habite ancient time report weare middeſt table pictured hercules tearing peeces théefe cacus foure corner houſe foure goodly trées iuſt height houſe branch ſpreading brauely abroad round houſe glaſſe windowes maruailous coſtlineſſe gaue light plentifully place ſame glaſſe hauing ſuch ancient hiſtories figured gold knight could looke ſo much liked made platir ſpeake thus ſhould ſéeme vrganda made study delighted decke ſo brauely without doubt ſhe would make farre ſumptuous within wherefore thinke good trie crueltie giant fortune doe accept v fauour ſhall ſpéed treaſure incloſed within houſe deſire may firſt prouing aduenture ſo prince palmerin like well would loth go againſt thing procéede determination anſwered palmerin promiſe cannot miſlike thing allow therefore pray get v libertie gaints enter ſo cannot ſpéed would aſſiſt ſée danger prince platir hearing word palmerin would trifie longer time haulng drawne ſword buckled ſhéeld went nobly againſt giant taking mace hand prepared themſelues receiue prince platir ſet ſéete firſt ſtep paſt height one cubite one giant caſt mace ground comming two pace froward though bene liuing body tooke prince platir armes hauing throwne downe two ſteps groued returued againe companion platir greatly offended ſée himſelfe ſo vſed came made ſecond aſſault ſerued againe prince berolde perceiued hée went tried fortune hee ſped according platir palmerin agréeued ſée friend ſo abuſed deſired reuenge ſpightfull iniurie ſo aduanced himſelfe trie aduenture knowing whether sage aliart wold hazard himſelfe becauſe would one ſtepped prince knowing aduenture reſerued making account beare friend company foyle therfore went ſmyling giant ſhewed ſo much fauour thruſt foorth againe becauſe image golde ſtood doore within cried aloude thus take heede ſuffer sorcerer enter chamber treaſure lye becauſe worthy ſuddenly theſe two giant tooke palmerin arme thruſt downe one ſtaires made palmerin haue ill opinion aduenture remembred good fortune paſſed thinking ſhould make concluſion ſéeing could atchieue conqueſt ſéemed leſſe attempted meane thought occupied conceit sage aliart knew well inward affliction came gate againe partaker friendes foyle opinion himſelfe ende aduenture ſooner offered charge giant without making ſhewe reſiſtance humbled themſelues féete granting frée libertie enter pleaſure ſight hereof pleaſed well sage aliart hée ſtood beholding workemanſhip doore image gold ſtood thereas watchman opened preſence little cheſt ſhe held vpon knées hauing taken key gold threwe downe ground sage aliart ſtouped tooke vppe without delay opened doore palmerin platir berolde comming enter attributing cauſe repulſe thus vrganda left aduenture diſcouered wiſedome diſcouered ſo ſtraunge meane firſt chamber library wherin ſhe alwayes woont ſtudy ſight hereof much delight eye thing elſe ſeene whole iſland library round garniſhed bookes sage lady alwayes woont contemplate bookes lying vpon ſumptuous deſkes gold deſkes ſupported beaſts antique worke ſelfe mettall couerings theſe bookes cloath gold hauing euery corner placed pretious ſtones incredible value rich chamber might compare next walles whereof round decked coſtly picture lady manifeſting moſt rare ſingular beauty ſuch rich robe deuiſes apparell one would haue iudged liuing creature ſuch rare inuention erte beſtowed theſe image goddeſſes diuers beautifull lady prince gazing theſe delicate figure attributed maruellous commendation wiſhing lady preſent ſée ſuch braue ſumptuous monumēts iudged ſight theſe beautifull picture well content eye though ſéene beſt beloued lady bett rupt minde theſe ſéemely ſhadowes along one part chamber portrait ſuch king queenes liued ye time sage magitian vrganda owne picture likewiſe middeſt thē ſhe ſitting chaire gold hauing booke lying wheron ſhe made ſemblance though ſhe read right ſide counterfeit placed oriana daughter king liſuart king great brittaine ſide briolania quéene sobradiſa leonorina princeſſe conſtantinople two faire princeſſes melicia olenda hauing name impozed vnder letter gold ſuch rare beauty theſe lady haue named one thē etalted aboue equall together maketh think raigned cōmendation beautie time valiant king amadis worthily praiſe vſed knight gained immortall renowne aduenturing another place ſéen yſeul faire geneuera quéene king arthur friend ſir launcelot du lake yſeul white hand accompanied many beautiful lady ſomtime floriſhed great brittaine bracando ſtudious leaue moſt worthy report becauſe ſhe highly eſtéemed another place ſtood empreſſe polinarda agriola empreſſe allemain gridonia flerida francelina figured ſo néere iuſt proportion wanted nothing life ſelfe worthy high praiſe delicate ſwéete face flerida ſuppoſed excéed another place chamber placed ſhaddowes court emperor greece cauſed many knight take aduenturous trauails firſt polinarda daughter vertuous magnanimous prince primaleon accōpanied faire miragarda leonarda ye princeſſe thrace altea sidelia daughter king tarnaes lacedemonia arnalte princeſſe nauarre chiefeſt theſe placed princeſſe polinarda ſéemed beauty aduantaged aboue prince florendos pointed ſée fortune wold reſpect place ſpeake indifferently ſuch workmanſhip beſtowed like wiſe miragarda one could hardly iudge whether polinarda excell oriana briolania ſuch equalitie together would haue tried ſharpe wit ſay thē faireſt yet portrait faire oriana ſet forth ſhew grauity wel beſéemed daughter ſuch famous king aſſuring ciuill gratious countenance able haue woone victory preciſeſt eye vpon theſe beautifull motion one theſe knight ſhould haue fallen affecting beſt beloued promiſe nether oriana briolania polinarda flerida miragarda cōpared yſeul faire yet notwithſtanding one could moued opinion ſo deceitfull regard saint beſide offend eye thus perſwaded themſelues true faithfull hope grounded heart firmely fixed eye man could remoued ſiniſter occaſion thought ſetled liking ſatiſfied changed euery countenance euery face liketh none contenteth ſuch recreant loue worthy come within court prince commended beauty yſeul worthily deſcrued yet thought owne lady fairer ſhe ſo ſtood maruailing theſe delectable inuentions whereon could gaze ſufficient deſires courſing ſuch endleſſe laborinth beyond prince palmerin rauiſhed affection ſéeing counterfeite ſo much torment ſhe attired ſame manner ſhe took farewell whereupon fell ſuch arrogant conceite though lady polinarda indéed fearing moued offence began manner ſpeake picture madame know ſhe onely hath power command profite receiue vſing ſuch ſpéeches maketh ſelfe deafe heare yet couet y• would reſpect word fauour would ſtrengthen loue lengthen life ſée wel madam make accoūt word may preuent vnhappy deſtinie wherefore much vtter great detriment grief ſo much ſooner ſhall knit vp ſmall lamentation aſſure onely liues die ſake platir vſed like language towards sidelia daughter king tarnaes lacedemonia ſhortly eſpouſed berolde prince spaine finding lady miſtres place failed praiſe though ſhe bene preſence cuſtome true faithfull louer delighteth made choiſe whether ſhe abſent preſent yet commend extoll felicitie ſo prince berolde thinke great iniurie ſhould commend lady aboue beſt beloued oniſtalda ſooth well deſerue place among sage vrganda forgot place study occaſion becauſe place ſo furniſhed eſteemed moſt ſoueraigne beautie whole world ſufficiently contented eye theſe braue ſhowes sage aliart ſpake vnto manner perceiue lordes theſe image haue depriued naturall vnderſtanding cauſe forget duty commandeth vſe honour wherefore pray doe ſéeme ſo fond prayſing theſe figure ſhapes without ſubſtance beholding theſe miſpend time looking recompēce haue power giue therefore ſhall neceſſary goe picture repreſent time ſufficiently content heart eye receiue pleaſure looking theſe toyes vrganda giueth ſee prefent enchauntment palmerin hearing word brother sage aliart returned anſwere doe maruaile syr aliart behold liuely preſentations ſo faire beautifull goddeſſes finde good cauſe buſie braines receiue memory credite thinke man would rauiſhed delight ſée thing ſo rare excellent importance palmerin ſpake manner becauſe would haue friend ſuſpect amorous thought ſo departing thence went againe caſtle prouiſion made ſate downe dinner ended concluded depart iſland wherevpon palmerin cauſed satrafort called preſence gentleman came company palmerin ſpeaking brother sage aliart began vſe ſpéeches thus ſhould conſider ſelfe noble friend brother way fortune might aduance ſuch eſtate ſhould able recompence manifold courteſies haue receiued handes might repute mée moſt baſe ignoble minde wherefore witneſſe great feare haue leaſt ſhould condemned amongſt vnthankefull frankely fréely giue perillous iſle haue conquered great trauaile loſſe blood deſiring would accept thereof ought rather vnder gouernment know wherefore pray refuſe gentle gift would ſuch eſtimation could finde heart beſtow vpon perſwade ſelfe vrganda ſhould reſerued satrafort perceiue willing hereto ſelfe deſiring would account nobleneſſe vertue requireth may diſcharge duty wherein greatly bound lord anſwered sage aliart iſland haue good occaſion offended ſéeing commit handes worthy come within neuertheleſſe earneſt deſire haue doe ſeruice willeth make refuſall gratious offer accept satrafort fubiect louing friend companion well valour perſon likewiſe let perfectly vnderſtand vowes himſelfe alwayes commandement thus concluding ſpéeches offered take ſhe prince palmerins hande kiſſe courteous prince would permitte taking sage aliart armes beganne againe followeth louing brother fortune rayſe ſuch preferment may finde ſomewhat worthie good deſertes ſhall well peceiue affection beare meane imagiae beſt mee prince berolde platir commended marueilouſly liberalitie palmerin whoſe preſence acceptable satrafort sage aliart ſo would gladly haue changed maiſter neuertheleſſe concealed mind cloſely himſelfe doubting leaſt ſhould purchaſe diſpleaſure new lord aduaunced himſelfe giue faith dutifull obedience praying knight tiger would continue woonted noble fauour palmerin vſed ſuch friendly behauiour towards remained well content withall hauing left sage aliart giue order cuſtoms iſle imbarqued himſelfe ſhip argentao deſirous goe firme land ſo ſoone could poſſible conſidered alſo hee would haue arganto returne gouernment becauſe would commodiouſly rip vp ſecret griefe siluian tooke leaue prince berolde platir giuing thē vnderſtand muſt neceſſitie goe alone himſelfe hee aduenture aſſigned promiſed day enſuing theſe three thus parting platir berolde glad pleaſe prince palmerin thing thought méete entred ſame foyſt wherein brought thither ſo humbly taking farewell palmerin ſayled towards conſtantinople wind weather ſeruing ſo commodious dayes attained firme land like manner prince palmerin another countrey taken leaue argentao likewiſe returned profound iſle subiects receiued •• atiouſly accounting highly bound prince palmerin ordaining ſuch gouernour would caſe ſuffer people iſland ſo cruelly dealt withall béene bloody giant chap xx alfernao arriued emperours court conſtantinople happened many dayes knight sauage man departed citie conſtantinople emperor aduertiſed loſſe prince florians eſquire cauſed ſmall griefe thorow whole court came ſo paſſe alfernao arriued vpon ſudden euen emperour ſate leauing table lamenting want nephew florian cauſed come alfernao fell downe féete theſe word illuſtrious moſt gratious emperour humbly deſire maieſty would thinke woonted fauour clemency remembring paſſed tranſgreſſions grace looke depth ſhall found worthy moſt grieuous puniſhment royall clemency hath power moderate accuſtomed vſe mercy whoſe offence deſerue rigorous intreating dread prince ancient man came requeſted highneſſe aſſiſtance diſſembling teares faint ſpéeches nothing elſe méere deceite great néede ayde one knightes wherevpon granted licence noble nephew ſhould leaue court goe company intending deceit deceiued ſelfe could execute determined began alfernao diſcourſe emperor whole ſucceſſe nephewe florian forreſt ſent informe maieſtie hapned report eſquire might better belieued whereto emperour thus anſwered certainly alfernao haue brought déere friend nephew greateſt danger euer could happē albeit haue good reaſon contrarie yet thine owne deſerts pardon thée bringing ſo good tydings whome heauens would ſuffer fall hand cruell collambra truſt mee alfernao dealing ſhall remaine ſufficient example giue credit hereafter either teares faire ſpéeches eſpecially comming ſuch one ſéeme arlencea eſtéeme maruellous well courteous dealing towards nephew fortune ſhe come court witneſſe good requite honeſt vertuous deſerts meane time may goe chamber reſt ſelfe pleaſe ſtay comming nephew arlencea ſhall beare record entertainment hope remit paſt would gladly anſwered alfernao go empreſſe feare ſhee hath conceyued knight sauadgemās eſquire may perſwaded hearing truth thus ſpeaking empreſſe accompanied ladyes came emperours preſence whereof glad made beginne thus madame perceiue deſire haue vnderſtand become nephew florian hath cauſed come ſo ſuddenly hither hath ſaued man labour comming empreſſe ladyes accuſtomed place commanded nigromancer alfernao expreſſe againe vnto empreſſe former diſcourſe ſhee might likewiſe acquainted deceytfull treaſon report diſpleaſed much alſo ladyes gentlewoman rayſing ſuch hatred themſelues againſt alfernao deſired emperour might departe place prince primaleon ſéeing great choller lady began pleaſantly ſmile prince hall likewiſe bearing company meanetime laughter laſted heard great noyſe without pallace diuers running know occaſion beheld albanis eſquire prince berolde spain come leading hand gianteſſe collambra ſight made people flocke heap excéedingly ſuch wondring pallace ſounded eccho noyſe albanis entred great hall holding collambra hand face ſo fearefull moued emperour ſtart ſuddenly alfarnao ſooner eſpyed heart came manner dead neuertheleſſe couered gréefe ſo cunningly could hauing embraced began manner madame ſhould appeare ſame miſfortune hath brought hither hath like authority ouer wherefore deſire take patiently commit vnhappines fortune vnſtedineſſe cruell collambra eyed emperor heard word alfernao ſhe began cry aloud ſuſpecting ſhe betrayed though voyce ſhe would haue ſhaken hall péeces ſhe wept bitterly pretty ſpace ſhe ſpake followeth alfernao ſée inſtant thy monſtrous diſloyall dealing thou haſt forgotten good kind affection huſband brauorant life time alwaies beare thee thou haſt deliuered hand thou haſt alſo betrayed daughter thou hauing vſed matter ſo ſhall neuer ſée againe madame ſaid alfernao know well doubt make loyalty ſée muſt conſtrained ſatiſfie rehearſing manifold extreame mifortunes well qualifie anger towardes cauſe ſée equall vnhappineſſe one vnhappy planet hath ſtroken v began rip vp whole circumſtance happened ſince departure end diſcourſe gaue vnderſtand arlencea daughter willed forget death child enuie ſhee bare killed ſhe agrée vnto ſhe ſhould daunger neuer ſée againe collambra returned anſwere credite alfernao ſo much offended preſent miſfortune theſe thy wordes wherefore knitte vp matter giue thée aſſurance die thinking arlencea daughter ſo forgetfull ſelfe endure courteſie hath murthered brother death yrkeſome vnto ſhe honoreth hath ſo much diſhonored theſe word ſhe caſt ſelfe downe ground ſo furiouſly good whi ••• ſhe would vſe talke ſo y• time ſhe rage albanis prince beroldes eſquire aduanced himſelfe make knowne emperour meſſage forgetting declare whole circumſtance happened perillous iſle palmerin ſlaine giant eſpouuantable thrée couzins depriued liues proweſſe lord berolde platir sage aliart theſe newes greatly ſatiſfie prince primaleon gridonia proeeding rehearſing danger mooued great admiration vpon alfernao declared people profound iſle choſen knight sauage man head gouernour becauſe abſent palmerin placed argentao rule iſle quoth hee knightes haue left iſland gone perillous iſle determined ſoiourne afterward come hither vnto highneſſe court emperour anſwered thus perceiue moſt noble knightly aduentures reſerued nephew palmerin whoſe welfare doubt depriued company sage aliart therefore would prince florian together promiſe doe euen long company breaking • ter deſired alfernao tell prince florian intend tarry long realme spaine gratious lord anſwered alfernao determined yet returne vnto court hée haue firſt ſhowne • lencea caſtell almaroll theſe word welcome leonarda prince thrace ſhée hauing already giuen entertainment prince florian chiefeſt place heart ſhe doubted leaſt ſight princeſſe miragarda would quite extinguiſh remembrance ſhée thought knight sauage man would enter combate againſt kept shield miragarda ſhe quite cleane forſooke former opinion lauded fortune ſending ſo good 〈◊〉 ſeruant polinarda perceiuing troubleſome thought eſpeciall friend ſoftly gaue comfort madame ſwéete friend ſuffer knight frequent thoſe place affection ſerueth dare aſſure beautie neuer princeſſe world attaine power change fancy therefore pray diſcouraged beauty princeſſe miragarda owne ſo ſufficient perſwaded ſhe hired contend madame anſwered leonarda able iudge much indebted gratious fauour ſéeing loyall friendſhip commandeth nothing ſhould concealed betwéene v let vnderſtand thus much preſent comfortable word hath brought tedious cōceit wherein ſpirit grieuouſly paſſioned emperor commanded magitian alfernao comfort collambra aſſure daughter arlenceas ſake hée affoord fauourable welcome court ſhée would conſent baptiſed euery one would ſo greatly honour ſhe ſhould quickely forget death child collambra ſéeing alfernao comming could ſuffer declare emperor aſſigned woman mad deſperate ſpake vnto order doſt thou alfernao recompence good déeds thou haſt receiued huſbands hand render thy ſelfe ſo willingly enemy ſide perſwaſion thou commeſt forſake law wherein haue bene nouriſhed brought vp life time promiſe thée finiſh life thy treaſons together end may example enterpriſe thing againſt dutie ſpecially dealing reſted hope fidelity whereof thou madeſt aſſurance promiſe theſe word ſhe ran one great open windowes hall one could get ſuccor ſhe threw ſelfe headlong downe court alfernao comming though would haue hindered threw himſelfe likewiſe downe collambra ſell ſo waightily ſtones ſharpe ſhe bruſed péeces hauing remembrance ſpeake one word afterward alfernao liued vntill next morning emperor primaleon ſorry ſée ſuch deſperate murder emperor princeſſes reioyced ſo well deliuered cruell collambra yet gréeue ſée ſuch bloody ſtratagem able endure pittifull ſight withdrew themſelues chamber two yong princeſſes leonarda polinarda paſſed away time diſcourſing ſeuerally valiant proweſſe knight vntill ſuch time called supper chap xxi prince knight priſoners great turk arriued court conſtantinople wherupon king recinde deliuered priſon prince albayzar next day body collambra alfernao buried emperour ſitting conferring albanis prince beroldes eſquire many matter profound iſle ancient knight maieſtie giuen charge guard port conſtantinople entred great hall come emperor preſence kneeled downe ſpake followeth inuincible emperour theſe newes hath béene rehearſed noble nephewes moue content amid manifold diſcontents tidings bring preſent leſſe welcome former aduertiſe highnes within hauen entred foure gallies great turke wherein polendos belcar prince knight court haue bene kept thus long priſon princeſſe targianaes father came let maieſtie vnderſtand hereof landed becauſe • ete ſhould acquainted therewith emperour remained ſo ioyfull theſe tidings poſſible might without making anſwer departed forth hall ſo rauiſhed inwardly ioy gladneſſe could tell prettie whither goe like manner happened oftentimes haue newes brought thoſe thing moſt deſir • u haue length came downe ſtaires open court ſate downe chaire vntill might ſée come gate meane many knight court came tell arriuall ſonne polendos make anſwer minde buſied remembring many miſfortunes come one another necke yet notwithſtanding haue come proſperous end whereupon humbly deſired heauenly power continue ſtill woonted fauourable protection nature men good iudgement doubt danger haue receiued good ſucceſſe hath bene euermore ſéene felicitie miſerie doe equally happen dram pleaſure hath commonly pound paine maner good emperour diſcourſed ſecretly himſelfe comparing euery cauſe ioyntly together teares plentifully run downe white beard thinking fortune fauoured age hee worſt able witneſſe dutie neuertheleſſe feared ſhould long enioy company knight impriſonment gone ſo néere heart hee feared betwéene two extreames ſuddenly rapt away emperor thus winding vp endleſſe bottom vncertain thought prince primaleon ſōne came knéeled giuing vnderſtand galley whre arriued wherevpon commanded horſe ſhuld brought ſo preſently tooke way port accompanied ſonne prince court chiefeſt inhabitant citie one greatly deſiring ſée priſoners emperor came port ſaw land polendos belcar oniſtalde diuers others might better welcom alighted frō horſe much abaſhed ſée knight ſuch order theyr face pale black ſtrength weakened board haire growne ſo long ſawe departed frō conſtantinople company princeſſe targiana began ſcantly know come ſhoare emperour contained ſelfe ſame courteſie mild nature dayly afford towards eſpeciall friend prince belcar preſented himſelfe emperour offering kiſſe highneſſe hand receiued armes imbracing louingly vſed ſuch gratious courteſie towards vnto prince primaleon ſon well bin brought vp court alſo becauſe ſonne owne ſiſter hardy friſoll king hungaria brother eſpeciall good friend continued fauorable vſage belcar oniſtalde ſon king recinde owne ſonne polendos came knéeled downe leauing belcar returned gratiouſly declaring ſight euery one incomparable beauty ſo departing port walked foote towards pallace refuſing mount horſebacke mind buſied ſuch excéeding ioy well recouery princely commendation targiana ſent whō proued ſpeciall friend prince primaleon went middeſt betwéene belcar oniſtalde prince knight came louingly cōmuning friend order followed emperour ſooner come pallace found empreſſe accompanied lady attending comming outtermoſt gate ſhe hauing giuen knight amiable welcome emperour commanded ſhould brought chamber great trauaile sea required ſome reſt prince conducted emperor chamber according cuſtome thoſe eſtéemed arriuall ſcant great hall perceiued enter turkiſh eſquire coming emperor began ſalute theſe word gratious lord almaneor ambaſſador great turk commanded let maieſtie vnderſtand loth yet take landing fearing leſt ſhould hinder pleaſure highneſſe conceiueth ſéeing knight ſo ſafely returned come hath ſent vnto maieſtie wherefore deſireth would iudge amiſſe hath done ſo haue ought mooued offence highneſſe morrow morning come ſorie wil make acquainted ſumme ambaſſage cauſe looſe part contentment preſent knight hath animated withall certainely friend anſwered emperour ſorry make remembrance let commit fault knight enioyne making amends againe morrow becauſe ſhall ſée day willing reſt himſelfe night galley eſquire departed courteous anſwere emperor taking empreſſe hand withdrew themſelues chamber paſſed night greater contentment done many day faire phoebus morning diſplayed golden face earth empreſſe walked chappell heare ſeruice emperour knight farre behind ſeruice ended dined empreſſe chamber ſhe determined feaſt polendos belcar oniſtalde prince ſerued dinner maruellous great ſtate table withdrawne emperor commanded principall knight court goe welcome land great turkes ambaſſadour would ſhew himſelfe honourable well would thought vngreatefull hauing recouered home againe knight alſo vnderſtand great turke polendos belcar reſt béene priſoners went foremoſt receiue ſhoare becauſe would haue thinke forgotten kindneſſe ſhewed sea primaleon ſomewhat diſpleaſed becauſe nature could ſuffer vſe ſuch kindneſſe towards knewe profeſſed enemy polendos company come port hée ſuch thought good tooke barge went aboord galley ambaſſador brought ſhore nobly ſuch noiſe drum phifes trumpet clarians turkes wondred royall entertainment ambaſſador nothing great courteſie polendos diligent ſhewing greateſt honour might knew well excéeding humanitie came lord gouernor wherevpon conſidered prince ſo wel beloued emperour palmerin ſhould finde friend aid neceſſity enemy moleſt emperor attended ambaſſadors comming empreſſe chamber accompanied ſonne primaleon many prince knight court ambaſſador ſame man came requeſt great turk name fréedome albayzar change thoſe prince priſoners turkie preſence emperour made ſuch humble reuerence maieſtie well deſerued vſing ſuch proude behauiour firſt comming conſtantinople emperor welcommed gratiouſly deſiring offended becauſe accept y• day according willingly would haue done moſt worthy emperour ſayd ambaſſadour ſo ſmall diſcretion knew well buſie yeſterſtay receiuing home whō haue ſo long looked letting theſe néedleſſe matter paſſe muſt requeſt know highnes minde concerning libertie prince albayzar would ſende great turke lord doubted would ſende home kept priſoners touching deliuerance lord hath bin ſo hardy truſt gentlenes onely intreatie daughter targiana hée hauing aſſurance prince albayzar daughter huſband onely word great friend deſireth would ſend home beloued lord albayzar great turke himſelfe willed vſe ſpéech hauing ioyned ſpeake thoſe thing little pleaſe hearing emperour returned anſwer know great turke lord hath determined make acquainted withal ſo accuſtomed doubtfull occaſions let mallice ſtretch neuer ſo far deuiſes purchaſe ſcope yet haue power make feare princeſſe targiana thinke ſelfe highly debt earneſt intreatie wonne libertie knight ſurely gréeueth father would ſo enuious towards would heart haue daughter againe court might recompence ſome part gentleneſſe ſhe hath vſed ſhe would ſo kindly pledge ſelfe vpon aſſurance ſhe repoſeth fidelitie moreouer promiſe sir haue written king recinde ſhould faile ſend prince albayzar beléeue certainly belong come hither wherefore pray ſtay till come meane time vſe matter ſo turke lord ſhall rid doubt princeſſe targian ſatiſfied owne contentment opinion ſaid ambaſſadour prince albayzar quickly damoſel ſometime ſent ſecret miſtreſſe diſpatched meſſage twenty dayes ſetting forth ſhe ſhould let king recinde prince albayzar vnderſtand cōming certifie likewiſe liberty knight meanes whereof faile come hither court vntill time determined licence ſoiourne declare lord turkes minde ſée prince albayzar neuertheleſſe preſent gratious letter haue well vnderſtood content thereof declare haue charge pauſing tooke forth boſom letter written p • rchment ſealed armes great turke humbly preſented vnto emperour preſently cauſed opened perceyuing thereby turke willed giue faithfull credit ambaſſador ſaid deſired report cauſe arriuall whereto ambaſſador thus replyed gracious lorde knowe haue forgotten day princeſſe targiana came vnto court neyther ſubtiltie wherewith ſhe entiſed brought forth father courte guilefull dealing nephew knight sauadgeman hindered ſuch ſort iourney could bring princeſſe targiana vnto court ſhe entertained excellencie empreſſe princeſſe polinarda ſuch gratious manner ſhe eſtéemeth ſelfe life bound manifolde courteſies lorde turke regard noble fauour toward daughter would gladly thing hee could witneſſe beneuolent minde forgetting iniuryes paſt faire daughter targianaes ſake condition way maieſtie offer nothing againſt right reaſon • hée ſhall conſtrained forcible ſtrength reuenge ſhame iniurie hath receyued knight sauadgeman ſubſtance minde thus briefe deſireth ſend vnto knight nephew becauſe would chaſtiſe haynous offence refuſe ſatiſfie requeſt commaundeth let vnderſtand enemie ſo reuenge knight abuſe world ſhall take example cannot belieue ſaid emperor turke lord ſeem threaten whoſe hand requireth nothing iuſtice willing doo cannot thinke well preſent procéedings ſooth demaund iuſtice beſides reaſonable graunt lorde requireth florian accuſed bringing away daughter anſwer earneſt intreatie deſire ſelfe lorde perceyue trauelleth vain nephew knight sauadgeman ſend vnto wiſt ſhould welcome ſelfe ſhould ſeeme content lord cannot ſend nephew except pleaſe himſelfe perſwaded conſent vnto much leſſe father prince great authoritie reaſon haue made content lorde turke willing receyue whatſoeuer pleaſe eyther bring ſend ſorie ſo farre ſpent yéeres cannot ſhewe haue beene ſometime neuertheleſſe ſufficient witneſſe ſelfe ſende knight whome hee demaundeth hee may tell would doo ſelfe let bolde knight doo errand vttermoſt aunſwere wiſh looke handes wherefore thinke good goe reſt ſelfe prince albayzar commeth • inde time ſo conuenient may departe pleaſe meane time honor ſuch courteous entertainment ſhall thinke well aſſured anſwered ambaſſadour anſwere would make wherefore hauing fulfilled charge néede matter henceforward vſe word ambaſſadour thus concluded p • lendos deſired emperour would ſuffer entertaine turkiſh infidell ſtayed wherevnto emperour gladly conſented polendos bringing lodging failed let ſee enimies better welcommed emperours court friendes lorde great turke primaleon remained well contented hauing heard anſwer emperor father alſo ſo def • ded cauſe knight sauage man loue princeſſe leonarda diuerſely mooued fearing leaſt ſhould fal great turkes hand would appeaſe anger ſtomacke ſacrificing good hardy knight god ſudden dump yong princeſſe well perceiued ſwéete friend polinarda hid knowledge thereof preſent time vntill brought empreſſe chamber two walking together lodging polinarda demanded cauſe griefe wherevpon princeſſe leonarda ignorant targiana béene brought canſtantinople noble florian forreſt elſe matter ſtood ſhe deſired polinarda ſo pleaſure declare theſe occaſions happened princeſſe herein ſatiſfied minde ſhée remained ſorrow without meaſure well occaſion ſuſpecting beautie targiana alſo thinke ingratitude knight sauage man ſo inſtant ſhe reputed man without faith loue regard loyaltie ſhe would gladly haue deuiſed meane whereby baniſh remembrance forth heart princeſſe polinarda perceiuing willing preuent miſchance ſhould happen couzin ſhe began vſe talke manner madame thinke prince florian ſame man princeſſe targiana muſt thinke ſo loue allowed among perſons honour made ſo ready thinke well occaſion might finde meanes get hand great turke father court could neuer haue eſcaped béene aide princeſſe targiana ſo ſatiſfie helpe neceſſity made himſelfe ſo hardy bring greece arriued left knowing honorable ſigne chriſtian knight ſhould make loue infidell moore therfore ground iudgement done paſt beauty farre excelleth blacke hew princeſſe targiana accounted one moſt renowned lady whole world muſt iudge thus ſelfe little boaſt good fortune entertained gratious ſeruice word may aſſuredly build knight sauage man onely would follow aduentures hath enterpriſed onely hope gaine fauourable acceptation wherefore pray let conſideration haue ſpoken cauſe forſake conceit haue couzin madame anſwered leonarda haue woon ſuch power ouer friendly word forced forget former imagination yet doubted couzin inueigled ſéeing hath conducting ſo many lady realme spaine good ſwéete lady ſaide polinarda pray let ſpirits troubled theſe ſuſpitious paſſions knight ſo weake iudgement ſhould make forget ſuch aduentures happen commonly trauelling knight méet many place lady damoſelles company maketh haue better remembrance thoſe ruleth thought ſoueraigntie loue couzin dare giue faith none thereof word may aſſure ſelfe theſe ſpéeches polinarda vſed ſo perſwade yong princeſſe thrace ſhe quite forſooke iealous thought caried ſo many contrary hardly place reaſon harbour often happeneth play wanton little blind boy goddeſſe cytherea chap xxii knight sauage man accompanied damoſels arriued king spaines court happened againſt prince albayzar ambaſſador great turke ſtaied certaine dayes court emperour company prince polendos made better account entertainement turkie deſerued many along looke made ambaſſador waighting cōming prince albayzar emperour primaleon could ſufficiently commend courteſie princeſſe targiana teares ranſommed chriſtian priſoners foorth trouble wée muſt come againe knight sauage man iournied ſo ſpéedily vanquiſhed foure knight valley gotten damoſels arriued citie bruſia time called tolledo king recinde made aboad little glad tydings came libertie ſonne knight held captiuitie great turke ſeene florian come king pallace called eſquire deſiring goe let quéene lady vnderſtand ſtrange knight come thither enterpriſed maieſtie thought ſo conuenient approue himſelfe againſt king recindes knight eſquire acquainted lord preſently went pallace brought quéenes chamber king himſelfe dyned company quéene lady eſquire beholding iudged faire beautifull marry found great difference betwéene lady ſeene court emperour palmerin eſquire aduancing himſelfe preſence went firſt humbled himſelfe king recinde comming quéene knéeled downe ſpake followeth madame ſtrange knight whoſe company came vnto court hauing paſſed thorow realme deſirous try himſelfe armes againſt knight royall court great deſire doe ſeruice king huſband ſuch intent procéedeth requeſt certaine lady hath brought company preuaileth ſo much good knight maieſtie ſo accept would venture iouſt knight court wil maintaine beauty lady excell hath brought might procéede enterpriſe rather intended aſke leaue king becauſe knowes ſhall way offend excellency king quéene verie glad theſe newes fortune ſent tryall thoſe matter moſt deſired manner dainty emperours court greece carryed ſuch braue report noble knight world went thither try valour beſide aduenture approued realme spaine altogether done caſtle almaroll ſo theſe two aforenamed place generall triall famous knight king spaine ſéeing quéen returned eſquire anſwer ſpake manner truſt madame ought refuſe gentle offer knight wel ſatiſfie mind haue deſired ſée ſuch hauty exployts alſo auoyd ſecret hard iudgment lady ſure would gladly ſée y• courage fauoured knight quéene mildly returned anſwer since liketh ſo wel gratious lord requeſt alowed thou mayſt eſquire ſay vnto knight king • thinke well comming court • permit libertie iouſt againſt enter fielde whether iouſt combate occaſions ſhall happen howſoeuer king alloweth fréedome fielde knight deſire reſiſt himſelfe hée ſhall moſt hartely welcome morrow morning may put intent execution greateſt reſt quiet anſwered eſquier knight maiſter deſireth haue may finde ſuch knight may beſtow breaking ſome lance ſince maieſty hath ſo fréely granted iouſt faile let vnderſtand gracious pleaſure meane hope knight put themſelues readineſſe eſquier ſooner departed king went looked foorth one window ſeeing knight fielde among ſo many lady hée ſaide quéene madame come hither ſhal ſee ſtrangeſt aduenture euer life certainely ſaid quéene ſhee well beheld knight damoſelles ſhould ſéeme haue good opinion knight behaue themſelues ſo amiably company one lady appeareth ſtature gianteſſe indéede ſaid king ſtrangeneſſe make eye knight iudge either fooliſh elſe compelled commandement ſome great princeſſe leade theſe damoſels king quéene ſtood thus ieaſting knight damoſels prince albayzar giuen vnderſtand aduenture came foorth chamber came pallace gate mounted horſebacke came window king queene looked foorth hauing giuen ſalutation day queſtioned ſomewhat enterpriſe knight determined trie combate haſty intent ſtaied time knight well armed came fielde monnted luſty courſar bearing deuiſe shielde white hart field sable knight place iouſt determined eſquire béene ſent meſſage quéene ſpake vnto order sir damoſels knight ſaith accuſtomed iouſt without ſhall recompence hée remaine victor wherefore pray let vnderſtand ſhall bée deſert chance conquer victory fall ſide yeeld damoſell vnto ſhall thinke beſt company spaniſh knight replyed thus knight friend ſéemes farre beyond ſcope minde would trouble folkes would gladly rid himſelfe wherefore may ſay vnto ſuch lady ſeruant towards haue dot yet ſo well deſerued vanquiſhed yeeld vp cuſtodie come cauſe place let well truely vnderſtand beauty thoſe damoſels may compare heauenly face lady fortune proue ſo good triall preuaile ſhall content ſelfe without expecting recompence knight hand therefore till would gladly know preſumeth hazard iouſt eſquire hauing brought spaniſh knight anſwere lord hée content himſelfe well therewith marry tell quoth haue leiſure name lady whoſe cauſe fight hée ſo happie conquer withall heart ſatiſfie requeſt eſquire went againe maiſters minde spaniard heard hée preſently entred theſe word perceiue thy maiſters proud hauty ſtomack made ſo bold enter fielde cauſeth ſo braue ſpéeches wherefore muſt take paine aſſwage courage becauſe helpe away one damoſels king recinde albayzar marked well large language deſired ſée déedes would counteruaile wordes eſpecially damoſels knight ſuch one made himſelfe laſt broached horſes ſpurs ran together ſo great force spaniſh knight ſeruant policia daughter duke ladiſlart receiued ſuch pleaſant ſtroke damoſell knight hauing broken ſtaffe ſo iuſt vpon • shield rared thorow midſt himſelfe throwne ground heeles vpward hee recouered himſelfe quickly like good knight drawing ſword came reuenge foyle hee ſuſtained iouſt damoſelles knight beholding ſtayed theſe ſpéeches sir knight came craue licence combat ſword wherefore pray pacifie ſelfe let iouſt theſe fiue knight ſee attend ſo happy eſcape hand diſaduantaged ſhall content pleaſure owne deſire spaniſh knight ſo offended miſhap cared dyed preſently king commanded auoyd place one fiue knight entred field welcommed like firſt ſo briefe beare one another company albayzar ſeeing ſaid damoſeles might woon without good paine beſtowne hauing ſuch good hardy knight defend damoſels knight hauing broken foure launce withdrewe himſelfe attending eſquire ſhould bring another albayzar ſeeing knight neceſſitie ſent one owne launce blacke head pure gold damoſelles knight would receiue ſpeaking brought manner thou mayeſt ſay vnto albayzar little loue good beare maketh mee diſdaine receyue thing hee ſendeth aduauncing himſelfe towards hee tooke launce ſent king wherewith charged another knight came againſt ſuch ſort caſt saddle ſo boiſterouſly good remained ſenſleſſe meane damoſells knight gallopped end courſe becauſe could hardly ſtay horſe▪ vanquiſhed knight aroſe departed field prince returned backe againe place albayzar ſate behold iouſt came tooke arme vſing theſe ſpéeches sir knight iudge little knowledge haue hath made deſpiſe contemne lance ſent yet parden folly ſo deſire ſaid damoſels knight beléeue word ſent eſquire perſwade ſelfe know albayzar souldan babylon whō would willingly enter combat albayzar hearing theſe word anſwered thus content becauſe know ſo well ſhall take ſurfeit looſing deſire ſtay till 〈◊〉 brought hither breake lance becauſe preſumed refuſe afterwards entertaine combate doubt giue ſeuere chaſticement proud mallapart ſtomacke would heart aunſwered damoſelles knight thou • armed mallice ſuch againſt thee cannot tell thou ſhalt féele albayzar preſently ſent armour king ſéeing fury noting high wordes paſſed betweene came field end would albayzar ſhould fall miſfortune bene firſt •• perours court place turke ſent impriſoned knight becauſe would recouer home albayzar 〈◊〉 cauſe king recinde would permit trie combate ſcantly would ſuffer iouſt together ſo greatly feared leſt damoſelles knight would endaunger perſon prince albayzar quéene verie well pleaſed meanes damoſels knight ſhe perceiued valor knight spaniſh court damoſels albeit reioyced ill fortune vnhorſed yet greatly commended proweſſe knight defended ſo well ſtill looked comming spaniſh lady delighting better ſeruants venter lady themſelues gréeued ſee good friend ſo vnfortunately foyled chap xxiii damoſels knight albayzar iouſted together long prince albayzars eſquires returned maiſters armour blacke ſtreamed ouer little ſtroakes gold prince babylon armed taken ſame lance florian refuſed came king ſpeaking manner deſire gracious lord would diſſwade enterpriſe becauſe know ſelfe able reproue knight ſhewed himſelfe ſo diſdainfull towards ſure would haue receiue ſhame court word king thus replyed albayzar ſo earneſt regard well would ſorry thing ſhould happen well wherfore grant combate againſt ſtrange knight truſt neither dare conſent well care haue perſon giue occaſion emperour palmerin whereby may thinke ill well quoth albayzar hope lance ſhall ſo much would haue may well complain highneſſe ſuffer puniſh pride knight good sir ſaid damoſels knight doe thus waſte time needeleſſé word good prepared ſelfe iouſt prouder would haue puniſh ſee occaſion yet doe dare fortune ſo friend remaine victor ouer let paiment ſuch ſhal pleaſe end pray quoth albayzar ſo much fauour tell aſſure would gladly know two cauſes firſt might ignorant knight ſhall vanquiſh ſecond ſo ſpeed according deſire may better enquire trauaile abroade anſwer damoſels knight wil ſatiſfie thy honor ſo much perſwade thy ſelfe greateſt enemy euer thou hadſt thy life gréeue may haue libertie combate againſt thee becauſe long haue wiſhed haue fill thee ſince pleaſure king ſhall preſume exceede higheſt neuertheleſſe awaite time may deale thee according deſire deceiued anſwered albayzar think know know thinke haue ſeene ſometime caſtle dramorant cruell made ſelfe ſo bold vſe ſuch language haue yet forgotten wherefore aſſure ſelfe ſpeeches thou diddeſt vſe brauery thou ſeemeſt haue preſent ſhall deſtruction ſuch dare afford ayde iniury haue receiued may little eaſe ſtomacke taking reuenge quailing thy vſurping boldneſſe cannot ſo deale would till fitter time ſerue purpoſe deſire thou wouldeſt breake one staffe vnder name ſome • word lady may ſee whether ſhe deſerue better praiſe lady run • aire princeſſe targiana take ſaid damoſels knight ſ • mpleſt beautie theſe company fauourite time ſeruice determined iouſt againſt would wiſh quoth albayzar becauſe lady haue named gratious miſtreſſe fight▪ knowne great high authoritie would name moſt fauoured ſuch one may thought worthy equall preſſe ouermuch anſwered damoſels knight would haue reueale aduertiſe fortune hath made ſeruant lady whoſe gratious fauour 〈◊〉 let ſoueraigntie name ſh • wen 〈◊〉 onely ſuch great importance yet ſince ſee af • ect ſo much content breake one lance ſake becauſe thought may better ſatiſfied aſſure ſhe tarre excellent beautie princeſſe targiana ſo ſingular aboue name worthy talked reſpect royall incomparable miſtreſſe deſire would requeſt know name becauſe haue vowed keepe ſecret may better make others maruaile ſhe ſhould cannot ſuffer ſaid albayzar thy reproachfull ſpéeches eſpecially thou ſeemeſt diſpraiſe whoſe beautie lady liuing way equall theſe two knight departed fetch car • ire ranne together ſingular courage albayzar hauing eye loue lady targiana mi • • ie enemie offered damoſelles knight accompanyed ſecret good princeſſe leonarda briefe theſe two knight ſo greatly affectionate towards lady encountred together ſuch force launce flew vp aire piece ſo paſſed ſhaken thing come end race failed take newe ſtaues broken againe like firſt yet aduantage either ſide king spaine made great eſtimation noble valor perceiued damoſels knight deuiſed might accompliſh meanes knowe doubted albayzar would diſcharge dutie wel enough becauſe shield princeſſe miragarda made valiancy well knowne court emperor palmerin theſe two prince much amazed ſéeing could haue aduantage ouer one another wherevpon tried third launce wherewith mette together ſo forcibly damolles knight loſt one stirroppes caſt vppon croupper horſe like manner albayzar forſooke ſtirropes conſtrained catch holde necke horſe greatly offended hauing iouſted ſo many time yet could ſpeede ſeuearely deſired wherefore determined depart one ſhould bee caſt beſide saddle theſe two redoubted knight went prooue fourth launce hauing hand albayzar ſpake damoſels knight thus pray sir fauour mee dooing muſt demand damoſels knight would paſſe returned anſwere trueth sir thus intended depart hence ſee ground therefore pray trauaile ſelfe deſirig thing mee certainely sir ſaid albayzar would haue thought béene ſo vncourteous neuertheleſſe yet intreate would goe preſent ſelfe giant almaroll ſo prooue ſo fortunate foyle ſay meanes haue acquited bond wherein princeſſe miragarda ſo ſtraitely tied ſhe may ſee knight iouſted againſt beauty lady targiana happen fortune fauour victory doe thing ſhall command offer ſo faire play ſaid damoſels knight cannot otherwiſe chooſe conſent requeſt thus pointed fetch courſe met together ſo directly launce broken buckled together mightily body hauing giuen ſuch rough gréeting damoſels knight compelled forgoe ſtirrops greatly amazed albayzar meaſured length ground ſo ſore ſhaken lay ſtudy prety damoſels knight ſéeing ſo aſtoniſhed▪ ſaid vnto may know aduantage haue gotten haue leaue trie combate cauſed helmet opened might receiue ſome aire ſitten good ſpace grieuing miſfortune eſpecially preſence king recinde hée aroſe holpen vp gentleman king commanded honour ſo much wherevpon damoſels knight beganne thus againe albayzar may perceiue little fortune fauours aduantage haue woon maintaining beauty gratious miſtres princeſſe thrace pray preſent ſelfe ſhall arriue emperour palmerins court ſhall ſay thus ſtrange knight calleth himſelfe damoſels knight hoth vanquiſhed commanded ſubmit felfe excellency thou haſt ſéene let thine eies iudge whether beauty targiana may preſume compare thou deepely drowned thine owne conceit thou wilt recant thy former blaſphemous error thou maiſt aſſure greatly grieued preſent ſeruice importance firſt ſhe hath receiued yet albayzar rage made anſwere faile kéeping promiſe thée god vouchſafe liue ſo long preſent thy head lady princeſſe targiana reuenge ſhame haue day receiued thy hand would ſory ſaid damoſels knight thou ſhouldeſt die minde returning face king recinde ſaid deſire grace would ſuffer depart would offended becauſe declare may perſwade ſelfe one knight world doth wiſh good readier doe ſeruice ſelfe word king thus replyed since sir knight would knowne ſhall moue contrary time paſſe way deſire viſit ſooth ſhall welcome thanke grace moſt humbly anſwered damoſels knight great honour courteſie haue found hand ſhall forgotten ſo long liue taking one launce left gaue reuerent ſhewe obeyſance king quéene lady tooke great delight beholding knightly behauiour ſo departed company king returned caſtle accompanied prince albayzar whoſe heart ſo intruailouſly ouercome griefe would ſpeake ſuffer ſpeake quéene lady ſorrie knowledge damoſels knight beſide offended prince albayzars foile well becauſe gentle behauiour ſuch reputation gained carried away prince miragardaes shield damoſels knight farre citie darke night drew forreſt néere faire fountaine concluded reſt themſelues night ſo refreſhed themſelues laid among gréene leaues prince himſelfe went lay pretty ſpace damoſels laying head roote trée beautie leonarda princeſſe thrace preſented ſelf amorous thought charging ſo many contrary paſſions night could lay eye lid together yet loue ſo irreſolute leſt thing world could haue made forget quite prince florian lay thus buſied thouſand imagination arlencea marnailouſly affected towards ſeeing companion faſt aſleepe went place prince florian laid ſitting downe ſide ſhe began fall theſe ſpéeches ſéems moſt worthie knight sauage man iniury heretofore haue done doth yet remain freſh memory make account liueth dieth onely loue ſpeake truth may perfectly reſolued without regard mine owne honour come ſéeke cauſe intreatie might moue pittie preferreth loue none aliue courteſie ſhall ſeeme refuſe conceite griefe ſo extreame muſt need giue entertainment lateſt enemy ſet ſoule body quietneſſe might haue comfort remaine deaſe make account breaking ſhe laid head prince breaſt fetching ſo many grieuous ſighes groanes though life would haue forſaken body whereupon prince tooke armes amiable ſpeeches though ſuch ſhe gladly looked began comfort thus madame arlencea ſo little eſteeme would willingly conſent doe thing ſhould ſeeme diſpleaſant offenſiue honour deſiring thinke ſo much bound intē ded accompliſh ſel • e deſireth ſince time great fauour deliuered daunger whereinto alfernao brought forſooke altogether folly ſo vaine humor loath reward ſo vngently whoſe courteſie neither time death make forget thus perſwade ſelfe haue prouided huſband according noble bountie doth well deſerue yea ſo good knight refuſe make choyſe knight sauage man may time vſe friend ſeruant pauſing kiſſed hand brought place lady ſleyt departing againe owne lodging ſhe began aſhamed folly noting well wittie word knight sauage man whoſe loue ſhe ſo extreamely paſſioned ſhe cō ſtrained diſcouer flame ſo torment one damoſelles ſame gaue fatall ring prince ſhe ripped vp whole diſcourſe word paſſed night deſiring earneſtly teares trickling chéekes ſhe would giue ſuch aſſiſtance ſhe might enioy loue knight sauage man damoſell anſwered lady thus truſt madame haue occaſion finde ſelfe agréeued good reaſon knight ought ſatiſfie ſuch prince ought trauell himſelfe damoſelles receiue ſhame diſhonour yet content minde becauſe thinke willing doe pleaſure goe knight vſe ſuch friendly perſwaſions vnderſtand depth intent arlencea imbraced damoſell genile anſwere ſpake againe manner know well ſwéete wench ſhall haue remedie caſe muſt enioy thy meanes wherefore pray thée goe fortune thée come ſo paſſe neither perſwaſion thing elſe mooue loue pray thee intreate would pardon fault committed diſturbing quiet eaſe madame ſaid damoſell repoſe yourſelfe altogether ſo ſhe went knight sauage man ſhe found ſlumber ſitting downe ſhe began manner thinkes enforceth lady liue ſorrow becauſe wil vſe regard vnto ought ſo eaſily take reſt knight sauage man hearing voyce woman opened eye ſéeing arlencea damoſell loued beſt amongſt beganne friendly embrace giuing better word gianteſſe lady whervpon damoſell beganne thus againe syr knight deſire would vouchſafe tell cauſe make account lady loue ſéeing ſhe hath ſake forſaken mother forgotten cruell murdering brother likewiſe hath loſt libertie ſelfe madame anſwered prince feare ſhall haue time enough diſcourſe whole matter becauſe vpon point day wherefore intend ſet madame arlencea part demaund occaſion haue forgottē ſéeing remaine affection ſince day alfernao deliuered power lady arlencea pray syr ſaid damoſel would offended niceneſſe onely auoid malice lady abſcence pray thinke ſo wel may pleaſed diſpleaſing haue better come mooue lady ſute againe knight sauage man hearing courteous anſwer might breake launce face venus tooke armes becauſe day came apace vnwilling ſhould ſée ſecret pleaſure durſt ſée feare ſhould ſhent labour chap xxiiii happened damoſels knight going caſtle almaroll vpon point day breaking damoſell gaue ladie arlencea vnderſtand anſwere k sauage man prince ſéeing lady walking came gaue morning courteſie afterward mounted horſeback beganne ſet forward iourney becauſe arlencea ſomewhat mooued euill fortune night paſt p perceiued well came vnto vſed ſuch kinde gentle language ſhe forgot care troubled ſo much prince began deuiſe pleaſantly foure damoſels woonne forreſt ieſted ſuch merry conceites iourney ſéemed nothing troubleſome vnto pleaſed polyphemia damoſell arlencea ſent mooue ſute prince ſhe thought ſhée deſerued better countenance hand knight sauage man knewe well countenance polyphemia ſhe grieued ſée vſe ſuch paſtime damoſels wherevpon began ſmile himſelfe becauſe would vexe would embrace one damoſel come another kiſſe one another would familiar withall much pleaſure poliphemia ſéeing dealing knight sauage man went ſide behind damoſels diſſembling ſo much ſhe could poſſible extreame affliction amorous thought regard honour commaunded kéepe ſecret paſſed betwéene prince hée making though ſaw continued pleaſure damoſels recreation ſake tooke delight walke foote would giue one another greene gowne ieſt iybe ſo pleaſantly poore polyphemia knewe well take yet hoping haue ſome partner miſfortune indéede ſhe came caſtle almaroll chanced fiue dayes departure spaniſh court came faire gréene field gallantly decked nature tapiſtry lady tooke delight ſtay becauſe would make noſegayes garland flower diſported themſelues ſo long thought méete put garland head mounted horſes againe merry pleaſantly diſpoſed change iocund humor beheld come ranke tree bigge tall knight manner giant mounted horſe meete carry ſuch mightie perſon armour azure colour ſpotted thicke little ſiluer flower shield caried deuiſe hidra ſerpent ſeuen head fielde sinople big knight two eſquiers attending one carried lance battelaxe knife gold come place knight sauage man damoſels ſtayd began language manner aduertiſe thée knight long time ſince deſired goe caſtle almarol heart became affectionate faire princeſſe miragarda ſuch good lyking growe determined try fortune againſt knight kéepes ſhielde good hope vanquiſh might afterward take office place hapned farre contrary deſire perſwaded fauour make victorious owne force able conſideration hereof doth little offend ſo determined reuenge ſelfe mean wherfore aduiſe thee wel theſe two condition ſhall put thée thou ſhalt beſt like either enter combat ſurrender theſe damoſels beare thée company friend anſwered knight sauage man aſſure thée man thou thinkeſt neither ſhalt thou find ſuch one wont vanquiſhed thy hauty word becauſe thou ſhalt deceiued giue thée vnderſtand accuſtomed feare ſuch fellowes ſpeake ſuch glorious pride themſelues neither huge ſtature giant diſmay thou durſt preſume take worſt garland theſe lady head would ſel thee life would make thée reſtore againe affection ſaid knight thou beareſt ſome theſe maketh thee eſtéeme danger wherein thou maiſt fall ſéeing thou wilt ſo luſtie content courteſies ſake offer thee condition ſhall diſmounted v ſwaine may haue paine foure theſe damoſelles foure ſhall ſtill attend vppon lady ſee likewiſe thy company wordes knight sauage man thus replyed could wiſh thou hadſt many damoſels thy power thou ſéeſt name end either thou mightſt win theſe conduct might maiſter thine except thou intendeſt take theſe lady force otherwiſe thou ſhalt haue pray thée get thee going thy buſineſſe ſee well ſaid knight contention cannot ended without laying hand weapon ſo try concluſion called eſquire brought lance couched ranne couragiouſly againſt damoſels knight met brauely mid way encountred ſo worthily pe • ce lance flew whiſtling ayre encounter knight loſt ſtirrops meeting together body horſes began fiercely fight one another ſo ſtrange knight caſt ground damoſels knight almoſt borne company becauſe horſe ſlaine knight horſe arlencea lady greatly feare leaſt knight would ouercome prince florian leaping horſe tumbled ground drew ſword ſtood ſtill heare knight would ſay ſeeing damoſels knight ſo ready combate began ſomwhat offended himſelf rough ſtroke lance made feare knight ſtood pretty ſpace buckled shield drew ſword ſheath comming prince theſe word thou art knight ſo much friend thine owne life agrée condition made ſhée iouſted thou ſhalt ſée kéepe promiſe thée pray thee ſaid damoſels knight vſe ſuch friuolous ſpéeches thus determined make thée beare cōpany foote becauſe thou ſeeſt horſe ſlaine ſo without waſting time word began charge knight fiercely knight ſaw felt likewiſe laid huge waighty ſtrokes till end receiued ſo many wound loſſe blood faintneſſe body conſtrained fall downe ground damoſels knight ſet foote taking helmet made ſhow though would haue ſmitten head knight yéelded himſelfe mercy deſiring might pleaſe ſaue dis life whereto damoſels knight thus anſwered content giue thée thy life condition thou wilt fulfill command thée know aduenture ſayd knight ſo perillous would make account ſauegard life thou ſhalt firſt quoth damoſels knight tell thou art afterward thou ſhalt take one horſes whereon thy eſquires ride take thy way preſently court king recinde quéene thou ſhalt ſay behalfe damoſels knight iouſted preſence againſt prince albayzar ſaluteth humble duty deſireth ſuch fauour king hand thinke ill becauſe made ſelfe knowne thou maiſt aſſure highneſſe faile make ſelfe knowne returne caſtle giant almarol becauſe may get thither ſooner take thy horſe recompence mine haue loſt iouſting againſt thée knight aroſe made anſwere worthy sir ſince fortune great vnkindes hath brought iato extremitie ſhall faile obey whatſoeuer commaund name called trofolant feareful haue heard ſometime remember true quoth damoſels knight pray make knowne caſe declare haue ſaid ſo may depart way accompliſh promiſe prince mounted trofolants horſe ſo tooke leaue ſetting forward iourney damoſels till came end pleaſant valley leaned himſelfe againſt ſtump trée becauſe eſpied thrée knight richly armed one cryed aloude ſhould ſtay till came damoſels knight hearing theſe word would goe ſtaied heare ſay come néerer ſame knight ſpake againe manner sir knight would gladly haue one lady company wherefore pray beſtowe beare moſt affection ſelfe truſt sir anſwered damoſels knight doe like ſo well dare ſo bolde take one iudge put life great daunger fancy ſaide ſecond knight doth beſt eſtéeme excéedeth ſtature meaning arlencea content ſelfe quoth third knight rideth next tall lady meaning polyphemia becauſe thinkes beautie excéedeth wherefore pray ſir knight content ſelfe lady ſticke v theſe three ſo well behaue ſelues ſhall haue occaſion complaine v perceiue anſwered damoſels knight would gladly haue theſe lady determined defend againſt therefore haue ſuch minde little riuer betweene v may eaſily paſſe fortune ſo good ſhall carry go backe againe good anſwered firſt knight ſéeing ſtomacke ſerues ſo wel ſhewe ſmall aduantage ſhall get dealing v vpon theſe wordes paſſed riuer hauing placed launce reſt ran valiantly againſt damoſelles knight entertained ſuch puiſſant ſtroake compeld fetch errant duſt ſo greatly amazed fall power ſtir himſelfe great two knight ſaw fellowe foyled came ouer riuer together abaſhed valour damoſels knight durſt venter try one another ranne together againſt though offered wrong would refuſe breaking ſtaffe nobly vpon one • ent kéepe firſt knight company hauing arme broken force fall drew foorth ſwoord welcommed third ſo friendly little tumble downe damoſels knight victorie commaunded eſquier alight tooke knight helmet might take aire commaunded ſhew obeyſance three damoſelles whome would néeds haue knew price willed ſware ſhould looſe liues knight perceiuing reckoned wrong hoſte promiſed would doe thing contrary whereuppon one came arlencea theſe word madame ſhe make moſt account beſéech command thing poore power ſeruice haue ſo little neede ſaide arlencea ſeruice would gréeue vſe aſſiſtance thing whatſoeuer neuertheleſſe may example ſuch following quality commit many outragious fact damoſels encreaſe renowne hath nobly vanquiſhed deliuered company command go king spaines court behalfe let lady vnderſtand deſert come wretched dealing ſay aduertiſe one preſume trauaile abroad without company ſome ſuch knight able defend againſt vnlawfull action madame ſaid ſecond knight polyphemia ſhall like command marie quoth ſhe take ſame courſe commpanion doth forgetting tell lady pray may liue ſafetie without hauing affiance knight whatſoeuer ſuch enterpriſe conduct trauails put truſt honourable loue euen bow ſoules loyall affection yet haue moſt néede ſhunne company rather let doubt proue ſhall find word true damoſels knight vnderſtood well enough couert ſpeeches polyphemia yet diſſembled though knew meant lady ſaid third knight ſo cruell commit greater taſke theſe two lady haue done companion quoth ſhe ſo cruell would haue thée baniſhed company thy deareſt friend damoſelles knight himſelfe began thus againe since theſe thrée lady ſhall carry theſe meſſages king spaines court pray tell lady deſire repoſe truſt ſhall imagine themſelues danger let well aſſured aduenture hazard ſoeuer helpe may yéeld aſſiſtance notwithſtanding one theſe thrée lady deſirous haue thinke contrary counſell deſire humbly make account thereof becauſe may know pray tell name depart may demand another day whether haue fulfilled promiſes lord quoth firſt knight thrée ſame court whereto ſend v meanes whereof grieue go ſhew miſfortunes court whatſoeuer might like ſend v name ſhall vnderſtand called grouanell knight brother named braboſan twaine ſonnes countie loban third knight couzin called claribard knight greatly renowmed court spaine truely gentleman ſaid damoſels knight ought thruſt ſelues ſuch diſhonourable action neuertheleſſe muſt excuſe beautie woman hath ſometime inueigled wiſeſt head would wiſh better aduiſed albeit ſelfe often féele heat ſame fire ending rode charge lady glad ſped ſo well theſe knight preſence likewiſe commended high good fortune chap xxv trofolant theſe three knight yeelded themſelues spaniſh court damoſels knight arriued caſtle giant almaroll long damoſeis knight could reach caſtle giant almaroll becauſe hindered way many knight ventured themſelues take damoſels taken charge conducting chanced king recinde ſtood pleaſantly talking window quéene many knight chamber beſide beheld enter goodly tall knight face couered helmet armour broken many place ſo beſprent blood fine deuiſes thereon could hardly diſcerned ſhéeld carryed eſquire ſhiuered ſelfe ſame manner becauſe deuiſe therein could well ſéene euery one great admiration went ſuch proud ieſtures made eſtimation neuer knight came entertaine pallace gate paſſed till came y• chamber king made obeyſance returned quéene theſe word madame haue combatted knight long ſince court iouſted againſt prince albayzar hath company nine damoſels deſired beſtow one halfe whereto would meanes conſent made anſwer could wiſh many lady conduct would take mine beare ladyes company trauaile vpon proude anſwer intended take perforce would ſuffer made ſuch reſiſtance againſt end onely conquer • great danger looſe life valiant redoubted knight granted mercy vpon condition ſhould performe command ſuch great humanitie would adioyne puniſhment ſhould come preſent ſelfe maieſtie craue pardon behalfe would let himſelfe knowne court returne faile come better acquaintance highneſſe meane craueth would pardon offence paſt know ſaid king ſhould remit iniury hid himſelf moſt deſired know earneſt ſéeing armour ſo much defaced good lord anſwered quéene deſire would offended paſt cannot thinke ſuch knight would deſire paſſe vnknowne grace without compelled ſo ſome earneſt occaſion ſaid king knight pray sir tell thoſe know ſaid knight call trofalont fearefull haue anſwered king oftentimes heard much talke knightly déedes haue atchieued cauſe would gladly haue knowledge damoſelles knight wherefore pray tell know iudge whence hee ſhould lord ſaid trofolant promiſe neuer ſaw life till iudge one ſonnes prince edward perſwaded one knight elſe could haue conquered whereof little aſhamed yea ſo much gréeued thereat take leaue highneſſe haue diſcharged commandement quoth quéene giue licence depart leiſure would thing ſaide king would take better armour handes becauſe caſe doe ſeruice beſide would knight ſerue emperour ſhould depart court deſtitute horſe armour lord anſwered trofolant thinke ſelfe highly bound maieſtie princely offer haue made determined goe euen ſée becauſe deride fortune face ſo departed king gaue queene vnderſtand trofolant reputed good knight would beléeue sonnes prince edward would come court depart againe without knowledge king commending valour damoſelles knight grouanell braboſan claribard entred chamber hauing made reuerence king quéene came preſented themſelues lady rehearſed great miſfortune damoſelles knight poliphemia commanded lady knew well poliphemia receiued ſome iniury knight whoſe noblenes made king ſpeake thus gentleman promiſe greatly deſire know knight hath thus vanquiſhed intend ſend ſome knight may bring hither ſhall like highneſſe anſwered one knight whoſe good fortune ſerued ouercome v grace muſt well thinke hard bring hither except liſt himſelfe truſt ſaid king make maruell much accompanied ſo many damoſels one knight cannot long endure patient conuerſation one woman theſe wordes king departed knightes withdrew themſelues chamber offended damoſels knight vanquiſhed becauſe ſhowne ſuch incredible proweſſe court againſt prince albayzar returne damoſelles knight made ſuch expedition iourney came néere caſtle giant almaroll wherefore ſtayed riuer theſin ſpeaking damoſelles manner arriued place faire lady conuenient diſplay force beautie fauouring enterpriſe combatte behalfe aſſure picture princeſſe miragarda caſtle ſuch excellency knight hath kéeping thereof cannot yet vanquiſhed cauſe iudge rather ſingularitie faire princeſſe force valour knight againſt intend try ſelfe wherefore pray faire lady ſeperate ſelues aſunder bethinke ſelues vnder whoſe name ſhall enter combate preſent know ſhall purchaſe ſome aduantage company poliphemia greateſt opinion beauty ſelfe amongſt ſpake prince order know wel sir knight victory gaine enter combate princeſſe miragarda procéedeth force loyall friendſhip truely far wherfore fortune chance forſake combate ſhe doth deſerue ſéeing great inconſtancy towards whoſe behalfe ſéeme enter combate damoſelles ſomewhat abaſhed hearing poliphemia ſpake ſo plainely wherevpon prince florian returned anſwere perceiue lady iniurious towards without great occaſion offer truly great diſcourteſie conceiue ſo bad opinion wherefore put ſuch ill
