ſuſpition determined enter combate vnder fauor beautie ſhall well perceiue contrary iudgement riding came laſt caſtle time miragarda lady came forth recreate ſelfe vpon water accompanied giant almoral damoſels knight ſooner beheld beautie th •• faire princeſſe heart preſently depriued libertie yet good qualitie paſſions tormented beautie lady longer continuance miragarda gone pretty diſtance ſaid damoſels ſay beautie gallant princeſſe ſay anſwered poliphemia ſhould diſmay ſelfe iote v conceiueth opinion ſelues may equall beautie miragarda ſooner returned againe ſhee ſate downe caſtle gate greatly delighting ſelfe behold ſo faire company florendos farre armed aſſailes ſomewhat moued ſéeing made liue continuall langout giant almorall beholding beſide knowing well miragarda greatly delight ſée combat ſtrange knight called theſe word sir florendos doe dutie commandeth princeſſe miragarda ſtayes onely behold florendos taking good view damoſels ſéeing knight prepare himſelfe iouſt preſently mounted horſe backe comming knight began manner ſalute pray sir knight tell vpon occaſion come hither ſo compelled bring theſe damoſels place pennance would gladly deliuered peraduenture may fortune ſuch pleaſure promiſe sir florendos anſwered damoſelles knight came hither enterpriſe take guard whereof make ſo great eſtimation onely ſee theſe lady repoſe truſt proweſſe hath conducted thorow many country cannot tell ſaid florendos anſwer ſhould make hath ſo good knowledge neuertheleſſe would deſire breake couple lance may giue little pleaſure princeſſe miragarda ſo fall iouſt hindrance one ſhall lawfull enter combat damoſels knight anſwered thus sir florendos would loth combat againſt although dare ſo bold iuſt little well ſatiſfie deſire princeſſe miragarda delight theſe damoſels beare company whoſe ſakes likewiſe breake two lance sir almaroll himſelfe force greatly enter combate afterward know well ſaid florendos aſſurance haue owne deed make vſe ſuch hardy language therefore agree whatſoeuer iudge reaſonable may aſſure ſelf almaroll faile accompliſh deſire chap xxvi iouſts enterpriſed betweene damoſels knight kept shield princeſſe miragarda combate damoſelles knight giant almaroll theſe knight preparing themſelues iouſt almaroll ſteppee betweene deſiting ſtay little till princeſſe miragarda beneath ground might goe vp caſtle take place window knight readie iouſt ſet ſtaues ground ſtaied till princeſſe miragarda come window florendos contemplated face hauing taken leaue gaue horſe ſpurres againſt damoſels knight met middeſt carrire ſuch great force trunchions lance flew vp aire paſſed nothing ſhaken eſquiers brought new lance wherewith ran together againe couragiouſly burſt ſtaues nobly wherevpon prepared third triall florendos ſomewhat agrieued hauing felt proweſſe aduerſarie feared leaſt miſfortune ſhould happen preſence lady damoſelles knight great doubt whether florendos beſide ſomwhat offended begun iouſt perceiuing well minde prince couzin fortune ſhould diſcountenance preſence beautifull miſtres preuent came theſe wordes thinkes neceſſary sir florendos ſhould content ſelues ſéeing neither v boaſt aduantage iouſt beſide cānot purchaſe great renowne conquering one affectionate ſeruants verily would ſorie ſhould receiue miſfortune hand might hinder place moſt hope wherefore pray giue leaue breake two three launce sir almaroll yéelde ſome contentment theſe lady beare company florendos returned anſwere perceiue ſir knight haue ſo little deſire deal feare nothing may happen witnes ſo well knightly behauiour wherefore pray forſake order tell whence tell name ſaide damoſels knight afterward iouſt againſt much againſt ſo cannot reſolue ſelfe vpon theſe two point ſhould reſt neuertheleſſe becauſe would gladly content well pleaſed venture againe theſe two prince ranne together ſuch force burſt ſtaues hand wherevpon horſes hurt ſo cruelly maiſters fell ground damoſels knight hauing ſhoulder horſe broken florendos horſe ſlaine outright ſo greatly vexe drew foorth ſword willing enter combate damoſels knight perceiuing hée ſtayed friendly language sir knight would gladly intreate forbeare ſo much reſiſtance againſt friend deſireth thing may doe ſeruice beare ſo much good vnto loath enter combate feare haue valor becauſe duty frienſhip forbiddeth mée ſuch vngentleneſſe perſwade ſelfe leſſe courage ſelfe could make good aſſurance victorie would grieue ſée iniured wherefore diſcourteſie may happen either ſide pray ſheath swoord againe reſerue triall therewith till ſuch one come ſhall ſéeke mallicious intent doe princeſſe miragarda heard whole diſcourſe paſſed damoſels knight could haue béene content boldneſſe ſhe ſaw ſée combate tried betwéene florendos ſpake againe manner hardly content ſelfe ſir knight without might ſée one v diſmounted elſe would tell yoe word arteſia one damoſels made anſwere tell ye sir knight order woont vſe ſuch knight knewe leſſe gouerned diſcretion himſelfe would neuer ende fight making excuſe v ſelfe may behold time ſéeing princeſſe miragarda doth fauour content knit vp thus without paſſing triall thinking v vnworthy good truly friend anſwered poliphemia haue ſaide moſt certaine belieue knight ſame opinion himſelfe florian ſmiling made anſwere ſee well faire lady paine haue taken conducting made account neuertheleſſe haue aduantage entiſing word want power deceiue maiſter ſelfe theſe wordes albeit ſpake ſomewhat ſoftly yet princeſſe miragarda well vnderſtande reaſon whereof ſhe tooke preſently one ſlender fidelitie ſhe iudged florendos one libertie loue power ouer himſelfe deſired liue ſuch libertie could haue compaſſed remedy ſo great torment beautie faire miſtreſſe enforced endure returne florendos could ſo wel perſwaded damoſels knight deſired enter combate giant almaroll perceiuing cauſed brought foorth goodly bay courſer ſent damoſels knight requeſt would put himſelfe readineſſe ende two might trie themſelues together would giue ſome delight princeſſe miragarda becauſe ſhe ſhould haue better combate content ſome reward ſhould ordained requitall paine remained conquerour vppon motion damoſels knight made reply looke sir almaroll ſhall pleaſe appoint ſhall finde contrary thereto ſo quoth almaroll victory happen ſide pray giue reward lady named arlence • faile eſtéeme chiefe miſtreſſe affection come paſſe fortune make choyſe ſhall receiue recompence horſe wheron mounted warrant good world truſt ſaid damoſels knight haue already determined ſelfe beſtow vpon ſuch knight make good account yet accept horſe ſo victorie fall ſide come paſſe vanquiſhed lady ſelfe finde heart ſatiſfie requeſt ſhall finde hinder thing content anſwered almaroll hearing ſpeake ſo reaſonably preſume ſhe refuſe knight ſo willing doe ſeruice without word placed lance reſtes couered shieldes gaue horſes spur encountred together ſo brauely damoſels knight forſooke stirrops almaroll caſt ground sable betwéene leg little offended haue ſuch diſgrace eſpecially preſence new choſen friend damoſelles commended greatly gallant beginning chiefely florian woon knightes kept valley almaroll hauing recouered feete drew foorth ſword came marching towards damoſels knight preſently alighted left giant ſhould offer harme horſe charged one another ſuch cruell ſtrokes moued great admiration preſent couragious prince florian well delight damoſels declare nobleneſſe fight prince florendos forgetting withall miragarda ſhould well perceiue ſtood feare knight refuſing combate ſide almarol behaued himſelfe gallantly deſire gaine arlencea ſuch regard loue life neuer fought brauely theſe two champion continued ſuch notable courage ſhort time armour broken many place body ſo grieuouſly wounded blood ranne pitifully almaroll ſo nimble quicke aduerſarie brought greateſt danger meanes whereof glad breake ſquare little take breathing damoſels knight would ſuffer followed intent ſo faſt vpon conſtrained fall earth ſéeming rather dead aliue ſight whereof gréeue prince florendos meaſure ſo much offenſiue princeſſe miragarda ſhe departed window commanding almaroll ſhould brought caſtle preſently done florendos went chamber ſée ſome prouiſion might made wound ſooth dangerous damoſels knight brought ſomewhat aſide damoſels vnarmed dreſſe wound great danger whereupon cauſed himſelfe armed againe mounted horſebacke intending depart thence ſet forward way two knight ſome ſtrange countrey arriued caſtle came deſirous try aduenture one theſe knight carnation colloured armour thicke beſet griffin ſiluer ſheeld figured white hart field sinople knight blacke armour bearing ſhield ſame deuiſe fellow theſe two knight ſooner beheld damoſels knight carnation armour ſpake thus companion ſeemeth sir come vnto place ſhall haue accaſion vſe armor kéepeth ſhield miragarda caſe endure combate knight ſhould ſéeme wherfore becauſe ſhall ſayd came hither vaine goe diſburden one ladyes ſhe méete company certainely anſwered knight cannot content ſelfe thing ſo baſe eſtimation hauing mine eye shield wherein pictured beautie faire princeſſe regard whereof maketh account nothing worthy theſe word companion caſt eye image miragarda hung ſeemelieſt place pillar whereuppon entred theſe ſpéeches ſée good friend haue aduentured place haue beſtowed labour vaine willingly would looſe life whoſe heauenly viſage shield repreſents content ſelfe hope glory aſſure ſayd firſt knight intend depart place without carry shield yet would poſſible firſt make tryall worthineſſe againſt durſt deny take hence aduancing himſelf trée shield placed offered take downe shield damoſels knight perceiuing intent knowing florendos buſie hurt giant almaroll would ſuffer preſence one ſhould offer ſo great wrong prince florendos wherefore regard good bare broched horſe ſpurs came place shield miragarda hanged looke knight • arme puld backward ſo great ſtrength • ell beſide horſe headlong ground withall ſpake manner may well perſwade ſelfe ſir knight deſire trie fortune aduenture ſo forgetfull honour procéede ſo cowardly attending preſence hath authoritie defend shield abſence therefore trie ſuch gentle companion dare preſume carry hence manhood miragarda come againe window take better aduiſe damoſels knight vnderſtanding braue word giuen knight greatly content ſelfe preſenc • tooke vpon ſo worthily defend ſhéeld againſt knight offered take away gotten himſelfe foote againe dr • w forth ſword phrenzie madneſſe came aſſault damoſels knight companion perceiuing came betwéene theſe word pray sir amount vpon horſe mean time trie valour knight may anſwer proude attempt made vpon adua •• ted himſelfe againſt damoſelles knight great deſire witneſſe courage princeſſe miragarda prepared himſelfe brauely méete aduerſarie hée diſcharged ſo nobly hauing full deſire neither ſhielde armour mailecoat could defend puſh lance paſſed cleane thorow body ſo ſtrange knight tumbled beſide horſe ground altogether depriued life damoſels knight gotten launce knight body praunced till came vnder window princeſſe miragarda ſtood expecting comming knight méeting middeſt courſe brake launce prince came together damoſelles knight caught hold enemy shielde hée pulde ſo great force brought head necke horſe permitting leiſure recouer himſelfe gaue owne shield ſuch cruell ſtroke creſt helmet knight ſo giddy therewith could hardly tell recouer himſelfe meane knight thus amazed prince tooke helmet gaue ſuch another heauie ſtroke hee fell beſide horſe foming forth blood mouth aboundantly florendos chamber giant almaroll greatly abaſhed ſéeing combate fought lady shield abſence wherefore fearing leaſt diſpleaſure ſhould come thereby forſooke occaſions went preſently thither hauing well viewed two knight receiued ſmall admiration aduenture damoſels knight perceiued ſpake order sir florendos ſée deedes wherein haue imployed ſelfe onely becauſe would doe ſeruice yet ignorant anſwered florendos wherein ſhall thinke ſelfe beholding ſée two knight brought badde eſtates yet knowe vpon occaſion ſhall sir florendos ſaide damoſelles knight reſolued hereof knight ſée ſlaine wold haue caried away ſhield princeſſe miragarda yet liuing ſlender abilitie fauourer aider others attempt haue giuen vnderſtand thing ſo high eſtimation might woonne without ſome labour thus regard offence offer witneſſe good vnfeinedly beare tooke vpon hinder ſuch diſloyall enterpriſe proofe word may behold whether true pray sir quoth florendos tell deſire know name whoſe proweſſe hath ſo déeply indebted sir florendos anſwered damoſels knight ſatiſfie becauſe ſée ſo deſirous wherefore aduertiſe florian forreſt couzin obedient ſeruice ſuffer receiue iniurie place ſhall preſent florendos great ioy replied thus minde hath béene troubled good well eaſed knowing ſéeing proweſſe wherefore humbly deſire thinke ſo well would ſpend litle time may commune matter ſome importance beſide ſhall cauſe wound giant almaroll ſooner healed grieue ſo much hauing receiued foile ſo noble knight hand doe thinke anſwered damoſels knight would wiſh tarrie haue promiſed viſit place ſhould faile doe ſhould gaine ill report number wherefore deſire ſuffer depart hence would take oath laſt knight conquered ſhall make faithfull promiſe haue knowledge name trauell court king recinde ſhall declare quéene occaſion combate fellow himſelfe deſire againe receiue ill opinion ſudden departure florendos laboured diſſwade iourney would meanes mooued determination wherefore friendly embracing ſet forward way accompanyed damoſels held greater reputation done began waxe contrary eſtéemed euery day worſe chap xxvii happened damoſels knight returned court recinde king spaine early next morning damoſels knight ſet forward iourney court king recinde intending came thither diſcharge himſelfe ſome damoſels becauſe would haue none company arlencea gentlewoman attended ſeruice loath forſake tiil brought place ſhe might marryed according honeſt behauiour deſerued end ſhe ſhould thinke vnmindfull rode thus muſing himſelfe heard voyce woman cry pittifully wood hard way becauſe cry ſo lamentable gaue horſe spurres ridde till came heard noyſe looking ſide beheld banke goodly riuer knight whoſe armour azure colour richly wrought ouer little fillet gold ſhield pictured golden lion siluer field feete held damoſell haire head whoſe beautie deſerued ſuch deſpightfull vſage knight ſhewed held sword drawne hand made ſhow cut head ſhe refuſed obey luſt farre eſpyed another knight tumbling among greene leaues laughed pittifull ſight ſo heartily ready fall ſowne beholding hard ſhift damoſell made helpe ſelfe laughed good ſpake theſe word doth good ſée fortune enforceth take ſuch great pain meanes ſhall eaſed ſuch buſie labour come take pleaſure damoſell damoſels knight perceiuing ſhame theſe knight endeuoured offer damoſell cryed aloude ſhould forbeare villany elſe would cauſe buy pleaſure dearely knight damoſell haire head ſéeing knight ſpake ſo boldly returned preſently anſwer offended sir ſée vſe damoſell manner truſt water ſo broad betwéene would quickly make know price boldneſſe nouertheleſſe thou dareſt tary long faile come thée thou ſhalt well vnderſtand thou méeteſt ſuch knight ſoone allay thy brauery pray companion ſayd knight lay doe offend ſelfe fretting raging iudge beſt go knight hath ſo many damoſels company may take choyce without trouble deſire friend anſwered damoſels knight would tell ford paſſage end may make triall valour haue ſo great deſire come v ſaid firſt knight muſt ſwim ouer know way began againe pull hale damoſell cruelly becauſe would mooue damoſels knight anger earneſt reuenging great ſhame villany making account danger paſſage alighted horſe lept riuer paſſed well recouering furder ſide knight lay among gréene leaues ſaid companion doe trouble ſelfe determination quickly quaile luſtineſſe knight whereto prince thus anſwered hard ſay thing may come paſſe intend hinder pleaſure make ſuch account without word ſetled himſelfe cloſe knight gaue ſuch friendly entertainment tumbled ground left arme broken ſhiuers knight ſéeing miſfortune fellow left damoſell defend himſelfe waightie ſtrokes damoſels knight handled ſuch ſort conſtrained craue aid hand ſought haue abuſed theſe word beſéech faire damoſell forget iniury haue done intreate knight ſaue life damoſels knight held hand would ſtrike becauſe expected damoſell would ſay ſhe beholding amiable countenance would haue forced ſuppriſed exceeding gréefe ſo ſhe pittied ſée ſo neare death ſhe required reuenge diſhoneſt enterpriſe whereupon ſhe ſpake damoſels knight manner let intreate lord ſaue life wicked man may hereafter warned falling like offence promiſe faire damoſell ſayd florian cannot command thing would willingly conſent vnto becauſe knight hath deſerued greater puniſhment yet hath ſuffered giue life vpon condition ſhall take companion beſt manner deuiſe ſhall trauaile king spaines court ſhall declare lady ſhame would haue offered ſhall promiſe neuer weare armour againe without pleaſures ſuffer knight promiſed reſpects accompliſh whereupon eſquires prouided knighly béere whereon knight layd arme broken ſo carryed companion court king recinde damoſels knight walked along riuers ſide holding damoſell hand reaſon exréeding ſeare forgotten eſquire knight would haue rauiſhed bound faſt trée put gagge wood mouth becauſe would bee preuented purpoſe cry long damoſell embraced ſhe deſired prince would returne againe deliuer eſquire miſerable vexation came found two palfrayes vpon prince cauſed eſquire mount commaunding ride along riuers ſide till could finde ſome place get ouer ſide bring horſe meane eſquire went comanded prince vnarmed himſelfe drie garment full water queſtioned damoſell ſhe happened place vppon occaſion knight ſo ſought diſtdneſt word ſhe made anſwer ſhall vnderſtand ſir knight borne countrey belong princeſſe miragarda know whether haue heard yes indéede haue ſaid prince name ladie ſo much renowmed whole world many knight meanes beautie haue wrought themſelues much diſhonour ſaid damoſell tooke occaſion trauaile little countrey fortune ſo vnhappie chaunced méete theſe two knight demaunded place iourney lay miſdoubting harme becauſe behauiour ſeemed honeſt declared vnto whole ſtate iourney whereupon one theſe knight ſpake thus vnto companion thinke good reuenge ſhame haue receiued caſtle giant almaroll ſhould eaſe ou • anger damoſell one attendant princeſſe miragarda reſpect beautie render v ſufficient pleaſure forget foyle tooke puſh launce knight equall fellow vngracious intent preſently allow others iudgement caſt lot ſhould abuſe firſt fortuned fall ſaw pulling ſo cruelly haire head becauſe eſquire grieuing ſée ſo ill intreated cryed aldude ſome might come ſuccour dealt ſo diſcourteouſly haue ſéene béene gratious aſſiſtaunce god knowes ſorrow poore ſoule ſhould haue endured truely madame anſwered prince reioyce chanc • reſkewe yet béene better haue come hither ſuch ſecret wound haue receiued ſingular beautie conſider good deſerts withall readineſſe ſhall finde mée welfare iudge may beſtow gentleneſſe vncourteous knight would haue taken perforce damoſell noting word regarding ſwéet countenance remembring noble behauiour princely courteſie made aunſwere knewe incident purpoſe hee beſt able anſwere harme 〈◊〉 newe 〈◊〉 willeth let alone hearken damoſelles eſquire returned cried prince ſhould preſently mount horſe giue aſſiſtance damoſels knight blacke armour ſought leade away perforce prince hearing word eſquire incenſed ſuch ſudden fury tarrying till armed ranne riuer ſwimme ouer great haſt willing damoſell come paſſe ouer foord eſquire could ſhew bring likewiſe company damoſels ſoone florian paſſed riuer perceiued poliphemia come riding towards cry tearing haire pittifully ſhould make haſt ſuccour miſtreſſe deſirous doe glad follow foote becauſe knight carried away grieuouſly wounded legges horſe fortune ſo much fauoured arlencea ſhe ſpied damoſels knight comming ouertooke gotten halfe mile diſtance riuer hée perceiued knight ſet vp arlencea behinde eſquire could hardly cauſe ſit ſtill horſe ſhe ſtroue ſo often get ground wherfore rid hold horſe damoſels knight ſéeing knight blacke armour clapt helmet head would haue diſmounted defend himſelfe aduanced himſelfe towards arlencea held faſt horſe till damoſelles knight ſtroken ſuch blow betwéene necke ſhoulders fell ground like dead man taking helmet would haue parted head ſhoulders yet pacified furie becauſe would ſend likewiſe lady spaniſh court cauſed eſquire vnarmed held arlencea horſe behinde maiſter wept bitterly deſiring prince haue compaſſion comming againe knight knées commanded declare name called rocamor ſayd knight friend thoſe two knight lately vanquiſh reuengement iniurie intended carry away lady well quoth damoſels knight faile accompliſh charge ſhall commit ſweare ſhall preſently looſe life knight anſwered thus good sir end may eſcape ſo great danger vow ſelfe obedient whatſouer command ſayd damoſels knight preſently take way king spaines court preſent ſelfe lady attendant quéene reporting hath paſſed betweene beſide ſhall neuer liue beare armes againe without ſhall pleaſe licence like charge haue giuen thy two companion haue promiſed fulfill beſéech sir anſwered knight tell end may declare name command thus ſubmit ſelfe king spaines court ſhall ſay quoth prince damoſels knight enioyned pennance ſo bold borrow horſe becauſe haue dealt ſo diſcourteouſly mine cauſing arlencea mount horſebacke left knight returned place damoſell ſtayd comming way conferred arlencea diſhonourably knight countrey behaued themſelues wandring damoſels come reſt company ſaw amongſt siluiana name knight would haue rauiſhed af • oorded gentle welcome damoſels little glad returne lady arlencea feared ſhould neuer haue ſéene againe night drew pace thiy concluded paſſe night becauſe knew prouiſion neare hand euery one tooke modicum ſmall refection afterward layde downe reſt siluiana could ſuffer ſléepe enter eye ſuch good opinion prince ſo farre loue ſhe ſhe rather tooke delight diſcourſe al night thereon entertaine ſuch quiet reſt fellowes chap xxviii prince florendos vanquiſhed knight thoſe knight prince florian cō quered arriued king spain court ſhe damoſels knight departed caſtle giant almaroll prince florendos deſirous execute charge left came vanquiſhed knight deſiring would ſatiſfie whence end cam thither whereto knight thus anſwered ſhall vnderſtand worthy sir borne realme spaine haue béene held good account king recindes court name ſhal know called brandamor companion name sigerall two deſirous ſeeke knightly aduentures among many paſſed honour concluded • make triall conqueſt ſheeld wherein figured heauenly face princeſſe miragarda fortune minding former regard ſhée v cauſed v conquered damoſelles knight could accompliſh meane enter combate whoſe charge onely defende shielde aſſure friend anſwered prince florendos bold diſcourteous enterpriſe tooke hand deſerued greater chaſtiſement haue yet receiued one cannot deale ſeuerely enough thoſe put foorth themſelues ſuch action doeth reproach high diſhonour wherefore may purge ſelfe notorious crime ſhall faithfully proteſt vnto goe ſubmit ſelfe king recindes court ſo preſume contrary haue adioyned ſhall enforce grieuous affliction theſe wound doe haue body knight yet thorowly receiued feare damoſels knight frighted withall vowed faithfully florendos would execute vttermoſt commanded wherefore hauing wound dreſſed preſently betooke himſelfe iourney leauing buriall companion prince day arriued king spaines court loth enter becauſe ſo well knowne king chiefe noble men court notwithſtanding great vnwillingneſſe regard oath ſo much preuailed entred pallace lady beheld repute amongſt number thoſe vanquiſhed damoſels knight becauſe armour ſo faire vnbroken blemiſhed place beſide shield whit impayred deuiſe thereof ſéene pleaſure ſo lady delighted greatly behold brandamor come chamber preſence king quéene together opened helmet knéeling downe quéene rehearſed whole circumſtance charge concerning behauiour damoſels knight reporting great miſfortune ſéeing ſo many friendes preſent colour aroſe ſo redde face neither king quéene knew beene daily conuerſant company generally reputed ſome ſtraunge knight ſo queene demanded occaſion enterpriſed combate damoſels knight brandamor gaue vnderſtand damoſelles knight ſlaine companion sigerall vanquiſhed iouſted againſt knight garded princeſſe miragardaes shield likewiſe combatted giant almaroll brought great daunger life wherevpon king entred theſe ſpeeches certainely cannot chuſe wonder hearing noble proweſſe vnknown knight▪ promiſe thée knight thou deſerueſt haue ſame puniſhment hath happened thy companion aſſure thée would ſee executed thée ſelfe perſwade ſelfe beautie princeſſe miragarda hath rauiſhed mind knight might boaſt better aſſurance themſelues could theſe wordes brandamor came kiſſed kinges hand occaſion king knew made iudge worthily damoſelles knight commaunded chirurgions ſhould vſe good reſpect vnto brandamor becauſe well deſerued valour time paſt ſcantly departed preſence two knight would haue rauiſhed siluian arriued court ſo féeble weake conſtrained leane eſquiers ſhoulders till came king preſence leaſt hurt began vſe language manner gracious lord damoſels knight whoſe renowne ſo highly commended court hauing vanquiſhed v open fielde commaunded v come ſubmitte ſelues excellency iudged according déedes haue deſerued reſpect whereof come preſent ſelues lady court intreate ſo worke behalfe maieſtie offence may pardoned fleſhly willes procured v commit theſe two knight diſcourſed large euery thing happened vppon occaſion king thus ſpake surely doth little content god hath ſuffered receiue puniſhment miſdéedes hand renowned damoſels knight whoſe behalfe loue beare proceede againſt according hainous offence haue worthily deſerued aſſure heare noble valour knight deſirous haue knowledge lord ſaid knight haue great occaſion eſtéeme opinion worthines ought knight ſake therefore humbly intreat maieſtie vſe ſuch perſwaſion lady ſuffer companion beare armes forbidden damoſels knight vntill lady court haue pardoned iniurie offered damoſell knight hardineſſe tooke v promiſe friendes ſaide king good ſo ſlender caſe ſhall receiue fauor ayde knight noting king anſwere deſired quéene might ſtand pleaſure command lady entertaine fauorable iudgements would ſo witneſſe good affection towardes ſo long liued would ready ſpend liues quéene leiſure make anſwere becauſe knight would haue carried away arlencea came humbled himſelfe knées lady declaring damoſelles knight commaunded come render himſelfe mercy without would permit ſhould weare armour conceit thereof ſo grieuous tooke hardineſſe intreate quéene aſſiſt ſute whereto ſhe returned anſwere ſéemeth lady court remaine greatly indebted damoſels knight whoſe ſake wil ſeeme hinder commit thrée diſcretions ſent knight laſt deliuered meſſage ſooner beheld two preſently knewe one called ferrobreque gentafort diſcended giant race ſight cauſed take miſfortune ſo heauily lady vnderſtanding pleaſure quéene concluded giue leaue weare armor warning perill liues vſe place lady damoſels ſhould iniured paſſe let alone whether cauſe iuſt vniuſt ſhould intermeddle withall charge ſeemed vnfriendly knight durſt ſéeme diſlike thereof wherevpon conſtrained allow ſentence afterward tooke leaue departed court good ſpace tydings came spaniſh court damoſelles knight length thrée knight armed brauely arriued pallace euening tide king queene lady walking faire gallerie proſpect whereof court might beholde theſe three knight ſent eſquire declare willes king recinde arriuall eſquire cauſed many aſſemble gallery eſquire come king humbled himſelfe knee theſe word renowned prince theſe three ſtraunge knight commaunded mée let highneſſe vnderſtand haue trauailed long time ſeruice thrée daughter galiaſter duke arragon iudged faire eye theſe thrée knightes albeit found verie falſe loue long time entertayned theſe knightes chiefe affection married vnto thrée gentleman brought vppe father court theſe receiued great contentment conſidering offence haue committed beiug ſo forgetfull owne honour marrie ſuch beſéemed degree theſe thrée knight ſo highly offended hereat haue concluded neuer eſpouſe damoſels onely ſuch wearie owne ſeruants vouchſaf • admit entertainment ſuch foreſaken lady ſhall alledge change equall theſe thrée knight iuſtifie triall thereof againſt combate becauſe theſe ladyes may fauour demand without preiudice renowme declare eſtates theſe knight firſt named luſtramar eldeſt ſonne marqueſſe aſtramor ſecond called arpian ſonne duke archeſte third gradian county artaſia doe altogether humbly deſire theſe lady highneſſe licence would ſhew good willes vnto becauſe ſo deſirous make knowne hauty valour inuincible ſtomackes abide day ſame manner ſee make proofe armes againſt amourous ſeruants ſo fall find lady court deſirous keepe old seruants entertaine theſe ſo newly come content depart hence euen came hither gone hence viſite moſt prince court chriſtendome trie fortune ſo fauourable knit vp earneſt deſires contentment king recinde greatly abaſhed theſe ſudden newes knight moued much aduenture eſpecially regarding eſtates would combate ladyes thus much ſay many among would gladly haue forſaken old fauoured ſeruants condition might marrie theſe three noble prince king quéene allowing well worthy enterpriſe ſtayed great looking ſome one knight court would ſo venterous deale ſéeing none would come prepared themſelues depart inſtant damoſels knight arriued valiant renowmed knight ſooner eſpyed knew came met letting vnderſtand enterpriſe thrée ſtrange knight rehearſed damoſels receiued much ioy thereat wearie hope depart theſe thrée knight prince vnderſtanding intens ſaid vnto ſhall ſelues imagine expedient recempence ſelfe theſe meanes theſe thrée knight great trauaile haue taken dayly ſeruice haue béene ſo greatly deceiued loue ſayd arteſia content change company ſame minde ſaid woone knight forreſt vpon ſent thrée knight preparing themſel • e iouſt willed come deliuer handes would compell ſtay company •• quoth king theſe knight wil attaine cheefe enterpriſe againſt hardy damo • ſels knight arteſia companion forſooke company arlencea put themſelues apart lady court perceiuing could chuſe maruell thereat knowing wel proweſſe knight conducted iudged occaſion damoſels deſire themſelues might owne libertie others reputed cauſe ſome vnfaithfulnes found knight gradian ſéeing day waſt apace tooke hardineſſe aduance himſelfe foorth firſt making ſhow iouſt damoſels knight beholding gaue horſe ſpurs encountred gradian ſo great force made fetch errand ground hee came arteſia theſe word neceſſarie againe come obey ſhall command receiued another launce one king page brought vnhorſed arpian becauſe learned ſit faſt sadle luſtramar angry miſfortune friend wherfore encountred damoſels knight ſo nobly cauſed forſake one stirrops himſelfe ſent kéepe fellowes company theſe thrée knight ſéeing diſhonour receiued iouſt offered trie combate sword chiefly luſtramar ſéeme moſt deſirous damoſels knight excuſed himſelfe ſéeing day departing ſo ſpéedily darke night ready ouercharge yet would luſtramar content anſwere poliphemia perceiued ſhe came vnto theſe word pray sir knight content ſelfe ſéeke • urther occaſions time aſſure guide ſo litle woont conquered deale well contented hauing felt indéede put vp ſoyle fall haue found ſo ſmall aſſurance anſwered luſtramar woman word counſell forbeare follow enterpriſe promiſe ſaid arteſia boaſt bargaine end theſe two knight prepared themſelues combate king recinde deſirous know damoſelles knight came himſelfe place theſe two knight offering charge one another hee ca • ſed parted • oure honourably brought pallace damoſelles knight humbly ſaluted quéene hauing taken helmet hée kneeled downe kiſſe hand king knew preſently imbraced louingly ſpeaking thus queene madame pray make good account deedes honour haue receiued knight hath finiſhed rare aduentures euer aſſuring prince florian forreſt otherwiſe called knight sauage man sonne prince edward princeſſe flerida great friend queene hearing theſe wordes tooke vp armes imbracing gratiouſly charged great diſcourteſie paſſed court would ſuffer himſelfe knowne luſtramar companion knowing vanquiſhed noble knight sauage man made account foyle receiued next morning departed thence deſired prince eſteeme vnfeined friend two dayes knight sauage man deſirous leaue court spaine whervpon tooke leaue king quéene leauing siluian court becauſe ſhe well knowne alſo arteſia companion wept parting loſſe could recouer againe queene tooke leaue friendly gianteſſe arlencea becauſe prince florian make ſo good account king recinde brought foorth citie taking courteous farewell ſides charging doe commendation emperor child emperours court king returned againe citie prince rode iourney chap xxix happened knight sauage man came caſtle arnalte princeſſe nauarre made abode florian forreſt forgetting take new armour departed king spaines court yet kéeping deuiſe ſhield sauage man ſtill becauſe greater delight therein manner trauelled atchieuing many rare ſingular aduentures breuities ſake let paſſe becauſe ſuch importance placed among knightly déeds coaſted along diuers country fortune length arriue pleaſant valley euen caſtle princeſſe arnalte ſtood ſhe rid abroad hunting alſo ſée combate fought betweene dragonlat ſonne drapos another knight would confeſſe princeſſe arnalte faireſt lady earth aſſure preſence arnalte gaue ſuch encouragement dragonalt vanquiſhed aduerſary without great endamagement perſon armour azure colour bearing ſhield ſame deuiſe miragarda enioyned came princeſſe caſtle almaroll left honour day vppon occaſion arnalte greatly ſtomacke knight beautifull gratious often fortunate triall aduentures continued ſuch earneſt affection ſeruice ſhe end began fauour courteous deed regard ſhe done returning knight sauage man princeſſe company damoſels eſpyed comming far whereupon ſhe came draganolt ſhe graciouſly ſaluted ſhe ſaid behold come onely man world cruell enemy deſire ſeuerely reuenged wherefore eſpeciall good friend deſire ſée vttermoſt redoubted behauiour fortune regard ſuch happineſſe enioy danger fight wil faile recompence ſuch ſort ſhall thorowly ſatiſfied contented promiſe make anſwered dragonalt ſuch eſtimation thought word onely able aſſure victorie albeit fortune ſhould ſéene ſet ſelfe againſt perſwade yourſelfe vnpoſſible vanquiſhed continue acceptable fauour hope whereof onely enter combate knight deſire haue reuenge wrong likewiſe depriue ladyes yea life ſhall like ſo command dragonalt ſpent amorous ſpéeches ladie miſtreſſe conquered thought knight sauage man company came place ſtayed dragonalt content honor princeſſe aduanced himſelfe forward theſe word sir knight let know arre arriued place thought méete make triall valour ſhall finde ſuch authoritie enforce obey commandement princeſſe cauſe confeſſe ſhe faireſt lady liuing earth beſt worthy knightly ſeruice haue diſpoyled armour ſhall goe ſubmit yourſelfe lady miſtreſſe arnalte princeſſe nauarre ſhall accept ſeruice thoſe damoſels company becauſe pittie ſee ſo ouercharged whereto prince florian thus replyed princeſſe nauarre friend ſo deſirous ſerued damoſelles great ſhame haue ſought preſent might haue found better acquainted damoſelles princeſſe arnalte might haue receiued far honoour thoſe thinke ſhall defend well enough comming ſeruice moreouer ſhould ſo impudent confeſſe large title haue made ſhould imagine ſelfe depriued wittes ſelfe ſeruant ſuch gratious ladie princeſſe arnalte may way equall beautie ſhall make confeſſe depart dragonalt offended heare word knight sanage men tooke ſtrong launce eſquire bowing himſelfe princeſſe aſſiſt fauour broched horſe againſt prince likewiſe prepared himſelfe iouſt encountred together ſo valiantly dragonalt breaking launce knight sauage man shéelde lifted vppon croupher horſe dragonalt himſelfe caſt forth saddle vpon prince florian caſt himſelfe horſe dragonalt hauing recouered feete beganne charge one another furiouſly dragonalt intended accompliſh promiſe would fight till knight sauage man depriued life found himſelfe greatly deceiued noble florian handled ſuch ſort prindeſſe arnalte well perceiued ſtrength knight began faile maruaile gréeuouſly wounded many place whereat knight sauage man greatly offended fearing ſhould kill outright pauſed awhile becauſe would ſuffer take breath deſired giue ouer combat returne paſſage enterpriſed guard dragonalt gaue anſwer counſell • r knight neceſſarie followed made account life honour fight therefore let vnderſtand intend giue ouer combat began combat freſh wounding one another ſo cruelly arnalte damoſels greatly pittie ſée knight ſo cruelly bent blood altered colour graſſe fought end dragonalt able endure longer fell downe knight sauage man féete princeſſe preſently fearing would cut head friend ſhe ſpake manner pray ſir knight take life conſidering victorie ſufficient honorable mind promiſe madame anſwered knight sauage man wil hold hand without recant former word promiſe gift intend demand pray ſaid arnalte let riſe content grant euer requeſt prouided alwayes ſeeme impeach mine honor knight sauage man gaue dragonalt hand princeſſe arnaltaes damoſelles preſently vnarmed conueied caſtle haue woundes dreſt daunger whereof ſo grieuous conceyt minde becauſe againe conquered preſence ladie knight sauage man lodged without caſtle arnalte thinking ſhe ſhould neuer reuenged ſoiourned three dayes end whereof came take farewell finding prince dragonalts chamber fell conference reprouing ſmall account ſeemed haue whereupon made anſwer madame firme conſtant kinde beautifull thing moſt neceſſarie durſt awarrant knight could conuicted manner beſide knight would willingly ioyne ſeruice aſſure offred compell againſt would willingly haue granted owne deſire ſo deſirous doe faire lady ſeruice remembring alwayes ſuch ought well eſtéemed forgotten ſhall vnderſtand haue béene court england spaine little renowned beauty faire lady nouriſhed likewiſe haue ſéene florenda daughter arnedes king fraunce whoſe beautie honoured great many ſhée champion named thoſe haue rehearſed ſelfe may compare lady emperour palmerins court haue ſéene gridonia polinarda leonarda princeſſe thrace sidelia daughter king tarnaes lacedemonia haue ſéene alſo princeſſe targiana daughter great turke whoſe loue albayzar soldane babilon hath ſuffered dangerous trauailes theſe iudgement highly aduanced beauty beyond ſo granted wedded affection towards let offend ſpeake plainely crueltie pride together doeth much deface title beautie cannot deny ſelfe making ſo light account doe ſir dragonalt remembring worthy knight sonne one moſt valiant prince earth triall ſufficient cauſe loue faithfully truſt muſt needes ſay hath put himſelfe danger vnfaithfull perſon neither knightly bountie regard owne duty hath power mooue reſpect therefore made promiſe grant requeſted deſire recompence noble deſerts would accept lord huſband ſo ſhall fulfill promiſe accompliſh commandement king father charged ſhould fulfill reſpect anſwere ſee man ſhould build aſſurance word sir knight anſwered arnalte fauour tel firſt afterward doe good ſatiſfie requeſt knowledge faire lady ſaide knight sauage man ſhall hinderance matter wherefore aduertiſe called florian forreſt sonne edward engliſh prince flerida daughter emperor palmerin • agonalt hearing theſe word ſpake thus victory haue obtained sir knight ſhould looſe nothing elſe reputation good knight could iote offended vanquiſhed handes alwayes returneth combat conquerour ſeeing fruſtrate hope ſhould yéeld content cannot chuſe complaine fortune hath cauſed fall ſo great perplexitie arnalte vnderſtanding knight sauage man sonne noble prince edward ſhe began bluſh remembring paſſed betwéene deſirous ſhe match mariage ſeeing ſhe might doe ſhe would ſhe contented ſelfe requeſt declaring minde manner thinke sir knight could ſo nobly vanquiſh enterpriſe knight would ſtudy practiſe deceiue poore ſimple woman neuertheleſſe behauiour prince dragonalt enforceth obey deſire vpon condition within one yéere hee ſhall bring mee court emperour palmerin well vnfained reuerence beare maieſtie alſo acquainted thoſe gratious lady haue named god forbid madame ſaide knight sauage man ſhould agrée lawfull requeſt rather becauſe knowe preſence greatly honour emper • ur court florian offered kiſſe princeſſe arnaltes hand ſhe imbraced courteouſly dragonalt would haue humbled himſelfe féete would ſuffer riſe bed made ſuch eſtimation hee ſent chiefe gouernours realme hauing knowledge knight sauage man iudged mariage dragonalt princeſſe according ought greater honour prince florian cauſed marriage ſolemnized preſently caſtle next morning came take leaue prince dragonalt quéene arnalte hauing made promiſe would faile accompany emperours court tooke way iourney forſake ſpeake ſomewhat prince albayzar chap xxx prince albayzar embarqued himſelfe ſaile turkie preſented himſelfe prince thrace albayzar soldane babylon deſirous leaue king spaines court thrée dayes tried iouſt againſt noble prince florian forreſt taking farewell king quéene lady thoſe knight court friend ſet forward way accompanied two eſquires making ſuch ſpéedy haſte long attained cittie conſtantinople comming pallace proude ſtately ieſture entred chamber preſence found emperour empreſſe lady beſide chéefe prince knight court making reuerence ſtood viewing among lady ſéene might repute princeſſe thrace laſt iudging prince ſate next vnto faire polinarda came knéeling ſaluted theſe ſpéeches madame inſtant depart king spaines court knight arriued accompanied nine damoſels trying iouſts moſt redoubted knight court vnhorſed brauely one another ſight hereof made deſirous hazard fortune ſuch ill hap ſerued done knight hauing thus conquered enforced make faithfull promiſe would come ſubmit ſelf declare meſſage would command condition ſo made either part began iouſt knight charged ſay vnto ſmall griefe vnto ſince fortune would preſent eſpecial occaſion whereby might declare good bare neuertheleſſe deſired humbly would make acceptance firſt ſeruice though ſo great eſtimation ſingularitie deſerues remaine know cauſe ſhall like imploy may doe ſeruice albayzar well knowne emperor court great ioy made ſide arriual emperor himſelfe well pleaſed ſée come ſo good diſpoſition good regard princeſſe targiana lady whoſe vertuous deſerts bound carefull albayzars health proſperity ſafe deliuerance princeſſe thrace aroſe taking albayzar hand ſpake thus vnto pray sir albayzar doe ſhall pleaſe emperour command iudge nothing hurtfull vnto ſéeing great deſire hath reioyce princeſſe targiana preſence albayzar tooke good part gentleneſſe princeſſe thrace vſed towards hauing giuen hearty thankes courteſie came ſaluted empreſſe princeſſe gridonia afterward came emperour taking armes entred theſe ſpéeches aſſured sir albayzar soldane olorique father receiued great contentment imbraced doe yet deſirous doe honour well friendſhip beare father recompence ſome part great courteſie haue receiued princeſſe targiana eſpouſed lady may commaund thing ſhe ſhall thinke good court ſory cannot perſwade ſelfe may doe much gracious lord anſwered albayzar ſo ſimple vnderſtanding well perceiue great honour haue alwayes offoorded yet cannot forget ſhame receiued court vanquiſhed likewiſe haue done iuſtice prince florian iniury offered princeſſe targiana albeit great turke father requeſted hand right iuſtice daily permit euery one kindred preuaileth ſo towardes heare iuſtice calleth ſée well ſaid emperour reaſon cannot preuaile certifie yet princeſſe targiana came hither owne good compelled enforced therto florian forreſt nephew referring talke becauſe vſed among friend pray imagine ſelfe welcome goe reſt ſelfe chamber gallies prouided haue expected comming ſince ſonne polendos knight arriued conſtantinople lord ſaid albayzar take time ſo commodious mée ſaile vſe ſo good opportunitie therefore intend ſtay longer countrey eeuen pleaſe anſwered emperor méet ſhould diſſwade ſo reſolute ambaſſador ſtaied came reuerently prince albayzar hold gallies ready sea good caſe winde well voyage prince albayzar tooke leaue emperor empreſſe lady accompanied prince primaleon polendos belcar giant dramuſiande others came port galley lay giant dramuſiande ſéeing ſmall account albayzar made prince bare company ſpake vnto manner ſée well albayzar emperor worthy blamed ſhewing honour ſuch vnthankefull perſon ſeemes regard prince primaleon father requeſt cōming grace company albeit needed abaſe himſelfe ſo much tuſh sir anſwered albayzar long ſince knew ſmall good thou couldeſt allow tell thée noble mind diſdaineth familiarity accoūteth better enemy thus thou maiſt perſwade thy ſelfe enemy emperor court ſo thou maiſt tell wherefore ſhould vſe courteſie prince primaleon ſhewe worſt wherefore ſir dramuſiande grieue ſee behaue ſelfe doe among mine enemy promiſe returne much expedition witneſſe walles citie haue houre minde could wiſh ſaide dramuſiande thou haſt béene thou wouldſt wert returned hither againe might reuenge iniurie thou didſt thou waſt ſo bold cary away ſhield princeſſe miragarda albayzar make anſwere prince primaleon tooke dramuſiāde hant knight returned pallace gaue emperor vnderſtand good prince albayzar bare gallies launced déepe marriners hoy • ed ſayles hauing wind ſo ſhort time reached great caire great turke made abode iudged emperour palmerin would offended entertainement gaue knight knowledge arriuall galley ſo ioyfull came himſelfe receiue prince hauen deſirous queſtion emperor honeſt vſage towards feared leaſt owne intent treaſon would reprooue albayzar remained certaine time great turkes court attending comming principall eſtates babilon would haue preſēted ſecond ſolemnizing marriage honoured preſence soldane perſia king bythinia king gaſplia king terbifonde beſide many prince knight concluded together paſſe sea lay ſiege citie conſtantinople becauſe would ſuddainely execute intent ſeuerely returned dominion make preparation traiterous enterpriſe chap xxxi happened knight tiger departed perillous iſle taking iourney towards citie conſtantinople knight tiger hiſtory hath beene ſilent along time entred foyſt argentao gouernour profoūd iſle time wind ſo contrary faine take landing ſame iſle ſoiourned certaine day earneſt importunitie inhabitant could thinke themſelues neuer enough ſatiſfied company yet long deſire ſée citie conſtantinople made imagine time tedious till came thither length much doe hee departed thence galley accompanied friend siluian uew armour cauſed bée made profound iſle kéeping deuiſe golden tiger renowned thorow country chriſtendome hauing ſayled long time hee came laſt coaſt scotland minde ſerued well goe ſhoare trauelled thrée dayes countrey came goodly valley along middeſt thereof great riuer far beheld faire houſe ſtanding riuer ſide hauing bride paſſage kept knight gréene armour bare shield white bull deuiſe made ſuſpect ſhould brother pompides ſide bridge croſſed ouer another part riuer eſpied another knight ſeemed hardy man knight bull rich armour might paſſe bride without hée firſt combate defended would endure fight hée muſt yeeld himſelfe armiſia king scot daughter houſe belonged ſtrange knight attending got horſebacke put fortune triall ſet libertie paſſage failed intent ſhall heare hereafter rendred himſelfe mercy armiſia ordained cuſtome ende ſhe might haue houſe furniſhed kinges good courage whereof ſhe knew ſhe ſhould get number becauſe paſſage one chiefeſt scotland none could get ſide riuer without paſſed bridge ſo large foure knight might eaſily combate thereon ſo well fenced either ſide could bee daunger riuer fought combate knight tiger ſtayed ſée ende combate betwéene theſe knight viewing well knight bull lifted vp feuere helmet ſpeake damoſell ſtood looking foorth window perfectly perſwaded brother pompides hauing concluded familiar talke damoſell tooke lance came forth vpon bridge whereupon ſtrange knight ſpake manner feare sir knight ſhall hindered night draweth faſt vpon v make end combate whereto ſée prepare ſelfe onely witneſſe ſeruice damoſell window materiall sir anſwered knight bull ſake enterpriſe fight doubt good promiſe without word ranne together couragiouſly broken lance met ſo fiercely body fell beſide horſes ground recouered themſelues drew ſwordes wherewith fought doubtfull daungerous combate aduantage whereof fell knight bull yet ſo eaſily glad reſt himſelfe enemie perceiued leaned himſelfe againſt wall giuing theſe ſpéeches ſtrange knight ſay sir doe perſwade ſelfe haue power ſufficiently accompliſh haue promiſed wherefore would counſell reſerue manhood occaſions better loſe life therefore bee ruled aduiſe goe ſubmitte ſelfe princeſſe armiſia deale diſcourteouſly ſo render ſeruice vnto willingly ſtraunge knight returned aunſwer sir knight know well profite danger come ſhould doe perſwade mée therefore pray let talke paſſe let v end haue begun ſo without attending anſwer began charge knight bull againe entertained ſuch ſort ſhort time felt himſelfe feeble reſiſt hardy ſtrokes enemy gaue ſo end vnable continue longer loſt ſo much blood yt fell downe knight bull taking helmet ſpake vnto manner ſhall vnderſtand sir knight cauſe ſcorned follow counſell ſhall now▪ whether goe ſubmit ſelfe princeſſe armiſia refuſe doe fayle part head ſhoulders know sir anſwered ſtraunge knight theſe two condition ſhould chuſe wherewith preſent ſo dangerous ſeeme would willingly receiue death hand goe ſubmit ſelfe pleaſed nothing elſe adioyning moſt ſhamefull death knight bull ignorant reaſon feared ſo much goe render himſelfe princeſſe armiſia deſired would tell name truely sir ſaid ſtrange knight intend ſo much ſatiſfie yet ſome contentment vanquiſhed▪ conquerour hath knowledge knight bull ſéeing ſo obſtinate ſent eſquire princeſſe armiſia deſiring ſo pleaſure grant knight life armiſia alwaies courteous preferment fauour commanded one damoſelles goe knight bull tell ſhould giue knight life knowledge damoſell ſooner come bridge ſhe preſently knew vanquiſhed knight adraſpe ſonne duke sizana ſlaine prince doriell brother lady miſtreſſe armiſia reuenge whoſe death guarding paſſage firſt ordained vpon damoſell began crie aloude teare haire pittifully ſaying come ſlaine prince doriell lady hearing ſhe came downe immediatly damoſels waiting ſhée wéeping bitterly ſhe ſpake knight bull manner pray sir knight let haue aſſiſtance deliuered grieuous paſſions wherein haue long time remained ſhall vnderſtand knight haue conquered ſame flew brother doriell whoſe death king father liueth extreame heauineſſe knight tiger marking word ſpake order friend siluian ſée wel dangerous fall hand woman deſirous vengeance deale hundred good hardy knight wherefore pray thée take horſe goe ſée entreatance life may ſaued came bridge deſired knight bull would offer knight cruelty turning princeſſe armiſia ſaluted theſe ſpéeches madame anciant enmitie cauſeth deſire death knight pray admit memorie lady ſo great calling ought void lenitie pittie chiefely ſuch time haue moſt power execute extremitie reaſons ſufficient appeaſe anger pray yet conſider ſelfe perſons vſe crueltie may ſhew pittie repent themſelues afterward collericke moode ouerblowne paſt honeſt vertuous language knight tiger power mooue pittie princeſſe armiſia ſhe commanded knight bull ſhould cut head enemie prince gaue theſe wordes promiſe madame neither pittie perſwaſion may preuaile ſtand ſuch eyeſore way ſelfe ſhall execute malicious humour would heart ſaid knight bull might pleaſe princeſſe grant knight life ſince preſume ſo boldly defend refuſe albeit ſo ſore wounded let vnderſtand neither ſhall hinder fulfilling lady hath commanded knight tiger vſe theſe wordes end hee would enter combate pompides onely change rigorous humour armiſia becauſe saw knight ſuch danger ſuch cruell minde princeſſe ſhée continued ſtill one ſong calling head vanquiſhed knight adraſpe great expence blood griefe ſée wreakefull armiſia ended life knight tiger pompides preparing themſelues combat armiſia ſéeing adraſpes dead could yet contented therewith becauſe head ſmitten ſhe commanded wherefore becauſe pompides accompliſh ſhe willed ſhée flang away furie went chamber pompides brought great extremitie loue ſo grieue departure conſtrained ſet downe vpon bridge knight tiger perceiuing heauines tooke pitty came comfort pompides ſéemed diſdaine becauſe iudged preſence procured miſfortune siluian ſéeing maiſter returne came walking horſe bridge pompides hauing eſpied knew preſently knight tiger renowed palmerin england perſwaſion great ioy hee conceiued came theſe word well aſſured gratious lord comfort receiued preſent inſtant deface extinguiſh former miſhaps palmerin tooke helmet hauing imbraced pompides beganne perſwade good hope lady ſooner forgotten anger ſhee reprooued ſelfe great vnkindneſſe ſhee ſent intreate pompides would pardon ſo pleaſure bring knight houſe whoō ſhe ſaw ſo familiar pompides vnderſtanding princeſſe took brother hand walked chamber vnarmed princeſſe came ſelfe viſit entring theſe ſpéeches knight tiger beſéech sir knight excuſe made account honeſt courteous word aſſure great danger wherein inſtant would ſuffer regard perſwaſion whatſoeuer onely reuenge ſelfe cruell enemy becauſe ſhal conceiue ill opinion tell cauſe enuied knight ſo much ſhall vnderſtand sir daughter meliadus king scot whoſe court adraſpe eldeſt ſon duke sizana pompides hath ſlaine▪ beganne waxe amourous becauſe knew bée one bad condition made regard earneſt ſuite neuertheleſſe ſo importunate voyde reaſon would anſwered wherupon conſtrained complaine prince doriell brother adraſpe perceiued himſelfe bee hated deſpiſed practiſed way might beſt reuenged following ſecret trayterous intent long opportunitie execute mallicious ſtomacke ſo chanced one day brother appointed walke abroade together adraſpe priuily armed hauing hand ſuch prouided purpoſe ſlew brother whoſe death king father could accompliſh reuenge becauſe hée ſhould deale one chéefeſt prince realme beſt aſſured friend yet heart frée continuall vexation reſpect nature could otherwiſe chuſe pittying willing aſſiſt father vttermoſt could left court cauſed houſe erected place chiefeſt paſſage realme enterpriſed haue ſome valiant knight defend birdge promiſing marry could ſo happie kill adraſpe alwayes accuſtomed bearing proude loftie minde would oftentimes come ſhow himſelfe onely vexe remembrance brother death ſtill hee would combatte knight euermore ſo fortunate vanquiſh kill knight bull tooke charge vpon adraſpe heard noble proweſſe remained two moneths could come hither againe yet laſt came trie fortune againſt knight bull hath depriued life ſée ſatiſfied wil made ordaine cuſtome madamy anſwered knight tiger ſhould haue helpe taking life told firſt great wrong done earth open ſwallow thoſe intend practiſe treaſon againſt prince yea prince himſelfe cannot frée ſuch ſecret conſpirators fauour ſhall ſtand ſtéede iuſtice ſuch wicked offendors wherefore ſharpely puniſhed reſt better warned tran • greſſion aſſure madame haue done well beſéemed vertuous princeſſe cutting branch fortune made inſtrument vnhappineſſe beſide duetie wherein bound knight father command ſhould ſée ſo good déede executed therefore let humbly intreate would kéepe promiſe sir pompides brother nephew king frederick england ſonne prince edward father friend ſée well ſayde armiſia haue wrought contentment knight father taken vengeance death prince doriel brother proweſſe whoſe preſence ſmall honour neuertheleſſe may thinke ſelfe little beholding hath concealed himſelfe ſo long would haue allowed honourable entertainment pray sir let offēd deſire know whether yon prince palmerin florian forreſt brother affectioned one becauſe would know fortune hath made ſo happy ſée prince returned anſwer florian forreſt madame ſo farre place hardly one tell meete wherefore may perſwade ſelfe palmerin pleaſe may command ſeruant princeſſe armiſia embraced gratiouſly reioycing ſhe might way accompliſh meanes honour becauſe king meliadus father brother quéene england prince edward mother death proude adraſpe reported ſame day king scot court foure league place name knight ſlaine whereupon king vpon next meaning tooke coatch accompanied many worthy knight came ſée prince palmerin england hauing giuen many gratious ſalutations tooke pompides hand promiſing make good eſtimation prince ſonne liued aged king ſate familiarly talking armiſia daughter archbiſhop esbreque arriued pompides armiſia preſently married together departing thence went ſtrongly ſeeke duke sizana father proud adraſpe king vowed put death kéepe priſoner reckoned without hoſte duke aduertiſed intent fled • ireland whereupon good liuing fell king handes england hauing knowledge pompides marriage made triumph bonfire good fortune happened pompides well beloued euery one well sonne prince edward vertuous bounty knightly courage chap xxxii knight tiger tooke leaue meliadus king scot princeſſe armiſia daughter happened vnto voyage nuptials pompides ſolomnized great contentment king scot whole realme knight tiger tooke leaue king princeſſe armiſia accompanied brother pompides embarqued gaue vnderſtand charge wherein prince bound receiued royall dignitie deſiring earneſtly ſince fortune brought ſo great felicitie would vſe himſelfe modeſtly wiſely becauſe fortune ſo vncertaine ſelfe ſometime ſhe put thoſe perſons greateſt feare ſhe placed moſt aſſurance whereby ſhe letteth vnderſtand ſhe quickly diſpoſſeſſe happineſſe ſuch time little looke ſuch alteration end may enioy dignitie moſt aſſurance counſell entertaine ſubiects amitie adminiſtring iuſtice rightly vnto let bee done ſo good zeale conuerted rigour cruelty whereby ſhall cauſe ſay gouernor become tyrannous vnmercifull lord anſwered pompides wordes ſauouring ſo good iudgement worthy moſt high commendation cannot thinke ſelfe much bound noble friendly counſell aſſuring lodge faithfully heart accompliſh according gracious commaundement otherwiſe ſhall iudge ſelfe vnworthy named brother many ſuch like ſpéeches paſt betwéene imbraced one another pompides returning citie palmerin entring shippe cauſed ſayles hoyſed winde ſeruing ſo well ſpent ſuch time méete ſo great iourney prince tooke landing hungaria paſt diuerſe place countrey chaunce arriue goodly forreſt length came faire fountaine couered arke maruellous ingenious workemanſhip becauſe weather excéeding hot alighted refreſh himſelfe fountaine meane siluian ſuffered horſes graſe paſture prince waſhed hand face eſpyed little downe forreſt damoſel running ſpéedily haire hanging ſhoulders tearing faire viſage nailes cry wéeping meaſure laſt ſhe eſpyed knight tiger ſhe came running great pace caſting ſelfe féete ſhe remained fearefully looking good hauing power ſpeake one word knight tiger ſéeing perplexed caſe began pittie much doubted leſt feared would make purſuite called helmet ſooner claſped head beheld comming way damoſell came giant ſtrongly armed carying hand huge mace ſéeing damoſell demaunded ſuccour knight tiger ſpake vnto manner truſt damoſell betake ſelfe ſimple aſſurance knight wanteth ſtrength defend againſt without word ſtrooke prince mace put shield reſiſt ſtroke ſo rigorous shield flewe two piece prince ſomewhat offended hereat wherefore drawing ſword gaue giant ſuch blowe arme afterward could hardly ſtrike great purpoſe damoſell remaining ſtill extreame feare cruell intreatance gigant vſed would haue departed hide ſelfe forreſt becauſe ſhe iudged knight tiger vnable ſubdue enemy siluian perceiuing came vnto counſelled ſee end combat wherevpon ſhe gaue theſe word pray gentle eſquier friend would ſéeme hinder giant nay rather deuill whoſe force none found able reſiſt aſſuredly put death hath ſlaine maiſter would yet ſaid siluian would ſtay ſée ende fight peraduenture may happen otherwiſe expect knight tiger deſtitute shield auoid cruell ſtrokes ſtrong enemy behaued himſelfe ſo politiquely nimbly hee lent giant many ſore blowes cōſtrained becauſe could lift mace right hand vſe left thinking yet deale well enough knight tiger prince ſo fierce vpon hauing giuen many grieuous mortall wound heart began faile ſo retired able reſiſt ſo many waighty ſtrokes neuertheles prince ſéeing almoſt brought buy let flie ſtill ſo fiercely could haue meane charge againe giant perceiuing himſelfe ſuch extremitie leaned backe againſt trée defended himſelfe great ſo well prince could hardly reach hurt hee waged fight euery way ſo preciſely mace hee held hand watching time might giue prince ſuch ſtroke willingly would knight tiger might preuaile againſt giant without hazarding perſon great danger went reſted himſelfe againſt trée like wiſe giant beheld ſpake vnto order pray thee sir knight let find ſo much friendſhip thy hand let vnderſtand thy name becauſe haue euermore thought ten beſt knight earth could much thou haſt done neither could haue bene able reſiſt halfe content anſwered knight tiger ſatiſfie thy ſo much condition thou wilt promiſe tell thy name cauſe thou doeſt purſue damoſell much quoth giant thou ſhalt commaund handes wherefore thou ſhalt vnderſtand called vaſcalion ocrance sonne giant lucran ſlaine conſtantinople hand primaleon whō ſo hardy enter combate reuenge death perrequin duas haue marriage gridonia ducheſſe ormeda afterward eſpouſed primaleon time father ſlaine left kéeping one brother named dramoque likewiſe ſlaine one ſonnes prince edward england knight yet ſearch knightly aduentures aſſure little agréeued ſée ſelfe caſe becanſe almoſt depriued hope reuenge death father brother dye damoſell ſo fortune cauſed méet day vnderſtood ſhe going court emperor palmerin viſite leonarda princeſſe thrace deſirous iniurie may emperours court endeuored ſelfe rauiſh damoſell time fulfill pleaſure eſquire eſcaped hand came hindered ayd fiue knight haue left hold combat ten knights▪ becauſe would follow damoſel tooke ſelfe flight ſo ſoone fiue knight began charge thus haue told whole circumſtance minde remaineth reueale ſelfe according firſt promiſed beléeue vaſcalion anſwered knight tiger neceſſary thou ſhouldeſt receiue ſharpe chaſtiſement vſing thy life ſuch wicked action proofe hereof thou mayſt behold thy ſelfe thou content death thy father brother ſéekeſt reuenge thy villainous innocent damoſell let thée know therefore kinſeman primaleon ſame man ſlew thy father brother made called palmeran england sonne prince edward faire flerida siſter primaleon whoſe ſake intend take thy life thée depart vaſcalion theſe word began greatly diſmay himſelf knew well ſtrength ſufficient hold long againſt yet preſently aduanced himſelfe ſhew deſire reuenged ſlaine vuckle palmerin glad perceiued gianc forſaken trée ſerued rampire defence aſſayled ſuch furious ſtrokes giant would gladly haue reſted himſelfe againe prince followed ſtill ſo earneſtly length tumbled ground content ſée ſo conquered ſet foote vpon taken helmet preſently parted head ſhoulders ſight hereof made damoſell ſo glad ſhe forgotten feare wherein ſhe giant purſued came knight tiger theſe word faire damoſell iudge fiue knight combate occaſion cannot otherwiſe chuſe great daunger wherefore goe ſéeke foorth ſuccour meane may come faire ſoftly eſquire better eaſe ſhall take vp behinde horſe tooke way ſaw giant come purſued damoſell long heard clanching swordes wherevpon gaue horſe ſpurs neuer left gallopping till came ſawe ſlaine foure giant knight ſixe two could defend themſelues purpoſe knight tiger knew dramian king recind • ſonne armour deuiſe bare shield alighting horſe put himſelfe among friendes charging one fought ſo ſtoutly tumbled réeling ground fiue perceiuing ſo greatly diſmayed ſhort time knight tiger companion made ende wretched liues damoſell arriued ſoone ſight siluian made knight tiger preſently knowne theſe fiue knight little glad company knowne approoued friend firſt dramian ſonne king recinde friſoll ſonne duke drapos normandie luyman burgundy tremoran brandedon al theſe fiue knight conducted eſquers little village farre forreſt carefully attended till wound healed knight tiger kept company two thrée dayes afterward tooke leaue ſetting forward next way could deuiſe bring conſtantinople emperor preſently giuen vnderſtand death vaſcalion tenne knight newes highly welcome emperours court chap xxxiii knight tiger arriued emperor court conſtantinople aduenture offered arriuall becauſe prince palmerin deſirous conſtantinople left company damoſell fiue knight emperours court continuing ſo long trauaile length came empire conſtantinople without finiſhing aduenture worthy rehearſall aſſure deuiſe tiger bare ſhield made ſuch report place abroad none would willingly meddle néerer prince approched conſtantinople found himſelfe paſſioned loue lady remembring vnkind ſpeeches ſharpe entreatance ſhe vſed departed court ſo earneſt thought durſt hardly offer come preſence siluian labouring much could poſſible cauſe forſake fond humor perſwading princeſſe furie could chuſe thorowly forgotten durſt awarrant ſhe repented ſelfe many time ſince ſhe vſed ſo vngently knight tiger hearing wordes siluian began comfort himſelfe indifferently riding came laſt haue citie ſight prince ſtood beheld great teares running downe cheekes many ſcalding ſigh ſent hart beholding chamber wherein lady miſtreſſe lay paſſed cogitation ſo well could hée claſped helmet taking shield launce hee commaunded siluian goe cittie prouide ſome place might alight becauſe would come vnknowne ſo aduenture might preſented hee arriued court ſo came paſſe knight came emperor court day arriuall palmerin hauing two eſquires attending carried helmet shield launce comming proudly emperor preſence vſed language manner giue thée vnderſtand moſt redoubted famous emperour arnolte lord aſtronomicall iſle giant brauorant great friend together gouernments ſomewhat néere one another confirme friendſhip long continued betweene father concluded ſhould marry arlencea daughter giant brauorant becauſe yeares diſcretion ſerued prolonged marriage ſpace fiue yeeres time brauorant departed life ſo likewiſe camboldam calfurnien brocalont baleato ſlaine two ſonnes prince edward england nephew aboliſh altogether houſe brauorant collambra wife counſell magitian alfernao ſent lady arlencea daughter countrey end deceit might cauſe knight sauage man forſake court reuenge might taken death sonnes would remedie inward ſorrowes ſeeing brought ſubiection thought vnpoſſible helpe miſfortune alfernao ſlaine collambraes meanes threw ſelfe headlong downe preſence enemy thus onely depriued liues worſt arlencea vtterly loſt keeping hath ſlaine whole linage •• becauſe haue deſire finde enterpriſed trauell hither minded deale knight sauage man doubting diſcharge life court whereat little offended fortune refuſe mee ſhall account iniurie vanquiſhed handes daily woont remaine victor place hée come beſide depriued life ſhall make ende thoſe careful thought maketh deſirous diſſolued purpoſe intend waite comming meane maieſtie giue leaue make ſome triall armes againſt knightes court ſhall count ſelfe highly pleaſured emperour returned anſwere truſt friend haue enterpriſed ſéeke owne ruine wherefore would counſell giue minde ſuch thinges fruite whereof may yéelde commoditie like aſſure neither florian palmerin brother inſtant court would wiſh heare neuertheleſſe time expect comming ſo deſirous make knowne valour grant libertie field knight court ſhall ſaile viſite deſire nothing anſwered arnolfe ſo without wordes entred field iouſted againſt three knightes two vnhorſed third vanquiſhed combat ſword day declining gaue ouer time next morning entred field againe blacke armour hauing painted shield little flame fire field sable knight tiger ſtayed long hee came ſhewed himſelfe field armed woont much diſguiſed ſhadowes leaſt hee ſhould knowne deuiſe tiger ſo defaced one could iudge proportion ſhould paſſed along empreſſe chamber windowe chanced ſée lady polinarda whereat ſomewhat abaſhed ſéeing arnolfe ſo ready iouſt let paſſe fond conceit praunced liſts know ſtate enterpriſe preſently declared one iudges feeld whereupon prince aduanced himſelfe giant arnolfe ſpeaking vnto manner thou ſhalt vnderſtand arnolfe thou art deale kinſeman knight sauage man wherefore thou haſt thing ſay vnto reuenge one linage arnolfe ſo iocound heard theſe word preſently gaue horſe ſpurs againſt knight tiger encountred together ſo great force prince forſooke one stirrup arnolfe ſent earth héeles vpward braue beginning cauſed emperor primaleon reioyce iudging ſtrength arnolfe vnequall compared knight tiger alighting horſe came receiued arnolfe point ſword little mooued ſore fall eſpecially hauing receiued ſuch foyle hand allied knight sauage man combate beganne continued great fury moued emperour theſe wordes perceiue arnolfe might haue vſed leſſe boaſting prowes becauſe ſéemeth far vnable make reſiſtance againſt knight fighteth reaſon good father aunſwered primaleon euill perſons ſhould puniſhed example may remaine others beware meddle ſuch vnduttfull attempt arnolfe knight tiger ſo hacked one another armour witneſſed cruell rage furie eſpecially gyant whoſe fleſh ſo cut mangled many places▪ blood tricked apace downe armour great loſſe whereof cauſed giue ouer take breath awhile deſired knight tiger tell name whereto returned anſwer tell thée alnofe ſaid prince néere kinſman knight sauage man hauing leſſe deſire end thy curſed life haue like ſuch thou art arnolfe replyed thus place long deſired aſſure thée receiue ſmall c • ntentment dealing thée ſo happie depriue thée life ſhal perſwade ſelf reuenged greateſt enemy fortune giue thée power vanquiſh ſhall likewiſe well content becauſe ſhall ſooner viſite brauorant ſonnes reuenge whoſe death either end thy dayes ſword offer vp ſpirit thy féete knight tiger perceiuing ſo obſtinate began charge roughly yet done following intent ſo gallantly neuer left till tumbled ground ſtarke dead taking helmet ſéeing life left knéeled downe thanked god victory came primaleon prince conducted knight tiger empreſſe chamber taking helmet knéeled downe emperour weeping ioy ſée imbraced armes gratiouſly afterward came humbled himſelfe empreſſe kiſſing hand like gridonia lady came • ady miſtreſſe ſuch ſpeech behauiour cauſed ſuſpition loue preſent chap xxxiiii talke prince palmerin princeſſe polinarda lady greatly buſ • ed prince palmerin certaine dayes viſiting friend could attaine felicitie heart deſired tormented ſecretly though bare foorth good countenance neither could find meanes ſpeake lady dramuciana gentlewoman might diſcouer griefe end therfore might ſomewhat remedy affection made caſe knowne siluian entring empreſſe chamber deſired dramaciana ſpeake word two ſo well siluian handle matter dramaciana came ſpeake prince palmerin chamber window vnderneath lady chamber ſo ſhadowed arch ſtone towards garden one might hardly perceiue palmerin receiued leſſe contentment ſpeaking dramaciana would béene owne lady made gentlewoman acquainted ſecrete paſſions wherevpon iudging houre good fortune could neuer come paſſe without aſſiſtance damoſell opened whole minde vnto whereon ſhe ſufficiently ſcanned modeſtly ſhe gaue anſwere may well think moſt famous renowned prince ſhe ſo willing perceiue doe ſeruice would loth hide thing might returne benefite may perſwade ſelfe dutifull good beare maketh ſo hardy time knowing whether ſhal deceiued intend otherwiſe make account méete friend dramaciana anſwered palmerin neither doth time ſo permit ſhould ſuch ſhameleſſe perſon render inturie courteſie neither would wiſh iudge ſuch one wherefore ſetting ſuch doubt aſide deſire certefie end thinke long ſeruice come vnto hope haue receiued meanes hath euermore ſuſtained vntill preſent cruell extremity elſe beene ſufficient kill knowes ſo well ſaid dramaciana declare griefe ſhall neuer make beléeue depriued good hape conſidered alſo noble behauiour cannot blemiſhed fogetfulneſſe may build vpon princeſſe polinarda hath béene grieuouſly paſſioned time long abſence haue béene daily tormented fearefull diſpleaſant thought ſay haue ſuffered theſe newes anſwered palmerin ought ſufficient content pray waſt time acquite ſelfe promiſe hath pleaſed oftentimes make conuenient theſe word whereby doe ſo highly pleaſe ſhould changed flattery deceite might growe ſuch ſeuere cauſe might loſſe lady well quoth dramaciana haue already prouided place may ſpeake minde princeſſe ladd ſhalbe cloſe ſecret window whereto may come enter chamber princeſſe fleridaes garden pray behaue ſelfe ſuch order ſhall neede ſpeake together againe ſo ſecretly becauſe place honor princeſſe cannot agrée together without occaſion great danger may perfectly behold anſwered palmorin account good hath béene alwaies call remēbrance cauſeth abandon ye vnhappy occaſions wherwith haue bin long acquainted enuious deſpite moleſt hauing fauorable furtherance ſide conſider ye ſwéet contentation ſhall receiue hauing meanes ſpeak gracious miſtreſſe find ſelfe thrown many doubtfull perplexity reſpect vnworthines honorable dignity ſo ſhall abaſhed feare yt diſpleaſure withhold diſcourſing long tedous trauailes ſake certainly ſir palmerin aunſwered dramaciana fond ſhould conceale princely déeds wherwith ſo many renowmed potentate haue bin acquainted haue bene ſo valiant hardy ſpend time hitherto trauailes excéeding danger yet haue finiſhed worthily néedleſſe ſhold diſmay ſelf preſenting perſon place frée hazard miſfortune wil tel feare affliction ſo coupled together tel remedy would haue ſtriue ſelfe yt feare may mind come reueale ſecret thought lady miſtres palmerin well noting friendly word dramaciana made knowne vnto depth amorous affliction ye knight drawing pace talk prince maner endles brake conference time ſhe ſhewing place appointing houre ſpeake lady palmerin taking leaue dramaciana went chāber ſpent night thinking talk paſſed betwéen ye gentlewoman himſelf ſo good hope mean made hart ſo ſorrowfull wont ſomwhat behaued himſelfe pleaſantly remembring heure felicitie drew néere time come dramaciana charged reſpect took way appointed place paſſing ſo couertly could garden entered princeſſe fleridaes chamber leauing siluian without giue knowledge came trouble palmerin walking vp downe chamber alone admitting many cogitation preſent attempt began thinke greateſt detriment might happen knew well came combate amorouſly power depriue wonted courage could driue ſo ſtraite point refuge might haue flie vnto princely fauourable bountie afford could make account conqueſt offering approach window eſpyed princeſſe coming whoſe ſight abaſhed ſuch ſudden feare found voyce faint ſpeake iudgement wherewith béene alwayes acquainted ſo weake ſimple one would haue taken rather ghoſt liuing man ſhe perceiuing greatly pittying withdrew ſelfe little window remembring good counſell dramaciana giuen laſt ſtepped window princeſſe ſeeing aduanced ſelfe little pauſing entred theſe ſpeeches madame houre good fortune would allow recompence end long laborſome trauailes ſhould haue occaſion find ſelfe agréeued well aſſure ſelfe preſence hath power make forget paine haue ſuffered time haue borne yoake loue haue alwayes remained faithfull ab • dient regard fauour brought place receiue vnſpeakeable content requitall paſſed affliction trauaile eſteeme importance compariſon dignity preſent mine eye ſo high honourable authoritie eſtéeme fortune excéede others could wiſh golden face beautie ſo ſplendant drouping thought might neuer ſhadowed cloud miſfortune ioy honour felicitie hath euermore bene making eſpeciall account excellencie iudge pitte ſée liue continuall ſeruitude ſince extremitie gréefe hath compelled take boldeneſſe would deſire thinke come yet regard well auoyde impeachment might happen blemiſh renowme deſire haue gratious fauor might end carefull continuall verations muſt iudge great conſider thing paſt aduiſedly ſuch hath bene dutifull remembraunce conceite imagine thing honour neither forſooke griefe danger trouble miſfortune whatſoeuer theſe hauing bene alwaies familiar life might eternize name time memory repoſing ſo good hope noble ſelfe eud trauailes ſhall agrée gentle acceptation enforced earneſtly requeſt albeit labour haue bene great gréeuons ſeruice yet ſo forgetfull ſelfe repute preſent gratious fauour excellencie farre beyond haue done rather becauſe know ſwéete amiable nature ſeeme altogether left vnrewarded come paſſe make friendly account ſhall finde ſelfe ſo dutifull towards deſire ſo comformable looke liketh content diſpoſe caunot accept gratefully ſuch ſo great content receiue trauailes haue done ſake winde blaſt mee bounty ſhaddowe feare foyle fauour ſtand wordes princeſſe thus anſwered thinke sir palmerin would cauſe come place hold theſe friuolous néedeleſſe word promiſe reaſon ſhould thinke ſelfe ſo deceiued could hardly withhold ſelfe leauing company firſt becauſe nouriſhed brought vp court likewiſe kinſeman friend hath made willing regard trauailes ſatiſfie earneſt intreatie dramaciana perceiue greater friend ſeeing fault mee rather blame mine owne timeritie though ſéeke ſatiſfie deſire without conſideration honour whereby let ſufficiently vnderſtand ſmal regard haue danger wherein may fall ſooner thinke vnaduiſedneſſe cannot deny greatly indebted yet ſuch déepe ſumme eaſily come forth without preiudice renowme eſtéeme reaſonable recompence noble ſeruice mine owne diſaduantage becauſe good fame commendation haue gotten may content haue reward good ſo great towards ſpéeches ſéeme make méet make known emperor grandfather mine alſo prince primaleon father doubting willing match v together ſhall eſtéeme greateſt good fortune may happen hauing gained loue liking whoſe proweſſe princely deſertes worthy moſt gratious eſtimation thus conſent knit vp long deſire v may ioyne one agréement gladneſſe prgy accept anſwer without good wils neither may accord vnto promiſe madame aunſwered palmerin hard receiue contentment commending déedes cannot regard make account ſhould ſéeme refuſe go emperour prince primaleon might thought vnwiſe firſt would perſwaded thorowly good principall action ſo fall conſent vpon word ſhall vſe yet reſolued acceptation ſhall take boldneſſe ſéeing time place ſo ſeruing let vnderſtand ſure inui • lable conſent loyalty together albeit fond timeritie vſed towardes may cauſe iudge farre vnable ſpeake ſuch • dacitie cauſe would haue yet thinke faithfull affection wherewith haue continually ſerued compell enter boldneſſe tell doe • oi ſéeme leane contented ſuch laudable recompence may receiue others handes regard haue trauailes aduentures daily vſed honour name maketh thinke deſerue great fauour nature cannot agrée would loth ſhould otherwiſe rewarded muſt content ſelfe obey pleaſure yet ſhall finde ſelfe deceiued opinion haue hitherto conceiued depriued preſence lady chiefeſt miſfortune happen faithfull louer left comfort ſuch carefull minde none abſent friend hath commoditie fit rip vp many ſad ſorrowfull diſcourſes wherewith may chaſe away remembrace deceytes whoſe preſence dearer life ſelfe yet ſuch cuſtome loue mingle among ſharpeſt conflict ſome hope onely ſwéeten mouthes little ſome delightfull taſte waſte time ieaſt dalliance vnder amorous enſigne gay foyle graceth copper curant gold meane ſhaddow deceitfull dealing yet number ſpend liues ſeruice gaine ſuch knowledge trumperie end glad forſake dare take hardineſſe doe ſo ſurely bound ſhall leaue deſire loued none regard whoſe good haue thruſt ſelfe danger whatſoeuer returning victor rather aide incomparable beautie force valour remain ••• ſelfe pauſing ſhe replied manner thinke syr palmerin receiue ſuch anſwere word gaue wherefore make iudge eſtimation ſince perceiue loue hath ſo fondly blinded ſuffer ſée modeſt readineſſe pleaſure content giue yet greater aſſurance for▪ would ſuch noble renowned prince ſhould depart offended iniured perſwading ſelfe ſéeme enterpriſe thing
