whereby motion impeachment may come mine honour ſhould thinke hardly diligent ſeruice haue done therefore againe humbly intreate ſpeake emperour primaleon father knowe eſtate good willes whereof ſhould faile giue perfect aſſurance mine anſwere truely dutie accounteth bad obedience ſuperiours wil ſuffice verily perſwade ſelfe loue ſéeme beare rather diſgrace preſerue honour ſwéete madame anſwered palmerin refuſe doe aduiſe reaſon ſhould thruſt foorth ſeruice knowing doe ouerthrow bliſſe erecting happineſſe conſiſteth duely gratious miſtreſſe thus concluding tooke hand kiſſed number time together without expence many ſalt teare reking ſighes made princeſſe bluſh grieue inwardly pittying ſée great humilitie prince palmerin ſhe betrothed ſelfe preſence princeſſe thrace dramaciana gaue counſell vſe matter order whoſe meanes polinarda ſo ſoone contented altogether windowe matter knit faſt aſſurance palmerin kéepe company day muſt part night till pittying ſée 〈◊〉 lady ſtand ſo long compelled take leaue time chap xxxv certaine knight arriued court emperour palmerin aduertiſed turk prouided great armie come beſiege conſtantinople dvring time great ioy court conſtantinople comming prince palmerin emperour tidings brought prince albayzar leuied great mighty armie come beſiege cittie aſſure meſſenger lord soldane bellagris preparing himſelfe readineſſe come aide emperour time ouercharged age found himſelfe farre vnable deale theſe affaire conſideration whereof little diſpleaſe neuertheleſſe fayled make prouiſion wiſedome willed entertaine enemy whereupon writ soldane bellagris ſending heartie thankes good forwardneſſe h • ſaw eſpecially time ſo néedfull meſſenger soldane diſpatched emperour ſent preſently informe theſe newes arnedes king france sonne law recinde king spaine edward prince england emperour vernar allemaigne maiortes many others armie turkes ſooner heard knight followed noble aduentures returned conſtantinople knowing ſhuld make better trial valour place ſuch rumour ſpread abroad turk intention ſhort time citie conſtantinople furniſhed many noble redoubted knight aduentures preſented day day emperour would ſuffer purſue ſuch occaſions becauſe nothing elſe deceite villany wayting ſtill time ſhould aſſaulted albayzar ſetting forward sea accompanyed diuers approoued knight armes alſo number cruell bloody minded giant intending make generall ſpoyle emperor dominion till haue better occaſſion leaue returne prince palmerin brute turkes army aduertiſed death satrafort gouernor perillous iſle taken trofolant fearefull deſcended giant kindred rehearſed firſt volume hiſtory trafolant vanquiſhed tournament prince florendos like miſhap day following proweſſe knight sauage man guarded ſhéeld palme tree forreſt cleere fountain damoſell sage aliart brought emperour palmerin might deliuer knight nephew woone honour day tournament likewiſe fortune trauailed caſtle giant almaroll vanquiſhed prince florendos guarded ſhéeld faire miragarda returning thence met damoſelles knight offering take one lady fell combate end likewiſe vanquiſhed conceit ſo many ſundry foyles knight emperours court cauſed deuiſe meanes might worke ſome iniurie belonged emperour reſpect ſo ſeuerely bent againſt would take vpon reuenge death calfurnien brother ende might better execute treacherous enterpriſe hée tooke way profound iſle thinking inuent ſome treaſon aide collambra intent diſapointed told ſhe brought emperours court greece determined goe viſit perillous iſle accompanied two knight kinſemen knewe well diſſemble treaſon ſtomacke satrafort thinking emperours court conſtantinople entertained louingly caſtle ſoiourned certaine day murthered satrafort houſhold pleaſure victorie ſhort argentao gouernour profound iſle came ſecret wile ſuddenly power taking trofolant forreſt ſent preſently emperours court little ioy comming ſaued palmerin iourney taking leaue friendes becauſe would goe take traitor done ſuch villanie trofolant condemned lawe publiely executed according trecherous dealing deſerued argentao honourably recompenced might haue better occaſion carefull circumſpect office ſoone trofolant put death sage aliart arriued court conſtantinople whoſe preſence gaue greater aſſurance emperour knightes gaue heartie thankes ſo ready goe recouer perillous iſle sage aliart came court prince floraman albanis frieze reccamon leyman burgunuy beſide many prince knight euery one forſaken ſeuerall country aſſiſt emperour conſtantinople aide becauſe heard turk preparation ſame day tydings brought court fredericke king england dead newes cauſed • ſmall griefe among prince eſpecially emperour himſelfe aged king fredericke iudged himſelfe long continuance behind ſpeciall preſident regard king fredericke one made moſt chiefe high account prince edward crowned king england great ioy ſubiects ſuch vertuous magnanimous prince funeral king frederick ſolemnized greece great ſtate beacon burning bonfire made whole empire according cuſtome countrey chap xxxvi aduenture happened trouble conſtantinople realme france manner chanced hiſtory reporteth certaine lady realme france enuying renowned polinarda greece miragarda spaine leonarda thrace whoſe beauty defaced greatly lady country began complaine much french knightes either want courage little regard loue beauty remained vnknowne realmes country prouinces vpon occaſion found themſelues ſomewhat agréeued end would remedie cauſe foure lady king france court thinking excell beauty enterpriſed eſtabliſh aduenture mooue mindes many knight come endure triall againſt ſuch would maintaine beauty firſt theſe lady called manſia ſecond telanfia third latrania tge fourth torſia hauing caſtle called owne name end thoſe knight deſired ſée ſhould come caſtles remained many ſundry ſtrange knight trauailed theſe caſtles ſhewed ſuch rare incredible proweſſe renowme theſe foure caſtles ſhall neuer forgotten may day yet behold france caſtles theſe foure lady yet honoured moſt ſpeciall eſtimation theſe foure lady couetous owne glory would know aduantaged beautie aboue telanſia ſerued princeſſe graciana ſecond daughter arnedes king france hauing ſuch opinion ſelfe ſhe thought ſhe excéeded lady world beautie manſia latrania torſia ſerued quéene forged ſame ſtampe telanſia manſia held ſelfe greater reputation becauſe ſhe higher king fauour came ſo paſſe thrée theſe lady married ſo ſoone beganne aduenture neuertheleſſe would haue continue ſtill fearing leaſt lady ſhould take preheminence aboue torſia remained vnmarried perſwaded ſelfe excéede thrée briefe theſe lady ſo earneſt intent ſo willing ſée iſſue thereof concluded entertaine knight ſeruice fortune ſerued ſée afterward might better ſubmit himſelfe obeyſance iudged cheefeſt affection moreouer ordained knight ſhould firſt binde himſelfe endure combatte againſt foure ſeruants ladie one hée proued ſo fortunate vanquiſh ſhould bée called knight fought combate beſide knight ſhould licenced goe ſéeke aduentures afterward ſtrange countrey becauſe lady remainned victoreſſe carrying true title ſupreame beautie theſe foure lady agréed eſtabliſh aduenture ſame manner haue told beauty might purchaſe like commendation princeſſe miragardaes noble triall ſhield kept caſtle almaroll king france sonnes accounted moſt puiſſant armes realme becauſe affection placed elſe made account aduenture neither germaine orleance becauſe minde likewiſe conſtantinople french knight remained doubtfull proue aduenture remembring condition theſe lady would ſerued ſo hardy venture hauing ſeene beautie firſt ſo caught captiue promiſed endure hardeſt perill obtaining loue ſéene ſecond lady preſently committed firſt forgetfulneſſe making ſame promiſe would looſe ſelues purchaſe looking third wittes ſo buſied thought ſo laboured none ſhe faire iudgements length came ſee fourth ſwéete delicate face thrée counterfeit reſpect ſerued foyles ſet beauty ſale ſo firſt laſt opinion ſo variable mindes ſo rauiſhed contemplating forcing might happen either trouble miſerie daunger death ſelfe threwe themſelues face fortune many knightes béene vanquiſhed proweſſe defended ſo nobly shield miragarda yet aduenture boldly trie enterpriſe could vanquiſh foure knight theſe lady preſented tooke vpon ſeruants lady ſo aduenture continued long time theſe lady could vaunt conqueſt aſſure renowne famous enterpriſe ſo blazed abroad place knight trauailed place early laboured earneſtly deſerue fauour theſe foure lady prince floraman sardignia trauailing realme france intending goe offer aide emperor conſtantinople met damoſel entred forreſt ſhe hauing company two damoſels becauſe ſhe deſirous prince sardignia ſhould behold beautie ſhe tooke maſke gaue one damoſelles floroman trauailed continually mourning ſpirit loſſe faire altea lady paſſed giuing ſalutation perceiued one followed ſpake vnto manner would know ſir knight meane paſſe ſo theſe lady offering ſigne courteſie ſalutation perhaps ſée lady paſſed may time well ſerue excuſe becauſe ſadneſſe maketh lady think heart paſſioned moued ſome occaſion ſhe deſireth take lodging • night one caſtles far hence ſhe faile entertaine moſt gratious manner ſhée deuiſe word prince floraman thus anſwered faire damoſell haue bin thing forgetfull towards lady humbly deſire pardon ſhe may perſwade ſelfe ſeeing paſſed without vſing courteſie rather occaſion turning horſe ridde damoſell lady entred caſtle floraman power ouertake whereat greatly agréeued comming damoſell brought thither preſently entred theſe ſpéeches pray faire gentlewoman tell mée name caſtle iudgement ſéemeth one fayreſt haue ſeene li • e pray lady entered ere could ſhew dutie caſtle anſwered damoſell farre beautifull within ſumptuous building ſée without aſſure knight hath good occaſion reioyce paſſe without ſome aduenture happen becauſe may account word truth impoſſible depart hence without triall proweſſe eſpie thrée knight vnder gréene trées left hand preſume ſo néere caſtle haue ſome meaning caſtle called caſtle latrinia lady name ſaw enter whoſe behalfe many knight put themſelues danger agtinſt de • end thrée ladyes french court onely contention beauttie end may giue ſounder iudgement caſe earneſt trying combate behalfe beautie ladie latriana worke meanes ſhall ſée come paſſe afterward vanquiſhed may better know whether owne imbecilitie imperfection beautie enter combate floraman returned aunſwere haue bene alwayes ſo vnfortunate faire damoſell maintaining like enterpriſes make daintie inhazarding inconſtance flattering fortune haue often heard madame latrinia take one foure lady realme excéede ſoueraigntie beautie could wiſh •• ti poſſible ſo good hap might come entertained gratious ſeruice greater part giuen ſide maketh doubtfull herein according permitted fréedome man damoſell floraman continued talke came caſtle offred paſſe theſe thrée knight ſtepped vſing theſe word prince floraman would know sir knight determined imploy ſelfe behalfe foure french lady becauſe v ſeruant whoſe cauſe maintaine ſhall conſtrained enter combate sir anſwered floraman may lawfully refuſe combate becauſe haue ſéene theſe foure lady one thrée knight replied againe thus ſo sir yet haue ſéene theſe lady ſhall ſuffered enter caſtle may contemplate beauty latrania chaunce remaine affectionate many haue done deſire enter ſeruice becauſe may ſo ſhun danger combate knight laying hand vpon one companion ſpake thus floraman hold honour haue ſight foure would chuſe lady manſia miſtreſſe another ſaide ſelfe knight wee altogither addicted ſeruice telanſia cauſe abide place ſée knight holdeth part dare ſo bold come place wée may try fortune gaining recompence lady haue ordained ſhall ſo happy remaine victor floraman greatly enflamed towards theſe lady remembring ſtill loſſe fuire altea entred caſtle latrania receiued gratiouſly excuſing himſelfe towards becauſe dutie ſhe paſſed forreſt aſſure floraman iudged lady caſtle ſo faire hee could willingly haue offered himſelfe ſuſtaine quarrell feared leaſt ſhould reputed vnfaithfull vnto beſt beloued altea ſtayed caſtle till morning hée would haue departed thence lady vnwilling ſee ſhe ſo much offended offered maintaine beautie vpon floraman went foorth thrée knight one came vnto demanded beauty madame latrania •• onne power ouer anſwered certainly ſaid knight greatly deſire deale thée may giue due correction thy proud ingratitude gentleman anſwere floraman pray put ſelues readines reuenge ſhame ſay haue done madame latrania may well ſerue becauſe haue better knowledge deſerts haue neuertheleſſe ſuch humor preſent dare aduenture ſelfe behalfe entend ſaide knight make knowe offence haue done vnto ſo gaue horſe ſpurres againſt floraman albeit iouſt loſt one stirroppes encountred knight ſo valiantly hee ſent ground headlong ſo aſtoniſhed could tell two perceiuing deſired likewiſe runne since lance yet whole ſound anſwered floraman content doe ſo much fauour ran againſt ſecond knight ſeruing like done firſt third came kéepe company firſt knight offended hee ſo vnhorſed deſired floraman ſtrike halfe dozen blowes end might amend foile receiued iouſt prince sardignia ſéeing excuſe would perſwade knight alighted horſe hauing drawn ſword dealt ſo nobly ſhort time perceiued great diſhonr gained prouing valour againſt continued ſo roughly fight knight compelled ſtep aſide take breathing made floraman giue theſe word beléeue ſir knight iudge ſufficient ſerue latrania ſelfe truely ſaide knight force beautie ſhe may way equall ſelfe hath brought daungerous eſtate well content anſwered floraman heare ſay ſo much greater aduantage ſhould haue lady preſent heare aſſure ſhe hath good occaſion accept well haue ſpoken became man greatly affected beginning afreſh againe knight though faintly defended himſelfe ſo well could latrania leaning one windowes caſtle ſeeing great daunger whereinto knight brought came downe place fought combate come prince floraman ſhe deſired ſaue knightes life whereto requeſt willingly conſented ſpeaking manner would gladly honour end combate becauſe thinke ſo conuenient knight may thinke himſelfe highly beholding haue ſaued life thorowly intended hee ſhould looſe ſéeing ſmall regard made ſelfe heare let reſt himſelfe latrania gaue honourable thanks returning caſtle ſhe grieued excéedingly good hardy knight could thinke ſo well champion cauſe floraman willed knight tell name promiſe anſwered knight entend nothing leſſe combate hindred lady haue giuen greater aduantage thereof thou haſt reaſon ſaid floraman vſe thy ſelfe thus one ought knowne theſe affaire eſpecially hauing receiued ſhame preſence one theſe lady taking leaue knight rid away preſently deſirous haue knowne chap xxxvii hapned certaine knight would proue aduenture theſe foure lady mean french court kept cittie parris many knight tooke pleaſure come thither moſt part whereof affectionate ſeruants theſe foure ladyes would practiſe iouſts combat honeſt paſtimes ſuch amorous perſons wont take delight aſſure french men themſelues ſo forward affectiō dayly preſence theſe lady neuertheleſſe ſtrange knight loue conducted thither ſee felt thoſe ſecret ſundry aſſaults enforceth endure yéeld themſelues obedient lawes theſe foure lady little prowde ſee themſelues ſo eſtéemed knight gaue themſelues moſt torſiaes ſide becauſe ſhe company vſed beautie gratious entertainement towards knight might vſe greater regard torſia iudged ſelfe worthy ſhe ſquemiſh diſdainefull making account trauailes knightes endured ſake thereby make beautie honoured extolled ſelfe made ſo great eſtimation thereof ſhe iudged thoſe knight aduentured behalfe greatly honoured making proofe valor defence beautie cauſe ſhe leſſe ſerued french knight ſtrange knight gaue themſelues altogether ſeruice deſiring trie fortune knowing victorie noble moſt doubtfull obtaining knight french court delighted themſelues behold theſe newcome louers albayzar came caſtle almaroll robbed dramuſiande princeſſe miragardaes ſheeld paſſed paris deſiring ſoiorne ſpace two dayes end whereof departed thence would enter combate ſuch would praiſe theſe lady aboue princeſſe targiana yet returned againe court would ſée theſe foure lady ſhe went eſtéeming knight two daughter florenda graciana whoſe courteſie well deſerue knight ſhould enterpriſe ſomething honour beautifull theſe foure lady among albayzar gaue praiſe torſia ſo beautie beſt contented cauſe place came prayſed aboue thrée albeit ſéeing french knight ſo affected theſe lady made occount ſwéete friend targiana trauailed thence conſtantinople enterpriſed maintaine againſt knight emperours court tge princeſſe targiana excelled beautie ladyep damoſels world ſame time palmerin england prince florendos paſſed french court ſtaying ſo great deſire approoue themſelues againſt albayzar dramuſiande likewiſe paſſed ſoone willing ſée theſe foure lady intent againſt albayzar would ſuffer goe hither aſſure beene enterpriſe albayzar aduenture france bene worthy commendation noble proweſſe ſhewen caſtle dramuſiande england miragarda spaine many knight trauailed ſée prince albayzar pompides blandidon iudged themſelues brother came court france thought ſo well beautie theſe lady ſetting remembrance loue aſide • ied combate wherein liues brought great danger theſe two knight renowned among ſtayed french court ſo inueigled beautie torſia diſcourſed intents▪ beganne mallice one another cruelly whereby ſhewed ſmall iudgement called loue 〈…〉 ſeeing ſo many miſfortunes tooke originall pompides conquered onely regard torſia ſéeing blandidon would giue place entreatance concluded trie combate agréeing thus betwéene themſelues hee conquerer ſhould remaine defend lady beautie blandidon deſirous could purchaſe acceptable fauour torſia agréed enter combate vnder ſame condition pompides oppoſed theſe two knight might ſooner execute willes came humbled themſelues quéene whoſe preſence pompides ſpake manner torſia madame knight brother ſo conquered grace beautie wherewith accompanied notwithſtanding nature friendſhip intend make proofe armes v twaine ſhall iudged worthy receiued ſeruice deſiring humbly offended haue enterpriſed would vouchſafe entertaine ſeruant fortune ſhall fauour atchieuing victory great ſudden admiration among hearing braue attempt theſe two knight eſpecially thrée lady ſéeing torſia ſo highly preferred beganne diſmayed changed colour torſia diſſembling although ſhee knowledge ſecret enuie iocond pleaſant ſelfe could caſting eye quéene ſhe made ſigne though ſhe would anſwer ſhe ſpake pompides blandidon manner may ſéene gentleman merit theſe thrée lady hath yet gained knowledge valour ſéeing enterpriſe hazard ſelues together one ſelfething wherefore admoniſh méete ſhould defend cauſe one another otherwiſe goe contrary determination ſo happy vanquiſh knight come behalfe theſe lady ſhall iudged worthy honourable reward méete ſuch famous noble conquerour theſe two knightes indifferently ſatiſfied anſwere torſi • wherevpon many knight deſired ſée went preſented themſelues field firſt rupert roſſelin knight good eſtimation maintained quarrell telancia brician rochfort loued manſia countie brialte affectionate ſeruant latrania pomdides blandidon came ſooner parke entred together becauſe torſia declared ſhould enter firſt maintaine beautie againſt knight therefore deſired quéene might pleaſe vnderſtand torſia ordained firſt diſcloſed companion ſhould enter firſt field blandidon diſcouered beginning pompides meane trie himſelfe firſt wherefore without tarying entred middeſt field entrance whereof lady placed ſtately florenda graciana ſhewed themſelues maruellous rich beautie nothing pleaſant becauſe neuer knight would eſtéeme proweſſe brician rochfort prepared himſelfe firſt encounter blandidon regarding manſia iudged worthy chiefeſt victorie ſpake ſomewhat anangrily himſelfe thus faire miſtres may thinke enterpriſe worthy preſented yet ſomewhat doe content ſelfe remaining victor diſdaine call ſeruant blandidon earneſtly deſired witneſſe bountie preſence torſia contemplated ſpirit thus doe demand madome fauour hand receiuing ſuch benefit ſhall purchaſe glory conquering enemy ran couragiouſly againſt brician rochfort encounted ſo brauely launce flew vp piece yet neither danger vnhorſed brician perceiuig reputed good knight armes hée deſired blandidon breake requeſt made refuſall ran ſecond time met brician ſuch force conſtrained forſake ſtirrops caſt armes necke horſe ſaue himſelfe falling ground blandidon caſt croupper horſe theſe two knight taken ſeates againe prepared themſelues third staffe diſcharged brician ſo ſtrongly horſe himſelfe tumbled ground blandidon danger haue borne company ſéeing enemy drawne ſword alighted horſe receiue aſſure combate eſtéemed one moſt dangerous euer ſéene countrey brician rochfort deſirous miſtreſſe manſia ſhold perceiue willing purchaſe loue blandidon vanquiſhed beauty cauſed hazard ſo great danger redoubled ſtrokes ſo fiercely vpon one another length brician ſore weakened fight depriued beauty lady fell downe ground blandidon preſently tooke helet made offer part head ſhoulders except would confeſſe torſia excell three beauty brician lay extremity one maiden honour cried blandidon lady adiudged victory euer brician rochfort caried lodging blandidon hauing loſt much blood wound receiued compelled withdraw himſelfe hauing power endure attempted ſhould remaine victor ought maintaine combat ſpace one day againſt knight came vanquiſher ſo fortunate ſhould bound likely diſpoſition beginne combate afreſh againſt three knight ſhould ſubdue might haue praiſe victorie pompides ſorry ſée blandidon ſo wounded neuertheleſſe glad honour day happened ſide vpon perſwaded himſelfe lady ſeruice would fall ſhare next day following fayled preſent himſelfe field long ſtayed rupert raſſelin entered blacke armour croſſe ſtrickt little fillet gold shield indian colour god figured brought vnder obeyſance knight mounted goodly roane courſer ſo ſoone heheld telanſia faire greatly affectionate ſpake himſelfe manner hee either may iniurie mée hauing ſéemely ſelfe therefore pray good madame would vouchſafe accept loyal heart wil neuer reefuſe doo ſeruice eſpecially may know pleaſure perſwade ſelfe ſoone diſcountenance knight maintained beautie torſia excell pompides knowing well behauiour rupert roſſelin little content poore louer receyued beholding beautie telanſia ſomewhat offended torſia yet come place combate ſhould fought paſſioned cauſe ſpake roſſelin order thou muſt remember knight thou art come hither waſte time contēplating beautie tranſformeth thée ſenſe reaſon perceiue well anſwered roſſelin torſia repoſeth little hope valour becauſe ſhe diſdaineth honour preſence ſo full word ſaid pompides ſhould ſpend time giuing eare day would ſoone gone without trying either iouſt combate without word ran againſt roſſelin encountring middeſt carrire ſo worthily hardly recouered himſelfe falling pompides nothing mooued roſſelin tooke new ſtaffe wherewith tryed fortune ſecond time pompides méeting directly brake ſtaffe nobly comming together horſes fought ſo one another pompides horſe ſuch ſtrength fel vnder maſter roſſelin perceiuing aduanced himſelfe recouered himſelfe ſtood ready receiue point ſword buckled together combat ſo cruell betwéen ſhort time fleſh ſéene roſſelins armour made ſemblance though nothing moued becauſe would haue lady make doubt proweſſe ſo earneſtly followed intent pompides ſmall aduantage himſelfe neuertheleſſe heart liuely himſelfe nimble quicke roſſolin ſuffered ſo many ſharpe ſtrokes ſo weake wearie enforced intreate pompides let take little reſt content anſwered pompides let pauſe end may better trauaile ſelfe beholding beautie telanſia conſidered alſo ſmall fauour torſia beſtowes cannot hinder vanquiſhing moreouer ſéene ſaid roſſelin great danger fight againſt men depriued hope whē one remaineth conqueror ouer ſuch perſons honour victory giueth larger contentment ſpoken pleaſed pompides beganne combate againe hacking hewing one another ſo cruelly within roſſelin ſo ſore laboured altogether vnable harme enemy pompides ſeeing himſelfe little better eſtate roſſelin doubting leaſt combate would endure long caught armes threw violently againſt ground hardly able ſuſtaine himſelfe falling remembrance victory made take courage wherevpon made proffer cut head roſſelin lady would agrée vnto roſſelin caried foorth fielde dangerouſly wounded pompides greater honour conducted chamber blandidon lay chirugions looked dillingently wound great friendes euer hauing one good aſſurance torſiaes fauour king himſelfe came louingly viſite knowledge greatly offended béene knowne court knight excuſed themſelues lady whoſe beauty cauſed trauaile thither alwayes deſiring vnknowne queene carefull haue well regarded time remained court good ſtate health humbly tooke leaue king queene madame torſia blandidon taking way conſtantinople pompides scotland eſpouſed princeſſe armiſia according haue declared already ſhall vnderſtand french aduenture continued time albayzar ſhewed proweſſe conſtantinople hauing cuſtody princeſſe miragardaes shield vntill inſtant knight sauage man accompanied arlencea damoſels returned king spaines court paſſing realme france firſt noble proweſſe attained aduenture ſhall hereafter heare wherevpon many ſecretly enuied whereof made account becauſe ſo well made knightly behauiour knowne lady french court chap xxxviii happened knight sauage man proouing aduenture theſe foure lady ordained knight sauage man conducting arlencea towards conſtantinople ſhewe lady leonarda faire princeſſe thrace aduertiſed quéene nauarre dragonalt aduenture foure french lady ordained report went maruellouſly endued beauty tooke way french court lay burgandie drawing néere citie sonier called digeon ſomewhat towards euening entred forreſt wherein monaſterie nunnes goodly riuer paſſing long vpon banke whereof hee perceiued certaine tent erected ſate diuerſe lady damoſels making garland flowres vnder gréene trées whereon hanged many ſhieldes defended certaine knightes néere hand repoſing themſelues within tent ſéemeth ſaid knight sauage man arlencea wee ſhall paſſe ſo eaſily make account ſo ſaid eſpied néere ancient knight requeſted know honourable perſonages recreated themſelues place sir anſwered ancient knight quéene came abroad ſollace ſelfe king hée ſomewhat higher forreſt courtly attendant hunting wilde hart pray tell quoth knight sauage man occaſion knight armed kéepe company ſhall vnderſtand sir ſaide ancient knight ſeruants vnto foure lady kéepe themſelues manner aduenture combate him▪ dare aduance himſelfe prooue aduenture pray sir offended part ſo ſoone ſee muſt away ſo ancient knight left ſée well quoth knight sauage man muſt prepare ſelfe iouſt wherevpon becauſe would knowne commanded eſquire couer ſhield ſomewhat meane ranne horſe vp downe finding nimble quicke enough shield couered rode toward tetes lady ſaw come damoſell ſuch ſtreat ſtature began laugh heartely knight sauage man ſooner beheld willing ſerue ſtaying horſe hee might better contemplate diuine face french damoſell commandement lady approched prince theſe word giue ſufficient example sir knight ſmall affection beare lady maintaining whoſe ſweete delicate complexion theſe knight haue placed shield trée defend paſſage dare ſo bold trie aduenture pray faire damoſell anſwered knight sauage man let mee knowe condition theſe knightes obſerue garding valley ſo bée iudge thing dangerous better depart trouble aſſure lady ſée company would loth ſee pe • ill perceiue ſaid damoſell one thoſe knight caries armor rather make ſhowe hazard perſon doubtfull aduenture neuertheleſſe let vnderſtand cuſtome vſed place ſo syr queene fraunce within theſe tentes hath foure lady company reputed excell others beauty deſtrous know may beſt make claime title aboue thrée tryall heereof haue ordained knight ieopard himſelfe aduenture ſhall take viewe one another hauing made choyſe one theſe foure muſt enter combate thrée knight ſeruants ladyes ſo fortune ſo good conquere hee ſhall called knight whoſe behalfe entred combate honor tell highly eſtéemed countrey becauſe lady deſerue moſt eſpeciall prefermēt syr ſtomacke ſo good may haue libertie ſee diſdain behold proweſſe wherwith accompanyed promiſe damoſell ſaid knight sauadgeman would hazard perſon theſe 4 onely well reſt y• quéenes companie marry firſt goe doo dutie maieſty haue ſéene ladyes ſo behaue ſelfe doubt well eſtéemed depart hée alighted horſe ſhewed himſelfe ſo reuerent quéene ladyes remained greatly contented damoſell ſhewed foure lady well viewed ſhee deſired tell minde knight sauadge man caſting eye firſt māſia beautie ſo well contented thought reſt decrée aduenture commaunded paſſe looke telanſia whoſe preſence ſo abaſh knew thoſe twaine ſhuld ſubmit himſelfe latrania came affection ſo iuggle iudgement could tell well ſay yet th • forgotten vpon ſight torſia beautie ſo enflamed euery vaine gaue title beauty aboue hee ſuch ſlender ſtabilitie loue looke forgetfull one another euen ſo failed like iudgement ſo hauing bene long ere hee made anſwere laſt ſpake damoſell manner faire damoſell haue brought mee ſo great perplexitie almoſt willing forſake aduenture ſo dangerous neuertheleſſe content enter combate honour manſia fortune fauour victory attend thrée behalfe telanſia whoſe fauour enterpriſe three latrania turning torſia ſaid eſcape danger theſe iuſt quarrell approoue ſelfe onely againſt thrée againſt dare come againſt let vnderſtand little account make life thus honoured imploy ſelfe ſeruice thoſe lady greatly abaſhed hearing braue offer knight sauage man made ſuch bruite preſently ſpread abroade king left chaſe returned tent lady rehearſed intent knight arnodes wiſe diſcrete prince knowing enterpriſe dangerous laboured haue performe promiſe made lady knight sauage man made humble reuerence king afterward mounted horſebacke ſpeaking thus againe damoſell brought thither theſe foure lady contented ſhall ſerue let ſée willingly venture life ſakes ſince haue tolde recompence ſhall ſo happy ende aduenture paſſe declare condition enter combate againſt ſeruants ſhall grant one gift ſo victory happen ſide end ſhall bee ignorant intent take paine diſcourſe ſhall vnderſtand determined guard paſſage valley againſt knight dare preſume paſſe ſpace eight dayes fortune allowe fauourable countenance victorie againſt knighes none lady ſhall depart hence miſhappe chance otherwiſe may depart owne pleaſure latrania vpon ſpake thns ladyes knight thinkes deſirous deale knight sauage man long ſince conducted nine lady company realme spalne faith ſaid telanſia ought grant demaundeth becauſe ſhall haue better knowledge valour content anſwered manſia vpon condition bring v caſtle almaroll enter combate kéepes princeſſe miragardaes shield behalfe one v foure force doe ſo preuaile combate againſt • r knight pray ſaide torſia change fond humour liberall promiſe▪ beſt grant truely contenteth much anſwered knight sauage man know minde ſo well think madame torſia reaſon ſhould refuſe thing yet would loath turne againe caſtle almaroll pray syr quoth damoſell ſpake firſt haue ſéene princeſſe miragarda conquered knight k • pt shielde surely lady anſwered knight sauage man haue ſeene miragarda combated againſt knight kept shield ſo fortunate power ouercome ſaide damoſell dare take hardineſſe vpon make ſuch large promiſe theſe lady would faile vanquiſh knight could preuaile againſt one knight marcy quoth preſence theſe lady affection beare ſhall ſufficient enter combate conquer knight dare meddle ſee well ſaide damoſell loue full incertaintie turning lady ſhe ſaid might well agrée requeſt great deſire ſhe ſee knight sauage man behauiour ſhe deſired king giue conſent manſia ſo highly fauoured king arnedes beſide ſo willing ſée paſtime gaue franke frée licence whereupon foure ladyes graunted kéepe paſſage would accompany eight dayes came damoſell knight sauage man theſe word haue ſo much preuailed sir knight theſe foure lady haue giuen conſent fo requeſt wherefore greatly deſire ſee déeds proue conformable braue word knight sauage man hearing damoſell ſaid came arlencea deſiring reueale comming backe againe ſet downe order thus firſt iouſt quoth ſhall manſia ſecond telanſia third latrania fourth ſhall honour torſia perceiue ſaid king arnedes knight willing accompliſh promiſe countie girarde deſirous make knowne good bare telanſia would néeds take field firſt encountring knight sauage man met ſuch force ſent earth héeles vpward ſo farre remembrance himſelfe faine caried forth field ſight king maruellouſly abaſhed countie gerard reputed beſt knight court manſia beganne thinke name thrée knight ſhould vanquiſhed honor day ſhould adiudged becauſe prince would ſo ouerlaboured could haue power vanquiſh thrée knight came countie gerard ſooner carried field brialte ſeruant latrania gaue horſe ſpurres burſt launce brauely one prince gaue ſuch friendly welcome conſtrained fall ground one armes broken whereupon caried forth field countie gerard manſia ſo glad ſhe could hide ſate againſt eaſily perceiue ſecret reioycing king arnedes ſeeing dangerous hurt brialte receiued beganne doubt ſtraunge knight would iniurie aliart normandie ſeruant torſia ran brake lance gallantly ſtrange knight shield ſent keepe fellow company whereas ſo offended ſtarted vp againe preſently drawing ſword came marching enemy fearing leaſt knight would haue ſlaine horſe lept beſide caſting eye vpon torſia making ſhow ſorie foile knight receiued vnder name yet acquite himſelfe promiſe charged aliart ſo roughly ſhort time tumbled foot yet would offer take life damoſell came granting victory thrée dayes ſorie ſaide ſtrange knight ſhould take ſuch paine lady ſée well anſwered damoſell witneſſe déedes promiſed word beginning knight sauage man counted himſelfe called ſtrange knight mounted horſe againe taking launce came place lady ſate entring theſe ſpéeches ſée ready lady enter field vnder name madame telanſia whoſe beautie ſufficient make remaine victor ouer knightes dare ſpeake againſt lady manſia doe forget haue promiſed mee ſince ſée willing diſcharge bond wherein haue tyed ſelfe king arnedes well noting valour ſtrange knight deuiſed might haue knowledge thinke bee one prince edwardes sonnes becauſe iudged would haue concealed himſelfe quéene beſide aduertiſed palmerin england giuen ouer following ſuch aduentures knight sauage man realme spaine thus imagining ſtraunge knight ſhould brian burgundie ſeruant manſia came field gallantly armed bearing deuiſe ſhield hope crowned garland flower field azure pauſing little looking ſtedfaſtly lady manſia parled himſelfe manner pray madame make doubt great proweſſe ſtrange knight could faile victory maintaining ſingular heauenly beautie preſumeth change another doubt make looſe ſéekes ſo gladly purchaſe ſo victory ſhall adiudged onely hath power winne remaine dutie liueth ſtrange knight came theſe ſpéeches haue done ſir knight ſecret fancy perceiue one ſéekes content ſelfe ſilent diſcourſes truſt ſend companion meane telanſia kn • w ſaide brian burgandie ende ſo couching lance add giuing ſigne ſtrange knight ranne together couragiouſly brake lance ſuch force brian burgundie vnhorſed ſors hurt yet would haue diſſembled entred combat ſword foure lady ſo afraid ſtrange knight would haue ſlaine cauſed procéede king much diſpleaſed ſéeing knight court ſo handled yet themſelues willing continue iouſt whereupon monſier artois ſeruant latrania would waſt time néedleſſe word cald ſtrange knight defend himſelfe would iudge ſayd ſtrange knight beautie lady ſhould cauſe regard ſomewhat ſince ſée repoſe aſſurance owne ſtrength beautie whereby might enioy moſt hope come welcome ſetting lance reſts encountred together brauely albeit failed breake ſtaues monſieuer artois receiued ſuch forcible arrant throwne duſt ſo ſore ſhaken could ſcantly mooue himſelfe ſtrange knight caught hold helmet pauſing ſpake manſia manner behold lady giue knight deſiring let carrryed foorth field manſia cauſed two knight conduct lodging brian burgundie much offended would depart fought combat whereto ladyes would conſent beſide king began angrie whoſe commaundement reputed among vanquiſhed brian departed place briſar gennes ſeruant torſia preſented himſelfe richly armed making ſhewe ſpéech towards lady déeds ſtrange knight whome thought long deale withall made ſo moued would ſpeake ſtrange knight perceyuing ſpake followeth pray sir contemplate beautie little whoſe ſake ſo bold enter combate end countenance may cauſe imagine griefe leſſe fortune direct herſelf againſt know well anſwered briſar gennes would gladly ſee mée ſome ſhew feare fainting becauſe would thereby magnifie déeds prouide ſelfe mee aſſure ſelfe ſuch hope repoſe lady fauour doubt ere go vnhorſe vpon theſe two knight met together ſuch force briſar gennes brake ſtaffe though able remoue aduerſary encountred ſo brauely ſent ground saddle betweene legges offered ſtrike sworde damoſell came ſtepped betwéene ſo ſtrange knight could execute intent king arnedes extreamely grieued ſéeing victorie come ſo faſt diſaduantage knight ſtraunge knight beeing glad ſee fortune fauour ſo well praunced till came latiania whome vſed language hee hath power performe hee promiſeth companion hath leſſe force quite himſelfe whome iudge beautyfull caſt eye madame manſia whoſe griefe hee might eaſily perceyue becauſe ſhee ſaw victory equall lady telanſia latrania could aſſure ſelfe ſ • rength followed becauſe ſhee feared ouermuch trauell would weaken ſtrength ſtrange knight chap xxxix ¶how ſtrange knight entred fielde iouſt vnder name latrania ſtraunge knight entred field againe came arlencea talked gomer benoit ſtayed letting vnderſtand day paſſed apace wherfore behalfe miſtreſſe telanſia bade iouſt ſtrange knight entertained middeſt way ſo gallantly • aine kéepe knightes companie becauſe hee knight good courage hee recouered himſelfe quickly drew sword ſtraunge knight beheld hee forſooke horſe ſaluted ſuch cruell ſtrokes ladyes glad ſend damoſell ſeparate aſunder fearing leaſt ſtraunge knight would haue ſlaine damoſell hauing ſent gomer away ſéeing ſtrange knight ſo pleaſant iocond though laboured himſelfe demaunded would thinke himſelfe haue trauelled enough marrie quoth theſe lady whome commit ſelfe daunger thinke themſelues haue neuer knight left doe ſeruice pray ſaide damoſell would tell mee may make report king cannot quiet deſire hath know name ladie quoth ſo ſmall eſtimation much aſhamed knight ſo vnexpert armes ſelfe ſhould diſcouered highneſſe ſo anſwered damoſell valour ſuch may well abaſh beſt knight haue ſéene damoſell gone forth lyſts ſtrange knight mounted • ſquyres horſe becauſe owne much trauelled king reioycing ſée ſo victorious pittying ſhould deſtitute horſe commaunded one eſquiers bring beſt moſt aſſured horſe ſight ſtrange knight humbly thanking king gift mounting backe attending knight ſhould next enter benteier berlande ſeruant manſia ſuch miſfortune vnhorſed likewiſe ſore hurt fall becauſe vnable helpe himſelfe king commanded ſhould carried field ſtill practiſing might know ſtrange knight rid end race ſéeing neuer knight ready iouſt ſate ſtill great ſtudy came arlencea willed remember buſineſſe knight ready trie haue done great pleaſure madame anſwered ſtrange knight ſuch mauellous conceite little regarde affairrs hand gaue horſe ſpurres againſt bertrand beaumont amorous ſeruant torſia ſped according fellowes likewiſe carryed forth field afterward came lady ſpeaking manner may ſée ſaire ladyes great afftction haue ſuſtaine quarrell together remaine conquerour ouer ſeruants good ſuch good eſtimation loyall vnfained loue beare make ſo forward ſeruice neuertheleſſe ſée ſo diſpleaſant miſfortune friend iudge ſhall haue ſlender recompence labour came madame torſia ſaluting theſe ſpéeches acquited ſelfe madame towards theſe lady thinke ſwéete miſtreſſe would doe promiſe behaue ſelfe ſuch ſort ſhall ſay ſelfe excéede promiſe concluding returned iouſt wherein ſo good fortune hee vnhorſed fiue knight together name alteo frieze dirdell burdeaux gualter dordonne dane picardie richard toloſe king arnedes knew ſay ſéeing beſt knight court ſo diſcomfited therefore would haue ſtrange knight procéede whereat ſomewhat offended fearing king would ſuffer lady accompliſh promiſed hee entred theſe ſpéechées highneſſe already acquainted condition whereon preſume enter iouſt therfore think reaſon deny iuſtice eſpecially ſtranger conſidering haue fulfilled promiſed lady deſire cōmand ſatiſfie paine perceiue ſaid king forget right haue would know intent ſéeke accompany thoſe lady whō hardly affoord ſent court pleaſe maieſtie anſwered ſtrange knight ſuch doubt made tryed iouſt therfore take vnkindly highneſſe ſhould depriue right ſéeing office let euery one haue deſert pray ſaid king tell noble behauiour maketh earneſt deſire know content ſelfe hinder thing lady haue promiſed beſéech grace humbly anſwered ſtrange knight would bee offended conſidering loth bee knowne yet vntill haue reuenged iniurie one hath dome mee promiſe faithfully highneſſe ſhall know ere depart realme faile declare name theſe lady becauſe haue remembrance ſuffered ſo great trauaile ſakes ſée well quoth king eaſe troubled thought well therfore build vpon promiſe day declining apace king ſet forward way digeon thinking ſtrang knight would come take lodging farre contrary wherefore theſe lady tooke leaue company tarying ſtrange knight ſéeing ſomwhat ſad becauſe loſt quéens company tooke helmet made lady greatly abaſhed ſo one could hardly iudge foure moſt affectionate ſtrange knight durſt familiar ſpéeches becauſe feared diſturbe patience ſo brought monaſterie néere hand valley abbateſſe brought faire chamber windowes whereof ouer goodly oratorie ſtrange knight himſelfe lodged laboured thought ſo extremely night done body day chap xl happened ſtrange knight firſt day enterpriſed guard paſſage valley faire aurora ſaluting lady chamber window put themſelues readineſſe becauſe deſired ſée knight proweſſe ſo went field vſing great fauour towards becauſe thought hee would leaue ſooner manſia requeſted place intended conduct madame aunſwered ſtrange knight ſo extreamely paſſioned cannot time report whither ſhall trauaile dare ſo bold ſaide manſia bring v caſtle giant almaroll enter combate ſakes knight kéepeth princeſſe miragardaes shield knight sauage man certaine damoſels kept company knowe daunger ſo great anſwered ſtrange knight would refuſe hazard might vſed gracious behauiour inciteth noble minde moſt fight v ſaide latrania deſirous ſhould approoue combate againſt princeſſe miragardaes knight v foure would aduenture moſt willingly greater trouble quoth anſwere preſent demaund hazard combate againſt knight whatſoeuer yet quoth ſhe admit neceſſitie ſuch wée would faine knowe v ſhould make beſt account • ſelfe caſe truſt madame anſwered ſtrange knight vnpoſſible make direct reſolution matter mine eye ſo equall iudgement foure cannot either loue affectione another haue ſir ſaid torſia time ſéene princeſſe miragarda yea madame haue anſwered ſtrange knight pray good sir quoth ſhée would vouchſafe tell ſhe ſo excéeding faire common bruite blazed abroad madame ſaid ſtrange knight may well aſſure ſelfe ſingular beauty hath ſo dazeled iudgement neuer ſawe liked better doe ah ha quoth manſia haue taken laſt wée may well perſwade ſelues torſia ſhe make moſt account neuer gaue ſo good wordes v wherefore ſeeing ſhée hath moſt power ouer preferre beautie aboue determined depart hence theſe two knight ſée comming hitherward knowe bee ſuch carrie away deſpight pray latrania telanſia beare company ſéeing knight hath reuealed himſelfe ſimply eſtéemed fauour ſtrange knight thought excuſe himſelfe commoditie ſo doe knight manſia ſpake arriued one called sir menelao clermont monſieur arnar abaſhed ſée theſe lady power ſtranger came vnderſtand occaſion sir clermont ſaide manſia ſince fortune hath ſo luckily brought hither pray deliuer ſtrange knight ſaith deſpite knight france cary v spaine make v giue attendance lady clermont ſeruant latrania giuing credite preſently manſiaes word tooke lance eſquier comming ſtrange knight entred theſe ſpéeches since haue sir receiued order knighthood offer iniurie diſpleaſure lady wiſh may ac • urſed beſtowed ſelfe ſhould attempt chaſtiſe follie wrong informed sir anſwered ſtrange knight perceiue manſia would gladly ſée brought danger ſhe would affoord like fauour lay power thinke ſhall gaine going buſines tarrying long company clermont ſéeing himſelfe ſo lightly eſtéemed grew ſuch melancholy ranne againſt ſtrange knight hée would ſuffer take launce hée ſlipping pu • h launce caught carrire one armes pulling beſide horſe threw ground great violence eſquire deliuering launce rode againſt arnar prepared himſelfe reuenge ſhame fellow clermont receiued alſo deſire fauour torſia becauſe good hope eſpouſe ſtrange knight ignorant affection met ſo iuſtly ſent kéepe clermont company end lady might perceiue deſerued • ter account made alighted frō horſe hauing drawne sword dealt ſo brauely together made know went againſt thoſe order good knight ought carefully kéep eſtéeme ſtrange knight deſiring delight whoſe kindneſſe mean ſlender brought knight ſo bad eſtates would willingly haue little reſt ſo enemy would haue ſuffered manſia ſéeing knight ſo great danger ſhe deſired ſtrange knight might pleaſe heare one word thē mean ſtayed heare ſhe would clermont arnar leiſure breathe whereof little glad manſia began thus ſtrange knight highly contented ſir haue witneſſed noble valour vpon theſe two knight whome deſire remit ſéeing th • able purchaſe aduantage ouer perſwade ſelfe syr arnar clermont wil refuſe gentlenes ſo dooing ſelfe ſhal haue cauſe thanke theſe two french knight glad might combat ended ſo good order neuertheleſſe becauſe lady ſhould iudge ſo fainte heart made though gaue ouer vnwillingly ſtrange knight beholding deſired manſia ſuffer begin doubted make better contented hee brought thē little danger pride anſwered torſia contented till ſome knight may haue power qualifie luſtineſſe beauty faira madam ſaid ſtrange knight doth ſo torment mee cannot wiſh greater puniſhment yet take thankfully comming body hand arnar ſo ſore wounded ladyes conſt • ained vnarme dreſſe woundes dangerous torſia tooke paine binde vp ſhyrt ſléeues ſtrāge knight ſéeing gracious courteſie theſe lady vſed arnar bega • ne pittie much eſpecially beholding torſia ſhew teares many french ladyes doo vſe wéepe much theſe lady thus buſie arnar knight arriued place combate fought bearing ſhield field ſiluer speare broken piece whereby vnderſtood hope altogether loſt knight pretie ſpace beheld beautie theſe lady made reſt vpon latrania deſirous doe ſeruice came theſe ſpéeches ſhall vnderſtand madame haue ſometime ſtaied hope place could purchaſe ſlender aduantage may behold deuiſe beare ſhield aſſure againe venture fortune behalfe perſwade ſelfe ſhall endure great torment ſake hauing fauour diuine beautie mine eye menelao clermont ſo amorous latrania iudged none ought loue himſelfe could ſuffer word knight speare returned anſwere doe attempt ſir knight fight foote againſt albeit ſée ſore wounded yet giue vnderſtand fauour lady reſerued hath ſuffered thus much ſeruice thinketh himſelfe worthy gracious recompence perceiue sir ſaid k speare ignorant could wiſh loue beare lady good eſtate end armed double againſt iudge farre vnable make reſiaſtance againſt ſtrange knight hearing proud word knight speare mounted horſebacke taking lance eſquire came vnto theſes word sir knight haue promiſed theſe foure lady guarde paſſage valley eight dayes ſpace two firſt dayes ſeruice manſia lady ſitteth left hand third fourth telanſia fift ſixt lady like called latrania two laſt dayes ſhall altogether imployed honourable ſeruice madame torſia aſſure greatly affectionate one except eſpeciall opinion haue torſia ſaw wéepe harme knight yet ſhe pitty ceaſleſſe gréefe endure ſake notwithſtanding ſir knight thinke ſo well ſelfe trie aduenture ſhall finde verie willing entertaine ten dayes ſince aunſwered knight sphere arriue place could deſirous trye valour preſent ſéeing theſe day limitted courſe awaite till come appointed honor latrania behalfe meane aduenture ſelfe troth ſayde clermont ſée knight beginneth diſmay himſelfe finde better meanes excuſe himſelfe put triall manhood thinke ſo anſwered knight sphere make returne hither appointed time fayle let know ſmall account make choller leauing clermont approched ladyes demanded bene caſtle gyant almaroll willing ſhewe himſelfe obedient courteouſly ſhaped aunſwere haue bene long ſince fayre ladyes aforenamed caſtle haue ſéene princeſſe miragarda yet entring combate kéepes shielde albayzar ſet himſelfe againſt vanquiſhed thinke ſaide manſia beautie conſiſt miragarda madam latrania driue harde point lady quoth knight sphere iudge ſimple vnderſtanding wil reproue abſent content humour preſent thinke expedient eache ſhould content ſeuerall giftes grudging repining another sir ſaide ſtraunge knight witneſſe well badde entertainement caſtle almorall hindreth iudgement beautie miragarda theſe foure lady whoſe defence ſtand lady beautie may compare knight sphere ſuſpected ſhould knight sauage man whervpon behold ſhield could perceiue becauſe couered knew eſquire ſo aſſured would deale neuertheleſſe affection hee bare latrania made forget friendſhip knight sauage man ſo tooke leaue lady intending lodge farre forreſt vntill dayes came aduenture ſtrange knight behalfe beloued latrania clermont arnar departed heauily ſtrange knight went lady monaſterie againe cauſed arlen • ea remaine till knight sphere iouſted together fearing leaſt company ſhould knowne becauſe reſerued married friend dramuſiande chap xli complaint ſtrange knight made night time vnder window chamber foure lady lodged theſe lady brought againe chamber windowes becauſe knightes quiet calme faire might diſcerne moſt part valley ſtrange knight ſo vehemently ſurpriſed loue great trauaile hee ſuſtained day force ſufficient cauſe giue mind reſt euermore ſéene ſpirit troubled newe imagination heart muſt néedes tormented infinite paſſions euen ſo hee moleſted ſo many newe care conſtrained come forth vnder ladyes chamber window hoping ſeme would take pitie laying downe among gréene leaues folding armes croſſe ouerthwart ſtomacke entred theſe diſcourſes know well loue enuious libertie haue ſéene dame england greece spaine nauarre without remaining affectionate fraunce ſuddenly inneigled foure ladyes onely delight depriue life tormenteth moſt loue much affected one thrée regard one heart biddeth forſake yéeld beholding ſecond finde ſelfe ſame alteration would forgette ſuch vncertaine aſſaultes ſée readier extant maketh thinke cannot true loue doth toſſe turmoyle ſo many ſorrowes yet doe imagine griefe leſſe remembring endure ſakes thinkes caſe hard one ſéeme make account wherefore ſée well ſhall charged extreame care yet vnfortunate knight vnder name prepare ſelues giue combate lady window heard well complaint ſtrange knight whereupon manſia ſpake reſt manner thinke good friendes goe vnto ſpend little conference himfor ſéeing night long troubleſome iudge cannot better driue away dare ſayde torſia ſo hardie goe viſite man maketh account kill come preſence aunſwered telanſia make ſhew fearefulneſſe miſchance happen v firſt ſhall voyde diſcourſing one another laſt departed togither petticoates mantell wrapt ſhielde deawe falling theſe foure lady come place ſtrange knight lay lamenting hauing ſaluted manſia beganne thus ſo syr knight deſirous knowe vpon occaſion vtter theſe complaint ſéeme hide theſe demaunds v wee ſhall enforced cauſe looſe without armes haue obtained armes indéed ladie anſwered ſtrange knight one hath power ſufficient vanquiſh ſhall offer great iniurie addreſſe ſelues foure againſt truſt syr ſaide telanſia wee repute ſo good knight hauing ſéene ſufficient occaſion cauſe v think ſo ſome v remaine yet doubt reaſon knowledge haue noble déedes déedes faire lady ſtrange knight replyed accompanied ſhew eſtimation procéeded imployed ſeruice ſéeing ſo agréeable ſhall attempt conquere knightes french courte vnder name ſée denie fauour hope euer purchaſe pray syr ſaide torſia let aſke one queſtion haue bene loue heeretofore certainly madam anſwered ſtrange knight haue bene many time practiſing follow little god loue compelleth envenomed ſhafts god men loue haue bene quoth torſia ſo greatly tormented ſéeme preſent madam qd hee gaue ſelfe ſeruice one whoſe loue hope enioy time trauels haue aduentured loue foure one ſéemeth forſake mee ende may deale ſame ſort aſſure madame neuer loued place ſéemed depriued life deſire conſumated fallen ſo extreame occaſions pray sir ſaid torſia doe moleſt ſelfe ſo accuſtomed trauaile country ſhake theſe paſſions well enough warrant ye thinke good grant ſatiſfie madame latraniaes deſire would conduct caſtle almaroll muſt enter combate vnder fauour againſt knight kéepeth portraiture miragarda elſe tra • •• e ſéeke knight sauage man muſt take force armes damoſelles company lady charge againſt dutie aduertiſe gardeth princeſſe miragardaes shield caſtle almaroll well content ſearch knight sauage man enter combate vnder fauour madame latrania ſhall beare company likewiſe cannot liue depriued preſence perce • ue ſaide latrania excuſe ſelfe well enough hope knight sphere reuenge ſquemiſhneſſe vſe towards latrania thus breaking purpoſe al foure tooke leaue ſtrange knight becauſe deſire ſléepe compelled ſo doe entred chamber diſcourſed among themſelues ſometimes commending knight noble valour againe gracious princely behauiour whereupon determined ſhew better countenance yet done ſtrange knight remained extreame paſſions becauſe departed ſo ſuddainely • earing vttered ſomewhat could like hée paſſed night many melancholly conceites vntill morning eſquire brought ſome refection time breakefaſt knight sphere came ſecretly monaſterie theſe lady reaſon late watching kept beddes yet becauſe ſtrange knight ſhould e • py went ſate downe foote 〈◊〉 hauing taken helmette beganne recount manifold miſfortunes endured aduiſedly conſidered found compared violent affliction ſuffred loue latrania whoſe beautie houres midday ſtrange knight kept within tent hauing occaſion arme himſelf lady perceiuing deſirous gone manſia aduanſing ſelfe chiefeſt ſetting foorth countenance vttermoſt becauſe day ordained honour ſhee behaued ſelfe moſt brauely preſence lady ſtrange knight knew well intent manſia glad ſhe ſee triall beautie day wherevpon framed language manner would willingly madame diſcerne ſome kinde imperfection courtly brauery thereby might receiue occaſion reſpect ſomewhat pittie man extreamely afflicted thinking may compaſſe meanes win • good opinion adorned ſuch rare exquiſite beautie doe euen lengthen liues take pleaſure behold good madame cannot ſo happy one thoſe take delight conceale ſelfe day deſire prepare ſelfe gallant may beauty may happen winne eſtimation aboue theſe ladyes becauſe vnknowne knight come theſe word ſtrange knight ſo well pleaſe manſia iudged would haue done ſhe tooke diſdainfully gaue knight vnderſtand ſhe reſerued latrania ſéeing ſo earneſt contemplating beautie manſia ſpake vnto manner ſee well sir regard haue manſia cauſeth forgetfull reſt ſo lady aunſwered ſtraunge knight doe honour heare ſpeake ſhall ſoone perceiue wrong opinion gaineſay ſayd latrania beautie honoured owne day day quoth whereon loſt libertie yet come ſhould haue ſome reaſon conceiue opinion deſirous know ſtate wherein loue hath bound subiects law knight sphere perceiue comming hitherward ſatiſfie therein may demaund yet containeth ſame minde wherewith preſented himſelfe doe ſeruice ſtrange knight vſed theſe ſuch like ſpéeches latrania knight sphere lifting vppe helmet came tent ſaluted lady gratiouſly ſtood earneſtly beholding latrania ladyes perceiuing thrée knight comming towards armed one manner thrée seruants manſia firſt engliſh man called brauor ſecond alter amiens third gualter amboiſe thrée king arnedes court becauſe meane make triall valour forreſt againſt ſtrange knight behaued himſelfe ſo brauely king preſence concluded day hazard renowne laſt day ſtrange knight enterpriſed ſhewe puiſſance honour miſtreſſe theſe three knight come ſweéte saint lady manner depriued wit beautie ſuch ſtately preferment eye knight sphere beholding noting well amorous paſſiens ſpake manſia manner cannot deny faire madame beholding ſtrange knight hath kept company certaine dayes theſe knight come ſeeke iudgement rather ſeeme yeeld themſelues conquered preſent ſight deſire perceiue combat may braue apparel hath dazeled eye ſingular beautie ſufficiency ſet whole world worke sir anſwered brauor ſo buſie deſcant meaning ſeeme iudge inward thought prepare ſelfe iouſt fayle giue due chaſtiſement lauiſh ſpéeches truſt sir anſwered knight sphere content ſatiſfie deſire condition knight ſhall thinke ſo conuenient pray sir ſaid ſtrange knight would ſeeme hinder enterpriſe atchieued may afterwards make triall knight courage lay iudge ſhall neede trauaile ſelfe much perceiue anſwered brauor intent ſpeeches neuertheleſſe hope gallant brauerie wherein haue day beheld miſtreſſe manſia onely graunt conqueſt ouer alſo ſufficient correct pride knight perceiue verie well ſaide ſtraunge knight affection onely vpon gay cloathing mine ſwéete ſelf weareth caſting eye vpon manſia entred theſe ſpeeches faire madame ſince honour day dedicated praiſe deſire allow mee ſo much fauour beholde entertainement newcome ghoſt feare blowes yéeld greater diſaduantage hee receyued content beholding beautie vppon ranne together couragiouſly brauor brake launce worthly ſtrange knight encountred ſuch force hee pierced quite bodie ſo fell beſide horſe ground dead companinions greatly abaſhed lady take heauily ſeeing miſfortune brauor whoſe bodie carryed monaſtery buryed alter amiens gualter amboyſe notwithſtanding death friend companion determined hazard honour aduenture gualter amboyſe firſt preſented himſelfe iouſt vſing language towards ladie deſire heartily good madame would ſuffer dye ſtrangers hand▪ onely liueth doe ſeruice ſo well deſire thinke mée extreameſt occaſion forſake mee theſe word vttered gualter amboyſe ſpoken ſuch manner knight sphere eaſily vnderſtood wherevpon ſpake madame latrania manner knight iudgement faire miſtris vnwoorthy loue gracious lady diſdaineth enterpriſe begin hee ſtoode thus communing ladie two knight encountred together gualter amboyſe caſt foorth saddle béeing vnable mooue straunge knight hée hauing broken launce addreſſed himſelfe alter amiens timerous fearefull yet ſhewe ſome good countenance ladie gaue horſe ſpurres againſt ſtraunge knight could méete according would neuertheleſſe alter amiens brake launce ſuch ſorte péeces flewe ſtrange knight horſe head whereat horſe ſo fumed gallopped maiſter violently field wherevpon ſtrange knight caſt himſelfe beſide commaunding eſquire ride take againe alter armiens ſéeing fortune faudured companion deſirous enter combat ſword cauſe alighted horſe gualter put himſelfe becauſe iouſted firſt ſtrange knight handled ſuch order ſhort time companion glad come helpe whereupon ſtrange knight entred theſe word come ſir euen well heart wiſh determined lay claime horſe becauſe mine runne away charged ſo furiouſly knight sphere conſtraided pittying eſtate wherin brought deſire manſia giue ſome ſuccour ſhe could well perſwade ſelfe doe ſo theſe two knight came rendred themſelues féet deſiring pitty preſent caſe doubting would apply liues many wayes ſeruice ſtraunge knight deſirous ſée eſtimation manſia would make came vnto theſe word ſhall vnderſtand ſir knight determined giue ouer without lady intreate behalfe ſelfe elſe ſhe ſhall promiſe graunt one requeſt entend vtter aſſure ſir knight aunſwered manſia doe intende make ſuch promiſe giuing vnderſtand ought beware paſſe ſelfe hope haue meanes ſhall haue perfect knowledge loue good ſéeme beare ſée well quoth ſtrange knight deſirous let know nature bent towardes aduenture themſelues ſeruice ſhall receiue better entertainment vſe towards whereat haue ſome occaſion gréeue would ſhould onely receyue fauour practiſe meanes poſſible pleaſe ſée intent vſe rigour would wiſh ſhould vſe theſe knight whoſe liues ſo little profite ſo count ſelfe happy becauſe life farre power thus ſayd offered mount gualters horſe lady gaue vnderſtand much abuſe knight offer ſuch iniurie meanes theſe two knight rid preſently away king france court made knowne miſfortune happened vnto knight sphere tooke way vnto lodging lady monaſtery manſia greatly contented ſtrange knight ſo well acquitted himſelfe towards thrée much maruell noble behauiour braue champion chap xliii happened ſtrange knight third fourth day ſight theſe iouſts lady hauing withdrawne themſelues monaſtery ſtrange knight entred tent refreſhed himſelfe ſuch viand nun ſent ſomewhat ſore trauailed hee deſirous reſt meane time eſquire returned ſearch horſe could hardly take day maſter •• ad ſaw ſtrange knight thinking lady would walk abroade done night tooke way gréene trées againe came abroad vntill morning mounted theyr palfrayes manſia ridde foremoſt hauing garland flower heade ſigne victorie telanſia followed next beeing good hope attaine ſelfe ſame honour latrania torſia came ſomewhat behinde vſing ſuch maieſtie theyr countenance knight enflamed towardes manſia come ſomewhat neere ſtrange knight ſhe ſpake vnto manner truſt syr ſo weary company haue concluded return • king court doubting ſhall aduertiſed thing happen abſence whereto ſtrange knight thus replied theſe word good madame vſe cannot thought welcome perſwaded lawe theſe lady france hath ſet downe firſt begun owne good willes cannot thus broken without great impeachment good syr anſwered torſia doe thus grieue offend ſelfe manſia ſpeake onely trie ſhe gone ſo ſoone warrant v breake promiſe till eight dayes fully compleate except ſome knight come whoſe power ſhall ſufficient cut determination thinke lady ſaide ſtrange knight ſhould wiſh miſfortune endureth much alreadie ſweete ſakes thinkes ſhould rather wiſh victorie fall ſide others laudable commendation ſhall get thereby ſtrange knight behaued himſelfe amiably entertaining theſe gallant lady knight spere arriued ſuddaine ſhewing obeyſance madame latrania ſpake followeth faire miſtreſſe neuer dayes ſo troubleſome vnto mee theſe endure preſent earneſtly thirſting deſiring time ſwéete ſelfe may allow ſome fauour neuertheleſſe well perſwaded knight honoureth ſeruice cannot eaſily vanquiſhed beares great good doo adioyning hereto imagineth himſelfe worthy loue may aſſure ſelfe ſo highly affected knight may way equall neuertheleſſe cannot chuſe take heauily fearing allow like ingratitude perceiue vſe theſe word latrania replyed thus ſpéech syr knight farre different offer made firſt arriued place ſo liberall promiſe would ſticke ſake conquer whole world ſtrange knight deſirous make one offered aduaunce himſelfe hindred damoſell arriued inſtant deſired ſhow knight guarded paſſage valley diſcloſing himſelfe damoſell ſhe ſaluted theſe ſpéeches hauing vnderſtood sir knight opinion theſe foure ladyes faireſt world ſomewhat deſirous trauell hither accompanyed theſe foure knight ſée vnder trée honour theyr ſeruice haue concluded iouſt doubting theyr paine returne greater profite vnto behalfe beſtow theſe ladyes muſt vnderſtand beſide theſe knight come enter combat ſword reſerue eſpeciall affaire mee greater importance ſtrange knight well aduiſed himſelfe damoſels word bare face couered hee anſwered manner would were▪ great eſtimation theſe ladyes kéepe mee captiue theſe knight company vſe ſuch fauour deſire madam telanſia may ſpéed worſe manſia hath done whoſe ſake haue already conquered thrée knight pray sir ſaid damoſell ſhew theſe foure lady ca •• telanſia ſtrange knight ſatiſfied requeſt ſhe entred theſe word ſooth sir beautie ſtraunge knight ſped alwayes ſo fortunately many knight ſought ſeuerely iniurie quéene would preuent much ſhe could cauſing damoſell entice trie valour againſt ſtraunge knight ſak • thereto willingly conſented neuertheleſſe king forbidden enter combate sword cauſe damoſell entreated ſtraunge knight would hazard breaking one launce againſt one champion damoſell thus concluded theſe foure knight thither ſpake followeth cannot denie faire damoſel haue ſeene throw world ground onely fauour madame telanſia oh syr anſwered damoſell doe yet beginne theſe thrée knight knew well proweſſe knight farre greater thought ſince ſuch great miſfortune hath befallen ſée ſecond knight deſireth reuenge companion wrong faile likewiſe theſe two knightes beare company perceiue well ſaide damoſell muſt tried knight ſhall liue hope conquer yet may ſay thus much without offence courage emboldened preſence theſe foure lady taking maſke ſtrange • night preſently knew made beginne manner glad faire gratious ſeruice decke trée flower ſurpaſſing beautie next baldwin diſmounted bameran amorous ſeruant lady briſa whoſe garland flower ſet next lady albaniaes rion belze ſeruant madame vertuoſa triumphant thoſe ſtrange knight maintained vnder fauour latrania torſia hope attaine ſuch honour telanſia done ſo theſe vanquiſhed knight departed preſently thence court digeon knight speare greatly abaſhed noting noble deed ſtrange knight whereupon tooke leaue went accuſtomed lodging paſſe night away reioycing greatly day come laſt ſhould witneſſe latrania proweſſe affection ſtrange knight ſo tranſformed loue theſe lady hee thought neuer leaue theyr company contemplating earneſtly eſquyre came told supper ready remembring alſo next day hee muſt enter combat knight sphere iudged one good hardy courage pray thée anſwered ſtrange knight let alone hope repoſe theſe lay ſufficient make mee breake sphere hope likewiſe knight thou nameſt lady vnderſtanding wordes theyr champyon gaue ſmall commendation theyr knightly déedes meane knight layde reſt ſo vnquiet ſléepe containe ſame minde woont goe walke vnder ladyes chamber windowe vnderſtand would come field againe aſſure theſe ladyes enforced end • ſo great trauell theſe worde gaue occaſion latrania take aduantage becauſe ſhe might better attaine deſire likewiſe triumph great fauour ſo declared name ſhe vnderſtood minde indifferently • aſed latrania time paſt heard inconſtant vnfaithfull dealing ſeating leaſt honour likewiſe might happen impeached ſhe failed preſently depart thence promiſing diſcouer lady latrania witneſſe vpon determination lady reſted ſo ſoone sunne ſhowne golden countenance earth certaine king court arriued fielde cauſed tent pauilions preſently • et vp becauſe king queene would come ſee iouſts day lady wold yet come • oorth • chamber becauſe carely iouſts ſhould begun king came long king queene came tent accompanied many honourable perſonages alſo lady damoſels great calling iudges fielde cauſed table ſet vp valley couered cloathes maruellous eſtimation king quéene refreſhed themſelues inuyting companie foure ladyes ſo ſtately apparelled day beautie ſeemed excell ladyes come queene straunge knight went foorth tent might better behold ſudden aſſemblie ſitting downe roote trée eſquyre brought victual breake faſt withall king riſen table theſe foure ladyes according woont mounted theyr stéedes tooke theyr way place ſtraunge knight remained euen readie fall daylie exerciſe courteouſly ſaluting went quéene tent king tent ſtrange knight ſtoode expecting ſhould firſt beginne iouſte king himſelfe greatly delighted beholding garlandes fauours ladyes loſt knight foyled began highly commend proweſſe ſtrange knight ieaſting foure ladyes eſpyed laſt come along valley knight sphere armed day bearing lady garland creaſt good hope keepe well enough king arnedes eſpyed hee entered theſe ſpéeches deſire greatly ſee garland flower brought vanquiſhed vnto theſe whereby may bee better aſſured whether hee preuaileth theſe conqueſts ſo happily may find péere elſe • n • knight sphere comming king preſence ſaluted humble obeyſaunce afterwards taking garland helmet deſired weare hee defended according merit beautie deſired might bee placed among vanquiſhed victorie happen ſide would ſeeke recompence hand thoſe garland might bee giuen beſtow friend requeſt latrania glad deſirous reach ſo high felicitie throughly perſwading ſelfe likewiſe ſatiſfie knight sphere ſhe put garland head earneſtly beholding ſtrange knight ſhe entred theſe ſpéeches ſée sir day ſtirrops vpon gallant beginning tooke new ſtaues wherewith met againe together ſo ſtrongly piece flew whiſtling ayre paſſing forward theſe knightes met ſo furiouſly body conſtrained tumble ground ſight king greatly abaſhed latrania contented ſelfe well ſéeing noble valiant behauiour knight ſhée thought good point ſtranger theſe two knight ſooner recouered themſelues drew ſwords wherewith hacked hewed one another pittifully ſtraunge knight deſirous v paſſe day great renowne followed intent ſingular agillitie knight sphere witneſſe earneſt affection madame latrania behaue himſelfe sphere ſeeing arme ſo mangled began thinke eſtate ſome hazard afterwards remembring beautie whoſe ſake thruſt himſelfe danger hée cōmuned thus priuately himſelfe greater good happen world allowed handes beſt deſerue wordes ſtrange knight thus anſwered •• e long enough faire damoſell ſince perceiued ſmall good bare ſince perceiue miſfortune ſo agreeable vnto deſire make knowne vnto lady make account fauouring well aſſured woont vſe ſuch recompence towards aduenture liues ſeruice wherefore ſhall well vnderſtand force tooke nature time paſt gratious regard one moſt ſingular lady deſire keepe woonted couetouſneſſe beauty ſhall decen •••• latrania vſe fauour towards pleaſeth make moſt account thus ſaid returned combate▪ helde betweene long perceiued armor defaced fleſh martyred themſelues greatly feebled againe withdrewe themſelues reſt little king arnedes loth two ſuch hardy knight ſhould end liues ſo deſperate maner quarrell ſo ſmall eſtimation would haue parted aſunder coye accepting thoſe render ſoules ſubiect vnto breaking cloſed againe ſtrange knight troth ſlowe receiuing aſſure liues béene great danger third triall beene arriuall damoſell mounted white palfray haire hanging ouer ſhoulders came ſtrange knight cry ſo loude voice brought eccho whole forreſt ſight euery one ſuddainely abaſhed chiefely theſe two knight ſeparated themſelues know • th cauſe ſpéeches madam life honor ought preferred vncertaine appetite affliction deſire humbly allow aid • uccor two diſtreſſed damoſels farre place great danger looſe honour eſteeme greater price liues trouble ſhall ſoone deliuered may pleaſe let mee haue one theſe knight endure hotte combatte loue ſhe thus ſpoken ſhe ſhed ſuch aboundaunce teares deliuered forth ſo many ſcalding ſighes latrania enforced miſſe deſire thinking ſee ende combate betweene theſe knight behalfe king ſéeing latrania make anſwer ſpake vnto damoſell manner theſe two knight faire damoſell doe deſire haue becauſe ſhall perceiue willingnes intreate pleaſe maieſtie anſwered damoſel ſo good knight know well ſhould requeſt neuertheleſſe make choyſe knight bereth ſhéeld couered latrania ſooner heard damſells word ſhee preſently came betwéene two knightes giuing ſhewe straunge knight ſhould ſuffer refuſall wherevpon ſhe ſpake thus syr knight ſuccour afflicted armes firſt inuented pray teares damoſell loue ſay beare may cauſe forſake combate moue goe helpe oppreſſed lady madame ſaide ſtraunge knight obey cauſe fond vnaduiſed yet would doe buſied eſpeciall matter may perſwade ſelfe bond wherein haue tyed ſelfe doth defend ſatiſfying commaundement conſidered alſo madame torſia may finde ſelfe offended ſhould manner ſlip giue due beautie worthily deſeruing pray ſir quoth torſia would witneſſe seruice loue place damoſell conduct co • tent obey commaundement anſwered ſtrange knight likewife goe companie haue taken condition depriued companie limitted time guarding valley madame ſaid damoſel latrania knight doth perfectly let vnderſtand obedient ſeruant loue ſelfe may well perceiue ſéeing preferreth pleaſure wherefore deſire intreate knight goe opinion ſhall finde affectionate yo • haue repoſed ſo much hope latrania willing pleaſure damoſell beganne intreate knight sphere might ſtand pleaſure giue ouer combate aſſiſt ayde great hazard madame anſwered knight sphere know great harme let alone combate mine enemy ſuch noble redoubted knight yet would haue one thinke reſpect feare diſmaying ſelfe let paſſe thus know ſelfe ſufficient enough greater matter marry concerning requeſt earneſt loue beare ſuch ſo great content ſuffer whatſoeuer lay vppon onely ſatiſfie content turning ſtrange knight beganne againe manner pray sir thus imagine think earneſt deſire purchaſe loue madame latrania hath bene ſome hinderance victory albeit made ſome aſſurance thereof owne conceit indéede anſwered ſtrange knight ſée hard man get aduantage without putting owne life great danger aſſure ſtroakes haue béene ſo well laid haue made conceiue ſo good opinion valour whereof ſince ſo well aſſured doth little pleaſe ſo good knight ſhall goe damoſels cauſe ere depart would gladly vnderſtand name end latrania may ha • e knowledge neceſſitie ſhe muſt account ſelfe greatly indebted king himſelfe leſſe deſirous know ſtrange knight deſired earneſtly reueale himſelfe knight sphere ſéeing king great importunitie tooke helmet kneeled downe kiſſe maieſties hand perceiuing friend dramuſiande would ſo permit caſting armes necke embraced maruellous gratious courteſie ſory ſuddaine departure would ſuffer regard willingly would hee would let part made knowne quéene lady declare king benefite knowledge ſtrange knight would alaſſe quoth king would willingly knowe much quiet ſelfe haue knowne oh syr ſaide dramuſiande beſéech expectt yet little longer vntill enterpriſe ſhall ended opinion ſeeke depart hence hée make himſelfe firſt knowne grace damoſell preſented ſelfe declaring high •• e ſhould gone wherevpon tooke leaue latrania eſteemed ſelfe aboue lady ſhe power bring obeyſance ſo good knight dramuſiande departure king quéene rode citie daily commended ſingular proweſſe ſtrange knight kept charge ſo well lady court would depart thence firſt might haue garland ſeruants loſt wherevpon came togither trée caught away violently ſtrange knight daring reſiſt chap xlv ſtrange knight day following garding valley king courtly attendant thus departed foure lady tooke way monaſtery ſtrange knight went tent ſate downe reſt himſelfe afterward kept cuſtome went walked vnder gréene trées lady determined ſhould night goe viſite amorous louer manſia night muſt go parley knight put waſtcoate blew taffata wrought ouer body net • worke gold wherein compoſed diuerſe ranckes • rich orient pearles placed stone ineſtimable value haire wound fine plat head couered imbrodered garland blewe veluet wherein ſet faire plume white feather beautifully adorned ſpangles gold order haue declared manſia came ſate downe ſtrange knight auoide ſuſpition ſhee tooke garland fearing hurt impeached serena elſe deſire ſhe perfecter ſéene laying hand vpon head ſhe beganne followeth syr time forbid manner complaint ſelfe ſhall deny paine paſt forgotten ſeruices recompenced gratious viſitation eſpecially ſeeing take pleaſure fauour ſo much time ſtrange knight ſuppriſed ſuch excéeding ioy could poſſibly make anſwer beautie manſia ſo rauiſhed vnderſtanding mindfull vſing gracious language wherewith ought haue entertained ſodaine ioy ſomewhat calmed failed account maruellous honourably wherewith ſhe remained verie well contented giue occaſſon ſpéech began court manner madame know wel good nature ſée deſerts doubtfull trauailes requited ſhould iudge otherwiſe vnworthie gracious viſitation haue afforded aſſuring moſt eſpeciall recompence happen hauing meanes contemplate excellent beauty may preſume paragon ſelfe haue ſame opinion truſt ſhew ſelfe ingratefull nature hath framed ſuch one may iuſtly called phoenix beautie haue ſo déepely imprinted heart ſhall extreamely tormented ſhall depriued ſwéete company yet greatly abaſhed digeſt ſo wel ſée ſuffer ſuch paine greefe deſerueth better eſtéemed hauing power cauſe liue contentedly die preſently pray sir ſaide manſia paſſe tell vſe theſe ſpéeches latrania truſt lady quoth curioſitie ſo much make great account ſhe perhaps might forgetful many thing eſpecially ſo many knight bound mind elſe grounded amorous repreſentations thruſt obliuion ſo madame towardes may altogether diſpoſe ſeruitude euen ſhe hath power ouer ſéeing ſo pray humbly good lady iudge foure moſt affectionate haue wel aduiſed ſelf ſeueral perfectiōs lady cānot yet denie aduantaged aboue beautie grace authoritie ſo eſtéeme ſelfe moſt fortunate depriued libertie altogether vowed obey manſia able withhold ſelfe giuing credite ſtrange knight golden word thinking vſed latrania ſame manner ſhe beganne come néere laying hand ſhoulder ſhe ſhaped anſwer matter ſo sir ſéeme make humbly deſire tell end may greater aſſurance ioyne beléefe perſwaſions perceiue anſwered ſtrange knight ſmall aſſurance repoſe ſo ſaying tooke hand ſhe ſuffered quietly ſo amorous word laſt bewrayed himſelfe vnto perſwaded griping one another hand certaine beginning loue little fauour made ſomewhat bold furder would haue procéeded lady left departed glad ſhe knew ſhe left without hope purchaſe intent ſtrange knight extreamely paſſioned ſéeing quicknes light regard loue wherewith ſhe accompanyed made ſo ſcornefully entertained yet could blame alone ſo vſed many ſad conceit paſſed away night ripping vp intricate ſorrowes • bound ſuffer day appeared mounted horſebacke vowing reuenge iniurie receiued night knight ſhould happen deale withall found himſelfe farre deceiued intent knight french court giuen ouer comming trouble whereat ſomewhat offended neuertheleſſe diſſembled gréefe lady might behold wonted paſſions latrania much diſpleaſed becauſe iouſts continued woont againe ſhe doubted leaſt knight sphere ſuſtained foyle damoſelles cauſe reaſon ſo ouercharged trauaile went ſhe would ſorry ſhould ſo fall proweſſe giuen aduantage ouer companieos cauſe ſhe remained continually affectionate towards dramuſiande concerning aduenture followed hiſtory maketh mantion damoſell ſent sage aliarts meanes onely ſuccour liues theſe two knight imployed ayding emperour conſtantinople place damoſell cauſed dramuſiande take way albeit loath forſake latrania theſe ſixe dayes thus paſt dedicated honor manſia telanſia latrania two dayes reſerued torſia come laſt whereof ſtrange knight glad intended doe done reſt firſt day chance haue aduenture becauſe one knight preſented himſelfe valley wherefore paſſed away time till night hee went accuſtomed place ſtaied long telanſia came taffata waſtcoate indian collour richly ſpangled ouer bodie head iewells great eſtimation thus ſhe came ſtrange knight deſiring certifie whereto hée made aunſwer perceiue madame loue altogether entendeth depriue life deſirous doe ſeruice extreamely plague puniſh paine oppreſſed ſoules may compare mine hath made thus vnderſtand ſeuerall viſitations end onely gaine knowledge without deſire pittie continuall dying ſpirit regard dangerous trauailes wherein ſeeke prolong loathed life though dayly deſire breathe laſt iudge word ſauour forgerie may compare continuall iuſtneſſe preſent behauiour ſhall finde owne iudgement witneſſe againſt ſelfe ought ſo diſdaine kindneſſe hath guarded paſſage vnder ſhe honour name whereby may triumph perpetuall renowne theſe cauſes conſidered thinkes ſhould vſe ſuch ingratitude knight hath béene occaſion ſo much eſtéemed alſo affectionate towards sir knight anſwered telanſia know whether wordes forged albeit cuſtome ſuch mingle many deceit among complaint would perſwade belieue ſay grant haue refuſed companion tell faire lady anſwered ſtrange knight tell ſhall greatly make daintie aſſuring durſt reueale
