ſpeciall ſeruice honour ſhall vnderſtand called knight sauage man name truly may change honour called ſeruant sir florian anſwered telanſia one ſignes whereby know ſmall loue beare reuealing name know account lady doubt haue fained haue done therefore pray offended muſt néeds part company riſing ſhe departed thence promiſing diſcouer end enterpriſe might hindered day following laſt trie valour torſiaes behalfe entred • ielde hoping day purchaſe immortall renowne chap xvi happened ſtrange knight laſt day guarded paſſage vnder name madame torſia ſtrange knight ſtayed till noone forth tent yet one knight entred valley made report lady feare ſeruants guarding thē cauſed forget affection woont word beare wherof foure agréeued ſo mounted thier palfrays al came commune knight vſed leſſe pleaſant behauiourr done whilſt theſe lady thus conferring ſtrange knight eſpyed comming thrée knight armor colour white blacke ſcarlet one figured ſhéeld swan field sable one theſe knight named alemant two italian alemant called himſelfe lambort saxonie trauailing conſtantinople met theſe two italian perſwaded trauaile caſtle almaroll willing likewiſe approue aduenture ſoone intreated beare company complections different fell way hearing aduenture theſe foure french l • dy addicted iourney preſently french court perſwading themſelues end aduenture wherein ſo many good hardy knight fayled thus armed after▪ one manner arriued valley laſt day lady aduenture know well ſaid ſtrange knight ſo ſoone eſpied fortune intend ſuffer day without ſhewing faire ladie great deſire hauè accepted among number beſt fauoured ſeruants may perſwade ſelfe knight whatſoeuer hath power reſiſt againſt haue ſwéete lady preſence ſtraunge knight repoſed torſia thrée knight arriued field aduiſedly beheld beautie theſe foure lady could iudge moſt excell beautie ſo affection contrarie two italian enterpriſed combate latrania alemant altogether inueigled beautie manſia theſe lady ſo well pleaſed poſſible could ſhould ſerued kinghts ſtrange nation made vſe ſuch great courteſie fauour towards done like king arnedes court whereat ſtrange knight ſo mooued preſently prepared himſelfe iouſt brucie verona one italian firſt beganne paſtime ſtrange knight met ſuch ſort ſent ground héeles vpward italian perceiuing named trucie beroze▪ gaue horſe ſpurres encounter ſent kéepe fellowe company much diſpleaſed lambrot saxonie eſtéemed good knight ſetting launce reſt two knight met together ſo brauely lambrot vnhorſed saddle betwéene legges ſtrange knight forced forſake ſtirrops alemant calling combate ſword ſtrange knight alighted horſe two italian would ſuffer alemant enter combate ſaide aduantage belonged becauſe firſt diſmounted vpon fell much variance among themſelues incontinently appeaſed foure lady ordained brucian verona ſhould begin combate firſt ſo entertained ſtrange knight trucie beroze conſtrained come helpe whereat ſtrange knight ſo mooued ſhort time layde brucie verona feete trucie beroze ſore hurt glad flie lady refuge deſired ſtrange knight ſaue life alemont deſirous reuenge iniury two friend receiued drew ſword buckling sheeld came fiercely aſſayle ſtrange knight dealt ſo roughly followed intent ſuch nimble braue behauiour alemant found dealt one ſtronger himſelfe yet mind rather deſired die hand demand ſuccour lady ſo greatly mooued pittie fearing ſee die came deſired ſtrange knight giue ouer combate requeſt contented glad ſo well accompliſhed promiſe giuing vnderſtand ſeruice could perſwaded eaſily enterpriſe aduenture night courteouſly tooke leaue went againe monaſterie leauing great extremitie greefe done dayes paſſed muſt forget tel lady likewiſe gaue three knight friendly farewell withdrewe themſelues alſo lodging day following tooke way whither▪ fortune guided vnwilling go viſite court againe much leſſe returne lady whoſe ſakes receiued ſo great ſhame ſtraunge knight remembring himſelfe torſiaes turne came viſite made account paſſed trauaile went accuſtomed place hee long looked preſence torſia albeit thought conceale himſelfe yet poſſible ſo doe hee onely bewrayed name vnto hee would haue diſcourſed whole life likewiſe ſhe bin diſpoſed haue giuen hearing long totſia tooke way place lady bene night apparell wastcoate blacke taffata body richly wrought euer paſement lace gold • oure finger bread betwéene curry lace coſtly pearles ſtones ſet forth ſuch brauery would haue amazed • réeſt knight world mantle blew veluet wrought round •• cure gold verie ſumptvouſly manner ſhe came ſate downe knight fearefull mooue effence way durſt take hardineſſe ſpeake whereupon ſhe ſpake thus thinke sir • hat comming would ſo •• ender eſtimation perceiue make alwayes miſdoubt therefore deceiued madame anſwered ſtrange knight pleaſure receiue arriuall ſo great deprined vſe ſpéech whereat ſée offended reputed otherwiſe loyall ſeruant aduaunce ſelfe entertaine ſuch graciers behauiour excellencie well deſerueth doe remember ſwéet miſtreſſe ſpoken talke 〈…〉 nothing elſe woonted gréeuous complaint 〈◊〉 afraide commit light albeit haue iuſt occaſion ſuch doubt faire madam diſpleaſing ignorant anſwered torſia neuer want excuſes knowes ſhift himſelfe haue giuen forth ſelfe daily vnder name obedient ſeruant cannot beléeue much leſſe abide accept knight ſeruice dare reueale name onely thing truely wherefore come hither time madame ſaid ſtrange knight know whether ſhould declare name vnto • remaine paſſionate vnderſtand knight whome beare moſt fauour conceale ſelfe excellency continuing ſ • lfe ſtill afflicted leauing vncontented aſſure make ſlender choyſe either theſe two extreames knowing may hurt moſt yet muſt put aduenture ſince good hap tyed heeles mercurie therefore ſhall vnderſtand madame called knight sauage man prince court haue receiued greater fauour ladyes hand haue done french court albeit haue done dutie ſeruice towards beare prize beautie eſpecially honour affection aboue ſeeing haue thus diſcourſed name vnto deſire thinke complaint iuſt occaſion true loue woont enforce ſuffer trauaile ſerue fidelitie ſhall reſt content ſo well recompenced ſuch eſpeciall good beare deſire life may prolonged onely pleaſure regarding often baniſhent hope deſpaire ſundry vnſauorie ſweetes wherewith muſt feed ſelfe onely froward rigorous ſtormes dayly hourely come therefore deſire good madame ſomewhat regard pittie hath onely ſuffer euer lay would refuſe torment ſo knew fancie thinke well sir knight anſwered torſia ſhould deceiued ſuch faire plauſible ſpeeches vnpoſſible • hunne miſfortune ſhould accompany two princeſſes targiana arnalte becauſe know ſo well would loath beare part complaint content time leaue ſhe thus ſaid ſhe preſently roſe departed accounting▪ aſſurance ſmall company becauſe euerie one knew ſundry prankes knight sauage man maruellouſly offended ſodaine departure torſia brake forth complaint ſtill though ſhe company albeit lady quoth remembrance vngentleneſſe maketh deſpaire yet preſence hath power helpe dolour reioycing troubled ſight giuing comfort afflicted ſoule knitting vp complaint ſweete companie depriued theſe fainting armes fold vp dying coarſe ſo many deadly ſigh accompany maiſter latter home moned pretty ſpace manner concluded himſelfe forget theſe lady entring conceit crueltie ſlept ſoundly till next morning ſo ſoone armed cauſed arlencea damoſels ſent remained monaſterie nun giuing moſt harty thankes friendes vſage ſet forward way knight sauage man would haue shield longer couered foure lady bare company little way palfrey glad could let king knowe hee faine would haue court perceiued labour vaine torſia ſmiling ſpake thus truſt ſir te • te fall mine eye thinkes take parting heau • ly euery teare bigge milſtone lady quoth fire kindled ſtomach loue ſuch nature water cannot quench ſeeing make ſo light account hath humbled himſelfe 〈◊〉 much deſpiſe loue occaſion ſuch miſfortune may aſſure ſelfe gage heart preſent ſelfe another place trie ſhalbe better entertained haue beene hand parting ſet forward iourney deſiring attaine citie conſtantinople chap xlvii knight sauge man arriued court conſtantinople dragonalt arnalte queene nauarre came likewiſe emperours court long trauailed knight sauage man till laſt hee came forreſt ſomewhat néere citie conſtantinople eſpied number knight lady damoſels made preſently ſuſpect emperor company indéede béen abroad ſée falcon flie age would ſuffer ride horſebacke coach accompanied empreſſe princeſſe court peroeiuing knight sauage man comming fiue damoſels company knew ſo ſoone beheld deuiſe shield came togither méete ſuch troupe knight sauage man ioyfull ſee himſelfe ſo welcome friend amongſt brother palmerin england came embraced excéeding humanitie arlencea alighted horſe tooke hand brought emperour kiſſed hand deſired excellencie might pleaſure remember much beholding lady ſaued falling handes cruell collambra mother arlencea humbled ſelfe emperour huge ſtature much wondred lady emperour ſhewed himſelfe gracious vnto like manner empreſſe gridonia leonarda princeſſe thrace ſuſpecting knight sauage man minde entertained arlencea euen ſo meane theſe lady thus ioyfully entertaining arlencea knight sauage man aduertiſed death king fredericke england grandfather tidings ſo heauy enforced forſake company rode citie come pallace conſumed certaine dayes mourning vntill time compelled goe viſit princeſſe leonarda lady emperour cauſed arlencea mounted horſebacke againe making eſpeciall eſtimation ſhe endued exquiſite beautie ſo ſhe adorned gratious maners liked euery one well beheld eſpecially dramuſiande ſo farre loue quite forgotten latrania emperour returne cittie eſpyed come riding along forreſt diuers ladyes damoſels accompanyed diuers knight offered iouſt attendant emperour principal knight company perceiuing deſirous beſide try valour ſuch aſſembly tooke ſtrong lance clapping downe beuer helmet came preſented himſelfe lady company authoritie command hauing taken leaue gaue horſe ſpurs ſo fortunate encounter ſent bellizant ſaddle afterward another lance one knight gaue hand ſent foure good eſpeciall knight emperours court ground whereat emperour maruelled noting braue behauiour knight cauſed ſent certaine lance could receiued damoſell came ſaluted emperor knight maner renowmed emperour dragonalt king nauarre deſirous content princeſſe arnalte quéen wife hath thus preſumed iouſt knight vnderſtood highneſſe place commanded infourme maieſtie hath left owne realme offer humble dutie excellencie emperour empreſſe hearing damoſelles word ſuppriſed vnſpeakeable pleaſure entending entertaine dragonalt much honour could deuiſed well knowing sonne valiant prince nephew king friſoll alſo mooue affection queene arnalte ample maner ſo without ſtay went meete dragonalt queene arnalte beheld alighted horſes holding one another hand went meete empreſſe likewiſe greater honour came feete accompanied gridonia polinarda leonarda diuers lady imbracing humanitie letting vnderſtand emperor court highly honored preſence ſides ſufficiently welcomed theſe prince dragonalt arnalte mounted horſebacke palmerin alighted taking bridle arnaltes horſe hand ſo walked til came pallace wherat princeſſe polinarda beganne waxe ſomewhat iealous arnalte well noting beautie two princeſſes polinarda faire leonarda thrace began thinke enterpriſed combate spaine faireſt world witneſſe manhood iuſt occaſion albeit next theſe two ſelfe eſteemed third beautie emperours court princeſſe miragarda came thither ſhe conſtrained fourth number dragonalt quéene arnalte lodged verie neere empreſſe chamber arlencea damoſels gueſts ducheſſe lubicall chiefe lady empreſſe emperour cauſed dayly iouſts tournements witneſſe quéene arnalte preſence agreeable dramuſiande ſo conquered loue arlencea could reſt place neither enioy quietneſſe palmerin liued content long time yet thinke thing ſound ſure lone preſenteth daily ſome occaſions feare amorous perſons vntill ſuch time deſires perfectly contented meane great ioy continued pompides king scottes queene arriued emperor cour receiued maruellous great pompe honour prince primaleon deſirous ſhewe himſelfe thankefull diuerſe occaſions paſſed betweene prince edward himſelfe ledde queene scottes palfray bridle till ſhe came pallace gate notwithſtanding intreatie pompides ſelfe often contrarie quéene scottes lodged princeſſe polinarda held ſelfe greatly contented becauſe ſhee ſo neere alliance moſt fauoured friend palmerin pomp de went comfort knight sauage man chamber kept would yet goe abroad ſo heauily tooke death king fredericke grandfather court conſtantinople ſhort time ſo well furniſhed prince noble knight iudged needed entertaine whole puiſſance pagan king chap xlviii arnedes king fraunce queene recinde king spaine queene accompanied princeſſe miragarda giant almaroll arriued emperours court conſtantinople emperour ſéeing himſelfe brought extremity age thought good enioyn nephewe marriage alſo prince knight béene nouriſhed court might mooue generall good liking ſo imparted intent empreſſe ſonne primaleon hee vnderſtood well thought matter hée writ preſently arnedes king france ſonne lawe would doe ſo much honour come quéene court like manner maieſtie diſpatched letter edward king england flerida daughter recinde king spaine deſiring quéene come court bring princeſſe miragarda company emperour vernar ſent likewiſe tarnaes king lacedemonia daughter sidelia whoſe beautie caried ſome credit time soldane bellagris maiortes many others emperour letter inuited court firſt came conſtantinople emperour vernar king edward england ſoone came soldane bellagris maiortes entertainement according noble eſtates deſerued came king tarnaes quéene sidelia daughter ſorrowfull lady pandricia empreſſe lodged owne chamber two king arnedes recinde arriued shippes port conſtantinople ſounded trumpet drummes ſo gallantly people afraide cittie fearing left enemy come princeſſe came receiue great ioy might behold king france ſumptuous galley couered cloath golde great value wherein himſelfe quéene florenda graciana two daughter many lady knightes beſide another galion king recinde quéene number knight guarde another galion faireſt princeſſe miragarda giant almaroll prince florendos many knight king recinde aduertiſed emperour intended marry princeſſe nephewe florendos king arnedes conſent doe honour cauſed galion march formoſt captaine ouer veſſelles emperour ſo glad theſe tydings hée forſooke coatch brought chayre place theſe prince ſhould land empreſſe quéenes princeſſes lady mounted horſes clad moſt rich coſtly harneſſe ſo ridde port citie ſtately emperour accompanied sonne primaleon king edward england emperour vernar allemaigne soldane bellagris maiortes ternaes king lacedemonia polendos eſtrelant pompides dragonalt little ioy aged yéeres ſee himſelfe ſo beloued moſt puiſſant prince whole world albeit preſence theſe great perſonages • pleaſant yet could hee chooſe take heauily ſéeing preaſſe ſo fore vppon long hée could bée companion king arnedes recinde prince florendos come land knéeled downe kiſſe emperours hand imbracing armes would ſuffer honour ſo much came quéene spaine quéene france two daughter maieſtie welcomed familiarly princeſſe miragarda came preſence accepted maruellous graciouſly entring theſe ſpéeches glad madame would vouchſafe come hither may requite great gentleneſſe haue found hand prouiding detaine prince albayzar ſo good ſecuritie princeſſe miragarda made anſwere milde princely courteſie made ſhowe well ſhee tooke emperours word aſſure preſence abaſhed iudgements number whoſe eye ſhe ſeemed faiceſt creature earth giant almaroll likewiſe welcome emperour princeſſe polinarda courteouſly ſaluted miragarda ſhe ſhrunke aſide brother florendos entertaining language perceiue new wel lord brother haue good cauſe thinke labour well beſtowed haue trauelled lady ſo ſingular beautie would heart good siſter anſwered florendo due recompence labour hath deſerued ſo might better aſſurance oh brother ſaid polinarda giant almaroll hath authoritie ſhut doore againſt therefore promiſe princeſſe thrace • orget enterpriſe meanes whereby ſhall doubt finde fauour emperour would delay time longer pallace rode altogether prince primalcon leading queene spaines horſe bridle albeit king recinde loth ſuffer king polendos much honour queene fraunce king edward england afforded like faire princeſſe miragarda well content aged emperor honour kinſeman prince florendos palmerin england like faire florenda florian forreſt princeſſe gracia • briefe princeſſe knight led lades palfra • e till came pallace emperour caried chayre foure knight communing princeſſe miragarda way deſiring fauour nephew florendos thinke one well deſerued hand chap xlix conference emperour prince marriage appointed accompliſhed effect prince thus arriued conſtantinople reſted themſelues certaine dayes emperour deſirous content euery one died beſtowed ſeruice honouring reuealed intent emperor vernar king edward arnedes recinde primaleon would gladly ſée nephewes married prince béene nouriſhed court would ſee matched according affection ſerued prince liked maruaellouſly emperours intent whereupon cauſed sunday following great feaſt ordained quéene fleridaes chamber place moſt conuenient pallace courtly diſports lady euery one regarded degrées pleaſant ladyes ſauoured ſeruants coſtly iunckets prouided banquet palmerin ſo earneſt affection towards lady iudged ſurpaſſe beautie florendos held ſame opinion faire miragarda florian made ſuch eſtimation princeſſe thrace feared combate againſt whatſoeuer beautie might carrie credite aboue reſt prince platir behinde conceite towards ſwéete ladie sidelia daughter king tarnaes empreſſe bazilia gridonia fl • rida francellina becauſe high eſtates chéefe next empreſſe 〈…〉 quéene flerida bare price beautie amongſt becauſe ſhe moſt ſwéete delicate time yeares table wiſhdra • e 〈◊〉 departed place emperour weake ſickely 〈◊〉 king edward expreſſe company giuen charge king edward willing obey emperor commandement aroſe table •• taking hat kiſſing emperours hand ſaluted preſent began thus moſt gratious empres v benefit honor hath receiued ſuch lady marriage emperour owne court hath pleaſed beſtow v ſome allied excellency others prince lord empire wherby renowme chriſtendom worthyly maintained cauſes expreſſing good nature continued floriſhing eſtate may therefore ſéeme good preſent publickely open gracious princely determination whereby may knowne highneſſe theſe quéenes princeſſes company ſhall thinke well aduice honourable councell ſeeketh put practiſe ſo maieſty hath ſet downe decree theſe young prince knight ſhal ioyne mariage • ecompence noble trauels thoſe moſt affectionate thē yet vnprouided lady maieſty allow continuance court whereby 〈◊〉 ſhall grew ſide euery one ſhall contented owne deſires pauſing attended empreſſe quéenes ladyes would ſay alſo • bethinke himſelfe name perſons emperour appointed many young prince knight ſomewhat abaſhed doubting whether might giue credite king word iudged labor ſufficiently rewarded might enioy ſweet saint miſtreſſe lady preſence began bluſh change amiable countenance whereby bewrayed ſecret ſudden ioy heart receiued ſpéeches king edward vttered polinarda often caſt eye prince palmerin great feare offender awaiteth ſentēce iudge ſhe doubted leaſt grandfather would beſtow ſome let enioy heart deſired palmerin afflicted ſame manner ſuch ſo great vehemency ſundry paſſions betwéene hope feare conſtrained ſuffer thought infinite deale trouble father king edward following former intent began againe manner ſhall vnderſtand sir florendos gratious lord emperour conſent king recinde enioyneth eſpowſe princeſſe miragarda iudgement bée thing offended bee ſo matched ſo ſhall syr florendos thinke ſelfe fully ſatiſfied trauailes haue endured ſake prince preſent looked florendos might well perceiue word king edward giuen ioy richeſt realme world poſſeſſion princeſſe miragarda kept countenance ſo demurely one could hardly iudge whether loue florendos acceptable thée ſonne palmerin ſaid king edward emperour prince primaleon willing thou ſhouldeſt knowe loue beare thee doe giue thée wife princeſſe polinarda doubting thou ſhalt imagine thy paſſed trauailes fully recompenced ſo ſweet reward princeſſe polinarda ſooner heard theſe wordes delicate roſiall colour dyed daintie countenance witneſſed loue good ſhe bare prince palmerin england likewiſe abandoned former feare ſeeing ſhould enioy felicitie hee ſo long wiſhed father king edward perceiued made though eſpie procéeded former determination giuing prince gracian sonne king france vnderſtand emperour beſtowe niece claricias daughter king polendos syr berolde vertuous behauiour muſt enioy iewel heart faire oniſtalda daughter duke drapos normandie niece renowned king friſoll whereof father ſure well contented ſir francian ſhall match bernada daughter valiant prince belcar noble prince platir déedes worthy perpetuall memorie ſhall poſſeſſe faire sidelia daughter king tarnaes lacedemoni • willingly beſtowe vpon noble behauiour hath well deſerued roſuel true inheriter prince belcar father ſhall honoured dramaciana daughter duke tirendos haue ſerued faithfully ſo long ſhall enioy laſt deſert labour bellizant brother prize lady deniſa daughter duke sparta content requite loue becauſe hath endured ſo many ſharpe ſhowers vnder name dramian ſhall haue guardon princeſſe clariana daughter di • ea princeſſe hungaria friſoll becauſe right ſuccéede duke father ſhall ioyned marriage leonarda daughter duke pera cauſe noble gentleman emperour councell call place end might perceiue good zeale loue beareth let forget maieſtie hath ordained concerning noble sir dramuſiande ſhall eſpouſe madame arlencea well content deſire loue alſo ſhewe himſelfe thankefull bewraying treaſon alfernao excellency hath concluded beſtowe profound iſle ſometime belonged • ather brauorant cuſtody ſonne florian friend darmuſiande ſuppriſed ſuch excéeding ioy theſe word power attend till king edward finiſhed diſcourſe came humbled ſelfe emperor yéelding thouſand thankes gracious courteſie king edward tooke vp armes deſiring haue patience little till ended charge comming princeſſe thrace entred theſe ſpéeches moſt excellent princeſſe nature hath plentifully endued beautie courteſie emperour wich theſe king noble lord company doe earneſtly deſire giue marriage ſon florian ſo déedes might deſerue ſo well good liking likewiſe wiſhed ſonne palmerin tied ſome point obedience according king sardamant grandfather appointed palmerin kept himſelfe ſilent humbly deſired king father vouchſafe word twaine granted came princeſſe thrace ſetting knee ground began followeth durſt madam take hardnes preſent brother florian firſt time ſaw fearing leaſt would thinke inclined regard pr • fit honour willing driue till preſent might haue ſome knowledge knightly déedes wherein perceiued take delight might bolder preſenting huſband eaſier entertaine let pray ſeeme acceptable iudgement emperor counſell hath determined perſwaded heauenly power doe thinke well ſhould ſo syr palmerin aunſwered princeſſe ſhée alwayes couet meanes whereby might ſhew ſelfe dutifull vnto ſhould ſéeme vſe ſelfe otherwiſe vnworthy receiue royall preferment king grandfather hath appointed beſide ſubiects might well examine ſhould goe contrary hath houre ouer therefore reſolue ſel • e ſhall content graunt thing imagine fulfilling promiſe mine honour palmerin kiſſing hand aroſe immediately little glad courteous anſwere princeſſe thrace made king edward turned knight beganne againe manner ſhall vnderſtand noble gentleman emperor ſhould reueale accept opinion princeſſes lady ſhal bewray intent empreſſe becauſe excellency would enterpriſe thing haue party well contented therewith theſe marriage ſo well thought euery one preſent knight lady told emperor contented eſpecially knight aduanced themſelues one another kiſſe emperours hand like emperor vernar bazilia gridonia king quéenes preſent emperour embraced euery one palmerin came h • ld armes ſpake thus ſonne haue continually imagined ſelfe might worthily recompence déedes ſo high eſtimation perſwade ſelfe deſire ſhall ſufficiently contented giuing iewell bliſſe honour trauailes niece princeſſe polinarda whoſe name pray heauens imprint ſo deepe heart empreſſe hath beene 〈◊〉 end bearing one name may alike happineſſe good fortune neuer thought gracious lord anſwered palmerin deedes ſhould purchaſe ſuch high happy felicitie maieſtie hath 〈◊〉 ſee goodneſſe defect bound duty life primaleon gridonia imbraced louingly glad daughter beſtowed ſo honourably theſe ioyfull motion one ſide ſomewhat pacified emperor returned counſell againe emperor vernar king edward primaleon king letting vnderſtand intend forget ladie pandritia whereupon soldane bellagris called whome king edward bewrayed matter paſſed bellagris vnder name entred pandriciaes chamber begot syr blandidon euery one thought ſhée ſelfe king edward sonne may reade firſt volume hiſtory soldane bellagris knowing thy great error faith aſſured withall blandidon ſonne remoued turkiſh opiuion wherein liued ſo long time remaine friendſhip theſe worthy prince hée concluded eſpouſe pandritia great contentment many prince friend likewiſe conuerſion came know lawe liuing god good hap emperor chriſtian prince glad continue bellagris good mind emperor preſently aroſe counſell went princeſſe chamber accompanied king edward maieſtie declared pandritia paſſed betwéene solean bellagris cauſing forget former opiniō blandidon ſonne king edward certifying likewiſe soldan receiued heatheniſh faith make amends marriage ſhe ought refuſe well conſidering valour rich soldane mighty renowmed prince alſo ſon might know noble father pandritia heauily looking ſo ſore troubled great ere ſhe ſpake word ſhe better remembred ſelfe ſhee earneſtly beheld king edward ſpeaking maner hard deſtiny worthy prince hath concealed ſo long laſt haue vouchſafed bewray life may heereafter pleaſant hath beene may aſſure ſelfe knowne giuen due chaſtiſement ignorant miſfortune ſince come light time loue ſonne ſaluation soldane subiects compelleth forget matter paſt conſidered alſo force loue made deceiue manner emperour liked well ſhe ſaid empreſſe embraced hee many time ſo glad could poſſible thing came ſuch happy end blandidon called preſence ſorry knew king edward father hope preferred soldanes dignitie made forget former occaſions take content preſent 〈…〉 l soldan bellagris baptized afterward emperor cauſed married pandritia prince court married alſo theſe marriage thus agréed vpon emperour commaunded day following thing ſolemnizing theſe honourable rite ſho • ld prepared moſt decent maner becauſe would haue married great hall pallace archbiſhop conſtantinople ſayd diuine ſeruice afterward made learned sermon giue soldane bellagris earneſt affection law ieſus chriſt publiſhing likewiſe openly paſſed betwéene ladie pandritia becauſe ſuſpition ſhould ariſe apt enough conceine euill opinion archbiſhop concluded ſermon baptized soldane emperor king edward england godfather two empreſſes godmother honour emperour would haue firſt married ſo soldane bellagris pandritia thus knit together matrimonie blandidon humbled himſelfe ſigne obedience soldane embracing tooke vp reioycing greatly ſo good knight ſonne hée ſhould leaue ſubiects ſuch worthy gouernour pandritia thus eſpouſed soldane empreſſe lady walked becauſe emperour would haue florendos miragarda matched next done heart abandoned woonted care taking hand gaue place quéenes england spaine walking along hall comfort theſe new married folkes good counſell next entred prince polinarda led betwéene empreſſe allemaigne quéene fraunce palmerin going accompanied emperour vernar king tarnes lacedemonia next came faire princeſſe thrace betwéene queene francelina theſſalie quéene flerida england glad ſée matched prince florian forreſt theſe two noble engliſh prince wedded ſwéete friend prince gracian berold platir prince knight eſpouſed vnto lady new quéen thrace princeſſe polinarda entred leading arlencea betweene whoſe beautie ſhewed ſtately ſet foorth preſence theſe two princeſſes prince primaleon king edward accompanied giant dramuſiande married arlencea great royaltie departed place princeſſe miragarda humbly intreated emperour would giue cordigea daughter giant gatarin ſhe remaining ſeruice marriage giant almaroll whereto maiſter preſently agreed vnderſtood good cordigea ſo gaue himſelfe honour princeſſe miragarda giant almaroll cordigea may reade large ſecond booke notable hiſtory edward brittaine giant almaroll lord another fortreſſe farre thence kept princeſſe miragarda fortreſſe called beauty bulwarke whereof hee made preſent eſpouſed lady cordigea condition ſhe ſhould call caſtle owne name returne againe hiſtorie ſoone archbiſhop ended theſe ceremony theſe marriage emperor went queene flerides chamber dinner prouided honor theſe prince withall lady came florenda graciana daughter king arnede • germaine orleaunce affectionate ſeruant florenda thought himſelfe vnworthy come preſence becauſe hee counted ſubiect king france yet emperour make ſuch commendation knightly déedes germaine orleaunce king graunted marry daughter florenda albeit daughter graciana found ſelfe diſcontented ſhe could get huſband ioy company feaſt ſerued moſt magnificall honor new married prince made ſuch high account thought heauenly life married man florendos palmerin florian platir prince reſpected fauour emperor king exceedingly like manner miragarda leonarda polinarda sidelia princeſſes honoured empreſſes quéenes moſt ſtately beholde oftentimes would recreate themſelues thorough city ſmall delight content emperour marking frien • ſeeing prince floraman abſent company hée demanded become made anſwere hee little palace ſitting mourning vnder tree florendos vnderſtood hee left company went perſwaded come reioyce floraman returned anſwere doe trauell ſelfe ſo sir florendos haue partner pleaſures enioy hath euer loſt comfort great good vnfainedly beare doth deſerue ſhould ſo deale ſorrowes would ten time ſhould doe would haue mee therefore deſire let beare griefe quietly ſéeing hee fortune delighteth torment continually florendos deuiſed meanes poſſible change conceite ſéeing labour beſtowed vaine returned emperor certifying griefe wherein left prince floraman newes emperour friendes heauily paſſioned continued commending prince floraman till gentlman vſher called ſupper ſupper ended table withdrawne theſe new merried prince began dance greekiſh manner maſkes paſtimes done night one went chamber receiue content cauſed endure ſo long trouble chap li queene thrace conueied away ſtrange aduenture knight continued pleaſure conſtantinople theſe prince delighting himſelfe ſweete lady whoſe ſake hee endured many ſharpe trauailes length determined ſo diner others though attained • ame felicitie yet witneſſe good affection friend ordaine generall tournament whereto came many ſtrange knight laboured much lay ſhew hardy valour thoſe prince appointed triumph meane ſport continued arriued knight armed blacke bearing deadly hope figured ſheeld coate armour blacke horſe lance ſame colour ſad habite euery one coniectured ſmall ioy knight himſelfe neuertheleſſe ſuch great fortune three dayes together remained victor againſt dealt length becauſe would diſcouer name iudges field florian florendos went arme themſelues deſirous try combate knight dramuſiande perſwaded contrary giuing vnderſtand prince floraman king edward ſon palmerin brought laſt emperor excellencie began comfort ſaying againſt reaſon ſhould afflict himſelfe ſuch ſort eſpecially thing could remedy moreouer leading life ſo penſiuely ſhould end onely ſhorten owne time alſo offend iudgements eſpeciall friendes would euerie one glad faine diſſwade greeſe torment word prince floraman thus replied know well gracious lord honour pleaſeth vſe neuer recompenced deed much leſſe ſatiſfaction made word beſeech maieſty conſider faithfull loue haue alwayes borne lady altea hath ſuch ſoueraigne power ouer ſuffer change humor albeit know ſhe dead ſmall greefe continuall vexation yet either ſhall teares reuiue againe bring ghoſt keepe company thus reſolued remember loſſe true loue ought remaine end end otherwiſe iudged light vnconſtant therefore beſeech maieſtie ſuffer complaint ſo well inured impoſſible liue otherwiſe emperour prince ſaw trauailed vaine perſwading floraman forſake ſorrowfull kinde life taking leaue emperour accompanyed king edward prince primaleon went chamber bring able endure ſight ſuch heauineſſe returned preſently chamber preſence theſe iouſts triumph ended theſe prince would ride abroade ladyes forreſt néere cittie might chaſe wilde bore hart beaſtes recreation whereof emperour glad taking coatch tooke way forreſt company againſt comming ſet vp faire tent table couered thing ready dinner ſate downe take repaſt went ſport dinner done hunter came certified emperour found mightieſt wilde bore euer ſéene vppon newes prince immediately aroſe table mounting horſes rode hunter finde gaine beginning follow chaſe bore euery one liked pleaſantneſſe paſtime ſuddaine delight mingled ſuddaine miſchance may reade diſcourſe following prince knight earneſtly purſuing 〈◊〉 heauens began ſuddaine troubled▪ darkneſſe came vpon could diſcerne • ſo horſes fumed fretted excéedingly veing afraide thundring lightning ayre maiſters glad forſake walke foote beſide emperours tent ſuch maruellous bruite noyſe heauen earth would haue gone together moſt abaſh tent wailing pittifull voyce woman heard crie gréeuouſly calling ayde knight sauage man length knowne queene thracc could ſuccoured knight preſent emperour becauſe darkenes ſuch none could ſée long darke cloude amounted sky againe making ſuch noyſe departure florian riding vp downe maruailing hereat length aduertiſed loſſe quéene wherevpon tooke way emperours tent finding maieſtie great feare heauineſſe yet would giue ouer ſo rode preſently citie hauing armed himſelfe concluded ſearch thorow country reſt place whatſoeuer vntil might heare ſome tydings whoſe loſſe heart extreamely paſſioned many friend preſented themſelues beare company trauaile emperour would agrée thereto fearing leaſt turkes would viſite conſtantinople returned againe knight sauage man great griefe could imagined ſet forward iourney ſtayed till hée hindered darke night hée glad paſſe roote trée forreſt morning hée mounted horſebacke many dayes hee wandered vp downe ſtrange countreys yet hearing newes would gladly méete withall froward chaunce hée maruellouſly abaſhed ſo intended 〈◊〉 ſhipping try fortune would wayes ſpéede 〈◊〉 better hee embarbued himſelfe putting himſelfe euen vnto mercy sea ſo trauailing place marriners could wiſh beſt auayle one day aboue hée aſſayled exceeding tempeſt waues toſſing veſſell ſuch ſort ſometime one would haue iudged touched firmament afterwards would fall downe hell trouble pilot marriners ſo diſſtraughted memory could deuiſe partes ſhould euen run way fortune pleaſed ſpace three dayes end whereof came mighty huge mountaine top thereof ſeeming touch cloud knight sauage man deſirous know countrey cauſed marriners ſet ſhore mountaine trauelled horſe back went vp foot comming laſt ſide mountaine entred goodly fayre field incloſed round huge rock like paſſed entrance middeſt field ſtrong admirable caſtle beauty alſo height beeing founded ſame rockes gate caſtle hanged garland tryumphe wherein letter golde written thus pallace queene melia knight sauage man ſeeing gate open tooke boldnes enter beheld meruailous height hall chamber caſtle belonging queene melia iudged moſt ſtately manſion euer came aſſure tower gallery building ſo ingenuouſly carued ſame rocke one would haue thought whole caſtle haue conſiſted one péece whereupon knight sauage man much abaſhed fortreſſe vnknowne knight emperours court greece length thought good viſit caſtle becauſe hée ſaw foure corner thereof foure gate entrance forbidden eſpied gate made faſt two great ſtroug chaines iron vppon gate béeing engraued many auncient hiſtories vnknowen knight sauage man long hée ſtayed beholde gate perceiued trauelled iu vain ſhould offer enter therat theu paſſed one gate came goodly great hall middeſt wherof chaſed gold picture ancient woman deuiſed cauſed caſtle builded monument garniſhed either ſide goodly marble pillar behold ſufficiently paſſed viewe reſt caſtle turning goe forward hée eſpied hard mightie serpent braſſe faſhioned made ſo artificially thing moſt ſtrange behold ſuch monſtrous highneſſe reached rafter held vp couerture hall serpent held necke stretched along countenaunce ſo vigorous fearefull made ſingular workemanſhip cunning able affright behold knight sauage man whoſe heart terrour fearefull motion could diſmay approached serpent hauing viewed circumſpectly eſpied key tied necke chaine gold chaine wound necke great many foldes wherevpon preſently imagined key conſiſted principall aduenture caſtle viſited many place returned againe brazen serpent marke key would ſerue intent came take chaine key perceiued serpent necke little chinke creuiſe ſight began ſomewhat comfort himſelfe ſo tooke key hauing meanes vſe owne pleaſure opened therewith little window made serpent necke looking might diſcerne hollowneſſe serpent round behold foure taper waxe ſtood foure candleſtickes siluer two placed towards eaſt two weſt burning maruellous ſpendant brightneſſe yet waxe ſéemed diminiſh thing betwéene theſe foure light couched pallad faire leonarda quéene thrace wife ouer head hung fayre cannapy gréene veluet ſight knight sauage man ſo abaſhed doubted whether might giue credit motion eye taken good view apparell knowing ſame ſhe ſhe carried forth forreſt perſwaded himſelfe ſhe wherevpon called aloud deſiring vſe regard vnto neuer iote néerer purpoſe ſhe enchaunted ſuch ſound ſléepe ſhe power vnderſtand knight sauage man perceiued earneſt good bare ſpake manner madame glory contentment victory yéeld manifold perillous aduentures haue happily finiſhed ſéeme forſake preſent aduerſitie whereon honour life dependeth let good madame enter courteous minde ſince ſtraunge departure emperour greece haue failed viſite many prouinces finde euen time hope finde chanced place may behold yet ſmall griefe cannot come neither wil vouchſafe heare extreame affliction poore heart pauſing began waxe maruellous angry ſetting ha • swoord ſnatching furiouſly foorth ſheath layde many violent ſtrokes serpent thinking deſtroy piece might come lady hee fa • deceiued intent serpent conuerted flame fire paſſed ſo suddenly away knight sauage man loſt ſight cleane fearing leaſt lady ſhould abide cruell torment becauſe serpent ſo changed away fier ſate downe ground great heauineſſe curſſing ill fortune bitterly intending neuer depart caſtle without might haue company lady perplexitie brother friend sage aliart would forſake ſo great neceſſitie entred hall attired engliſh manner hauing armour leyſure arme himſelfe ſo greatly pittied miſfortune brother florian forreſt sage aliart ſooner come vnto ſaluted theſe ſpeeches perceiue sir knight haue altogether forgotten eſpecially place haue moſt néede helpe theſe word knight sauage man preſently aroſe embracing sage aliart armes returned anſwer lord brother ſure vnknown vnto one occaſion gréefe thorowly ſetled minde cauſeth party ſo vexed commit thing elſe forgetfulneſſe therefore think ſhould offended though remembrance ſuch ſharpe extremity deſire deliuered ayde woorthy ſir anſwered aliart whoſe knowledge ſerued bring quéene leonarda place hath done ſuch maruellous mean impoſſible recouer hence ſo ſpéedily fortune reſeruing employ valour aduentures worthy moſt high renowne ſuffer intent brought hither fully executed hath ordained ſuch ſort arte ſhall end cruell enchantment neuertheleſſe ſhall neceſſary kéep company becauſe courage ſtrength may much helpe caſe hée thus ſaid hée commaunded knight sauage man ſhut window hang key place whence hee tooke firſt hée looked ſee eſtate quéene leonarda • florian hee laboured buſtly extinguiſh light taper becauſe hée coulde ſuffer extreame ſhyninge brightnes ſhould dazell eye looked ſwéete quéene wife ſo light ſome hinderance thought guard excellent beautie wherevpon aliart ſpake thus vnto perceiue well lord ignorant verture theſe taper whoſe light onely maintaineth life quéene leonarda looke ſoone ſhall extinguiſhed conſumed euen ſo ſoone ſhall life fully compleate ended communication theſe two knight went foorth caſtle ſo ſoone come open field ayre began excéeding troubled ſo time maruellous darkeneſſe ouerſhadowed yet laſt cleared againe knight sauageman greatly abaſhed ſéeing himſelfe depriued sage aliart company huge monſterous bull ſéemed hee come top rockes vppon bulles necke knight sauage man caſt himſelfe brought immediately darke obſcure caue bull left vaniſhed away theſe fearefull motion could diſmay hardy knight imagine illuſions ſent purpoſe hinder determination therefore would make account looking caue light ſomewhat increaſing beheld figure picture moſt renowned knight carried arm time famous king amadis hee might diſcerne eſplandian among moore ſpectacle delighted much moſt hononrable place ſtood armato noble king perſians hauing letter golde left ſhoulder declared name famous progenie knight sauage man earneſtly beheld theſe gallant image percyued enter caue aged woman ſo weake feeble extremity age ſhe ſeemed ready fal earth whē ſhée looked knight sauage man ſhe ſtarted backe great amazement cry aloude pittifully demaunded aide ſuccour grauen picture would helpe conquer knight come violate deface pallace cry olde encauntreſſe image began ſtirre themſelues lay holde theyr swoordes speares knight sauage man made offer defend himſelfe ſtood ſilent former eſtate old woman vaniſhed ſight wherevppon knight sauage man departed thence comming hall serpent beheld ſame old woman ſtanding windowe looked beheld quéene thrace wife made preſently coniecture place incloſed remedy trauailes whereto would gladly attaine grieued ſhewe force againſt woman thruſt ſhoulderſ ſo ſtrongly againſt window length opened ſhe went turning cloſe window againe made faſt againe ſo ingeniouſly one could iudge way ſhe made entrance knight sauage man could chuſe laugh ſee grace olde woman maintained enchauntment comming windowe hée iudged entered knockt kept ſuch bounſing thereat olde woman came opened windowe preſenting ſelfe accompanied foure knight clad armour coſtly ſumptuous ſhe declared knight deſart ſought deſtroy ancient pallace theſe foure knight lifted vp mace knight sauage man ſeemed defend himſelfe olde woman vaniſhed away incontinent theſe ſtraunge motion hée could chuſe wonder ſitting downe viewe brauery houſe hee perceiued middeſt hall candleſticke golde ſet braſen pillar coſtly workemanſhip candleſticke burned goodly white waxe taper whoſe light ſhewed ſuch ſtraunge manner many wonderfull occaſions preſented eye wherevpon imagined caſtle béene founded onely ſome maruellous eſpeciall cauſe narrowly circumſpectly looked place beheld number cofers round euery cofer hauing key gold hanging made open one another found library queene melia gorgeous apparell belonging woman melia cauſed made giue couzin daughter king armato brother knight sauage man found ſet downe writing library gad read beganne againe woonted griefe ſeeing himſelfe hope recouer queene thrace wife affliction sage aliart preſented himſelfe againe entring theſe ſpéeches lord brother ſince haue done ordained referre reſt behind deſpight perſon delighteth torment thus recouer loue ſo dearely know well anſwered knight sauage man alone reſtore felicity ſhould thinke otherwiſe vnworthy haue furtheraunce extreame trouble chap lii aide sage aliart obſcure valley noble knight sauage man deliuered enchauntment wife queene thrace sage aliart would deliuer queene thrace enchauntment deſired ſee place caſtle viewed hee made account thing onely library becauſe well worthy eſtimation hée made conueyance bookes arte perillous iſle placed among bookes sage vrganda ſomewhat hath beene diſcourſed already knight sauage man reſted himſelfe becauſe great trauaile ſo doe sage aliart thus ſent book away tooke taper ſtood candleſticke gold ſpake knight sauage man manner ſhall vnderſtand lord life queene leonarda conſiſteth onely vertue light impoſſible v ſaue redéeme deſpight targiana onely cauſe miſfortune ſo order matter heart ſhall ere long receiue contentment yet ſhall sage enchauntreſſe brought vnhappy eſtate haue power reſiſt determination thus concluding went vnto serpent holding one hand fatal candle little booke found lying foote marble columbe knight sauage man opened little doore key sage aliart reade ſo earneſtly booke vertue wordes written booke taper waxe belley serpen begand letſe light • et extinſhuiſh altogether béene put one inſtant life quéene thrace béene brought great daunger framed ſuch artificiall pollicie ſhe ſwéetely flumbred life vertue light yet ſhee depriued nat • rall ſences iote impeached ſingular beautie ſoone one theſe taper loſt light sage aliart lighted againe candle owne hand conſiſted cōtrary meane helpe purpoſe whē burned place ſafegard life contained quéene thrace ſtretched armes one awaking ſound ſléepe taper extinct lighted againe ſhe ſtarted vp ſuddaine meruailing ſée ſelfe ſuch narrow place eſpecially company huſband noble knight sauage man beheld teares trickling downe chéekes knowing well ſtrange ſuch caſe sage aliart ſéeing quéene ſuch extreame heauineſſe rehearſed thing happened aſſuring emperor court generall ſadnes abſence alſo certified knight sauage man departed ſame day cōſtantinople ſearch wherat ſhe grieued much ſhe opinion perſon ſoeuer happened place ſhould brought ſuch danger might eaſiſy get againe knight sauage man could endure ſée lady ſhut vp ſo long ſerpents belly deſired sage aliart deliuer extremitie vpon word sage aliart candle one ſerpents noſtrels made lespe caſt fire foorth mouth ſo abundantly one would haue thought hall would haue ſhaken piece ſo great noyſe ſerpent made queene leonarda ſo amazed fearefull motion ſhe brought againe former perpletitie ſight knight sauage man mooued excéedingly ſo hee came embraced sage aliart humbly deſiring helpe neuer aliart approched ſerpent thruſting arme litle doore quenched light taper done ſerpent ſtood indifferently quiet knight sauage man pleaſed wherefore began afreſh intreat brother would pittie diſtreſſed caſe quéene wife ſaid well pleaſed sage aliart ſeeing brother florian ſo earneſtly affected queene thrace remembring ſmall eſtimation woont make woman become ſuch faithfull reuerent ſubiect god loue thorowly recounted theſe matter himſelfe fell reading looke ahaine ſo deuoutly length quéene thrace came foorth serpent ſo rauiſhed inwardly delight ſhee beheld louing lord huſband ſhe ran caught armes maruellous ioyfully thinking thus ſelfe valour ſufficient end aduenture whatſoeuer ſo pleaſant knight sauage man hauing ſweete wife quéene armes thought himſelfe onely happy man world delighted themſelues thus ſo long pleaſed prince sage aliart went ſhew ſingularities caſtle quéene leonarda bringing ſtately pillar marble likewiſe gallant library queene melia rich robe ſtately apparell preſented view ſhe deſired owne immediately thinking ſo ſhe ſhould fully recompenced paſſed miſfortunes ſo theſe ſumptuous garment might beſtowed ſhe might carry conſtantinople earneſt motion prouoked two knight depart place sage aliart giuing vnderſtand ueceſſary minde ſhould fulfilled requeſt neyther could ſhe carry thing thence albeit liked neuer ſo well reaſon theſe rich veſtures reſerued one queene meliaes daughter beautie ſhould excell time knight sauage man ſomewhat moued theſe wordes fearing hee ſhould long enioy queene wife sage aliart ſéeing theſe two louers reſtored liberty tooke leaue trauell conſtantinople preſence long deſired looked gaue charge knight sauage man would come thither ſpeede poſſible becauſe friend might greatly furthered company let vnderſtand occaſion quéene thrace thus enchanted hiſtory diſcourſeth princeſſe targiana could forget anger heauy diſpleaſure towards knight sauage man dayly thyrſting deſiring reuengement entertained partner purpoſe enchantreſſe whoſe dwelling realme perſia named druſia velonna targiana expecting time ſhe might open intent enchauntreſſe druſia length conſented fulfill mind one day princeſſe bathing ſelfe fountaine druſia came ſuddainly thorow window high tower preſenting ſelfe ſo ſtraungely princeſſe targiana ſo amazed frighted thereat ſhe called ſeruants come helpe druſia reuealing ſelfe princeſſe quickly remooued feare whereupon ſhe rehearſed earneſt deſire reuenged knight sauage man requeſting fauour furderaunce cauſe enchauntreſſe one loued princeſſe well glad compaſſe thing might yeeld content ſpake vnto manner madame haue well pondered matter wherewith haue made acquainted haue deuiſed meanes releaue ouercharged troubled thoughtes eaſ • might reuenged knight sauage man brother sage aliart obſcure vally whoſe great experience knowledge may ſome hinderance v neuertheleſſe haue found one practiſe wherby may bring great trouble daunger oh velon • quoth targiana onely thing deſire hinder offend way whatſoeuer know well madame aunſwered druſia velonna ſlenderlie affected notwithſtanding loue moſt eſpecial good yet ſo amorous queene thrace wife poſſible man wherefore intend conuey ſuch ſecret place sage aliart ſhall haue power helpe vntill empire greece poyled brought confuſion neyther ſhall knight sauage man bee able finde ſhall ſpend time ſeeking yet ſhall labour beſtowed ſuch ende▪ ſhe would targ • ana well contented enchauntreſſe tolde wherevpon ſhe enchaunted queene thrace manner haue declared already afterwards ſhe returned princeſſe targiana ſhe likewiſe conducted arte caſtle quéene melia time albayzar gone vnto babylon targiana ſufficiently pleaſed ſelfe beholding rare ſtrange alteration quéene thrace ſhe deſired druſia ſhut doore hang key chaine serpent necke wherevpon targiana departed thence place great turke father afterward tooke iourney perſia opinion sage aliart could helpe pittiful eſtate queene thrace caſtle melia ſhe remained thus enchaunted vntill knight sauadge man sage aliart met together deliuered wee returne prince albayzar comming laye siege cittie conſtantinople whither knight sauadge man trauelled ſpeedily againſt reaſon ſuch noble redoubted knight ſhould abſent place déereſt friend aſſembled together chap liii ¶of chriſtians citie conſtantinople time princeſſe targiana ſent tydings courte emperour palmerin comming enemyes rehearſed chronicle emperour palmerin king england spayne france lacedemonia theſſalia deſirous depart theyr ſeuerall kingdomes triumphes ſports mariages friend ſomewhat ouerblowne paſt euen preparing themſelues iourney fortune would make partner y• emperor daungers towardes preſented ſuch occaſions conſtrained breake theyr former determination princeſſe targiana ſent news ſame inſtant emperour huge nauie albayzar prepared beſiege conſtantinople withall moreouer ſhee gaue vnderſtand armie great turke father arriued porte armenia ſtayed onely winde likewiſe turke father appointed albayzar chiefe captaine generall armie becauſe hee ſurpaſſed valour courage report armie cauſed great aſtoniſhment manie chiefly able endure trauell armes emperour palmerin himſelfe ſo ouercharged yéeres hée could walke chamber yet hee able comfort encourage deereſt friend good counſell wherby troubled mindes greatly caſed primaleon naturally giuen couragious brauely minded make account miſfortunes might happen rather becauſe valiant prince knight companie could ſummoned better time witneſſe theyr nobilitie king court ſent • gouernours realmes signory ſhould leuey power could poſſible come thither ſpeede aſſiſt chap liiii ¶how enemy ſent embaſſadour emperours court anſwer made manner haue declared already emperour prouided entertaining enemy maieſtie aduiſing himſelfe theſe affayres aduertiſed embaſſadour arriued porte cittie demaunded ſafe conduct hée would come ſhoare maieſty counſel king prince content graunt requeſt wherevpon embaſſadour tooke landing accompanyed foure knight hee tooke way emperours pallace king prince determined embaſſadour ſhould rehearſe cauſe arriuall prince primaleon would ſuffer come emperours preſence diuerſe contrary opinion affirming preſence noble anſwere emperour himſelfe would daunte terrifie enemie able doe vpon determination agréede emperour brought chayre great hall embaſſador ſtayed hauing viewed ſtrength citie knew well ſhould beſtow good labour could conquer emperour according milde noble nature receyued embaſſador enemie gratiouſly king prince theyr due appointed place generall ſilence amongſt embaſſadour began theſe ſpeeches illuſtrious moſt puiſſant emperour could wiſh ſée thée flouriſhing eſtate thy yeares well participate many trouble imminent dare take vppon defende thy empyre alſo enlarge contentment ſhall ſo happie gaine victorie fielde battell preſented thy maieſtie let thée vnderſtand albayzar great soldan babylon prince turkie accompanyed soldans king puiſſant prince hath ſent thée let thée know determined theyr ſtrength power beſiege citie reuenge death manie theyr eſpeciall friendes receyued diſhonour cittie neuertheleſſe soldane albayzar hauing forgotten gracious courteſie thou didſt ſometimes vſe towards oloricque alchidiana princeſſe targiana hath thus concluded fearing noted ingratitude make thée offer eyther ſurrender cittie conſtantinople knight sauage man king thrace thy nephew hand depart leaue thine empyre ſubiect power without offering reſiſtance determination condition hee bring armie thine empyre hée thinketh neceſſary thée rather looſe one cittie whole empyre better thée deliuer one man hand ſée death number thy eſpeciall friend word emperour thus anſwered friend hardly endure let thée paſſe ſpéeches muſt néedes anſwer thus account well profite follow counſell matter ſending one man may make ſure account ſafetie reſt one man found ſo good knight valour ſufficient redeeme captiuitie muſt ſo forgetfull honour render state aſſurance lordes mercie beſides thing much againſt reaſon duety yeelde cittie hand heathen infidells true god worſhipped ſpirit truth truely cannot maruell much hée ſhould offer come thus empire conſidering promiſes hath paſt betweene mée opinion ſhould rather furthered aide aſſiſtance hindered impeached thus maliciouſly truſt god ſhall prepare graue walles cittie haue done alreadie many predeceſſours without regarde theyr owne honour courteſie haue come aſſaile manner perceyue lord anſwered embaſſa • becauſe fortune hath daily fauoured preſent dreade miſfortunes whereinto may ſuddenly fall therefore intend returne anſwere lord ſent taking leaue returned galley lay anckor accompanyed many prince lord emperours court giuen friendly farewell galley ſet forward ſuch expedition ſhort time came reſt armie chap lv ¶how armie great turke arriued port conſtantinople noble valiant proweſſe chriſtians would ſuffer pagan take landing embaſſadour albayzar soldane babylon thus departed emperour palmerin called together prince noble courte giue preſent order euery one ſhould beſt ſpéede poſſible prouide themſelues armes forbidde entraunce enemie haue good regard affaire citie ſafety ſame committed guard emperour vernar king polendos accompanyed thouſand fiue hundreth knight horſebacke foure hundreth footemen king edward england choſen generall conſent chiefe captaine gouernour fielde hauing vnder conduct two thouſand knightes beſide giant dramuſiande noble behauiour expedition wonne great eſtimation maiortes pridos duke galles roſiande de la bronde sonne argolant duke horten pompides fifty knightes come theyr company diuiding theyr knight foure part number eight thouſand euery thouſand generall captain arnedes king france ordering fiue hundred attended likewiſe sonnes gracian guerin germaine orleance beſide fifty good hardy french knight thouſand fiue hundred conducted recinde king spayne prince berolde onſtalde sonnes awayting giant almaroll one hundreth spaniſh knight soldane bellagris captaine ouer foure hundred knight owne subiects guard owne perſon prouided one hundred chiefeſt knight court among sonne blandidon whoſe noble behauiour deſerued commendation belcar duke pontus durace committed like charge king recinde arnedes hauing guarde owne perſon roſuell bellizart sonnes king tarnaes lacedemonia ancient noble prince giuen guard pallace ſecurity empreſſe queenes ladyes hée attending two hundred knightes primaleon choſen lord generall cittie hauing charge ſeauen hundred knightes wherewith regarde well field cittie palmerin florendos platir diuers knight charge vtter wing armie loſt children▪ giue ſuccour perceyued moſt neceſſitie thus emperours court well ſtored noble renowmed knight yet maieſtie king edward greatly deſired preſence prince florian forreſt whoſe abſence horſemen footemen ordained haue alreadie declared next morning▪ king edward commaunded ſtrike vp allarum hee giuen vnderſtand enemie within halfe league cittie prepared themſelues take landing emperour cauſed himſelfe carryed vp high tower pallace becauſe hée would ſée fortune diſpoſed happineſſe king edward ſooner arriued enemie placed armie seaſhoare hinder enemie comming land therein deceyued multitude galley ship ſuch impoſſible doe would albayzar accompanied moſt renowmed knight armie two moſt ougly fearefull giant euer ſeene made offer take landing firſt emperor court ſtepped them▪ entertayned ſuch ſorte diuers turkes chriſtians dangerouſly wounded albayzar ſo offended becauſe could haue libertie get foorth galley hee commaunded gyants ſtep water whoſe commaundement pre • ently obeyed theyr • e iron began ſo breake thorowe pre • ſſe hindred albayzar comming ſhoare began giue place landing dramuſiande perceiued hee ſtept water vp nauill couering himſelfe ſhield hee encountered giant aduanced himſelfe foremoſt king edward leaped sea hinder giant dealing dramuſiande theſe foure thus encountring together knight emperours court ſeeing captaine foote began follow ſo albayzar conſtrained come neere giant becauſe thought would want ayde palmerin england buſie ſide ſeeing horſes round field without maſters doubted leaſt ſome miſfortune fallen friend whereupon gaue horſe ſpurs galloped place ſaw greateſt bickering ſéeing king edward father ſtanding ſea dealing ſuch ougly monſterous giant preſently came ſtepping entred theſe ſpeeches deſire gracious lord father giue ouer enemy giue ſuccour friend dramuſiande miſfortune ſhould happen loſſe would gréeued chriſtendome king edward eſteeming light word sonne would leaue giant ſo greatly hee deſired remaine victor neceſſity wherein hee perceiued diuers friend cauſed ſtep backe giue place noble palmerin england albayzar behaued himſelf ſuch braue manner diuers glad ſhunne preſence florendos beheld hee aduanced himſelfe ſuch knightly proweſſe ſhewen eyther ſide began cruell dangerous combate dramuſiande preuailed ſo well againſt enemy giant hee tumbled downe dead himſelfe ſore wounded king edward commaunded carried citie palmerin england ſlew giant likewiſe father left fighting withall himſelfe ſo dealt withall fiue dayes could weare armour albayzar ſooner perceiuing giant ſlaine preſently retired galley ſo diuers turkes beſide edward ſaw turkes betake themſelues galley againe hee mounted horſebacke giuing ſigne company withdraw themſelues deſiring soldane • lagris king arnedes king recinde prince belcar dealing another veſſell ſought take landing follow gaue vnderſtand florendos platir blandidon giant almaroll carried citie ſo ſore hurt able ſuſtaine themſelues king recinde palmerin belcar likewiſe grieuouſly wounded made king edward deſire goe citie meane primaleon entred field accompanied ſeauen hundred knight deſiring earneſtly king edward traine would withdraw themſelues might come freſh aſſault enemy king edward would ſuffer ſhould ſo therefore altogether went cittie much grieued principall knight armie ſo ſore wounded chap lvi griefe ſorrowe made conſtantinople dangerous eſtate wherein giant dramuſſande brought turk placed campe citie conſtantinople emperor captaines thus come citie traines paſſed night vſiting ſo ſore wounded whoſe ill lucke primaleon greatly grieued iudged want helpe ſuch hope defend enemy entring land next day moſt palmerin england florendos king recinde belcar berold roſuel bellizart ſuch caſe could endure beare armes againe ſo ſoone vpon concluded let enemy take landing ſuffer b • ild tent prouide field mea • e wounded perſons would better diſpoſition ſuccour looked would likewiſe arriued wherewith good hope bid enemy braue battaile meane time daily gaue albayzar company ſundry aſſaults king edward going viſite wounded perſons found prince palmerin talking faire polinarda whoſe company made forget griefe hurt alone conſiſted onely medicine reſtore health like manner found florandos miragarda platir sidelia polendos francelian berolde oniſtalda normandie gracian claritia roſuell dramatiana bellizant den • ſa francian bernarda guerin clariana diuers others knight bare moſt affection dramuſiande like caſe theſe fortunate louers wound ſo yangerous could enioy ſwéete company beſt beloued arlencea towards remained maruellous affectionate ſo aſſure emperour court ſo ſorie miſfortune citie ſelfe béene brought extreame danger king edward whoſe minde ſuch pleaſure made account reſt quietneſſe kept friend dramuſiande company hauing wife quéene flerida onely comfort heauie penſiue eſtate arlencea whoſe ſad caſe may eaſily iudged young married louers florendos miragarda viſited giant almaroll whoſe danger almoſt ſame eſtate dramuſiande yet able walke behaue himſelfe pleaſant company whoſe caſe pittied lamented generall soone arriued sage aliart whoſe preſence former feareful vncertaine doubt ſomewhat calmed certified emperour florian would long abſence thence newes much ioy maieſtie caught sage aliart armes embraced gracious countenance came empreſſe entertaine ſame fauour like bazilia empreſſe allemaigne gridonia polinarda princeſſes lady among quéene flerida moſt glad preſence well perceiue loue king edward huſband bare alſo becauſe ſundry time preſerued liue child knowledge ſame day came emperours court prince floraman trauailed finde prince florian forreſt aduertiſed enemy laid ſiege conſtantinople left realme sardignia giuing charge gouernours left ſhould leuey great armie expedition ſend conſtantinople may read large hereafter ſame day likewiſe arriued king eſtrellant hungaria accompanied two thouſand horſemen tenne thouſand footman vnder conduct prince friſoll sonne albayzar greatly grieued loſſe men wherfore gaue charge chirurgions campe ſhould bee carefull reſpectiue wounded commanded • laine bée buried thing accompliſhed thought expedient called principall eſtates armie councell whome hee concluded perſons ſhould vigilant carefull themſelues night becauſe next morning ſhould take landing certaine watchword would giue day ſooner chaſed away vncomfortable obſcure night ship gallies brigandine ga •• ots prouiſion war tooke landing league diſtance frō conſtantinople hindred forbidden whereupon ſounded drum trumpet cornet clarion inſtruments wherewith made ſuch triumphant noyſe people citie much amazed thereat sage aliart floraman deſiring ſée campe enemie requeſted emperour would lycence goe thither maieſtie would graunt yet hée ſuch aſſurance knowledge sage aliart place ſoeuer néeded feare theſe two knight thus departed citie armed defence onely ſwordes becauſe day faire cleare betooke themſelues little hill might pleaſure diſcerne enemy armie diuers thought good ſcout take becauſe might vnderſtand ſtrength citie albayzar would grant ſhould ſo wherefore ſent eſquire vnto attended emperours court let vnderſtand would come néere ſee campe authoritie commaund ſuch indifferent friend vnto might come depart without danger theſe two knight gaue ſuch credit meſſage albayzar ſent went eſquiers company albayzar perceiuing came forth two page rich apparrell attending receiue afterward hee went thorow campe becauſe ſhould ſée mightie ſtrength thereof declared name prince companay among whome verie many giantes terrible ouglie ſlaine dramuſiande palmerin england albayzar diligent regard theſe two chriſtian knight ſée ſight ſhowne could diſcourage feare doubt theyr wellfare contained ſuch ſtoute vndaunted countenaunce ſeemed diſdayne thoſe occaſions albayzar thought ſhould moſt diſmay whereat little maruaile ſéene whole army albayzar accompanied hem neere citie deſiring ſalute emperour empreſſe taking leaue courteouſly returned • campe walked ſadly eſpecially sage aliart hauing foreſéene would happen could hide ſorrow hee conceiued minde neuertheleſſe behaued themſelues pleaſantly entraunce cittie becauſe would diſcourage mindes people come pallace emperor preſence prince floraman▪ commaundement maieſtie entred theſe ſpeeches gratious lord rich enemy hath brought cittie incredible rehearſall ſhould take vppon make rehearſall thereof ſhould waſt great deale time may apply better purpoſe certifying excellencie enimies ſtrength wherefore let maieſtie vnderſtand enimies leſſe number two hundred thouſand ſimpleſt whereof carryeth ſuch brauerie minde abide féeld lateſt houre death king aetolia thirtie yéeres age hath conduct day vnder charge tenne thouſande horſemen fortie thouſand footemen ſo brauely armed ſurely muſt neceſſity commend aboue reſt pride prince albayzar doth much amaze ſmall eſtimation made puiſſance himſelfe gaue v ſight whole armye graunting like aſſuraunce court hee v ſo deſire ſée garriſon thing haue diligently noted cannot greatly profite himſelfe reſt whereof perhappes may forgetfull good lorde sage aliart large diſcourſe vnto highneſſe haue beh • ued ſelues ſo well friend ſayd emperor poſſible bring v certaine aſſurance cauſe wherefore neceſſarie enter councell may auoyd enterpriſe alb • yzar souldiours content ſhall likewiſe ſée cittie ſo charge giuen captaines behaue themſelues ſuch circumſpection enemy may get ſudden aduantage againſt v emperour ſet downe determination prince betooke themſelues ſeuerall charge might better reſpect practi • e enimie chap lvii ¶of albayzar well prouided armie ſuccour came emperour palmerin albayzar prouiding ſtrength armye cauſed ſuch trench rampiers defence fortification bee made round camp imagined ſufficient withſtand reſiſt furious batterie whatſoeuer would haue ſome knowledge valour enemyes hee appoynted principall captain place importance moſt aſſurance campe afterwards conſent councell ſet galley shippes fire reſeruing certain number ſwifteſt brigandine ſight f • made ſuch aſtoniſhment conſtantinople fully reſolued determined hazarde theyr liues ſubdue pompe glory enemy ſéeing preſumed ſo much themſelues emperour ſitting chaire one turret pallace perceyued well hee ſhould driue enemyes empyre without great effuſion blood loſſe friend ſpace ſeuen dayes continued burning theyr shippes leauing themſelues deſtitute prouiſion depart thence fortune ſhould oppoſe ſelfe againſt ende ſeuen dayes conſtantinople began ſkyrmiſh wounded prince recouered former eſtates except dramuſiande giant almaroll yet chirurgions aſſured emperor greateſt danger paſt likely doo well enough meane king edward primaleon endeuored themſelues fortifie cittie gouernours thoſe realmes belonging king preſent conſtantinople ſent ſuch good prouiſion ſtrength force could poſſibly make ready ſudden rehearſe vnto neceſſitie chiefeſt ſuccour ſent theyr kingdomes signory firſt emperour • nar allemaigne ſent two thouſand horſemen twelue thouſand footman king arnedes fraunce like number recinde king spayne two thouſand light horſemen eyght thouſand footemen prince floraman foure hundred horſemen foure thouſand footemen tarnaes king lacedemonia foure hundred horſmen foure thouſand footemen thrace honour king florian forreſt came foure hundred knightes horſebacke foure thouſand footemen england came foure hundred knight tenne thouſand footman nauarre came two hundred light horſemen denmarke came two hundred light horſemen drapo duke normandie came thither two thouſand knight horſebacke foure thouſ • nd braue footemen prince belcar came foure hundred horſemen one thouſand footemen roramant king bohemia ſent foure thouſand footemen eſtrellant arriued accompanyed eyght thouſand foure hundred gallant knightes horſebacke tenne thouſand hardy fighting men foote ioyning cittie number twenty thouſand horſemen threeſcore thouſand footemen emperour counſell appointed thus come aſſiſt ſhould reſt themſelues certain dayes becauſe ſuſtained weary iourney ſo time wounded perſons able beare armor ayde theſe gaue battell enemy chap lviii ¶of aduenture happened arriuall ſtraunge knight accompanied ladie prince albayzars campe come ſuccour emperour repoſed themſelues young prince knight court conſtantinople gaue enemie ſundry aſſaults ſkirmiſhes preuailing alwayes ſo happily aduauntage ſtill came theyr ſide time ſkirmiſhed manner emperour empreſſe ladyes high tower ſee theſe braue attempt perceyued enter cittie towardes enemyes campe knight ſéemed haue ſo good opinion himſelfe mounted braue gallant courſer himſelfe attired guylte armour whereon wrought diuerſe ingenious knottes deuiſes ſiluer beſide armour bloody many place gaue ſufficient teſtimony knight daylie enioyed little reſt shielde loue artificially figured roughly helde hayre head bloody minded tyrant knight ſeemed carry launce neck horſe hauing point thereof little white enſigne hee wore ſigne peace quietneſſe eſquire bare another shielde couered ouer ſkinne wilde beaſt another launce hand rid lady blacke palfray ſhée attyred turkiſh manner robe white sattine cutte pinked many place ſo blacke ſilkes lying vnder white gaue braue grace vnto apparell becauſe body ſléeues thicke beſet pearles ſtones great eſtimation lady haire ſpread abroad ouer ſhoulders face couered becauſe ſhe would knowne ſoone knight come néere prince albayzars tent ſtayed pretie ſpace whereat turk ſomewhat abaſhed becauſe knewe part knight ſhould iudged armour chriſtian apparell ladie turkiſh could imagine certaintie caſe meane prince campe thus regarding beholding knight perceyued ſende eſquyre prince albayzars tent hauing face couered leaſt hee ſhould knowne hee beganne minde manner lorde knight ſée preſumes ſo néere campe mee giueth vnderſtand hee hath many yeeres ſerued lady company yet able winne enioye loue ſhee could well dryue delayes excuſes ſhee deſired bring vnto place muſt enterpriſe io • ſt againſt foure knight behalfe ſo fall fortune fauoureth victorie ſhee faile requite labour loue knightes camp ſhall refuſe trie valour againſt ſhe hath giuen leaue offer ſame condition emperours knight conſtantinople refuſall made likewiſe lady muſt conſent recompence hee vanquiſhed ſhe made challenge therefore lord may determine ſelues dare make tryall valour knight would gladly know ſaid soldane perſia gallaunt young prince braue armour recompence knight make victory may happen ſhall lord anſwered eſquyre ſend owne eſquier haue reported giuen charge without word hee returned maiſter accompanyed eſquyre soldane perſia whome knight came ladie made aunſwere ſee well friend requeſt thy lord ſtandeth good reaſon wherefore thou may 〈◊〉 ſay vnto thy miſfortune bee ſuch▪ theſe foure knightes chaunce vnhorſe faile deliuer horſe armour beſides ſhew obeyſance ſhall commaund condition lady may remaine libertie doo ſhee ſhall imagine conuenient herſelfe 〈◊〉 pagan prince well contented could good offer knight wherefore ordained iouſt
