intreate prince albayzar beſtowe one vpon syr anſwered ſtrange knight content allow thing ſhall ordaine yet ſomewhat offended ſelfe make partaker fellowes miſfortune marrye perſwade ſelfe faulte conſiſted horſe ſo ſore laboured trauell hee hardly performe dutie syr knight anſwered soldane ſhall complaine ſo ſmall matter therefore beſtowe one owne horſes vpon troth sir anſwered ſtrange knight ſo vnacquainted countrey knowe whoſe handes might requeſt ſuch fauour yet want great offer courteous cannot good make choyſe horſe friend ſaide dramuſiande thinke well behauiour gentleneſſe pray accept horſe whereon mounted good sir anſwered ſtrange knight graunt ſuch courteſie ſtraunger vnknowne good offer would highly impeach mee ſhould refuſe hée alighted horſe mounted dramuſiande ſent giuing ſigne soldane without delay ſhould defende himſelfe taking launce encountred middeſt carriere ſo brauely ſtraunge knight loſte styrrops soldane perſia throwne earth ſo ſore hurt came foure knight carry foorth fielde ſtraunge knight returning againe hée came vnto prince albayzar theſe wordes ſee syr haue accompliſhed challenge preſented vnto ladyes behalfe therefore syr albayzar graunt licence knightes deale ſame triall attend • iouſt héere till night ſo long horſe able hold perceiue well sir aunſwered prince albayzar pride wherewith accompanied maketh ſo gallant ſpeeches aſſure youre ſelfe doth little gréeue generall armie hinderance dealing neuertheleſſe deſire haue pull downe glorious ſtomacke content knightes ſhall hazard fortune againſt king edward prince highly commend courage ſtrange knight ſpake greeke language ſo perfectly would haue iudged prince florian forreſt long foure knight prince albayzar preſented themſelues field brauely armed whome ſtrange knight vnhorſed one another preſently whereat albayzar much offended ſo hee deſired knight reſt himſelfe wordes knight thus anſwered ſee sir haue two launce yet left willing beſtow breaking therefore ſend giant ſtandeth next trie fortune together ala sir anſwered albayzar forward wiſhing fortune turne face therfore pray thee framuſtant quoth giant thou wilt graunt knight honeſt requeſt giant ſo glad doe thing might content albayzar armed himſelfe immediately giuing horſe ſpurres againſt knight met together ſo forcibly knight conſtrained catch hold necke horſe ſorie receiue ſuch foyle preſence ſo many good knight wherefore reuenge himſelfe enemie tooke ſecond launce wherwith encountred giant ſo worthily himſelfe almoſt caſt ſaddle ſuch fortune againſt giant point launce entred beuere helmet whereby caſt croup • r horſe giant thinking recouer himſelfe pulde bridle horſe ſo ſtrongly horſe fell downe kackward vpon fall • id ſo aſtoniſh carried field depriued ſenſes miſhap diſliked prince albayzar ſtraunge knight came theſe ſpéeches thou thinke good syr albayzar depart citie ladie deſireth ſo draweth towards night entertainement allowe heere iudge ſhall ſlender ſee well aunſwered albayzar vſe thing neuertheleſſe pr • weſſe haue ſeene content accompanie lady gate citie doubting aſſurance beeing lycenced king rec • nde theſe prince king edward friend tooke • ood part word albayzar brought gate city tooke leaue king recinde reſt deſiring ſtrange knight tell demaund thing anſwered knight force greatly make knowne vnto wherefore ſhall vnderſtand knight sauage man principal enemie lady queen thrace wife tooke helmet ſaying glad meete place would haue occaſion deale th • ſe wordes albayzar ſo offended would ſpeake night king edward friendes rode citty ioyfully certifying emperour arriuall florian queene thrac • graciouſly entertayned empreſſe ladyes maruailed much ſtrange apparrell w • ich workmanſhip queene milium wherof 〈◊〉 make preſent • one daughter king armato brother haue already declared emperour ſo glad arriuall nephew hee would hardly ſuffer preſence hee kiſſed hande empreſſe grandmother quéene flerida mother hee ſaluted friend hee conducted chamber haue wound viſited receiued iouſt againſt prince albayzars knight chap lix ¶here ſhall declared manner prince florian forreſt arriued conſtantinople manie thing happened comming ſoone prince florian recouered quéene wife ayde aſſiſtance sage aliart followed aduentures certaine time becauſe ſhe ſhould perceiue valiant noble diſpoſition vnderſtood hard caſe wherinto déere friendes conſtantinople brought changed former determination cauſed quéene decke ſelfe turkiſh attyre tooke way place troubled friend remained becauſe could enter cittie muſt firſt paſſe campe enemyes diſguiſed himſelfe ſtrangely couering shielde sauadge deuiſe carryed shielde whereof haue ſpoken alreadie found one chamber caſtle quéene leonarda enchaunted manner hee preſented himſelfe albayzars tent ſped iouſting haue hearde reſted himſelfe two dayes deſired emperour giue enemyes battell becauſe thought euery day yeare till might encounter prince albayzar maieſty deferred matter ſo long could becauſe would aſſured good diſpoſition armie turkes tooke ſtrangely trauelled ſo farre lay ſiege principall citie empire yet 〈◊〉 ſo long ioyned battell albayzar knew wel aduantage city might get compaſſed wi • hin ſuch ſtrong walles defence beſides cittie plentifully ſtored good hardie knightes would murther many ere would yéeld themſelues therefore changed mind giuing aſſault made hauocke ſpoyle citie thereby prouoke emperour ſeeke reuenge meane continued ſpoyling soldane perſia ſent meſſenger emperour beeing brought maieſties preſence ſetting knée ground began manner moſt puiſſant emperour soldane perſia soueraigne lord licence prince albayzar captaine conſent whole turkiſh armie ſaith greatly offended hath happened ſeuerall iouſts againſt nephew florian would gladly hazard himſelfe condition willl ſuffer twelue knight court come fielde morrowe morning iouſt combate againſt twelue turkes companie lord captaine thus much graunt combat ſhall fought empreſſe chamber windowe ende theſe princeſſes lady may ſee valour proweſſe ſhall ſhewen ſides agree giue ouer ende combate theſe ladyes ſhall thinke good ſo command moreouer humbly deſired empreſſe may ſtand pleaſure iouſts ended giue leaue daunce theſe lady emperour returned anſwere thou maiſt friend ſay vnto thy lord content graunt requeſt twelue knight • court ſhal faile meete fielde two houres warning beſide empreſſe ſhall giue leaue daunce theſe ladyes truſt agrée determine albeit know theyr ſworne enemy knight come companie twelue thou mayſt ſay soldane thy lord forbidden come arm like doe promiſe knight court none themſelues ſhall come armed field eſquire returning anſwere soldane perſia hée companion beganne preſently prepare theyr deuiſes armour chap lx ¶howe combate betweene twelue turkes twelue chriſtians begunne howe ladyes cauſed giuen ouer preſently betwéene knight emperours courte aroſe great controuerſie becauſe euery one ſtroue number twelue hardly could quieted ſuch theyr earneſt deſire deale turkes yet ende glad obey determination florian choſe twelue according named firſt palmerin england brother prince florendos gracian berolde floraman sardignia blandidon platir pompides king eſtrellant hungaria roſuell francian sonne king polendos roſian de la bronde theſe twelue knight armed richly hauing theyr coates armes made theyr ladyes king edward arnedes recinde soldan bellagris giant dramuſiande vnarmed accompanyed theſe knight field ſame place soldan perſia appointed becauſe empreſſe ladyes might ſee theyr behauiour came soldane perſia eleuen knight company honoured preſence king gamba sparta armenia giant framuſtant vnarmed soldane perſia deſired greatly vnhorſe prince florian forreſt hee comming foremoſt king aetolia two thought moſt valiaunt againſt palmerin england determined iouſt hee knew deuiſe ſhéelde golden tower field sable soldane perſia clapt downe beuere helmet king armenia gaue launce ſo readie iouſt ſound trumpet ran altogether couragiouſly met one another ſuch force moſt part caſt ground palmerin england enconntred king aetolia ſo brauely ſent meaſure length ground himſelfe ſo ſhaken forſooke stirrops florian soldane perſia encountred ſuch force caſt foorth saddle florendos vnhorſed prince arfaſia named argelao bréefe vnhorſed except palmerin platir king polendos deſiring accompany friend alighted horſes charge enemy soldane perſia king aetolia offended miſfortune preſented themſelues enemy ſo aide companion beganne combate sword ſped better thereby iouſt lady pittying ſéeing soldane perſia great daunger reaſon florian woonne aduantage ouer likewiſe palmerin florendos brought enemy ſubiection concluded princeſſe miragarda accompanied foure lady king tarnaes lacedemonia ſhould goe field ſeparate ſo ſoone combattants eſpied would ſuffer come ſo farre gaue ouer combat come meete princeſſe miragarda thought ſelfe greatly honoured theyr forbearance combate hauing gratiouſly thanked ſhee returned backe againe holding prince florendos hand degrées following decent manner come pallace soldane companie honorably entertained emperour empreſſe miragarda gridonia flerida prince gaue princeſſe polinarda vnderſtand soldane perſia thought maruellous well emperour cauſed brought chamber preſence richly behanged cloathes ineſtimable value turk entred chamber mindes rauiſhed beholding ſtately maner therof king edward recinde arnedes king entertained turkes ſingular humanitie made iudge courteſie bountie emperours court could matched world beſide beheld rare excellent beauty lady imagined knightes preuailed theyr heauenly feature ſtrength conſiſted themſelues soldane perſia ſtill viewing princeſſe miragarda tooke faire polinarda length found deceyued ſaw florendos ſtill company palmerin kept wife polinarda talke made preſently recall error turkiſh prince whoſe mindes onely ſeeke ſpoyle cittie tooke leaue departed come theyr campe practiſed way worke theyr trayterous intent soldane perſia tooke princeſſe polinarda daunce king aetolia tooke beautifull princeſſe miragarda soldane albayzar took queen leonarda▪ knowing prince florian would ſcantlie bee pleaſed therewith king coſpia albeit hée young himſelfe yet refuſed ladyes tooke quéene flerida ſo falling courtlie paſtimes daunced ſo much pleaſed themſelues courteous manner departed thence going foorth chamber giant framuſtant well viewed arlencea ſo rauiſhed affection towards hee challenged combate againſt dramuſiande morrow becauſe would dally either ſide threw downe theyr gage emperour cauſed taken vp aſſuring fielde behalfe soldane albayzar made ſame promiſe maner tooke leaue one another euery one wiſhing night paſt becauſe good hope ſee notable combat ſhall vnderſtand waye framuſtant onely giant whoſe force albayzar wholly repoſed himſelfe chap lxi ¶of noble valiant combate betweene dramuſiande giant framuſtant next morrow dramuſiande addreſſed himſelfe place combat ſhould bee fought accompanyed emperor vernar king edward sonnes whome loued honoured long giant framuſtant came attended diuers companion friendes hée armour rich ſtrong neceſſary dealing one ſuch valour giant dramuſiande whome exceeded farre hugeneſſe ſtature beeing mounted luſty courſer made albayzar friend imagine victory would happen ſide acquainted noble proweſſe dramuſiande iudged contrarie certaine word vttered eyther ſide continued long dramuſiande beeing earneſt deſire chaſtiſe proude behauiour framuſtant gaue horſe spurres againſt likewiſe prepared himſelfe entertain encountred ſuch excéeding force glad catche holde neck horſes ſhunne fall immediately recouered saddle againe drawing theyr swordes ſcabbards began charge one ſuch furious ſtroakes ſurely combat ſéemed moſt dangerous becauſe could méete ſo cloſely together horſebacke would alighted dramuſiande behaued himſelfe ſuch expert nimble dexteritie fight framuſtant could faſten ſtroakes hee layd loade enemy ſuch eagerneſſe theyr quarrell eyther ſide could hardly bee iudged whome aduantage would happen long endured combate ſhields ſo broken defaced could find little defence theyr armour ſo cruelly cut mangled theyr bodyes wounded many place made regardants minde combate deſerued great commendation euer yea combat betwéen dramuſiande giant barocant might compare framuſtant ſhewed himſelfe ſufficient power briefe doubtfulnes combat ſuch victorie hoped eyther ſide fortune reſerued theſe champyons action greater moment would ſuffer combate endure longer inſtant time arriued fielde princeſſe targiana accompanyed princeſſe armenia diuers worthy knight aduertiſed famous cittie conſtantinople beſieged deſired trauell thither ſée prince albayzar came foorth theyr kingdomes left ſufficient gouernours take charge afterward accompanyed two thouſand knightes iourneyed vntill came walles conſtantinople princeſſe targiana bearing great good emperour honour hee beſtowed court beganne wéepe take heauily ſéeing friend ſo troubled brought danger ſhe knowledge combate betwéene framuſtant dramuſiande ſhe would alight horſe entred field prince albayzar beeing little glad arriuall princeſſe armenia soldane perſia ſundry king companie manner ſhee came theſe two giant fought combate approaching dramuſiande ſhee layde hand right ſhoulder taking maſke frō face ſhe ſpake vnto manner think reaſon syr dramuſiande former quarrel ſhould ſet apart ended preſence loyall vnfained friend dramuſiande calling remembrance length returned anſwer certainely madame might accounted vngentle minde would refuſe vanquiſhed condition thought agréeable nature iudge doe aduantage much wiſhing mee giue ouer combate eſpecially ſeeing matched ſuch ſtrong puiſſant enemie knowe well ſaid framuſtant theſe glozing wordes ſpoken heart onely flowte ſ • orne neuertheleſſe hope make finde true ende pray thée framuſtant anſwered dramuſiande ſhew thy ſelfe inſtant ſomewhat obedient madame targiana conſidering wée place may time trie ſelues together albayzar commaunded framuſtant withdraw himſelfe meane emperor vernar king edward diuers prince came princeſſe targiana florian forreſt ſhruncke away cittie becauſe would haue knowe ſaluted dignitie deſerued ſhe willed doo humble dutie emperor empreſſe princeſſes friend ſhe tooke leaue returning cittie dramuſiande ſhe departing albayzar prince campe ſhe receyued meruailous ſtatelie ſides glad haue company lady well prince cittie emperor allemaigne king edward ſpent time diſcourſing beauty princeſſe armenia exceeded farre princeſſe targiana continuing commendation fayre lady came pallace emperor reioycing greatly arriuall princeſſe targiana empreſſe bare ſo great good vnto princeſſe lady ſought deſire lycence might goe welcome princeſſe targiana ſhe ſelf ſo flattered prince albayzar ſhe obtained lycence goe ſhew reuerence empreſſe lady next morning ſhe rode brauely cittie accompanied princeſſe armenia soldane perſia diuers prince brought citie entraunce wherof emperour ſate chayre brought thither honour targiana tooke armes ſhe bene owne daughter like princeſſe armenia soldane perſia kinges came company princeſſe targiana ſo caried pallace entring empreſſe chamber ſhe entertained gratious courteſie ſhe company beſide imbraced one another princeſſe polinarda preſented queene flerida targiana whome ſhe held hand vſing many gentle ſalutations ſhe knowledge miragarda leonarda ſhe perceiued verie well beautie might compare gréeuing leonarda eſcaped ſo well place ſhe cauſed enchaunted ſhe came princeſſe miragarda theſe ſpéeches cannot chuſe madame eſtéeme meruailous well paine aduenture honour field defence beautie cauſe muſt take good part labour prince albayzar beſtowed behalfe quéen leonarda ſhe would ſpeak one word becauſe ſhe married prince florian whome ſhe condemned mortall enemie princeſſe armenia ſitting betwéene miragarda leonarda much abaſhed ſhe acquainted lady emperor court notwithſtanding entertained honourablie thus continued princelie courteſies one another till night drawing targiana tooke leaue emperor deſiring maieſtie excuſe warre commenced contrary empreſſe lady brought pallace gate eche ſide parted ſuch heauineſſe could ſpeake one another emperor himſelfe accompanied without cittie becauſe targiana excuſed ſelfe warre albayzar enterpriſed againſt maieſtie tooke hand ſpeaking manner promiſe madame little griefe cannot time witneſſe le • th iudged vngratefull vnto deſerues honoured moſt gratious ſeruice malicious dealing albayzar truſt cannot diminiſh one iote good beare aſſure may diſpoſe court pleaſure may make ſelfe bolde welcome héere great turke father court breaking ſaluting eche great courteſie emperour carryed backe pallace targiana conducted camp accompanied emperour vernar king england fraunce spayne many prince emperor court hauing brought campe tooke leaue returned citty deuiſing ſeuerally among themſelues whoſe lotte targiana ladyes ſhould fall ſo victory chanced theyr ſide oftentimes nature souldiers ſhare diuide ſpoyle among themſelues fortune hath deliuered theyr hand chap lxii ¶of battell betweene chriſtians turk happened many dayes arriuall princeſſe targiana prince well one ſide concluded ioyne battell marrie chriſtians deſirous thereto turk becauſe victual beganne waxe ſcant within cittie beſides albayzar came oftentimes prouoked alſo standard enſigns diſplayed vrged knight cry call theyr cōmanders captain ſuffer ſaillie foorth cittie griefe ſo encloſed within theyr enemyes come daring ſo boldely without vppon primaleon would gladly haue iſſued foorth prince would haue bin ruled would aduenture ſo raſhly becauſe many weake ſickly trauelling sea therefore determined recouer themſelues perfect aſſurance health would thuſte themſelues face daunger well reſted recouered themſelues found ſtrong able deale enemie commaunders ſummoned traines field king edward generall whole force commaunded horſemen footemen prepare themſelues battell firſt squadron conducted soldane bellagris whome committed fiue thouſand good soldier owne subiects ſecond giuen charge recinde king spaine conduct thrée thouſand ſent kingdome spayne third led arnedes king fraunce charge like number king spaine two thouſand souldiers ſent france fourth vnder conduct polendos king theſſalie attending like number fift charge emperour vernar allemaigne ſixt laſt foure thouſand conducted king edward england primaleon would day take vpon charge might better giue ſuccour thoſe place perceiued moſt daunger becauſe iudged pollicie vſed warre theſe followe brauely ſéene fielde day belcar drapos normandie maiortes otherwiſe called great dog palmerin england florian forreſt florendos platir blandidon berolde prince spayne floraman sardignia gracian france roſuell bellizart oniſtalde tenebrant francian pompides sage aliart king eſtreliant friſoll albanis frieze rodamont dragonalt king nauarre luyman burgundie germaine orleance tremoran reſiran de la bronde dramuſiande almaroll moſt renowmed knightes emperor court squadron vnder conduct soldane bellagris concluding themſelues ſo ſoone battell ſhould begunne would take part ſide theyr dutie affection beſt ſerue king tarnaes accompanyed many valiaunt knight committed charge defence cittie footemen choſen fiftie thouſand ſuch accounted moſt wiſeſt expert souldiers vnder conducting king tarnaes helpe preuent danger imminent cittie king edward himſelfe braue gallantly armed ceaſed viſite charge horſemen likewiſe hee came among young prince knightes encouraging noble ſpéeches countenance bewraying inuincible minde conquerour deſiring remember theyr knightly déedes paſſed might occaſion ſtirre vp nobly defence flower chriſtendome theſe ſuch like ſpéeches ſo animate embolden traine moſt fearefull leaſt minde deale enemy ſéemed willing forward battell hée braueſt souldier field king perceiued withdrew himſelfe company commanding soldane bellagris giue firſt aſſault albayzar diuided horſemen ten companyes giuing euery squadron fiue thouſand men firſt squadron conducted soldan perſia accompanied giant framuſtant fiue hundred wel approued souldiers ſecond giuen charge king trebizonde third king caſpia fourth king armenia fift king gamba ſixt king sparta ſeuenth king bithinia eight prince argelo arfaſia tenth laſt conducted soldane albayzar himſelfe whome ſeauen giant guard perſon ſo ſoon framuſtāt eſpied dramuſiande forefront chriſtians armie deſirous approoue himſelfe againſt onely hée went licence albayzar foremoſt squadron turkes becauſe hee thought meanes encounter dramuſiande young prince albayzars campe diuided foure part part contained fiue twenty thouſand left beſide ſent pauillons ſafegarde princeſſe targiana princeſſe armenia richneſſe armour ingenious deuiſes theſe knight well one ſide bare conflict would trouble eloquent tongue marcus tullius cicero make true ſufficient diſcourſe thereof yéelde greater contentment thoſe friendely gentleman take delight reading famous hyſtorie rehearſe name braueſt fielde firſt begin chriſtians wherof ſometimes two thrée together whoſe armour deuiſes like colour proportion king edward emperour vernar soldane bellagris theyr armour scarlet white blacke colour mightie chaynes golde croſſing theyr bodyes theyr ſhieldes bare flying griffon fielde siluer vnderneath written letter golde name ſuch eſtéemed bee beſt beloued moſt famous friend primaleon king polendos white armour theyr ſhieldes portrayed ſiluer fielde clouen rocke deuiſe primaleon woont beare amorous princeſſe gridonia wife recinde arnedes francian gylt armour two lyon rampant ſhieldes field azure king vngaria eſtrellant belcar vnkle black armour ſhadowed little ſtreams gold becauſe long ſince deceaſſe king friſoll ditree theyr deuiſes figured theyr ſhieldes golden trée fielde sable palmerin england prince florendos gréen armour thicke beſet little fillet gold theyr ſhieldes figured fortune siluer fielde whereby vnderſtood yet repoſe ſome truſt prince floraman sardignia kinght sauadgeman theyr armour indian coulour wrought ouer little ſhrubbes golde deuiſes theyr ſhieldes contrarie floraman portrayed ſhielde death holding lady hand fielde sable florian kept sauadge deuiſe wherewith atchieued ſo many honorable victory dragonalt king nauatre albanis frieze king denmarke redde armour circle ſiluer croſſe thwarting euery way ſhields pictured field sinople loue holding knight vnderneath féet deuiſe princeſſe miragarda commanded dragonalt carry life time vanquiſhed prince florendos caſtle almaroll prince berolde oniſtalde brother gylt corſelets baſes blacke ſhields figured little flame fire field sable polinard muncalion armour gréene carnation colour ſhields diſplaied ſiluer sea field sinople blandidon friſoll black armor carrying theyr deuiſes ſhields two golden griffon fielde geules pompides platir gréene armour eache carried ſhielde ſiluer bull fielde sinople pompides tooke great delight deuiſe armour prince gracian guerin brother gréene scarlet white colour fillet golde croſſe ſtrickt ſeparate colour theyr ſhieldes figured garden flower ſiluer fielde rodamont bellizart theyr armour verimillion colour theyr ſhieldes carryed hope habite woman depriued life deuiſe fielde geules roſuell dramian white armour thicke beſet roſes golde ſhields pictured diſplayed enſigne ſiluer golden fielde baſilliart didon brother azure armour wrought ouer little siluer ſhrubbes ſame manner ſhields luyman burgundie tremoran armour tawny colour colour conformable amorous thought becauſe tremoran hope eſpouſe ladie carried deuiſe according ill happe layman burguudie ſame caſe willing kéepe companie therefore carryed theyr deuiſes theyr shielees sifiphus tumbling reſtleſſe ſtone field sable sage aliart obſcure valley roſian de la bronde white armour maner deuiſes ſhieldes sage aliart figure god apollo ſhield field sinople roſian ſhielde tower nemrod whence hee lineally deſcended maiortes giant almaroll blacke armour theyr ſhieldes ſame colour without maner deuiſe giant dramuſiande ſtrong armour • ier ſhielde ſame manner whome chriſtians made eſpeciall account becauſe knew noble valour hee indued withall diuers others braue theyr armour deuiſes ſhieldes made gallant ſhewe among chriſtians let paſſe time auoyde prolixitie wee ſpeake ſomewhat prince albayzar gallantly mounted gréene armour thicke beſet spheares gold ſigne victory ſhield pictured fielde sinople liuely naturall forme princeſſe targiana soldane perſia carnation coloured armour beeing thicke beſet precious ſtones incredible eſtimation ſkyrts baſes framed diuerſitie fine curious artificiall knottes gold middeſt whereof ſtood two letter p p cauſed placed onely firſt letter name princeſſe polinarda towards whome maruellous affectionate good hope rewarded woonne victorie shield figured hope gréen veſture like young beautifull ladie vnderneath written letter golde name princeſſe polinarda king gaſpia tawny armour ſtreaked ouer diuers place blacke ſigne bene vanquiſhed combate paſt ſhielde bare deuiſe beare hauing clawes al bloody field sable whereby hee gaue vnderſtand good hope bathe hand blood enemy king trebiſonde red armour ouer figured little ſiluer bird hauing wing ſpread abroad manner flying carryed picture god mar shielde minotaurshead conquered creete deuiſe golden field king sparta white armour ſhield portrated lyon torne piece becauſe torne lion himſelf youthfull time king aetolia blacke armour bearing deuiſe ſhielde blacke bull field geules king armenia azured armour wrought ouer roſes golde ſhield figured phoenix fielde azure whereby meaning ladie onely phoenix beauty world whome might equall ſelfe king gamba guylt armour baſes ſiluer shield pictured golden lion ſiluer fielde king bythinia gréen armour croſſeſtreaked bond ſiluer coupling manner knot ſhield caried golden tiger rampant againſt rock chriſtal field sinople prince argelao arfaſia armour like king bythinia many prince albayzars knight came fielde brauely armed let paſſe vnnamed time aſſuring framuſtant giant armed gallantly behaued themſelues ſuch report field thought verily diſmay chriſtians countenance chap lxiii ¶of firſt battell betweene chriſtians turkes ſucceſſe thereof armye eyther ſide appointed good decent maner potentate king prince perſons moſt authoritie would néeds goe place themſelues formoſt rancke holding opinion ſuch renowmed battell wherein perill chriſtendom conſiſted preſented themſelues foremoſt fight ſhould deſerue greateſt honor glory field conſideration made captaines leaue theyr charge lieutenant come place themſelues face battell drummes trumpet ſounding gallantly either ſide soldane perſia marched traine receiue firſt squadron chriſtians meeting togither primaleon encountred king caſp • brake launce ſo brauely himſelfe forſooke ſtirrops king caſpia ſuch forcible ſtroake hee ſent headlong earth ſore wounded palmerin england ſerued king aetolia ſame manner albeit reputed amongſt turkes eſpeciall good knight armes florendos king armenia fayled iouſt met ſo forceably togither theyr bodyes horſes tumbled ground prince florendos recouered himſelfe againe quickly turke ſo amazed fall hee could hardly tell whereupon two couzins came vnto conducted betweene tent berolde spaine floraman sardignia addreſſed themſelues prince argelao king bithinia encountred ſo furiouſly caſt forth ſaddles able mount themſelues againe becauſe number ſo great fight ſo h • te recinde arnedes ranne againſt king gamba sparta vnhorſed except king recinde kept horſe valiantly soldane bellagris king trebiſonde mette together brake launce verie brauely béeing thing ſhaken encounter soldane perſia deſired haue himſelfe ſéene field ſooner eſpied knight sauadgeman gaue horſe ſpurres encountred ſo nobly knight sauadgeman loſt ſtirrops recouered againe preſently soldane ſo ſore ſhaken lay along necke horſe tumbled ground one traine immediatly ſuccoured among dealt firſt encounter dramuſiande framuſtant moſt regarded fayling breaking launce met ſuch couragious manner together body horſes men ſent ground recouering themſelues nimbly againe beganne furious cruell combate example knight charged one another moſt puiſſant ſtroakes prince emperours court firſt encounter except king edward emperour vernar king polendos would depart squadron fearing leaſt would diſparſe themſelues order giant almaroll kept company likewiſe becauſe ſaw giant foremoſt rancke framuſtant whome dramuſiande fought gallantly thyy thus encountred launce many knight throwne earth ſome ſlaine outright ſome little better caſe drew ſwords ſides began moſt cruell battaile euer ſéene captaines returned againe ſeuerall charge becauſe would haue fall order argelao king bithinia fighting foote againſt floraman sardignia berolde spaine ſuccoured soldane perſia like noble captaine praunced among ranckes animate encourage mindes friend aſſembling ſundrie company hee came theſe foure continued fight ſtill fiercely soldane bellagris traine ſhewed ſuch proweſſe freſh commers soldane perſia himſelfe companie brought enforced giue place againſt willes leauing argelao king bithinia ſuch danger king trebiſonde come vpon ſecond turkiſh squadrō béene ſlaine hand floraman prince berolde soldane perſia ſo greatly gréeued ſéeing men ſo vanquiſhed left ſo heart cried ſuccour king trebiſonde whoſe aide returned recouer loſt length made meanes get argelao king bithinia thorow preaſſe thē ſéene prince primaleon might plainly haue diſcerned willing • e preuails againſt enemy laide loade ſo euerie ſide following vpon thē traine ſo nobly one durſt ſtand endure fury meanes recouered horſes againe floraman berolde ſo wounded glad get forth battell primaleon palmerin england florian forreſt traynes helde king trebiſondes ſecond squadron ſo h • te play wiſhed themſelues little furder left hand squadron moſt daungerous battaile betwéene framuſtant dramuſiande gotten great aduantage enemy reaſon framuſtantes ſword broken hand albayzar ſent two hundred knight foote helpe giant primaleon perceiued ſpake palmerin england manner pray sir goe ſuccour friend dramaſiande neuer returne cittie except haue mée without word layd luſtily knockt downe euery one ſtood vntill came dramuſiande thither likewiſe came defend againſt enemy knight sauageman florendos platir polinard pompides sage aliart maiortes friſoll blandidon roſiran de la bronde belcar ſonnes likewiſe accompanied twentie moſt renowmed knight armie aide framuſtant came soldan perſia king trebiſond accompanied hundred knight great authoritie valour foote primaleon ſaw friend without horſes alighted likewiſe ſo prince palmerin chriſtian knight heard primaleon fought foote forſooke horſes came haſtily running defend beganne ſuch cruell fierce battell ſides remained doubtfull dangerous dramuſiande framuſtant ſo layde vpon pommils ſwords length ſo ſore trauailed ſtroakes could little hurt primaleon king trebiſonde buckled together ſuch fierceneſſe fight end conſtrained pauſe like happened palmerin england soldane perſia knight sauage man ſlew two knight came traiterouſly ſtrooke behinde back florendos reſt companion ſtuck ſo cloſely tackling many enemy ranne like dogges away maiortes ſo compaſſed enemy none friend might come helpe ſo ſuch gréeuous wound giuen hauing ſlaine ſo many enimies durſt abide hée fell downe dead ground himſelfe florian forreſt ſo grieued ſaw fall teares trickled downe cheek albeit extreame heauineſſe yet followed kilde maiortes reuenged death nobly becauſe death ſo braue noble man much lamented knew valiaunt minde moſt eſpeciallie sonne dridan anguiſh mind caſt himſelfe amongſt enemy within behaued himſelfe ſo well turkes knew coſt extreame griefe death father yet ſuch vnhappie fortune end beſet among thickeſt enimies many cruell wound giuen diuerſe place body fell ground vitall ſpirite forſaking made follow father dead ghoſt ſmall griefe noble king edward england reſpect great friend ſhippe loue remayned long time betwéene maiortes becauſe iudged fighting thus foote would death many deere friendes commaunded hard horſes breake ranckes whereto preſentlie obeyed ſcattered troupe enemy ſuch ſort friendes mounte • horſebacke againe dramuſiande framuſtant ſeparated ſunder ſecond encounter king trebiſonde ſlaine hand noble palmerin england dramuſiand framuſtant ſo daungerouſly wounded able hold fight longer wherefore conueied thence one turkes tentes cittie tendered preſent regard according dangerous eſtates required conflict thus broken diuers entred firſt ſquadron retired take breathing primaleon palmerin many emperor court beſide pleaſure endure trauaile armes ſuch ſmall account made hurt enemy empreſſe lady ſéeing ſo great cruelty loſſe ſo many noble gentleman withdrew themſelues chamber lamented ſuch gréeuous maner ſeene enimie entred citie whervpon many lady great authorite hearing pittifull lamentatiōs came vnto pallace repoſing altogither hope aged emperor knightes field ſhould fayle victorie king tarnaes would haue denied lady entraunce pallace could well doo hardlie man gouerne common people eſpeciallie generall feare liues threatned eye emperour himſelf whoſe debilitie yéeres griefe minde conceyued vnlooked ſtratageme depriued woonted good iudgement pollitique meanes preuent ſo great miſchéefe could imagine himſelfe remedie ſuddaine miſfortune euen woman ſtomacke rather inuincible minde alwayes borne héeretofore fel puſillanimitie doubtful feare himſelfe vtterlie forgetting auncient adage audaces fortuna iuuat targiana princeſſe armenia lady turkes campe ſo fearefull doubtfull victorie lady emperours court king edward generall chriſtian armie deſiring witneſſe noble valour fielde hauing reſted himſelfe pretie ſpace diſmounted thrée knight one another one launce afterward drawing ſworde charged enimes ſides ſo valiauntlie glad auoide giue place prince albayzar likewiſe ſéeking honour himſelfe day renowme field came vppon chriſtians incredible proweſſe ſuch reſiſtaunce made freſh company battaile endured long time blody cruell ſo man could iudge ſide moſt aduantage came newe aſſault vpon chriſtians great number turkes left wing among whome ſixe monſtrous terrible giant aſſault ſo hote time chriſtians enforced retyre giant almaroll kept companie king recinde lorde ſéeing chriſtians withdrawe themſelues addreſſed himſelfe one giant called dramorant mighty mace hee gotten battell hee kept ſuch rough playe could paſſe forward willinglie would haue done king recinde ſéeing another giant named trafamor cōming ſtrike almaroll behinde backe ſtepped hinder determination hée aged feeble able reſiſt mercileſſe ſtroaks bloodyminded giant trafamor ſo pittifully wounded fell downe giant féete tooke ſword thruſt heart king recinde prince palmerin perceyued hée ry ſorrie comming rage giant trafamor neuer left vntill ſuch time hee layde downe dead ground ſo ſore himſelfe▪ glad get foorth battell commandement prince primaleon • hee carryed cittie made great doubt life reaſon loſt ſuch aboundance blood almaroll dramorant ſundred whervpon death recinde k spayne blazed army ſuch heauy newes arnedes king france couzin ſingular good friend making account life hee threw himſelf amongſt enemy ſéeking reuenge death king spayne hee loſt owne life ſlaine oniſtalde sonne king recinde followed arnedes reuenge father death king edward prince ſo offended ſawe theyr déereſt friendes thus caſt ground ranne amongſt thickeſt enemyes layd loade like deſperate men knight sauadgeman likewiſe whoſe ſhield manner deuiſe could diſcerned ſo hackt broken piece came vnto giant dramorant handled ſuch knightly order made tumble downe dead belcar king polendos entring king aetoliaes troupe ende enforced paye ſharpe tribute death demaundeth nature dutie vnfortunate ſucceſſe cauſed little heauines among chriſtians eſpecilly prince berolde spayne vnderſtanding king recinde father oniſtalde brother ſlaine enimies ruſhed fiercely vppon determining eyther reuenge theyr loſſe leaue life among company prince floraman sardignia followed cloſe butchering turkes euery ſide whereby hee manifeſted prince berolde entyre good affection bare valiaunt florendos moſt iniury enemie day knightly ſtroakes bee ſéene shield deliuered true teſtimony great danger eſcaped made account ſuch earneſt deſire reuenge death déere friend battell may reputed moſte cruell perillous euer ſéene ſo many grieuous tragicall spectacle ſéene diſmall day loſſe number famous prince moſt renowmed knightes might haue ſéene roſuell bellizart breake hardily preaſſe theyr enemyes without eyther feare regarde theyr owne liues looke theyr noble father prince belcar francian ſide came ſearche father king polendos enemy perceyuing knowing néere allyed emperor followed fiercely ſée could firſt murther prince berolde ſooner come place father lay ſlayne hee ſawe giant almaroll loſt helmet face ſo pittifully beſmiered blood great griefe behelde hee place laid ſeuen hardy knight ſlaine foot determined forſake dead body prince loſt owne life likewiſe place enemy reſiſted prince berolde ſo ſtrongly béene ſuccour emperor vernar primaleon florendos blandidon béene ſent kéepe father company primaleon laboured earneſtly get giant almaroll foorth battaile becauſe deſtritute helmet armour broken much body wounded many place ſuch loue fidelitie bare prince impoſſible primaleon cauſe withdraw himſelfe vpon reſkew prince berolde enemy came running amaine place soldane perſia conducting hearing almaroll continued manfully killing came galloped thorow rancke till came almaroll ſo ſeene gallant behauiour primaleon florendos sonne defending almaroll enemy fury would haue imagined type knightly valour conſiſt theſe two famous champion little grieued ſée almaroll ſo willing ſéeke owne death could bee perſwaded minde friend giant gramato came company soldane perſia aduanced himſelfe deale almaroll hardy florendos ſtepped ſlaine outright almaroll caught body ſo grieuouſly wounded ſuccour whatſoeuer would ſaue life fell dead giant gramato berolde afterward charged ſo roughly gramato ended life accompany giant almaroll began courage chriſtians encreaſe worthily ſtronger place turkes soldane perſia conueyed foorth battaile reaſon wound receiued throate puſh sword ſo soldane bellagris found good opportunitie carry body king recinde oniſtalde ſonne forth field prince berolde helping conduct body becauſe himſelfe loſt ſo much blood could ſcantly hold longer primaleon hauing regard troupe men diſperſed field beheld king edward traine driuen retire albayzar accompanied thrée giant number knight ſéeing chriſtians fore trauailed came vpon freſh charge king edward met proud enemie ſuch puiſſance glad draw backe reſt himſelfe aſſuring king england behaued himſelfe ſo nobly field whole chriſtian campe repoſed themſelues pompides baſiliart sage aliart platir friſol germain orlnance luyman burgundie rodamont albanis frize dragonalt roſiran de la bronde tremoran tenebrant roſuell bellizart diuers chriſtian knight reſiſted enemy verie valiantly followed ſo faſt vpon albayzar company freſh ſupplies ſtill come made notable conqueſt aduerſaries primaleon left gouerne theſe soldane bellagris blandidon went florendos floraman noble king edward england would haue approched eſpyed emperour vernar polinard brother foote encloſed ſuch number turkes liues greatly feared king bythinia ſlaine emperour vernars horſe falling ground brake one maiſters legges fall ſo emperour faine ſtand vppon one legge defend himſelfe hard caſe hee verie neare death brother polinard ſtept preſently defended ſuch manly proweſſe enemy could way come hurt emperour primaleon ſéeing miſfortune emperour allemaigne turkes ſought euery way take life ſo ouercome inward griefe teares trickled downe chéekes fearing vtter ruine conſtantinople ran ſuch courage vpon enemy downe tumbled dead groūd euery ſide florendos thought armour ſhiuered ſhéeld defend himſelfe yet accompanied prince floraman folowed father ſhewing incredible proweſſe floraman ſetled himſelfe againſt king bithinia preuailed ſo well againſt ſent headlong groūd depriued life primaleon ſéeing floraman bee ſomewhat ſore hurt deſired withdrawe himſelfe battell turkes conducted king bythinia ſawe theyr captain ſlaine beganne retire ſpeedily meanes primaleon recouered mounted polinard horſebacke againe hee could imagine howe got emperour vernar field made aduenture men ſuch daunger doubtfull ſhould haue fallen enemy hand king armenia came vppon againe foure thouſand men hoping recouer king loſt ſo primaleon faine alight horſe defence emperour vernar like manner moſt prince knight fearing leaſt harme ſhould come vnto prince emperour many ſlaiue newe aſſault ſo king armenia fiue hundred beſt tryed soldyers emperour vernar ſéeing death ready entertaine meanes ſhun embraced mildely patiently young prince ſaw emperour ſlaine carryed foorth fielde brought great heauineſſe cittie become manner deſolate moſt vertuous valiant king edward ſéeing himſelfe left alone soldane albayzar whome hee dealt ſo ſtoutly withall pompides platir prince might reſt themſelues cauſe friend ſlaine tranſported thence ende hee brought albayzar ſuch eſtate kilde fielde hee bene ſooner reſkued giant came neuertheleſſe hee taught dutie ſo well hée tooke engliſh prince ſharpe schoolemaiſter king edward albayzar continued theyr fight night drawing apace trumpet ſounded retrait ſo euery one haſted vnto enſigne king edward ſummoned men together thinking ſo well theyr generall iudged themſelues happy vnder leading gouernment bellagris primaleon brought traines likewiſe place array chriſtians betooke themſelues cittie turkes returend theyr campe chap lxiii ¶of conſtantinople gaue enemy ſecond battell great miſfortunes hapned citty amongſt chanced vntimely death aged emperour palmerin chriſtian pagan prince theyr force eyther ſide thus retyred theyr ſeuerall hold conſent albayzar palmerin prince knight ſlaine battell carryed thence interred theyr funeralls performed grieuous complaint made cittie loſſe ſo many noble renowned prince leaue iudgement courteous reader muſt néedes thinke griefe great chriſtendome receiued ſuch loſſe many yéeres could recoured againe conſideration entred ſo déepe aged emperours heart forſooke earthly vale miſery yéelding ſoule god body bowelles mother whence came firſt time enchaunted bird kept pallace ſung thrée time together pittifull note ſo olde young court alittle maruaile thereat birde may reade large notable famous hiſtory emperour palmerins life booke called palmerin doliue hiſtory plentifully ſtored diſcourſes ſingular delight worthineſſe thereof eſtéemed many nation hiſtory likewiſe therefore excellency aforeſaide hiſtory reſpect dependeth matter briefely touched booke ſo accounted parcell hiſtory entend god ayding publiſh ſhortly doubt gentle reader ſhall finde worthy commendation haue vſed place obſequies funeralles emperour ſolemnized great pompe dignitie like manner honour emperour allemainge king ſlaine battaile many dayes wounded prince found themſelues good diſpoſition againe weerevpon determined enter field becauſe enemy demaunded battaile firſt prouided ſafegard city committed charge king tarnaes lacedemonia sage aliart obſcure valley hauing conduct fiue hundred knight horſebacke foure thouſand able footemen reſt chriſtians deuided ſixe ſeuerall band firſt conducted pr • nce primaleon atiending two thouſand fiue hundred knight ſecond band ſame number committed prince floraman sardignia third king eſtrellant fourth albanis frieze fifth drapos duke normandie theſe fiue hand like number ſixt vnder charge noble king edward came reſt chriſtian ſouldiers soldane bellagris traine charge vtter wing giue ayde ſaw néede required theſe knight departed citie toward field blacke armour ſhields ſame colour without deuices horſes likewiſe trapped blacke expreſſe inward heauineſſe would haue neither drumme trumpet kind inſtrument vſed warre neuertheleſſe albeit ſad procéeding battaile declared owne heanineſſe yet likewiſe feare terror enemy ſéeing comming farre euery man cloſed beuer helmet becauſe enemy ſhould perceiue mournfull countenance come place battaile ſhould fought ſpread themſelues abread field deuice captaines without making maner noyſe footemen came attired black likewiſe without either drum phifes trumpet wherby gaue enemy vnderſtand vnfained loue affection bare emperour could forget gracious friendly entertainement woont make enemy thing prince ought haue regard remembring great vertue famous emperour gouerne kingdomes ſuch ſort people may rather know gréeuous loſſe haue death ſuch prince behaue themſelues ſuch manner subiects ſhall reioyce rid gouernour turk greatly abaſhed ſéeing enemy come marching order knew well mourning habit would battell make account liues albayzar ſéeing aſtoniſhment souldiers came encourage like noble captaine laying renowme victorie ſhould recompence trauailes ſufficient reuenge death many parent friendes loſt liues walles conſtantinople cauſe warre firſt enterpriſed good ſpace vſed theſe ſuch like ſpéeches began waxe deſirous battaile chaſing formerfeare remembrance marched ſame manner firſt battaile ſauing vnder charge captaines conducted ſlaine armour much broken bruiſed ſo died blood iſſued body almoſt ſtrange ſight field chriſtians ſad mournefull habites blacke king edward ſéeing men placed decent order backwings ſuch regard hée thought méeteſt hée gaue charge primaleon giue conſent company noble palmerin england florian forreſt florendos platir pompides blandidon roſuel bellizart dragonalt king nauarre giant dramuſiand moſt renowmed prince court enemy ſide king aetolia firſt field becauſe conducted formoſt troupe wherein moſt puiſſant knight turkiſh armie beſide giant framuſtant deſired aboue thing preuaile againſt dramuſiande chriſtians finding themſelues readineſſe turkes ſounded drummes trumpet beginne battaile ſodainely came ſo great tempeſt returned backe againe able ioyne fight ſpace two houres meane time tempeſt continueth let v returne citie conſtantinople haue heard committed chargs tarnaes king lacedemonia sage aliart obſcure valley finding art cittie conſtantinople would bee brought deſtruction king edward england prince primaleon reſt prince knight maintained warre would ſtand great hazard looſing liues able auoyd cruelty turk would get cittie poſſeſſion vpon theſe aforeſaid conſiderations determined prouide ſafety princeſſes lady high authority moſt great childe neare • ime deliuerance wherefore fruit bodyes might periſh extremity raiſed darke obſcure cloude ſhadowed light firmament ſuch ſort onely field couered therewith alſo cittie ſo wrapt cloud poſſible diſcerne meane army remained great amazement darkeneſſe power méete together aliart conueyed da • ke cloud empreſſe princeſſe polinarda princeſſes ladyes beſide perillous iſle prince palmerin england beſtowed ſhaddowed iſle likewiſe enchantment ſuch manner remained inuiſible vntill aliart conceiued ſo well time reaſon thought good diſcouer theſe lady ſurpriſed maruellous admiration wh • n found themſelues conſtantinople ſtrange land could haue company endured ſo many hard dangerous conflict ſakes aboue cauſes moſt offend trouble conſciences yet length ſaw remedy glad practiſe content themſelues often viſiting chamber expell cogitation ſéeme irkſome vnto thus wil leaue empreſſe lady perillous iſle returne king tarnaes conſtantinople cloude vaniſhed away day cleare againe ſéeing empreſſe lady sage aliart forſaken companie conceyued ſuch extreame griefe within himſelfe doubting leaſt ſome miſchaunce befallen amidde pittifull lamentation hée yéelded vp ghoſt leauing cittie ſo comfortleſſe diſpayring within themſelues deſired finiſh liues forſaking quite hope fielde whome happened fortune ordained may read chapter following chap lxv ¶of ſecond battell betweene chriſtians turkes happened therein darke cloud gone fight sage aliart hauing brought empreſſe lady perillous iſle day began waxe cléere againe armie marched forward méete together enter ſkyrmiſh heard moſt lamentable pittifull outcrye made ſtaye hand looking ſée cauſe noyſe ſaw great many ladyes damoſells come foorth cittie haire diſperſed abroade ouer theyr ſhoulders wringing handes grieuous manner loſt king tarnaes sage aliart knew left ſuccour defence came chriſtian campe huſbands brother sonnes kinſmen ſéeing could promiſe themſelues aſſurance cittie would liue die fielde king edward primaleon ſo amazed clamor theſe woman cauſed theyr enſignes ſtay commanded horſemen breake theyr array till vnderſtood cauſe diſorder told king tarnaes sage aliart forſaken cittie driuen great admyration themſelues whereupon ſent pompides platir cittie bring certaine tydings vnlooked miſchaunce theſe two knightes come cittie heard manner king tarnaes dyed alſo howe sage aliart gone man could tell whether beganne thinke within themſelues theyr traine brought ſuch extremitie fortune concluded finiſh memorie theyr knightly déedes deliuering theyr liued ſwords theyr enemy likewiſe perſwade themſelues sage aliart abſented himſelfe occaſion onely becauſe perceyued theyr generall deſtruction hand reſpect iudged hée prouided ſome refuge empreſſe lady enemy might triumph theyr miſfortunes great diſcontentment theyr lordes huſbandes theſe heauy newes returned camp againe certifying king edward primaleon sage aliart departed whervpon concluded generall determination withdraw themſelues cittie make prouiſion defence thereof would enter battell enemy aſſure pittifull ſight behold men woman child came fell prince féete yea ancient citizen gray head white beard ſo weake féeble age glad ſupport themſelues ſtaues made humble requeſts might rather enter battell thereto end liues deſtroyed home wiues child enemie king edward primaleon prince little abaſhed finding pallace ſuch deſolate manner neyther empreſſe princeſſes ladyes founde vexed mindes vnexpreſſable griefe went theyr accuſtomed chamber finding whome moſt affectionate ſoules ready forſake theyr bodyes young prince enioying theyr ſwéet ladyes ſo ſhort time whoſe ſakes ſuffered ſo many bitter brunt thought themſelues able liue long time depriued company honored moſt pure vnfained affection paine greater euer béene miſhap irkeſome danger paſt becauſe lady rewardes knightly victory hauing thus loſt ſuch ſodaine hope enioy ſight wherefore ſéemed men depriued ſences looking gaſtly fearefully one vpon knowing way comfort redr • ſſe preſent heauineſſe caſe chriſtian prince remained ſpace thrée day hauing minde giue enemy battaile time primaleon maide conueiance aged men wiues child night time diuers caſtles fortreſſes néere adioyning knowing farre vnable helpe extremitie cauſed wals cittie beaten flat ground thought good aduice euery one bee ſo done two eſpeciall cauſes firſt would animate imbolden chriſtians time battaile ſéeing themſelues diſpoyled place wherein repoſed aſſurance ſafety enemy ſhould vaunt deſtroyed city defaced chriſtians themſelues ſo fortune ſuffered enioy victorie citie ſéeing walles ſo ſpoyled euen firſt foundation • f conceiued ſuch hatred againſt turkes whome reputed cauſe ſubuerſion ſtrongeſt defence prepared themſelues altogether enter field reuenge themſelues proud vſurping enemy ſo marched prince field went ſame manner aliart conueied empreſſe lady conſtantinople perillous iſle albayzar knowing well intent enemy cōmanded captaines place men aray afterward trumpet ſummoning brauely battaile commanded king aetolia giue onſet band enemy whereto king preſently obeyed comming gallantly troupe men prince primaleon prepared himſelfe receiue giuing horſe ſpurres preuailed ſo fortunately encounter made king aetolia meaſure length ground hee quickly ſuccoured men otherwiſe primaleon giuen death wounde palmerin england ran againſt prince argelao met ſuch puiſſance launce pierced cleane thorowe body ſo fell ground ſtarke dead like knight sauage man valiant knight named richard eſtéemed ſingular captaine amongſt turkes prince florendos platir gracian berolde knight ſlew outright likewiſe encountred iouſt dramuſiande framuſtant brake launce yet kept horſes valiantly whereupon drew ſwordes began charge furiouſly chriſtians behaued themſelues ſo worthily firſt encounter king aetolia whoſe traine twiſe ſo many number prince primaleon glad retyre able endure hardy ſtroakes prince palmerin florian florendos faine betake themſelues refuge ſecond ſquadron conducted king caſpia came brauely vpon primaleon company yet able enforce thē retyre one foote back palmerin prince maintained ſight ſo ſharply againſt cōpelled recoyle backeward soldane perſia perceiuing came aſſiſt company ſooth made great ſlaughter wearied chriſtians béene prince floraman ſéeing soldane perſia come ſo faſt forward squadron ruſhed vpon band men reſiſted gallant manner palmerin bare great malice soldane perſia becauſe ſo amorous y• princeſſe polinarda wife wherefore ran fiercely againſt brake launce ſo brauely soldane tumbled headlong backward saddle turkes laboured earneſtly mount king againe primaleon went ayde prince floraman likewiſe caſt beſide horſe thus helping one another néereſt hand ſo forgotten dramuſiande framuſtant hauing forſaken horſes fought ſo long together ſuch cruell manner body wounded many place dramuſiande like ſuſtaine worſt framuſtant aſſiſted againſt another knight named grantor dramuſiande beene ſlaine betwéene beene prince florian déere friend came buckled grantor ſuch ſort laide dead foote immediatly turkes beheld grantor ſlaine enuironed prince florian dramuſiande ſo terrible euerie ſide line brought ſome daunger king eſtrellant hungaria charge third chriſtian squa • ron entred vpon tu •• e droue backe perforce till ſaw friendes brought ſafetie againe framuſtant néere diſcharged life soldane albayzar ſeeing daunger commaunded altogether runne chriſtians like king edward men becauſe ſhould helpe fellowes neceſſitie florian ſeeing albayzar comming launce charged reſt gaue horſe ſpurres méete theſe two worthy knight encountred together ſo nobly albayzar glad catch holde necke horſe ſhun fall prince florians horſe ſo ſtarke trauaile fell ground vnder maiſter leapt saddle quickly ſo ſuſtained harme fall albayzar laboured earneſtly get dramuſiande prince florian within rankes men becauſe hee ſawe cruelly hacked hewed turkes thought himſelfe happieſt could auoid preſence yet ſuch company men albayzar hemd withall loſſe liues determined soldan bellagris polinarda arriued expedition walking vp downe bandes men giue aide perceiued neceſſitie required ſaw dangerous eſtates dramuſiande florian thruſting vpon turkes great puiſſance reſkewed dramuſiande brought foorth armie reſt himſelfe mounted florian horſebacke againe notwithſtanding practiſes enemy contrary glad conuey framuſtant foorth battaile likewiſe ſawe ſo ſore trauailed ſcant able ſtand feete theſe two giant field greateſt hurley burly prince psimaleon becauſe palmerin england soldane perſia foote fought maruellous fiercely togither like polinard ſtout turke named ferrebrocque cauſed men ſides haſten conflict king aetolia accompanied fiue hundred knight foote came reſkew soldan perſia berolde spaine remembring death king recinde father ioyned fight king aetolia king edward came thither troupe men aſſiſt friend ſo albayzar behalfe soldane perſia bringing many knight beſide foure ſtoute cruel giant whoſe preſence much terrifie chriſtians ſo many durſt enter fight ſuch monſters yet could theſe knight giant diſmay noble palmerin englād continued fight ſo brauely soldane perſia would leaue till ſaw ſlaine hia foote whoſe death tha turkes lamented much principall captaine vnder prince albayzar likewiſe tooke soldanes death ſo heauily came men vpon chriſtians like mad man victorie prince palmerin againſt soldane little comfort ſaw ye prince polinard fought ſtill againſt ferrebrocque fall downe dead ground ferrebrocque diuers turkes fall downe ſlaine ſide likewiſe death polinard gréeuous friend companion emperor vernar brother kilde firſt battail empreſſe bazilia ſeeing lord huſband gon repoſed al hope comfort prince polinard florendos whoſe griefe could expreſſed death friend polinard becauſe bene nouriſhed al youth together emperor court reuenge death déere friend companion ran fiercely amongſt thickeſt enemy firſt met withal giant pandolfo holding mightie mace hand aduanced himſelfe receiue prince florendos began fierce terrible combat betwéene ſo within whyle giant pandolfo railed exclaimed againſt god horribly finding himſelfe able reſiſt force one knight woont vanquiſh euery one entred fight florendos regarding railling word brought ſuch féeble eſtate length fell downe knées florendos taking helmet ſtrooke • head ſhoulders berolde spaine lekewiſe ſlew king aetolia albayzar perceiued hee came running berolde twentie knight ſo murdred spaniſh prince amongſt soldane bellagris hindered determination came band men reſkewed commanding foure knight carrie forth battaile ſeemed rather dead man one life left order brought pacentio emperor cheefe chamberlaine charge giuen wounded perſons becauſe verie ſkilfull therein man auncient time iudged fit enter fight prince beroldes miſfortune ſuch griefe friendes rather deſired beare company liue hope vncertain victorie ye doubtfull remembred loſſe emperor vernar king recinde prince knight sauageman ſeeing great ſlaughter albayzar made friendes pricked thorow place came vnto theſe wordes time albayzar alloweth v opportuuitie ſatiſfie long deſired reuenge eche becauſe two occaſions trouble pray thée let quarrell ended betwéene thée mee let thoſe innocent matter looſe liues offence ſo glad aunſwered albayzar good happe méete thée time would chaunge preſēt fortune moſt renowmed eſtate world breaking theſe two valiant prince began fierce cō bat wherein albayzar brought great daunger giant named altrope came defended giant knight sauadgeman ſoone depriued life would haue gone afterward forth battaile reſt himſelfe king sparta came great many knightes compaſſed knight sauageman ſuch ſort fully determined looſe life amongſt yet ſo chaunced primaleon palmerin ſaw hard caſe brother florian arriued • ickering ſlew king sparta luymeno sonne antiſtes brother beſide many knight perſonages great account chriſtians ſide ſlaine tenebrant francian whoſe loſſe chriſtians much lament tidinges brought soldane bellagris one kild ſonne blandidon report ſo gréeuous hée brake thorow thickeſt enemy till came sonne laye preſently alighted horſe comming sonne made ſuch ſorrowfull lamentation ouer would haue mooued ſtony heart pittie blandidon yet ſome life left hearing voice soldane niquee father opened eye offered lift vp head ſpeake vnto ſuch feebleneſſe could mooue head whereupon caried forth field committed cuſtody olde pacentio bellagris tooke matter ſo heauily ſonne concluded finiſh dayes place ſo cruelly aſſaulted enemie likewiſe reſigned vp vitall ſpirite kilde giant malearque conflict ſlaine turkes king gamba two brother giant piſiſtrato king caſpia giant framuſtant ſlaine noble dramnſiande beſide number famous turkes chriſtians ſide ſlaine germayne orleaunce luyman burgundie pompides king scot diuers worthy chriſtian souldiers amaze number cittizens cōſtantinople brought forth ſuch richeſſe left citie ſet fire enemy face end enemie remayned victor hée ſhould vaunt ſpoyle goodes ſo content burnt rich went ſet fire braueſt buildinges cittie one another brought cinder ſmall griefe chriſtian armie ſeeing ſuch renowmed cittie ſo ſet fire triumphed ouer nation albayzar ſéeing chriſtiās ſtriken maze ſight fire came freſh bād men vpon thē knight sauadgeman ſéeing albayzar comming buckled himſelf againſt eyther ſide ſhowne incredible proweſſe end prince florian preuailed ſo well againſt enemy yeelded vp ghoſt foote turkes beholding beganne faint much whole hope refuge lay prince babylon neuertheleſſe ſuch affection would depart dead body hemde knight sauage man ſo hardly euery ſide almoſt ſlaine reſkewed diuers friendes ſhort time got better turkes knight sauage man caried olde pacentio iudged almoſt paſt recouery thus chriſtians obtaine victory turkes albeit little pleaſure themſelues ſuch ſmall account made honour gotten man mind goe fetch rich left turk tent ſo grieuouſly take loſſe friend abſence lady thought neuer ſée againe common hindes boores countrey came ranſacke turkes tent becauſe knowledge gold infinite rich precious stone iewels tooke fill worſt leauing thoſe thing behinde greater eſtimation much vnlike aeſopes cocke ſooke precious stone barley corne committed brutiſhnes people béene brought vp place knowledge good iudgement chap lxvi counſell aduiſe sage aliart gaue empire conſtantinople cauſed body emperour palmerin prince wounded battaile conueied perillous iſle chriſtians thus preuailed againſt turkes sage aliart came chriſtian campe ſet downe order béene flaine battaile ſhould buried ſuch maner poſterity ſhould remember ſingular proweſſe battaile againſt great turke liuing yet ſore wounded annointed certaine kinde oyntment vertue wherof ſuch caſt ſound ſléepe meane argentao gouernour profound iſle sage aliart commaunded come arriued porte conſtantinople foure galleyes come ſhoare sage aliart went cittie commaunded inhabitant aſſemble themſelues together immediately hée began let vnderſtand ſmall hope repoſed liues prince primaleon emperour florendos sonne becauſe béene ſo cruelly wounded battaile deſiring take loſſe ſo patiently could diſmay themſelues ſhould prouide reedifying citie onely aſſure themſelues danger enemy witneſſe world fortune power roote quite name noble citie conſtantinople ſhe ſubuerted memorie many famous renowmed citties beſide ſhould call home againe thoſe citizen feare daunger taken themſelues neare adioyning fortreſſes generall voyce chooſe gouernour otherwiſe ſhould containe themſelues within bond aſſurance therefore quoth willing ſhould chooſe gouernour ſo bee emperour primaleon prince florendos sonne ſhould finiſh liues hurt haue receiued battaile becauſe would haue left comfortleſſe muſt vnderſtand yong princeſſe primaleon sonne noble florendos princeſſe miragarda muſt next inheritour empire childe young beſide hée long way hence would would get ſuch gouernor might thought worthy ſo great charge may well contented withall vntill young primaleon come ſufficient yeares hee may able receiue royall scepter gouernment muſt deſire offended becauſe kéepe childe ſo farre aſſure ſhall daily company noble prince whome hee ſhall exerciſe knightly armes learne rule diſcretion vertue wherewith neceſſary prince ſhould adorned ſelues would wiſh order dealing ſo well ſhall ſucceede empire may receiue occaſion diſlike may continue courſe better come diuers time viſite let vnderſtand welfare emperour primaleon citizen conſtantinople tooke good part theſe friendly ſpéeches little agrieued greater aſſurance emperour primaleons life wherefore ſeeing sage aliarts excuſed matter ſo well requeſted would tell place yong prince nouriſhed might come ſometimes viſite lord soueraigne requeſt anſwered aliart great yet ſomewhat content earneſt deſire place prince nouriſhed called perillious iſle ſometime belonged sage vrganda time cuſtody brother noble palmerin england conquered ſword great loſſe blood beſtowed vpon thus directed order gouernment tooke way monaſterie saint clare body emperour palmerin lay embalmed body king princeſſe cauſed bée conueyed one argentaos gallies primaleon king edward ſonnes berolde gracian floraman sardignia blandidon eſtéemed dead perſons aliart laid ſuch traunce laid another galley wound viſited diligently galleyes departing citie people began lament excéedingly becauſe ſo many noble prince brought ſuch dangerous eſtates yet durſt ſhewe kind feare diſmaying leaſt ſhould chance diſpleaſe friend sage aliart within fewe dayes gallies arriued perillous iſle lady receiued worthily sage aliart ſhewed himſelfe ſo diligent towards recouery thier health remained ſides greatly contented finis courteous reader thus gentleman haue finiſhed ſecond part famous hiſtory deſiring beare rudeneſſe tranſlation esteeme good farre cunning ſtretch vnto hiſtory palmerin doliue contaiueth three ſeueral part ſhould haue bin tranſlated prmaleon greece becauſe originall ſtories haue ended third part worthie hiſtorie god aiding ſhall haue ſpeedily thing elſe deſire accept conſider highly hath bene yet eſteemed diuers country firſt written spaniſh towgue next italian afterward french hath bene countenanced title prince perſonages great dignitie may moue allow better acceptation honour countrey england deuiſed
